review_body: We couldn’t have asked for any better experience than if the Iroquois hotel. I researched many hotels and I’m so glad that I picked this one. Perfect Location, close enough to everything but far away enough from the mob scene of times Square. The rooms were spotless and a very nice size. Will definitely be my hotel of choice when in New York. And… A great price point as compared to the surrounding hotels on 44th St.

My fifth and most fabulous stay at this hidden gem of a hotel. My husband and I and our 2 closest friends came up for 2 nights to see Hugh Jackman at the Garden. Vanessa, the hotel concierges was so helpful in arranging a driver for us. Our friend fell and broke her elbow on the day of the concert and had to go to hospital. The front desk clerks and Vanessa did everything to accommodate them. So kind and compassionate. Seth the doorman was extremely helpful also. He directed us to The Blue Bar after the concert that proved to be what we all needed after her accident. It ended up to be a fun evening. Kudos to Lenny our driver too. This man went out of his way to help us. I give all of them a huge high five. We will always stay at the Iroquois! Beautiful, clean rooms, perfect location and phenomenal staff! 5 stars!

My husband and I stay here several times a year while travelling for business. We love the boutique atmosphere and attention we get from the Iroquois. The location is perfect for our needs and always look forward to staying here.

I highly recommend this hotel! We had a great family vacation and found the staff to be accommodating and amazingly friendly and helpful. Also, we stayed here before and it was nice but the renovations fantastic. We will be back!

My husband and I travel to NYC annually, often choosing to stay in a different hotel each time. Our stay at The Algonquin was so pleasant and convenient that we my find ourselves becoming repeat guests. How nice to have a quiet, comfortable room smack dab in the middle of so much activity! We never used a taxi except to and from the airport.

Staff was very friendly, we arrived early and early check in was not a problem. Loved our room it was clean nicely appointed. Great location, we walked to see Hamilton, the New York Public library, the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Lots of good dining around. Hotel was very quiet.

This is probably the 6th time we have stayed at the Iroquois, after stumbling on it years ago. We love the small size of the hotel, the comfortable rooms and the extremely accommodating staff. The rates are reasonable and the 3rd night free deal made us decide to come in a day earlier. The location is perfect and we always make a point of staying at boutique hotels when possible. Iroquois never disappoints and it our go-to hotel in NYC.

There are so many things to like about The Iroquois, from our preliminary conversations with Vanessa (an angel) to the directions given to us for how to get to JFK on our departure, the property beyond exceeded our expectations. It is perfectly situated near multiple subway options - anyone who has visited NYC will tell you how important this is - as well as easily walkable to dining, shopping, and sites. As a bonus, we were greeted warmly at reception and in our room with congratulations on our birthday/anniversary with a bottle of Prosecco -- a very nice touch. Every morning when we left the people at the desk wished us happy exploring and were happy to see us when we returned, asking us about our day. The room was comfortable and roomy by NYC standards and even though we didn't have a view (it didn't matter, we didn't need one) plenty of light came in through the three windows. We will absolutely stay here again.

We stay at the Iroquois Hotel frequently. We love the staff who are always helpful, polite, and professional. While you are only a block or 2 away from the heart of Times Square, you feel you are a mile away from the hustle.

Ok I have mixed feelings about this hotel. Let’s start with the good things. The location is phenomenal. The hotel is between 5 and 6 Ave right by Bryant Park. The lobby smells wonderful. The doormen are very nice. The suite was big. The bathroom was also very large,I love that it had a little window and that the floors were heated. The room temp. and cleanliness were a 5. There was turn down service in the evening. Large windows in the suite. The reasons I won’t give the hotel above 4 stars- the elevator was tiny and took a very long time. We were on the 5th floor and often took the stairs. The lobby is small and the elevator is by the front desk and the people atthe front desk rarely spoke to us as we waited for the elevator or as we came in. The Lantern bar was open and popular, Friday night when we arrived, and we never saw it open again. I liked the room a lot, so if you are looking for a really good hotel room, I highly recommend it. If you are looking for more amenities and movement in a hotel this one isn’t the one.

We have been staying at the Iroquois for about 6 years and have never been disappointed. Everything has been recently updated and we are looking forward to the opening of the restaurant. The staff are top notch and the lobby and rooms are immaculate.

Very nice and charming hotel. Top location between fifth avn and times square. No possibility for dinning or breakfast ! We had a room for 2 adults + child. The beds were very small for 2 adults.Price - value = excellent !!

I’ll start by saying this is a very nice small luxury hotel. You can’t beat the location for getting around the city. The staff is excellent(JJ at the door is awesome),the rooms are spotlessly clean with great beds, VERY quiet room, heated bathroom floors, and the most amazing shower ever! I’d give this property a strong 5, but the ventilation system(or smoking policy)needs improvement. When we returned from dinner last night, it smelled like someone had been smoking in our room. I notified the front desk so that we wouldn’t be charged a cleaning fee. Tonite as I’m laying here in bed, there is cigarette smoke coming through the vents from another room. The front desk says they think they know which room it is coming from, but that room won’t answer the phone. They offered for us to change rooms, but I’m not going to wake my husband at 11pm to change rooms. I do think a strong knock on the culprit’s door is in order. Again...very nice hotel, with a stay that was made less desirable by other guests.

My friend and I had an incredible girls trip for my birthday. Every member of the staff went above and beyond to make our stay a beautiful experience. The hotel is beautiful and full of stories from the past. Very nostalgic and elegant. I will definitely be back.

great place-- great service-- super clean and modernized.... night and day difference from a very nearby - very similar old hotel ( not gonna name it--but it's easy to figure out ) --i'm fussy about hotels--and this place is awesome !!

Great location.. just few steps from 5th avenue and Times Square. Very nice rooms, very comfortable and clean. Love it !! The only bad thing is there's no breakfast anymore, but there are many restaurants near.

We had stayed at several hotels in the immediate neighborhood, including the Algonquin and Royalton, dating back many years. Searching for a hotel in mid-winter, I was delighted to find that the Iroquois was a bit more flexible regarding cancellations than the others -- coming from the northern snow belt, that could have been very important. Not only that, but the Iroquois has been recently renovated, and also offered a three-night special package. The hotel was convenient (well, we knew that), the staff were courteous and helpful, and we found the lighting and climate control in our room to be well designed and functional. Really, there was nothing to criticize, although we were sad to discover that the former restaurant in the hotel had been closed. There are wonderful eateries on the same block, so that was not a serious problem. I usually resist giving all top marks in these review, but the Iroquois earned them!

My short 3 day stay at the Iroquois was thoroughly enjoyable. The room was perfect for one person. Excellent bedding, towels and gowns. Friendly, polite staff and also helpful. My room was in the mddle of the hotel and away from any noise. It was acrosss from the lift which, surprisingly was no bother.at all. A pleasant stay and higly recommended.

My stay at the Iroquois was fabulous. A quaint, friendly enviroment to stay while here on business and pleasure.The room had all the amenties needed with highend finish for a reasonable price considering it is located in the heart of the city.I highly recommend the Iroquois. Clean, safe and comfortable.

The room was quiet, very close to all of the attractions. Subway was nearby.The staff is very helpful and friendly.Wish we had more time to visit the bar/tavern on site.Would definitely stay here again.

Excellent hotel, great staff and service, would highly recommend. The pillows and bed were so comfortable. The heated floors in the bathroom were so welcome. The voucher for the DB bistro continental breakfast was nice. The hotel had coffee in the lobby also and wine and cheese in the afternoon. Having a gym in the hotel to use was great.

Great find in Manhattan. Centrally located, friendly reception, contemporary (though small) rooms. Included breakfast in DB Bistro nextdoor was very upmarket though limited choice. Great value when I stayed

My husband and I were tourists in NYC with a jam packed itinerary. We were thankful to be staying at this gem of a hotel where we could rest our weary feet. You cannot ask for a better location, and the hotel is clean and quiet. Above all, their staff is extraordinary.

My husband and I were recently in NY for a week of conference meetings (held at another - large conference - hotel) - we stayed at the Iroquois because we wanted a smaller hotel. I found the Iroquois on line and the location was excellent for our needs - mid town, quiet street, lovely facility, great area for anything you wanted to do. I called for a reservation and have never found a receptionist as helpful, resourceful, and patient as the woman with whom I spoke. We were not disappointed when we arrived at the Iroquois - in fact, it exceeded our expectations from the moment we entered the lobby - We were greeted warmly at the front door by the doormen every time we cane and left for the day - to the desk personnel who registered us and showed us to our room, to the concierge who recommended some of the most wonderful restaurants - 3 of them on 44th Street - the room was very quiet and the bed comfortable (would love to have one for our home) and the housekeeping was impeccable. Our room was small and at first we thought we would like to move to a larger room, but actually decided not to do that - we were comfortable and it was cozy. The widows actually open to allow fresh air if you want and the heating unit was responsive if we wanted more or less heat. Upon arriving home, I discovered I had left (or lost ) a sweater and upon contacting the Iroquois, was informed not only had they found it but were mailing it to me. I cannot recommend highly enough the benefits of staying at a hotel in New York City that has all the comfortable qualities of the Iroquois.

For years we were frequent guests of another nearby boutique hotel, but on the suggestion from a close friend we tried The Iroquois, and we haven't gone anywhere since. My wife and I love the old world charm of the hotel. The staff have always been professional, friendly, and very accommodating. We love visiting NYC regularly for Broadway shows, or trips to Radio City, Carnegie Hall, and Lincoln Center. The hotel is close enough to walk to the heart of it all, but away from the madness of Times Square. We look forward to returning soon !

We had to unexpectedly book a room last minute in NYC on Valentine's weekend, due to a mixup at the hotel we originally booked. Much to our surprise, not only was a room available at the Iroquois, but it was a better rate for a larger room than our original booking. We were greeted warmly at check in, and offered our choice of a prosecco or water. Of course, we chose the Prosecco! That was just the beginning of the hospitality we received during our 3 night stay. Every single staff member was welcoming, friendly and accommodating. The room was comfortable & clean, and the bathroom had plenty of shelf space (important for 3 women sharing a room!) for storing toiletries. Bonus - it had a heated floor! The decor was modern and the beds very comfortable. The location is very accessible to transportation via subway, car or on foot. I would definitely stay here again, it would be on the list of my top 5 midtown hotels, especially for the rate we paid.

This took some digging to find, but I’m really glad I did. I’ve stayed in New York a fair amount and the value at this place is excellent. They seem to have some great deals and rooms are definitely 4 start (I think many NY hotels claim to be bit so often feel tired and not quite at the standard). It was a decent size (again for an NYC hotel) and staff were friendly. Super convenient for all of Midtown too. Having just looked for the right deal in the past I’ll now look for this place first. I’m really pleased to have found it.

Wonderful location on a quiet side street near the theaters and Times Square. Attentive and friendly staff, nice gym and lively small perks to put the extra touch on your stay. Quiet with very little city noise - 4/5 for sleep quality only because I am over duvets - too warm!Overall was perfect for our theatre weekend!

I stayed the second time at the Hotel and it was as Pleasant as the First time ... the staff is always greeting friendly , asking for help ... room Service immedeately ( ice cubes ) ... clean Rooms ... clean bathrooms ... everything Great ... and very Central ... Great Restaurant next door : db Bistro moderne ( breakfast, lunch, Dinner )

My recent stay was awesome- the customer service is phenomenal and the staff (from concierge, front desk, and housekeeping) are all so friendly. The hotel location is the best, can walk everywhere. It is always nice to return to the Iroquois whether for business or personal travel!!

Really enjoyed the Iroquois Hotel. The hotel is in a perfect location for theatre but is off the Times Square noise. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and the wine & cheese receptions in the lobby on Tuesday and Thursday evenings was lovely.Would have preferred having a coffee pot in the room rather than in the lobby by the elevators.I definitely would recommend this hotel on a trip to NYC.

I was there only for 1 evening. The personnel were very professional and courteous. The location was excellent and the room decor was simple yet elegant. The room I stayed was very quiet. I was able to leave my bag upon checkout with the front desk so I could continue to enjoy NYC. I would recommend Iroquois to anyone.

The hotel was extremely clean.. the staff was courtesy and kind.. door men were excellent as well as front desk staff.. I cannot comment on food as I didn’t eat there but all else was wonderful and I would def stay there again

What a lovely experience staying at this hotel. Where do I start the room was really beautiful and so comfy. Underfloor heating in the beautiful bathroom to make early morning shower so inviting . Housekeeping service every day hotel was spotless.The location is fantastic just a short stroll to Nroadway and Times Square and yet complete silence in the bedroom at night for a great nights sleep I am not sure how they achieve this. Lovely wine and cheese reception on the Thursday evening we were there in the lobby really nice idea to meet some fellow guests. Wasn’t sure about the tea coffee at reception in the mornings rather than this facility in the room,before I went but have to say it was ideal no faffing around with small cups and cartons we could get a very good take away cup of coffee just outside the lift door and bring back to the room without all the mess. The staff we met during our stay couldn’t have been nicer or more helpful from the bell hops to the concierge and reception staff all willing to go that extra mile to oblige special mention to DJ Irma and Oliver. Negatives ? I honestly cannot think of 1 except cocktails are pretty pricey in the cocktail bar but I suppose that’s New York prices. I hope I will get the opportunity to return some day and I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Manhattan.

First impressions, beautiful outside, very clean but small reception. Our room was on the 7th floor, superior room which really is ordinary room... Room very clean and pretty. Bed soft and comfy. Bathroom small but beautiful... Normally at this point I would give it a 5* and move to my next review but I left it on 4* for 2 reasons... The window in our room was very small and due to the wall being pretty much there in front of it there was no natural lighting... that would be ok if it was mentioned when I was booking it... the second thing is minor (or major if you are in a hurry) but no spare tp was left in the room... not good if you are desperate I would book the same hotel but maybe a different room next time when I am in New York... oh forgot to say this hotel is very close to all the theatres...

This was the second time we stayed at the Iroquois, and we enjoyed this stay just as much as our visit last year. The front desk staff was welcoming and efficient, providing superior service and responding quickly with anything we needed. The location cannot be beaten with quick access to anywhere in midtown Manhattan just a few minutes walk away.The Iroquois (Presidential) and Executive suites are a good size and offer a comfortable, quiet stay. Quite enjoyed the heated bathroom floors and in the Iroquois Suite the steam shower. It's also nice to have windows in the bathroom for the natural light.I agree with most of the reviews that the absence of a coffee maker or tea kettle does dilute the overall guest experience, but we did bring our own kettle and mugs, so it wasn't much of a problem for us. We did have a Nespresso machine in our Iroquois Suite, but there were no capsules or coffee cups provided, so the device served no purpose. Also, there was a dining room table but no tableware, so we made do with paper and plastic from take-away places.Appreciate the chocolates left on the bed each night during turn-down service but would have to say housekeeping needs to pay more bit attention to service details as we had a couple of hiccups, but none severe enough to elaborate here.We've enjoyed our last 2 stays so much that we've already booked our stay for 2021 and look forward to returning then.

This is a small boutique upscale hotel in the heart of the theater district. It has been completey renovated in a contemporary style although I miss the library off the lobby, which has been turned into a small space for relaxing. The restaurant was under renovation when I was there but there is a bar adjoining the lobby.Pros: I stayed in a "Superior" room. It was small but adequate for one person. It may be cramped for two. The furniture is attractive and very good quality. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom is an adequate size with good shelf space. The bathroom floor is heated (nice touch!) although there was no instruction card and I couldn't figure out how to work the controls (I had to ask at the front desk). There was a walk-in closet with an ironing board, iron, safe, bathrobe and slippers. The front desk staff is exceptionally friendly, polite and caring, knowledgeable about nearby restaurants and always willing to help. I was offered a glass of prosecco or a bottle of water on check-in. There was wine and cheese in the lobby for guests on the Thursday night I was there. Cons: I asked for a quiet room on a higher floor away from the elevators. My room had a small window over the bed with a view of a fire escape and the back of another building. I asked if there was a room with a better view available. None of the rooms have great views because the hotel is sandwiched between buildings. I was told that any other room wouldn't be as quiet so I stayed where I was. Heat throughout the space was not uniform. The window in the walk-in closet was old so the closet was cold and my clothes were cold when I took them out. The window in the shower stall also was old so the stall was cold until the hot water warmed it up. The heating system was loud when it cycled on. None of these were deal breakers for me and I would stay here again.

This hotel was beautiful. Our room was big and gorgeous and very clean. Perfect location. Staff superfriendly and helpful.Fitness center left much to be desired and no on-site restaurant at the moment. Would've been nice to grab breakfast at the hotel before heading out for the day.

The Iroquois is a nice place, clean and nicely appointed. The price is what you get for a hotel on 44th street and so I would call it fair - not too expensive not too cheap. The hotel was offering a package with valet service for the car which saved some money for our 1 night stay but would have been significant savings had we been staying longer.Staff was friendly and helpful.

The Iroquois is on a very good location (between 5th and 6th avenue and very close to Times Square). The decoration is refined (rooms, bathroom and corridors). We enjoyed our stay and we would return.

On the run all day. The service and staff were so accommodating. Checkin professionally done with a smile. Needed to run the next morning and leave the bags after we checked out. It was seamless and quick. So appreciated.

Excellent hotel, friendly staff, comfortable rooms great location,new renovations are coming along well, Lanterns keep cocktail bar is hidden gem, comfort and cleanliness of the hotel is excellent with free tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning,
user_name:
haydn j
Swansea County, United Kingdom

review_body: I had an upgrade to a suite so maybe this doesn't apply to the other rooms... The suite was nice, spacious, clean, with an extremely comfy bed and marble bathroom. I think this is due to current construction (which also may explain the bargain price?) but the bar is really rather tiny. But the two bar keepers were friendly and trying to work with what they had.

Family of 4, stayed 5 nights in Dec 2020, in 2 rooms. Plus:a. Excellent location, within walking distance to New York’s top attractions including Broadway, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and Bryant Park.b. Friendly doorman. c. Comfortable bed, cozy room. Heated bathroom floor is a big bonus.Minus: a. No coffee/ tea making facilities in room. Complementary cofee is provided at lobby in the morning but we missed having our decaf cuppa in the evening.b. No complementary bottled water nor an electric kettle in the room. Not sure if this is unique to NYC hotels but this is the only hotels in my 16 days US trip whereby we have to pay for water and this is not exactly a budget hotel.Read somewhere there is nightly turndown service with chocolates and daily delivery of The New York Times but we didn't have any of those (likely discontinued). We are generally happy with our stay at The Iroquois.Other than food, accommodation takes up a big chunk of our budget for NYC, may be worthwhile staying in NJ or Brooklyn and train in/ out of Manhattan. But for first time visitor to NYC with a flexible budget, stay in Manhattan.

The Iroquois is perfectly located on a quiet street so close to Broadway, NYPL, Empire State Building. Its a quick,easy 10-15 min walk from Penn Station. Room rates are reasonable if staying on the right nights, rooms are small but beautiful and clean-icing on the cake was heated bathroom floors. 24 hr fitness and dry sauna provides water and towels and a pelaton. Front desk and door man very friendly and welcoming. This was our 2nd stay and would highly recommend

Stayed there for 4 nights. Very convenient. Internet - great & reliable. Di dnot have a chance to check the bar - next time. Central and easy to get around. Staff supportive. Bed / Sleep quality, excellent.

Bigger than normal room for nyc, clean, great value, makes you think you shouldve paid more because of the service and features. Mini bar was a little pricey, sauna and gym on property were very nice! Would stay again!

I really enjoyed my stay at the Iroquois. I was there for 9 nights attending a training week at a nearby building. The bar didn't have food yet so I never got to try it out but it looked really nice. It is a small hotel but great friendly staff, clean, comfortable room, and a truly great remodeled bathroom with waterworks fixtures. The building is flanked by other buildings on three sides, so my window looked into an odd bricked shaft--if you want a view you would have to be facing the street or at the upper floors. I didn't really care because I was out and about most of the time but good to know what to expect. The location is fantastic and compared to other hotels nearby with big fancy lobbies and restaurants, the price was very agreeable as well. Perfect for my needs and I'd stay there again for a similar trip.

The location is perfect for walking to the theatre district, shopping and Rockafeller Center. I highly recommend it if you want a quiet, welcoming and convenient place to stay. The staff was so helpful and friendly. Our executive suite was perfect for 3 old friends. We had fun together without feeling cramped. It was perfect for us!

My husband and I surprised our two kids (4 and 6 y/o) with a trip to NYC for Christmas. We arrived at The Iroquois on Christmas Night after a three hour flight delay, desperate for a Peking Duck Dinner. Seth welcomed us to the hotel, got us to our room quickly and had a reservation for us (that we would’ve never been able to get on our own) at The Peking Duck House 45 min later. For the rest of our stay, Seth was our man and his recommendations were spot on. The entire staff was outstanding and we will definitely be back. The accommodations were top-notch and we all slept like babies after exciting days in the city. Can’t wait to go back!

Visited the Manhattan and stayed at the Iroquois for several days for New Years and really enjoyed our hotel. They had just completed renovations and the rooms turned out beautiful.The Iroquois is 44th in between the Algonquin and Sofitel across the street from the Royalton a couple blocks east of Times Square.Perfect for theater going, dining out, and touring the town.

We did an impromptu trip after the holidays and found this gem. There was phenomenal service, friendly and responsive staff, great value and an incredibly convenient location. We will definitely be back.

Stayed 4 nights over New Year. Clean and comfortable rooms, centrally located within easy walking distance of main sites and great eating places. We were there for NYE and really struggled to get back to the hotel in the afternoon due to road closures around Times Square. It would have been nice if hotel had advised guests how to best access the hotel on NYE, it was very stressful and front desk weren’t really interested which was a shame as the majority of staff were really helpful. Was aware of the refurbishment (after I had booked), which did compromise the stay a bit, as a bar/restaurant would have been nice for a drink after a long day sight seeing. I think the bar did seem to be open one evening but not consistently!

I’ve stayed in plenty of NY hotels and I will definitely return to the Iroquois. It’s located about a 10-15 minute walk to Broadway, Times Square and Rockefeller Center but since it’s on a side street, it doesn’t feel like you’re in the thick of it. The hotel has been recently renovated and the rooms are well-appointed. We stayed in an executive suite and it was a largest room I’ve stayed in NY. The bedroom had a king-sized bed and the living room had a fold-out sofa bed. The bathroom had a nice-sized shower and bathtub. One of the nice features was the heated floor in the bathroom which was lovely for a cold winter day. The hotel bar was recently renovated and an excellent way to relax after a long day of walking around the city. Another plus was complementary happy hour on Tuesdays and Thursdays which had very nice wine and cheese. The hotel is small and boutique and such a huge improvement to the large sprawling hotels in NY with masses of people and questionable service. As for service at the Iroquois, it was extremely polite, professional and timely. No complaints whatsoever.

I really enjoyed location along with service! The staff was helpful. It was very clean, kinda small room but perfect for me! Everything about my stay was great! If I come back to NYC this is where I would stay.

Superior room queen bed on the 9th floor and it’s amenities were excellent; dry sauna and gym facility satisfactory; friendly customer service from staff; knowledgeable bartender; bottle of wine and locally-made chocolate for NYE celebration the cherry on top!

Friendly staff, within walking distance to most major things to visit, chic, free water and coffee every morning. A classical and hystorical vibe that we loved. Room could be bigger and the view at the 9th floor could have been great, but it is not in their power.Conclusion: extraordinary! Totally recommend!

The Iroquois is conveniently located and spotless with a lot of historical charm. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. There are many great restaurants and sites so close to the hotel. I would definitely return to this property.

My wife and I have been visiting New York during Christmas for the past 4 years, this was the first trip with our daughter (8 months old). Being that we now had an infant with us, one of our criteria was a place that was baby friendly and this place ended up on our list during our search. We ended up booking the Iroquois Suite which comes with a separate dining room, separate bedroom, the bathroom consists of a steam shower, tub, two sinks and a heated floor by the shower. It felt more link an apartment instead of a hotel room, it was great. We had contacted the hotel in advance, letting them know we were going to be with an 8 month old, they had a pack and play, baby bath kit, baby toy, and baby bathrobe waiting for us in our room!The staff is also very friendly, helpful, and professional. Upon arrival there was a bit of traffic in front of the hotel making it a bit difficult for our driver to find a spot. The doorman noticed immediately and was very helpful in helping us unload from the car and get the bags to our room while we focused on checking in (remember we have an 8 month old with us so this could have been much more stressful). Front desk was also very helpful with suggestions for food delivery as we had dinner in the room with some friends a couple nights.Overall a great experience, we are already talking about coming back.

the location of the hotel is excellent (very close to Times Square and 5th avenue shops), the staff was very welcoming and very helpful, the hotel offers (with other hotels) free walking tours which is an important extra bonus

Wonderful trip love the hotel. Returning for many years. The remodel is beautiful and the staff is welcoming. We love the neighborhood. Convenient location to Grand Central, Bryant Park, and lots of restaurants and cafes.

Wife and I regularly stay at the Iroquois hotel during our visits to New York. Hotel staff, front desk to doormen, housekeeping to restaurant all welcome guests upon arrival or when making eye contact during the day. The hotel is confidently located near our areas of interest, generally Broadway show and fine dining. The rooms are well appointed, clean and comfortable and quiet. We always appreciate how easy (quickly) it is to enter and exit the hotel.

I’ve been staying at the Iroquois for the last 7 years. Great location, comfortable well appointed rooms and the service is excellent! Several staff have been there for years.In particular Carlos is wonderful. He’s friendly, helpful, and remembers us year after year. I genuinely enjoys what he does.

Nice hotel. Comfortable rooms. Friendly staff. Located in the heart of mid-town. Blocks from Bryant Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, the Empire State Building, the theater district, and more. Just wish the bar / restaurant would have been functional.

AMAZING STAFF AND LOCATION! The Iroquois Hotel was very clean and the location on 44th Street is superb!!!!!!! Our room was quiet, clean, and offered everything needed for a pleasant stay.We would definitely go back. Again, AMAZING STAFF!!!!

I stay at the Iroquois frequently. Depending upon rates, I stay sometimes in their smallest rooms and at other times the spacious Executive Suite. In every stay, I am treated by name at check in and with a smile. It is a gracious and sincere service, not fake like many "boutique" hotels can be.The always-spotless rooms themselves are super comfortable. The heated bathroom floors are marvelous on a cold NY day. The bed linens are exceptional. The pillows are clouds of joy. The beds themselves are amongst the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The bathroom toiletries are pleasant and there is a full range of them.The hotel itself is not large and has a cosy feeling and is super quiet at all times of days and night. The front rooms face 44th Street and can have some road noise like all of NYC, but 44th is not super busy as it terminates at Grand Central just a couple blocks down so I have never had issues. The interior rooms have no NYC noises at all.The best word I can use to describe the Iroquois is cosy. I rarely use that for a hotel. It is the warmest term I can apply to a space and the Iroquois deserves it.I highly recommend this hotel.

This is our 3rd stay at the Iroquois. We love this hotel. The location is perfect and the staff is the best. We found this hotel by accident and it is now our only place we will stay when we visit NYC.

Great location, clean and well-appointed room, close to most midtown locations, good diner nearby. Lovely heated floor in the bathroom! Front desk service was consistently excellent and helpful. We would definitely stay here again!

Used to stay here a lot - great location & like it's boutiqueness.A lot of re-modelling going on so no bar or restaurant. It is pricey but think a few things are missing. Is there a coffee machine? Couldn't find one. Promised bottle of water never arrived so a bit miffed to be stiffed with the cost of one from the minibar.Had workmen making a lot of noise literally right outside my bathroom window which didn't wake me up but didn't feel particularly private in there.Apart from water, front desk generally very good & helpful.

The hotel was centrally located and the rooms were very quiet and clean. Loved having the large tv and refrigerator in our room. All the employees made us feel welcome and they were extremely helpful with our needs. The perfect quant hotel with a family atmosphere which is hard to find in most hotels. I would definitely recommend the hotel.

This used to be the cutest boutique hotel but since they’ve changed it, it’s just like all the rest except they don’t offer coffee. The location is great, the rooms are clean and comfortable but for the amount you are paying I don’t know if it’s worth the money.

The Iroquois has a wonderful staff, greeted us with a smile every time. Rooms are very comfortable, slept well each night, no street noise to speak of. Very convenient location. Marble tile and counter tops in bath was a special touch. 2 elevators meant we seldom had to wait. An in-room coffee maker or coffee in the lobby would have been nice. Enjoyable experience. Would definitely stay here again!

Great location, super clean, delightful staff. Located in the heart of the theatre district and shopping. Rooms aren’t big but most aren’t in NYC. The staff is very helpful. You can’t go wrong by staying here!

Great hotel for holiday sites! A few blocks from everything we wanted to see and so close to Grand Central. Staff was so nice and helpful. We were greeted with Proseco for a birthday celebration. This is my new favorite hotel for NYC!

One day I had difficulties while I was trying to reconnect to internet. but in general service was great!The attention given by the people at the reception was excellent.For sure I would stay there again.

Great location to everything, During holiday season, roads are closed down to allow people to walk to attractions, very confusing to Uber and Taxi drivers, but the staff instructed you to your understanding of how to get there from here, recommendations for dinner(close and delicious) a welcome when you came in from day/night trips with bottled water offers.when you returned exhausted!

A recent remodel stripped the Iroquois' lobby of all its charm. It is completely generic, sterile, and a little cheap looking. Nothing inviting or interesting about it. The rooms are still nice (though very small) with comfy beds and linens and nice showers. It's such a great location and I like the rooms, so I'll probably stay there again, but I'll always miss the old lobby. What a shame.

There is a lot of construction in the hotel for new bathrooms, restaurant and bar. These amenities are currently missing and our stay was not up to par as a result. Once this hotel is back on track without construction, I believe it is a five star place to stay in a great location.

The Iroquois Hotel is in a perfect location, convenient to shopping and restaurants. The hotel is a boutique style hotel that gives a personal touch to each visitor. The staff went out of their way to help us and make our stay enjoyable. We loved staying there and plan on returning when we visit NYC again!

We attended a wedding at the Harvard Club and stayed here. When making the reservation the staff was kind of cold- we received the same upon check in. The rooms were dark(we didn’t even know it was morning) and quiet. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. We think the bathroom tile was heated? That was a nice touch. Overall it was a good hotel to sleep in but we didn’t get the whole boutique welcoming feeling for a hotel we would have chosen on our own .

Lack of tea and coffee making facilities and room service not suited to someone on a different time zone. At this price your guests should not have to leave the room to get a bite to eat of a hot drink in your night time (which might be their day time)

We stay at this hotel every year for Thanksgiving and love it. This year, the bar was closed, the restaurant was closed and there was no coffee in the lobby...no coffee in the rooms either. Not what we expect for a room that costs over $2,000 for 5 nights. The bar and restaurant were being renovated but the room rate should be based on certain amenities and if those amenities are not available, the rates should be adjusted to reflect the lower star level.We'll stay again but this was a disappointing visit.

We recently spent three nights at the hotel. It is a great location near Bryant park and Times Square with about 60 rooms. Rooms are not large but well maintained. Service is what sets the hotel apart- staff are outstanding especially the concierge. The current downside is that there is no bar or restaurant but they are working on it. They will get you complementary coffee in the morning. Suggest the hotel provide coffee machines in the room.

Found the Iroquois online I loved the look of larger rooms and the location near Times Square but not right in the middl. Th Iroquois did not disappoint Quaint, quiet, clean and nice amenities We loved the Executive Suite Nice size for 3 people Nice shower with rain shower and we loved the heated floors. There were darkening shades. Of course, like most in the city you could hear street traffic at some level but not bad or disturbing. Front Desk Staff and doormen were fantastic and helpful. The bar and restaurant were under construction but there was coffee available in morning along with a wonderful library to sit and enjoy. (No worries on food as there is a wonderful dinner literally 3 or 4 doors down. Also several bars, pubs within minutes. Highly Recommend.

The staff are incredibly helpful,enthusiastic,genuine and just plain nice ! Vanessa and Carlos are ambassadors deluxe who can never do enough to help. The location is perfect for everything ,with a Daniel Boulud restaurant next door, two blocks from Times Square , Birdland and Theatres.

I have to say I regret not coming here to this hotel in New York City before, why ? First the location is perfect being 3 min walking for Time Square 3 min walking form Bryant Park and almost 15 min walking from Central Park. The rooms are super clean and the staff are very friendly and greeting always with smile, and before I forget the cost compare to what they provide is amazing really affordable cost and I hope they keep it the same. Really great experience and 5 stars visit.

Everything was perfect from the minute we arrived to once we left. Staff was very accommodating. The location was great, close to everything we planned on visiting. Stayed here previously and Will definitely return.

We stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was spacious and clean, and the bathroom had a separate tub and shower (which is rare for a city hotel). I personally thought it was a nice touch giving my toddler a present upon check in. It made him feel extra special. Unfortunately the bar was closed, but overall we had a wonderful stay.

This is my 4th weekend stay at the Iroquois New York and it just gets better all the time. Love the location, Staff and can't wait to visit NYC again. Also, my guests will also be booking in the Future. A Big Thank You to ALL!!!

everything great except the place is small. our room with 2 beds would be impossible for more than 2 people. great staff. fabulous location. hotel was undergoing a lobby remodel and had no art or plants or decor of any kind. just as we were leaving, the new plants arrived...

Location is the best thing about this hotel. I’ve stayed prior remodel is a disappointment. Elevator broken, restaurant under construction nothing else offered, bar under construction nothing else offered. Room not

This could have been a great stay but with no doorman to help on at least two ccassions which caused a situation that made me have a lot of pain but even when the hotel knew a problem had happened there was a lackadaisical attitude that actually msde the situation worst. They knew i was a nice guy a good tipper and well like by a lot of guests because of my sharing of travel tips in NYC.

Great location. Very attentive and friendly staff. Comfortable, though small size rooms that are recently updated with nice amenities. Hotel is currently in the midst of reconstruction so no restaurant or bar on premise; although many in very close proximity. The location for theaters is Supreme....very close, but not in the melee of people and traffic. And as stated, the staff is exceptional. Only downside is the price - it is a "boutique" hotel.

Excellent stay in New York. Perfect location and fantastic hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Room was clean and had everything we needed. Front desk always on hand with helpful information and places to visit

The location was excellent. The rooms and bathrooms were spacious for the price and compared to other properties in New York. The staff was exceptional. They printed out restaurants and Broadway Show schedules for us. We will definitely stay there again.

Room and amenities were great, but bathing and brushing teeth was difficult due to the brown water. It's a shame because the rest of the experience was good but when you're on business and you can't shower, that's a problem.

This is a great hotel, with a wonderful staff. Would highly recommend to all my business associates, friends and family. Love the location and the facilities that is why this is my preferred hotel in NY.

I have stayed in this area of NYC when travelling here for business before, but this was my first time at the Iroquois. I chose it because it was convenient to my meetings, reasonably priced (for a major city), but also I was looking to stay at a smaller hotel with a bit more character. I was not disappointed. I enjoyed the stay very much. The staff was great. Room spacious with a nice desk for getting work done. The bed was very comfortable. I left for EWR at 0500, but check out was smooth and the doorman hailed a cab for me and loaded my bags into it. I would definitely stay here again.

We had drinks at the Algonquin next door one evening and frankly Iprefer the Iroquois. The lobby is pleasant and quieter, not like Grand Central!The rooms at the Iroquois are small but that's NY. Clean and comfortable, very pleasant & helpful staff.

The staff here is very friendly and helpful, without being over bearing. Despite the fact the hotel was under refurbishment, the rooms were very quiet and well appointed. Price was very reasonable, and the Location is essentially unbeatable.

Hotel is in a great location with an attentive staff. Rooms are clean and convenient. The hotel lacks certain amenities, but that was because the restaurant was being renovated at the time of the stay. Otherwise, the convenient location makes it an ideal choice.

Checkin was unreasonable. We arrived very early and were asked to come back later, basically no problem. When we came back later, we were put off because the suite was not ready yet, ok too. Only on demand we were told 12.00 o'clock. When we returned we were told that the suite had only just been cleared. We would be notified by telephone. On the hint that I hadn't brought my German phone to the USA - acceptable - an email notification was offered. We didn't get any notification and didn't come to our suite until late in the evening. Back in Germany it turned out that we probably got an SMS on our German number, a pity ... Why couldn't we be told immediately in the morning that we couldn't get the suite until 3 pm? Other hotels can do that too, offer alternatives and at least a coffee. Here the service was impolite, incompetent and we didn't feel like a guest but only a supplicant. For us it was clear: never again! For April 2020 we have now booked somewhere else.

Clean and quiet and located close to T Sq., plays, shopping, Grand Central Metro North and 9 blocks from Penn Station and Amtrak. Fantastic! Recommend-would stay again. Will be glad when their restaurant reopens.

We could not have had a better stay. great location, very helpful and friendly staff. Very clean and nice. they try and help you in any way possible. Know all the local place for great meals and can get you and where in the city

We had a wonderful stay at the Iroquois, a beautiful boutique hotel located in the heart of the theater district. It is easy walking distance from Time Square, Central Park, MOMA, Carnegie Hall, Bryant Park, countless good restaurants, and much more. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. The staff was polite, welcoming, and very helpful. We will definitely stay here again!Richard and Sarah

Great location, room was stylish and reasonably sized, great sleep accommodations- excellent diner two doors away and the theater district around the corner. Have stayed in several other hotels in the area and the Iroquois met or surpassed the quality of those rooms at a better price and location.

Fantastic location, one block from theaters. Services extraordinary. Great bed confort. The Bistro fabolous, every plate were unique and detailled. Definately returning soon. To improve room space in case you are travelling with several suitcases

The Iroquois Hotel is great hotel in New York City. Our king deluxe room was very nicely appointed. It had been completely updated and was very, very clean. It is in a great location, just two blocks from Times Square. It is far enough away from Times Square to avoid the noise and the crowds. It is close to the theaters and lots of great restaurants. This is where we will stay when we return to New York City.

Super-clean, quiet, luxurious, well-appointed room with heated bathroom floor and staff that was always willing to help or answer questions with a smile. Great location in midtown. You can easily walk to Grand Central Station and other subway stations, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park and the NY Public Library, the Garment and Theater Districts. Close enough to Times Square, but away from the chaos. I will definitely stay here on my next visit to NYC.

Wonderful attentive staff. Spotless boutique hotel in mid town. Old New York feel with contemporary services. The restaurant was closed due to renovations but the staff went out of their way to accommodate us for room service. The location is perfect . Minutes from time square , yet private. A beautiful little haven.

I am writing in regards to my wonderful experience with Ms. Torruellas. I worked with Vanessa on arranging a birthday amenity for my husband who checked in today (his birthday). Right from the start, Vanessa was pleasant, responsive and very helpful. I had corresponded with her a few times to update her on Matthew's arrival time, specific likes, etc. Again, always very responsive. I had very specific requests for his amenity and it was executed perfectly. Additionally, being a Convention Services Manager, I really appreciated her follow up. Vanessa even emailed me pictures and made sure it was delivered promptly at 3:00pm.As someone who has worked in hotels for 10+ years, I truly value genuine customer service and that is what Vanessa provides. It was very refreshing as sometimes, as I am sure you know, it is rare to find. Please make sure she gets the recognition and praise she deserves.Thank you to Vanessa and to the rest of your team for helping make my husband's birthday special!

A few friends shared a suite and connecting room for our 5 day stay in the City. This location is perfect as its centrally located to everything, and an easy short walk to theaters. The staff goes out of their way to greet you and meet your every need. The rooms were very clean well appointed and the beds extremely comfortable. We were return guests and will return again. Thank you Hotel Iroquois for your excellent hospitality!

The best Hotel in NYC.The bed and pellows are to die for. Th Hotel Staff are so helpful and always with a smile.The location is incredible.The bathroom is in a good size.I want a bed just like that in my house !!Is the best choice!!

We had a wonderful time in NYC. The hotel staff was fantastic. They helped us with all our questions. The location is Great. Very Safe walking to Time Square and 5th Ave. We walked 24737 steps in one day!!! We will be back!!

A perfect location just off Times Square so you're very close to the hustle and bustle but without the noise. We upgraded to a Superior King Room which had an absolutely enormous bed. The room and bathroom were a good size and very well soundproofed, we didn't hear any other guest's TVs, showers, conversations or footsteps unless they walked directly past our door. The internet was strong and we had usb chargers in our bedside tables-a great touch, as was the heated bathroom floor. Our room was at the back of the hotel so we didn't have a view like some people have said but we really only used it to sleep in and prefer peace and quiet so it didn't bother us, neither did the lack of tea or coffee making facilities in the room, although the front desk staff did say we were welcome to come to the lobby for complimentary hot drinks and water. We thought this was a really good compromise by the hotel considering their bar and restaurant are still under renovation.The staff were all very friendly and greeted us with a smile. We both felt we would rather stay in this fantastic little unique hotel than the larger resort style ones, particularly when you spend most of your time out in the city. When we return to the New York this would be our first choice.

My first visit to the US to celebrate my 60th Birthday, I booked the Iroquois as it looked charming and the reviews were still excellent despite undergoing renovations . I was not disappointed , yes the room was small with two Queen sized beds , but so comfortable and spotlessly clean , very quiet despite being in the centre of the city. Staff very friendly and helpful. Recommend this hotel to everyone planning a New York trip .

We just returned from a great weekend in NYC. We stayed two nights at the Iroquois New York and found it a great place to stay and a wonderful location for Broadway, museums, restaurants, and all the other fun things to do in midtown manhattan. Highly recommended.

First stay at the Iroquois and would definitely stay there again. Very clean throughout; very quiet. Friendly staff, especially the concierge Vanessa, who directed us, advised us, answered any questions--truly a godsend for our week. Location on 44th is so close to Theatre District and Times Square..

The hotel is pleasant. The newly renovated suite was nice and definitely value for money. Also the other rooms we booked were great. But like the suite, the entire hotel was boring in design and hard it is to understand why you would make such poor choices in color and furniture when you are updating your hotel. Amenities as a coffee maker, bottles of water in the room and fresh flowers were missing. Bathroom was tiny for a suite but functional and a had good rain shower.Staff was friendly and efficient and location is great. So far so good and a reason to come back.The hotel is renovating and we knew that, and we tried to be flexible and understanding when elevators were blocked or working crew was irritated and not very friendly when we got back after dinner. I was understanding when they wet vacuumed the hallway on the 12th floor, had noisy heat blowers in front of my suite to dry the carpet and that we were informed that the sauna and fitness was also undergoing maintenance and not accessible.This review would have been positive regardless that the complimentary wifi is not working very well and sometimes not working at all.This review turned bad when on the last night I received a letter under the door. This letter was informing all rooms and suites on the 12th floor that someone had been smoking and that management was investigating and that you would be confronted with a $350 fine if you had smoked in your room. They also asked to report if you saw someone smoking.I am a non smoker , I don’t like it when other people smoke, but I also think it is a huge mistake of management to decide to approach the issue the way they did. You sort of Make everybody a possible suspect. It leaves me with a bad taste and it is a horrible customer experience.Especially when you consider that the whole day they were wet vacuuming the hallway and then had noisy massive heat blowers in the hallway without any written heads up from management. Apparently the hotel is more busy policing the guests than they are interested to ensure the guests have a flawless experience.So purely based on this letter I most likely would not choose to stay at Iroquois in the future. I don’t like to be considered a suspect! Solve guest issues in a different way. #unprofessional #1203

Great central location, nice, clean, small, quiet rooms (no view at all). We travelled as a family and had booked a room for three persons - however we were not told that there would be no room for a roll away bed and that two persons were expected to share one double bed - the lack of a good sleep for those two did impact the whole experience. Also, the hotel currently has no bar or restaurant due to renovation (not expected to finish until January despite claims on their website that it will be done "in the fall". They apparently offer complimentary prosecco at reception but they keep this a secret so if interested, remember to ask as information will not be volunteered. Really missed tea and coffee making facilities in the room and the hotel even charge for bottle water (which is typically complimentary in other hotels).

Great location, clean rooms, felt updated and was still undergoing some renovations. Restaurant was still closed for improvements. Staff were friendly and courteous. I would most likely return on next visit to NY.

Cheesy title aside. This is definitely one of the best hotels I've stayed in, the good experience started even before checking in. All the inquiries that I've sent by email were answered in a very courteous and prompt manner. I could sense the friendliness from the simple emails, unlike the usual curt manner that's most common in NYC properties. So, kudos DJ for the great correspondence.My entire experience at the hotel was very positive, everyone treats you in a friendly and professional manner at the same time. In my second stay at the property, I was pleasantly surprised to find a personal note, a chocolate bar and a bottle of wine as a compliment from the wonderful staff.The staff alone makes this property a very highly recommended one add to it the great location and nice facilities. The rooms are very clean, everything works the way it's supposed to. Meanwhile, the renovations didn't inconvenience me at all.Will certainly stay there whenever I'm in the city and I highly recommend the property.

We had stayed here before and loved this hotel however this time room was dark renovations meant no bar or breakfast area and they still charged same rate. Reception staff were not very helpful and we will not stay here again

We recently stayed at the Iroquois for the second time and loved the new look! We stayed in our usual Premium Queen room so we could wake up and look out at the Chrysler Building each morning. As always, every staff member was kind and courteous, from the front desk to housekeepers and maintenance staff. We can't wait to see the new bar and restaurant on our next visit

Small room, but very clean and comfortable. The space is organized in a very efficient manner. For the price, a window that looked up something other than a concrete wall would have been nice. Wi-Fi could have been better for work VPN purposes. I really appreciated the free water bottles upon arrival. Other than the notes above, very comfortable.

It’s unassuming, low-key luxe. Easily one of the best maintained and clean hotels I’ve stayed at and always consistently friendly and high quality. There is still construction going on, so it can get noisy after 9 during the week depending on your room...but that will pass.
user_name:
Wanderer20069106784
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed overnight for an event in NYC. The room was clean and newly renovated. We had a quiet room on the 9th floor. The lobby has been updated as well. The bar/lounge was closed as it is undergoing upgrades, but there are plenty of nearby places to grab a cocktail and a bite to eat. Great location for Broadway shows and midtown attractions. The staff was very attentive and made us feel like special guests rather than tourists. Our daughter was meeting us and arrived early. They made her feel welcome and let her stay in the room until we arrived. Traffic in the area is difficult, so don't drive there if you can avoid it. Reasonably priced. We would definitely stay there again!

Yes, the Iroquois is small, but you’ll probably enjoy it. The Pros: “reasonably” priced, quiet, clean, close to everything, a bowl of citrus fruit in the front desk (clementines, I think), complimentary chocolate bar and small bottle of wine, slippers, two robes, and a generally polite staff.The Cons: a Queen-sized bed, tiny rooms (maybe 200 sq ft including the bathroom), and two windows completely darkened out so you can’t see anything outside. Yes, it’s worth the visit.

Birthday weekend in NYC. Stayed here many times previously. Like the location as it’s close the theaters. Disappointed that the bar and restaurant on premises were under construction. Rooms are clean, but small.

We stayed here for two nights. The rooms have recently been renovated which really shows. We had a lovely modern room and very pleased that the wardrobe was big enough to fit our suitcases which cleared space in the room. The service from the staff was fantastic- everyone was helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Hotel ordered us a car to the airport. Location of the hotel is great for exploring Manhattan. We would definitely return.

Lovely hotel in a great area. Only minutes from Time Square but also a quiet location. The room had two double beds a little small, but clean. Lovely staff all very helpful especially Vanessa. Lovely doormen, very helpful.

We were very pleased with our stay at the Iroquois. As some has stated, the rooms are small but that's fine with us. The staff was EXCELLENT! Anna was extremely helpful during our stay. We, and our friends, highly recommend the Iroquois. Great little find in the theater district!

We stayed here as part of a birthday celebration. The staff was amazing and went above and beyond to make it a special night. They wrote a personalized card and sent us free goodies. Not to mention the room was perfect and spacious and the location was surrounded by amazing restaurants. Highly recommend.

Extremely comfortable bed and nice size room with everything I needed. Very large bathroom. Comfortable room and amenities. Very pleasant and helpful staff with great doormen. I appreciated the free overnight shoe shine.

Pros:Awesome for groupsLarge roomsUpdated bathroomsFriendly staffCons:Slow elevators Limited restaurant hoursNo poolSeveral girls and I stayed in the executive suite with the connection to the premium king room! The two rooms gave us over 1000 square feet of space, basically unheard of for NYC hotel rooms. The rooms & bathrooms have been recently updated, the heated tile floor was a very unique touch.. the girls all loved it! We stayed here for a Christmas in New York Bachelorette Party!

Traditional hotel with friendly staff. Our room was nicely furnished and - compared to former experiences in New York hotels- quite spacious. The restaurant and parts of the lobby are maintained in present, so we were having breakfast and dinner elsewhere. The hotel is located very central in close neighborhood to Times Square, but our room was very quiet. Altogether we were very satisfied.

very good beds, poor cleanliness, poor internet (wifi), staff willing & very friendly but not able to solve mentioned problems; excellent location. Will not stay there again, if you need a hotel without "the extra mile" good choice

The room was clean and comfortable, but small, and the hotel had a good central location. Our room was not made up on the first day, although we left the room at 10:00 am. The concierge was very helpful and she had good information on places and how to get around the City. Other than that, there is nothing else to recommend about the hotel.

Enjoyed a lovely stay at the Iroquois, a small boutique hotel. The rooms were very clean and well appointed; the bed was very comfortable and noise was at a minimum. The staff were very professional and courteous and were quick to provide any assistance when needed. The location was superb - very close to Times Square, Grand Central Terminal, and a 20 minute walk to Central Park. Would definitely re-book. This property in the future.

This is a really great hotel. Old-fashioned in all the best ways - no hip trappings and funky lighting, no undisclosed 'facilities charge' (a currently fashionable scam among NYC hotels which I can only hope one day results in a class action lawsuit), just a good honest concern for the welfare of its guests. It feels like a slice of an earlier NYC.The staff are excellent - friendly, informal, always ready to help and creative in dealing with unforeseen issues. Seriously, you can ask these people for anything and they'll find a way.My room was recently refurbished and immaculately appointed in retro 1960s brown and beige, Norman Parkinson 1940s/50s Vogue photographs, enormous and wonderful tiled bathroom (with a tub - hooray), plentiful towels and thick bathrobes. Much attention has been paid to the bed (it always amazes me that so many hotels skimp on what is, after all, the main point of staying in a hotel) - it is huge and wonderfully comfortable.NB. Renovations are currently underway at The Iroquois, and so the hotel is running at half speed - no bar or restaurant. The desk staff were apologetic but clearly excited about what the place will be like once the work is done - and I share their enthusiasm. Meanwhile, the sheer charm, value, efficiency and comfort of this place is enough to merit a 5* review even without the bells and whistles.I visit NYC a lot, and have tried a lot of different hotels. In its philosophy of care and evocation of an older NYC, the hotel which the Iroquois most recalls for me is the The Mark on 77th/Madison but at ¼ the price. My only reservation is that the Times Square radius is not my favourite area of NYC, but The Iroquois can't really help that and it's going to be my regular bolt hole in Manhattan from here on.

I really was shocked to see the the hotel was being renovated! I couldn't even get a cup of coffee. The located was good, but like I said.......they should have been upfront! Also, they charge you $50.00 a day for "incidentals". No "incidentals" were used (wet bar etc) and I'm still waiting for this amount to be subtracted from MY BILL!

Nice, well appointed room with a comfortable bed. Staff were helpful and the Doormen were great, even remembering our names to welcome us back to the hotel on the second night. Only slight negative was the lack of tea or coffee in either the room or hotel, as the hotel bar/restaurant is being renovated this Autumn. Location was excellent and the rooms were quiet - a real plus in this part of NYC!

Hotel is small, but acceptable. The elevator was a bit slow. Room was very clean and was attended to very well everyday. The street is quiet even though it is only 2 blocks off Times Square. I would stay there again.

Rooms were excellent, as was the staff and location. Our only issue was lack of a way to re-use clean towels, too many tiny single use plastic bottles of soap, shampoo, conditioner, etc, and no recycle bin. We had to use the "do not disturb" sign to avoid having clean towels laundered and reduce the large number of tiny plastic bottles in the bathroom. (even though we would have liked to have the room cleaned) Many quality hotels have already adopted these eco-friendly practices.

Great location, great staff, but NO amenities - NO bar, NO resto, NO coffee, only one working but very SLOW elevator, and NONE of this is ever mentioned on the website or by the hotel when you are making the reservation - really not acceptable for the price paid for this hotel.

We were extremely impressed with this heritage boutique hotel. Excellent location close to Times Square and the theatre district. The room was small but very comfortable. The standout was the staff, their attention to detail and excellent communication skills made our stay delightful.

Lovely old NY hotel on a historical street. Very convenient to the theater we went to, but so much nicer to be off of Times Square., which most NYer's don't much like. Room was small, clean and the bed was sooo comfortable. Everyone made us feel special, andthe upgrade was the best of all. Could have been a headache if Vanessa hadn't helped out.

The hotel is outstanding (recently renovated), great location and world class customer service, Vanessa and her team made our stay a memorable one. Will definitely stay at The Iroquois when we visit NYC.

On this trip we planned to see two Broadway plays and take a walking tour in the area. Previously we’ve stayed farther out and when the theaters let out its a long, crowded haul back. Hence the decision to stay here: quick walk to and fro. We like a smaller hotel with old world charm and enjoyed our stay. As other people have noted, the renovation work makes the lobby look like an apartment building and there’s no restaurant or even drinks available (as was stated on the website). We missed having a coffee maker/tea kettle in the room. (The fridge is full of costly things we don’t drink.) A few times we had hot water brought to our room so we could make our own tea~adequate but hardly luxurious.The room itself was of good size, comfortable and quiet with a generous closet with shelving and a safe. Bathroom was exceptionally nice: very roomy with useful shelves and extra long towel bars. A make up mirror and windows that open also a bonus. Staff we encountered seemed friendly although some were new and not that knowledgeable. I wanted to try the sauna but it was closed. To print boarding passes I had to email the front desk so they could print them.Location was great. Easy to walk or take the bus and/or subway to places of interest. Found nice (but expensive) restaurants close by to eat. I look forward to seeing the renovation of this lovely place completed to provide a more comprehensive hotel experience.

It was our second visit to New York after our Cruise in August. We wanted to stay in a different location a few blocks way than our first hotel. A couple of days before we arrived we checked trip advisor for location & nearby restaurants. We discovered there was building work. Upon arrival met by the doorman who accommodated our luggage. Checkin smooth.The lobby was very small due to the construction and only one elevator. There was no water or coffee facilities reception. Our room on the third floor was two queen beds. Very tastefully decorated and a nice compact bathroom. However we did have a lot of luggage this proved tricky as the room was quiet small. There was a stocked mini bar & on top a tray with snacks. However no coffee machine or free water. I feel that a hotel of this standard could take away the snack tray & provide a krups coffee machine and water. The room was at the end of a corridor and therefore relatively quiet.We were not notified at all by our third party booking agent Hotels.com that this hotel was under renovation. I would recommend this hotel when the building work is complete.

This is a very convenient hotel and I have stayed here before. This time it was under renovation, so there was only one small elevator and no restaurant. Check before you book. I am sure it will be very nice again when the renovations are finished. The location is wonderful.
user_name:
Deborah C
Needham, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: The Iroquois hotel is close by the famous Algonquin. It is a smaller boutique hotel with small but stylish rooms and great front desk service, Unfortunately, when I stayed there in early September, the lobby area was quite cramped, and the restaurant/bar was closed to remodeling. I would enjoy staying there again as it is very centrally located to other places I wanted to visit.

This is a lovely hotel in a fabulous location with lovely staff. However, there is extensive renovation work going on to improve bar/restaurant area with a stud wall cutting off the entrance. A bit of a shock when we arrived as it looks disappointing and dated. Tom the lovely manager told me they keep asking booking.com to let people know and nothing has been done to alert visitors. I had booked this hotel months ago and would not have done so if i had known this ... plus no tea or coffee making facilites in room. There is an excellent diner three doors down but expectations need to be managed. Ask Vanessa for advice as she is brill, Tom is excellent manager and Carlos the door man is also lovely.

We stay here whenever we are in midtown but hadn’t been about 2years. We were surprised to see the lobby in the midst of remodeling but you’d never know it from its pristine condition. Construction is being kept out of sight. Rooms look great with new everything including the bathrooms. Luxurious details throughout. Staff is always great and eager to help. Iroquois is a great place close to everything! Walk to shows, world class 5th Avenue shopping, fabulous NY Public library, and Rock Ctr to name a few.

Under construction, the hotel is limited with only one elevator, and no food or coffee service. Good thing there was a Gregory's Coffee across the street. Still, great service and well appointed and very clean rooms

Three of us were in town for a broadway show and I booked at the Iroquois. The location is ideal if you are coming in at Grand Central. It’s just far enough from Times Square to have a quiet night but a short walk to the theater district. The staff was wonderful and the rooms were clean. The beds were very comfortable. I will stay here again.

We spent 5 nights here visiting the city. We wanted to be close to Times Square and the theaters. It was a short walk to these places and to the subway stations that could get us to other parts of Manhattan and to Brooklyn so the location is quite convenient. All of the hotel staff were so friendly and helpful. We were greeted with a smile by the desk staff and Vanessa the concierge daily. The rooms were on the small side but a good size for NYC. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The restaurant/bar are currently being remodeled but there are so many restaurants nearby. We will stay here again on our next visit.

Excellent location, very nice hotel, clean and nice smelling, with a great staff - welcoming, smiling, helping with any request (especially Mrs. Vanessa, the Chef Concierge). Looking forward to see the new look of the hotel after the current transformation that is happening now.

Have been staying here over the years and although the rooms are small, the hospitality just gets larger all the time. All of the staff we encountered in the most recent visit were just so low-keyed and unpretentious, but caring and professional. Miss the bar and dining room, can't wait for them to re-open (the bar was great for meetings at cocktail hour) but in the meantime, a great home in NY.

Location location location. Theatre, shopping and restaurants are right out your door. Staff makes for a warm and inviting stay, the beds and pillows are divine and the rooms are immaculate. The name small luxury hotel nails it!

The Iroquois was recommended to us by my sister-in-law. We were headed to NYC for a show and a visit to the 9/11 memorial. The location was convenient to the theater district and Time Square and was an easy cab ride to the memorial. Our first experience with the hotel began with our doorman, John, who assisted us with our bags and vehicle. The hotel desk staff were friendly and helpful with our couple of questions. We found our room to be very clean and spacious enough for our stay. Close by the hotel is a coffee shop and newly renovated diner. Our visit ended with our doorman, Carlos, who was helpful in retrieving our vehicle and very personable. Great visit and highly recommended.

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. While the room itself was small, it was perfect for 2 people. It looks as though rooms were renovated not too long ago. Very clean & very comfortable beds. The location of the hotel was perfect. It was on 44th between 5th & 6th with close proximity to the Broadway theatre district. The staff was very friendly & helpful.

I love staying at The Iroquois. Location and convenience are not always one and the same in a large city, especially when on business. The Iroquois is centrally located to shopping, restaurants and the Javits Center. The quality of service and accommodations is exceptional and I stay there whenever I come to NYC whether for business or pleasure!!

Nice, efficient, clean hotel very close to Times Square. Doors closing in hallway were a bit on the noisy side. Bathroom was extremely clean, as was the room. Particularly liked the radiant heat in the bathroom floor. Would stay here again.

We all came in to go wedding dress shopping for my daughter. We needed a hotel that could accomodate us and be comfortable! The hotel was very central. Every staff member was courteous. The rooms were clean! Beds comfortable.Our stay was overnight. Great experience! I would highly recommend it!

Premium King was perfect. Request a view of 44th street. Champagne in the room to help us celebrate was a nice touch. Use the concierge. Vanessa was very helpful. Our location was perfect for walking to theaters, Times Square, and fine restaurants. Pack an umbrella just in case of rain.

Have stayed in NYC many many times and yes we are all used to the fact Hotel rooms are smaller in NY. Arrived 830pm for what should have been a 7 night stay. The room was so bad that the next morning at 5am I had to call my company travel team to move me out. The door opened onto the bed and what was meant to be a window was a brick wall. What they called a room was little more then a closet/box! Not even a dog would be expected to stay in such a room. Once I shows the travel team the pictures they could my believe the “prison cell”. When I checked out I was not even asked why I was leaving and cancelling my stay! Says it all! And have made sure our corporate travel company are aware no one should be booked in such a place!

Have stayed in this hotel a few times before , but not for some timeFirst of all the hotel is undergoing renovations ( not mentioned anywhere)Only one elevator working, make one wait a long time both up and downThe hotel in the past offered free coffee in the lobby in the morning.unfortunatly-this has been stopedOtherwise, a very nice stay, rooms clean and we’ll equipped

We had a wonderful time and all of the employees were extremely nice. Vanessa the concierge was the best concierge we have ever had and we have traveled all over the world. it is perfectly located to see shows.

Our first time to New York from New Zealand. We arrived from San Francisco at 9am in the morning and I was sick and we didn't think we would be able to check in so early but I was too sick to do anything else. The staff quickly made a room ready for us and had a manager check the room first before we checked in and I was able to spend the day in bed. This boutique hotel is 5 star. Beautiful rooms, Super King Bed, luxurious bedding and pillows and the cleanest Hotel we have ever stayed in and we have stayed in hundreds of hotels. The location is incredible. Walk left to 5th Ave for shopping or turn right for Times Square and Broadway. The hotel is quiet, just far enough from Times Square that you don't get the noise. We will definitely be staying here next time we come to New York. Thank you to the staff that acted quickly to check us in early. Your service and Hotel is impeccable.

The hotel is lovely and in a great location. Not a far walk to the theater district or time square. The room was very comfortable and clean and the beds were very comfortable. We loved the house slippers provided and the soaps were great and smelled good. The tangerines in the lobby were a nice snack. The staff was very nice and friendly. This is a beautiful little hotel in a very nice location. I have nothing negative to say about it.

I have stayed at the Algonquin several times when visiting New York for theater. This time I decided to try something different but in the same neighborhood. I chose the Iroquois and I was so pleased with my choice. The room was well appointed and spotlessly clean each day of my visit.
