The hotel is quiet and not noisy and has a ;peaceful feel to it and I slept very well. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful as well. In short, it was a great hotel I would recommend to anyone and one that I will stay in the next time I am in New York

Awesome, Amazing, the best!! Great hotel in this location, super clean rooms, friendly staff, an amazing experience. I highly recommend it for your next trip to the Big Apple without the slightest hesitation!!

We checked into the Iroquois early on Saturday, August 31 for 4 nights and had stayed next door at the Algonquin the night before due to a mix up on a flight change. The staff here were very accommodating and held our bags for the day before our room was ready. We were off to see the sites of NYC. We received a call around 2:00 pm advising us that our room was ready. We stayed in Suite 370. The suite we were in was huge and everything in the room and central air conditioning worked as it should. There was a mini-bar fridge stocked with items in the room with a small area for guest use. Also noted, if you needed a fridge in your room for other items to store, guests would be accommodated. We ordered one and a small fridge was delivered to the room and turned on.Other comments about the room include shades and drapes that kept the room quite dark out when it was light outside. This was very nice. The beds were very comfortable with 4 large pillows on our king bed. The only small inconvenience was ice needed to be ordered each time vs. having a machine located somewhere in the hotel for self-serve. Also, there was a lobby / restaurant renovation going on while we were there which only allowed for one elevator to be in service. This made wait times for the only elevator serving the building to be well over 3-4 minutes at times.Overall, the room and hotel were excellent. Vanessa, Tom and John were also very nice and had the perfect customer service skills. Thank you all, we’ll be back.

We chose the Iroquois because of its location and weren’t disappointed. An easy walk from Penn Station to the hotel and an easy walk from it to the sights. On check in we went directly to our room and were delighted to find some chocolates and wine to celebrate our wedding anniversary. A lovely and thoughtful touch. Our room was excellent and we weren’t affected by the building work at all. There was a short wait for the lift but not too bad. Definitely recommend and if we come back to New York will look to book again.

Despite reception, bar and restaurant being refurbished, still charging top dollar. Disappointed at speed of refurbishment, website at time of booking said it would be complete late summer, now says it will be in fall

We stayed here for 5 nights and received excellent service. The location was also amazing. We cannot say a bad word about this hotel. It was clean, quiet, and the staff could not do enough for us. Strongly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York.

Staying at The Iroquois was part of an anniversary trip to see Dear Evan Hansen and dinner at Daniella’s. The Iroquois was everything we hoped it would be : upscale, with attention to detail, welcoming, impeccably clean and comfortable ! The staff was on top of their game as well. We’ll return!

Only 1 elevator and no use of stairs.We had to always wait and constantly have full elevator pass us.No restaurant or bar.No business centre to print boarding passes.Staff was very helpful but couldn't help with lack of space.

Quiet, small hotel. Stay very pleasant.Cute, small hotel- all accessories/necessities needed are available.Great area- just a block away from the hustle and bustle.Location was ideal- not far from Grand Central, also across from parking garage. So either which was is perfect in accommodating your travel preference. Hotel room was small but manageable- good size bathroom which I prefer to compromise some room space for.Hotel also very clean.Only complaint is there is just 1 elevator which runs slow when trying to accommodate 12 floors of guests.

Hotel is in midtown and close to shopping and theater. The staff was very helpful and always pleasant. The rooms are small but well appointed with robes and slippers, safe, iron and ironing board in closet. Honor bar with refrigerator in room. Fruit at front desk. Very nice!

Check in was easy. Small lobby due to restaurant under construction. Down to one small elevator during this reno. Rooms were very clean, comfortable pillows and bed, classic robes and toiletries, great wifi, housekeeping responded quickly, friendly staff, reasonably quiet. All the basics done well, no extra luxury.

Location, service, decor, etc. is all top notch! Although the restaurant/lobby is currently being renovated, the staff still did a great job making sure the inconveniences were minimal. Looking forward to returning after the renovations are completed this fall.

The Iroquois New York is a beautifully appointed hotel with equal helpings of class and charm. Like all properties going through renovations, there are some growing pains, but the kindness and helpfulness of the staff outweighs any issues you might encounter. We will definitely be back!

Stayed here two days in August. Staff went out of their way after they found out I was celebrating a birthday, but overall were all friendly and helpful (even cleaning staff). Room was very clean and well-kept. Location great. Single elevator for 12 floors not so great (LONG waits at times), and voucher for "breakfast" next door was nothing more than pastry and coffee -- chintzy for an expensive hotel. I'd definitely stay there again, but expect to pay a premium. Kudos to management for staff training, though -- best I've seen in NYC so far.

There was a festival taking place the day I checked in. The roads around the hotel were closed to vehicles and even pedestrians. It literally took me an hour just to get into the hotel. Yet I had called the hotel twice that day before I arrived and they never said a word. When I told the manager that when I called they should have told me where to park and how to enter, but he just shrugged. His “so what” attitude was disappointing. I have stayed here before, and like the location, but I probably will stay somewhere else next time. Just a reminder Mr. Manager: there are other hotels in NYC.

This was only a one night stay but the room was clean, comfortable and well equipped. I had a good night's sleep and was ready for my business meetings the next day. I particularly appreciated the desk and power supplies accessible.

Overall Great Experience... Only thing I could say is that an Additional elevator is needed, but we managed.Honestly one of the best Sleeps we had in a while; Nice Size Bed,comfortable Mattress, & soft Bedding... Thank You!
user_name:
Jefe126
New York City, New York

review_body: Very good position just inside Times Sq., room standard size, my has small window without daylight (3rd floor), excellent bed, good service. Slow elevator. only 1 for all guests. For short trip very good

Adorable 1900’s feel. Rooms are smaller, but beautifully decorated. Staff is super friendly and helpful with anything. Great for a couple to retreat from the world. Location is excellent, Just minutes from Times Square.

We have stayed at the Iroquois many times and enjoy the great location and good value. The check in was slow this trip because there was only one person to assist guest. VERY unusual based on past trips.

The location is perfect. The hotel is luxurious and I just love the staff. They are the best. The hotel is right at Times Square and the theatre district. I always stay at the Iroquois when I'm in New York, because you get the intimate feel along with luxury.

This is one of the nicest places I’ve stayed in NY. It has old world charm with modern conveniences. It’s bigger than most places I’ve stayed with a full closet and desk. The bathroom was lovely- beautiful tiles and great touches like a magnifying mirror. There were robes and slippers in the room and the bathroom floor was heated! All the front desk staff were upbeat and pleasant. My only regret is that I couldn’t stay longer!

Ok so I should say upfront that we got a great deal on our stay there so if I were to balance what we paid with what was experienced then I’ve no complaints. My wonderful wife and I had a short break in NYC. This was following on from some US business trips we’d had. On arrival the staff could not have been more helpful and welcoming, so no complaints whatsoever with the staff. The hotel itself was not at all as was expected. The details here on TA suggest that the hotel has two bars and a restaurant. Well it might have had a while ago, they’re currently under refurb. Not just one of them. All of them. So if you want breakfast then you need to book with their ‘partner’ hotel next door, remember to chat to your mortgage advisor before leaving home though as you’re going to need the cash. Also, when you get back late at night from enjoying a show on broadway or the best Italian meal ever in Greenwich Village, don’t expect to grab a night cap, there’s NO bar, except the mini one in your room of course (don’t forget to consult that mortgage advisor). So never mind, there may not be a restaurant for breakfast, at least you can make yourself a coffee or tea in the morning with the ubiquitous tea and coffee making facilities in the room......oh hold on...... there’s none of those either..... really? ..... really? Yep sorry sir, need to order coffee from the hotel next door (did I mention the mortgage advisor?).That said, the room was great, clean tidy, well maintained as you’d expect. But this is a hotel, in central New York, sorry but I expected better..

We stayed at the Iroquois for 4 nights and loved it. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The hotel was close to Times Square and fifth avenue but still very quiet in the room. The rooms were lovely and very clean. This was just what we needed for our stay in New York and would highly recommend it!

Excellent service in all regards, especially concierge! Restaurant advice was impeccable. The boutique size of hotel allowed for greater personal treatment including map & directions and even choice of umbrellas!

We have always been pleased with our stays at any Triumph Hotel. It is a hotel group that you can rely on for comfort and extra-special attention. Our overnight experience at the Iroquois Hotel was lovely and went beyond our expectations. Each member of the staff was pleasant and accommodating; the rooms we booked were spotless and we had two very comfortable, quiet rooms. The hotel is in a fine location and will soon include a renovated bar/restaurant. Throughout our stay the staff was friendly and professional. We were even surprised with a kind note and birthday cupcakes and wine. It was such a special treat and surprise. P.S: Our only suggestion would be to offer complimentary coffee and a hook on the bathroom door for robes.

I don't normally like to stay in midtown but I was very pleased with the quiet location. The staff couldn't have been any nicer. The room and bathroom were also nice but very small (especially the bathroom). However, I did get the least expensive room available. I would have given the room a higher rating if it and the bathroom had not been so small.

You hardly can beat the price/quality of this location. Clean rooms, friendly staff, efficient service. The location at a walking distance of Tomes Square, Grand Central Station, and to Metro stations is particularly convenient.

I will stay at this hotel again. It was fantastic! The beds were super comfortable, the service was impeccable, it was super clean, and the location was great. We were able to walk to Broadway shows, great restaurants, and Central Park.

The hotel is currently undergoing renovations so for regular visitors, the Library is no longer there nor is the complimentary morning coffee and the restaurant is being re done. . Only one elevator is working and there seemed to be slight problems with the room keys not working. Aside from these issues, the hotel's location and atmosphere is excellent and the staff - especially Vanessa- is courteous, helpful and very obliging.We celebrated a special event and the hotel went outta their way to be extra nice and generously provided a complimentary bottle of bubbly. I would absolutist recommend this hotel.

This hotel was perfect for us. Perfect location, people were nice, convenient parking. Rooms were small but bathroom was roomy. I think this location is the best. Close to Bryant Park, Grand Central and Broadway.

Great Mid-Town Place to Stay. Close to the theaters, subway stops, and Grand Central. Very nice rooms that have been recently refreshed, quiet and cool environment. Staff is friendly and always helpful. Internet works great.

Excellent accommodations & service. conveniently located. Close to Madison Ave and Time Square. Nice quite street on 44th. Staff is amazing and always welcoming. I have stayed there for work and pleasure. Free Coffee in the lobby in the morning and happy hour in the evening.

Rooms were beautifully decorated and very clean. The bed was so comfortable, I never wanted to leave it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Great location, easy walking distance to Broadway theaters.

Great location, clean but only drawback was the size of the rooms. Very small and struggled to unpack two open cases at the same time Staff very helpful and friendly and knowledgeable of the New York area

Stayed for 3 nights while on business. Staff was very professional and courteous. Rooms clean and comfortable. Great big bathrooms. Close to it all but in a neighborhood setting. Good restaurants and bars very close. Quite nights and comfortable rooms. Would stay again.

i was disappointed with the lack of dining and bar and no where else to gather there, the total lack of coffee anywhere, a variety of other complaints. staff and cleanliness were good. I would not stay there again give the above and various other issues

The Iroquois Hotel is very close to Times Square and Bryant Park---only a few minutes walk---yet it is located on a street that is quiet and safe. If you can get a good deal, like us, it is a perfect hub location to plan your day trips around the city. The rooms are impeccable. Clean, well decorated, with a fridge to put your water bottles. All the employees are welcoming, friendly, and professional. Do not hesitate to stay here for either business or pleasure or both.

We have stayed here multiple times and will continue doing so. The recent renovations make it even better and we look forward to their completion. Even with renovations underway, the hotel was very comfortable, clean, friendly, and the renovations did not disrupt anything.

From the doorman to the desk staff a ready smile and positive comments were expressed. The room was comfortable and offered a good nights sleep. I recommend bringing your own beverage of choice if you like to imbibe in the comfort of your hotel as the lounge is currently closed for renovation.

My husband and I wanted a weekend in the city. A friend recommended the Iroquois Hotel. We could not have been more pleased! The Iroquois is a charming boutique hotel that was centrally located to all the things we wanted to enjoy. The rooms were chic, clean and fresh. We loved the retro city photographs that hung around the halls and the room. The beds were firm and the bedding was crisp and very comfortable. The staff was attentive and had great knowledge of the area. They were helpful in pointing us in the right direction when it came to dinner reservations and special events going on in the city that weekend. I would highly recommend this hotel. Besides the comfort and quality of the rooms, the location was just steps away from the theaters, great shops, cafes, bars, and restaurants.

This is my 3rd time staying here in the last year. (The 1st time and 2nd time were also a charm) A wonderful boutique hotel with personalized service (kudos to Christoph), spotless rooms, and excellent location near Time Square, Broadway, Bryant Park,5th Avenue, Grand Central and subways. The hotel is currently undergoing a renovation ( no restaurant on premise) and one elevator. However do not let this stop you from staying here. Highly recommended.

We absolutely loved the Hotel and its location. It was within walking distance (for us) of everything and place that we wanted to go do and see. we were very happy! We would recommend this property to everyone!

We appreciated the location of the Iroquois Hotel... it is in a quiet location but close to Times Square.The staff was helpful and personable.I booked the property through Hotels.com and was not aware of the Bar/ Restaurant closure, due to renovations. That was a bit of a letdown.

Would recommend to anyone who likes small, quite hotels in the city. A real treat compared to the loud, noisy, tourist megaliths that seem to proliferate in the City. A very welcome and much appreciated respite from constant flow of the city!

The Iroquois is still going through renovations, but the only inconvenience was the lobby. There was no early morning coffee and newspaper to greet guests, which seems like such an inexpensive yet much appreciated touch. Inconsistent doorman availability. Room was beautiful and well appointed. And a really clean and friendly diner is just steps away!

Second time at the Iroquois, and was not disappointed. Ideal location and friendly staff. Was hoping for completed remodeling, but will just have to return to see it! The hotel even offered a free 90 minute walking tour of Bryant Park, the library, and Grand Central Station.

Having stayed at other small luxury hotels in NYC, The Iroquois was a breath of fresh air. Rooms were clean, the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. Walking distance to the theater district and many restaurants.

The hotel was excellent and the staff we're very friendly and attentive. The room's are fairly large considering this is NYC and we had a great time. Would not hesitate to comeback and stay @ this hotel.

Wonderful!! Loved the location and the employees were wonderful!! also they always had water and fruit available in the lobby!! They could use a nice restaurant/bar in the hotel. However, I heard that is in the making!!

We had a wonderful stay. The hotel was undergoing renovations but we barely noticed the inconvenience due to the fantastic staff. I was at some eyes and smiles on their faces from Dorman to check in to the concierge. I think given great information from Vanessa and everything was seamless and comfortable. Rooms are spacious by New York City standards and clean and quiet. Everyone was so lovely and we hope to come back on reservations are complete. Stay here he will not be disappointed. Location was excellent as well convenient dining and Broadway.

Clean. Great bed. Dark rooms. Quite. Perfect when working late and have early morning meetings. Rooms are small, but more than fill the bill. Construction is taking place, so there is a wait for the elevator, but that isn't something to gripe about. Just plan accordingly.
user_name:
Mommys3girls
New York City, New York

review_body: The Iroquois hotel is in a great location, convenient to Rockefeller Center and other midtown locations. It doesn't have the fancy lobby that other motels may have, but I found the rooms to be very nice and up to date. If you normally stay at a Four Season, Ritz Carlton, etc., this is a nice alternative.

This hotel is great! Good location- close to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. The best part was how amazing the staff is! I would book here again just because of how great they are! If you will be staying in the area check this place out!

Respectfully workers. The only thing that surprised me was how small our room was. Main entrance or lobby was small but l was told that it was under construction. Room cleaning was good. Location was perfect. Serving coffee/tea, ice water in the morning was perfect

Terrific hotel! The rooms have very comfortable beds with nice linens. The rooms are appointed with all new items; LG flat screen TV, refrigerator, hair dryer, iron. It's like being at home or much nicer! The staff is exceptional. They all have been there quite a long time.

My wife and I stayed for 4 days/3 nights at the Iroquois recently and enjoyed our stay. We had a queen room on the 5th floor which had zero view, but was nice and quiet. Good working A/C and comfy bed. The bathroom is painfully small...we could never both be in it. But the shower was fine with good water pressure. The heated bathroom tiles were a nice touch. Each afternoon they'd put out a free alcoholic beverage...bottle of wine or a rum punch. My main gripe is I'm a big coffee guy. No coffee maker in the room and they only put coffee out in the morning (which wasn't very good). Free coffee all day is always a nice perk I like at a hotel, but not a deal breaker. Front desk and door staff were very kind. The Iroquois didn't blow me away by any stretch but we weren't disappointed at all and enjoyed our stay.

First time staying here but will stay again when I go to New York. Staff was courteous and knowledgeable, rooms are clean and close to a lot. The lobby was under construction but there was no inconvenience to guests.

Simply put, the Iroquois exceeded expectations, it was a wonderful value and I'll never stay in those huge hotels again. Everything from the courteous staff, to the well appointed rooms, top quality bedding, towels and toiletries were perfect. You can't beat the location, which is a short walk to Grand Central in one direction and a short walk to Times Square and the theaters in the other direction.

Rooms clean and provided with everything except coffee maker. Staff VERY helpful and friendly and Doorman can get a cab in minutes! DJ's Restaurant next door or Algonquin also next door will provide mels and cocktails until renovation complete. Very convenient so guest don'r realy miss those things for the moment. New Lobby should be ready next week. I am returning in October. Hotel was full.

My daughter and I stayed at the Iroquois to celebrate my retirement. This hotel was everything we could have asked for in a hotel in Manhattan. We were easily able to walk to the Theater District, restaurants and shops (without being directly in the noise of Times Square). The room was nicely styled, and very clean. The beds were extremely comfortable. The best part of our stay was the staff. They were all very polite and helpful. Vanessa (at the front desk) answered all of my questions, gave me wonderful recommendations, and never appeared to be rushed or bothered by my many questions. She even had a sweet surprise sent up to my room for my retirement. I will definitely return, and will recommend The Iroquois to all of my friends.

Loved how quiet this hotel is. Great location. We were within walking distance of the Schuberttheater & restaurants. Loved the makeup mirror in the bathroom. Very good lighting in the bathroomas well as the main room. Well thought out.

We were very disappointed with our stay at the Iroquois. Our booking made on 1st February for a 3 night stay commencing 24th July gave absolutely no warning that the hotel would be undergoing major refurbishment. No subsequent message was sent warning us that aside from a gym, there would be absolutely no facilities available on site. The breakfast advertised at additional cost had to be taken at another hotel nearby. There was no functioning bar or café and the restaurant had a sign saying “Re-opening Summer 2019”! There were sounds of banging and drilling during the daytime. During our stay, the hotel had only one functioning elevator for guests over 12 floors leading to waiting times of several minutes. We have stayed in New York on many occasions and our “Deluxe King Room” was one of the smallest of our many stays. The bathroom was tiny. Perhaps the clue is in the first word of the group title “Small Leading Hotels”. The room had the smallest closet I have ever seen which held precisely 9 hangers sideways on. No adequate room for setting up suitcases and no room to store clothes if you’re staying more than a few days. I used my case situated on the floor as a wardrobe taking care not to trip over it. However, the room was well appointed and clean and the hotel is well positioned on W44th between 5th and 6th, a stones throw from Times Square.
user_name:
GeraldS834
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. With so many tower blocks surrounding it, the room was a bit dark and we needed the light on even in the day. We would definitely stay there again.

We booked this hotel largely on price and location. Turned out to be an excellent choice. Small and quiet, with excellent staff. Walking distance from most things we wanted to see or do. Easily accommodated us when our flight home was cancelled after we had checked out. Will stay there again on our next visit.

We arrived early and our room was already ready which was nice. The room was clean and housekeeping kept it fresh and clean for the entire three nights we were there. The location was perfect for walking to shows, restaurants, and shopping.

The location was great. Within walking distance to many sites. There's a great little diner next store that has coffee to go and makes great breakfasts. Staff very friendly. Rooms a little small, but clean and efficient. Would definitely staff again.

This is an excellent hotel. We visited in July 2019 and the hotel is undergoing some renovation. In spite of that, the front desk area and the rooms were very neat. We were not bothered at all by mess or noise.Price point is an exceptional value. The location - in between Grand Central and Times Square - can't be beat. Our room was clean and spacious and kept up to date. The bathroom was very nice, with a walk in shower. The front desk staff belongs at a 5 star hotel. Can't say enough good things about them. We got into town early and were able to check our bags. Buckets of ice were delivered quickly when we requested them.I will stay here again on my next visit.

I was skeptical when my husband hooked this boutique hotel but he assured me that location combined with the reviews and reasonable price was worth it!! I couldn’t agree more!! This is a lovely hotel with kind and helpful staff, and clean rooms just minutes fromTimes Square. Despite the renovations they are doing and lack of onsite restaurant, we enjoyed the complementary drinks in the afternoon and coffee and tea in the morning.  I would recommend this hotel to just about anyone (unless you want/need a large bedroom and bathroom). It was just perfect for the 1 of us!!

Lucked into the Iroquois for last night in NYC. Very friendly staff. Gracious and helpful check-in. Very clean and nicely appointed rooms. Lots of cool bars and restaurants (shout out for Lambs Club across the street) on the block and in the area.

Lovely hotel - will be even more so upon completion of their renovation project. They are currently undergoing a major renovation to the lobby and restaurant so the front lobby is a temporary setup. It is nicely set up in the small space they have to temporarily occupy and the foyer smells delightful. We were on the 6th floor and were never disturbed by any noise or disruption due to the construction/renovation. The hotel and staff did a great job of keeping that closed off and unnoticeable.The staff were amazing - 11 out of 10 for everyone we came in contact with! Front desk, bell desk, concierge and management were extremely courteous, friendly and helpful.Cannot say enough about the personnel!

My wife and I were very happy with the overall quality and experience at the Iroquois. It was our twelfth anniversary and we were delighted with the ambiance, cleanliness and service provided. The lobby is undergoing a renovations, so the lobby is has been temporarily relocated to the area of the Triomphe restaurant adjacent. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful.

The room is clean but the hotel service is quite bad. Room is not ready when I arrived, which is way after 3 pm. Front desk is not helpful and even don't know how to check out. Some of the staff are even rude.

The hotel is stylish, historic but contemporary, and the staff are amazing and highly professional. Very comfortable beds and spacious (for NYC) bathrooms and very well designed. I will stay here again!

Really good location, actually the best near time square and central park! The hotel service is superb, realiable internet, very comfortable and clean rooms!! In my opinion, the best value for money hotel in new york

Iroquois has everything you need for NYC stay. It is pretty, clean, has a great staff and service, even has a happy hour wine and cheese. The library will be restored after renovation as well as the restaurant and bar. Excellent!

Deciding on a hotel in NYC is so overwhelming. We were 1 of 2 couples traveling together for the 4th of July weekend. We finally decided on the Iroquois because I called in and had the pleasure of speaking to Kristoff. It is difficult to find someone willing to answer your questions and act as though they want to be of assistance. I booked this hotel based on this interaction with Kristoff and how nice and helpful he was.We arrived and were greeted warmly by Kristoff and another lady. They promptly checked us in, Our rooms were ready, They had even put both rooms on the same floor. They also offered us a glass of prosecco (Which they had available at the front desk 24/7).The room was very clean and recently updated. I would not say it was spacious, but it certainly was not small and there was plenty of room for the 2 of us. The decor was stylish and the heated tile floor in the bathroom was a nice touch. The linens were high quality (Frette) and the bed was comfortable. Our room was also nice and quiet on the 8th floor. I would definitely recommend a room away from the elevator because it might not be so quiet there.The location is very close to Times Square and the theater district. Fantastic location really, because you could walk to so many attractions in just a few minutes, but not have to deal with the shoulder to shoulder crowds on the sidewalk or the street noise.The real highlight here is the employees. As nice as the hotel was, the staff out-shined all the other wonderful attributes of the Iroquois. I wish I would have written this as soon as I returned home, because I am unfortunately failing to remember some of the other names I wanted to mention.The concierge- sweet girl who offered our friend her Blink182 ticket which we could not take her up on. Very friendly and engaging.Night time desk clerk- Oliver maybe? Always smiling and greeted us so warmly when we came in late in the evening and always offered us bottled water to take up to the room. There was another employee, I am not sure what his position was but I think his name was JJ, also always chatty and smiling. In fact, we did not encounter one single employee there that was not doing a great job and making us feel welcome.In the lobby, they always have something out for the guests. In the morning it was coffee and tea, throughout the day it was iced water and juice, and in the evening it was iced water, juice, an alcoholic beverage of punch or wine, etc. They also had fruit and Hershey kisses. Speaking of the lobby....yes, the main lobby, Lantern's Keep, and restaurant are being remodeled so the makeshift lobby is small and unremarkable. That being said, it was still fine and designed well to isolate the construction which we never heard or saw. I do hope I get to go back and see everything once it is complete.Great job, Iroquois..... you guys are definitely getting it right!!!!

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Iroquois. Great location for going to plays and other activities. Express bus from Newark airport lets off at Nearby Bryant Park, so that is also very convenient. Very happy with our decision to stay here.

This hotel is in perfect walking location to everything. The staff was wonderful the room was great. I loved everything about it, and would recommend it to anyone traveling to NYC. Our room was perfect size without feeling cramped.

Aside from two workers I and other guests I shared an elevator with found to be very rude, this was a great hotel for the price. They have in room massages that are convenient and great! 24 hour gym and sauna was also a great plus.

I would wait until renovation is done. The rate was fair but no less than the Sofitel right next store but the Sofitel did not have a king avail...I will say the room was very nice. Tasteful, neat and clean.

Beautiful room with comfortable bed, extremely quiet even though we were right next to the elevator. Outstanding service from the front guest and doorman. Perfect location on a (relatively) quiet street but just steps away from Time Square and theaters. Fantastic value. We have stayed in small boutique hotels around the world and the Iroquois is right at the top!Added bonus: Kellari Taverna next door and the Red Fame Diner were great for dinner and breakfast.

Stayed at the Iroquois for 3 night. Nice size clean room. Had a room at the front on 2nd floor. It can be noisy with street noise but otherwise was quiet. Staff very friendly and helpful. Good location and easy walk to times square, 5th Avenue and Grand Central station.

We booked The Iroquois on Hotel Tonight as a last minute 4th of July trip down to the city. It was fun being in the center of things -- so close to Times Square and Rockefeller Center -- as we haven't lived in NYC for nearly a decade. The hotel rooms were of decent size, and very clean, though the hotel itself doesn't have a lot of amenities. The restaurant is under construction and there's no hotel bar or large lounge area. But the staff is very kind and accommodating, and there is a fitness center and sauna if you want to start of your day with a bit of exercise. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again for a night or two. Definitely a great location for sightseeing, as you cannot be more centrally located.

Yippie! Bathroom has full sized tub.Heated bathroom floor.Bathrobe is provided.Fresh fruit in the lobby.The silliest thing about this hotel is this survey. They won't accept your comments unless you write at least 200 characters.

I have stayed several times at the hotel and have really enjoyed my stays. It is conveniently located to shopping and NY c attractions. The staff are helpful and extremely friendly. It is a great value!

All the staff at the Iroquois were friendly and sporting a smile. The room was small, but the bed and pillow were comfortable. The rear-facing room was reasonably quiet, except for the hum of the A/C unit outside (room was on the 4th floor, which was just above the A/C unit on a lower roof). The only disappointment was that one of the wash cloths had prominent red and yellow stains on it. I could not tell whether this was a wash cloth used by previous guest and not replaced, or a wash that was poorly laundered so the stains were not removed. It was a relatively minor issue that did not mar the overall experience (hence the 4/5 rating), but it made me wonder about the cleanliness of the other towels and wash cloths I was using.

The hotel was located near Time Square and was a convenient location from where to visit the other parts of Manhattan. All of the staff members were lovely and approachable. Would definitely visit again.

we stayed at iroquois in february and it was great, the room was nice, it was quiet though to the great locationthe staff was friendly and helped us at any timethe bar had deliscious cocktailvariationswe can recommend this great location

A great place to stay in NYC with friendly staff, comfortable rooms and a great location. We would definitely stay here again. The hotel is being remodeled right now but they did a wonderful job of making the hotel feel upscale and comfortable.

Very nice facility with friendly staff. Just wished we could have stayed without construction going on. No view whatsoever out the window, but couldn't have been quieter, which was more important to us than a view. Vanessa the concierge was awesome (and that's a word I try not to overuse as much as possible). Room was a little small, but clean.

The location was perfect for visiting Manhattan by walking. We walked to Amercan museum of National history and Central Park easily.Staff were very nice and friendly. The rooms were old style but comfortable. Too noisy at night because we were in downtown.Unfortunately when we were there, the restaurant was under renovation. So we had to have a continental breakfast at the restaurant next door. It was just a basket of 3 kinds of pastries with a cup of coolffe and a fruit juice.

In a lovely area of NY. The staff were very helpful the rooms were lovely and the hotel had a nice homely feel about it, would highly recommend this hotel. On arriving we were welcomed with happy hour which happens a couple of times a week so wine and cheese and other guests to mingle with a lovely touch.

This is my second time at the Iroquois and it did not disappoint. Our room was very clean with a note and some goodies for my nephew who graduated from high school as well as some goodies for Aunt Sue. A special thank you to Vanessa for the sweets and welcoming my nephews and I and making our stay special

Great cost hotel with friendly and helpful staff. There are about 1.5 hour walking tours available every day. The restaurant is closed for renovation. The included breakfast was a continental breakfast (coffee, juice, and croissant). The room wasn’t noisy, bed was comfortable. Lowdown’s were the AC blowing from above strait into face and some dust in the room - I can easily spot it on the mobile phone screen in the morning.

great location very clean staff was the best always there when you need them bellmen did a great job with my bags every need taken care of will be back august everything you want to do you can walk to shows subway 5th ave grang central

I’ve stayed here twice now and I’ll go back. My only issue is with the internet service and this time with the Libby computer which just didn’t work, and wasn’t fixed while we were there. The rooms are smallBut comfortable. They beds are comfortable. For NYC it’s very quiet and it’s only about 1.5 blocks from Time Square.

Check-in was very efficient. Unfortunately, the main lobby and bar/restaurant area was being renovated, which we were unaware of when making our reservation. This meant only 1 elevator was in service which was annoying at times. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are comfortable if a little on the small side. The bed was not as comfortable as comparable hotels we have stayed in on this trip. The location was great for us - everywhere we wanted to go was within walking distance.

My girlfriend loves this place, and it is on her rotation when she travels to NYC for business. She was so excited that I was going there for the first time and kept talking about the speakeasy lounge in the hotel. Unfortunately l, when arrived and she asked about the lounge, she was told for the first time that the bar was closed for construction. When she called to book the place, she was told the hotel was having a summer special but not informed that the bar would be closed. The only other issue was out room was literally 2 feet from the elevator and the noise was a lot. You can see the light from the hallway through the side of the door. A little insulation around the door would help with the noise level.The staff was excellent, and the room was very nicely appointed. Bathroom was good, and the berry tea downstairs was a nice touch. Great location and nice place. But, she was quite disappointed about not being told about the speakeasy being closed when she called to book. She has been going there for years,but I’m not sure whether that will happen again.

We just left the city after a quick overnight to meet up with friends and see a show. We returned to one of our favorite hotels in the city, the Iroquois --a beautiful hotel with the staff to match. Special thanks to Christof for ensuring we had a memorable, albeit brief visit. We will be back!

It was one of many times we have selected the Iroquois for our stay in NYC. Despite their construction, our room was quiet, beautifully appointed and all the amenities were high quality. Every member of their staff smiled, greeted us at every turn and were extremely helpful. It’s not the most economical choice in Manhattan but so centrally located that we could take buses and the subway anywhere.

Room was good size and cleanliness high throughout the hotel , staff very pleasant and helpful nothing was too much botherhotel located just up from Times Square easy access to all popular locations and restaurants

An excellent boutique hotel. Similar to The Talbot in Chicago, for those who are familiar. Very clean and well appointed rooms, which are quiet, and, at night, dark. The staff truly cares for it's guests and it shows.Will happily return to The Iroquois on our next New York adventure.

Had to make a quick trip to NYC and could not get into the usual hotel so gave this a try because it was close to the office and I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was small but very clean and well appointed. I had everything that I needed and was very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Great hotel!! Perfect location for midtown activities. Fantastic stuff with great service attitude. Was able to check in at 9:00am and checkout after 13:00. The room was nice and clean. I will defiantly come back!!

We just spent 8 nights at the Iroquois and could not be more pleased. This was our second time staying at this hotel, the first was in 2014. The rooms and bathrooms have been upgraded and were very comfortable. We had a premium king room and the space was fine for us. The lobby and restaurant are undergoing renovations right now so there is no on site food. They do partner with the restaurant next door for room service if needed. Air conditioning worked well also. The only thing we wished we had was a coffee maker in the room. They do have coffee every morning downstairs for guests but it would be great to have it in the room. We want to give a special shout out to Vanessa, who we remembered from our first visit. She is always happy to give recommendations and chat with guests. We can’t wait for a return stay and try the new restaurant.

You might want to wait until the restaurant remodel construction is finished. Location was great. Close to Times Square and Theatres but a few blocks away so quieter. The staff was very helpful. Rooms small but elegant. Coffee in the lobby in the mornings. Iced tea in the afternoons.
user_name:
Gina H
Diamond Bar, California, United States

review_body: We recently stayed at The Iroquois on W 44th between 5th & 6th. Location, Location, Location. Easy walking distance to Broadway shows, restaurants and shopping. Subway 2 blocks away. Perfect location for you NYC getaway. We have stayed at the hotel many times. They are currently undergoing a renovation of the restaurant and lobby, and when they are done, it is going to be fabulous. Meanwhile, the entrance to the hotel is the previous restaurant entrance. If you go, do not expect a lavish lobby. They have done a good job making due, and it is presentable. NOTE: All the rooms have been upgraded so that is a plus. Construction should be done end of summer? Regardless, a perfect place for your NYC trip, business or pleasure.

Great place to stay in the center of all sites in NYC. Great service, clean room beds were soft and comfortable. front desk was staff extremely helpful. Gave us a map of the local area. I would recommend this hotel

First time in NYC. The hotel is in a great location. Staff was fantastic; greeted with smiles. Room was very nice. They are going through a few upgrades but that did not affect my stay at all. I will be back.

Great location. Staff was very accommodating. They went above and beyond to make are stay comfortable and enjoyable. We highly recommend the Iroquois New York. We will be back to New York again and plan on making the Iroquois our hotel of choice.

My wife and I decided to spend one night in the city and choose The Iroquois based on its history and reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel is going through what appears to be a lobby and restaurant upgrade, so no bar, small sitting area in the lobby or dinning. There are lots of restaurants nearby and room service is available from restaurant next door.The staff at the front desk and door men were professional and courteous. We stayed in a room with a king size bed. The room was cozy, clean with nice features and finishes. Overall very nice place and will be much better when lobby and restaurant is open.
user_name:
pmny
New York City, New York

review_body: This was my second time staying at this wonderful boutique hotel and I will stay here again for sure! Perfect location in the heart of midtown but the street is quiet. Must give major shout out to Oliver, at the front desk. Super friendly and helpful and welcoming.

My husband and I recently stayed in Manhattan New York and the hotel we chose was just perfect. A beautiful Boutique hotel frequently visited by no other than Barbara Streisand herself. The hotel is situated in the perfect location Mid town Manhattan which means we were within walking distance of all the best places to see. When leaving the hotel if you turn right it will take you to Times Square and Broadway when turning left you have Central Park and the Museum Mile. Our trip was firc11 days and we were able to see all the popular attractions as well as visit Coney Island, Queens, New Jersey Ellis Island, not forgetting all the great places to eat. We found a place called Europia where we had our breakfsstcevery morning and a great pie shop called Two Little Red Hens in Lower Manhattan. The transport is brilliant just buy yourself one Metro ticket to share the fare is £2.75 one way so just top it up when you need to. The Metro ticket can be used on the Air ztrain, the Subway, the Trams and the Ferry. Don't bother with the hop on hop off buses if you are ok walking as you will miss so much if you are not on foot. We covered 73 miles walking around this beautiful city and we would recommend the hotel 100%, however there are no tea making facilities on your room so we did go and buy a very small kettle for us to go have a nice cuppa each evening and early morning. There are tea and coffee provided to all guests each morning down in the lobby so you could pop down to get a warm drink but not during the evening as cold ice water is provided at this time as well as hibiscus tea and lots of Hersheys little kisses chocolates, which was a lovely little treat. All the staff are very helpful and courteous, the rooms are spotless and cleaned every morning. All together it was an amazing holiday and we would definitely return.

Reception and staff is exceptional friendly and helpful. You feel like home or like a regular guest.The rooms are very elegant with cozy beds. The regular rooms are too small (fortunately we had a suite). Unfortunately the lobby has no atmosphere, you don’t want to stay there too long. There is no deco, books, cozy cha

I read reviews of this hotel before my stay and I think my expectations were simply too high. My room was tiny, even by New York standards. There was barely enough room to walk around the bed. The window was very small, thus resulting in no natural light coming into the room. It made me think of a jail. The hotel restaurant was closed for renovation, which was a pain when arriving in the evening after a long day of travelling and one is simply too tired to look for dining options. I’ve stayed at many Small Luxury Hotels preciously and usually enjoy the brand, however I was disappointed with this stay.

Stayed at Iroquois for 5 nights. Hotel is perfectly located just close walking distance to Times Square but far enough out to not experience any noise. Very welcoming and staff could not do enough for you. Was our 25th wedding anniversary and we had complimentary cupcakes and wine sent to our room which was lovely. Bar and restaurant closed but that did not cause any issue little diner just down street for breakfast. Would definitely recommend this hotel if staying in New York.

I arrived in my own car (always a challenge in midtown) but was greeted and helped very easily by the staff who assisted with the parking and my bags. Absolutely no hassles. Though the hotel was renovating it's restaurant and bar, everything was orderly and effective. The room was clean, quiet, comfortable, and of good size for a midtown hotel. Staff was very service conscious and attentive.

Position of the hotel means most iconic sites can be reach with a short walk. The Restaurant was under refurbishment so can't say what it would be like to eat there but plenty of places to eat nearby.One lift was out of service so shared by staff and guest.

Why would anyone want to stay at one of the large monster chain hotels when you could stay at this great boutique hotel where every guests is treated as someone very special that they are glad to welcome to their oasis in NYC. Great location if you are going to Broadway shows, or have business in midtown Manhattan.

Thoroughly recommend the Iroquois to anyone wishing to visit New York and base themselves in Mid Town. Close enough to Times Square and Broadway without being affected by the noise, easy walking distance to the key sights of the area (Broadway, The Empire State, Chrysler Building, Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central and Central Park for example). Friendly, helpful staff, clean rooms and once the refurbishment of the hotel bar lounge is completed this summer, it would be high on my list of places to stay in New York.

Excellent staff. Extremely well decorated and well appointed. Great attention to details. Great location. Within walking distance to Grand Central Station, the theaters, Times Square, Restaurants and Shopping.

Nice big rooms, super attentive staff, great shower. Location can’t be beat. And a reasonable price. What else do you want? :)We found a complimentary bottle of wine and a chocolate bar in our room when we checked in, to celebrate our anniversary. Thanks Vanessa and Anna!

Great location, great service and great room. We have stayed here before and love this hotel. Easy parking across the street and just blocks away from the theater. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel!

Stayed overnight while in the city - staff were very friendly and helpful - location was perfect - right in the heart of Times Square and the Theatre District - The welcome gift was much appreciated - would love to stay again

Nicely remodeled vintage hotel close to Broadway theaters and an array of great restaurants. Comfortable room, friendly and knowledgeable staff, pleasant fitness room. Very nice for business or pleasure.

Perfectly located, near Times Square but just far enough away to be quiet. Very pleasant and courteous staff, nicely appointed room and great bathroom. Good bed and bedding! We would like to come back to see the public rooms once the [very quiet and unobtrusive] renovations are complete.

I would highly recommend The Iroquois Hotel to anyone looking for a high-quality and comfortable hotel located in the heart of Manhattan. The hotel's staff was exceptional, including the concierge, as was the hotel's commitment to the details that made our stay extremely comfortable and pleasing. The hotel was spotlessly clean, very well cared for, nicely appointed with comfortable furnishings, and quiet. This hotel certainly fulfilled the "luxury boutique hotel" description!

A gorgeous hotel and great location. I was warmly greeted and Edward at the front desk was wonderful. Room was spotless and very well appointed. Location made it easy to navigate midtown. Great value for the money!

From the moment we stepped through the door the staff at the Iroquois made us feel special!! We were greeted by a bowl of Hershey Kisses and to top this off, glasses of Prosecco to celebrate our weekend. But the one gesture that made quite an impression was a lovely note written by the staff accompanied by a bottle of wine and special treats. We also loved the free tours offered by Dan from StreetwiseNewYork.com!! We will definitely be back.

This is a gem of a hotel located one and a half blocks away from Broadway with great dining nearby. The staff was wonderful and treated us like family. Always had a smile and answered all of our questions and requests for help. We will be back.

I have always wanted to stay at the Iroquois and now I know why...it's lovely, charming and the staff is very professional and personal. My too is spotless and I am very particular. It has everything I need. Not large but just the right size. The bathroom floor is heated, and AC and shower both work fabulously. I am as impressed by the glassware to the products in the bathroom,robes, towels and slippers. I hope to stay more often! Thank you Iroquois you have exceeded my expectations and as a Sotheby's agent for many years that is important to me.

This is a very pleasant hotel right in the middle of the area that most people want to see. the staff were very helpful at all times with anything that you required. It is very close to all the theatres and many places to eat.

My friend and I spent two nights at this gem of a hotel and can’t say enough wonderful things. Though our room was small it was well appointed and clean and comfortable. We appreciated the full size hairdryer in the room and the complimentary wine/beer in the evening. The staff was beyond friendly and helpful. We had zero issues with our stay. Perfection top to bottom and such an easy convenient location to everything. Felt totally safe even walking around at midnight. Highly recommend.

Great little hotel, although the lobby (restaurant and bar) are under renovation. I have stayed here many times for location, safety, service, and ambiance. This visit seemed a little "off". I'm hoping once the renovations are done that it will return to its lovely old self!

I've made no secret over the years I've been writing TripAdvisor reviews that I'm a big fan of the Small Luxury Hotels brand. Recently my wife and I made our semi-annual visit to New York City to see a Broadway show (Come From Away), attend a concert at MSG (Billy Joel's 70th birthday bash), eat some great food (Oyster Bar at Grand Central Station and Keen's Steakhouse) and tour a few museums (911 Memorial and the Natural History Museum). The one thing about The Big Apple is that it never disappoints and is the very definition of world class. With that in mind I wanted to stay at a hotel that would live up to that billing without forcing me into bankruptcy at the same time. We found it at The Iroquois. Here's why.Manhattan is a big island with a zillion things to do and see. You can take the subway quite reasonably to get anywhere on it and we use it a lot when we are in the city, but if I have a preference it is to walk. Only by walking can you really appreciate why New York City is, like London, Paris and Rome, a city that has a unique vibe of its own. That is why my first choice is always to stay in Midtown Manhattan. That's where you'll find Times Square, the Broadway theatre district, Madison Square Garden, the famous shops of 5th Avenue, etc., etc. etc. However, the last thing I want in a hotel is to be too close to the swarming crowds that can be claustrophobic at times. The Iroquois has a perfect location on West 44th between 5th Avenue and The Avenue of the Americas, two blocks from Times Square. The street is relatively quiet, but only a few minutes walk from Broadway. I've stayed in well over a dozen different hotels in NYC and none has had a better location than The Iroquois.I also like a little history in my hotels and The Iroquois has that as well. It is just coming up on 120 years of age and for most of its existence doubled as an apartment/hotel with a number of luminaries as residents. James Dean lived here for two years. For a while in the 1980's it featured a cabaret restaurant run by the legendary Jan Wallman who jump started the careers of Woody Allen, Rodney Dangerfield, Barbra Streisand and Joan Rivers among many others. More recently the larger apartments were converted into what is now a 120 room boutique hotel.The rooms at The Iroquois are quite typical of most New York City hotels, or at least the ones that ordinary mortals can afford. They are not large, but they are luxurious.Like all SLH hotels, the mattresses, linens and toiletries were excellent. I wasn't cracked about the minibar which had virtually no room to store our own beverages, but that was easily solved by having our own mini fridge brought up at no extra charge.The bathroom had a heated marble floor and a really good shower with a great flow of water. That should be a given in any good hotel, but believe me, it's not. Also, I liked the fact that you didn't need to be an Einstein to figure out how to work the darn thing.You can have the best built hotel in the world with the greatest amenities, but it doesn't mean a thing if the staff are not up to snuff. If they are surly or treat you as if you are an interloper or obviously expect huge tips for the most nominal of tasks, it will ruin the experience. The staff at The Iroquois were none of these. Many of them have worked here for decades. They were uniformly exactly what you would expect from a quality hotel - polite without being obsequious, friendly without pretense and there when you needed them. As an example, after checking in I could not locate my cell phone and figured I'd left it in the car which was now somewhere in the offsite valet parking garage. One of the guys on duty accompanied me the two blocks to the garage and we had a great chat about the city and life in general there and back.On Tuesday's and Thursday's there is a manager's reception from five to six. These are not uncommon these days, but usually they are quite parsimonious with the spirits. Not so at The Iroquois where the glasses were refilled by the chap in the picture above as soon as they were half empty. He seemed genuinely determined to make sure everybody was having a good time and by six we definitely were.One thing The Iroquois has that is quite unique is complimentary walking tours six days a week in conjunction with Streetwise New York that start at six different hotels in Manhattan. On Sunday's the tour starts at The Iroquois and features highlights of Midtown Manhattan including Bryant Park, Grand Central Station and the New York Public Library. On other days you can make you way to other hotels and visit TriBeCa, Hell's Kitchen, the Upper West Side, NoMad and Times Square.One thing I should mention for anyone who might be thinking of staying at The Iroquois in the next few months is that there are renovations taking place on the ground floor. The hotel's restaurant and lounge is currently closed.  That's not a hardship because there are tons of great eating and drinking places nearby, but the hotel is also offering a food service from famed chef Daniel Boulud's db Bistro Moderne which is literally right next door. For cocktails try the Blue Bar at The Algonquin which is just two doors down. Finally, if you want more than just a coffee for breakfast go just a few steps farther to The Red Flame Diner which is as New York as you can get and could easily be mistaken for the fictional Monk's from Seinfeld.I've stayed in many hotels that are under renovation and it can easily ruin the vacation if the noise and construction dust are not controlled. I can honestly say that if they didn't tell you that there were renovations going on, you wouldn't notice it. There was no noise and no dust. In fact, for a New York City hotel The Iroquois is extremely quiet. I now have a reason to return when the revamped restaurant and lounge open in the late summer or early fall.So, in conclusion, The Iroquois easily lived up to my expectations as an SLH member hotel

Lovely straff and services. Rooms towards The backyard is not disturbed by streetnoice at all, even though the hotel lies in the centre of Manhattan. Roomdoors could be more noicereductive, but mainly guests at this hotel, have manors, so it wasnt really a problem. We would love to return to The Iroquois!

Clean, quiet room on 9th floor. Great location to attend museums and go to Broadway shows and excellent restaurants within walking distance. There were renovations occurring to the mail floor, but this was not a distraction.

A wonderful hotel! we met a couple in the elevator who said they used to stay up the block at the marriot marquis, but it was so big and noisy. They found the iroquois and stay here every visit! i agree! would come back any time. and the location can't be beat!

Our room, which was a shoe box, had a cricket in the room and it chirped all night long. There are no amenities although they state there are. You need to leave the hotel to get everything and anything. The put out a pot of coffee in the lobby but you have to sit on a bench to drink it. We had 3 rooms all together and none of us will ever stay there again....

One of the reasons I always stay at the Iroquois when visiting NYC is because of the convenience to theaters and restaurants. The rooms are well appointed, and a new renovation is currently underway to be completed in a few more weeks. The staff is incredibly friendly and will do most anything to make your stay a good one

If I needed anything, I have the feeling that it would have been taken care of...but I didn’t. Everything was impeccable here. Note: tiebreaker for other potential hotels you may consider: heated bathroom floors here at the Iroquois! The location is fantastic for tourists: walking distance to Times Square and Grand Central because it’s in between those two landmarks. Yet, it is far away from Times Square to be quieter at night and surrounded by non-touristy dining. Highly recommended. The only thing that might be shocking to out of towners is the small size of the room. But this is no fault of the hotel...It’s midtown Manhattan.

Arrived midday and met Kristoff who was extremely friendly and very helpful. Our room was large with a king sized bed and plenty of storage space. The bedding and towels were of a very high quality as were the toiletries. Coming from the UK I wasn't sure about a hairdryer so brought my own but no need as a salon style dryer was provided.The hotel is on 44th Street and 2 minutes from 5th Avenue shops in one direction and Time Square in the other.I can't think of one negative thing to say and would certainly stay here again and highly recommend this lovely hotel.

Enjoyable heritage hotel. Not the most modern but very cozy. Very helpful staff. Booked a return trip. I would recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues. The location is great for the business I do

Great location for Midtown! The rooms are not huge but are very comfortable. Nestled between 5th and 6th Avenue. The blackout curtains are awesome. The rooms are extremely clean and the staff is very friendly. I recommend having some white noise to drown out the noise of the city. Though it is nestled in off the main street, it still can get a bit noisy from outside.

For many years, I have been coming to this neighborhood for business and staying at another hotel. After a bad experience last year, I found the Iroquois and I was so very happy that I did. This small hotel is so much more lovely: well appointed and simple and very very comfortable. I had a room on the 10th floor that was the QUIETEST sleep that I have ever had in a NYC hotel. Just amazing! The staff was friendly and very helpful, but not at all intrusive. Although the neighboring bar/restaurant was under construction, the neighborhood has ample food/drink options. I will definitely return.
user_name:
Paul J
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Iroquois Hotel in NYC is luxurious in decor,great staff, exceptionally clean, wonderful location with lots of amenities at a very reasonable cost.A very comfortable stay.It is a great place for a vacation, a brief get away or work related experience.

From the moment we walked in, we felt that we were stepping bake to the golden age of NYC and its beautiful hotels! The rooms are perfectly updated, with all the modern conveniences. There is a fabulous restaurant attached, where we had breakfast as well as light bites pre-theater. The bar, a former speakeasy, is really fantastic! Small, intimate, with great ambiance and a server who can get you a unique drink based on your preferences! Can't wait to return!

Nice location: close to Times Square , Central Park and to the Rockefeller center and other tourist places Staff were friendly Rooms were good .... Breakfast we had to eat next door hotel but it was goodLoved my stay there

Centrally locates , walking distance to Penn station, Times Square and Broadway. The Bistro next door provides good breakfast and other meals. A lovable crew at the reception and ever present bowl of tangerines.

We were in need of a place since our plane was delayed, and the Iroquois came to our rescue. Comfortable and kind, in fact they even adjusted the price given our situation, great location, we would stay there again!

Thanks to the excellent team of the Hotel - always friendly and helpful. Every Tuesday and Thursday afternoon complimentary snacks and drinks (also red and white wine). Tea and Coffee complimentary all day and night. Ice cubes were brought to the room if wanted. The closet was too small for my clothings.
user_name:
Travel62113894425
New York City, New York

review_body: If this is the part of town you want to be in, I would certainly recommend the Iroquois. Some of the historic hotels in New York feel like a touristy rip off, but the Iroquois does not feel that way. The cost was reasonable, compared to the going NY rates. Staff are pleasant, the room was clean and quiet (it was on the top floor at the end of a corridor), and there was a fire escape outside the window, which helps you sleep easier! Yes, the room was on the small side, but given that this is Manhattan, what else would you expect? The Iroquois has the advantages of being one of those hotels that appeals to people who appreciate the history of New York, but maybe not those who mainly want a Marriott/chain type of experience. I had no problems during my stay at all and would highly recommend it.

A lovely welcoming spot right in the centre of the city. Just a block and a half from Times Square and around the corner from Bryant Park. While the hotel was beautifully decorated and all amenities were in rooms, the staff were particularly noteworthy. Vanessa the concierge knows everything about the city and is super helpful. However, all the staff were so welcoming and genuine. It was a great stay.

Definitely a great location for theatre goers; was going to several shows and it was only a 10 minute walk to each one. Have been to the Times Square area too many times to enjoy it for other reasons but the choices were limited.Like most NYC hotels, the rooms are small but being small and dark doesn't make the hotel "boutique". Rooms become claustrophobic if you spend too much time there.The lobby is very disappointing and there are few design features that make it special.

Central location for theatre and museums/art galleries as well as shopping. Love this small gem. On this stay the restaurant was under renovation, not a major issue. There are lots of choices close by.

Located in a perfect area of NYC for theatre events, restaurants and museums. The staff could not be nicer. The lobby of the hotel is going through a major renovation which I am sure will make the hotel even nicer; completion date is scheduled for June. Book a weekend in the city and enjoy your stay.

Employees were all friendly. Shave creme was actually mini-can versus the junk that is in ketchup tubes that doesn't work. Toothpaste was an actual tube. It's the little things and Iroquois pays attention to these things. No issues.

We always stay at the Iroquis when visiting the city. The location is perfect, the rooms are always impeccably clean, the beds are comfortable and it is very quiet. The service is beyond good. We highly recommend!!

We have stayed here many times and hope to do so again. This hotel is in an unbeatable location and is well appointed and maintained. Our room was extremely comfortable and yet maintained the character of the old building. The very best thing about the Iroquois is the staff who are extremely professional and competent whilst being friendly and pleasant - there is nothing of the canned, faked corporate hospitality about the place.

This my third visit to the hotel and stayed for a week. You cannot beat the location. It is in walking distance to Broadway and five minutes walk to Times Square. However it is quiet and a perfect retreat from the 'noise'. It is clean, comfortable beds, air conditioned with a lounge and drink service.

Although hotel facilities were OK and the location was very good, the service was poor. I had some doubts about charges they made and no answer was provided. It is a pity because It would have been a good experience.

Another great stay at the Iriquois. We have been staying here annually in April for the past 5-6 years, and it continues to please us. The on-going lobby/restaurant renovations did not detract from a quiet and pleasant stay. You can't beat the location for broadway events. My king deluxe room on the back side of the hotel was perfectly sized, very clean, and amazingly quiet. I liked the walk-in shower. The front desk staff and bellmen are always smiling and welcoming. There is no on-site restaurant or bar during the renovation, but the area is replete with places to eat, so this shouldn't be a problem. There's a french place right next door. Saju Bistro is a short way down the street near Hotel Mela, and has a very nice breakfast for the price. Osteria al doge is an excellent italian restaurant; and Kalerri serves very good greek mediterranean for lunch/dinner in an inviting atmosphere. They specialize in seafood but have a diverse menu. All of these restaurants are on 44th St. and are very close to the Iriquois. I continue to highly recommend the Iriquois and look forward to next year's visit.

Found this hotel for a visit to NYC with my son for Spring Break to see Hamilton. Hotel location is great; close enough to action but not in it. Room is well appointed and bed is comfortable. Will stay here again.

Had a wonderful stay here over four days. The Iroquois is an historic hotel located on a quiet side street in the heart of Midtown. Times Square, Bryant Park, and Grand Central are all an easy walk. The building itself is a beauty, twelve stories tall with a great facade. The service was awesome; Vanessa the concierge reached out prior to my trip via email and offered assistance. Upon entering my room I was surprised with a basket of beer and some cupcakes! Vanessa had wrote a note and provided the welcoming gifts. This kind of service makes a difference! My room was clean and well organized. The toiletry products are supplied by C.O. Bigelow. The size of the room is comfortable by Manhattan standards. The beds and linens are of high quality. The windows open partially which allow fresh air. All of the staff at the front desk, doormen, etc. were extremely professional. There is complimentary coffee & tea in the common area every morning. If you are looking for a classy stay in NYC check out the Iroquois.

We were looking for a convenient smaller hotel in which we could find comfort after taking a 14 hour overnight flight from Israel for a 4 night stay before flying home to California. We knew the Iroquois was perfectly located, being very close to Times Square, Broadway shows, restaurants, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave. and main lines on the subway. However, we hadn't expected the Iroquois to be a place of great warmth and kindness, after losing my wallet in the cab on our way into the city from the airport before 9 a.m. The Front Office manager, Christoph Duerrbeck, was so gracious and helpful, showing us that all the banks connected to our credit cards were a few blocks away, having housekeeping get our room ready quickly so we could relax, and even asking days later if the wallet had been found. He has a wonderful staff which truly made us feel like the hotel was home.  They have recently upgraded the rooms, which have very comfortable beds and beautiful spotless bathrooms. We appreciated how they set aside a small space in the mini fridges for guests to store their own water and how efficient and unobtrusive the housekeepers were. Since we were out most of the time, we did not mind that there is no view from the windows, and it was extremely quiet.The Iroquois would have undoubtedly been more pricey but we got better rates due to a remodel of the lobby, which does not affect the guests at all because it has been walled off. We would recommend getting a slightly larger room if you are staying for a longer period. We thought our Premium King was worth the difference. We loved being able to walk to our 2 Broadway shows and the restaurants nearby. The only places we used the subway for were the 9 11 Memorial and Hudson Yards, which were very easy to get to from the subways nearby. New York can be a impersonal place. We have stayed in many different areas of NYC in our many travels there. But for location, service, and warmth, you can't beat the Iroquois!

I have stayed at this hotel twice. I can not say enough about it. It will be my go to hotel in New York form now on. I will bullet point the areas of perfection.*Beautiful, warm, renovated to perfection*Outstanding staff, particularly bellmen and front desk agents*General manager was present, available, committed to excellence and it shows in every corner of this exquisite property* Immaculate*Location perfect for shopping, theatre*Bistro next door has wonderful French cuisine*Bathrooms have heated tile floors - nice treat in the winter*Comfortable, yet indulgent, warmly decorated rooms*Wonderful beds for a good night's sleep*2 blocks from Bryant Park*Two blocks from Grand Central*Did I say immaculate? Super friendly and professional staff.This is the most welcoming place to stay in New York, and beautiful hotel.I LOVE THIS HOTEL

Definitely a great place to stay if you're in midtown! Clean and very courteous staff members. The room was a good size as was the bed. Stayed on the 3rd floor, but it was still quiet. Would stay again.

We booked this hotel at the last minute for an over nite stay in NYC. It is a beautiful, clean hotel with a friendly, helpful staff in the middle of the theater district. The front steps are a bit steep for people who have mobility issues, but there is a bannister to hold onto. That is the only negative thing about this hotel.

a wonderful experience; however, we probably would not stay again because the room/s are too small for our liking. we are thankful for a friendly staff, clean room and a quiet stay. I wish you great success with all the planned renovations

Although the lobby, restaurant and bar are all currently under renovation, the hotel remains a great escape in the heart of Theatre district. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Will definitely be back!

Lovely hotel in great location. The room was small, but very comfortable, bathroom huge with nice finishes. Hotel staff was helpful and friendly. They were undergoing some remodeling so we didn't get to see/use restaurant or bar. Free WiFi was a great benefit. We would definitely stay here again.

Beautiful hotel. Perfect location for going to shows, exploring Times Square and walking to museums. Staff was professional and incredibly friendly. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else while visiting NYC.

Three years ago, I wrote a review stating that after staying at the Iroquois for many years, it had gotten expensively stale and just didn’t compare with the amenities provided by more up to date hotels springing up in New York. I subsequently stayed at several excellent properties who then decided they would build on their growing popularities by adding a “resort” fee or “amenity charge”. I have made it a matter of principle to refuse to stay in these hotels always letting them know that they should be ashamed for charging what they should be including in the first place. I find it the worst of scams.Happily the Iroquois, which I must admit to missing staying at, does not indulge in such subterfuge (and hopefully never will) and I am happy to report that not only now does it compare as favourably with many of those same hotels, but it provides an even higher standard overall and at a relatively lower and more reasonable rateThis was my second visit in the last 3 months and both times my visits were excellent and very comfortable. First the staff are exemplary and make you feel welcome and appreciated in every encounter. Being a light sleeper I always request a quiet room at the back of the hotel away from the street. Though the view is non-existent from the windows, it still allows you to see what the weather is doing but more importantly you don’t hear a thing except maybe on the rare occasion in the evening or morning when thoughtless empty headed entitled fellow guests slam their doors when entering or leaving their rooms or decide to screech at each other while they are awaiting the elevators in the hallway in what they think are normal speaking voices. Happily the refurbishment of the compact rooms includes the ability to control the temperature in the room where before it was centrally regulated. Also a great improvement is the fridge in the room which allows you to store your own beverages as it is an honour bar (how very civilized as opposed to those monstrosities that charge you in a heartbeat should you make the mistake of jostling anything) . The lighting in the room is also greatly improved and the bathroom with its rain shower head and great water pressure is a joy. The crowning achievement is the incredibly comfortable bed in which I sleep like a rock in with its wonderful linens and pillows. Also the internet is solid, consistent and strong. There are still no coffee or tea making facilities in the room ( one would be hard-pressed to find room for them though the room does not feel cramped at all) however there is delicious fresh coffee available in the lobby every morning which can be brought back to the room.I am so happy to have rediscovered the Iroquois after staying at pretty much every property on the block where it stands going all the way back to my first stay at The Royalton back in 1972 then after its makeover where the large spacious rooms were transformed into trendy little dark boxes, at the Algonquin before its myriad takeovers and renovations, then The Sofitel…etc. However now that I think back overall I still prefer the Iroquois as, pardon the clichè it really does feel like going home.
