Very nice experience, friendly stall, good location well appointed rooms that seem to have been refurbished. Room and bathroom were tight but efficiently designed to fit a king size bed. would go back.

Whether for business or leisure this is the best place to stay -- convenient location and a great luxury boutique hotel. From the friendliness of the staff to the nicely appointed rooms you will not be disappointed in choosing this hotel.

Top situated hotel: quiet rooms and very friendly people. They send me informations about glutenfree restaurants and other suggestions with a personal touch. I appreciated this very much, was very good.

Best aspects would be location, bed / linen quality, bathroom updated, reasonable price point for midtown manhattan. The negatives would primarily the be age and layout of the property including a dated lobby, strange flow towards the elevators, cramped hallways etc. Not a big deal if you don't care about those things. Overall, would happily recommend this as a high end 'value' property.

This is my preferred hotel when in NYC for business trips. It is an excellent boutique hotel in a very good location. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Rooms may be considered a little small but typical NY size.

I visit this fine Hotel for many years. Among many things I appreciate (rooms, Location), I like to emphasize on service, i.e. the staff of the Hotel. I dare say that all those I came to know on my first visit are still working there (a good sign in itself) and I am grateful for that because it makes the Iroquois a special place for me. The reception is very friendly and quick, always keen to help. The doorman is like a friend. And Vanessa from Concierge has contributed so many times in helping to prepare my trips that I would not know half as much of NYC if she wasn't there. All are dedicated and fun to be with. Travelling a big deal, myself, I have yet to find a place to outperform this experience.

We have been staying at the Iroquois for many years as we are avid theatre goers and find the location to be perfect to walk to dinner and shows. The rooms are small and clean with quality linens and amenities. We have occasionally tried a different hotel but always go back to the Iroquois. Every single employee we have come in contact with has been professional and courteous. It is our hotel of choice in NYC. This last time, we received a call from the hotel, after we had checked out, telling us that we had left cash in the safe and that it was turned in by an employee, Derek. Needless to say, we were blown away that Derek had been so honest in alerting management to the found cash. We passed on our sincere thanks to Derek and gave him a well deserved cash reward. On top of this, Christoph and Vanessa went above and beyond in securing a money order for the remaining cash and mailing it back to us, as we had already left town. Stay here for the quality hotel and the quality people that work there. The Iroquois has our loyalty forever and remains our hotel of choice in NYC. Thank you Derek, Christoph and Vanessa.
user_name:
Michelle L
Camp Hill, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: We had a lovely stay at the Iroquois Hotel. Wonderful staff, Wonderful room. Wonderful location, just a block from Times Square and a block from Grand Central. We saw museums and shows, and brought our granddaughter with.

Outstanding service at this hotel . great location, well equipped rooms , professional staff , very clean rooms , in particular the service is excellent , helpful staff ,kind friendly I always try to stay at this hotel

The location of this hotel is perfect. We could walk to 5th Av, Bryant Park, Times Square, Central park, Madison and more. Very friendly staff en - for Manhattan - reasonable space in the room. Will be back one day.

Wonderful place to stay. Location cleanliness comfort and amazing quiet room. From the welcoming glass of proseco to checkout, this was one of our best stays in nyc. And the bed was incredibly comfortable. Most of all, the staff were all friendly and helpful

The hotel is very centrally located. You can walk to subway and to Radio City and many theaters the front desk staff is helpful and the room, although a bit small is well equipped and extremely comfortable. The beds are amazing

I felt so welcome being here and I will definitely come back when in the city if the price is right! The reception area seems to be under renovation, but the room was exquisit. The glass of prosecco in the evening was a very pleasant surprise!

Very nice boutique hotel convenient to theater district and restaurants. Very friendly and helpful staff. Size and furnishings of the room were better than the average NYC hotel room for comparable price.

I have only positive thing to say about our stay for a weekend get away to NY City. This hotel is right in a heart of the action, so close to Times Square and Broadway district but very quite. Our room was not large but very well planned to move around, meticulously clean and fresh, with comfortable bedding and signature robes. The staff is prompt and polite, service was quick and we were able to check-in two hours earlier than supposed to. This small hotel is among the most charming, attentive, accommodating, and comfortable places I've visited.

Hotel lobby and restaurant are under renovation so it seems they lowered the nightly rates. For the value, the Iroquois was amazing. Rooms were clean and well stocked. Service was excellent. We did wish we could grab a drink or snack at the hotel itself but lots of other options in the area. Location is excellent if you want to be near Times Square.

Great place to stay and just need a small breakfast in lobby. Only coffee and tangerines but muffins, bananas and grapes would be nice. Love the heat floor is bathroom and had issues in shower finding the hot water but found it eventually.

Lovely location in New York, quiet street off Times Square.Great service, best staff experience, always smiling and quick to help with any question.Rooms were very clean and quiet. Highly recommend this hotel.

The staff recognize you anytime you enter and greet with smiles. I love the location to all the hot spots and I loved the bedding and the newly renovated bathrooms. We are looking forward to the opening of the new lobby and bar area that they are also known for.

I would suggest this place for a very enjoyable stay either while doing business or just a fun weekend in the city. If you are uncertain where to dine ask "Seth the doorman", obviously a seasoned New Yorker,You will not be disappointed!

I stayed at the Iroquois on business in December of 2018 and March of 2019. Both trips I returned to my room late at night and a maintenance person was in the hallway near my hotel room doing "touch up" painting. I did not feel safe either trip! I will not stay here again!!!

This hotel is located right near 5th avenue going east and also near Broadway and theaters going west.Perfect for a short stay in the city. Hotel is clean, beds great. NO views from rooms but if you are in the city, you are probably doing theater or sightseeing , right? Restaurant being updated so it's closed til summer of 2019. Staff excellent, especially the doormen..Lobby very tiny. Staff very very helpful and courteous.

Excellent location. Wonderful small town atmosphere. Employees always helpful and friendly. Rooms very clean and comfortable. We will always stay at the Iroquois New York boutiquewhen we visit the city.

Pleasant stay for a quick business/leisure trip. The bed was comfortable and the heated floors was a plus considering the frigid temperatures outside! Location is conveniently placed in Midtown, close to shops and subways stations. Penn Station and Grand Central are less than a mile away (10-15 minute walk).

My wife and I have stayed at the Iroquois several times and we love it. In fact, it is becoming a "home away from home" for us. It is excellent on all fronts: location, facilities, and service. The staff will do all that they can to make sure that your visit exceeds expectations.

Very nice hotel on W44th in Midtown convenient to Times Square and Broadway. Great service, easy check in and check out, and very hospitable! Everyone was very courteous and helpful. The only drawback was the rooms were very small. Plenty of awesome restaurants and pubs within walking distance, and a short walk to the Broadway show we attended.

This is the first time my husband and I stayed at the Iroquois Hotel. We loved it. The front desk staff are always so friendly and helpful. Vanessa, the concierge, made is so easy for us to take the subway as well as get to the places we needed to get too. She is a gem. JJ, the doorman and bellman, is so friendly and helpful with whatever was needed. He added some sunshine to our day. Centrally located in Times Square, the rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable. We can’t wait to return to New York City and Iroquois will be where we stay.

Very pleasant stay. Centrally located hotel but away from the noise of the city. Enjoyed our stay and would recommend to friends who would ask about out trip. The Staff were extremely pleasant to us. They were also very helpful in advising us of the renovations which were going on and did not affect us at all.

Rooms were very quaint and clean the location is very good and safer areathe Staff was very nice and helpful but it had the slowest elevators in the eastThe restaurant was closed it would have been nice to know ahead of time and the lobby needs some help

All staff were extremely attentive from the time of our arrival to our departure. Doormen were helpful and pleasant (with luggage, obtaining cab, etc.), front desk personnel addressed all of our needs quickly and accurately (no wait to check in or out) and maid service was also excellent. Location is ideal. Room was very comfortable, spotless and well-appointed.

Most importantly: the staff was friendly, knowledgeable, happy, professional, helpful, etc etc etc - I could go on and on. I would stay again for the staff alone. BUT the location is great (close enough to Times Square for a short walk, far enough that you're not woken up by lights and horns). The room was a good size, especially for NYC. The heated floor in the bathroom was a great bonus. Valet was quick, storing bags was simple. Thank you to all of the staff! Will be back.

Stayed at the Iroquois for 3 nights during a very cold period. The rooms were modern, although small. But the underfloor heating in the bathroom was a nice touch. The fitness centre was small, but I was generally the only person using it at any time - so it was adequate to my needs. The hotel itself was located just 2 blocks away from the centre of Times Square in mid town, so was very central. Staff were friendly and helpful. Unfortunately the bar/restaurant was undergoing renovation while I was there, so there were no meals available in the hotel - but there are plenty of nearby options in the location. The only issue I had is that it seemed any time someone would open or shut a door near me, my door would also shake - which was quite annoying at night time Otherwise, was sufficient for my needs.

Centrally located, the Iroquoise is the perfect location to enjoy the city at best.Gentle and helpful staff, they did take care of our stay even before Arrival.Clean rooms equipped with all you need. No noise from the outside.I would certainly recommed the Iroquoise to everyone desiring ti discover NYC at best.

The Iroquois was absolutely perfect. Located right off of Times Square the location could not have been better. Close enough to walk to most things - yes quiet enough to sleep. Will definitely stay here next time. Staff was super friendly and helpful!

Overall a good stay, however the room was small and drab. The old brown paint should be stripped. The restaurant was under construction so we couldn't eat on premises - this was not brought to our attention at booking time. Only coffee was served in the main entrance.

Reserved room for theatrical event on Broadway Sun night. Spectacular room with great location, on the quiet side of Times Square. Would definitely stay again. Hotel restaurant and lobby were under renovation and had to eat breakfast nextdoor, good option.

The Iroquois Hotel is a hidden gem. Perfectly located in midtown. It is very well appointed and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. It is an absolutely beautiful hotel. My new go to place in NYC.

A wonderful hotel. Highly recommended. Great location. Friendly and accommodating staff. Comfortable rooms. Reasonable prices for location. Easy walk to theater district, major attractions and shops/restaurants.

this was our 6th stay at the Iroquois and it was as delightful as all the others. Staff are welcoming and professional, the hotel was spotlessly clean, and the location can't be surpassed .We'll definitely be back and look forward to seeing the new space currently being revamped.

Excellent. Great service. Great location. I will always stay at the Iroquis whenever I visit New York City. It is a very quiet hotel and I felt very safe. Therefore, I slept very well. They set up everything up for me from a car from the airport to the hotel, dinner reservations and theatre tickets.

This was our first stay at the Iroquois and we were so pleased that it will be high on our list when we plan our next trip to New York City. Can't wait to see what the Lobby renovations will add to the experience.

The Iroquois is a hotel I have stayed at off an on for almost 50 years. It is well located with many restaurant choices on 44th street. It is also near 5th Avenue and Theaters. The hotel is comfortable if a bit old fashioned - beds are comfortable and it is quiet. I wish they had do not disturb signs so the house keeping wouldn't show up at inopportune moments. It is one of the very few hotels anywhere that has some softer thinner pillows - usually they are all heavy hulking pillows.They do have places to charge phone and computer...and pretty reliable internet.

Though disappointed that the hotel bar was under renovation, we were pleased with the friendly, accomodating staff. Additionally, the rooms were clean and well-appointed. Though small, the room had everything you would need for a few days in the city. No space was wasted in the room. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were lovely.

Great value. Wonderful service. Great location. The hotel staff was absolutely the best at helping these Southern travelers. They gave us tips on how to navigate the city. They were extremely friendly and helpful!

Have stayed here now 3x and I seem to appreciate its great location and value more and more every time. Currently undergoing some lobby renovations but almost no traffic or hassle. Sits right next to the Algonquin, Sofitel, and City Club Hotels as well as the Strip House steakhouse. We received a fantastic rate for our weekend stay in March and the staff here was very friendly and helpful with taxis and directions. Minutes to 5th avenue shopping and minutes to Broadway. We would love to return in the future.

Helpful staff . Comfortable suite .Room upgrades are great . An incredible quality stay for an amazing value . Close to Times Square , Fifrh Avenue shopping , Rockefeller Plaza and Bryant Park . Classic simple elegance.

Very satisfied. Looking forward to staying here again. Unfortunately, the bar and restaurant were not available due to the renovation happening. The staff members are extremely friendly and very helpful.

This is a lovely hotel off of 6th Ave., close to many attractions and convenient to the subway. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were comfortable, and we liked the decor. We would definitely stay there again.

I have been to the Iroquois many times, but since renovating the rooms it is only gotten better and it was always great. Bathrooms are nice and smartly laid out plus beds, pillows and sheets are first rate. Cannot wait to see what the rest of the renovaio. Has in store.

Yes - the hotel is under construction and it is disappointing that there is no bar / restaurant, however, I must say the level of politeness and courtesy from the staff has been stellar. The staff has gone out of their way to make up for any inconvenience and have been extremely professional. I must call out the door man, Seth, who not only always remembers my name but has consistently been an exemplar ambassador for the hotel. The staff has taken an initially unhappy experience for me and completely made me feel welcome and at home. Great staff and great stay!

We stayed here for 2 nights with our boys, ages 19 and 17 - we loved it! The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Our rooms were well appointed and spacious. The location is excellent. We told them we were touring NYU for our high schooler - when we returned there was a note and cupcakes for him in their room. True, it is under construction and the bar is not open, which is a bummer. We were looking forward to enjoying that while we were there. But we still enjoyed it and will stay here again.

The hotel is under construction - something they don't tell you when you book and there is no mention of it on their website. The lobby is uninviting and forlorn. There is no restaurant. There is no cafe. There is no bar. The hallways are beat up and worn. I would have never stayed here had I known its current condition

I had such a great experience at Iroquois New York, the room was quaint yet had a nice homey feel. The bathroom was beautiful and I loved the heated floors! Would stay here again in a heartbeat! Service and doorman were always pleasant.

We came in by train from L.I. to see a play @ 200 pm. Plan was drop luggage and go. The young lady at the desk worked her magic and found us a deluxe king at noon so we were able to settle in, Thanks again. Location was perfect ,3 blocks to the play and 6 blocks to Mastros . Everything was perfect.

The Iroquois Hotel was fabulous and it is centrally located in Midtown so you can easily get anywhere by a cab, uber or subway. Vanessa (the concierge) pulled out all of the stops to make this the perfect romantic weekend for me and my boyfriend. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this luxury boutique hotel.

The location is right at Times Square and right at 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Plaza and Central Park. The staff is always the very best. I love this hotel. The Iroquois is right at the theatre district. The rooms are wonderful. They are clean and well supplied.

I felt the hotel was a second rate Algonquin! In order to get a room I1/2 hours early, I had to pay $ 50.00 more per night plus all taxes. The restaurant is under renovations, so no quick late-night bite or quick lunch.Also, I am sick and tired of hotel employees discussing their personal issues and lives and using vulgar languagein front of paying customers!!!!!!!!!! ie: doorman with a driver

We stayed at this hotel in February of 2019 for one night. We thought it was fantastic and would strongly recommend it to anyone wanting to be near Times Square or Bryant Park.Location: This place is about a block or two from everything. Turn right outside the main entrance and you are in Times Square, turn left and a few blocks away is Grand Central. Bryant Park is about 2 blocks south as well, it really is great location.Parking: There is a parking garage right across the street. We parked in there and it was $52 for 24 hours. Very easy and convenient. The Staff: From the minute we walked in to the minute we left, they were very nice and professional. Not one bad thing to say at all, they were great.The Hotel: Room was fantastic. Larger than we expected, very modern and clean. The bathroom, which had heated floors, was spotless and very nice as well. If I had to find a negative, it would be the view from the window, but what can ya do? I wasn't there for the view and understand that these buildings don't always have the ability to provide views. No issue at all for us, we were happy to have a window and natural light.The hotel bar was closed for renovations, which was kind of a bummer, but we found plenty of places to spend time right around the area.Oddly, when I checked in with the Hotels.com account, they ask for a survey of how it was going. I answered all positively with the exception of when it asked if i was provided any upgrades or VIP treatment. I simply answered that I wasn't, but I never expected to. When I returned to my room they left us a small bottle of red wine and some chocolate. It was a nice touch, but not needed as we were very happy with our stay. It did show me that they monitor the response from guests and were willing to try and make them happy, which is always a positive.Definitely worth every penny in my view, great stay.

This hotel is under-stated from the outside, but it's outstanding. The staff is exceptionally warm and friendly. The interior feels old fashioned and classy. The rooms are small but clean and stylish. We got 2 rooms for ourselves and our teenage boys. If there were any question of fitting into 1 room, well welcome to New York it was no contest. There is a parking lot just west of the hotel on 44th street that is among the cheaper places to park in NYC per our research on parkopedia. We appreciate that the hotel offered to hold our bags for free for the day after we checked out. We'd go out of our way to stay here again.

I keep trying new hotels and think I have found what works perfectly for me. I did get the deluxe room as I wanted more space around the bed and thought it was a good value for an extra $20 from the standard room. Bedding and towels were soft and new and the entire room looked recently renovated. I liked the decor of classic new york touches with the breakfast at tiffany's art work to the 1940's style furniture. Great shower and roomy bathroom. No noise from street or other guests. Great staff. I'll easily stay here again.

Cordial and helpful staff. Clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Excellent location for theater and dining. we have stayed at the Iroquois perhaps a dozen times and never been disappointed. There are much more expensive hotels where we have stayed and they have not measured up to the Iroquois's standards. We have always felt that not only was our stay appreciated, but our presence was highly valued by everyone.

My family has stayed at the Iroquois multiple times. Most recently we have been given the opportunity for extended back to back annual visits. (2018 and 2019.) Each time I have enjoyed my visit but as noted by other travelers, the pattern of on-going property renovation is beginning to wear. I appreciate the management's/owner's efforts to stay current and relevant but I am beginning to wonder about the advertised qualities of "quaint and historic." Yes the building is old but everything else seems to be going by the way side. There is currently no on-site library, restaurant or Lantern's Keep bar. Photos have been displayed for upcoming new facilities but everything from the past appears to be rapidly disappearing. Quite honestly, one of the reasons I was drawn to the Iroquois was its ability to appreciate the past. Now, as I look at the artist renderings and ponder the Iroquois' future, I am unable to understand how the changes will continue to make this property "quaint"? The displayed artist's renderings show a design style which can be found in a lot of other New York and world wide properties. Even with all of the changes, the service at the Iroquois is generally fantastic. John is fabulous at getting you a taxi, Vanessa knows her city, and the front desk maintains a smile at all hours of the day! The room cleaning services, however, are not exceptional. With each of my past stays, my family has experienced the phenomena of finding items on the bathroom floors from previous residents. (Gross.) Each time we have been graciously offered an alternative but really, when will someone in upper management deal with the bigger issue of quality control? I have recommended the Iroquois to family members and would not hesitate to do so again. I would hope, however, that the powers that be will regard their visitors with a touch more respect. The renovations and sprucing up are splendid but please have the courtesy of giving your guests, especially those that book well in advance, notice of pending interruptions to service. I would also like to think that a facility such as the Iroquois will treat their employees in a fair and gracious way but I am not sure this happened with the sudden closing of the on-site facilities. The superior staff of both the Lantern's Keep and restaurant disappeared with the start of renovations. Last of all, for the sake of all guests who have come to regard the Iroquois as a destination on its own, please retain your heritage and keep the history alive for future visitors.

I can't say enough about the quality service we received during our stay at the Iroquois. From the gentleman at the door to the desk receptionist, our stay was perfection all the way around. Will definitely go back the next time I visit NYC

This is a nice hotel near everything, especially good for Broadway shows, but far enough away that it's not too noisy. Nice staff. Rooms not too large, but ours was fine for the 2 of us. Beds very comfortable, but shutters do not block out the light too well. Overall we would stay again!

I have been staying at the Iroquois for more than 15 years and this was one of the best stays ever. Hotel is undergoing extensive renovations so no bar or restaurant until summer. But staff is very friendly and upbeat and the rooms are great. Comfortable beds and light-blocking blinds. Will be great once the new lobby and restaurant are completed.

Property is under renovation of the front desk, bar and restaurant but when entering you would have no idea .The front desk appears to be a permanent structure. The staff is very engaging and helpful ensuring a great experience. The room renovations were well done. I am looking forward to my next stay and see how the renovations of the common space compliment the rest of the property. The location of the property is perfect for navigating around midtown easily. Steps away from Bryant Park and Rockefeller Center.

We spent our customary 4 nights in the Iroquois and were, as always, thoroughly pleased. The lobby currently is undergoing a transformation. Nevertheless, it's a welcoming place populated by outstanding staff.One great improvement in the already excellent rooms: lots of easily accessible power outlets, next to both sides of the bed and at the desk. Given the fine size of the room, this made powering up facile.The Iroquois continues to be one of our favorite hotels. We already have one more reservation and are planning another for next year.

We stayed here to celebrate our 50th birthdays with our family and booked x3 rooms. The best thing about the hotel is the location - great for exploring all the main sites of NYC and easy walking distance to Central Park, Top of the Rock, Times Square/Broadway, Empire State etc.The rooms are a decent size, well equipped and well maintained. On the whole, the staff were nice. We would return due to location and value.

This is the second time I've stayed at the Iroquois New York and I love this boutique hotel. The rooms are quiet, staff is always warm, friendly and helpful, bed is very comfortable, bathroom floors are warm (great in wintertime), coffee and tea handy in the lobby. It's a convenient walk to 5th, Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center. It's also just a few doors down from my favorite NYC diner the Red Flame which has great food at reasonable prices for the city.

The Iroquois is under renovation now so main floor is distrupted but rooms are still lovely and there is an excellent restaurant db for dinner and good breakfast dinner on same block. Help is always friendly and polite.

I'm super critical of hotels and this one was fantastic. From the moment I got out of the taxi, the staff was helpful and friendly. The room was very nice and clean. I have zero complaints. I'll be back!

We stayed at The Iroquois last minute due to winter weather issues. The staff was welcoming, informed and professional. Our room was cozy and clean and the location was ideal for our city plans.We will return and will now consider this property our go to hotel when we visit the city.We look forward to the renovations!

Loved everything about our stay at this hotel. Everyone was friendly and helpful from the moment we walked in the door! Two main things we need in a hotel is cleanliness and quiet, and this was perfect. Thank you for making our stay wonderful!
user_name:
srodnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: The location of this property was great. The service was excellent, rooms were good size for NYC and very clean. The beds, pillows were really comfortable. The bathrooms were newly updated, including heated floors. We would highly recommend.

Very convenient to Broadway & Times Square, I enjoyed a very relaxing stay here. Rooms are well appointed and I was greeted with a complimentary gift (wine & chocolates) in my room. Staff were all friendly & helpful. This hotel would have rated 5/5, except for the inaccurate description of the room size. Advertised as "301 Square Feet (28 Square Meters)", my Deluxe Queen room was actually 190 Square Feet (18 Square Meters), including the proportionally compact bathroom. Disappointing, given how good all other aspects were.

Nice hotel and good services and close to Empire State Building,Hard Rock cafe,Time square. Only 15 min to Intrepid the museum. Central Park is also close to the hotel. Easy too get taxi, services in hotel is great

My sister and I shared a room at this hotel for a quick weekend get-a-way. The staff gave us a complimentary upgrade and were very king. Oliver and Francene (spelling?) were very energetic and welcoming. I was greeted by name each time I came and went from the lobby. The room was small, which wasn't a problem because it was still plenty spacious. The bathroom was clean and pretty. I did not find the hotel room to be loud and slept quite well. The mattress and pillows were all very comfortable.

The Iroquois is always a great place to stay. Although undergoing a major lobby/restaurant/dining renovation, this hotel works through it in a delightful way. It certainly does not affect the room, which are still a great value in NYC. You can't beat this location is you want to do theater and shopping.. It's simply the best.

Was a short stay, but very nice. The service was outstanding from valet as I dropped off my car, front desk, etc. Room was great, and we got to use the gym/sauna... everything was nice. Will be returning.

The rooms have been remodeled and now the lobby is being transformed. There is no inconvenience to guests while this process continues. We stay here several times a year. The rooms and service are always impeccable. You'll be amazed that this quiet location is just a short walk from the Theater district and the hustle of Times Square.

The GM got us a quick drink when we arrived since the bar wasn't up then. The hotel is clean, nice and right in the center of it all for NYC. We had a great quick overnight in The Big Apple! Thanks for an awesome trip!

The hotel is very well located. The staff at reception desk is very friendly. Easy and fast check in/check out. Room was well equipped and confortable. Very good bed.Some refurbishment in progress at the moment

The Iroquois is excellently located close to the theater and mid-town. Service is super friendly and the rooms very well appointed. The hotel is not a huge property therefore service is more personal.

The Iroquois offers a wonderful balance of old world charm and updated amenities. Within walking distance to the theater district, Times Square, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center and hundreds of restaurants, it's central location cannot be beat. Take advantage of the complimentary walking tours. From the door man to the concierge, the service is impeccable.

We look forward to returning to The Iroquois Hotel, especially after reconstruction of the restaurant and library. The rooms are nicely appointed and the linens are lovely. The staff pays close attention to the needs of the guests which made our stay much more pleasant.
user_name:
Mary B
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Not my first stay here, and it won’t be my last. The lobby and restaurant are being beautifully redone. That said, I wish I had been told beforehand that the lobby was under construction. Highly inconvenient. Queen rooms are tiny but well-appointed with great beds and good showers/bathrooms. No more Molton Brown toiletries! Doormen less than attentive, but perhaps construction issues plus cold weather interfered. Front desk always friendly. Turndown service was little more than a friendly housekeeper dropping off chocolate squares, unless you request more. Complimentary newspapers and coffee in lobby area only. Terrific location to get anywhere in NYC. Very safe and secure hotel.

The hotel is very well situated. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Room was very comfortable and well equipped. Reception desk is efficient and checkin / check out very fastI would recommend this hotel for couples and families rather than for business

We really enjoy staying here. This is the second time we have stayed. It is so convenient to all the locations we enjoy. It's easy to get to so many areas and we always feels safe. The staff have always been friendly.

I love this place..not my first time here and hope to return. Service is awesome and the rooms are quite nice. Location is amazing. The restaurant is being renovated and should be finished this summer.

We had wonderful service from the beginning to end of our stay. All the staff was friendly and helpful. We used the valet service which is very convenient and the garage is right next to the hotel. It was a short wait when we had to pick up our car upon departure but no more thank you would expect anywhere. Upon check in we were greeted by friendly staff and offered a glass of prosecco or wine (I chose the prosecco) which set the tone for a great time ahead. Entering our room there were chocolates on the pillow. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. While I know rooms in Manhattan run on the small side our room was a fairly good size for NYC. The bathroom has black and white marble and is small but quite functional. We had plenty of room. There were Bigelow toiletries. The room is all new and fresh looking. We were right near the elevator and didn't hear any noise from it. Later that night we were offered turn down service and some more chocolates. We were also surprised with a treat of a fancy chocolate bar and a split of wine in our room when coming back after being out in the early evening. These small details were greatly appreciated! The hotel is also in a great location near the theater district. It only took us a few minutes to reach our venue for our show. There is a diner a few doors away from the hotel for a bite to eat and more fancy restaurants as well nearby. I can't say enough good things about the Iroquois hotel! We will definitely be back and I will recommend this hotel to others.

Vanessa Torruellas was fantastic with providing me with information regarding transportation to and from their hotel. Recommendations for dinner and walking tours were great. They do complimentary walking tours on Sundays at the hotel and Sonya from Streetwise New York was a wonderful guide. The staff were so nice and helpful and the hotel is situated in a perfect spot to walk anywhere in the city on foot. Christmastime in New York is wonderful. I would stay at this hotel again.

This European-style little hotel is in a great location, close to a lot of things in Midtown including the subway, yet on a quiet street. The people here were great — friendly, helpful, prompt. The elevators are a bit old but quick. The public area are currently under renovation but it didn’t bother me. Both times I requested ice it arrived within 2 minutes (the hotel wasn’t full). The doormen and front desk folks were also fri day and helpful. The room, bed, and bathroom were very comfortable. I did not find the decor to be dated or worn at all, as others have said, but classic. The cocktail lounge is moody and chic. I paid about $200/night which I felt was a fair price. I would stay here again.

Stayed in New York for the weekend. The hotel is in a great location, not far from 5th ave and broadway.The room and bathroom are small. However for a weekend, it was enough space for two adults. The bed were comfortable and the turn-down service was a plus. Overall, i would consider staying here for another weekend trip.

Had a lovely stay and thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Iroquois. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay pleasant and memorable. Absolutely loved the renovated executive suite and look forward to the additional lobby and restaurant upgrades once completed. Location is super convenient to Times Square, Broadway theaters, shopping, and subway lines. So glad to have found this little gem of a hotel and plan to keep the Iroquois as our lodging of choice when visiting New York each year.

This was our first time staying at The Iroqouis and we were pleased with the location, staff, and cleanliness. We felt welcome and watched over while enjoying the city with our six year old grandson. Transportation was readily available when needed but walking was easy for many of our activities.

The bartender's at the bar (Lantern's Keep) were great (Gus and Steven). We started staying at this hotel because of the bar and have since come to really like the hotel. We visit once or twice a year.

The Iroquois is comfortable, clean, quiet and has a perfect location. Staff is friendly, helpful and accommodating. I always stay at this boutique hotel when in NYC on business or with family and never disappointed.

We were in the city to see Hamilton. The location of the hotel was perfect for that and was also convenient to Times Square. Our deluxe queen room was admittedly on the small side (especially the bathroom), but we had no problem moving around or finding a place for our clothes and luggage. Also we loved the heated floor in the bathroom. The hotel was very quiet, and we slept wonderfully. The staff were friendly and helpful. All-in-all, we found it a very good hotel for the price, and we would definitely stay there again.

We have stayed at the Iroquois on several occasions. What makes this small luxury hotel great is the staff. Always attentive and always welcoming, they make you feel you are at home. The King size rooms and the suites are very comfortable and have recently been renovated with class! Finally, you cannot beat the location. The hotel is proximate to Grand Central and subway travel throughout the City and the Theater District is a few walk-able blocks away. There are several good restaurants steps away from the hotel.

On a 3 day business trip. My room was a quiet oasis from the city. Service quality top notch.Staff was attentive to every detail and very accommodating to any request. Would recommend without hesitation.

After searching for the right hotel to stay during the Thanksgiving holiday, I’m so glad I came across this gem. Everything about this hotel was OUTSTANDING!! The location was perfect. The rooms were super clean and decorated so nicely. The bathroom was very spacious too. But, it was the staff that stuck out for me. They were amazing! Everyone from the doormen that greeted us, to the front desk staff, to the cleaning staff, they were all so friendly and attentive. The Guest Relations Manager, Vanessa, went above and beyond to help make our stay the best! I can’t say enough about her, she was fabulous! When we make another trip to NYC, we will absolutely be staying here.

Can’t rave enough about this lovely and immaculate midtown hotel. It’s a gem! It’s location is perfect for foodies and theater goers. Although the lobby library and restaurant were under renovation it didn’t not hamper our lovely experience.

Small but not tiny room, with comfortable bed, linens and very large shower. Very pleasantly decorated. No coffee/tea machine which I consider a big plus. The TV had a large number of channels including HBO. The location was perfect. The cost probably reasonable considering this is NYC.
user_name:
Laocoon51
New York City, New York

review_body: Good location and within walking distance to many attractions. Close to Times Square, however no direct access to the ball drop. Compact, yet neat, clean, and tidy rooms. Comfortable bed. Friendly staff.

Great location. Very clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Good sized room with comfortable bed. The location is perfect. Close to Times Square and lots of restaurants in the area. Would highly recommend!

Great location. Excellent and attentive service. Marvelously comfortable beds. Heated tiles in the bathroom. Elegant, graceful, and functional furnishings -- even the drawers in the bureau are self-closing. We felt well-tended.

Our recent stay at the Iroquois Hotel was great. The room was newly decorated and very comfortable. The hallways were freshly redone. The lobby and restaurant area are undergoing renovation so that was less than ideal, but that didn’t detract from our very positive stay. It was a great location for going to the theater (we saw two plays) and it was reasonably priced for New York City. I will stay there again.

Terrific hotel and great staff. I was very pleased with the location, comfort of the room and bed. The heated tile bathroom floor was a big bonus. I didn’t hear any noise from other rooms near or above/below.

The Iroquois is always a great stay with a professional staff that is friendly and helpful. The location is perfect, the rooms are tasteful and pricing is fair, for an NYC hotel, with a variety of theatres and restaurants within walking distance.

My wife and I and another couple in for a theater weekend....The Hotel was excellent in all respects from check-in to departure... The service was consistently excellent and professional... I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend The Iroquois to friends and family..,

I just love this hotel. It is small, charming, and warm in a giant city that can feel cold and overwhelming. Just off Times Square, it is convenient to everything. Wonderful staff, great rooms. Love the heated bathroom floors!

Awesome in every wayGreat locationClose to train sttion and Time SquareWould and will go back againGo there you will love itEasy walkingGreat little diner place resteraunt right down the streetGreat prices and food

We took out granddaughters to NYZc for their first trip at Christmas. The Iroquois was a great hotel to stay in. Excellent service, great bathrooms for NYC and a perfect location. My husband and I go at least once a year and and we always stay at The Iroquois. Great value for NYC!

For a small luxury-level boutique hotel, The Iroquois was a good value. Our room was very clean and attractively decorated. The beds were comfortable, with a good variety of pillows from soft to firm. The staff was friendly and attentive. There appeared to be complimentary copies of the Wall St. Journal and the New York Times in a study-type of room off the lobby.

The Iroquois Hotel is conveniently located 2 minutes from Times Square. The kindness and the availability of all the staff and the quality of the rooms and the bedding allowed us to spend a great stay. Thank you very much.

Great location, well run establishment and very clean. The staff were extremely friendly and made the stay really enjoyable. Would recommend the hotel to families looking for a hotel in a central New York location.

The staffs were nice and helpful. Room and the bathroom were smaller than we expected but clean. We arrived around 5 pm and waited for 30 min. for our room to get inspected. The air conditioner was noisy.

Good stay at the iroquois only spoilt by the hotel trying to take $1500 from my bank upon booking with booking.com. Booking.com asked the hotel teice for an explanation and they couldnt be bothered to follow this up.....not good governance. However the hotel is cool, good rooms comfy beds and spotlessly clean. Nice coffee bar across the road as well

The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was exceptionally clean and beds were comfortable. The location was ideal and the Iroquois Hotel was a great value for a Christmas trip. We would definitely stay there again.

I stayed for New Years (December 31 - January 1) at this hotel. From looking at all of the reviews and the company's website itself, it looked like a true 5 star hotel with exceptional service. My room had a brown stain on the sheets of the bed so they were clearly not clean. The TV was not in working order. The bathroom sink was also not in perfectly good working order. On the hotel's website it says the windows are soundproof, however, I could hear the traffic very well all throughout the night.The worst experience I had was with the communication with the hotel. I called the day before I was to check in and was told they have valet parking and self-parking. Self parking was at the Icon or right across the street at Park Fast. I chose Park Fast due to the proximity of the hotel. Upon check-out I was told they do not work/validate Park Fast. I could care less about the few dollars I would have saved. How can you be a 5 star hotel and not know information about your hotel.Would not recommend this hotel. Service is everything and it was clearly not here.

We have been coming to NYC for the past several years for a long get away week end and once we have found The Iroquois, have been staying at this hotel and plan to continue to do so. From the location, to the service of the hotel staff, and food quality at the restaurant , in our opinion this is one of the best places to stay in NYC.

The room I had was small but comfortable and clean. The Iroquois is a boutique hotel situated in an excellent location beside 5th Avenue and is a short walk from both Macys and Times Square.The stay was enhanced by great advice and recommendations from the Concierge, Seth. We were given first class service through his support in booking his recommended restaurants and a cocktail bar. All delivered to the expectation he created.

There was a bed bug scare so i was very nervous about staying there. A union was stationed out front with a huge inflatable bed bug but turned out to be nothing. I turned the bed upside down to make sure it was all clean and it was. The decor was dark and artsy. The hallways smelled a bit musty but otherwise as I mentioned the facilities were clean. The elevators took forever to call though.

I wanted to get a hotel that was centrally located in Manhattan: close to Times Square, Rockefeller, Central Park, and the Midtown. I booked the Iroquois Hotel through Orbitz. My only criteria was a room, in Manhattan, that would accommodate me (I'm 6'4"), my wife, and our 17 year old son. Most rooms in Manhattan have two double beds, and I just do not fit. I've stayed in Brooklyn, Jersey, Queens, Manhattan, and all of the rooms are small, the beds are hard, and the quality does not fit the price. The Iroquois was a very, very pleasant surprise. I booked a King suite, for $675 a night, during Christmas. The room was massive, 800sqft, and very well appointed, from the heated floors, huge shower, and separate living room. The service was extraordinary, from the doorman, the front desk, concierge, to bellman. Turn-down service was complimentary, and the decor was great. I highly recommend staying here to anyone looking for a quaint, quiet, amazing room in Manhattan.

We come every Christmas and have always enjoyed our stay. Great hotel, small and personable, great location. Easy access to Grand Central, museums and lots of restaurants. Helpful team, who wants your experience to be positive.

Excellent location. Everything is within walking distance. Wonderful boutique hotel. Restaurant suggestions were bang on. Love the hot apple cider in the lobby when you come in from the cold. Stayed there a few years ago but we were not able to go back due to availability and finally had opportunity to return. Already booked for next year to avoid disappointment.

Great hotel to stay. Great location to everything. Heated bathroom floor were nice to have during the winter. Hotel staff were friendly. We had the room with double beds. For NYC the rooms were decent in size. The turn down service each night was great.. I would stay here again as it was perfect location to broadway, Central Park, Madison Avenue.

We have had numerous stays at the Iroquois Hotel NY, and it has always been exceptional, with excellent attentiveness by the hotel staff. The concierge was remarkable during a recent stay, helping to make my wife’s birthday a memorable one. We have another trip planned to to stay there, and would recommend a hotel without question as their location is superb, the rooms are clean, and the staff excellent.

We had an excellent stay at this charming hotel. We loved the compact size and the glorious view of the Chrysler Building. The staff was top-notch - always friendly and helpful. We were especially appreciative of the doormen and their ingenuity in getting taxis. So clean and the room was beautifully-decorated - and what a fancy bath! The perfect property - no way to go wrong here. Choose a high floor for the view.

I had a last minute business trip during one of the City's busiest times of the year. I was afraid that I would have to pay an absorbent price to basically sleep for 7 hour. We found the Iroquois and booked it. Oh my was I happily surprised upon my arrival! It is simply beautiful! The room was just what i needed and and nicer than I could have expected. I have already recommended to friends and family and my assistant has kept it as a preferred hotel for travel to the city. I can not wait to travel for pleasure and stay at the Iroquois and enjoy their amenities.

The service was excellent!! The staf really made our stay the very best! The room was perfect for us and the bed was great. Location is unpecable. Close to times square but far enough so that there wasn’t noise.

We had a great dinner at Triomphe. They usually open at 5:45 during the week. We requested 5pm on open table and they were able to accommodate us. Everything especially the service was what you would expect from a top restaurant in nyc. We had tickets for Billy Joel’s Christmas show. Took a short walk to 42nd street to catch the 1 to the garden. Great show. Christmas in nyc in a beautiful iconic hotel was a treat

The Iroquois Hotel is a nice, clean, very welcoming establishment centrally located a short walk from many of the major sights in Manhattan. Everybody was very helpful and the room was just enough for my family and I. We found our go to spot whenever we visit. Thank you.

Staff was very helpful, particularly Christoph and Pinto. Our suite was quiet, comfortable and very well located for theaters. Also, good value for the money. Will definitely be back and recommend to friends

This is our quiet home when we are in NYC. We love the staff and how well they take care of us. We love the rooms and the beds are heavenly. The update to the hotel is beautiful. The decor is fresh and modern. Love the heated bathroom floors. We won't stay anywhere else

central secure but quiet location for tourists. Brilliantly quick breakfast bar next-doorStaff unfailingly helpful and concierge particularly soComfortable rooms and useful coffee facility for early start

The Iroquois seemed like a decent value for the Christmas season so we gave it a try and couldn't be happier. It is not the fanciest hotel in NYC nor does have the largest room but it has everything you need. The staff was excellent and couldn't be more helpful. The location is outstanding and easy walking distance to everywhere you want to be during the holidays. Excellent restaurants are nearby and the staff has great recommendations. The rooms are comfortable, clean, updated and quiet compared to many other hotels. Bathrooms in the standard rooms are a bit on the small side but adequate and typical of NYC hotels.

The Iroquois is perfectly located for a New York Midtown trip. Great new Rooms, helpful staff and concierge and very nice rooms. I've stayed here 5 times in 3 years and will be back. Rooms are very quiet also.

Rooms are charming and spacious, considering the desirable location. Heated floors in the bathrooms are quite lovely. The staff is accommodating and welcoming. The hotel is very warm and inviting. Highly recommended.

Great location. Very nice hotel, rooms are decorated very nicely, comfortable beds,free Internet, very friendly staff. Our room had a view of the Empire state building. Nearby very good restaurants and shopping.

I can honestly say I have never experienced customer service to the standard I enjoyed at the Iroquois. Christoph, the manager, and Seth on the door are by far the most attentive, personable and impressive hotel staff it has ever been my pleasure to get to know. They provided the personal touch which truly sets the Iroquois apart, and, from the touching welcome gift awaiting us in our room, to the hugs on checking out, made our stay there a unique experience. No request was too big or too small. Christoph is an unusually caring and knowledgeable man, and our daily conversations were a highlight of our stay. We usually choose the Sofitel, right next door: a grander, more modern hotel but distinctly lacking in the warmth and care we enjoyed at the Iroquois. Though our room was slightly on the tight side, and the air conditioning was a little noisy for a light sleeper like myself, these are minor misgivings that do not detract from the overall pleasure of being a guest of the Iroquois. If you like your hotels to feel like a home from home, and if you value your interactions with the hotel staff as instances of real human connection, then you too will be enchanted by this wonderful gem.

Rooms are small. Common areas are small. Competed for service and access with outside (non-guest) events. Hotel too small to cater to both guests AND to contracted events. Location is outstanding. Staff friendly and helpful when not pulled off to help with events.

Great rooms, exceptionally friendly staff and a good restaurant for breakfast. Fabulous bathroom with heated floors which is really nice in the Winter. Very comfortable bed and excellent pillows, linens and towels. Rooms are updated with the latest connections for all you cell phones, tablets which is very convenient. Outstanding location near Bryant Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central and the 5th Avenue shopping district.

The Iroquois is not a large hotel with hundreds of rooms it seems like it has been there a long time and is small and perfectly formed.The staff are all lovely and the hotel has a warmth, the rooms are not too big but decent and smart. It could not be more central set in the heart of New York. It takes a long time well over an hour from the airport as it would for any hotel in town.I enjoyed the stay and it stands out as not a huge branded hotel dotted around the area.

A beautiful and cozy boutique hotel. Loved the ambiance, service, and cleanliness. I would highly recommend a stay especially around Christmas time. You can feel the energy and great location just slightly off the chaotic streets. Perfect location!

Outstanding service at this small hotel. Great location, clean, well equipped rooms and a small welcoming library in the lobby. An excellent small hotel which I highly recommend. In particular the service is excellent - helpful, kind and friendly. Whenever I am in NY I always try to stay at this hotel.

We stay at the Iroquois every trip to NYC. It is our favorite NYC hotel. The location can't be beat. close to theater and subway. Room although small is very comfortable and extremely quiet. Bathroom is spotless with good hot water. Our room was a superior queen.

We stayed at the Iroquois in the past and it always exceeds our expectations! Love the old school hotel experience! It is centrally located for easy access to all amenities and attractions. I will always choose The Iroquois when in New York.

The Iroquois is on a nice street off of 5th Avenue. Very small rooms, as is typical of NY. Very clean. They could use a little more storage space or amenities like hooks or shelves. No coffee in room. Pleasant staff.

This is a nice hotel, perfectly located, about 5 mins walk from Time square, Broadway, Macy’s etc.Staff are extremely friendly and knowledgeable, especially JC the doorman.It has a built in cocktail bar but with limited seating, and as a resident, you had no advantage ( queue jump).

A small hotel with charming service right in the heart of mid town. Rooms on the small side but clean and adequate. A famous bar at the back is popular and serves well made cocktails and there is a quiet library at the front for Reading.

The Iroquois Hotel is a wonderful boutique hotel. I may be a bit bias as I know the owner, Shimmie, but it really doesn't contribute to this review. The Iroquois Hotel has been in the family since the 1950's and has always been known as a great place to say and one of their famous guest, James Dean, once said, The rooms are laid out as if a King and Queen are arriving....and they are, only its you! You're are treated like Royalty as soon as you walk in and until you check out. If there is anything you need.....just ask and it will show up at your door within moments.Thank you everyone for making my stay there unforgettable.
user_name:
Salvatorie
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel was very nice. I would almost call it a boutique hotel. Doormen were awesome and took care of any requests. Rooms were ready when we arrived. Bed was luxurious and rooms had been recently updated. Very clean. The rooms were a little smaller than I was expecting but we made it work. Very easy walking to Times Square and everything we wanted to see and do. .

We came to New York for 3 nights 4 days and the stay at Iroquois was great. They were very helpful with any questions we had (I’d never been to NY so was looking for input on what to do and where to go). Rooms were clean, well lit and newly renovated. Rooms and beds were slightly small but didn’t bother us as we were mostly out touring anyways.

I was in Ny for just a week and had an excellent trip, what helped me a lot to enjoy was being in a friendly, cozy hotel with an excellent location!! I want to thank the staff for their effectiveness and care. Always there to attend my requirements. The room was well cleaned. Everything I needed was received promptly But, special special thanks to Vanessa Tortuellas chef concierge. She was everything and more, her kindness her predisposition to help me and solve problems was unparalleled!! Very pleased to meet her!! I will definitely return to The Iroquois!!

Francelle was amazing, I arrived in NYC early and they had my room ready (which almost never happens), and they placed me on a high floor away from the elevators which I loved and requested. They were very helpful in recommending places to eat, getting me a cab, and accommodating when my room was leaking. They upgraded me and took care of me immediately. This is a small hotel, but very charming, and I loved how quiet my room was. I will be staying there again next week. When I called Francelle remembered me and was very helpful. The whole city was holiday ready, and I loved the decorations inside and outside the hotel.

My wife and I spent four days in the city at The Iroquios. It was a great trip and the hotel is in a great location. Very close to Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center and Times Square (all within a short walk). The staff were very friendly and helpful during the trip. We will definitely be back!

Our group of 5 women stayed here two nights in Dec to see the sights and a show. The weather did not cooperate, and one of our group felt unwell, so we opted to stay in and play bridge for a few hours. How happy were we to have chosen this charming and beautiful hotel to stay in—we found the staff warm and accommodating. First, Johnny, when I asked for peppermint tea and there was none—found some somewhere and delivered it to me. This was a turning point for our friend in feeling better! Then, Christophe went above and beyond to find us a cozy, quiet place to play bridge. We can’t wait to return to this delightful gem with old world charm and a caring staff. The Triomphe Restaurant is a plus—food is great and service excellent!

Amazing hotel with the best staff! The rooms are a nice size and very clean and the beds are very comfortable. The house keepers did a great job replenishing daily and the turn down service was great. Front desk staff was always accommodating and the door men were fantastic! The hot drinks were always fresh and the gentleman managing it kept the area very clean. The location of the hotel is unbeatable. Overall, just a fantastic place to stay while in NYC!

Chose this hotel for a five day break to experience Thanksgiving in NYC with my daughter. I simply can’t find fault with it - perfect Midtown location, lovely room - smallish, but reasonable by New York standards - with lovely roomy bathroom, nice cosy library with complimentary tea and coffee in the morning and hot cider after a cold afternoon seeing the sights, and friendly welcoming staff throughout. A special mention for concierge, Vanessa, who was so helpful and knowledgeable in recommending places to eat etc. Will definitely choose this hotel if I return to the City - can’t recommend highly enough!

I stay at this hotel all the time and I have a great experience every time. Everything from the doorman to housekeeping is always the best you could ask for. I would and do highly recommend this hotel

We had been anticipating a much needed getaway from our daily routines and this hotel did not disappoint. The Iroquois is always a good value in the city, but if you book during any of their seasonal promotions, you can get an extraordinary deal by NYC standards. The hotel's location cannot be beat for all of the many activities that Manhattan has to offer, yet the hotel is serene and comforting once you step inside. You will see how easy it really is to leave the hustle and bustle behind. Any stress melts away, especially when you are greeted so warmly by the staff. Everyone has a quick smile and kind word at the Iroquois. Loved our executive suite on the 10th floor - separate bedroom and sitting area, a truly gleaming bathroom with heated floor and an awesome shower with bench. The rooms at the hotel have been renovated since our last stay and our suite was really appealing with its new furnishings and upscale vibe while still retaining the historic feel of the hotel. We have already booked again for next year. Life is short, you owe it to yourself to spend part of it at this hotel.

Very clean typical NYC size but comfortable bed nice sized bathroom. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Good location by Bryant park. Convenient to the theater district but you could escape Times Square if you wanted to. Older historical hotel but rooms were recently redone.

A perfect location for our weekend. Everything we wanted to enjoy was within walking distances. Staff was polite and extremely helpful. The room was a little tight but more than adequate for our needs

Really enjoyed the Iroquois on my one night stay on business. Good midtown location; warm greeting at the front desk. Was given a large king bed room on the 10th floor that faced the street; nice decor, good desk space, comfortable bed, larger renovated bathroom. Some overnight construction noise from the street made it a little hard to sleep, but not uncommon in Manhattan. Nice wine reception in the library with friendly hosts, and also met Brendan the GM, who was also a friendly host. Workout room could use a concept 2 rowing machine and some updated bikes. Overall, really enjoyed my stay and will return.

Clean, updated rooms and great location. Best of all was the Staff. Everyone was pleasant, polite and showed a genuine desire to be helpful. Christoph and Vanessa were especially helpful. Have already booked for next year!

We stayed at the Iroquois Hotel December 2014 and returned this visit and were not disappointed. Beautiful historic decor, wonderful staff and service and central Midtown location yet quiet. Highly recommended.

The hotel was quaint and very pretty. It was close to Times Square. We were greeted with a smile each time we came in. I highly recommend it. We came to watch the Macy’s Day Parade as our son was in it. Very close to where it was.

We arrived from the UK after an 8 hour delayed flight and then 7 hours on the plane so we were shattered on arrival. The hotel seemed quite dark on entering. There was no one on the door and no one to help with our luggage. check in was ok but didn't ask how our journey was or overly friendly. We went to our rooms and again no help with our luggage which is unusual in a 5 star hotel. We had booked 2 rooms with bathtubs but both just had showers. I went back down to the front desk and the check in guy was then excellent. He immediately gave us 2 different rooms with bathtubs and dealt with this in a very professional and decent manner.The room was lovely albeit quite small. The bed one of the most comfiest I've ever slept in. Extra touches such as chocolates, crisps, phone charge and adapter were very welcome. No view but we don't go to NY to sit in the room so not an issue.There is complimentary coffee in the library each morning which was a nice touch. Concierge was very helpful and the doorman also great. We must have arrived at a bad time when staff were fer.We had drinks in the bar and the barman was brilliant. He arranged bar snacks for us, despite food having finished being served. Front desk were very helpful regarding babysitting service too so 5 star there.The hotel is in a great location, away from the hustle of Times Square but still very close. Overall a good stay.

Have stayed here for a number of years and are very pleased with the facility, people and especially the location, A short walk to all the show venues, the best restaurants and fifth avenue shopping. Fantastic

The Iroquois New York was conveniently located near the theater district and was walking distance to 5th Avenue. The staff and accommodations were great. I would recommend staying here and I would stay here again.

We love this hotel. The location in midtown is fantastic. The staff is always courteous and very helpful.Our small issues are that each time we came down for coffee in the morning in the library the urn was empty and we had to wait for refills. It would also be great to actually be able to get onto the lovely little lounge at the back to have a drink.I know these are small problems, but we have been spoiled here and expect the best.

The Iroquois is a beautiful boutique hotel that offers location convenience, lovely rooms with nice amenities, breakfast, a bar and courteous staff. They have also just added a free Happy Hour for guests on Tuesdays. The value for your money is impressive.

Great hotel in a great location. I would use this hotel again. I swapped rooms on the first night as the initial room (room 1000) was too noisy for me. The room's windows were immediately adjacent to an external air conditioning unit attached to a neighboring building. Hotel staff were very obliging and relocated me to another room located on the 3rd floor. I spent 6 nights at this his hotel with no incident or complaint. The bed was very comfortable.

I chose this hotel for it size and location. It is an outstanding boutique hotel in mid town NYC. It is close to the theater district and shopping on 5th avenue. Classy rooms and lobby. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.

Great hotel in mid-town. Rooms are small but that is New York. The staff could not be more friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that there is not coffee service in the room other than room service.

The hotel bills itself as a small luxury hotel. With that billing, I would have expected more. We arrived early (11.00am) and I had a 3.00pm meeting to attend out of the hotel. Although they said that the room was being cleaned as we checked in, it took a further 2.5 hours for our room to be ready. The staff seemed put out that they could not notify us that it was ready by cellphone (we do not have one) even though we were only next door in the lounge. The Bar/Lounge area decoration was uninspiring as was the door in the restaurant. While we only had breakfast, it too was mediocre. The coffee and tea were weak, the food a little greasy, my eggs were overcooked, the toast was cold and the butter hard, the coffee was weak and so was the tea. The rooms are small, as you would expect in a smaller, downtown hotel, however the bathroom was very small and the closet was almost inaccessible. The sound insulation in the room could use improvement and we could hear the water running in the room next door and the doors opening and closing.

This is a gem of a hotel that is a quiet oasis a stone’s throw away from the craziness of Times Square— walking distance to theatres and great restaurants but not right in the heart of the blinding billboards. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The beds and bedding were amazingly comfortable. The room and bathroom were super clean. And the room is surprisingly quiet! The towels were thick and were replaced with fresh ones at evening turn-down! The bathrobes were a nice touch. Francelle at the front desk was always smiling at friendly. We were there as a family (with teenager) and found this to be a wonderful home base for our adventures in NYC. We loved every minute and can’t wait to go back to the Iroquois!!!

The hotel is in the perfect location for touring midtown...few minute walk from Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central. Staff was amazing. Bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. The whole experience was absolutely amazing!!!

What a welcoming, quiet, calm oasis in the midst of the hustle and bustle of NYC! So close to everything (Times Square, Theater District, shopping, restaurants) yet the minute you walk inside you feel removed from it all. Throughout my stay I was greeted with friendly smiles and helpful service from everyone I encountered (doormen, front desk, concierge, housekeeping). I stayed in a premier king room. It was smallish but clean, updated, tastefully decorated, and had everything I needed (except for maybe a coffeemaker). The bed and pillows were amazingly comfortable and I never heard ANY street noise. After long, hectic days running around and nights at the theater, my cozy room was a welcome relief. Ahhhhh..... Loved the "library" room for morning coffee and perusing the paper. I had the "breakfast package" as part of my SLH membership. I would not recommend it. There are much better breakfast options (service, food quality and value) right in the neighborhood. But other than that, I loved everything else about the hotel: the boutique size, wonderful staff, comfortable accommodations, and perfect location. After staying in countless large and small hotels throughout the city, the Iroquois is definitely my new home away from home in NYC. I look forward to coming back soon (minus the breakfast package). Thank you for a fabulous stay!

The Iroquois was conveniently located but somehow managed to be very quiet despite the street noise outside. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. They called before our trip to see if we had any special needs or requests and were always there to answer questions. Staying here made our trip to New York very enjoyable!

We stayed at the Iroquois NY this past weekend since my husband was running in the NYC marathon. We arrived early morning, so our room wasn't ready until 1:00 p.m. The front desk and bellhop staff were all very sweet and welcoming. The rooms are gorgeous; very clean and well laid out. They had turn down service, and nightly weather updates. We loved the proximity to shopping, restaurants, etc. And it was very easy to hail a cab. I would love to return to the Iroquois on our next trip to NY. I highly recommend staying here.

This is a lovely well kept hotel. The rooms are super comfortable with a bit of luxury. Super clean! The staff was friendly and helpful. It's in a great part of town with lots of restaurants. We enjoyed it and we would definitely stay here again.

Very nice boutique kind of hotel with great location midtown. Nice bar area and restaurant and close to other good restaurants. Rooms are small but efficient and and clean. Great beds. Don’t spend much time in my room when in nyc anyway.

This is my second time staying here and I wouldn’t stay anywhere else. It’s a quaint beautifully decorated spotless boutique hotel in mid town. The staff are the best! The location is awesome. It’s a home away from home.

My brother and I stayed here as part of a reunion. The first thing that comes to mind is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Room was good if a bits small. I would recommend the Iroquois. Go for it.

We were in NYC for the marathon. The Iroquois is in a great location, close to Grand Central, Bryant Park and Times Square. On the morning of the marathon, they had prepared breakfast bags for the runners staying at the hotel. So thoughtful & appreciated since we had to head out so early. Would definitely stay there again.

Great hotel in a great location for midtown manhattan.Hotel staff very attentitive especially vanessa who was outstanding.Rooms very clean beds very comfy and no outside noise.Great base for Nyc. Times square 5 minutes away, subway less,plenty of places to eat nearby for all budgets.Wish i wa still there

This was my second stay at the hotel and I'll be back. I travel to New York for pleasure only and the price, condition and location can not be beat. The staff is also the best. On a recent trip I left a bag of purchases in the lobby. Somehow it was connected to me and my purchases were mailed to me when I got home.
user_name:
Gary B
Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States

review_body: Enjoyed our stay. It has a marvelous location. Very easy to get around it to get transportation. Bar was too small for our group but not a problem as there are many places near by. Staff friendly and very helpful

Great location for traveling to New York. Was able to walk to so many great spots! Rooms were a bit small, but very warm and cozy. We weren’t in our room that much !! Doormen were welcoming and front desk friendly. Vanessa’s help was so nice too! Very sweet , along with Francel

I would book again in a second, when going to ny! Everything in Midtwon Manhattan can be reached by foot! The rooms are cosy and clean! But the best is the really nice staff, especially Vanessa was very helpfull!!

We went to NYC for a wedding and had our kids with us. The room was clean with comfortable beds. Room service was quick and the food was great. We were always greated with a smile. Overall great service and great experience.

I can always depend on the style, service and cleanliness of this hotel. I always feel very much at ease and safe as well.The Iroquois is close to exceptional Broadway shows. The hotel’s restaurant is always a pleasure.

We stayed at the Iroguois in mid-October just to kick around the city. The reception we received at the Iroquois was truly exceptional. With grown children, we really appreciate the quiet ambiance of a centrally-located boutique hotel. The location was perfect! The staff from front desk to room service was impeccable. The Frette sheets and Down Right pillows were heavenly. Definitely worthy of a return trip!

Our family of 3 stayed at this hotel in 2 rooms for a weekend in October. The hotel was most responsive to our request for a higher floor room, and the front desk staff was welcoming and responsive to us throughout our stay. Their concierge, Vanessa T., was very helpful and professional prior to our arrival, directing us to great restaurants for dinner. She was a pleasure to talk with by phone and email. Our rooms were updated, and the beds were super comfortable! Since we had come to the city to celebrate two birthdays in the family, the hotel welcomed us with plates of chocolate covered strawberries in our rooms and lovely messages written in chocolate on the plates, such a lovely touch to start off our weekend! We also appreciated that complimentary coffee was offered in the lobby every morning. The hotel's mid-town location was very close to the theatre district and shopping, which was another reason we chose it. This is our second time staying here, and we'll be sure to be back the next time we return!

Enjoyed the Iroquois very much. Small and pleasant hotel. Rooms a bit small but have everything that is needed including spacious desk, electric outlets, free wi-fi, all the usual amenities, clean adequate bathroom with walk-in shower, daily newspaper. One problem is the heavy traffic around the hotel, access is not easy, especially coming from the north - west side (no left turn to 44th on 7th ave.).

In the middle of Club row, the Iroquois is superb. Very walkable to just about everything in midtown. Staff is very professional - but warm also, not stuffy. Hotel has a great old-school NYC vibe, but rooms are very modern. Great Wi-Fi. Super comfortable mattresses. Spotlessly clean. As with all Manhattan hotels - small rooms, but very tastefully decorated. Lots of charging ports and great lighting for relaxation or work. Nice toiletries too. Had breakfast in restaurant - very good. It was $100 less per night than the Sofitel next door - and I would much rather stay at the Iroquois regardless.

Very pleased with my stay at The Iroquois, the location couldn't be better for theatre, Times Square, only a 1.5 miles from Penn Station. My room was quaint, bathroom was large, room was on the small side but not for NY I'd say. My room was always exceptionally cleaned, great housekeeping team, loved the weather report and chocolates with turn-on service, thick plush bath towels and robes, slippers and shoe shine service. Elevators are on the small side and not fast however I never had to wait long at all for one. Their Triomphe restaurant is the perfect place to grab dinner before a show - try the French Onion Soup. Shout-out to Alex for going above and beyond helping me navigate the best way to get to Long Island and then to LGA. I would definitely stay here again!

The Iroquois is a boutique hotel conveniently located in the heart of Manhattan. Close to 5th Avenue shopping, Broadway shows and countless wonderful restaurants. My one slight issue was the hotel's restaurant. I only had breakfast but very limited menu and not too inviting of decor. Food was acceptable.

This hotel has a fantastic location and is generally well furnished. However, the room was very small. The biggest issue I had was with the front desk clerk. When I asked whether there was a room ready, even though it was before check-in time, she implied that I would need to give her a tip. This rubbed me the wrong way and gave me a negative first impression of the hotel.
