This was our 5th stay at the Iroquois! We love it here! Great location for theater, but very quiet and tucked away! Newly updated with beautiful bathroom! Love this hotel - great sleep, too. We love coming here.

Great hotel in NYC, clean rooms, good staff, fast elevators, good breakfast, good service, detachable head shower in the bathroom, nice and new interior, close to central park, would stay again if coming back to the city.

Steps away from theaters, restaurants and popular sites. Lovely hotel with excellent service and pleasant personnel. The bed was comfortable and featured sparkling clean linens. Bath was small but adequate for our needs. Definitely will plan to visit again.

I chose this hotel based upon a business recommendation and the proximity to my business meetings and was not disappointed! I was able to join the wine reception in the lobby which was a great way to end my day. My room was large for NYC standards with plenty of plugs/USB ports at convenient locations. Loved the linen thread count, the heated bathroom floors, and the rain-head/hand-held shower features. I highly suggest a hand crafted drink in Lantern's Keep ~ great ambiance.
user_name:
epcbenton
New York City, New York

review_body: We selected this hotel after reading Travel and Leisure’s list of recommended NYC hotels. The front desk staff was cheerful and responsive. Rooms were attractive and clean. Heated bathroom floor. Odd that the fridge space had been turned into a cabinet, with an outdated bottled orange juice inside. Biggest disappointment was the restaurant and bar. Very tired, extremely expensive food, with mediocre service. Was really looking forward to a wonderful dinner there after a day of travel.

Great hotel with a wonderful staff within easy walking distance of numerous good restaurants and the theater district, but the street is blessedly quiet for NYC. Good restaurant and bar on site as well. Also has an adequate fitness room.

My experience was excellent with you! Congrats to all of you! The location is excellent, the service of all the employees too, everybody with a smile in their face, during the night there wasn't noice!

excellent historic building restored for comfortable lodgings...centrally located walking distance to everything midtown rooms smaller but more than adequate ...tastefully appointed , staff all welcoming and courteous... highly recommended

Thanks again, had a great time, can't wait to come back! The room was a little smaller than I thought it would be, but we didnt really mind. I would have liked for a comfy chair in the room, but not sure where it would fit, but it turned out really good and the view was excellent!

If you prefer the leather and mahogany atmosphere of a small luxury hotel, this is the place for you. I’ve stayed at The Iroquois several times. The rooms are comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful and the location convenient. It’s a great small hotel.

We loved almost everything about the hotel, the staff and service and attention we got. Not going to extend a recommendation for the Triomphe Restaurant...there are better options on the same block, so this really isn't a ding on the hotel experience. No views from the rooms, so we would grab a low floor and use the stairs rather than the elevators. Other hotels on the block have better cocktail bar experience, and the coffee shop across the street is top notch. Staff handled our bags for early arrival and late departure, plus some valuables held in the hotel safe. Airport trip arranged by the staff was as we hoped for, but if you are agile, grab rail transfer from subway or Grand Central 3 blocks away.Perfect location for Broadway plays and nice dining options.

If you are looking for a big, flash lobby this place is not for you.However, if you want a hotel with well designed rooms, lots of power outlets conveniently placed, outstanding service and super friendly and obliging staff then this IS the place.The location is great. Close to the subway and my favourite coffee place on the other side of Bryant Park: Blue Bottle (try the hazelnut croissant).The room and bathroom are functional and well lit. Housekeeping does a great job and every thing is clean and immaculately maintained.The door guys are friendly too and don't stand around checking their mobile phones the way others do at nearby hotels.

Very nice hotel. The facility and the staff were top notch. The staff was very nice throughout our stay and very helpful and respectful. Would highly recommend the Iroquois to any travelers. We were in for a family wedding, they provided a great rate and a great place for us to stay and mingle and were very helpful with directions and information.

This is one of my favorite hotels in New York. I've stayed at this hotel for almost 10 years. I'm there at least once a month and highly recommend to all my friends and family. The service is excellent and the staff is outstanding! Not to mention, the rooms are luxurious!

This is a well located, professionally run NY boutique hotel. Others have commented that the rooms are small. I’d agree, perhaps a touch on the small, but this is Manhattan. Quality of the furnishings in the bedroom and bathroom are very good, and in keeping with the Art Deco theme of the hotel. I would say the bathroom is small, but layout is very well designed so it does not feel that way.Breakfast menu was not extensive, but food was well prepared and restaurant staff very amiable and helpful. The Lantern bar is cosy and worth a visit.My biggest gripe is the extensive use of brown in the bedroom decor - carpets, woodwork, and even the wallpaper had brown stripes. Perhaps that contributes to the feeling that the room is a little small.2 other gripes is that the closets are hard to get into and although a mini bar is provided and there is a cabinet for a fridge, there is no fridge, and therefore no cold beer while working on that later night report.A colleague had noise issues in his room, but I had no such problems. Like all Manhattan hotels, it is always worth asking for a quiet room when booking.But these are small issues, and do not take away from the fact that this is a very comfortable, well run hotel in a good location in NY.

Love this little boutique hotel. It's positioned perfectly between 5th avenue and Times Square , staff are lovely. Our room was big enough for two. , so no complaints from us , would not hesitate to book this little gem again and neither should anyone else

The hotel amenities and the location are superb but the unyielding staff commitment to it’s guests is beyond incredible. We have stayed here many times but each new experience is always better than the one before which seems impossible given that we always believed the next could never be better than the last. They are always professional but their personal commitment is the truly special components.

The Iroquois Hotel is one of the best hotels in New York City. Though it is between 5th and 6th, it's close to the Theatre District, shopping and great restaurants but far enough away from the Times Square circus. The staff is always friendly and tries to make your stay with them as comfortable as possible. The adjacent restaurant, Triomphe, is first class and the food and staff there are also wonderful.

Lobby is cozy and welcoming, staff is friendly and helpful, the room was clean and nicely decorated, and the bed was super comfy. Room service was very good and fast. The room however was quite small. We had a view of fire escapes, brick walls, and other guests' windows so the blinds were closed all the time. We had to take turns accessing the closet and using the bathroom which was very tight. The room worked for a business trip but I would not recommend it for a vacation, especially at nearly $500/night plus tax.

The hotel is perfectly located in the center of Manhattan and only one block from Times Square and 2 mins from 5the avenue. The staff are very friendly and the check in & out went very smooth. The front desk staff are highly professional and nice specially Francelle who was helpful and let us check in early and allowed us to check out at 1 pm instead of 12. The hotel as well very clean and tight and the room is fair enough in compare to other Times Square hotels.

I stayed here with my husband on a part business part pleasure trip. We arrived exhausted but immediately relaxed in the warm New York welcome. Our room was extremely comfortable, quiet and fitted to a high spec. This is mid town New York so the distant sound of sirens was audible from our room at the rear of the hotel but importantly we could not hear a sound from adjacent rooms. The staff are friendly and helpful. If it's a modern hotel with a sense of history you are after this is the place. We will return!

My friend and I stayed here for two nights while in the city to see some shows. Great location close to Bryant Park, Radio City, Times Square. The hotel has just finished a full renovation, and it looks gorgeous. Check in was smooth and easy—we requested a change to a room with two beds and were easily accommodated. Our room was a good size and very clean. Nice bathroom and incredibly comfortable beds!Would definitely stay here again.

My 5th visit and the only place I will ever consider staying in NYC. As in previous stays, I was warmly welcomed, room requests were accommodated and the staff were very helpful. I’d noticed that the rooms had been updated since my last visit. I always sleep well here, the beds are super comfortable and I rarely hear traffic noise. The other reason I always pick this place is because of the location. Bryant Park/42nd Street Subway is just a couple of minutes walk away so it is easy to get Uptown/Downtown or to Brooklyn. Times Square is about 8 minutes walk with a large amount of Subway lines. 5th Av is right at the end of the street for all the fancy stores. Herald Square (Macy’s and less expensive stores) is 10 minutes walk. Breakfast is good value at the Red Flame diner a couple of doors down the road (opens 6am) for those who are jet-lagged! This hotel is a quiet oasis away from the intensity of the city streets. On my last day it was raining hard and I was offered complimentary umbrellas to use before I had to head to the airport. The doorman also did a great job hailing us a cab quickly, which isn’t always easy on a very wet day. Thank you to everyone at the Iroquois, we hope to return again some day.

We have just returned from a trip to New York and Washington. We spent a number of nights at the Iroquois during the trip. The hotel's location is good, within reach of all the sights and a few minutes walk to subway. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The room was small and clean. Like many central New York hotels the view from the room is an office block. The reason for average review is the price we paid: Compared to a top five star hotel in Washington, which we stayed in on this trip, and another New York hotel about seven minutes walk east of this one, which we also stayed in on this trip, it was poor value for money. The bar was tiny and in semi darkness due to "subdued" lighting. The breakfast room was also small and quite uninviting. We ate breakfast out every day. The door staff were helpful and friendly.

We have stayed at the Iroquois several times in the past and our visit this time lived up to our expectations...and then some. Believe everything you read in these reviews that say how friendly and helpful the staff is, how comfortable the beds are, how great the location is, what a quiet respite it is in the busy city, etc. We have to send a special shout out to Vanessa, the fabulous concierge who simply could not be better! She knew everything about the subway, shows, city passes, restaurants etc etc. There was nothing we asked about that she wasn’t knowledgeable about. She made our stay even more fun! She is a gem and the Iroquois is lucky to have her!This is a fabulous hotel and we will only stay here when we return to NYC!

Good Hotel, hotels in top location in New York are expensive.Everything was perfect, small minus point: the windows on the outside must be cleaned.We always eat breakfast sober, that's why we did not have breakfast in the hotel for $ 30 per person!Highly recommended at a top location

We were very happy with this hotel. The room was quiet and clean, the washroom large, staff very friendly and helpful and is within easy walking distance to many of the cities restaurants, theatres and attractions.

I can't speak highly enough about this hotel. A comfortable, quiet room, just a short walk to Bryant Park subway. Lots of power points that are conveniently placed. Heated bathroom floors. The staff are lovely - they care that everything is just so. Little treats were placed into our room from time to time, which made us feel special. Just delightful.

Location of this hotel is excellent. Five minute walk or so from Grand Central Station, Times Sq, Library, 5th Ave, etc. Rooms were very quiet, no impression that you were in a 24/7 city. Bed also incredibly comfortable, although that may be because we were so done in at the end of every day. Staff were good, special mention for Vanessa, the concierge, who managed to locate and go get a backpack I'd left on a bus when we arrived. I was stunned and very relieved. If were were to return to New York I wouldn't hesitate staying there again.

Just far enough away from all of the action but close enough to get to the action without a problem. The staff is very helpful and friendly if you need anything. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

The Iroquois is a great hotel. From the moment you walk in, you feel welcome. The rooms are very quiet and a great retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city. The staff is very friendly and helpful for booking reservations and rides.

This is my second stay at the Iroquois because I had such a good experience last December. The hotel is so well located, the accommodations are so nice and the staff so friendly that I feel like it's a little home in Manhattan!

This is a perfect location for those looking to check out all the midtown things to do. So many things are a 20 minute walk away or less - Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central, etc. Surprisingly, there wasn't much in the way of noise at night even being right in the midst of so much. Rooms are small but comfortable. Definitely would consider to stay here again on next trip to NYC.

I am not sure why everyone loved this place so much! My friend stayed at the Royalton across the street and it was more modern with a MUCH nicer lobby. The Iroquois lobby is tiny and dark. Room was decorated in brown tones, literally with brown curtains, a brown rug, brown fake leather headboard. Larger than the typical NYC hotel room. Staff was LOVELY - great, super nice front desk person who recognized me after the first day, GREAT door man who worked hard to get me a cab during a busy time so I would not miss my train. Overall hotel was nothing special though.

We had another lovely stay in the Iroquois. Beautiful, comfortable rooms.The rooms were quiet despite the parade. Fantastic location! It is so convenient to many sites. We were interested in the theater district which could be reached in a natter of minutes. Staff was attentive snd accommodating.

The Iroquois never disappoints. Great acccomodations, location & staff! The perfect place to stay when we are visiting the city for shopping, enjoying the theater & fine dining. We wouldn’t stay anywhere else & always look forward to our next visit.

I have been staying at this hotel for business and pleasure for several years now. The staff greats you like you are family and the rooms are all remodeled and very upscale. The location is perfect and it is hard to imagine staying anywhere else in the city.

Overall good. Small rooms but nice and clean, decor not outdated. Room service not very good, menu after hours very small and limited to sandwiches, no room service on Saturday. Very good location a block of Broadway and close to 5th Av. Very central and convenient.

This past week I was in NYC again and stayed at the Iroquois Hotel. As in the past, I have nothing but praise for the hotel and the staff. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable and go out of their way to help you and ensure that your stay is as pleasant as possible.The rooms are clean, comfortable and newly renovated.I can't imagine staying anywhere else when I am in the City - this is "my home away from home".

The hotel is close to Times Square and many theaters. We had a wonderful stay! Excellent staff! Had a nice lunch at the restaurant- the food was delicious. There is a Pret a Manger around the corner for a quick breakfast if you choose not to dine in. We will be back!

Great location. Easy walking distance and access to all the tourist attractions as well as client visits. I love NY and have stayed at many y hotels in the area. I have returned to Iroguois 3 or 4 times and am never disappointed.

The Iroquois Hotel was great. Close to Times Square but not to noisy. Staff was excellent and very friendly. The rooms/bed were very comfortable. The bedding was very nice. I would definitely stay there again.

The best hotel I’ve been in nyc!! Very very kind staff (the lady at the check in counter, don’t remember her name was specially nice to us) the beds are super comfy and no noice from outside or neighbors :-) EXCELENT!!!

We had such an amazing time this weekend! We checked into our room earlier than we were supposed to, thanks to the great service by Francelle!!! The room was really small but doable. The next morning, I decided to ask for a bigger room and Francelle granted our wish... she upgraded our room, helped us gather our things, and escorted us to our new room. My best friend and I went out and when we returned she left us treats to enjoy. Overall, the hotel was nice, in a prime location, and quite comfortable. The best part has to be the service we recieved from Francelle!

The hotel room and bathroom were clean, staff was friendly and accommodating. Restaurant was nice and the food was really good. They allowed us to leave our bags after checkout and pick them up after seeing a show. Valet parking is less per 24 hours than using a parking garage.

Good central location near Bryant Park and Rockefeller Centre that makes it easy to get anywhere in the city quickly. But it is far enough away from Times Square that you aren't part of that area and its trashy chaos.

We spent 5 nights at this fine hotel, 2 adults and our 16 yr. old daughter. Front Desk staff was very friendly, the 2 Queen-room is small (like all NYC hotel rooms) but very clean, comfortable beds, nicely decorated with a fantastic bathroom. But most important is the location for tourists like ourselves. Between 5 & 6th Ave. just 3 walking minutes from Times Square and thus most attractions in Midtown Manhattan, subway station closeby and many restaurants.

My wife and i stayed here for the second time for the Labor day weekend and this second trip was as good as the first. The location is perfect, just out of the craziness of Times square (5 minute walk) but very central and easy to get around to everything. The best part of the hotel is the sleep - the beds are great and it's dead quiet - perfect after a long day at the US open tennis or sightseeing. We did not try the restaurant, although the bar downstairs looked very nice too.

7 nights in the hotel, nice stay, great location between Times square and 5th avenue, next to grand central, small but clean and quiet room. Everyday you get chocolate and weather forecasts in your room.

Having stayed here in May I decided to return in August since my last visit was such a wonderful experience. I had the pleasure of staying here the weekend of August 11th for two wonderful nights in a premium queen on the 11th floor with a view of the Chrysler Building at night. As always the staff was excellent including Christoph and Shade. Would return again and again. Excellent location in Time Square.

Great location in Times Square but still quiet rooms. The staff were very friendly and helpful.We spent three nights here as part of our honeymoon and would highly recommend the hotel. The bar served excellent cocktails too.

We enjoyed our stay and found the staff to be very friendly and welcoming! They went above and beyond to ensure we had a comfortable stay! We will definitely stay again! The location was convient to the theaters and subway system.

Small, recently refurbished, very small room,quiet, clean and pleasant staff. Vanessa the Concierge is extremely helpful and nice. In the center of all activities.Queen size bed is so comfortable it’s hard to get up and get on with your day!Large individuals must make sure they get the larger rooms.

Stepping into the lobby here is like entering a whole different NY. It might be the vintage glamour of the place, but it's more due to the warmth and friendliness of the staff. Everyone who works here seems to really want you to enjoy your stay, and has a very charming, refreshingly genuine way of showing it.

Great place to stay NYC- cozy and comfortable, easy access to theaters and great restaurants nearby and love the bar inside. They were great when had to cancel because couldn't get to NYC and I am happy to stay there for all future trips to NYC and to recommend them.

We stayed at the Iroquois twice recently. It was peaceful despite where it is and so it is really good as a base to explore from. We'd like to acknowledge and thank Vanessa in particular whose service is outstanding - she has a desk in the lobby and she can advise on pretty much anything to see and do in the city, book tickets, advise on restaurants. Thanks for making the stays work out so well.

My son and I stayed at this hotel for a week. Only got positives to say. Our room was immaculate, the staff were amazing and always greeted you with a smile. They were extremely helpful with the queries we had. The hotel is in a great location - a 2 minutes walk from Times Square. We never tried the restaurant or bar but it always looked lively in the evenings. I would stay here again if I ever visit New York in the Future 10/10

My wife and I have been staying in NYC hotels for getaway weekends and short trips for 30+ years. A few years ago we came across The Iroquois and now we look no where else. it is a beautiful small boutique hotel where you are always treated like a valued guest. They are in the heart of it all, but just far enough away that you are away from the throngs visiting Times Square. We have always found the entire staff to be phenomenal ... from bellmen, to check in, housekeeping, to the staff at the Lantern's Keep ... you feel like an old friend coming for a visit. Cannot wait for the next visit.

We just spent a week at The Iriquois hotel. It’s location is central to so many sights and easy access to the subway if you choose that for traveling further out in the city. Taxis were also always available. The staff are super friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations.We didn’t have a view from our room so if that’s important, ask ahead of time. The room was clean which is more important to us.Daily newspapers are available along with coffee or tea. Cold, refreshing water in the afternoons/evenings.There is a gym with every piece of equipment needed for a daily workout.We had drinks (very nice) at the bar but didn’t eat at the restaurant for breakfast.We will stay here again when we return to NYC.

This hotel is centrally located, and it's easy to navigate the 'sites and sounds' of NY from the hotel. Also the rooms are clean and the bed is so comfortable.Check in and check out were are breeze, I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NY

We loved our stay. The rooms were spotless, beds comfortable, staff superb and location was amazing. The hotel is practically next to time square putting you in a great place to manuever the city comfortably.

Great location for us. Staff very helpful. Some renovation going on outside. So busy for four days never used the gym or restaurant. Would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel to friends. Gregory’s coffee shop across the street was also good.

Returned to the Iroquois after several years to be pleasantly reacquainted. A fine hotel with obliging service and excellent rooms. Great location and a wonderful bed! Most likely to return at a future date!

A beautiful boutique hotel close to all of the action of Times Square but without the noise and craziness. Staff were very friendly and made the overall experience enjoyable. Highly recommend this hotel!

this was a great choice, it has a fantastic location which allowed us to walk to several attractions, conveniently in a not very lousy street, calm and discreet. the service was always nice and careful and the hotel amenities a real pleasure. the rooms are very comfortable, with a good size and nice furniture. I will definitely will go back in my next visit to Manhattan.

A great location, reasonable price, lots of character, and most importantly, amazing staff! The hotel itself was very nice, clean, and all the amenities you could ask for. But the staff members themselves are what made such an impression on me. I have never felt so welcome or cared for by any hotel staff as I did at The Iroquois. The staff were all patient, kind, helpful, and respectful. I cannot brag on them enough! They are the reason we will stay here any time we return to NYC.

Stayed here due to location: easy to get to from JFK (on the ACE lines) and EWR (1 stop from Penn Station), well-located in midtown (easy walk to UN HQ). Very good value as well. All the basics were covered: comfortable bed, feather-free pillows on request, friendly staff.This hotel has answered (almost) all my general business traveller niggles: one place to turn the lights off (after a 12 hour flight this can be a nightmare), phones, radio/alarm that makes sense, easy to operate bath/shower, sensible layout, blackout blinds. A surprising, but welcome addition: the food is actually good. Not good for a hotel (I don't normally eat in hotel restos because, well, you have everything out there you want) but after a London flight + 7 hours in the office needs must. I would put it on a par with Manhattan standards. Fish cooked perfectly. Lovely amuse bouche. Beautiful heirloom tomato salad. Basic internet included (and was completely fine for what I needed - better than my UN guest internet in fact!) though you can upgrade for a tenner a day. room maybe could have been a bit bigger but, then, this is midtown - it was well-laid out and comfortable.

Excellent location between 5th Ave and Times Square. Comfortable room ( we had a suite). Excellent service (with the room, reception and concierge). Interior (lift) has come into years somewhat, but as we understood, renovation is scheduled. We definitely like to come back.

Perfectly located! A genuine NYC experience. The room was very attractive and fully equipped with all your needs. Great to have good morning "joe" complimentary in the lobby along with the NY Times. Sign up for the hotel promos; definitely worth it. See you again.
user_name:
Ersajo
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel was excellent for our family weekend get together. Great rooms, clean with very comfortable beds, good internet and all the staff here are extremely friendly and helpful. Offered help with our travel, remembered our favourite tipple in the bar and not forgetting the endless supply of umbrellas. Thank you for making this a memorable stay.

What can I say that has not been said already, Faultless experience in a lovely hotel with fabulous staff in an amazing location. What more do you want ?! Did not use bar or restaurant but they looked pretty popular. Rooms were immaculate and I got my two rooms adjacent to each other on a low floor just as requested. Fridge missing in one of the rooms [need to request these] which was rectified within 15 minutes. If I ever return to New York then I will be staying here for sure.

Excellent location, just a few minutes walk from Broadway and Times Square, yet on entering the hotel the first thing one notices is the peace and calm. The staff were unfailingly polite and helpful, really the service was what one would expect of a much more expensive hotel. The management team are to be congratulated. The room was elegantly and tastefully decorated, the bed extremely comfortable. If I ever stay in NYC again I can't think of a good reason to stay anywhere else.

Rooms and beds are so comfortable! There was a strong smell of smoke (to me) in my original room and I asked to switch rooms and this request was granted immediately, and I was moved to another floor. Very much appreciated.
user_name:
Sarah C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Iroquois New York is a great place to stay. Great location walking distance to 5th Ave and Time Square. Staff goes above and beyond to make your stay memorable and enjoyable from the time you arrive until you leave.

Always a pleasure staying at this small, boutique hotel. Great location near Times Square, yet very quiet! Restaurants and great sights all within walking distance. Valet parking available but we self parked across the street.

Everything at this hotel was prefect. It is close to anywhere you need to be and the staff is super helpful. I think it is a gem of a place. It is great to have it so close to Bryant park which is a lot of fun.

This hotel is located within easy walking distance of Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and other attractions. The room was clean and very comfortable. Staff was great and very helpful with information. I will definitely be staying here again and highly recommend it.

This was a really pleasant place to stay. Tasteful decorations and bathroom. Very convenient to theaters. Attentive service. We got a pretty good deal last minute through hotels.com. There was no problem accommodating my mother in law in her 80’s. There was a nice library to sit in on the ground floor. Beds were comfy. 11th floor was quiet. No view.

We have stayed at this hotel on and off for around 12 years. Each time it amazes me how the quality is maintained. The location is perfect for shopping, sightseeing and business. Just around the corner from Bryant Park and a short walk from Grand Central. Rooms are delightful, beds super comfortable with the freshest linens and lovely toppers. The staff are among the most helpful and pleasant around anywhere in the world. Great to see that standards are being maintained. One note, we felt that the breakfast in Triumph this time had slipped and although the service was pleasant it was not the same.

My daughter and I stayed at the Iroquois for the weekend to celebrate her birthday. From the first contact to our departure every staff member was kind, helpful and so welcoming! My daughter had a beautiful treat delivered to our room that she loved! The location is absolutely perfect for Broadway shows, shopping, Grand Central, Bryant Park, etc. Close enough to walk to Times Square but not so close that you have all the crowds, noise and craziness. Just a delightful trip and we can't wait to return!

Just a wonderful place to stay, comfort, clean & modern. Nothing was too much trouble. Fabulous staff. Very central. We loved it, would certainly return. Cannot fault it at all, had such an amazing time

The Iroquois offers a quaint, high-touch boutique hotel with attention to small details that make for a wonderful guest experience. Friendliness from every employee and great location make this is our go-to when we are in mid-town.

Excellent location. The staff was very kind and helpful. The room was very clean and the shower was big and pampered. We didn't use the extras like restaurant and movies that the hotel offers. We definitely recommend taking this hotel if you are looking for a quiet place as close as 5 minutes walk from times square.

Whether you're in NYC for business, or are a tourist, the location of the Iroquois is ideal. This intimate, newly renovated boutique hotel has a friendly staff, and you never feel like you're in the lobby of a giant trainstation. The guest relations person, bellman, and concierge are literally 20 feet from each other. I've stayed dozens of times, and they have never disappointed me.

About 2 1/2 blocks from the bustle of Time Square and the Theater District, The Iroquois is on a more quiet street - less than 10 minute walk from Grand Central Station. This is a small, elegant hotel. Although not large, the rooms are roomy, by New York Standards. They were newly updated with new cushy carpets and fresh marble-tiled bathrooms. Robe, slippers, complimentary chocolates... The beds are comfortable, plenty of hot water for the shower, usb ports (1.0 and 2.0) in the clock to charge phones or iPads. There is an in-room refrigerator with items to be purchased (candy, soda, water) but the prices are high. Complimentary coffee is served in the library in the morning - infused water the rest of the day. There is an on-site restaurant, but we did not have an opportunity to try it. When we arrived, it was pouring rain. They lent us umbrellas so that we could venture out. Staff was very helpful printing out directions for us and giving tips for the subway. We were able to have a late checkout time so that we could sightsee in the morning and then return to freshen up for a matinee show. The staff also stored our bags while we were at the theater so that we could just stop in and pick them up after the show on our way to Grand Central Station to take a train home.Our favorite hotel in NYC so far!

The hotel housed in old building and has beautiful interior elements, there are lots of boutique feelings with good in room amenities, bedding facilities and toiletries. By location between fifth & sixth avenue, it has most convenient location for both business and pleasure. The only one thing I can’t give highest score is continental breakfast, each day with same limited menus and limited order. If only hotel can be little more generous on this, it can be great choice among expansive rooms in town.

Hotel and staff amazing especially Shade and Vanessa. Great room and location. Was visiting for my birthday with a friend, and hotel furnished my room with comp wine and strawberries. I researched a lot of hotels before choosing Iroquois, and I really made the right decision to stay here!

Wonderful, modern and clean hotel located in Midtown/Time Square. We came to the city for my son's 10th birthday and the Iroquois made us feel special at every turn. From emailing us before we arrive to help with plans to chocolate covered strawberries in the room, we enjoyed every second of our stay. Vanessa is amazing and goes the extra mile to ensure guests of the Iroquois have a wonderful time in the city.

We found our FAVORITE small luxury hotel in NYC—polite staff, impeccably clean, quiet, and a short walk to Broadway! We stayed five nights in their standard room. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was tucked away down the hall, so it was quiet. Holiday visitors will love the close proximity to Rockefeller Plaza. We’re already planning our next visit!

It's a beautiful property right near Grand Central. The rooms are on the smaller side, but absolutely beautiful. The staff is great. The bar has some great cocktails as well. I would stay again in a heart beat.

This hotel has it all, but customer service is what puts it over the top! The rooms are extremely well kept and clean. Beds are beyond comfortable. Love the shower heads and heated tile flooring. Coffee or tea each morning was a nice treat. Location was perfect. Two streets from the heart of Times Square and a quick walk to all of the other main attractions. Vanessa was so helpful and answered all of our many questions. Front desk staff were very kind and accommodating. We will definitely stay here from now on!

Excellent hotel... room was spacious, modern and clean. Great sized bathroom. Perfect for my business trip. Enjoyed Triumph restaurant for breakfast. Great menu. Will try for dinner the next time I stay. Elevators could use to be upgraded, but outstanding stay.

I arrived late after my flight was cancelled and just needed a place to stay in the Mid-Town area. My room was ready and they were expecting me as soon as I arrived. The only problem was I tried to order one of the items from the late-night room service menu, but when I called, the restaurant's voicemail picked up saying the restaurant was closed.

I loved the Iroquois Hotel!! I definitely do not want to stay anywhere else when I visit New York. I love that this is a small boutique hotel so you don't get the large groups of people milling around in the lobby and I never had to wait too long for the lift. The staff are all so friendly, from the doormen to the front desk and the cleaning staff. The room I had was spacious by New York standards and very clean and comfortable with plenty of plugs and outlets in the room and next to the bed. Lovely bathroom with large shower and plenty of space to put everything. The hotel was very quiet, I was on the 10th floor and did not hear a thing from the outside world and I had two large windows in my room which let in plenty of light. I really liked the little things like the turn down service in the evening with chocolates on your pillow, the coffee in the library in the mornings and fresh lemon water in the afternoon. The location is great for shopping, eating and seeing a show. Do yourself a favour and stay and the Iroquois, you won't regret it - I can't think of anything I didn't like. I stayed in a Premium King Room.

Top notch service, friendly staff and we felt comfortable the moment we checked in. The concierge, Vanessa, was the best I have ever worked with during a trip. The location was ideal for the theatre, shopping, good food and trains. Would definitely recommend and will return to this Midtown gem.

I love this hotel! Great location near everything but not in the mist of what can be NYC crowds. Super friendly staff accommodating every need. Maid service was excellent as well. I don’t think I will ever stay anywhere else when visiting NYC again.

Oliver at the front desk was amazing. I also want to say thank you to John who worked the front door. He was also excellent. Honestly, everyone I came in contact with was wonderful. The woman who worked the desk by the baggage holding area was also incredibly helpful when I was leaving. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Not to mention, the location is perfect. Just far enough away from Times Square that you don't have to deal with it, but just close enough for when you do. I would absolutely stay here again. Thank you to everyone who made my stay so easy! Especially since I was travelling for work and had to be there for an entire week. It certainly felt like I lived there and you all made it perfect.

Overall great stay. Excellent hotel. Friendly staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds, great location. Rooms were clean and well appointed with that extra little touch of luxury. Walking distance to Times Square and Theater District.

Loved this place.Rooms on the small size, but to be honest, not there a lot.Heard no traffic or sirens, so made for a good night sleepAll staff from the front desk to door men greatOnly about 5 mins walk to Times Square. 15 mins from Central Park.We walked everywhere.New York is a fantastic place and this is a convenient base.

Best location and the feel of an European boutique hotel for a great price! Could not have been any better. The room size was amazing and the bathroom was so well appointed. The toiletries felt very high end. Do stay here...you won't regret it!

The location of the Iroquois is great: perfect for Broadway, and I walk a lot, so it's also ideal for the Morgan Library, the Met and the Met Breuer, MoMA, and Lincoln Center. If you're not an avid walker, you might find those last four a bit of a stretch, but just march on. The property is excellently maintained and the staff have the hospitality gene.

As always, dependably wonderful stay. Welcoming, professional and accommodating staff. Wonderful location with comfortable well-appointed rooms. Could not have been nicer, and I look forward to another stay in the near future.

Small but nicely furnished rooms. The room was clean and the beds were good. The staff was friendly and helpfull. Located in the hart of manhattan only a short walk away of many of New Yorks highlights.

Our stay @ The Iroquois was fantastic. The hotel is located on a very quiet street that is a stones throw from the craziness that is Times Square. The room and furnishings were very well presented and the room was very quite. The staff was helpful and very welcoming! We will be back!!

We were extremely pleased with our stay. The staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful, the room we stayed in was lovely, clean and luxurious, and of course this is a great location, I highly recommend!

We loved the staff from the front desk to the door men. Always so helpful and friendly and willing to help with all requirements to get around the city. Would stay again when visiting the city. Thanks Iroquois

Super friendly and professional staff, lots of nice little extra's (chocolates, half bottle of wine for rewards members). Room was small but quiet and well appointed. Everything you need. Definitely a step up in quality and value compared to other hotels I've stayed in in the immediate surrounding area. My NYC office is around the corner and I will be staying here from now on when I visit.

This is a very nice hotel in a great location. The room was very clean and a nice size. The bathroom was very small but it was manageable. We were on the top floor so it was quiet. I couldn’t hear my neighbours. The hotel employees were helpful whenever I had a question. I was very happy during my stay. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

We've stayed here several times and love the central location, helpful concierge, and responsive desk and housekeeping staffs. This time we were disappointed that the suite we booked for a week ended up being handicapped accessible, so the bathroom had a shower only. We wanted the soaking tub that was in the suite description. The staff offered to let us move if we waited till the next day. We declined because we had a lot of activities planned and did not want the inconvenience and wasted time of moving. As repeat customers who booked directly through the hotel, we should have been given one of the as-described suites to begin with.The recent room renovations are lovely.

My room was very nice and looked out at the Chrysler building....great view. Staff were super friendly. GREAT location. Walked to Time Square & Central Park. My room was also ready 2 hours BEFORE check in time.....when does that happen??
user_name:
bobsickels
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Excellent service, cleanliness, overall quality. Room was beautiful. Staff was courteous and helpful. The size of the room was more than adequate. We had a room in the front of the hotel, and has views of 44th St. Front desk staff gave us a choice on location of room, which was much appreciated.

We arrived in the early hours of the morning and the staff on duty were pleasant. Fantastic location. Five minutes from Times Square and its subway f you don't want to walk to other landmarks. We never used any facilities in the hotel so can not comment on those.My only moan was the lack of storage in the bedroom. There were 3 adults in our room with only half a wardrobe hanging space and one drawer. I was unable to unpack all of our clothes. Another member of our party had ample storage in their room.

My first time in the city celebrating my daughters HS graduation and my 46th bday. We couldn’t have picked a better hotel. Service was excellent, hotel was beautiful, clean, historic. Felt very upscale yet small and cozy. Loved it and would highly recommend staying here. Heated bathroom floors became a favorite luxury ❤️

We highly recommend the Iroquois.You dont need to spend a fortune on a hotel room.Clean and comfy room and very friendly staff.This is our second time staying here and we will always stay here when we are in nyc.

Have stayed at the Iroquois many times - great location and value - staff is very accommodating and willing to help all with the usual traveller questions.Would not consider staying any where else in NYC.

lack of coffee machines inside the room is disappointing. Sunlight went through the blinds straight to the bed. Only one elevator and is a bit slow.Otherwise, very good and clean hotel and professional staff.

We love the Iroquois for its location, service, and exceptionally quiet rooms with comfortable beds. The rooms are not huge, but totally reasonable for NYC. We've been in much smaller. It's a perfect spot in midtown - near theaters, but on a quiet street. The staff is welcoming and made us feel at home during our nearly week-long stay. We will be back!

I heard this hotel is known for its customer service and they didn’t disappoint!! Wow so many professionally polite people under one roof. Room were clean and looking new. Small however welcome to NYC,and if you slept late , they were serviced after you got up and left room even at 12 pm. Doormen knowledgeable and helpful. Stay here it’s in a perfect location in theatre district and good restaurants. Use their associate parking garage get a stamp and save 10 percent. Definitely a stay again hotel.

We always enjoy our stay at this lovely hotel. It’s such a short walk to Bryan park and this place is enjoyable. We enjoyed to see the exhibition of Downton Abbey and we wish that next time we could stay longer.Thank you for your outstanding services!

All the family really enjoyed our stay here. Location helps get the most out of a visit to NY but the atmosphere is amazingly quiet and tranquil for being so central. Staff are great, facilities excellent offering real value for money. Happy to recommend.

Small, but well appointed rooms. Very personable staff. In the heart of theater district. Better places nearby to eat and drink than at hotel. If lobby experience is important to you, go elsewhere as lobby here is virtually non existent as is

I had an excellent stay. The hotel was clean and the room was spacious and very comfortable. I always stay at the Iroquois because of the great staff and the location is a short walk to Times Square and the theatre district.

The hotel it’s very well located, very clean, quite and staff was very polite & helpful. On our request we chose another room that feets our needs and the staff helped us in this way. We stayed for 10 nights, and we had a very plesant stay.Even they were doing some maintenance work in some area of the hotel everything wad very clean and quite with a lot of care for their customers.

Beautiful little hotel. The staff were courteous and nice. Everything about the room was great. It was very clean, the bed was comfy, sheets silky. I never knew breakfast could be so “beautiful”. It was too pretty to eat but it was delicious. I’ll be back

This hotel ticks all the boxes.It's location is in the heart of everything and so quiet.The staff are very friendly and helpful. After leaving the hotel to travel to Vermont I'm pleased that on my return trip to New York I will be staying here again for three nights.I can highly recommend this hotel, you won't be disappointed.

Sweet old classic. If you like feeling like you are visiting the roaring 20's, with new bedding, then this is your place.nice, upgraded rooms, good staff. Location an A plus. Rate was fair. Will repeat.

The room was very clean. Friendly and helpful staff were great. They had great recommendation on more casual dining for us than the restaurant in the hotel (also great) which we loved so much we ate at twice! We would recommend the hotel as a great centrally located stay. It was also a quick hop to the subway at 42nd and Bryant Park which was nice for getting around.

The Iroquois is a small and inviting boutique hotel between 5th and 6th avenues, near many theatres, the New York Public Library (with lions!), Bryant Park, etc. It is close but not in the maelstrom of Times Square so the location is great for theatre and museum lovers. I've stayed there twice now, once a couple of years ago with a friend, this time with a 26 year old niece I was treating to Harry Potter, etc.... and it's been wonderful...small, quiet, comfortable, very welcoming unintimidating staff members. There is a small lobby with a sweet little library nook where you can get morning coffee and read ACTUAL newspapers (The Times, etc.) Which I did every morning while waiting for my niece to come down and join me. We stayed for three nights and had breakfast there twice because it was so pleasant, great service, beautiful and delicious food, just a lovely way to start the day. All staff members were welcoming. I was searching for a room with two beds so we would be comfortable...the room was fairly small but had two very comfortable double beds and a very nice very clean bathroom. To me this particular NY City hotel is a real oasis...I visit now for cultural trips when I can and this is a wonderful location for what interests me to visit in the city.I would really recommend it and hope to get back there again on my next trip.

We booked this hotel based on the reviews; we were not disappointed and the reviews were spot on. What can I say that hasn't already been said. One thing is for certain the Americans certainly know how to do customer services and hospitality - The Iroquois staff were nothing but great to us. As a family visiting from the UK we were greeted with and treated with nothing but kindness and friendliness. This started the second we pulled up in our taxi where we were greeted by Seth on the door. On hearing our accents he pointed me in the direction of all the nearest bars where I could watch the champions league final. We checked in with a smile from the reception staff who arranged for our bags to be taken our room. The rooms could be seen as a bit on the small side but that was far from an issue for us; It had 2 comfy double beds, a TV and bathroom. It was comfortable, clean and well looked after - what more do you need. You don't travel to New York to sit in your room and we didn't; it was simply somewhere to rest your head.We didn't use the facilities; bar, restaurant, gym etc but what we saw of them they seemed spot on. We took advantage of the free Wi-Fi (no need to pay for the superfast; the free one was fine). Despite there being a coffee shop on virtually every corner in New York the hotel provided coffee in the library every morning.On our last day we checked out at 12pm and spent our last day sightseeing. The staff looked after our bags (locked away) and let us use the gym to shower and change before arranging a taxi to the airport.Quite simply this hotel was excellent which is down to the staff. Would we go again? Absouluetly. Keep up the great work everyone and hopefully we'll see you again (next time without the child so we can sample the hotel bar and nightlife)
user_name:
Steven G
Manchester, England, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed our stay. The room while small was a good value. Alberto at the bar was very cordial and helpful. Well located near theatre and shopping on 5thSeveral good restaurants nearby from French, Italian to Seafood

Great location! Wonderful service! This property is very clean and the staff pays great attention to detail and make you feel right at home. Many attractions are within walking distance in NYC and the gym and sauna the hotel provides was just perfect for my leisure. I would definitely return again!

Great location, great staff, clean room, super comfy bed, heated bathroom floor, and the noise level is good. Never woke up to any outside noise. Drove up and the parking garage is right across the street from the hotel.

I was on a business trip and stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. These are the reasons why: 1) Location, location, location. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Times Square is two blocks away, Rockefeller 3 blocks away, the Grand Central station is around the corner, Whole Foods Market at the corner of Bryant Park plus many many more shops and eateries. Just Google its locality and see it for yourself. 2) ServiceThe staff is warm and friendly, in particular, the Doormen. They are always smiling, helpful, friendly and professional at the same time. The hotel offers a free walking tour like most of the hoteliers but not on every day hence check with the receptionist. 3) RoomsThe room is modernly furnished with fantastic bedding and pillows. The soft lights in the room are warm and welcoming. Unfortunately, I had a room on the 3rd floor and with no view, it faces the back of another building, up close. My window shutters were shut the entire time hence no natural light as office workers can see right into the room. I had no fridge too hence if you get a room on the 3rd floor, perhaps ask for a room with a view and a fridge. The WIFI connection in the room is a little sketchy, not good enough for video voice call. Besides all these, I do love the room, It is well- design, modern and luxurious and I slept really well in the room.OthersFree flow of coffee and tea served in the lobby in the morning. No kettle/coffee/tea in the room.

Hotel is within walking distance of many NYC sights and wonderful restaurants. If you need a cab no problem the hotel employees will handle that for you. Subway just right around the corner from the hotel. The room was excellent, plenty of room for the three of us and sound proof. We did not hear any outside noise. The hotel itself is beautiful.

Great hotel, location very busy. Minimal staff but helpful if asked. Did not get help getting bags to room. Rooms very small but very nice and very clean. Staff very fast if asked for assistance. Over all very good.

I stay only for 4 days on a business trip and it was a very placent stay.I`ll try to stay in this hotel for the next visits I`ll make to NY Thanks a lot for all the good service I received. Everything was clean and good.

Really nice hotel in a great location in midtown. Clean, quiet, nice staff. Only stayed one night, but will definitely stay again on return trips to the city. Booked my stay based on others reviews I read on-line, and they were spot on.

The hotel was in a fantastic location close to Broadway plays and food. All within walking distance. The employees were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel has recently been remodeled and décor was lovely

Very well located in the middle of Manhattan, excellent service, clean rooms, big enough rooms, very friendly personal ( especially at reception), quite rational rates, nearby all significant places like Time Square.

It's a fantastic location. It was always clean rooms. But the Wi-Fi system is uncomfortable. The best part is the location, as mentioned above, which is a good place to walk for Bryant Park and Central Park to the top. Though there is a proper place to eat breakfast around the hotel. the room is really small and no sun light and there is no tooth brush. It’s the most unfortunate part.

The hotel is beautiful and in a great location. I've been to NYC many times and stayed and many different places. This is very quaint and quiet. There are some bars to get a drink and a nice breakfast place next door.The rooms were really nice and the heated floors in the bathroom were a nice touch. The only minor issue I had was that my room had no mini bar and when I requested one I received an empty fridge.

This was a return trip to The Iroquois. We will continue to stay here when in New York. Highly recommend this property. The rooms are very nice and cozy, the staff is excellent, and the location would be hard to beat.

Megan was the first person that greeted us. She was great. Everyone was ready to help. Best experience ever. We are planning to come back in December. Just to stay at this amazing hotel. James was another name I remember. Always greeted with a smile. Everyone did whatever it took to make our stay comfortable. The location was good too. very close to everything. Great coffee in the morning and a paper every day. The larger hotels cant hold a candle to this little gem. Thanks again Megan for being so nice. We are looking forward to our trip in December. Great little bar downstairs and library nice also. Perfection!!!!!!

My mum and I were visiting New York for 9 days and wanted to stay somewhere convenient to the theatre district, as I was seeing a few shows, but not too close so we could have some quiet. The location was perfect; only a couple of blocks to main subway lines making it very easy to get to main tourist attractions. The bed was the best bed I have ever slept on! I’m a little sad to be returning to my bed back home. I wish I could take a pillow home! Much appreciated after long days out. The only downside was that our room was on the seventh floor and we couldn’t see out the window to check the weather because the surrounding buildings were too tall. The housekeepers bring a helpful little weather card when it’s time for turn down, however. View wasn’t too important anyway as we were out all day. We were in a premium king room and found the space to be fine. The service was phenomenal. All the staff we came across were genuine, knowledgeable and very helpful. All our requests were attended to promptly and cheerfully. Another small mention to the amenities. While we brought our own lotions and gels etc. we found ourselves using the hotel’s as they were of such good quality (and refreshed every day). It was an absolute pleasure to stay at the Iroquois and I hope to return soon (for a snooze in the wonderful beds!)

Just got back from a fantastic stay at the Iroquois hotel. Located on the perfect spot. Not too far from the theater district but not smack in the middle of Times Square. At a boutique hotel like the Iroquois attention to detail and customer service is exceptional. From the moment we arrived, to the moment we left , Amanda was fantastic. We stayed in the executive suites and the rooms were spacious, clean and well-appointed. Nightly turndown service with chocolates is a nice touch. The staff is just amazing. Amanda, Shade, Carlos and James made this a great trip.

Whilst the scaffolding on arrival was a little worrying, the staff were very welcoming & gave us some recommendations for breakfast! Great things-Staff, early check in due to early arrival, a treat for my birthday Not so good-The hotel had shut its bar for the memorial weekend, plastic sheeting in the corridors on the way to our room presumably for the workers on the roof, no Molton brown toiletries as advertised

Quality hotel with great location. Larger rooms are very nice. Smaller rooms are lackluster and some borderline unenjoyable The bar is awesome and feels like a small speakeasy. Bartender are fantastic. Sit at the bar and enjoy a custom drink.

I stayed here with my patents and my SO to celebrate my fathers 70th birthday. The rooms were not large but not too small either. Everything was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We also loved the location. We could definately stay here again when se go back to NYC!

Great service and great locationEasy access to subways,restaurants etc room clean everyday and concierge Vanessa was fabulous helping anytime with any questions.Olderhotel but we'll maintained and upgraded

My husband and I stayed in a suite for 5 nights on a special promotion; we were pleasantly surprised with the spaciousness of the two-room area, the comfort of the bed, the pleasures of the full/deep bathtub (somewhat rare in NYC), and most of all the excellent attitude and helpfulness of all the staff we encountered. The place is small enough to feel like a boutique hotel, but big enough to have amenities like a restaurant/room service, a concierge and turn-down service (with chocolates!). The property has recently been renovated and feels fresh and modern, despite historical "bones." Convenient to the theater district but distant enough from the craziness to be relaxing.

Th location is great, the team is the same and the quality of sleep is the best you can get in a hotel. It was a nice escape from a noisy city.The rooms are a bit small and the AC is a bit noisy.Highly recommended!

My wife and I traveled to NYC for three nights. I searched many hotels as there are many to choose from in NYC. I decided on The Iroquois based on the reviews of customer service, location, and it being a small luxury boutique hotel. WOW...The customer service was better than any hotel I have ever stayed. All the reviews are spot on. If we needed anything, it was provided and immediately...not later, but right then. On top of the customer service, the location is outstanding for NYC. The hotel has a great bar which was exceptional. The restaurant was great as well. We had dinner one night and breakfast each morning. We stayed in a Premium King, which I thought was a little small, but for NYC, it was probably large. Enough room for the two of us. Room was quiet as I requested. No problems with elevators as I have heard others complain about a other location in NYC. If you are reading this and still attempting to decide which hotel you will stay at, make the reservation. You may find nicer 5 star hotels in NYC, but I doubt they have the customer service and other great benefits The Iroquois has. Book now.

The Iroquois New York was outstanding. Rooms were newly renovated and cozy. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurant breakfast was very tasty and fresh. The location is perfect for theatre goers and walking distance to many restaurants!

This is a great older hotel with a friendly staff who greet you with a smile every time they see you. Rooms were clean and comfortable bed. The bathroom could be described as cozy and wifi was not always dependable but who really goes to New York for hotel wifi and big bathrooms? Get out there and explore the city because the location is within easy walking distance to metro, Times Square, Broadway, NYC Public Library, Grand Central Station, etc etc etc. Would happily stay here again.

The location was perfect. In midtown. Bryant Park, Times Square, Empire State... We didn’t have street views but we could hear the trafic. Very normal in this city. Without breakfast but the hotel offered coffe and tea in the lobby

Brilliant location for all we wanted to explore in NYC, staff were very helpful and loved the room and style of the hotel. The room was quiet and really comfortable, we would definitely stay again and recommend.

I slept in the comfiest bed in the world. The service was great and the people there was amazing! So nice. The bed is fabulous and the pillows are the best. It's like sleeping on heaven. Definitely going back. Great location also!

The Iroquois Hotel always makes me feel at home!!I've been staying here for the past 4 years and each time has been amazing!! One of the best small and luxury hotels I've stayed in!!All the staff is really nice, the food is delicious and the location could not be better!! Also the bed is super comfortable, always helps to rest!!Thanks to all the staff!!

The Iroquois is a small but luxurious hotel. The staff is attentive and professional, especially the bartender, Alberto and the concierge, Vanessa. I will definitely put the Iroquois on the top of my list for any upcoming stays in Manhattan.

the Iroquois Hotel is small, elegant and perfectly located close to everything you'd ever like to do in NY. Staff is friendliest I've encountered -- and room are spacious and really quiet. We've been staying there twice a year on our trips to NY and plan to so for the remainder of our traveling days

The Iroquois is our new favorite NY hotel! We were very impressed with the accommodations and the service. Upgrading us to the Exec Suite with VIP service on our first visit was a brilliant move. We’re sold!

My husband, 16 year old son and I had a 3 day trip to NYC for a little business and little fun. The Iroquois's location was great for us- close to Times Square and Broadway but far enough to be out of the fray. Very quiet room. We enjoyed several restaurants within a block or 2. We had a 2 bed room that was plenty of space for the 3 of us. The bathroom, although small, had plenty of counter space to hold all our toiletries, hair stuff and my make up. The Terry robe and towels were think and luxurious. We loved the breakfast in the hotel restaurant. The pancakes were great. Very friendly staff throughout the hotel. We will be back to the Iroquois!

A little gem...peace among the hustle and bustle of Times Square and the theatre district. Extremely helpful staff to first timers to NYC...we had no problems with dinner reservations, theatre tickets, subway and museums that were on our list.

Great experience. Staff was outstanding. JJ was extremely helpful and Vanessa, the concierge, was the best we have ever seen. She arranged a trip to the 9/11 Museum and Memorial and walked us through the subway system. We highly recommend using her services. Great little bar with very friendly wait staff. The hotel is walking distance to the theater and Times Square. Great experience.

This is our 4th time staying here at the Iroquois. The staff is wonderful and helpful. They recently did renovations to all their rooms. The tile floors in the bathrooms are heated! I love it here and will stay again.

I have been staying at the Iroquois for over 10 years and my last stay was the best ever! They have really stepped up their game. Renovated room, very friendly and welcoming staff, and an incredibly helpful concierge. I liked the hotel before but LOVE it now. Highly recommend it.

The staff at the Iroquois were very friendly and helpful, offering umbrellas, opening doors and always greeting us when we came in with a smile and hello. The rooms are on the small side, but it is NYC; if possible try not to get a room facing the street as the traffic is backed up and the horns start early in the morning. Difficult to catch a cab on this street. Recommend you walk to either 5th or 6th depending if you are going downtown or uptown; much easier.

This is the perfect hotel for business or pleasure. Staff is second to none and the rooms are great. Very well maintained, very clean, and comfortable beds and pillows. Excellent shower! This is a go to hotel for me for now on for sure. Out of the hustle and bustle of Times Square or should I say

This lovely boutique hotel is perfect. The location cannot be beat. The rooms are very quiet and comfortable. Although we have not had any special needs during our stay; the staff is very attentive and always ask us if we need anything. We’ve stayed here before and will definitely do so again!

Great building, outstanding staff, perfect location for midtown. Quiet. Safe. Great value for New York. Close to plays, restaurants, shopping. Very good concierge. Have stayed here eight times, no problems. .

The Iroquois is a lovely hotel with loads of charm combined with modern amenities. Our room was one of the smaller ones in the hotel, but still very comfortable -- beautifully designed and updated while retaining charm. What we also enjoyed is the location. 44th street has several other hotels and restaurants, giving you some good options. It's in the center of everything but unlike other nearby streets this is still sane! Easy access to mass transit and to the theatre district, as well as shopping. Would highly recommend. Only real criticism is lack of coffee maker in room, although it's available in the library area.

To remodel the Hotel . To have better Restaurant and a bar where you can spent time bised your room.To suggest activities. To have a qualified ConciergeTo improve Menu at the restaurante. To improve the service

First off, let me say that I wouldn't stay anywhere else but the Iroquois, unless it were booked solid! Then I don't know where I'd go! I might even rearrange the dates of my trip so I could stay there instead of somewhere else.The hotel is well situated between Fifth and Sixth avenues, close to a subway stop and within walking distance of pretty much all the Broadway theaters and some of the sights and museums (like MOMA). Upon arrival -- my second visit -- I was given an upgrade on my room, which was a lovely surprise. The room was wonderful, and I can only hope to get it again sometime! The toiletries in the bathroom were very nice and came in handy. I wish the mini bar stocked scotch, but that would be my only complaint!A big plus is the concierge, Vanessa. I don't think there is anything she doesn't know or doesn't know how to obtain. I needed new shoelaces that wouldn't keep coming untied, and she directed me to a tiny shoe-repair place down the street that fixed me right up. She is a gem. The restaurant staff are also wonderful -- friendly, attentive and professional. I finally got to have a drink in the tiny Lantern Keep cocktail lounge -- it's expensive to drink in New York, and it's very expensive to drink here. But I had to experience it at least once!! Glad I did; the bar staff were also very friendly, and the room is lovely. I had drinks before the theater, and that turned out to be a good idea because the lounge gets crowded later.Everyone on the staff deserves a nod for their great attitudes and friendliness. From the bellmen to the front-desk staff, everyone conspires to make your visit a great one! They succeeded as far as I'm concerned! I'll be back in the fall!Kelly W., Phoenix

Courteous staff, well appointed rooms, great location. Small, but cozy, lobby and reading room offers a respite from the hustle and bustle of New York City. Wonderful French restaurant right on premises for breakfast or dinner. Great location for theater, walking distance, but out of the fray of Times Square.

We had an all-girls shopping and sightseeing vacation, and the hotel was perfect for that. The room was surprisingly capacious, and quiet. The hotel location was excellent for both, sightseeing and shopping. We also liked the small and personal boutique-hotel feeling. The staff was also great, really friendly, and everything was really well organized. The hotel gym was not in use (since some maintenance work), but we got to use the Equinox gym nearby, and really enjoyed that! Also, a little short-time inconvience was compensated so well, that no hard feelings were left. If/when I go back to NY again, I definitely choose the same hotel again.

My family enjoyed a pleasant weekend stay at the Iroquois. A good time was had by all. We were treated very well by all staff and enjoyed lovely cocktails at Triomphe. The hotel is currently renovating some areas so the fitness center is currently closed but should reopen soon. In the meantime, they have made arrangements for guests to use a nearby workout facility. We were not at all disturbed by any work they were doing on the hotel and there was no noise associated with it. The library is a nice space to read the paper and enjoy a cup of tea or coffee in the morning, and chiiled water with fresh veggies or citrus during the day. The location is close to Times Square, many restaurants, shops and St. Patrick's Cathedral. We will definitely return and stay agin.

The Iroquois is a charming small hotel where the staff will take great care of you. The warm welcome of the front desks is echoed by all the staff - the bell staff taking care of luggage or getting a cab, the concierge getting quick dinner reservations or helping plan activities after my business meeting end. The location is great for theater or midtown business meetings. The rooms are comfortable and nicely designed. It’s wonderful to come home to a warm and welcoming haven after a day in the exciting and bustling city.
user_name:
Catherine S
Anchorage, Alaska, United States

review_body: You will lnot be disappointed in the qaulity of this boutique hotel. Rooms underwent renovation are well appointed . The staff is always pleasant and they are truely concerned about the plleasure of your stay.Location is in a quite area of mid-town with easy access to 5th and also Madison Ave.'s shopping. Also Times Square (if you dare)

Having stayed here years ago it was a nice surprise to return. Things were like they were the first time. Outstanding customer service, a welcoming staff and a calm, civilized atmosphere. Classically furnished rooms, clean and comfortable. Far enough away from the bustle of Time Square but close enough to the Theatre District, Grand Central Station , Bryant Park, 5th Avenue. Reasonable rates. Would return.

this is our 6th stay here and I have to say they have it all together,fantastic staff that really appreciates their clients and there job and it shows we had another great stay and look forward to our next visit...WE LOVE NY

We stayed at the Iroquois for 4 nights and enjoyed it very much. Every single staff person was super friendly and helpful. Our room faced another building , not the street and was very quiet which we appreciated a lot. We had breakfast in the restaurant and it was delicious and plentiful. We will definitely stay at the Iroquois on a return visit to New York.

We just spent 4 days in NYC seeing plays, hearing jazz, and relaxing in the Park 2 blocks away with our books. The location couldn't be better---all the subway lines are within a couple of blocks---and getting to and from our shows was an easy walk. Since we were last here, the hotel has been upgraded with beautiful new bathrooms and new furniture. Our king room was spacious and quiet, and the housekeeping staff was in and out a couple of times each day to keep it sparkling. The desk people were very helpful with directions and general questions, and the whole trip was a delight from beginning to end.There is an inexpensive diner on the same block, and an inexpensive and delightful Cafe (Un Deux Trois) where we ate breakfast, lunch, and a quick dinner on the next block.This is our 5th stay with the Iroquois, and we will definitely be back.

(4 nights, 2 queen beds)- very friendly staff- big and quiet room for NYC Manhatten- perfect location (close to time square / bryant park but a bit away that it is not too noisy/busy)- clean room- price is not low but fair for NYCI would recommend this hotel and will chose it again for the next NYC trip.

Great location and beautiful classic decor room. However, when we arrived, no-one was available to help us take our suitcases up the stairs to the foyer which would have been very helpful as there are a few stairs. We could possibly have asked someone for help but we would have to go inside to find someone and did not want to leave our suitcases unattended in the street. When we checked out, we had good bell hop service though. We had a few issues with glasses in the bathroom not being cleaned - one was very dirty when we checked in and it was not cleaned the next day either. We enjoyed being able to request a free mini fridge to use for our own items. The mini bar for some reason was not restocked even through we stayed there 4 nights and the used glasses were not replaced. The room was small but nice and quiet with a nice view of other skyscrapers. Overall a nice experience but for the money, I was expecting the small touches to be better.

I've stayed at a couple different hotels in the area and The Iroquois was one of the least impressive. The room was quite small. There was the (way too soft) bed, nightstands on either side and then wall. There was no closet, just a small hanging rack above the mini fridge. Honestly not sure where I would've put my luggage if I had something larger than a carry on. They do give you 2 pieces of chocolate with every room cleaning which was nice. I'm not sure if they have a restaurant attached or when their room service ends. I checked in pretty late the first night (maybe around 10 pm) and they said there was no room service, but I'm pretty sure the booklet in the room said it ends at midnight. Either way, they gave me some to-go menus and said I could order delivery from one of those locations.

Centrally located. Walked everywhere. Very friendly staff. Room was just what we wanted (two doubles). Quiet for a big city. We will come back and recommend. There is a good breakfast place a few doors down. Watch out for the price of cocktails in that neighborhood, ouch. We are Canadian so double ouch!

Pleasent, good rooms. Didn't try food or bar. Nice showers and comfortable beds. Good rate for NYC standards. Friendly staff. Depending on the room but I got no view (it was to a dark ally), but I spent limited time in room.

I needed a hotel room in NYC for one night. I was having a difficult time finding a 4 star for less than $500 with taxes and fees. I stumbled across the Iroquois on Trip Advisor and the reviews were good. I was able to book a standard queen room with their

I stayed here for a week in April, initially for business but then as a great base for shows, sights and restaurants. Staff and manager are very friendly and helpful. The hotel has been undergoing refurbishment and we had a really nice room that had benefited from that. Beds were extremely comfortable, free wifi was excellent, bathroom well equipped with good shower and large TV with lots of cable channels. Breakfasts were delicious and better than many American breakfasts though there is a great diner nearby too. There is a small but pleasant library area with free tea and coffee too. The Lanterns Keep cocktail bar is one of the best in Midtown. Nearby Bryant Park is fabulous and you're a short walk from Broadway theatres, restaurants and Irish bars - the latter are great value for NY and the nearby Lambs Club does a great jazz brunch at weekends. Only a few criticisms: wardrobe space is very tight in the bedrooms, choices on the set breakfasts should include lox and why no coffee pot in the rooms. But overall we would thoroughly recommend this hotel as a base in New York and we will be back.

About the seventh time we stayed here and never been disappointed. Although last time was 4 years ago, still a lot of the same faces. You are always welcomed with a smile, rooms have been redecorated (and renovation is still going on). It’s central location for leisure and business and its price/quality makes it hard to beat ... although I missed the coffee (or infusion) in the morning installed at the entrance...

I got the least expensive room - this one was quite small and dark, but I just don't care. I'm not in the room during the day, and I love this hotel.The front desk people and the concierge were so nice and helpful. I like the way the rooms have been updated. (I guess they're still working on that because there was construction going on, and the spa/workout area, which I've actually never seen, were closed, but I wasn't disturbed by any construction noise.) There's just always a nice feeling about the place when I stay there. It's a five-star hotel in its category - small, clean, friendly and well-located for midtown and Broadway. Be sure to sign up for their emails, which alert you to opportunities to get good rates.
