Noisy Air Conditioning, Presence of Housekeepers in the hallways was obvious and toiletries were not not regularly replenished. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Location was very convenient to shopping, dining and entertainment.

Just had to write this review of The Iroquois Hotel in NYC. My husband and I just returned from an overnight stay in Manhattan to see a Broadway show and add a bit of relaxation and enjoyment to Life. The staff at the Iroquois were all pleasant and kind and helpful, I can honestly say we've never experienced better hospitality at any other property we've visited. We felt warmly welcomed, and that just about says it all!We were graciously provided with an upgraded room and a sweet surprise of cookies and a sparkling beverage in our room, and that certainly added to our efforts to relax and enjoy Life. The room was beautiful and sparkling clean! There was a bit of street noise that filtered up to the 4th floor, but didn't interfere with our sleep. We are at a point now where walking is a bit of a challenge for both of us, and this hotel is perfectly situated between Grand Central Station and Times Square.We are so happy we chose The Iroquois, and can't wait to return to this lovely, warm hotel.

Iroquious is the perfect hidden gem among the other huge hotel chains in Times Square area. Loved the fact that it was a small boutique hotel, giving you that personal touch and feeling of home. We stayed at the penthouse in one of the smaller sized rooms. A bit tight for two people staying for 5 nights (and tons of luggage) but big enough to get a nights relaxed sleep after being out in the busy NY jungle during the day! Clean rooms, comfortable bed, nice and modern bathroom. A little bit dark as one of the windows was inside the walking closet (with the street view)Helpful and kind staff, concierge was excellent. Would return but upgrade to larger room type next time!

This was my first time in Midtown, I generally prefer the UWS for it's more residential feel. I thought that staying in Midtown would be too busy and noisy, but this was not the case. The Iroquois is just far enough away from Times Square that you can avoid that area completely if you want, but still close enough to walk to the shows. Terrific subway connections. Endless dining options. The hotel itself got everything right. It's a turn of the century property with that relaxed vibe that comes from not trying to be trendy. The public areas feel like private areas, filled with comfy furniture and books. You can get coffee in the library, how great is that? And it never felt crowded, which in NYC, is a rarity. Rooms are nicely done and quiet, for the first time I can remember, I heard neither outside noise or the other guests! They don't build them like that anymore. The relaxed vibe carried over to the staff. From the doormen, to the front desk, to the cleaning staff and the restaurant...every person without exception was friendly and helpful. And the cleanliness was of the highest standard. I live in a small city on the other side of the continent, so I find NYC to be pretty great but pretty intense. The Iroquois was a most welcome respite in the middle of it all. Highly recommended.

This hotel continues to be a classy, quiet, and comfortable hotel with a perfect location in midtown. It's on 44th, so the theaters are within blocks, and its easy to walk to Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, or Radio City Music Hall. Restaurants are in abundance, and the area is very safe. The staff welcome you with a smile every day. There is fresh coffee in the "library", along with the morning papers. The bed is very comfortable, with top quality linens. The bathroom is updated. There's an on-site speakeasy as well as a fine French restaurant for drinks or for dinner. What more could you ask for? I highly recommend this hotel for either business or leisure travel. It is perfect for the single women traveler.

If you are looking for a smaller place to stay in the City, check out the Iroquois. The hotel manages to keep a traditional feel while offering modern amenities. The location is super convenient. The staff was friendly, and the rooms were nice.

Can honestly say this is the best hotel I’ve ever stayed in plus the best holiday for my birthday! The staff are so friendly and helpful at all the desks, there’s a man who helps you organise your trip that we dropped in and spoke to every day for advice without him we would have probably got lost! The food in the restaurant is lovely too. There is a huge selection of drinks at the hotel bar which is open fairly late also, with a really friendly bar man! The rooms are so clean and tidy and really luxury to stay in with a huge walk in shower and power supplies for phone charging built into the side tables!To make it even more special they gave me chocolates and a card for my birthday then did it all again at request of my boyfriend and they even helped him organise a bunch of flowers for me. Completely over the moon with our stay it couldn’t have been better thank you!

This was my third visit over two years. I spend 150 nights a year travailing and traveling and this is my NYC choice for a quick visit. They are doing a major remodel, which takes out the very few small negatives from my earlier visits. Comfortable rooms, good amenities, such as mattress, pillows, towels and heated floor inn the bath. Mini bar and electrics are spot on. The Front desk staff take care of the necessary, and the lobby and library manage the free space we need.Oh, yes, the on site restaurant is good, and the Lanterns Keep bar is just the right temperature for a Manhattan Cocktail. @i will be back

That is -- if the price for the "superior queen" is under $300. I have stayed here on and off for over 30 years. They wanted over $460 for it one of the nights we stayed!! Our room - we called it the "little brown room" was tiny with the MOST comfortable bed I have had in a hotel. The air conditioning almost blew us out of bed - like being in a wind tunnel - and I had no bedside table on my side, so we moved one over. The location is on a street where there are many choices of both hotels and places to eat. The bar/restaurant at the hotel sort of functions - sometimes there is no one around....not exactly what travelers need, but quite good.

I've now stayed at this hotel twice and have another trip booked in May. Location is great for access to Broadway shows, subway stops, and several of our favorite restaurants. The staff is always helpful and quick to respond to requests. Prices are reasonable for NYC and the room size is decent. Bedding is nice and the heated floor in the bathroom was awesome during the April cold snap. We feel really pampered by the turn down service which comes with chocolate!

This was our second visit to the Iroquois Hotel and we were just as thrilled with this visit as the first. Incredible staff all the way from the bellmen, to housekeeping to the entire front desk staff.Very comfortable rooms with first-rate service.Excellent hotel in NYC!

We are greeted by smiling, empathy, friendly staff around noon time. She is awesome, we feel like we are back home having someone by the door step listening to our bad experiences in the flight. Room is clean and new. Walking distance to every where in the city. Oh yes, Apple Cider served in the Library room are the best apple cider I every had.

This is an extraordinary hotel. Yes, the mid-town location is ideal and the room renovations are nothing short of amazing, but it still comes down to the staff. This staff is extraordinary! They make you feel, no they convince you through their actions and attitude, that you are far more than a mere paying guest. You learn almost immediately that you are a vitally important part of an extended family, a group of friends, and are recognized as individuals whose needs and expectations are never too grand or too high for them to fulfill.My wife and I, sometimes with family members and this past visit with two close friends, have been repeat visitors since 2002. We have gotten to know Alex, Kelli, Christoph, Anna, Shade, Amanda, Billy, Oliver and Venessa, who occupy the front desk, as well as the bell staff, Carlos, “J.J.”, John, Manik, Lirim, and Sagar. They know our names, our preferences, and they go so far beyond anything we could ever expect of staff members. These are special folks with an unyielding commitment to satisfying their guests. They have never failed!Over the sixteen years and more than twenty five stays at the Iroquois we have known more than a few General Managers, but none have been as thoughtful, focused and professional as Breandon Gallagher. Leadership counts and his is at the top.Again, a great hotel, but again, to paraphrase and old saying: it is one that makes you feel that you at home in a place away from home.Jim B, SSI, GA

We were lucky enough to spend 2 weeks at the Iroquois choosing to look for a more boutique experience than our last trip to NYC. From Start to finish we felt at home. The rooms are very clean and comfortable (Not huge but this is an old hotel and it didn't feel small). The staff were very welcoming and attended to our every need. The location really can't be matched, central to every attraction and many fine eateries and shops. Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station, Central Park and The Empire State Building are all within a leisurely walk away.The Triomphe restaurant on site is excellent and the Lanterns Keep is a really cool, cavern-like bar mixing killer cocktails. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We spent six days at The Iroquois upon a family trip to NYC (I grew up near the city and had not been back in almost 20 years). The Iroquois exceeded our expectations in every way. One person was nicer than the next! The rooms were well appointed and very clean. The concierge went out of her way to help us at every turn. There was a real kindness among all staff at the hotel and they clearly appreciated the fact that we were staying with them. The front desk staff was fantastic too - always smiling and saying hello. The Iroquois confirmed what I have always believed. New Yorkers are some of the most genuine people in this country (we were visiting from the south). We will absolutely be back and will recommend The Iroquois to any friends traveling to NYC.

We stayed at the Iroquois for 3 nights. A trip to see a redux of two fine Broadway shows and enjoy some newer ones too. The weekend was enhanced by the delightful experience we enjoyed at The Iroquois. The staff we encountered were friendly,warm,welcoming...from the front desk folks,to bell/doorman and housekeeping. The location is superb for Broadway theatre goers.We will certainly consider Iroquois for any return trip. I left having a warm feeling about my experience here. Felt wanted!

Price to quality this is an excellent choice. The rooms and bathrooms are comfortable and in very good condition. The room I had, off the back of the hotel, was also very quiet considering the very central location, which is outstanding and close to all of the midtown attractions and shopping. The service at the service at the hotel was 5 star from check-in right through to check-out. Highly recommended, would gladly stay here again.I consider the price mid-range for NYC even though the property is above mid-range in quality and service.

This was our second time staying here since August of last year. Had a few days to visit the city again and picked this hotel again due to location and the experience from the first visit. Also had booked a cyber Monday deal over the holidays and the pricing we got from that could not be beat anywhere. Also received a AMEX gift card to use. The rooms have been renovated since we were here last and we even got the same exact room from last time. Service was great and they stored out bags for us on the last day since our flight was leaving well after check out. I didn't notice it when we there in the summer because it was not needed, but the bathroom floors are heated. I think this was part of the renovation. What a nice touch when you step out of the shower during a cold morning and your feet are warmed up by the tile floor. I would stay here again if ever back in the city. Great location. Free coffee in the mornings although you have to go into the restaurant if you want cream for the coffee....they only have milk out.

The staff was marvelous, and we loved the location of the hotel, close to Broadway shows and good restaurants. The room was very comfortable and, for Manhattan, a nice size. We look forward to another stay there!
user_name:
cpn46
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is second year in a row we have stayed at the Iroquois on 44th St. in Manhattan. The staff is always great. Several months after I booked hotel they had sale. I contacted hotel management and they readily adjusted my reservation to the sale price. I love the hot apple cider they supply every day in lobby along with the complimentary apples. This location is fantastic being in midtown Manhattan and an easy walk to many venues. The bathroom was small but who needs a big bathroom. Water pressure in shower was adequate. The queen bed was very comfortable and staff cleaned the room no matter how late we slept in or left the room. Room service was great. Anytime we needed ice they delivered it to us at the door. Complimentary water bottle, chocolates on bed pillows, and large TV were nice touches. Robes and slippers were in the only available closet along with a safe. The room had a mini fridge, however we did not use it. Looking forward to staying here again March 2019.

The staff at this hotel is outstanding! If was so refreshing to stay here after a day of hustle and bustle in the city. Did I mention Quiet? It is a great place to recharge after a day out sightseeing or a night at the theatre.I did not meet one rude person during my stay. I was only greeted by staff asking how they could make my stay better.The location is outstanding! It is literally only blocks from the Theatre District and Times Square.I felt very safe with my wife and my daughter in this area.I met other travelers on their eighth stay at this hotel and now I understand why. When I return to NYC, this will be the first call I make before my arrival.To Shade,Carlos, Seth, Amanda and Olner my sincere thanks for your outstanding customer service.You treated my family like we were your family.We could not have asked, nor expected more than that. Thank You for your hospitality and your courtesy. The Mitan family will be back!

Walking distance to many attractions of the big apple but in a comparatively calm street. Old building with character. Very friendly and helpful staff. We enjoyed the stay very much. And we already made a new reservation!

We love this hotel... location, amenities, service, and tradition make this our hotel of choice in NYC... Everyone greets you with a smile and will do anything to make your stay memorable. If you go, say hi to Carlos and John for us!

We always enjoy our stay. It is immaculate. Staff attentive. Can’t beat the convenience. We have eaten in Triomphe in the past. Unfortunately as we were guests on Sunday, it was closed. But we will be back, for both the food and the hotel ambience.

We were extremely pleased with our stay at the Iroquois Hotel. The location was perfect for walking. We were close to Times Square, Central Park, and Fifth Avenue. The staff at the front desk was very helpful. We arrived there at 9 a.m. which was too early to check in but they held our luggage for us while we started exploring the city and called us as soon as our room was available. They were helpful with suggestions about nearby restaurants and with directions for our sightseeing walk. We checked out the morning of March 17th. The area was part of the St. Patrick's Day security block which meant a taxi was not allowed to pull up to the front door, but they helped us get our luggage to the next street and hailed a taxi for us which made our exit easy.We would definitely stay at the Iroquois Hotel while visiting New York.

It is more a boutique hotel so don't expect the big lobby with lots of staff. But the staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms are being redone and we got a new one. Clean and well done for the size. Everything worked and we were very comfortable. The way hotels stays should be!

This was my second stay at The Iroquois Hotel, the first visit was three nights and this last one was for five. The location is fabulous, within ten minutes of so much, yet removed from the chaos of Broadway and Times Square. This boutique hotel is polished and top notch. There isn’t a hotel with any better attention and service. I don’t think I could ever stay anywhere else, I highly recommend!

Perfect location for us and our family reunion to march in the St Patrick's Day parade. Close to Times Square. Many nearby places to visit and dine. Entire staff at the hotel were respectful, helpful and attentive! Great rates for room due to Black Friday promotion.

This was our fourth stay at the Iroquois Hotel. We were warmly welcomed apon arrival by their friendly and helpful staff. We love this place. Great location! Very comfy beds. Very clean. Quiet! They have recently added heated bathroom floors, which is a really nice touch.

Excellent service through out stay. Nice reading room with coffee/tea. Big comfortable bed in a decent size room for New York City. Heated floor in the bathroom was a nice surprise. Quiet dining room made it easy to converse during meal. Didn't utilize the bar - but it was packed. Doormen secured us a ride to airport during NYC half marathon.

This was our second time staying at the Iroquois and it exceeded expectations with the renovations. There are many hotels in NY that are twice the price with a less charming atmosphere. From the time we were greeted at reception we felt that every need was met. Breakfasts were excellent. Our room was lovely and it was a perfect weekend.

The Iroquois has so many great things going for it that we don't even think about staying anywhere else. Lovely rooms, efficient/friendly/very courteous staff, location, comfort ... We just have no complaints. Highly recommended.

What a gift to have already had my second wonderful stay at the Iroquois in 2018! And again, the superb comfort and service at the Iroquois sets it far above that of any other hotel I know. Every aspect of my February stay was perfect – from beginning to end. The Iroquois has come to define highest quality hospitality for me, and that is entirely due to its unique and unfailingly professional and generous staff. As before, a guest couldn’t ask for a kinder or more thoughtful team to ensure a completely delightful experience. Each of the staff who contributed to making sure I felt totally ‘at home’ and cared for from reservation to check out deserves a mention here – and apologies if I’ve forgotten anyone in this list. Huge thanks then to Breandan, Garette, Latosha, Christoph, Shade, Amanda, Billy, Anna, Joana, Kelly, Lirim, John, J.J., Carlos, and Bill! You’re the best – and I can’t wait to be back with you again soon!

This is our 5th time staying at the Iroquois. You can't beat the location. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We apppreciated being recognized and thanked for coming back. We look forward to our next stay.

We have stayed at this property several times and in fact is now the only place we stay when we visit NYC. The location is perfect, the staff is warm, welcoming and helpful and the rooms are impeccably clean and extremely quiet. We will be back again this summer to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary! Special thanks to Amanda and Christof for another great stay.

I love this hotel! It is a beautiful small luxury hotel which is undergoing an extensive upgrade of all guest rooms.Conveniently located for shopping, Broadway, Times Square and Central Park.The rooms are comfortable and well appointed. The staff is professional and they truly care - all the way from Housekeeping to Management.Triomphe - the restaurant at the hotel is definitely not to be missed!I always feel welcome and consider this my "home away from home".

Was planning on checking out the bar inside this hotel so I called to see what the accessible route would be as I use a wheelchair and the front entrance has steps. The person who answered the phone first asked me when I was coming and when I told him tonight put me on hold and a minute later told me their ramp was not operational and that the only way in would be if I could walk up the steps. Not sure how a ramp could possibly not be operational, but I am sure that the hotel is violating the Americans with Disabilities Act by not maintaining it properly.
user_name:
annatated1
New York City, New York

review_body: The Iroquois hotel really makes your stay in NY perfect down to the detail. The staff are very professional, friendly and accommodating, and enhance your stay with extra touches of treats and wine. The room was meticulous and well-stocked with all the amenities you might need. The robe, slippers and bed were very comfortable. The hotel has a perfect location right around Bryant Park, but not in the middle of traffic and noise. I will be sure to return!
user_name:
F00die121
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great Hotel, Great Service and great location, highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Rooms are typical size for New York City, but the service far surpassed the usual treatment we receive when visiting the City.

I stayed for business and the staff were more than just helpful. They have the most attentive concierge and the breakfast was excellent. The room was spacious and the service was excellent. The location is fantastic, as it is quite close to the shows, Time Square and many other sights to see. This was a central location and a very close commute to our work also. The room was quiet, no view, but relaxing and I felt very safe. The staff are willing to assist in any capacity. While working on their health center, which was closed, they had a deal with a nearby health club. This was very nice and quite a good club.

We have just returned from a holiday in the Us one weekend was in New York - The Iroquois Hotel.We found everything to our liking and were particularly impressed by the care and attention we had at the front desk particularly from Shade who looked after us and all our needs.Do not miss the cocktail bar!We look forward already to our next visit

Perfect location, newly remodeled rooms were beautiful, quiet and comfortable. Staff was amazing. And location is in the heart of Times Square area without being in the hustle and bustle. This will be my go to destination.

This was a second trip to the Iroquois Hotel and it was as enjoyable as the first. The hotel is very inviting with a warm cozy feel and the look of a European property. The front desk staff were terrific. When we checked in, I mentioned to Shade ( hope I got the name right - lovely , beautiful young woman) that we were here to celebrate my friend's birthday with a night out and a Broadway play. When we returned in the evening from the show , there was a plate of chocolate dipped strawberries with Happy Birthday written in chocolate on the plate in our room . Wow what a special treat . We really appreciated the personal attention and kindness . The library where complimentary coffee is served in the morning starts the day off right and the hotel's location is very convenient to many attractions . The rooms are smallish but comfortable with slippers,, robes and Frette linens. At checkout we spoke to Christof ,who we met on our last visit Personal and accommodating another example of the Iroquois staff who truely want to make your stay fabulous. We have already booked another stay.

The hotel was small but still quite lovely. Had this a trip for just the two of us the room size would have been perfect, but for three it was on the small size. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and for being in NYC the rooms were very quiet. The location can't be beat as it its centrally located to everything but tucked aways so not so crazy with tourists.

I travel a lot - all around the world (60+ countries so far), and although I have stayed in many world class properties, there are not many places that have made me feel so comfortable that I would take the time to write a review...multiple times. The Iroquois, while not the biggest nor fanciest, has a unique elegance and penchant for customer service that keeps bringing me back. And the latest renovations only make me more loyal. Thanks to Breandan and all his staff for spoiling me.
user_name:
Lane H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: A little gem of a place on a quiet block away from the hubbub of Times Square, but within walking distance of all the action! The ambience is old-school elegance, with a hip twist. The beds were delightful, and I got such restful night's sleep that I normally don't get in a hotel bed.

We just completed a 5 night stay at The Iroquois - our 6th or 7th time. We couldn't imagine that the best could get better - it has.The rooms are getting a makeover. Ours has been completed. Fresh carpet, new wallpaper, warm floors in the commodious bathroom, excellent soundproofing. The list goes on and on.Staff, as always, is gracious,warm and helpful. Yesterday, we received a call from the front desk. The housekeeper had accidentally spilled one of our pill boxes. We were offered a very fine accommodation for this minor slip up. We travel several times a year and stay in very fine hotels. There's none better than The Iroquois. It's Trip Advisor rating is excellent but should be MUCH higher. Look no further than The Iroquois when you visit New York. It simply can't be beat.

Great small Boutique hotel in fantastic position for Times square , Central park etc. Great refurbished quiet rooms and lovely helpful staff always ready and willing to advise and help. We will return.

Fourth or fifth stay at this very cool hotel. Just two blocks from Time Square/Theater District but out of the craziness. Exceptionally clean rooms, comfy beds, great staff. Small but charming bar/restaurant off the lobby, four good Irish Pubs within two blocks, outstanding Greek restaurant (Kellari Taverna) just 100 steps away. Easy walk to west side piers (Circle Line and Intrepid), Easier walk to Grand Central Station and thus everywhere else. Great value in mid-town. (What's not to like? as NY'ers say.)

We have stayed at the iroquois. several time and continue to be pleased by both the accommodations and the service. On the first day and our stay there with an unusual noise coming from the ventilation system. We called down and the front desk sent up a maintenance person who arrived very quickly. Fortunately the noise stopped before the maintenance person arrived but I was impressed by the quick turnaround of getting someone looking in to the situation. If you are looking for a smaller hotel in a great location and a good value I would certainly recommend the Iroquois

Very wet weekend but The Iroquois made it a great stay. Check in was fast, courteous, and easy. Room was very clean with extremely comfortable beds. Heated bathroom floor was amazing Not only did it feel good on our feet but was a great place to dry shoes from the rain. We received umbrellas each time we stepped out of the hotel. Staff was great!

This was my second stay with the Iroquois (same conference, second year in a row) and it met all the expectations I brought from my first stay, which was an excellent experience all around. This year I exchanged my travel companion from my bestie for my hubby, who has literally been everywhere, stayed everywhere. From roadside motels to Le Bristol in Paris, he has seen it all, and I am delighted that he loved this property. From the horse's mouth, the Iroquois is "cozy without being pretentious and so quiet!" I too, was amazed again by how quiet the rooms are. In a city like New York, this is an enormous plus; particularly when you're traveling for business, tired, maybe a bit grumpy, and really need your sleep. Grand Central is all but two or three blocks away and we were so happy to find out that the one show we booked (The Play That Goes Wrong at the Lyceum Theater) was just a couple of blocks away. Great locations, excellent & attentive staff, I would happily stay here again!

Great Hotel and staff. A very enjoyable stay. The great Midtown location makes everything in the City so convenient. I really can't say enough about how pleasant the hotel makes the stay and is willing to help you with anything that you need.

The independent hotel has a historic New York feel. Everyone is incredibly friendly and eager to help. The management followed up with a request for feedback, and within a day of my feedback I received a personal email from the manager expressing how he had followed through. Wonderful!

The friendly and helpful staff were the icing on the cake in this hotel. It was brilliantly located in Midtown but quiet. Small rooms but great service and cleanliness made up for lack of space. Would thoroughly recommend.

Stylish, really comfortable, competitively priced, great staff, good location. Seth, the doorman is a legend. I keep coming back to this hotel because it never disappoints. Their new bedrooms are beautiful and it’s in a good location, in the middle of everything.

This is a pleasant, friendly, small hotel in a nice location near the theater district in midtown. Staff was helpful and rooms were nice but on the small side (this is NYC). Only downside was 1 elevator not working and fitness room under construction. Will definitely return.

First I want to apologize for this very delayed review. I had the most wonderful and welcoming hotel experience of my life when I stayed at the Iroquois in Summer 2014. My one-week stay with the Iroquois was very comfortable. Their staffs were very friendly and passionate about their work (the bell boys, Concierge manager Bill, check-in counter staffs, room service staffs,the housekeeping staffs, etc). Everyone made our stay feeling like "coming home", because everyday there was big dispenser of ice water with fresh mint or lemon, and every evening there was a bowl of fresh strawberries at the front counter. The Concierge manager Bill was very helpful and knowledgeable in recommending nice restaurants and attractions to visit around Manhattan, as well as very thoughtful in helping us organizing our fine dining experience. One night, my mom and I had a a late dinner reservation and were worried about getting to and back from the restaurant at that hour. Bill took care of our safety by arranging transportation for us to and from the restaurant. I also really appreciated how housekeeping has kept our room clean and fresh every single day ^_^.

The Iroquois offers first class facilities in a convenient midtown location, but the staff is what made our stay really memorable. They were all super friendly and did a great job making us feel right at home. A wonderful visit!

Love this midtown hotel for its intimate feel and excellent staff. The rooms are clean and have everything one needs for a pleasant stay. Very comfortable and very good location for dining, shopping, shows.

The room was a disappointment..."Deluxe King" had only a shower (no tub), and a view of nothing. The gym/sauna were closed (for renovation?), but no mention of this when I booked online. The gym/sauna were prominently advertised.

Try the Iroquois...great service, food and convenience in NYC. A cup of tea before the theater, breakfast or a good night's sleep are all provided with smiles and relaxed but lovely service.It's steps away from most NYC theaters, too.

The Iroquois is big enough to have the services of a large hotel, but small enough to deliver a very personalized stay. The staff is consistently pleasant and engaged and the rooms comfortable and well appointed.

The Iroquois New York, from the front desk, the concierge, the door men, the front desk, the maid service and also the chocolates, turn down service lady. I can't tell you enough wonderful things about this boutique hotel. It is a home away from home. From the moment we checked in, until the day we left, the staff treated us like friends/family. I picked this hotel for the location, and the rating on Tripadvisor, and I am very happy that we did. The location is between Central Park, Grand Central Station, New York Public Library, Empire State Building and Times Square. The hotel was quiet, but as soon as you walk 1/2 block to 5th Avenue you are in the thick of New York hustle and bustle. A great location for people who like to walk and have a centrally located hotel. We walked between 9 to 14 km per day. Its also easy to get a cab from this location. For a first visit to New York, it was a great place to stay. I would like to thank all of the workers at Iroquois Hotel for the hospitality, professionalism and efforts to make our stay wonderful. Special thanks to Bill, the Concierge for ensuring a prompt ride to the airport and to Seth, the Doorman. We enjoyed meeting each and everyone of you. Hello from Canada, and we hope to visit you again. Dawn Leaman

I was excited to stay here for the Christmas holiday. The location is perfect right near Bryant Park. The hotel lobby was lovely, small but enough room to sit and chill after a day of walking. My room was nice however bathroom way too small. I understand some of the rooms were updated but mine was not one of them. They did send a bottle of wine to the room as a welcome gift. Food at the hotel was okay, I would stay again but just upgrade to a suite for hopefully a larger bathroom. I was happy to have stayed on same floor where the James Dean suite was located.

Returned to The Iroquois after several years. Still, a perfect location for theater lovers. Right off 6th, but without the craziness of Times Square. My room was newly redone and very attractive. Well-lit, in-room thermostat comfy bed and lots of water pressure in well-designed shower. My new favorite place to stay in the city!

My husband and I arrived on a damp cold evening 2 nights prior to Christmas after a long flight from Australia. The hotel staff were wonderful and greeted us so well. Check in was very efficient and we were settled in our room very quickly. After a quick freshen up we were back down stairs where reception staff provided us with maps / directions to all the pre Christmas local highlights. On Christmas Eve they found out where Christmas church services were and printed them out with directions. They also provided us with their umbrellas on damp evenings and made polite chit chat, calling us by name when passing them in the lobby. The hotel was immaculate and we loved their early morning tea and coffee service. Thank you Iroquois - we hope to be back

This hotel is a gem. Perfect location! Lovely modern, updated design and amenities. Guest services very friendly and helpful. I will definitely come back and hope there is a room for me despite all of you booking up the Iroquois.

The amazing staff and boutique-style ambience of the Iroquois make this cozy hotel a stand out in New York City. Location is the perfect walking distance from the Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and other major attractions. One of my best hotel stays in a long while.

This best staff! Friendly, exceptionally helpful and attentive. The room renovations are excellent! We have stayed at the hotel in the past and have never been disappointed. One is made to feel at home, from the greeting at the desk to the farewell from the doorman when departing.

Iroquois is my hotel of choice in NYC. Terrific location. Friendly and attentive staff plus terrific restaurant. I love this small quiet hotel. Every aspect is top quality. Looking forward to a return.

Great boutique hotel in the heart of midtown. Close to shopping, theaters, Central Park. Metro is very close and easily accessible from La Guardia by express bus/train to 42nd St/Bryant Park stop. Good restaurants and a Whole Foods nearby.

Hotel staff was so friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to greet us and accommodate inquiries and requests. Location is great - close enough to everything but just enough away from the crowds and noise. If you are looking for a boutique hotel I would recommend the Iroquois.

This is a convenient midtown hotel. It is great for business travelers who prefer a boutique hotel vibe versus a major chain. The tradeoff is smaller rooms. But both of the rooms I have stayed in during two separate trips have been very quiet, which I value highly for NYC hotels.

Great location with easy access to shows, restaurants, and transportation. Room was not large, but clean, well-appointed, and completely satisfactory. Staff was universally friendly and helpful. This was our second stay. We will definitely come again.

After having stayed at a number of hotels over the years while in NYC I would rate this as the best hotel stay ever in NYC. The service provided by the hotel staff was excellent from the time you first exit your car at the front door to the time you enter your car to go to the airport at the end of your stay. Kudos to staff: the door staff, the front desk staff, the housekeeping staff and the room service staff. Looking forward to returning to NYC and staying at this hotel in the future.

I had stayed at The Iraquois on multiple occasions due to their centralized location. Now that they have renovated their rooms, it is definitely the one place I will check out first when making a reservation. We had a 3 night stay at one of their newly renovated executive suites, and it was great. The room is well decorated, and had some amenities I have not seen in a hotel room at this price level before, including a 60" tv in the living room! Service was very good overall, with the exception of the bar and restaurant personal which seems a bit off their game. All in all, a great experience.

The Iroquois is very convenient to many different venues in NYC...they are currently remodeling rooms, and the remodeled rooms are gorgeous...including heated tile floors in the bathroom!!!! The staff is always friendly and outgoing...makes you feel like family!

Tremendous staff & management working to give the best in guest satisfaction. The front desk was very accommodating in getting us the room that was right for us. The manager kindly introduced himself when he stepped on the elevator and said goodbye when he left. Every employee exhibited the same level of gentleness. Newly renovated rooms bring accommodations up to today’s expectations w/ outlets for chargers, heated bathroom floors and substantial bathrobes. Coffee in the rooms would seal the deal though.

I just love this hotel and return every time I visit NYC. The staff are all amazing and go above and beyond to make sure your stay is comfortable and you have everything you need. I’ve been going for the last 4 years and one of the staff even remembers it’s my birthday even though I didn’t mention it! You can’t top that to make it feel personalized. The rooms are great and the hotel’s location is superb...within easy walking distance to subway stations, broadway plays, Central Park, shopping, etc. I’ve never been disappointed there, feel the area is very safe, and consider this my go-to hotel for this great city!

I've stayed at the Iroquois several times and it never disappoints. First -- highly competent staff (which is most important to me) who are genuinely welcoming and cordial (which is a huge extra bonus). A friend and I came in on Saturday with no dinner reservations -- dumb of us! -- but the Iroquois found us a seat at their bar, where the service was marvelous and the food outstanding. The location is superb for Broadway, Lincoln Center, and many of the galleries museums, and after a day of hiking around the city and an evening at the opera, the quiet, comfortable, and well-designed room (hooray for enough lights and outlets!!!!) was a treat. Three cheers and five stars for a delightful boutique hotel. The Iroquois remains my favorite place to stay in NYC.

Great hotel and location. Had a short stay and we are glad we chose this hotel. Very friendly and supportive staff. And as others have mentioned close to action but in a quite location. Would stay again :)

It was our first trip to NYC, and finding that perfect hotel for my daughters and I was proving to be more difficult than I thought for our 4 night stay. It was by luck that I discovered this hotel, it had everything on my checklist- great location, restaurants close by, updated and clean rooms; beds were super comfy and friendly staff. Not to mention the bathroom! Modern and Heated tile flooring- perfect after spending an entire day in the cold!.We arrived early (12 noon) and we weren’t expecting our room to be ready but was pleased to hear that it was. When we were shown our room we were very delighted as it was a bright room with full windows. We were traveling to celebrate my daughter’s birthday and we found the room comfortably sized (3 adults), we had suitcases and still room to move around. The hotel surprised my daughter with a scrumptious plate of chocolate dipped strawberries and wine for her birthday- what a thoughtful gesture and it really set the mood for our stay. We had a wonderful time and will definitely stay here again! We didn’t get the chance to try the Triomphe Restaurant and will make a point next time. The only downside was that there wasn’t a full length mirror in our room! ( that’s a necessity for a roomful of females! Loved all the photographs in our room too-perfect for our occasion:).

We have stayed at this hotel for 20 years. The customer service is great, front desk is tremendously helpful, and Al the Bellman has been there 22 years. Great location and walking distance to GCStation, Times Square, all kinds of restaurants.

We stayed there during a recent weekend in New York. It is tucked away enough to be quiet, yet close to shows and dining. It was clean, everyone was very friendly, and the heated bathroom floors were a bonus.

This was our second stay at the Iroquois. Again the room was spacious and quiet and comfortable with great light for reading. The bed extremely comfortable. Staff are extremely friendly and attentive. Valet service very good. Free hot cider and coffee very good. We would recommend staying here especially if you take in Broadway shows, like pubs and museums and shopping etc...GREAT LOCATION!

The Iroquois Hotel has all the charm, ambiance and decor of a wonderful old European Hotel. The staff are very gracious and helpful. The room was quiet with elegant furnishings and nice amenities. The heated bathroom floor was greatly appreciated on a chilly winter visit to New York. City views of the Chrysler Building are delightful. The location is very central with easy access to subway or cabs. A lovely hotel!

Nice, quiet, boutique hotel with old school charm and clean ,modern rooms. Just took a one night stay to celebrate an anniversary after other plans fell through. A peaceful, clean, and friendly oasis if that is what you are looking for.
user_name:
Y723GIjasonc
New York City, New York

review_body: Loved everything about my stay at this hotel! Great location, nice room, and fantastic customer service! Definitely check out the Lantern’s Keep bar, it’s a hidden gem. The staff went out of their way to make sure we got a great room, as early as possible, and to make sure we were pleased with it.

Lovely hotel ,well located for all attractions,pleasant and friendly.Tea and coffee supplied in lobby room on a morning.Hot apple juice on an afternoon.Mini bar well stocked but pricey.Rooms cleaned every day.

Clean, quiet, great restaurant downstairs. Loved it. And the most comfy bed I have had the pleasure ti sleep in in a hotel in a long long time. In the heart of NYC. Clean, quiet, nice staff. We will definitely stay here again.

This is now our go-to hotel for visits to NYC. The rooms are extremely nice. They are clean, the beds are comfy, and the bathroom towels are fluffy. But, it’s the staff that brings us back. They are possibly the friendliest and kindest folks in NYC. One young man met us at the door and helped with our luggage and then quietly helped as we left. I was in such a hurry to get to the cruise ship I forgot to tip him so the hotel allowed me to add it to my bill after the fact. He was just such a nice young man and helpful as they all were. This quiet hotel is literally in the center of the action too. A 10 min walk to Rockefeller. Five minutes to the heart of Times Square or Bryant Park. We walk fast though. It’s about 20 minute to Macy’s.I can’t imagine staying anywhere else in NYC now.

There are no downsides to this hotel - only positives. It is perfectly located in the heart of the City but has quiet rooms. The newly refurbished rooms are a true delight. Lots of power points close to the bed; full length mirrors; under-floor heating in the bathroom; lots of storage space in the bathroom and a great roomy shower. The staff are very friendly and unfailingly helpful. Any requests - large or small - are dealt with efficiently and with a smile.

Fantastic location for walking to everything Midtown and Uptown Rooms immaculate cleaned daily to high standard..The most amazing comfortable bed and pillows to sleep..Bathrobes and slippers were a godsend to warm us up after a long day sightseeing..Warm apple cider in the library too to help us thaw out.. All staff very helpful knowledgeable and we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone..Chocolate dipped strawberries and prosecco on ice lovely surprise waiting in our room to celebrate my 50th Birthday and our 10th Wedding Anniversary..Thankyou to everyone for a most enjoyable and rememberal stay..

Excellent location, excellent staff and excellent food and beverage are a few of the reasons I always choose The Iroquois. Fabulous place to stay if you like a boutique hotel where everyone remembers your name.

We stayed mid December for a long weekend and had a great experience from when we checked in to the time we checked out. Everyone was friendly and courteous at this hotel and were always smiling which is nice to see! Our room was perfect! Although a little smaller than we are used to it was cozy and inviting. My favorite thing was the heated floors in the bathroom, such a nice little touch! I read some reviews about no hot water and bad water pressure but we did not experience either of those issues. Bed and pillows were quite comfortable, we actually slept in a little later than expected since we were so cozy. Lanterns keep is attached to the hotel, there was always a wait but well worth it, personally i think there should be a different line for hotel guests to get priority seating. We sat at the bar and enjoyed watching the bartender make drinks (i think his name was Daniel) he was a delight! We were not able to check out the front bar since it was always crowded but maybe next time! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend to all!

I traveled to New York with a friend and we stayed at the Iroguois. It is fabulous! The service, the location, the bed were all superior. The room was lovely and the bathroom was fantastic! I would definitely recommend The Iroquois to my friends and family and I would undoubtedly enjoy staying there again in the future!

Well, what can I say.....I have travelled the world twice, however this was one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in! From the doorman to reception staff.....every single person I came into contact with smiled at me and my twins and could not do enough to help us. We felt loved and secure, celebrating a trip of a lifetime. I had just got the all clear from cancer and had saved up to take my twins for a Christmas break in New York. This hotel was so perfectly located for myself and for teenage children. The consiege was amazing! He helped us plan each day to maximise the benefits of our stay. The reception desk were incredible, polite and so helpful. The maid was adorable, telling me all about New York. The people in the cocktail bar were fun, good at their job, and welcoming. Door staff excellent. I will return, have booked flights already. Wow! Well done.

Great boutique hotel close to all main attractions but quiet and we had a room facing the street free coffee and flavoured water in library every day great friendly small bar downstairs staff extremely helpful from the front desk to the doorman we had a long flight from Sydney arriving at hotel at 7am and they let us check into room immediately rooms reasonable size by New York standards would highly recommend this hotel
user_name:
Rebecca W
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Having stayed at several Small Luxury Hotels of the World over the years we chose The Iroquois for our Christmas break in NYC and it lived up to its reputation for service and location. You really are in the middle of everything so whether you rate shopping, museums, or the shows as your holiday priority, it is all on your doorstep. The nearby subway stations of Port Authority and Grand Central take you up or down town when you want to venture further afield or the walking is too much. Amenities wise, the beds are very comfortable, nice linens etc, essentially all the refinements you expect from an SLH establishment. The hotel has a quaint period feel to it and you are treated warmly by all the employees which adds to the charm. We didn't need much from anyone whilst we were there but any issues or queries were dealt with promptly. A big shout out has to go to Seth, one of the doormen, who is a real credit to the hotel and manages the balance of attentiveness and just getting on and doing the job very well. Apparently the hotel is in the process of refurbishment and I will say that it needs to as in places it is showing wear . Our room, a Premium King, was roomy enough with a nicely appointed bathroom (gorgeously hot shower!), but clean and well maintained as it was, the general furnishings and carpets are tired and in need of a lift and I would expect more from an SLH property.All said, a great stay in a classic Midtown location allowing New York to weave it's festive magic so many thanks to all at the Iroquois!

Nice comfortable hotel in nice area close to Times Square. My only complaint would be that the bathroom was tiny but it wasn't a problem for us. Also the lamp on the desk cut off the corner of the tv but we just had to put it on the floor! Nice extras with the hot cider in the library & the complimentary bottle of red! We loved our stay here!

Great location. Customer Service from Front Desk in particular was first rate. Family friendly. Bill the Concierge was very helpful and a good guy. People working at this property were all top notch. Only possible knock would be the Housekeeping were some improvement is needed but beyond that, The Iroquois New York is a property I highly recommend and will return to......

good service. Good bed. Joana at the desk very helpful and all the other persons also very helpful.The restaurant was very good but expensive. But a little expensive. because the rooms very small and no windows. But the rooms very clean and the beds very comfortable.

I brought my girlfriend to New York for the express purpose of proposing to her (which I did!) She said yes and we both were very pleased! I had never been to the city but she had numerous times, even once during Christmas. I’m pleased to say that we both had a wonderful time! Transportation was no problem and hotel staff were always friendly and helpful. I underwent a little shock with food prices but we hunted around and found a few restaurants that didn’t seem so bad. We had a great time at the hotel and the city in general.

Wonderful hotel at a great location with exceptional service. Boutique style with lovely rooms. Sade and her team with Bill ensured our Xmas in New York was a great experience. Third stay there and will stay again!

Definitely not a luxury property but it was nicely appointed. If you drive your car, do NOT use the valet service. There are public garages on the same block just before you reach the hotel. We learned the hard way that valet takes the car to a lot that is a couple of blocks away and operated by a third party. It took us one hour to get our car back! No one at the hotel told us this, otherwise, we would have planned accordingly.

We have just returned from staying at the Iroquois over Christmas. It is just off 5th avenue and so easy to walk to major sights from here. The rooms, whilst not being large, have all the comforts you could need. Very friendly staff.

Perfect location for a trip to NYC. Right in the heart of it but not in the middle of it so a nice little escape. The rooms were small (we had a family room and 4 of us was a tight squeeze) but all rooms in NY are small. We didn't eat at the hotel as it did seem quite pricey for breakfast and theres a very nice diner just seconds around the corner. If you do go then I would just get a yellow taxi from the airport as we got a cab arranged from the hotel and it was about double the price and not very friendly (yellow taxis work on a fixed rate). Be careful not to help yourself to any of the items provided in the room as a bottle of water will set you back $10! Too late for us as we were very thirsty when we arrived and didn't realise the water wasn't complimentary! The little bar in the hotel looked lovely but we had children with us so didn't visit. All in all though the staff were friendly and accommodating, the hotel and rooms were clean and the location was perfect. If I came to NY again I would definitely return.

Fantastic smaller hotel in a perfect location blocks away from Times Square. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and all we needed for myself and my two teenage children. This will be my go to hotel for NYC going forward.

The Iroquois offers a great location while staying in NYC. Just two blocks from Bryant Park, six blocks from Rockefeller Center, two blocks from Grand Central, and about the same from Broadway ... it puts everything within a short walking distance! The hotel itself is welcoming ... from the coffee offered in the lobby to the staff at the front desk ... it makes guests feel appreciated. The room is rather small, but adequate ... however, the bathroom configuration could use some improvement! Everything is so close together, it feels like the bathroom on a cruise ship! But, aside from that ... the accommodations are clean and cozy ... so there really is no reason to complain! Overall, it provides a convenient and comfortable place to stay when visiting NYC.

We loved our stay. When we visit New York we make it a point to stay in smaller hotels. We enjoy the personel attention the quiet atmosphere that you don’t get with the larger hotels. The rooms are beautiful, the staff is extremely friendly, and the location is perfect.

This property is in a great location, near everything. The feel of the hotel is like being at home. I really enjoyed the warm cider in the evenings, and the breakfast was great. The hotel has so much interesting history which was great!

I booked three rooms for my family for five nights the week before Christmas. This was the third time that my wife and I stayed at The Iroquois. We again were most pleased. Anna greeted us warmly and checked us in with grace and charm. The Iroquois is tastefully appointed. Rooms were comfortably furnished. A bottle of wine and chocolate dipped strawberries awaited us when we entered the room. My wife and I stayed in 1110, a renovated premium king room which was comfortable and quiet. A wardrobe and dresser provided plenty of space to accommodate our five-days worth of attire. Rooms were clean, well-maintained, as were all areas of the hotel. Housekeeping kept everything in order. Our bathroom was well lit, provided plenty of space for us, and had heated tile floor, a welcome feature during the cold week, along with a walk-in shower. Chocolates on the pillow and a card with the next day's weather forecast and temperature were a great touch. The Iroquois offered very reasonable rates for a high-quality, midtown hotel. An additional reason for choosing this hotel was location, between Fifth Avenue and Sixth Avenue, walking distance to theatres, stores, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Terminal, and many excellent restaurants. We enjoyed breakfast at Triomphe and drinks at the hotel bar, both providing attentive service. The Iroquois is the perfect hotel for us. We shall return.

Our family stayed at the Iroquois for three nights in late December. Although we have visited NYC many times, this was our first time at this hotel. We chose it because we had tickets to a Broadway show, and wanted to be within walking distance. For that, the Iroquois is an excellent choice. W. 44th Street is a quieter (by NYC theater district standards) street, but easy walking to all of the theaters. The rooms (we had two) were small but very nicely furnished. The bellhop told us that they had been recently renovated. They each came with a free bottle of wine!The hotel lobby has a little side room (they call it the Library) where they had free coffee or hot apple cider for guests. The hotel has it's own restaurant (we did not eat there, so no opinion on that), and there are numerous other restaurants in the area. All told, I would recommend the Iroquois if you need to be near the theater district, and want a relatively low key, friendly place to rest during your NYC adventures.

We stayed here for Christmas...excellent hotel - small, quiet, intimate and great location to all the midtown activities but away from the chaos. Had read many super reviews about the outstanding service, and can confirm they are totally accurate and well earned. Will absolutely stay here again!

Great location for access to the sights in mid-Manhattan, such as, Christmas windows, the Rockets, Chelsea Market, and Bryant Park with the Christmas market. Hotel is also near a variety of eating establishments with wide range of prices.

The hotel Iroquois is perfectly located in the Times Square area. The staff were all courteous professional and friendly. Especially Amanda and Shade. It was a true pleasure dealing with them. I would go there every time for business and pleasure

My mom and I stayed here for 3 nights for her 80th birthday trip to NYC and it couldn't have been any better. The hotel is incredibly comfortable and quiet but just a quick walk to lively Times Square and Theater District. As perfect as the hotels is the staff is even more incredible. Every person was kind and made us feel like VIPs. Skip the hotel restaurant for dinner (food is super expensive and not great) but the ambiance is stunning so worth stopping in for drinks before heading out to see the city. Definitely 100% recommend.

We loved the hotel. We loved the service. Everyone was super friendly and helpful with everything. There are no ice machines and they even offered to bring some up for us free of charge. They also offered to heat up some leftovers for us as well. The daily hot apple cider was so nice to come back to after a cold winter day. Highly recommend trying it. The only complaints were that we were suppose to be offered an upgrade and were not. The room was smaller than i thought it would be but all the closet and dresser space was awesome. The turndown service and nightly chocolate with weather for the next day was super cute and nice. Would recommend anyone to stay here.

Have been to NYC many times and we have decided this is our new favorite place to stay. We have stayed here the last two times we have traveled to NYC. Truly great experience. The rooms are clean and well appointed. They have heated tile floors in the bathroom! The beds are great. They go out of their way to help. Took the tour that they offered and that was great too! Ideal location. There is no 6 star button..... otherwise they would get this too. If the continental breakfast, is included it is well worth it!

This was our first stay at The Iroquois and we were delighted. We previously stayed at a hotel across the street, but wanted to try a different one for this stay. The check-in staff was kind and helpful, very welcoming. There are two elevators for more expedient service to and from your room. The hallways are quiet, as is the room. We had almost no noise, save for the occasional, muted siren. We had no difficulty sleeping. For a NYC hotel, the room was adequately large. The bathroom had heated floors, the guest towels were luxuriously thick, and there were plenty of in-room amenities. The hair dryer was full-size and had 6 different options. There was an in-room mini-bar fridge and they left a small bit of space for guests to use OR you could call the front desk and they'd bring a fridge just for you. Turn-down service was excellent and everyone who worked in the hotel went out of their way to ensure we had a good stay. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but we did have a drink at Lantern's Keep. It was something we'd only do once -- the cocktails were $19 each (we each had a Gin & Tonic). The drinks were good, but $19 each was a bit steep. Overall, it was an excellent experience and we'd definitely do it again.

I honestly cannot fault this hotel!Spotlessly clean, with polite and helpful staff and a quiet, refined atmosphere. It is perfectly placed as it is literally in the heart of everthing, but still feels like a cosy little bolt-hole as soon as you're inside. It's calming, comfortable, convenient and stylish.You can keep to yourself, or wander down to the very good bar (there's actually two, and we liked the restaraunt bar best) and chat with many guests who are on their third, fourth or fifth stay at this well kept secret of a place.Gregory's coffee right across the street and the red flame diner a couple of doors down make it easy to set yourself up for a day in the city, while the complimentary hot drinks in the lobby make it the perfect place to come back to when you've worn yourself out.We had room 908 (family room with two double beds) and it was perfect for our needs.The beds are comfy, the bathroom was amazing and the room itself was well sized and looked fantastic (we're actually still here! I'm writing this review lying in bed after a great nights sleep and waiting for my my wife and daughter to wake up!)You don't really get a view with this hotel, and in our opinion that small fact isn't enough to detract from the many wonderfull things that this place has to offer.We looked at lots of hotels prior to trip, and we've spent the last few days walking past the other choices we rejected and just nodding at each other because we know we made the right choice!To all the staff of the Iroquois (Amanda, Joanna, Billy, Seth, JJ, Bill and Thomas to name but a few)Thanks for making our trip really special.We'll definitely be back.

Excellent service, clean rooms, elegant food, relaxed ambiance. This is an ideal midtown location for vacation or business. The hotel team is attentive, not annoying. Rooms are clean, well appointed. Enough storage for clothes, enough outlets for devices, great beds.

My first time at this property and I was very pleased. I like the feel of the property very much. The rate was a phenomenal bargain for pre-Christmas in NYC. My room was a bit small but very nicely appointed and daily service was excellent. Bellman John was exceptionally personable and helpful throughout my stay.Front desk staff also.

Truly an amazing hotel experience, I had requested a couple items for my wife’s birthday and they went above and beyond what I asked for. It was awesome! Location could not be more perfect either. We will be back!

I spent two nights at the Iroquois in mid-December. Its location is excellent. I walked everywhere—to the theater, my favorite restaurant 44 and X, Macy’s, Saks, etc. The Red Flame diner is about 2 minutes away for a quick, reasonably priced meal. I have nothing but praise for the bellmen, the folks at the front desk, and the friendly and competent concierge. By the way, when he’s off duty, the front desk folks step right up. Although my room was small (Fine for me since I was only there to sleep), it was clean, quiet, and appropriately furnished. The bath was fine—and I promptly ordered my own Frette towels when I got home. This was my second stay at this hotel and I’ll be back! I particularly appreciated the hot apple cider in the library when I returned from shopping!

We moved to the Iroquois due to a reservation mix up at another hotel. What a find! The location and accommodations were excellent. All of the staff were so personable and hospitable making the hotel a home away from home for our 6 day family visit to NYC. After breakfast on the first day, I told the front desk that I was going to walk up the 12 flights of stairs for exercise. After I started my climb, one of the front desk staff took the elevator up and met me at floor nine with a bottle of water and "only three more floors to go!" This hotel is a favorite!

My sister and I enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Iroquois Hotel this December. I would not hesitate to recommend this lovely little gem to anyone looking for a comfortable, clean & friendly stay in NYC. I will definitely be back!

Perfect little boutique hotel that more than met our needs. Great location to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Broadway. But enough away from the crowds and lights. Rooms were perfect. Beautiful linens and toiletries made for luxury feel. Beds were very soft and had great pillows. Turn down and chocolates were very nice. Concierge exceeded in helping meet our needs and everyone there was always very pleasant and first rate. The hot apple cider every afternoon was a treat. They go about and beyond with special things like that. We will go back and stay there again and again. So much better than the big chains that feel so impersonal.

great location of hotel. Hotel is small is it is more of a boutique hotel. Very "homey" feel.. Rooms are very clean, bed is comfortable. Rooms are small, however, this is NYC. It was perfect as were not in the room very much. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Our second Christmas season shopping trip staying at The Iroquois. Excellent location mid point between Rockefeller Ctr and Times Sq. Easy walk to both along with restaurants and Broadway shows. Hotel service is good starting with bellmen who greet you at curb (Carlos and JJ are standouts) to front desk team (Ana a standout) to the housekeeping team. Concierge Bill gave us good restaurant tips and secured great Hello Dolly tickets for us.Hotel recently renovated the rooms...very nice European feel....especially the Frette sheets and towels!

Our first trip to NYC was even more wonderful thanks to our stay at the Iroquois Hotel. Perfect location, sparkling clean and comfortable rooms as well as friendly and helpful staff. We can’t wait to return!

A wonderful experience and the most pleasant staff we have come across on any if our trips. Shade and Amanda at the front desk were wonderful helping us with a theater ticket mixup that could have been a disaster. Great location, courteous staff, and lovely accomodations made this a memorable trip.

My wife and I were very pleased with all aspects of our stay. The room was very comfortable; we were delighted to be in one of newly updated rooms. All the staff were both helpful and pleasant. All the plusses of staying at a smaller boutique hotel.

Decent hotel. Nice staff. Inadequate sound proofing between rooms. Disturbed my sleep. Can handle sirens and street noise but not coughing and conversations filtering into room like the neighbors were occupants of the same room.

I pay cash and still they charge everything to my credit card. I have been fighting to get my money back, and it has been a nightmare.I arrived 11/21/17 and departure 25/11/17, room 208I have my printed receipt were it clearly says I paid cash $1,288.98 and still they charged to my credit card. I have been calling the hotel and are continuously denying the charge.I will NEVER consider again unless they repair the damage immediately.My trip was great, but your felony is BIG.

location is wonderful. close to subway, train station theater district, fifth ave. An extremely comfortable hotel in all respects. staff is warm, helpful and welcoming. did not eat in restaurant. menu looks good but abit overpriced. room rate is high but will worth the the money. we have stayed here multiple times and never disappointed .

The Iroquois is quite the find. I found it through Zagat as one of the top ten best hidden deals in ny. Their best rooms are very reasonable. The hotel is going through a major face lift and the new rooms are beautiful. The beds are are and have always been the most comfortable with the nicest sheets and fluffy down pillows. They do un feathered as well. The restaurant is one of the top french restaurants in the city. We have been staying for years and wouldn't go anywhere else. it is our home away from home.

Wonderful hotel! Very nice rooms, fantastic location!! The staff could not have been more friendly and courteous!! Special thanks to the team of AMANDA,ROBYN,SETH, and BILLY!!! Also, concierge on duty was BILL, a huge help with great suggestions. Would definitely recommend this small luxury hotel for your Manhattan visit. Treated us like old friends.

see my comments in the previous section. My stay was very enjoyable. I was very grateful for the kindness and help of the checkin clerk who helped retrieve my wallet lost in the taxi from the airport.
user_name:
Suzanne L
BOCA RATON, United States

review_body: I totally enjoy every stay in this hotel. Never crowded, the best attention and service. The location is quite convenient, as it is close to Times Square and 5th avenue, Its still my favorite in New York.

The hotel was working perfectly on all levels. Lobby staff and front desk were extremely gracious. Triomphe provided a great atmosphere and menu. Great service staff at breakfast and dinner. My suite was very clean and comfortable.

The room was small (cozy), but a queen bed it was fine for us! The bathroom was also small but the shower was large! The toiletries was awesome. The room didn't was a view, but the room was bright. The price at over $500 is a lot, but December is a pricey time.

Great location, comfortable and welcoming, rooms are always ready for you and it really is a great place to come to at the end of a tiring day. Would recommend for business or recreation. The staff know how to make your stay memorable!

Amanda Scalzo was fantastic. Tended to our every need promptly and with a smile. I would return in a heartbeat. I think the lounge is a little overrated and overpriced with some crazy rules but I am now being hypercritical

The Iroquois Hotel is top notch. We have stayed here several times and they always go above and beyond to make your stay the best it can be. Anna worked especially hard to get us a wonderful room and rate. Our room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable and quiet. The front desk is also very helpful with restaurant suggestions and directions. We love everything about the Iroquois and will continue to return.

Classy Hotel with all the necessary amenities. The room was comfy and quiet, located at the back, so the outside noise was virtually blocked out. Staff was friendly and helpful. Great choices for breakfast, if a tad pricey. Location on 44th Street makes it a great choice for a city stay. Very satisfied overall and will probably stay there again.

This is a wonderful hotel. Heated tile bathroom floor. Chocolates on the bed each night. Wonderful breakfast. Top Notch staff. From entrance to exit. Will definitely be back my next trip to New York City

This hotel is always great. Clean, quiet, great staff and lovely decor. Given we were in the middle of Manhattan at the most crowded time of the year, the room was amazingly quiet. Beds were also very comfortable.

Great location if you want to be close to Times Square, 5th Avenue and the Theater District but don’t want the crowds and noise of staying right in it. Rooms were small and had no view but that’s what you have located on a side street. Staff extremely polite, friendly and accommodating.

We stayed at The Iroquois for four nights at the beginning of December to celebrate our wedding anniversary. While the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly from the outset, we were initially disappointed with our room. When my husband discussed this with the staff, we were most impressed with the swift response of management. Our room was switched to a room on the 11th floor (#1100) which was beautifully decorated with a great view of the Chrysler building. In addition, the staff went above and beyond to make our stay memorable by leaving chocolate dipped strawberries in our room. A special mention must go to Bill, the concierge, who was most pleasant and helpful. We had breakfast at the hotel three of the four mornings and it was excellent with a wide variety of items on the menu. The hotel is perfectly located, a short walk from Time Square, Fifth Avenue, the Empire State Building and Radio City. I couldn’t recommend this hotel highly enough.

The Iroquois Hotel was a pleasant surprise since this was our first trip to NYC. The friendliness of the staff and the attention to detail, such as the delivery of a special birthday fruit tray and wine, made this experience a memorable one! The hotel is perfectly located - one block from 5th Avenue, two blocks from Times Square, minutes from Rockefeller Plaza and St. Patrick's Cathedral. We can't wait to go back; well done Iroquois Hotel!

The staff could not be nicer and the room was fabulous. One of the best hotel showers out there! Bill provided excellent restaurant recommendations and provided us with a car to the airport. Front desk was beyond accommodating and they greeted us each time we entered or left the lobby. Breakfast was very good and the entire experience exceeded our expectations. Won't stay anywhere else in NYC!

I went with a friend, and we booked a 2 queen bed room. It was, nice, clean and quiet. The staff were awesome, and it was nice to have a bar right downstairs. It is in a great location, near Bryant Park and Times Square.

In my view you will not be disappointed , location fabulous - boutique feel - incredible staff Very good experience Few small misses that prevented it from being great , in fairness I have Very high expecatations and am a hotel snob ! Overall I would say it was very good and if you like small feel boutique hotels , this is needed a wonderful choice

We visited New York on 25th November for a six night stay at The Iroquois hotel in midtown Manhattan. Having stayed at the hotel in previous years we were expecting the usual excellent level of service and accommodation. We were not disappointed and we were very impressed with the recent upgrades to the premium king room in which we stayed. As usual all of the in house staff were friendly, welcoming and very helpful when information was required. We would highly recommend the hotel and hope to return soon.

We had a good time here before Christmas and everything is so nice at the hotel. we were regret that we did not stay longer but we had another trip to start so hopefully we can come back in spring 2018.Thanks for your outstanding services and we always enjoyed our stay. Loan and Ted

This hotel has a great location and very professional, helpful and pleasant staff. During our stay, various problems occurred with the elevator, the Wi-Fi and room noise. Maybe this is just Typical of the midtown New York City experience, but it did not help us in our business meeting with international guests.

The Iroquois is a great hotel in a great location. It is very centrally located to all the major areas - Times Square, Theater District, shopping at Macy's, NY Library, Central Park as well as Penn Station and Grand Central. The staff was very nice and welcoming. Everyone was really friendly and very helpful. The room we had was beautiful and immaculate with heated tile floors in the bathroom. I hope to stay at this hotel again on my next visit to NY. Everything was perfect!

We went to NYC to watch the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. The hotel is just a short cab ride or 10 minute walk from Grand Central. Check-in was quick and the staff very pleasant. Our floor was remodeled in the summer and was equipped with the latest amenities. (The bathroom has a heated floor). Times Square is just a short walk away.The staff was always there to answer question about the area. I would recommend the Iroquois to anyone going to NYC and needing to stay near the theater district or midtown. We plan on coming back whenever we need to stay overnight in NYC.

The hotel was conveniently located to shopping, Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park and Grand Central. Our room was recently done over including the bathroom. I would highly recommend the Iroquois Hotel.

Staff took excellent care of us & made sure we were well taken care of inside & outside hotel. Much appreciated. Transportation was arranged to & from JFK. Restaurants took extremely good care of us. Very convenient area is Broadway or Times Square is where you will be

I have stayed in many New York Hotels. The Iroquois was one of the less expensive ones but really delivered. I had a premium king room which is I believe the largest king room. I like quiet hotel rooms and these rooms face the back. I stayed four night and had a great sleep each night and I'm a light sleeper. Coffee in the morning in the lobby and hot apple cider at night were great touches. The bar serves very good small plated food. Staff was very friendly, housekeeping did a great job and they have a nice practice of putting a card where you insert the key card telling you to call down when you want your room made up if your do not disturb sign is on.The only negative is that the room did not have an armchair in it, just a desk chair so there was really no place comfortable to sit except the bed. I didn't find this a problem but if you want a sitting area you might consider a suite. I would stay here again.

the staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was very clean & the beds very comfortable. The hotel was in a fantastic location & so convenient to so many attractions & close to subway stations

The Iroquois was a great choice for our trip to NY. The rooms, although small, were clean, very comfortable, quiet and met our needs. The location was perfect. We were able to walk to the theater, Time Square, Bryant Park and Grand Central for easy access to subways for heading to lower or upper Manhattan. I look forward to staying at the Iroquois in the future.

We had a wonderful 4 nights at the Iroquois. The hotel is very well situated for theatre lovers and there are many fine restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. The room while small is tastefully decorated and very comfortable.

Fantastic location, Fantastic service, Fantastic team. Couldn't ask for anything more in a NYC downtown hotel. From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave, you are not just a guest you are made to feel like you are their most important guest. Keep it up.
