We have been staying at Iroquois Hotel for 5 years and the staff and location makes this the best boutique hotel in the city!! We would not stay anywhere else!! Where else can you walk to any type of venture from dining, shopping, sightseeing, and broadway plays!! Just the best!!!

I love the atmosphere of the property. It seemed to have its own sense of history and charm. The location was walking distance from New York's entertainment and pounding pulse of the city. The staff (particularly Seth the bellman) made our stay all the more memorable. We sought to reward him before we left, but he wasn't on duty at check out time. But don't worry sir, we will be back! The Iroquois is my new home away from home... and I look for to coming home again.

The Iroquois has a perfect location to 6th Avenue Businesses and to Broadway. It is extremely clean and the staff are fantastic. The restaurant is lovely and quaint. The rooms were very small and the bathrooms are very small but it was the most quiet room I have ever had in a NYC hotel.

We spent our anniversary weekend in NYC, and booked the Iroquois as our weekend getaway. It was delightful. Although the room was on the small side, which we expected, check-in was easy-peasy, everything about our room was neat and clean and the help throughout, from bellmen to concierge to the wait staff and expert mixologist in the Lantern's Keep (the cute little bar/former speakeasy in back, just off the lobby) was delightful.All in all, The Iroquois made our anniversary weekend more special than it would have been on its own.

Renovated room so great bed and setting. Small room though.Breakfast was expensive and not so great in quality. Dinner is the same, a little better but expensive. Location is amazing, small street right next to Times Square.

On a business trip to New York, I stayed at this hotel from the 13th until the 17th November 2017. I had often wondered what this hotel was like, having regularly stayed at other properties in the same street. The reception staff were welcoming and efficient and checked me into a twin room on the twelfth floor, the top floor of the hotel. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated with dark wood and dark wooden blinds. The bathroom had a tub and a shower and the overall impression was that the hotel had been recently renovated. I used the hotel restaurant only for breakfast where service was fast, helpful, but friendly and where the cost was reasonable. On departure, the concierge was very helpful in storing my luggage and in finding me a yellow cab for my trip to the airport.As I was staying at the hotel for more than three nights, I was given Amex cards for $25 per night which I was free to use how I wished, including against my hotel bill.My stay at this hotel was very pleasant and achieved my wish to be at a boutique establishment. It has all of the facilities of a much larger hotel, but with very good service and staff who care about knowing their customers and giving excellent service. I will definitely stay here again.

An excellent location and small boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan . The front desk staff and concierge were so helpful and friendly. The bell staff was protective of guests, and very helpful at all times. The hotel is clean and rooms are lovely. Nice , quiet breakfast room and lovely bar area. No complaints at all, and would definitely stay here again!

The Iroquois New York is an excellent choice for a stay in New York. The location is excellent within easy walking distance of Times Square and Broadway. Thank you to Oliver and JJ and the rest of the staff for making our 12 day holiday in New York the best ever. I would thoroughly recommend the Iroquois. The rooms are well equipped and the beds the comfiest I have ever slept in. The staff really looked after us and nothing was too much trouble for them. We look forward to staying at the Iroquois the next time we are in New York.

Great location. Close to Times Square and the theater district, yet far enough away from the crowds. Close to GCT and Bryant Park. Plenty of nearby quality restaurants and shopping. Small room but very comfortable and well appointed. Loved the heated bathroom floor! Great on cold mornings.Quiet, just right!

Close to all the activity yet located on a quiet street. Old feel New York Hotel with luxurious rooms and beds. Very clean and up-dated. Wonderful staff to assist in your needs. Lively bar for signature cocktails and restaurant on site.

Great hotel with newly renovated rooms, confortable beds, and reasonably priced for a NYC hotel near Times Square. The bar at this hotel is the reason to stay. Natalia and Daniel are absolutely the best at making delicious cocktails.

The Iroquois is an excellent place to stay in New York City. The location is excellent and convenient to most of the major sites in the city. The staff is excellent and the accommodations are very comfortable. If you need advice on your visit, the concierge is superb.

Enjoyable hotel at a great location for the theatre and to embark on downtown and uptown sites.The hotel staff is very nice. The breakfasts, though not included, are quite good. For the location the value is there.

The Iroquois is an excellent small and intimate hotel, and so convenient to everything, including theatre.Staff was professional and helpful. Room and all public areas were clean and inviting. I would highly recommend it.

Great location, rooms very tiny but this is NYC, Bathroom is very clean but too small to have 2 sinks or more counter space. I would have enjoyed 2 chairs nothing to sit on, had to sit on the beds. Grat for 2 guest ONLY

The Good: location, excellent staff, nice toiletries, comfortable bed & good linensThe Not So Good: Small rooms, miniature bathrooms, room ventilation fans that sound like jet engines, small lobby, weak wifi, no coffee in room, hard to get ice

This hotel ticked all the boxes for me. We arrived early in the morning & the hotel was more than accomodating to hold our luggage. The staff were more than helpful in directing my wife &I me to points of interest. Rooms although on the smallish side (typical Nyc) were comfortable,clean &I provided a closet for clothes & luggage. I would go back to this hotel again. Service,sleep quality & value excellent.

I had expected more. Everything looked good online but the hotel felt tired. My room was small and the carpet felt dirty.I could not properly change the temperature in the room which was true also for the shower.Room service foos was good however.

Ideally located for Times Square(5 min), Empire State(15 min), Central Park (15 min) and 5th Avenue(2 min) . Room was ideal - two double beds for three. Clean with comfortable beds. Pillows are best we've experienced. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Great diner close to the hotel - open all day. Used it for breakfast - big portions with never ending coffee refills.

Rooms are very well appointed. We had a double room for three people and loved the ease of access in and out of the Iroquois. The hot cider in the library is a fantastic touch to chip off the cold in December.

Character hotel in good location, very clean when visiting New York ,, self parking rightacross the Rd . Handy to metro & Time Square & shopping. Staff weren’t that friendly except for door man & concierge . Breakfast okay but expensive for what it was.
user_name:
Celia V
New Plymouth, New Zealand

review_body: Stayed here for a get away theater weekend in New York and very happy we did. Great location within walking distance of everything in mid town and the theaters. Welcoming door and front desk staff at this boutique hotel. We booked a slightly larger room at a slightly larger price and glad we did. Very quiet, clean and comfortable, but as things go in NYC, compact. Did not eat in the hotel, but there is a small restaurant tucked in to the lobby that serves breakfast and dinner. The compact lobby also has a small sitting room with coffee and fruit and a small, but hopping bar at the rear. We found a very friendly diner, The Red Flame, about 5 doors down that was our breakfast go-to; fast, good food at a great price.

Wonderful hotel, perfect location, excellent service! We are always loyal to this gem when visiting NYC! Rooms are nicely appointed and newly renovated. Book the James Dean Suite if possible. Won’t be disappointed!

Wonderful hotel! Close to everything without being too close. Time square is within a couple of blocks, Grand Central is within a couple of blocks. The hotel is beautiful and cozy. Get atmosphere excellent bar.

The Iroquois is our go-to hotel when visiting NY. The location is perfect, the hotel is lovely, small and intimate with wonderful rooms and amenities. The staff is fantastic, always pleasant and helpful. The redone guestrooms are a delight. Love this hotel!

Love this little jewel of a hotel in a quiet part of town so close to theater and fine dining. Coffee shop and parking directly across the street plus a sweet little bar and award winning restaurant on premises. Lovely staff. Thanks for the birthday treat.

Very satisfied with the service. Front Desk and bellboys were very friendly and helpful. Be aware that full wifi service is with pay. Basic is for free. The room was adequate although a large garbage can was needed as well as more hangers. The knob of the bathroom door fell off the first night we were there. The front desk became aware of the problem at check out.Location was excellent. In the heart of Midtown, near theaters and restaurants. Fifth ave, a stone's throw away as Times Square. Nice for family and business.

Although the rooms are small, the friendliness and courtesy of the staff make up for it. Everyone was incredibly professional and seemed very invested in making sure our stay was a good one. The location is central, and yet the rooms are quiet and the beds are very comfortable.

Amazing stay in the IroquoisThe whole staff was great especially Billy and Shade at front desk, Doris as housekeeper.They always made sure our comfort was optimum, always helped a lot with a great efficiency and kindness.The Iroquois provides a great level of services, it is very clean and well kept, the location is perfect.It was a true miracle finding this hotel after having refused a crap apartment from Airbnb.I was travelling with my wife, kids and in-laws. All are exigent clients and were really pleased by our stay.Thanks to the whole team!Jerome

Our time at the Iroquois in early October was an absolutely wonderful experience! I have only very rarely experienced anything like the level of kindness and care at a hotel that was so unfailingly provided us at the Iroquois. Heartfelt congratulations to all the staff for achieving such a superb standard of service and hospitality on every level! Our every encounter with Iroquois staff was a happy and memorable one, and there are many individuals deserving of appreciation here. But number one is certainly Shade - who from our exceptional check-in experience to our departure proved to be a real star and a truly exemplary host who made us feel at once that the Iroquois was our home away from home. Likewise, Christoph was also a marvellous host at reception. Lirim and John at the front door deserve huge thanks and special appreciation for their kindness, too.  Can't wait to return soon!

The rooms are clean and comfortable at the Iroquois. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit small and do not have in room coffee or tea service. Avoiding rooms on the street side would be helpful to visitors due to night and early morning noise—seek interior rooms.

We love the proximity to the theatre district, and yet being far enough away from the madness of Times Square. All guests are treated with warmth, courtesy and respect. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, especially with the recent renovations, which are up to date, and yet still comfortable and cozy. It truly is our home away from home.

The newly remodeled Iroquois hotel is clean, conveniently located, and with an outstanding staff. In addition their colocTed restaurant, Triomphe, serves wonderful food.They offer a free walking tour of the local area, led by StreetwiseNewYork, which was excellent. All in all a comfortable place with a friendly atmosphere.

We stayed at the Iroquois New York for six nights at the end of October. The hotel is a classic boutique hotel in mid-town Manhattan. It's location on West 44th St. between 6th and 5th Avenues is ideal for exploring all that Manhattan has to offer - close to Times Square but far enough away from its craziness. The Iroquois belongs to the Small Luxury Hotel group and is consistent with the group's high standards. Of particular note is the staff's friendliness and willingness to serve. Seth, the Doorman/Bellman addressed my wife and I by name the second time we saw him. The front desk staff were quick to say hello and offer us water or fruit whenever we walked by. Mid-Manhattan hotels are famous for small rooms and when we first arrived our room was recently remodeled but definitely on the small side. When we mentioned the next day our disappointment with our room size the Front Desk staff (Billy and Front Desk Manager Amanda) arranged for us to move into a much more spacious room of the same category. Instead of a window overlooking an alley and the back of another building, the new room had a street view which also allowed us to see the top of the Chrysler Building (which lit up at night). The room interior (both rooms) was very clean and the remodel was quite pleasing. The bathroom was well lit (a big plus) and the turn down service was an an added benefit. There was the classic mini-bar with just a little space for personal items to keep cold. The hotel did offer (if requested) a separate small refrigerator to be brought to the room.Overall, the Iroquois was an ideal location for a Mid-Manhattan stay. The proximity to the subway allowed us to get around the city easily (we used a weekly subway/bus pass to go all over) and the theater district/Times Square was an easy stroll. We will definitely consider the Iroquois for our next Manhattan visit.

We have stayed at quite a few hotels in Manhattan and this is our favorite. Quiet, comfortable, convenient and easy. Having a comfy lobby with newspapers and beverages as well as an on-site breakfast option (reasonable price for NYC) was especially nice given the rainstorm we experienced while visiting. We will likely stay here again next time we are in town.

Quaint hotel with very nice, efficient staff. Enjoyed our stay but felt the housekeeping service was below par. Also, complimentary tea and coffee only available in paper cups in foyer which was annoying,

Great location, excellent service, everything you need for a relaxing stay in the heart of Times Square. The room was very well appointed and the bed extremely comfortable. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Well worth a visit

This was our fourth visit; we hope to repeat/return every year.Great location a few blocks away from the noise of Times Square, lovely hotel, excellent service.We are never disappointed. Ask for a quiet room if you're a light sleeper!

Love this boutique hotel in midtown... special treats as it was my birthday. Within walking distance of lots of great places. Received an unexpected upgrade as well as chocolate covered strawberries. Careful of the bar if you are more than a party of four.

The Hotel Manager and his staff are outstanding! True professionals and honest! I hope to stay at The Iroquois in the future. I enjoyed my room, however, I truly needed a lamp at the desk. The bathroom was nice. The bed was comfortable.

I was in New York for my daughters birthday. We stayed at the Iroquois that weekend after changing from another hotel that we did not like. Everything was perfect, the room was spotless the service was incredible and the location ideal. The staff is so kind and helpful and the concierge was very nice. Amanda at the front desk was so lovely, helpful, incredible person and really made it perfect for us.. Shade was also just as wonderful and warm and they even had a beautiful birthday platter sent to our room for my daughter.It was oustanding. They really made it special for us. Thank you very much for this magical weekend! Can't wait to come back :)))

Lovely hotel in a great location in Midtown Manhattan. Perfectly placed for all the major sights, it's an easy walk to the Empire State Building, Grand Central, Rockefeller Centre, Central Park, Times Square etc. The subway station at Bryant Park is 2 minutes away. The hotel itself is fairly small (which we liked) with very helpful and friendly staff. As is typical in New York the room wasn't large but it had excellent A/C, comfortable beds and was spotlessly clean. The negatives were limited to the rather dull room decor (too much beige and brown!) and the somewhat eye-watering prices for breakfast and a drink in the bar ($25 and $18 respectively), though I can hardly blame the hotel for the terrible exchange rate.

We enjoyed our stay. Our premium room was comfortable and spotlessly clean. Room service was excellent and turn down service ensured that rooms were kept to a high standard and towels were regularly replaced and high standards maintained. The underfloor heating in the bathroom was a real luxury. Sleep quality was good. Reception staff was welcoming, helpful and efficient; umbrellas were offered when it rained. We can recommend this hotel.

Small, intimate hotel in the bustling midtown district. Very helpful staff and an absolutely perfect location for tourists. The Lantern’s Keep is an amazing experience with some of the best cocktails I’ve ever tasted.

The Iroquois hotel is well presented and provides exactly what it says on the tin. Not spectacular and a little over priced but very well located within Manhatton, especially if able to explore on foot, you are well rewarded. The staff are friendly and very helpful, always looking to help maximise your stay. Overall a good hotel which is a great base for exploring New York City and as such would recommend highly.

I recently stayed three nights at The Iroquois for business, a hotel that has always been on my list to stay at in New York but just never had the opportunity.What can I say, the hotel is simply outstanding and is now my hotel of choice in New York. From check in to check out the staff and the hotel made this stay absolutely perfect.The hotel itself is in a perfect location for seeing and doing everything you want to in the city. There is a bar and restaurant onsite that can take care of everything you need if you don't want to wonder out or just tired at the end of a long day. The staff make you feel at home and the size of the hotel is perfect for a "homey" place to stay away from home which makes the difference on a business trip and something I look for in every city I travel. Everything is perfectly maintained and spotless, from the room to the hallways to the lobby you can really tell that taking care of the hotel is a first priority.The room was outstanding, it felt like it was new and was very functional and comfortable. The bed was perfect for a great night sleep with top quality linens and towels (I really wanted to take the bathrobe but didn't, it was so awesome). The climate control was perfect, I like a cold room to sleep and you can definitely get it there and to add to it there is a heated floor in the bathroom !! The rain shower bath was perfect, couldn't ask for anything more from a room, felt like home with little noise from the street.This is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at in New York, just wish I hadn't waited six years to try it, my new home away from home in NY.

Great location, delicious food and super comfortable beds. The staff are warm and welcoming and they treat you like old friends. I send all my colleagues here when they are headed to NYC. It is small so book ahead.
user_name:
F5705OHdonnam
New York City, New York

review_body: Close to Times Square without the noise, with plenty of dining options nearby. Great staff! The room was quiet and the beds were comfortable. Heated floor in the bathroom! I would definitely stay here again on a future visit to NYC.

I had high hopes for this "boutique" hotel. It was disappointing. There are others much better. Keep looking. Make this your last choice only if the others don't come through. If location is critical then go for it, but be prepared to only sleep here. Nothing else.

An excellent overall experience, great location close to Times Square and subway, very good dining on the same street, nicely kept property, comfortable rooms, pleasant staff and Bill H the concierge is top notch.

The Iroquois is an excellent place to stay. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff members are pleasant and helpful. We were particularly impressed with young John. The back bar is charming and Vito--the server--is great. The hotel is close to Broadway (a very short walk) and to Grand Central Station. There is an okay diner on the block and more places to eat dinner on 46th and elsewhere. We saw a few young kids, but this hotel seems more appropriate for couples.

This was our third stay in NYC and I wanted to stay a little further south of Central Park than we normally do. I didn't realize how close to Times Square we were and was worried about the bustle - but it was perfectly out of the way! Walking distance to Macy's and Hell's kitchen for dinner was great and to many other venues of course.The staff were so very nice and accommodating. The room itself was small as I had expected but a little tired as well. The blinds were damaged and the drawers in the dresser would not stay closed with clothes in them so we had to wedge up the front legs. The lighting was quite poor and the shower head was clogged. We did have someone try to fix the shower head and it was a tad better. The bathroom was great otherwise and had a light up vanity mirror - perfect for makeup. There were wine glasses in the room on arrival and then we had to request them everyday thereafter. (it took all of two minutes to have them delivered!) Having said all of that - I understand they are refurbishing the rooms at this time.It was VERY quiet from street noise. All in all a great stay despite the very minor room issues. I would definitely stay here again, wouldn't hesitate.

My wife and I took a brief getaway to the City for our anniversary, inasmuch as NYC was the site of our honeymoon 45 years ago. We chose the Iroquois because we have dined at their restaurant, Triomphe numerous times over the years and have always had positive experiences. Additionally, we read reviews of the hotel, including Conde Naste's very high rating, and decided to try the Iroquois. Our experience, from the reservation to the unexpected upgrade to a suite, exceeded our expectations. The personalized treatment sets this experience apart from that which one may typically receive in a larger hotel. The location is excellent. The suite we had was on a newly renovated floor and was spotless and beautifully decorated. No detail was omitted, including a heated bathroom floor. This boutique hotel is a true gem, as is its restaurant. We will not hesitate to return.

The hotel is at a great location in midtown. This is specially the case if one wants to see a Broadway show. Staff is very friendly and the rooms well appointed. The hotel is very well priced for New York City.

Very clean and comfortable hotel in an excellent location. Staff were friendly, attentive and responsive. Facilities in room could be improved by providing mirror in better location for make-up and hair (my wife had to sit on floor). Also missing tea and coffee making facilities in room.

Its a very good hotel in so many ways; value, service, location, etc. The staff are also helpful and mostly friendly. You felt welcomed. Happy I had chosen this place- especially for first timer visiting the famous NYC!

This is one of the historic grand dame hotels with a comfortable one block walk from TimeSquare. The room was tasteful, spotless, and the bathroom well appointed in marble, although the room was overall on the small side. The staff was always helpful and smiling and efficient. And even the WIFI worked well.

The hotel is just steps away from Times Square, the Theater District and a lot of great restaurants. We couldn't have asked for a nicer place to stay. I'm certain it was a birthday trip that my husband won't forget.

A beautiful and convenient hotel with amenities and helpful staff. The rooms were quiet, clean and comfortable with a beautiful updated bathroom. The restaurant and bar were a delicious treat! I will definitely return to this establishment!

Stayed for 3 nights at The Iroquois last week and we had a wonderful time. It was our first visit to NYC and we're so glad we chose this hotel. From the moment we arrived the staff made is feel very welcome as they were so friendly and helpful. Our room was very small for 3 adults but this wasn't an issue as it was spotlessly clean with very comfy beds and a good size bathroom with a large walk-in shower. The hotel is on a quiet "street" as opposed to one of the "avenues " so although we were less than 2 blocks from Times Square we didn't hear much noise at night and slept really well. We had to check out at 5am and there was someone on the desk and someone else was able to get us a cab to the airport. Thank you Iroquois for making our first visit to New York such an enjoyable experience.

Excellent location but still close to the buzz for daytime. Slept soundly as it was so quiet at night. Close proximity to a fantastic diner for breakfast. So handy for shopping at the wonderful stores in 5th Aven8.

This is a lovely hotel with friendly, helpful professional staff. I stayed here years ago and had great memories of it. I was not disappointed this time. The location is excellent and it has a great cocktail bar.

The location of this hotel is perfect. Five minute walk to Times Square. However, because it is in a quieter side street, you didn't feel like you were in a big city.The staff were always helpful and accommodating. The room was on the small side but clean. A turn down service was also available. There was water in the lobby which could be taken to the room. We didn't have a good view out of room window but that was not an issue. Would highly recommend.

My mom and I traveled to NY to celebrate my birthday. I am so happy we chose The Iroquois! The Iroquois team was amazing - each person we interacted with was helpful, courteous and kind. The services and amenities were excellent. The property location was perfect - convenient and easy to navigate! I would recommend the Iroquois to anyone and would come back.

I just love this hotel. Although it is located in the Times Square neighborhood, it is an oasis of peace and tranquility. The staff are very courteous, kind and professional. Several flights were canceled, including mine, on the day of departure and the staff went out of their way to assist stranded passengers in any way they could. The culture created here is one of caring and compassion. Everyone was so willing to be of assistance. Bravo Iroquois staff members!!!!

we couldnt sleep all night there was a terriable noise from the air condition .no other room to give us! we were up all night !!!!!! the room was also noisy from the street below! the water presure in the shower was poor ...do yourself a favour and stay away from here

The Iriquois has great coffee and fruit infused water in the lobby. The staff was friendly and helpful. I had a problem with my key card and new ones were brought to me right away. The shower is great. My view was not good, but I saw a friend's room and the view there was better. the lobby was a nice place to wait for our group to gather before heading out for the day. The hotel has free area tours, but we didn't have time for any.

Over the past fifteen years we have stayed at the Iroquois Hotel in NYC more than twenty times. From these experiences a strong pattern emerges. These people genuinely care about their guests. Yes, the rooms are great and the newly renovated ones are spectacular, but the staff is the key. Alex, one of many on the front desk mangers, is a signature example of how to treat a guest but that is also true of Bill, the concierge, and John, Malik and JJ who handle the doors, bags, and cabs, and it extends to every maintenance technician and housekeeper as well. They all make the stay extraordinarily personal. To us this is a Our most recent visit was in early October and we brought a thirteen year old grandson along as well. From the time we arrived until this very moment he has been persistent in his staunch praise of the hotel and the people working there that he met. He keeps asking how so many people there knew who we are and how did they remember who he was with and his name. We told him to thank the General Manager, Breandan Gallagher, because it is his leadership that ensures that such things happen.The Iroquois’s location is remarkable. It is a few blocks from Times Square, Grand Central Station and Rockefeller Center but because it is on a “Street” rather than one of the heavily trafficked “Avenues” it is not overwhelmed by tourists and an endless parade of vehicles.

The property is well located, only a few blocks away from the Grand Central station. If your activities are in midtown, this hotel provides you with a super convenient access to everything. The room decoration is sophisticated. Chic and nothing loud, but not boring. The lighting in the room was nice. Many spot lightings (vs. few large lamps) so that we could adjust the room brightness/darkness easily and just right. There is a good sound proofing on the wall. We could not hear anything coming through from the next door. However, there were noises coming through from the hallway. We heard a couple of short conversations. Not a huge problem because there are not too many rooms per floor, and the kind of people staying at the hotel are not exactly late night club goers type. The hotel cares about the guests' special occasions. At the turn-down service, they sent us a lovely plate of chocolate-covered strawberries and a bottle of red for our special day. A big thank you for the thoughtfulness! The door staff was swift with our luggages. The coffee service during the day and the infused water in the late afternoon were a nice touch. If we needed to stay in midtown in the future, we will definitely return to the hotel for another lovely experience. Thank you!

My daughter and I had a wonderful stay at The Iroquois Hotel. The location was perfect for our visit. It was easy walk to the Airporter shuttle to JFK. Our room was very comfortable and quiet. We would definitely stay there again.

I had a wonderful stay. From the moment of check-in, the staff was professional, friendly and courteous. The accommodations were clean and properly supplied. Upon check-out, I was able to have my bags stowed to explore the city without the hassle of lugging it around. The hotel is in a centralized location and a couple blocks away from Times Square (enough removed from the crowds).

The Iroquois just gets better. Great location, great value and the best folks welcoming and helping you enjoy your stay. In a very busy section of Manhattan, this is a welcoming oasis. We very much liked the upgrades in our room.

If you're in NYC for theatre, this is top location. All Broadway theatres walking distance. Staff very friendly and helpful. Double room we had plenty big, although very plain; bathroom very nice. Beautiful restaurant and cocktail bar; no more expensive than others in theatre district hotels. Walking distance to Grand Central.

The hotel and the staff never disappoint. It is always a pleasure to return and to be treated as family. Best SLH that I have stayed in. Excellent food, excellent service and the newly renovated rooms are truly modern and chic. Definitely far more closet space than previously experienced in the suite.

The hotel provides a clean and comfortable stay and in close proximity to most attractions and shopping. Walking distance to Time Square and 5th Avenue. The only flip side is that they do not offer a breakfast buffet.

Good location. Small room and bath, which I guess is common in New York. Very nice staff; clean rooms and nice linens. Food very expensive but lovely ambiance. I liked this hotel but must say it is a lot to pay for a small room with little window light, no sitting chair, no in room coffee or fridge. I will say the bed is quite comfy and I slept well and the shower fixtures are good.

While the hotel is quaint, quiet and in a good spot, the room I received was the smallest room I have ever had in NYC. You couldn't open the bathroom door fully as the bed stopped it! I would possible stay there again, but just know to ask for a full size room!

We had an incredible time (five nights) at the Iroquois Hotel. Our room was perfect for the two of us, newly remodeled and very comfortable. The Hotel was located in a great location, easy walking distance from many of the popular sites, including St. Patrick's. We were treated with excellence by the outstanding staff. Can't wait to return!

The Iroquois is a small hotel where you get excellent service by a wonderful staff. The accommodations are very confortable and clean. Although it is close to Times Square you are in a relatively quiet block surrounded by private clubs and other well known hotels. and its location could not be better. If you plan to go shopping you are next to Fifth Avenue.

The upgraded rooms are nice. The other ones are ok ( after experiencing the upgraded ones it's hard to like the others ). Location is near Bryant Park, and Library, great place to Ben on a sunny day. The front desk is friendly the rooms are clean.

I've stayed at this hotel in the past and had a good experience for the money. Nice location. That said, our last stay was really bad. Worst problem was the lack of air conditioning that several guests were complaining about it. Barely slept as the heat was pretty rough given the expectation of air conditioning. Also, the shower had really low water pressure and zero hot water. What was supposed to be a nice weekend ended up being very disappointing. I understand that things break and need to be fixed, but they offered a refund for the night that the system was broken yet never followed through with it. Very disappointed and will not be back.

We are happy that we found Iroquois several years ago. Since that we have always stayed there when visiting NYC. And we were not disappointed this time either. Everything worked well and we got good service.

My wife and I stayed at The Iroquois for 4 nights on our first visit to New York. The location is ideal - central to almost anything. Midtown is more expensive than other areas, but worth the extra price if only staying a few days, so you don't waste time travelling. This is a quaint hotel with friendly and attentive staff. Having selected a single Queen room, it was slightly on the smaller size, but we hardly spent any time in the room. Looked at a King suite for next time and was huge! Looking forward to coming back!!

Favorite hotel in NYC. This was our 4th stay at this hotel. Annual girls getaway. Personal, friendly service as always. Stayed in newly renovated room . ( double double) Beds super comfortable!! Will be back next year!

We spent four nights here and loved the hotel. The location is excellent - right in the heart of Theatre District and a few minutes walk from Broadway, Time Square and 5th Avenue. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. Our room was lovely - large and newly refurbished with a very large, comfortable bed, excellent bathroom, lots of space and storage. The only downside is the lack of comfortable communal space. There is a bar and a small restaurant - which we didn't use - but just a very small central lobby area. For us travelling as a couple, far from a problem and we loved the place.

On a more quiet side street perfectly located between Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and Grand Central, The Iroquois boutique hotel was a stellar find. Floors 7 and up just renovated, with luxe towels and linens, new carpet, gorgeous curtains and bath. All around, very 5-star feel. We got the 1 bedroom suite so our son could stay on the pull-out sofa. All new furniture felt clean and was very nicely appointed. We loved the staff - constantly smiling, helpful, kind. Great value for such a large room and amenities. Will absolutely recommend and return.

This hotel is way beyond special and what makes it that way is its people. They are concerned, professional, sensitive and responsive. The physical facilities are terrific and the location is perfect.

After a lot of research and some recommendations from friends, we went with a booking at The Iroquois. Great choice for us. Pros:The location is nicely situated for most of what you'd like to see and do... close to theater and 5th Avenue shopping, and certainly a long pleasant walk to most everything else. Plus the street it is on is a lovely one, with several interesting buildings, clubs and spots to visit.Newly refurbished rooms provided space for everything we needed. New AC system gave us nonstop 65 degree climate our entire stay - even in the bathroom. The room looked fresh and clean and quite nice. Bedding was great. AND we adored the discreet system on the door with a small toggle that allows a housekeeper to know you wish to be left undisturbed without a sign out front or a knock on the door -- we loved that!Nightly turn down, even when we didn't leave the room until after 7:30 pm. Morning papers on the door. Breakfast delivered right on time - HOT. Plenty of towels. Quick elevators. Quiet hallways. Lovely iced water in the lobby to take with you. This seems to be a small business hotel, with nicely dressed people that were professional and orderly, which we appreciated.Cons:Not much of a view from our room, but it was very quiet!The much ballyhooed "feeling of famly" wasn't anything we felt, but not sure we needed it. No one knew our names, but they were friendly and helpful for sure.We'll definitely recommend and would stay again when we visit the city. We hadn't been to NYC before, but our stay here was certainly part of the successful trip. Next time we'll find time for the sauna and Lanterns Keep!I should also say that we checked in under difficult circumstances -- our credit card had been used fraudulently and was going to be closed. Front desk staff were kind enough to deal with our CC company and make arrangements allowing us to check in before closing the account.... and they helped make sure we got our replacement as soon as it arrived. We appreciated their attentiveness and patience.

Excellent location and good looking small hotel but the air conditioning was incredibly noisy. As was the other noise which included engineers banging on pipes early in the morning outside our 4th floor room. Additional problems with lack of hot water, we were advised to run the tap until it warmed up. 10 minutes later it was warm enough to have a shower. After 2 sleepless nights, the very helpful Shade on reception moved us to a new room at the front of the hotel on the 7th floor. This was a huge improvement yet the air conditioning remained remarkably noisy for a 4 star hotel. And that is the problem - the staff are helpful, the hotel is perfectly located, the bar is very nice but it is in serious need of infrastructure investment in what is a very competitive market.

We booked this hotel due to location. I booked online and chose the premier room, which stated it was bigger than the standard rooms. I proceeded to call the hotel after booking on their website and they advised that I had booked an accessible room, which no where on the website did it state this. I was advised many people book this room and we would be happy. Later I was told at check in, by the front desk clerk herself, that the room isn't nice and we wouldn't have been happy with it.We arrived at 9am to check in and were aware that we would not be given a room until 3pm, which is the standard check in time. The clerk at the desk took our telephone number and advised she would call if it was ready sooner. No call was ever placed and we arrived back to the hotel around 4pm to obtain our room keys. Another front desk agent now advised that the room was not yet ready and that it would be about another 10 minutes. Considering the check in policy is 3pm, I am not sure how that was even possible. We advised her that we were exhausted from travelling and waiting any further was unacceptable. She then proceeded to try and give us another room which was a lower quality then the premier room we had booked. I certainly was not going to receive a lower quality room and pay a higher price for it. The room we received was tiny and had a view of a wall and ventilation system. We were also unable to control the temperature in the room which made for a terrible sleep because it was extremely stuffy and hot. We decided upon initially entering the room that we would be checking out the next day and going elsewhere. Upon check out the price for the room did not match my quoted price given upon booking, but the clerk was unable to figure out a break down of what the 2 days we initially booked would cost. We didn't bother to push the issue as we wanted to just get out of there and we will not be returning.

We thought we would stay at a nice hotel for our 25th Anniversary. Whilst the rooms and the hotel were of a very good standard, the value for money was not. It was not worth the extra cost, when you couldn't even make a cup of coffee in the room, and the TV service broke down for two days, without any guest notification.

This hotel is just a short walk from Times Square and yet a quiet and calm oasis. Many great restaurants nearby, and just around the corner from Bryant Park and Grand Central Terminal. Suggest requesting a room on the back if you don't mind not having a view, as those rooms are extremely quiet. Other rooms we have stayed in are also very quiet, especially by NYC standards. The entire staff are very helpful. Christophe at the front went above and beyond to be welcoming and helpful. We have stayed here before, and would gladly return. Excellent hotel choice!

Perfect location, easy to walk every part of the Manhattan island; rooms need to be improved, need some maintenance; good breakfast selections from the menu (not an open buffet breakfast room), no need to go out for a breakfast; very good and helpful staff - front desk, concierge and waiters.

See my above comments regarding our visit to NYC and our stay at the hotel. The staff, in particular, were very nice to work with, and were quite helpful when issues arose regarding reservations, amenities and room service. I have posted additional remarks in previous sections of my review.

The staff at the Iroquois NY is amazing! Each and every person my sister and I encountered were warm, friendly and extremely attentive. What a wonderful group of people! If you need any help planning something special before you get there, Bill is a great help with concierge services. My sister loved the treats that greeted her when we arrived. The room was very cozy and elegant. We loved the decor, warm bathroom floors, slippers, very comfy beds and great shower. Our room was also very quiet considering all the noise at street level. It is also convenient to all of the common tourist hot spots in mid-town. I definitely recommend this hotel and am so appreciative of the staff we met this past week.

We absolutely loved the location and the hotel. It truly was a hidden gem. The hotel was accessible to everything we needed. Every staff member we encounters was so friendly and helpful. They were truly grateful we selected their hotel. Their pride in the hotel was very apparent.

Shower not working correctly, no TV service, room too small. No communication from staff about TV service until I question about the matter. No following up either. Very disappointed with the stay. Will not coming back.

I visited this hotel for a week. Staff were very friendly and the hotel was well located in Midtown and surprisingly quiet. As is common there were no tea and coffee facilities in room. The bathroom and room were small and functional. Cleaning and catering were good. The hotel let itself down with cold water issues a couple of times and an aircon malfunction. They were renovating the hotel at the time.

The hotel is very nice and the staff is extremely friendly. But the room is - even for NY standards - very tiny.Unfortunately, I did not use the gym and sauna. If there will be another occasion and the rates are acceptable, I sure will stay here again.

This place is in a super location. Don't pass up The Red Flame Diner, three or four doors up the street. We zipped over to the Sondheim Theater to see "Beautiful". Bryant Park is REALLY close, too, and a treat on a nice day.

Lovely staff, attentive, great bed and bathroomSmall hotel but very nice, and good food in the adjacent restaurant that does also the room serviceTerrific location.Would be nice to have a coffee maker in the room but not essential.

Room was unusually large for NYC, very clean and comfortable. On a side street so little noise, very centrally located within blocks of Theater District and Times Square. Very reasonable price compared to higher-end hotels in the area. Very good service. Definitely a good choice.

We spent one night at this hotel. The staff at the front desk were pleasant and helpful. The bed was great for sleeping. The shower was great. It is a very old building but the rooms are updated and clean. The room was very very small. The closet was huge with a window. The price was right and the location was fabulous. No complaints.

Great place to stay! Location is fabulous. The staff is so helpful. Wish we could have done the complimentary walking tour, but did not have enough time. I would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone!

Excellent hotel. Quaint rooms and phenomenal staff. The restaurant and bar was great, but not many choices for a vegan other than salad. The location was perfect for my stay -- walking distance to whatever you need, drug store, restaurants, and groceries. Also close to Bryant Park.

I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel. The staff of the hotel made our stay the most enjoyable stay we've ever had. The moment we arrived we were greeted at the valet by very accommodating bellmen who immediately took our luggage and accompanied us to the front desk where we were greeted by Shade, who was simply the best!!! She made sure she explained everything the hotel had to offer and made sure our reservation process was handled quickly and professionally. It was such a pleasure to see her friendly smile whenever we entered the hotel. The hotel is located in a wonderful spot and the bellmen made sure we had umbrellas when we left for dinner as there was a chance of rain. The hotel offers coffee in the library in the morning and was so nice to see the friendly faces of Shade, the bellmen and the concierge. The bellmen ordered our car to be brought up front upon checkout. There was a parade going on 5th Avenue and a delay to get the car. One of the bellmen went to 6th Avenue to wait for the car while another carried our bags to 6th to receive our car. I don't know of any other hotel, especially in NYC that would be so accommodating. We will definitely be staying at this hotel for all of our weekend stays.We highly recommend this hotel!!
user_name:
Cindy P
Port Chester, New York

review_body: I stayed 2 nights. The Iroquois hotel gave us the best service, me and my wife was completely satisfied.Especially the room was so comfortable and quiet.I will book again if I come to New York next time.

I had the absolute pleasure of staying at one of New Yorks finest boutique hotels, the Iroquois on 49w 44th.With its elegant Art Deco surroundings and exemplary service, this hotel exemplifies nostalgic grace and warmth. The food is excellent and the service unparalleled. From every single front desk person to every single bellman ,this hotel wrote the book on customer service. Hand delivered nightly weather forecasts for the next day along with dark chocolate treats and so much more. A gem located minutes from time square. It's difficult to imagine staying anywhere else.

Part of the Small Luxury Hotels group, the Iroquois is conveniently located, but not quite the luxury experience expected of this affiliation group. The rooms are modern and well furnished, but like the rest of the hotel overwhelmingly gloomy, finished in dark brown. Our rear facing room was quiet though. The public areas are cramped. We only tried breakfast in the hotel, but again a disappointment. The food was not as good as the (much cheaper) Red Flame diner next door and the service was perfunctory. Front desk staff were helpful and efficient but there was no doorman to help with our luggage on arrival. For $400 per night I expect more from a Small Luxury Hotel.

I was very impressed by the staff and amenities offered at the Iroquois. The location is close to the theatre and shopping; near 5th Avenue, Times Square and Central Park. The room was spotless and the beds so comfortable. The bathroom had excellent lighting, great water pressure in the shower and magnifying mirror for make up at eye level. There was also full length mirrors and two closets in our room. The only drawback is that our room and the bathroom was smaller than I am used to. But because of all the amenities and touches and the excellent service of the staff, the small room did not take away from my experience at this hotel. I would definitely return to stay at this hotel in the future.

Our children surprised us with a weekend stay at this hotel for our 40th wedding anniversary. The front desk staff were extremely friendly, helpful, hospitable and professional. The bellman stored our bags while our room was being prepared and brought them up later. Room was spacious, neat and clean. Large bathroom and shower also neat and clean. Our children had them surprise us with a bottle of champain which the had placed in the ice bucket and the hotel also contributed a bottle of pinot noir for us. Wonderfully decorated and great hotel staff. Great locationand a short cabs drive to all sites in NYC.

I travel alone and decided to take a chance booking the Iroquois Hotel for myself while I was in NYC this week - for four nights. I booked in advance and requested a renovated room. I was given the new Deluxe Queen room on the 7th floor. I must tell you, the furnishings are exemplary - modern elegance - the bathroom is not to be believed, very modern with a pull out make-up mirror by the sink wall - the shower is amazing - there is plenty of light in the room - which is very sizeable - and a full length mirror - a huge 40" screen TV - a clock radio, a modern phone - drawers, closet space, robes, a safe for your computer - I can go on and on. And - the best part - the employees - Shade is an incredible, professional, friendly person at the front desk! All the employees are totally fantastic - they made me feel so special that I forgot I was alone! Please do not hesitate to stay here - you must live the experience - I will be back, hopefully for Memorial Day weekend - or sooner - do not go anywhere else - The Iroquois - its location, its beauty, wow - it is family! I am forever grateful to the entire staff and whoever designed the rooms! Thank you! ANN FRIEDMAN

The location of the Iroquois was close to every location we wanted to visit. The front desk staff, concierge and bell men could not have been more accommodating. A truly memorable stay at the Iroquois. We will be back.

Staying in mid town near theater district, you generally have to expect crowds and noise. This little hotel was a nice respite for us. The people are very friendly and professional and our room was quite modern (i've seen some reviews about rooms needing updates, so maybe some do, but ours was quite nice). Like any hotel in Manhattan, try to get a high floor so the noise is mitigated.

With a charming lobby and pleasant guest services, there are many reasons to stay at the Iroquois. They do need to upgrade the room lighting and temperature control. Location is excellent and cost expensive but competitive.

The Iroquois Hotel was one of the best hotels we’ve stayed at while visiting NYC. The staff at the front desk were welcoming and sweet. They were able to safely store our bags before our room was ready and brought them up to our room when we got back. The room came with a complimentary bottle of pinot noir and some chocolate (no special occasion). The rooms were incredibly comfy, the bathroom was luxurious, and there was no sound to be heard even tho you are steps away from the theater district/times square.
user_name:
mhantis
New York City, New York

review_body: From the beginning of our stay, staff was all ways top notch.The bathroom was wonderful with large shower.Best was the linens and the beds - wanted to wrap them upand take them home with me to Atlanta.Was there for US Open Tennis and the theater- Hamilton & Anastasia !Hotel was wonderfully located.What a FABULOUS trip -from Hotel to all that New York has to offer !!

We had a wonderful experience at the Iraquois. Room was comfortable. Staff was beyond wonderful. Location was perfect for our tourism needs. Building is older so rooms are on the small side . But nicely appointed and maintained. Will stay there again.

We are return guests to the Irouois . We love this place .a great location. Wonderful staff..All are very kind specially the front desk and Bill the concierge allways ready to assist.Rooms are very clean .This year we just been twice ( last May)We will return again and again..Ones you stay at the Iroquois you will never look for another hotel in NYC.We thank the Iroquois for beeing so special

Can’t say enough good things about the Iroquois!! The staff is friendly and go above and beyond to do anything for you!! The doormen are excellent and have information about anything you might need. We needed a cab and one man went down to 6th Ave to flag one down for us!!

A hotel experience is made up of many things such as a comfortable bed, safety, cleanliness, staff friendliness etc...This was a great experience from top to bottom. I had a clear explanation at reservations of what to expect and what the hotel offers. My experienced matched the expectation set. I stayed in an executive suite (703) and it was lovely. Nice spacious room, tub and stand up shower, and a nice size living room. It was great to be able to work and watch TV on a really large screen at night and most of the next day. I came in at 8pm, worked until 11pm and worked 7-1pm before going to a meeting. So i spent a lot of time in the room. The location was excellent. It would be a nice sightseeing hotel or a hotel to stay for business in midtown. I had a great check in and the young lady set up a car to pick me up from my meeting and take me to an airport on Long Island. That experience was great, so they showed good judgement and got it set up within 10 minutes of my arrival. I hung my food order on the door and the food arrived the next morning within 2 minutes of my selected time and was cooked exactly as ordered. And finally housekeeping saw me leave the room and walked me to the elevator as we had a nice conversation. It was an excellent experience. If you need to be anywhere near 44th and 5th ave or madison...i would highly recommend The Iroquois.

We were very pleased with our experience at the conveniently located Iroquois. Our Premier King room was quiet and we appreciated the Frette linens and updated style. It was extremely convenient to charge all our electronics due to the clever nightstands and desk with a generous number of built in outlets. We also liked the window treatments that were great at controlling light. Service was wonderful. We felt our business was valued, but most importantly, we found every staff member we encountered to be friendly and helpful. Although there was a discrepancy between the amount we had confirmed and the amount charged at checkout, the front desk promptly refunded the difference once I emailed a screenshot of our confirmation. That illustrates how important it is to keep a picture of that confirmation! We would return to this hotel and would recommend it to others. Just remember to keep a screenshot of that confirmation!!!
user_name:
SANDRA G
Portland, City of Roses

review_body: Great service and friendly staff. Ideal location. Comfy beds and nicely appointed rooms. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking to stay in New York. The staff are exceptionally helpful and always made you feel welcomed.

The Iroquois was centrally located for everything we wanted to do on this trip into the city. We walked to Madison Square Garden, The Highline walk/park, Central Park, Gulliver 's Gate, and a great Japanese restaurant right across the street. I think the staff was very pleasant and helpful and The hotel has a lot of character. We didn't get to use the gym.

We had a great stay at the Iroquois. Christoph at the front desk was so helpful and had chocolate covered strawberries and wine left in our room to celebrate my husband's 30th birthday. We really appreciated the extra service and it made the weekend really special. The location is great; easy walk to Times Square and many other attractions. Our room was clean and comfortable. John took care of our bags at check in and was also very nice and helpful. Would absolutely recommend!

I first want to compliment the staff of the Iroquois. From Christoph, the Front Office Assistant Manager to Carlos who handles the bags and works the front door, to the housekeeping staff, they are all awesome. I don't care what you need or are looking for they are there to help. From reservations, to a map, to transportation, they are all there to assist you. The hotel itself it fantastic from the lobby to the room. It's a quiet oasis in the middle of Manhattan. You are near Times Square, the Theaters, restaurants, bars, sight seeing opportunities, and if you can't walk there then the subway is right there. Cant find your way just ask the staff, they will get you there. The rooms although the typical NY small were fantastic. They appeared to be recently updated or just kept in primo condition. Neat clean, and sure comfy beds and pillows. They left a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates for us! Nice touch. The place is a quiet sanctuary is the middle of all that famous NYC madness. Go out enjoy the city knowing that at the end of the day you can retreat to the Iroquois and be taken care of by the best staff I have ever experienced at a hotel. To the General Manager of the Iroquois, you are to be complimented on your staff and your hotel. I will make this spot the only place I stay in the City ( I have stayed in quite a few in NYC) whether I am here for business or pleasure. Thank you for a great weekend.

Great hotel and perfect location for all your adventures. The hotel is spotless and the team want to help and look after your every need. Thank you to Brendan and the team at The Iroquois. If we return to NY, we know where to stay...

We spent one night in The Iroquois and our stay was fantastic. The hotel is superbly located, but is a quite haven. The service of the staff was excellent and they were extremely helpful with very helpful tips. Would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Superb service and comfort. Everyone was so helpful and accommodating. Location between 5th and 6th is ideal. Concierge helped me greatly by confirming tickets that I had to an event which put me at ease.

When we chekced in, there were some request omission, bathtub and refrigerator.But the hotel stuff and manager were very kindness to us and quickly arranged to replace the room. And they also responded to our several sudden request.

Thoroughly enjoyed our long weekend in NYC thanks to the location of this marvellous hotel. All staff were courteous and very helpful, especially the concierge who sorted out a boat trip for us. Room was spacious and surprisingly quiet.
user_name:
gregoryupnorth
La Colle sur Loup, France

review_body: Excellent hotel! The staff was very friendly and helpful. They held our luggage before our room was ready and called to let us know we could get in our room. The room was very clean. The floors in the bathroom were heated! They also have water, tea, and coffee out. Perfect stay!

Great place to stay especially for first time New York visitors. Location was great and within 7-15 mins walk to some of the tourist spots like Times Square, Broadway, and Bryant Park. Also very close to a Subway station. Rooms are small which is very typical in New York, but it's very comfortable and just right for my sister and I. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful!

During my stay in the Iroquois Hotel I enjoyed very much the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff,All of the ladies and gentlemen at the reception desk were very helpful and friendly. Also the breakfast and the dinner at the triomphe restaurant is excellent and very special.

I know where I will stay from now on whenever I'm in New York! Breathtaking hotel. Staff went above and beyond. I felt right at home. A relaxing hotel from the bustling excitement of New York. Perfect location to see broadway shows, or get your fill of fine dinning or shopping. I can't say enough about this hotel. One of the best overall hotel experiences I've ever had. And I travel ALOT.

One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at both domestically and internationally ! The staff was very nice, the room was beautiful, the roads were nice, the coffee in the morning was very nice ! it was a great location. Quick walk to Grand Central Station. We stay there because we had tickets for the U.S. Open

I have stayed at the Iroquois approximately ten times over the past five years, most recently, last week. It has been an excellent experience each and every time. The rooms are small, but immaculate and quiet. The staff is well trained, efficient and caring. They know each guest by name if you stay more than one night! The food is excellent. The fresh squeezed juices make breakfast an event.

We stayed there for the second part of our honeymoon at the end of August, had request a bouquet for the room as a surprise for my new wife, this didn't happen but we did get a half bottle of red which was fine. Overall condition of room was excellent possibly down to it being recently refurbished. Small room with a massive bed didn't leave much room for accessing luggage. We were there for a 8 days and it was evident that room wasn't really dusted much if at all, imagine they'd have used the excuse of not touching our stuff if It bothered me enough to complain, can't fault the cleanliness of bathroom. Usual noise during night to be expected for New York. Mini bar over priced especially the water, doesn't matter how many stars your hotel has the bottled water shouldn't be $10 a bottle. Lack of complementary tea and coffee in room was a bit unusual and disappointing never experienced that in any other hotel I've stayed in. This review may appear a bit nitpicking and I rate our experience as very good none the less, if they address these things they'd get 5 star reviews all day long I think.

The hotel is perfectly located for theater, parks and shopping. Service was excellent and staff courteous. During our visit the hotel was being renovated (several floors) so elevators were used by construction staff making waits for an elevator lengthy during the day.

The front desk staff were great. From the moment we pulled up our car to checked in to checking out they where helpful and courteous. The hotel was right in the middle of all of the places we had planned to see for my wifes 60th birthday.

The hotel location is absolutely perfect. It is close to Times Square, but so far away that it is not noisy or too busy.The staff in the hotel is extremely friendly and helpful.One word of advise, skip the breakfast in the restaurant, it's not worth the cost. However, the bar is very nice for a drink in the evening.

Excellent hotel in a great central location ( a few blocks from Times Square yet a quiet - for New York Street). All the staff were very accommodating and friendly. We found our first room a little dark and were swapped to another room with no issues at all. The reception staff were really pleasant and also special thanks to Seth and John (Doormen) and Bill the the Conseirge. We would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
wendyoneill45
New York City, New York

review_body: hotel was in a great location and very nice. Room was quiet. Nicely furnished. Size was what we expected. Very clean. Shade' , front desk , was really nice and was the first person we met when we arrived. Very helpful,cheerful. Always smiling.. All the employees were very nice and helpful. We would certainly recommend this hotel.

Excellent property! Excellent staff! Excellent location! We were in town to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday. Iroquois went above and beyond to make her day extra special. I had already ordered flowers (actually rose pedals on the bed which they had shaped into a heart - nice touch - wife loved it) but the hotel added chocolate covered strawberries on a plate with Happy Birthday written on it, a small bottle of wine, and some truffles. Again, very nice touch! We also had another couple with us from the UK and they were equally impressed with the service and the quality and size of the room (for midtown Manhattan).Overall, we could not imagine our experience there to be any better than it was!

We really enjoyed our 5 night stay at The Iroquois. We booked on Black Friday so got a really good deal for such a great location. It's a 5 minute walk away from Times Square, the Rockafella Centre and right in the middle of 5th and 6th Avenue. We stayed on the 12th floor, which didn't boast the coveted views of the city but the room was very comfortable and spacious as well as being cleaned regularly. The staff were friendly and when we left, the doorman went above and beyond to help us with taxi prices and flag down a yellow cab for us. We would definitely stay here again, the location alone is worth every penny!

We were in NYC for the weekend to celebate a birthday. The Iroquois has a great blocation 5 minute walk to Times Square and other venues. The staff were overly nice and helpful. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to any one.

The Iroquois was a wonderful place, centrally located for our girls weekend in New York. The food was great, the employees were helpful and pleasant. It was fun to have a place to relax and have drinks in house after a day in the city. You can walk to so many of the sites that make New York such an exciting place to visit. Can't wait to come back

Love this hotel. Central to everything I love about Manhattan. Efficient, friendly staff make your stay here a very pleasant one indeed. I highly recommend this for couples, families or singles. You will not be disappointed.

I recently stayed in the city for a weekend with my family celebrating my mother's 80th birthday. The rooms had everything we wanted, clean, comfortable, etc. The service was outstanding. Starting with Bill, the concierge, whom I challenged on many fronts, from finding restaurants to checking if the "Open Table" reservations went through (one restaurant I reserved only had voice mail and did not return calls when I tried to verify reservations) to getting through a maze of extensions to Amtrack to help change a reservation.Amanda and others (I wish I noted their names) and the desk were friendly and interested in making sure everything was fine, being proactive in questions. Even the doorman were attentive (Thanks for your smiles, John).I will not wait for mom to turn 90 to visit again, and this is where I'll stay (note the location, BTW).PS - I don't contribute often to Trip Advisor, but travel frequently, and have no personal interest in promoting them, they just inspired me. In other words, this is not a "planted promotion" that sometimes may happen on the web.

Best customer service from start to finish. The front desk was professional and efficient. The consierge was helpful and the rest of the staff was friendly and accommodating! Excellent stay! We will be back!

The Iroquois is perfectly located for walking or access to the subway system. The hotel is clean and well presented, some building works are currently being undertaken and improvements included individual room temperature control and bathroom floor heating. Bed comfortable +++. Staff were courteous and keen to assist.I would have no hesitation to return.

We are huge fans of The Iroquois. Always a pleasant staff and when there is a problem, it is fixed immediately. As an added bonus, the coffee in the lobby is excellent...and we are very fussy about our coffee.

The Iroquois was a wonderful hotel in a perfect Midtown location, convenient to everything. It was an excellent price for a room with two double beds. Have already returned once, first trip with family and the next trip with friends. Wonderful stay.

Iroquois Hotel is a great option for staying at NY city. It has a excellent location and the renovated rooms are very comfortable.The food and service of Triump Restaurant, located in the hotel are excellent.

Excellent service and accommodations. Location is great and staff is friendly. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Located in the heart of the city. Excellent food and enjoyed the complimentary coffee and refreshments. My family and I will definitely book again on our next visit. Highly recommended.

Excellent location in Midtown Manhattan. Easy to get around either walking subway or car service. friendly and helpful staff that went above and beyond to help make our trip that much better. Great comfortable and clean guest rooms.

The Iroquois is an older hotel, but in all the best ways. Rooms are not large, but are very comfortable and nicely done. The hotel doesn't have hundreds or thousands of rooms. So you don't feel like you're staying a big impersonal hotel. The staff is congenial. The location is great.

Hotel rooms weren't as advertised. I had no internet connection for 4 of the 7 days i stayed. Service was excellent but overall experience is 2/10. Gym equipment was shockingly poor I Will not be referring or returning.

Have stayed at this hotel many times at different times during the year and have not been disappointed. It is a smaller hotel with charm and character that has remained throughout renovations. There is even a small library off the lobby with books, coffee, and tea. Fun bar and a very good restaurant, but near many others if you choose to eat out. Close to the Broadway area and shopping. The staff is one of the best we have encountered and always available to answer questions.

We spent the night before arriving at the Iroquois at the Intercontinental hotel which is 3 blocks away. Although the Intercontinental had HUGE rooms with modern furnishings and a modern bathroom there was absolutely zero customer service. When we arrived at the Iroquois there was a stark contrast. The doorman was extremely helpful, the front desk woman was absolutely charming and friendly. Even though the room was small and not as modern as the Intercontinental the fact that the staff seemed like they truly cared made all the difference in the world. Also since it is a boutique hotel you do not have to deal with all the crowds like at the Intercontinental.

Great small boutique hotel with grand service. Very well located in Midtown. Superb service from all levels in the hotel. Excellent restaurant and bar as well. We will return regularly and encourage friends to do so as well.

I would not hesitate to recommend this boutique midtown hotel. The small bar restaurant serves very good food. The location is in the heart of the city yet it was a quiet, restful stay. I arrived via Amtrak Penn Station and was able to walk to the hotel on a very nice NYC afternoon. It's close to events---Broadway, shopping and galleries. This was my first stay at this hotel. I do come into the city often and will certainly return here next time.

The staff were very professional and courteous. The rate I got was under $200, which is great fro that location. I don't recommend the restaurant; their breakfast was lacking, so I just went to Cafe Un Deux Trois instead. It's right across 6th Ave and has much better food, including breakfast. Also, I found their bar was closed both times I tried to go, but the Blue Bar at the Algonquin Hotel is right next door and a great place for a drink.NB: The 'courtyard' view rooms have a view of an old wall, and not a very interesting one at that, so I'd ask for something else if you plan to open your curtains or require daylight in your room.

The Iroquois New York was recommended to me by a friend who had stayed there and she was right -- an elegant, relaxing hotel in the middle of a busy city. Being in walking distance to Time Square and several subway stops, this hotel is located in an ideal part of midtown Manhattan. I would definitely recommend this property and would stay there again in a heart beat!

The Iroquois is a small boutique hotel with all of the amenities. They offer prompt and helpful bell staff and a warm receptive check in process. The rooms although small are clean and comfortable. The location is excellent, close to theater, shopping, restaurants and Times Square. The only downfall is parking: check in was prompt however valet check out took over 50 minutes to retrieve our car. Even though, I will definitely stay again and just allow for additional time to get my car as all other staff was great.

Loved staying here many years ago and our most recent stay was just as nice!!! All the staff are professional, friendly and helpful! Our room had just been renovated and was lovely! Staff surprised us with a nice bottle of wine for our anniversary and a large plate of chocolate covered strawberries for my husband's Birthday ! Looking forward to our next stay!!

This hotel was 2 blocks from Times Square and very convenient to a lot of attractions. lOcated on a quieter street and no neon lights shining in window. We had 2 adults and 1 child with us. The room was small, but I am told all rooms in NYC are like that. I think they could eliminate the desk/chair and replace with a dresser. The chair just seemed out of place in a room that small. We didn't visit the cocktail bar because they didn't allow children but the restaurant bar did and it was fine. Good drinks and talkative bartenders. Doorman was good and arranged a car for much less than we paid to get there from airport. all staff was friendly and concierge desk was great for advice on restaurants and subway directions. Free coffee in lounge was nice touch. I would stay here again just based on the location and the street located on. There were a few other hotels and restaurants next door that had better lobby bars, but that didn't take away from our experience here. The lack of noise on the street and overall cost compared to others make this hotel better than others I saw. Good location to subway stops, restuarants, times square, walking distance to Central Park although we took cabs back.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Iroquois. The staff was extremely professional and gracious. Although our room was TINY it was very nicely appointed with a minuscule but completely luxurious bathroom equipped with its own temperature gauge. Our room was very quiet and the beds wonderful at the end of long days in the city. Our only complaint was that storage was not adequate for clothes or luggage. My suggestion would be to remove the desk and chair and provide a dresser.

Have visited city often and have normally stayed at the larger hotels, but not any more. The Iroquois is a quaint, lovely hotel located around the corner from Times Square. The friendly staff were so attentive. The lobby is warm and they had complementary tea and coffee in the library. The room was very nice and they have a nicely equipped fitness center. Will return for sure.

Everything was great! It is worthwhile. The staff is professional but friendly. The doormen were always at the door...on the ready to help. They are rehabbing the rooms and corridors in a very tasteful way.

We had a wonderful stay at the Iroquois New York over the weekend. The hotel staff is very welcoming and the hotel is spotless and very relaxing. Our king size bed was super comfortable and we had everything we needed in our room. The location is perfect for exploring the city, with excellent restaurants close by. The library is a great place to relax and have a cup of coffee or tea in the morning or cold fruited water after being out for the day! This was our second stay and we plan to make it our go-to place in the future.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Iroquois. Our room as tastefully decorated and comfortable. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and pleasant--really outstanding. The location is very convenient. Fantastic value--a lovely hotel at a reasonable price.

Excellent hotel. Stafff was amazing, highly recommend, would definitely stay there again. Conceiere was helpful and friendly. Front desk went above and beyond. Bellboys were friendly and appreciative. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends!!

The Iroquois delivers a consistently high level of service and comfort. Some rooms are a bit small but they are uniformly well appointed and the staff is both welcoming and accommodating. Rooms in the back are preferable if you prefer quiet.

Hotel was in a great location. Very close to Rockefeller and Times Square. Great boutique hotel. Room was super clean and and a good size. Very comfortable and good size washroom. Triomphe restaurant was very good for breakfast and the bar/ lounge was good. They offered coffee and tea every morning in the library and flavoured water in the afternoon. Staff were extremely nice and helpful especially Christophe and Peter. Definitely would stay here again..

The Iroquois Hotel provided us a perfect location, a great room (although small - larger than other older hotels I've stayed in), and a great price for that location and room. I was in town on business, shooting a TV commercial, and the entire staff helped me in every way I asked and did so with a smile and a great attitude. The two young women at the front desk were incredibly helpful and Bill, our concierge, was invaluable in helping us coordinate some of the logistics within the hotel. We had 5 rooms for the time we were there - and not a single complaint from any of the crew.

Choose a hotel with confortable rooms large enough at a great price. Beats all large brands by a mile . Excellent ! Beds are great ! If you need to stay in the area the location is a perfect match. Had a great experience .

I recently stayed a the Iroquois because my "preferred" hotel was sold out. I was so surprised by the staff -- from the moment the bellman picked up my luggage, through check-in and then check-out, everyone seemed to really want to be helpful.
