Midtown NYC can be extremely noisy -- and in 90+ temperature the streets can be unpleasant; however, when I stepped into the hotel, it was simply calm -- almost soothing. I had a basic room but the bed, the lighting, and the bath were fine. I did have the world's narrowest closet -- but it had two doors, and there was room to hang all my clothes. I especially appreciated the early morning coffee off the lobby -- a pleasant way to start the day. I shall stay here again.

An unbelievably good location in Midtown Manhattan, perfect for exploring the whole of New York. Times Square, 5th Av, Grabd Central, Central Park, The High Line are all just a few minutes walk away. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in New York again!

Everything about this hotel was spot on. Great location, very comfortable bed, nice amenities. The staff was amazing and the rooms were clean and very pleasant. We didn't eat at the restaurant or go in the bar but they both looked good. I would definitely return.

The Iroquois has been our hotel of choice for an annual mother-daughter trip for the last 10+ years. Our stays have been consistently wonderful. The staff, from the front door to the concierge to the front desk are all incredibly friendly, attentive and helpful. Can't say enough good things about this wonderful hotel.
user_name:
jacllb04
New York City, New York

review_body: This was our first stay the the Iroquois Hotel after 15 years of staying at the Michelangelo Hotel.The staff was incredibly friendly and went out of the way to help and to know your name. I had several special requests that were fulfilled flawlessly.The suite we were in was nicely furnished and the bed was very comfortable. The only downside - we wish there were more modern HVAC controls - one were you can control the fan speed and separate controls for the bedroom and living room portions of the suite.We will definitely be staying here again.Well done Iroquois!!!

I'm in New York a lot, but never stayed. This was a great choice and I'll be back. It is reasonable, well-located and seemed very quiet. I loved the 1930's feel of it. It was a bit warm in the bar after a very warm summer day, but that's an old hotel. The rooms are average size for midtown and comfortable. Elevators are a potential issue if crowded, but not bad in my stay. Nice staff-they are very service conscious. Overall, a very positive experience for a frequent traveler.

Still love this place after all these years. Great service (shout out to Shade and Amanda at the front desk), location and rooms. Even though it's steps to Times Square, subway stations and 5th Ave you feel like it's on quiet side street with less of the hustle and bustle 1/2 a block away on either side. Gregory's across the street for coffee in the morning is also super handy. We <3 NY but we really <3 the Iroquois. I'll continue to visit and send clients here.

I keep coming back to this hotel for its great service and location. Small and cosy. Celebrated my husband's 80 th birthday. Staff was attentive and professional. We went to Triomphe restaurant and loved it.

Myself and partner stayed here for just over a week and did not want to leave - The hotel is clean, luxurious, safe, classy with a great vibe but I have to say that the staff are the best thing about this hotel, every time we returned we were warmly welcomed by everyone from the doormen to the housekeepers.Upon check in there was a hiccup with the billing which was very quickly fixed along with a complimentary bottle of wine for the inconvenience, special thank you to Amanda at front desk. I required a fridge for medication which was promptly brought up to the room and set up with no issues.We had delicious cocktails at the cocktail lounge, very warm cosy environment with friendly bar tender.Another special mention to the doormen Seth and I forgot the other guys name (feel so bad as he was one of our favourites think he was Russian?) he took our bags up to our room and remembered us every time we saw him, super friendly!Location is great as you are walking distance to times square but not so close that all the crowds annoy you. Subway close by to go uptown or downtown. More importantly NBA store is only 5 mins walk away.Cannot wait to return to NYC and stay here again!Thanks for making our second trip to New York a great one!

The hotel was well appointed, great location and wonderful service. The service from all the staff was perfect! We couldn't ask for a better location. The room was very nice as well. The concierge service is very useful and the staff is knowledgeable.

Clean rooms, friendly and attentive staff, great amenities and a fantastic midtown location. Price was great and the value was the best. I highly recommend the Iriquois Hotel for any type of NYC stay, business or pleasure.

Just this year, we've had the opportunity to stay at the Iroquois three times. Location for us is perfect -- steps from Fifth Avenue shopping, theater district and Times Square. But it's the staff that puts this property above others along 44th Street. Bill, the concierge, offers excellent advice on restaurants and things to do -- no request is too small. He surprised my daughter with chocolate-covered strawberries sent to our room for her birthday! Doormen Seth and Carlos are gracious, friendly and helpful. Seth even took time overnight to write out subway directions for us to a Brooklyn neighborhood, and they were under our door the next morning! Rooms are well-appointed, including fluffy comforters, and are a good size for NYC hotels. The Iroquois keeps showing us why we make this hotel our first choice every time we travel to New York City.

So thrilled with the accommodating nature of every person at this hotel! It is a great location, we got a recently updated room that was terrific and comfortable and we took advantage of the complimentary area 1 1/2 hour walking tour that was better than some others we have purchased in the past.Attention to detail at The Iroquois was top notch. We chose to have drinks and eat breakfast out in the city and felt very safe returning there.

Being a quest that is treated for every comfort , check in so easy and the bellman are the best. After checking in go to the bar and having my favorite drink. This is our 6th stay and have never been disappointed. Great location

We booked adjoining rooms (hard to find in Manhattan) with one king and two doubles. The hotel is a charming older hotel but has been updated, is clean and well maintained. The bathrooms have been lovingly renovated with high quality materials that far exceed the quality selected for newer hotels. We never heard anyone or anything during our stay - absolutely quiet at night which is amazing considering our proximity to Times Square, Central Park etc. The staff helped us up and down front steps with strollers, loading child car seats into vehicle, and with very specific requests for food the way kids like it. Highly recommend this hotel to other families, a very pleasant stay.

Had a great time at The Iroquois. Staff was excellent, friendly and helpful. Great boutique hotel in an excellent location. Seth was outstanding. Had King Suite which was very roomy, hotel is on a quiet street.

Everything was exceptional. The room was absolutely lovely and immaculate - plenty of room and a nice view. Every staff member we encountered was incredibly hospitable. We will stay here again and again!

The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The bar was rather loud and felt cramped and was overly dark. The room was quiet and relatively clean with a comfortable bed, but the view was of an unpleasant looking alley. The location is excellent.

This was our third stay at the Iroquois and we have never been disappointed! A great example of everything good....great location (steps from Times Square), clean rooms and lobby, friendly & helpful staff. Although the hotel is close to Times Square it is quiet and cozy as it's on a quiet block of 44th Street. Walking distance to Rockefeller Plaza, Grand Central, Macy's Herald Square, Central Park and so much more. We will definitely stay here again!!Extra praise and accolades for Seth at the door. He is a super young man....so good at his job. Amazingly, he remembered us from two years ago. He is warm, genuine and gives spot on advice.

We have wanted to give the Iroquois Hotel a try for some time. We got the chance and were not disappointed. All the staff were as helpful as any we have ever dealt with. Great location. The hotel was steeped in history, yet modern amenities-perfect combination for us.

Excellent hotel, location, and staff were all wonderful. This is our "go to" hotel whenever we come to NYC. Though the hotel is an older hotel, it is maintained beautifully and the rooms are quite nice. The beds are very comfortable. The staff all go above and beyond and they are what make this hotel so special - especially the front desk staff.

There are lots of really good hotels. There are not so many SPECTACULAR hotels. The Iroquois is a spectacular urban oasis in the middle of Manhattan.From the moment we entered and spoke with Christoph at the front desk, I knew we were in for a treat. We were quite early, but Christoph promised us our room would be ready in an hour, and it was. When we returned, Amanda made sure to treat us to complimentary drinks in the hidden cocktail lounge.The room was spacious, the bathroom HUGE, and the bed was addictive. We didn't want to get out of the bed, the linens and pillows perfect. The room was attended to twice a day, and I got to be honest, I'm not ever going to complain when I return to my room and there is chocolate on my pillow.We were on the top floor, yet the water pressure was fantastic and the bathroom products were top of the line.The little library off the lobby, which had coffee in the morning and fruit infused water the rest of the day was a great little touch.When we told Shade the night before departure that we might need a touch longer to check out the following morning, she happily directed us to her manger, Amanda, who cheerfully extended our check-out time to accommodate our morning plans.The doormen were friendly, everyone we spoke with was helpful. Great room. Great customer service. A complete and total gem. I can't thank the team enough.We will return, and soon.

From arrival to departure, you're welcomed home. Service is personalized and professional. Cozy, clean, convenient, and comfortable. A home-away-from home in the heart of the theatre district and more.

The Iroquois met all of our expectations! Great location, great size, quiet, great beds, pillows and shower! We will stay again! The staff was very helpful and friendly. We were very busy with theatre so we didn't eat here so can't comment on that. Gregory's Coffee across the street was wonderful!

This place is a gem. John the doorman let us into a our own oasis in the city.The Front Desk Staff was very professional while addressing our rooms climate issues. After 2 fans and a window unit were applied we were resting comfortably.. The location of the property is ideal for any adventure. Numerous dining opportunities are close by. Coffee shops are equally abundant. A short walk to time square reveals the glamour NYC has to offer. Rockefeller Center Radio City are also near.

The hotel is very well located with many good restaurants nearby as well as broadway and fifth avenue. The service was also friendly and professional. We will recommend the hotel and will stay there again.

Stayed three nights in a nice and functional Queen Deluxe Room: charming hotel in a wonderful location, very clean and comfortable room, very good wifi service, prompt and efficient staff, a little expensive when considering that breakfast is not included. Altogether, I would recommend this hotel.

Located between Grand Central and Times Square it is a short walk to Bryant Park and the Empire State Building. The rooms are clean and well appointed and a good size for New York. The best thing about this hotel is the staff starting from check in to when you check out they do their best to make sure your stay is as enjoyable and comfortable as possible. All the staff are a true asset to the hotel but Anna (Front Desk) and Bill (Concierge) really did a great job to make our stay a truly memorable one.

The hotel is between 5th & 6th Avenue on 44th Street. Close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center. Not too far from the Empire State building and Grand Central Station. The nearest subway appears to be in Times Square 2 blocks away. It is on a well lit street & we never felt unsafe even late at night always seemed to be a few people about. The hotel has 12 floors, 2 lifts (1 was intermittently out of service all 5 days of our stay). Some of the rooms are apparently still to be refurbished. 1207, our room had been done & it was very nicely done to. Very comfortable room, huge bed, very clean & tidy. No tea & coffee facilities in room, which would have been nice.DVD player listed but not in room, apparently removed when refurbished & replaced with option to buy new releases via the TV. DVD list of 150 films weren't new but were free. We asked for the list of films & the DVD player & both arrived by lunchtime the next day. The room details did state a fridge could be supplied upon request & we did request it before our arrival, but it did not arrive. There was a little space in the mini bar which we used. We were offered a morning paper, which never arrived until our last morning. Just so you know in case it effects your choice room 1207 has no view, office buildings & fire escapes all within a few feet of the window, but as you spend most of your time out in the city it's not a big thing to me. It cost me just under US$1400 for a 4 night stay, Thursday to Monday, seemed a little expensive. There were a few slips in service and I don't expect this with a smallish hotel, that prides itself on service & that is this expensive. I must say all the staff were very friendly, informative and tried to be helpful. The ability to safely leave our bags at the hotel all day while we were out after we had checked out was very useful. Also being able to use a computer and printer for printing boarding passes for the return journey also came in very handy. I must also say they did recognize my birthday with a complimentary dinner plate full of chocolates & strawberries along with a small bottle of red wine. We did not eat in the hotel, there are always plenty of choices nearby and we particularly liked the diner about a block away for breakfast on the way towards Times Square. Overall though a very enjoyable stay for my birthday, more I think to do with the city than the hotel.

Fantastic- No issues- great service, great staff, great restaurant. If you do not go to the Iriquois,you are making a terrible mistake. Take this from someone who has travelled all over he US fr business and pleasure. Cannot wait to go back.

60 Th Birthday trip with an old friend My friend lives in CA and I live in FLWe had a great time as tourists. We both were born and raised in Queens Chose the Iroquois for its rating and boutique size and location

Clean, quit, comfortable, chic, superb location... super friendly staff. Was in NY for business and to visit family. worked as a great base camp. Close to theaters, shopping, Times Square, and great dinning. Will be back for sure!
user_name:
Eduardo A
San Juan, Puerto Rico

review_body: Stayed at the Iroquois for my birthday and even though the hotel was going through some renovations on the upper floors, the staff went out of their way to make the stay enjoyable and take care of any needs or request. For example, the expresso machine was not working, and they went across the street to bring me expresso each morning! Now, that's service! This is my go to hotel when in NYC. Great location, restaurant next door, and the remodeled rooms look great!

Me and my wife staied here for a week. This is a very good hotel at a reasonable price considering its location just a few minutes walk to Times Square. The staff were nice and helpful. The room was small, but I guess this is true for most hotels in Manhattan. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, there are many Coffee shops nearby.A very recommended hotel.

Superb in every way, wonderful comfort and luxury in such a busy city. Should we return to New York this would be our first choice of accommodation. The staff were highly efficient and couldn't do enough for us.

I'm late in posting as I am new to trip advisor. I have travelled many places and stayed in many hotels. This was my first trip to USA and New York. The hotel was recommended by a friend and it was a great decision. The hotel has a great location in midtown which is within a block or 2 from many of main tourist attractions. Check out the map. The staff were charming and helpful, the room clean and quiet and the bar was a great place to end up after a long day discovering New York. You will not regret choosing this lovely hotel as your home whilst visiting this vibrant city.

Third trip to New York and first time to stay at The Iroquios Hotel. It will not be our last as it was perfect in everyway. Sad to leave but we will be back. The Hotel was perfect in size, quality, comfort and cleanliness. Location was Brilliant. Well Done to the whole team, who were well mannered and helpful at all times.

Our stay at The Iroquois was amazing. The room was clean, the staff was really friendly and helpful. They really made us feel welcome. The atmosphere was very familistic. The girls at the reception, especially Amanda and Kia, were great.It was definitively not our last stay at The Iroquois!

A great street needs a great hotel. W. 44th has two and one is The Iroquois. Cosy friendly reception. A terrific cocktail bar huddled behind. Warm rooms with classic windows - the worn wooden blinds giving a sense of tradition and comfort. Perfect mattress and duvet, desk and drawers of hardwoods and a few half bottles of some on the minbar. One is complimentary. Fortunately lacking the Scene in the lounge of the other good hotel down the street, The Iroquois has a library and lounge out frontRooms are decent size for NY and the prices in the market. It's a regular stop for me.

We were so excited , finally a dream come true we made it to New York . Perfect area to stay Midtown a quick walk to 5th Ave. NBA store just there . Turn the other way and your a couple of blocks from theatre district and time square. They were also shooting Bull and the black list in the street bummer couldn't see anything.When we got to the room there were chocolate dipped strawberries & bottle of red for my birthday Thank you. The hotel itself is very old and tired, the rooms are tiny but there were 3 of us sharing. Apparently that's the norm Rooms were clean and tidy with turn down service nightly . The staff were so friendly I couldn't fault the service at all. We had drinks in both bars. They have a Restaurant fine dining . There are plenty of restaurants cafes etc around and close by.I don't think the air conditioning was working we had the windows open to let some air in. We didn't complain as we were living the dream and were only sleeping in there. It was warm in the rooms. But when we checked out they did say they had problems. Thank you New York we had the best time. Hope to come back soon..

Love the proximity to the amenities of midtown. The hotel was extremely quiet (didn't even hear a door close in the hallway), and houses our favorite NYC bar, The Lantern's Keep. Our view was of a courtyard closed roof with pipes and services, but we slept well and will return.

I stayed at this hotel years ago and I loved the traditional decor, the luxury and the wonderful staff. I recently stayed again early this month, and I while I would ay the staff and the overall experience is still top notch, the hotel is in the midst of a renovation and I am not keen on the shift. The colors seem decidedly dark, the furniture more modern rather than traditional, and gone are the apricot colored coverlets. Instead, just the standard white down that every hotel has. Frankly, it reminds me a lot of the Empire which another hotel I stay in a lot in NYC. I am not crazy about it. I liked the luxury and the lightness of the old decor. And since the rooms are conventionally NYC tiny, dark furniture and carpeting really makes them smaller. Still, I understand that after many years renovations must be done. And I understand that the new rooms have more electrical outlets. Mine certainly had plenty and that was a plus. One negative was no coffee in the room and the free coffee in the lobby (a plus!) didn't start until 7am. Too late for an early riser like me and I HATE having to get dressed to go out and get coffee. And all the rooms I've ever had are pretty small. On the plus side, the staff could not have been more helpful and attentive. the minibar was not stocked when I first arrived and the management corrected this the next day. On my arrival I received a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and a "welcome back" note. That was spectacular! I was surprised that the hotel staff remembered I had stayed there in the past. But they did. Every time I exited there was someone to hail a cab or help with luggage or offer an umbrella. The coffee and water in the lobby was a wonderful plus and that little library was a wonderful haven! It is a great place to relax. The bed was comfortable. Wonderful that I got a NY Times delivered daily! A huge plus for me. Housekeeping was always prompt and perfect. I never had that experience of coming back at 3pm and finding my room not done. Another plus is great fluffy bathrobes!! This is one of my number one requirements! Love that. This is a small, boutique hotel find. WONDERFUL location. Right near Saks 5th Ave., St. Patrick's Rockefeller Center, theaters, Times Square (but away from the noise). It is really an ideal location. And perhaps because there is so much competition in NYC, the Iroquois really does try harder with its service. I would say the service is 5 star. amenities and room more like 3 1/2 to 4 star. But maybe when renovations are complete it will be more like 5. Coffee in the room, please!

All was good except the room temperature was too warm and it was not adjusted well enough when requested. The location was great, the valet team was helpful and the bed was very comfortable.Desk was very friendly

Exceptional, attractive, and very clean hotel with an excellent location. Two blocks from Bryant Park subway; maybe 3 blocks from Times Square/major subway station. Just 3 or so blocks from Grand Central Station. One of the most competent and friendliest hotel staffs I have EVER experienced...anywhere. Understand that the least expensive rooms are indeed small, so if the size bothers you and you can afford it, opt for a larger more expensive room. The Iroquois IS deserving of its rating here.

This is a great location within walking distance to great dining. The hotel has newly renovated floors. There are two great bars, one to have a drink before dinner and one to hang out after. I would highly recommend. Great staff and gym

Even though i ended up spending over 500 dollars for two nights no one bothered to tell me the hotel was under renovation and would affect my floor. as a result, loud noises, irons dropping yelling and continuous banging was what i got. the hotel gave me a discount of 20% for the second night but the damage was done as i was there for important business meeting. Very small rooms, no coffee maker in room, very small hotel i wonder why they get such high reviews. the room was not very clean and there was a big yellow stain on the bath rope when i checked in, made me wonder what else was dirty

Excellent value for midtown boutique hotel. Staff very friendly and welcoming. Convenient location. Restaurant had a nice atmosphere and food/service excellent. Hotel was very clean and had a nice ambiance.

Beautiful hotel with wonderful staff! Room was very comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Location is convenient to Times Square and 5th Avenue area. My daughter and I really enjoyed our stay at The Iroquois.

I returned to NY this June 2017 with my team for meetings in NY and we stated at the Iroquois. Their service is consistently excellent, staff is super friendly and accommodating, and I always enjoy going back to my room at night. It is so restful and comfortable and very clean. The rooms are well-appointed with everything you need. I always feel at home at the Iroquois.

I stayed for a week and everyone tried hard but things just took awhile to work out the kinks with housekeeping and handicapped assistance in the evenings. Would like to have in room coffee and a handicapped accessible entrance.

We have stayed several times over the years here, always to our delight and a five star rating. This time not as good. Vanessa, the concierge, was great, friendly and helpful as usual. Our room for six nights was fine, comfortable, clean, and a bit bigger than some we've been assigned in the past. There is construction going on with a floor being refurbished and one elevator was used mainly for that. No noise though.refurbishing the decor will spruce up the rooms.The continental breakfast was poor quality. Service was fine. The pastries tasted as if they were bought in some cheap deli. NYC is home to many fine bakeries where flakey fresh croissants, etc can be easily obtained. The cappuccino machine was broken for one week. Is it that difficult to buy or rent a cappuccino machine in Manhattan? One day the orange juice tasted as if it came from a container instead of being freshly squeezed. It was okay the other days.

We decided very spontaneously on a family road trip to stop in NYC. We have previously stayed at the Iroquois and were not disappointed with another visit. We had 3 adults and 2 young children with us, ages 17 months and 4 years. Upon arrival we were greeted by Valet who guided us into a small spot to park and unload the car on this very busy street. He helped my husband unload the car while I got the kids. He took care of everything else, parking the car and brining our luggage to our room. While checking in hotel staff greeted my kids with welcome packets with a I love NY keychain, pen, crayons and NYC coloring book. Check in was quick and easy. Now to the room. They have recently remodeled and OMG! It was home away from home. Gorgeous! Room service was quick too. As for location of the hotel it is perfectly place. Settled between Times Square/Theatre District and 5th Ave shopping. One of our favorite places to stay and we will be back for sure, sooner than later.

Stayed at the Iroquois as 3 couples for a family get together. Great place to stay, excellent location with very attentive staff. Rooms were very well appointed, quiet and comfortable. We took one suite to use as an area to hang out when we weren't walking the city. That worked out very well.

I needed to be nearby Times Square but wanted to be away from the congestion and noise. I could not have picked a more perfect hotel. Only a few steps away from the square but quietly tucked away on 44th - walkable to Central Park, Fifth Avenue, Empire State building, museums. Variety of dining options. The staff was friendly and helpful. Had a newly renovated room on the 11th floor which was quiet and had a view. This will be my go to hotel for my future NYC trips. Don't miss the Lantern's Keep Bar!!!!

It is billed as a luxury boutique hotel in a great location. It has a friendly, caring staff in the public spaces but the front desk is inflexible and would not recognize my reservation upgrades until I had to pull out the computer confirmation. The room I received was so small there was no chair to sit in except at the desk and the bathroom was so cramped you had to close the door to turn around. I travel to NYC often and there are much better choices of hotels at this price level.

We were impressed last year and even more so this year. It is worthwhile paying for a good quality, well located hotel such as The Iroquois. Friendly staff all round, and the newly renovated rooms are excellent.

My family just stayed there from June 8-13th. The location is pretty close to almost everything we wanted to visit. The room was small, but comfortable. The best part of the hotel was the great group of people that work there. I would definitely stay there again after such a good experience.

The staff at the Iroquois were excellent. They made my birthday stay with friends very memorable. I would highly recommend it! From ease of booking and check-in, to friendly staff, to excellent accommodations and location, you can't go wrong!

Very nice hotel with a friendly staff. Clean rooms and in a great location. The room I had was on the small side but not unlike many other hotels in the city. I booked online and they had a special price of $187. This was a great value for this hotel in this location.

This hotel is an oasis in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the 42nd Street area. The hotel ic compact but the rooms are spacious for NYC, not sure how they do that! Amazing linens and comfy bed. Quiet rooms.

I have stayed in New York Hotels many times but the Iroquois is a Special Hotel. The Hotel is historic and beautiful and just the right size. It would be considered a Boutique Hotel. We checked in and our room was not ready but they had a small library beautifully decorated with books, computer and either coffee or fresh fruit flavored ice water in a lovely glass container. When our room was ready we had been upgraded to a suite and it was gorgeous! Located on the 6th floor facing the street. They had doormen opening doors and someone to carry your bags if needed. The room consisted of a large couch , stuffed chair, desk and wooden chair, coffee table , TV , snack area with refrigerator and nice glasses. We brought in our own wine and water but you can purchase it in the room. The Windows and ceiling are very beautiful and high!The bedroom had a most comfortable decor with a King Size Bed and lovely linens. The bathroom was well done with both a tub and walk in shower. The service with the staff was very helpful in getting us transportation. I ate in the restaurant for breakfast only and had the Continental Breakfast with coffee and orange juice . The room had white linens and the basket of pastries was plentiful. Very elegant. The restaurant looked like it had an interesting curved bar that looked inviting but we did not have a drink there. I would stay again !

Excellent location, one block to 5th Ave one direction and 2 blocks to Time Square the other direction. Lots of places to eat, and convenient to subway. Consierge Vanessa was very helpful with getting us organized.

We like the Iroquois so much that we keep on coming back. The welcome from the doormen is always warm, the staff in the restaurant are attentive and professional, the cleaning staff friendly and the concierge service excellent. And it's in a great location for the theatres, sightseeing and shopping.

Cozy, elegant, midtown hotel from the Golden Era. Glamorous.Comfortable and with a suberb staff, who will be at your service. Close to all the University Clubs business dining;Times Square,;Broadwa;, many fine restaurants with pre and post show settigs.

Nice quaint hotel! Excellent location close enough to times square to walk (2 blocks) but far enough not to be in the mix and noise of things! Rooms are small but when you're in NY you're hardly in your room anyway!Nice staff and clean hotel!

this was our 4th stay with the Iroquois. The hotel is very well-run and very clean, with the best location possible on a quiet street 2 blocks from all the action. All the staff we encountered were knowledgeable and welcoming, and the total ambience is just delightful, from the well-appointed rooms to the helpful concierge and the charming coffee/tea room. We had a King Room, as we had before, and it did not disappoint in any way.We will most certainly be back.

Very high level of service, clean hotel and rooms, quiet rooms, excellent location on central midtown of Manhattan.The hotel has only 12 floors, an important fact in New York because of an elevator availabilit

We chose The Iroquois for its location (far enough away from the noise and lights of Times Square but within easy walking distance) and its value. We were extremely pleased with our choice! Our room was small but probably average-sized for New York but it was very comfortable and well-appointed. The front desk staff was very understanding when we needed to cancel a day of our reservation when we arrived a day late due to a cancelled flight. And then they were very helpful when we decided to extend our stay an extra 3 nights (that should tell you how much we enjoyed our stay!) and made sure we received the best possible rates and that we were able to stay in our same room. The concierge and front desk staff were very helpful in arranging for a car from and to Newark Airport (even when we decided just an hour before we needed to leave!). The doorman and front desk staff always smiled and greeted us with a "welcome back" whenever we returned from a busy day of sightseeing. After finding out my husband and I were celebrating our 30th anniversary the concierge surprised us with chocolate-covered strawberries, a bottle of wine, and a card. All of these examples of personal attention will make sure The Iroquois is at the top of our list for any future visits to NYC!

We had a wonderful time. The staff was very helpful and cheery. It was raining and yeucky outside but warm and toasty inside at the hotel. Very nice room, entrance, and services. The proximity to Times Square and Broadway is perfect. Central Park isn't too far away, either. We would stay here again.

We found the Iroquois a friendly and welcoming Hotel ; quite traditional in style and ambience which was charming however it did feel as if it could do with a freshen -up in terms of the decor and furnishings ( carpets , blinds , furniture etc ) . It is not a Boutique Hotel in the European sense . We did have some problems with the plumbing but these were sorted out quickly . The location is very good and the rooms are good value for New York.

I have stayed here often on business, and all rooms have been quiet and clean, but have not loved all the rooms I have stayed in. The new renovation is a huge improvement. Kind, attentive staff. Great bar.

Stayed here for a weekend. Hotel is lovely, the rooms are nice, and the Lantern's Keep bar is a great place for a nightcap after a busy day in manhattan. The front desk and lobby staff were accommodating and friendly. And for the location, between 5th and 6th on 44th, the value is very good for this level of hotel. My wife and I will definitely visit again when we travel to New York for just the two of us.

Without a doubt our favorite place to stay in New York City. Great location, staff and ammenites. Consistantly great service and the rooms are spotless. The staff is very accomadating -- you will not be disappointed

This is a beautiful, small, boutique hotel, with great customer service. Everyone was more than accommodating, making for a very easy stay. The hotel is centrally located to wonderful restaurants and within ten minutes walking distance to Times Square and the theatres.

My friend and I were recently in the City for a show at MSG and wanted a nice place to stay that wasn't outrageously expensive (not always easy to find in NYC). I found this little gem that is close to the Theater District and walking distance to all things Midtown. We got in a bit early and our room wasn't ready (not surprised and was just happy to check our bags). The hotel staff was very warm and helpful. When we came back a couple of hours later, the woman at the front desk gave us a small bottle of wine for having to wait. What a nice surprise! In the two hours we "waited", we'd found our way to the Ninth Avenue Food Festival - something you can't miss if you're there in mid- to late-May! And try the rice balls!!!The hotel is in a historic building and very well tended. Our room was small (as are all affordable rooms in Manhattan), but clean and cozy. The beds were comfortable, the pillows nice and plentiful, there was an MP-3 deck/stereo, and the room was less noisy than most as it was overlooking a courtyard. My only gripe was that I couldn't get the room as cool as I like it (not really that big of a deal since it was mild out and I tend to like a meat locker temp). In all fairness, when I did a survey after my stay and mentioned this, the manager contacted me. I would highly recommend this hotel if you're staying in Manhattan and I would absolutely return.

My husband and I had a wonderful experience at the Iroquois Hotel in New York City over the Memorial Day weekend. We had a recently renovated room on the 11th floor that was lovely. The staff was excellent. From doormen, check-in desk, concierge, to maid service, everyone was helpful, efficient, and pleasant.

Stayed here for business & was very convenient. Rooms & hotel generally needs updating - not very special with limited atmosphere. Reliable but tired. Breakfast included with rate was boring & not enough choices.

Well-located in theatre district, good consideration, but small rooms and small bed are drawbacks. Good value in overpriced market. Restaurant closed for unknown reason. On busy weekend in NY location important to avoid cabs. Walking distance to all Broadway action, Central Park, MOMA and more.

I travel to New York, mostly for business at least ten times per year, and usually for no more than a two-night stay. I almost always stay at a five star hotel on the upper east side. Realizing I usually end up downtown for dinner or drinks, I decided to try the Iroquois. The most friendly, helpful, cheerful staff ever! The rooms were spotless. beds were very comfortable. snack and beverages available 24 hours.

Although asked months ago, my request for a high floor suite not honored. Suite very underwhelming. Old furniture (not the antique look, but the quality), dark, tiny bathroom, small bath. Really disappointing!

The hotel was beautiful and the all staff was very pleasant and helpful to first time visitors. The rooms are extremely comfortable and nice amenities. Great location! We would stay there again and plan to do so when we return someday.

My husband and I spent a night here celebrating a special birthday. It's a quaint boutique hotel that has just been renovated and the location is pefect for seeing a show. The staff was very warm, attentive and friendly and when they knew it was a birthday they sent wine and chocolate strawberries. We cannot recommend this hotel enough.

A very welcoming hotel and typical of the SLH culture. we had moved from another hotel, also a SLH which did not feel anything like The Iroquois New York . we hope to return one day and the Iroquois will be our fist choice of hotel.

My wife and I stayed at the Iroquois for an anniversary trip to NYC. The hotel was a very good choice on 44th Street. Reasonable rate for the city and very convenient for theatre and access to Times Square. Did not use dining services in the hotel but a number of good options nearby. Concierge service was excellent. Second time at the Iroquois. Have also stayed at Algonquin which is next door. Both good choices - got a better rate at the Iroquois.

The hotel is well located near the attractions we wanted to see. The room was small, but very clean. The staff were very friendly, and helped with restaurant choices, getting taxis, and holding luggage after we had checked out.

We are long time visitors to NYC and have stayed in many hotels. This was our first visit to the Iroquois. It will be our first choice for future visits. We arrived in the midst of a dreadful car incident which happened just a few blocks away. Streets were cordoned off. It was extremely hot weather. We had to walk far out of our way to get to Broadway. Despite all the chaos, the hotel was calm, efficient and we felt totally cared for and on holiday. Security was excellent. We had 3 visitors over our 4 day stay. Each was announced to us. All the staff were professional and well informed. Room was comfortable with well thought out storage and shelf placement in bathroom. One lamp did not work well and was replaced within 15 minutes of notification. Wonderful hotel!!!

The location of this hotel is nice. The thermostat in my room didn't work. The bathtub had dark black hair and matching mold in it. The window shade did not raise. The first room had only 2 working electrical outlets that I could find, so I could have light or recharge my phone and computer. I will not return.

Hotel was very nice. The rooms were clean and nice. The staff overall was pleasant ans wanted to assist in any way they could. The only issue I had was the mini fridge was completely empty. It would have been really nice if they at least had cold water in the room. When you come in late night and you are thirsty there is nothing to drink. I finally got service from the front desk and they brought up warm water and warm Coke... which I could not open because you needed a bottle opener.... very disappointing when you are super thirsty.

My husband and I spent a relaxing weekend at the Iroquois Hotel. Beautiful place....located right in the middle of everything. And the room was incredibly quiet even though our room overlooked 44th St!!

The Iroquois is a charming small hotel. The staff is warm and welcoming. The small lobby with newspapers and coffee or water was a comfortable place to wait for friends. The concierge was helpful with dinner suggestions and reservations on short notice. The room was comfortable and clean. The location was perfect for my business meeting and for a Broadway show in the evening.
user_name:
Catherine S
Anchorage, Alaska, United States

review_body: This is an intimate property reminiscent of the small and lovely hotels in Europe. The location is perfect for Broadway and also walking to shopping, museums and points of interest. We spent 5 days here and could not have been happier. Service is friendly without being fussy. The bar serves great cocktails and the breakfast was first class. A slow drain was resolved almost immediately. We wanted a room with two beds so there was not an abundance of wiggle room but more than enough space for a comfortable stay. Where do they still have turn down service and put chocolates on your pillow? The Iroquois!Front desk knowledgable and helpful. All in all a hotel that we love...small with amazing service and a fabulous location. I have future reservations here and will look forward to returning. Thank you!

My partner , Ron McArthur and I have just returned from spending one week at The Iroquois. We have definitely found our New York base for upcoming visits to the city . This charming boutique hotel ,perfectly located half a block from Fifth Avenue and just minutes from the Theatre District , is run like clockwork . Small Luxury Hotels Of The World can be justly proud of maintaining this property within their very select group. The ever-present , "hands on " General Manager , Breandan Gallagher can boast a staff that, without exception , have been hand-picked or perfectly trained. They understand that a smile , combined with informed guidance , create the ideal atmosphere with which to commence each day . We certainly learned and laughed a lot !At 'Front of House' , Amanda , Anna , Kelly , Christoph and Billy worked together as a well-run team , along with others whose names we fail to recall . Seth , Liriam ,and JJ were positioned on the other side of Reception to ensure that our needs were met , and that we were starting off in the right direction. At the Concierge desk , Vanessa and Bill made sure that reservation requirements were met , and that we knew how to reach our destination . All of these people , plus others , represented the team on hand to satisfy your daily needs. There were undoubtedly numerous equally skilled people behind the scenes , who contributed to the running of this "jewel" which is unpretentious, but which carries the correct level of sophistication.Whilst we were there , the hotel was undergoing a complete renovation. This could cause disruption , but not once during the week were we disturbed. We enjoyed the luxury of an Executive Suite on the twelfth floor . Apparently we were the first to utilize this accommodation following its total overhaul . The comfort factor was complete, but to us , the total lack of noise was the most important aspect. The new insulation eliminated any noise from adjacent rooms , and one would never realise that West 44th Street was directly in front of us. In this beautifully decorated suite we had just one complaint. The only mirror, located in the bathroom , was not long enough to reassure us that we looked good enough from top to bottom , in order to compete with the rest of Manhattan !! This was mentioned to Seth on our first morning. By the time we returned , a full-length mirror had been placed in the living room.We ate breakfast at the hotel each day. The delightful Samantha was there to seat us each morning , and showed genuine interest in our daily plans and activities . Manus and Pinto ensured that our requirements , and occasionally fussy needs , were fully satisfied at table. Again , they were all fully aware of the value of a smile.We apologise to those people whom we have failed to mention , but stress again that we never experienced anything but genuine courtesy from all of the staff. We thank all of these people for their positive contribution to our vacation , and strongly suggest that readers of this review can book with confidence at The Iroquois when next visiting New York . We cannot wait to return .Thank you all , Ron and Peter , Port Hope , Ontario , Canada .

We absolutely Love this Hotel and service is Spot on!!! If you need anything !!Ask Bill Heinrichs the Concierge He is Excellent with local knowledge and can get you tickets, car service, even helped us With FedEx locations. Thank you Bill!!!!
user_name:
Y4318PPjuanr
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed for 6 nights and found it a great base for a leisure break in the Big Apple. It's quite an old fashioned hotel which adds to the charm and small enough that the staff quickly get to know you and cheerily greet you at every opportunity by name. James Dean was a regular guest once upon a time and you certainly get a sense that this is a place with a history.Our Premium King room was spacious and well appointed although the elderly lifts were a little temperamental during our stay and we occasionally had to use the stairs (which was interesting being on the 8th floor)! Location wise, W44th is about a central as you can get, in the middle of everything but just far enough away from the craziness of Time Square.We are SLH members and were pretty well looked after as usual. No upgrade this time but a nice bottle of wine and some chocolates in the room on arrival as well as a late check-out on the day we left. The high speed Wifi was complimentary as was a decent breakfast every morning. We never ate at the restaurant with so many options elsewhere but did finish the night in Lantern's Keep on a few occasions and enjoyed some very imaginative cocktails and - I'm not kidding - admired the nicest ice I've ever seen in a drink anywhere. Like large chunks of crystal. A strange thing to point out perhaps but they have stuck with me...New York is a city of countless hotel options but if you want a relatively quite base in MidTown this is definitely worthy of consideration.

LOVED our stay. Went up to celebrate my daughters birthday and this hotel went above and beyond. Although our room wasn't ready early the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They held our bags and gave us a map and great directions and helpful tips. We got back and our bed was turned down with chocolates on the pillow. BETTER YET there was a plateful of amazing chocolate dipped strawberries for my daughter and a beautiful card! Nice touch! Beds were comfy, room was a nice size and quiet and the bathroom was beautiful and clean. I definitely enjoyed the coffee in the lobby along with the NY Times. Only drawback was the wine selection in the downstairs bar.... but there's a wine shop across the street. Location was close enough to Times Square but not in the middle of the crazy. Also just a few blocks from Grand Central. I will definitely be staying again in the future!

Our granddaughter attends college in Bronxville so we will be traveling to NYC every few months for the next few years and will stay at this location again. The service was excellent. The staff is very helpful and friendly.

Enjoyable stay, cozy and comfortable public areas. Suite comfortable, pull out queen size bed very uncomfortable. Personnel polite, affable, helpful, professional, excellent. The night porter (Seth??) most wonderful person

Where do I start ? We just love everything about this hotel , we stayed for a week and from the minute we arrived everything was perfect to the minute we left , we were so lucky to get a newly renovated room on the top floor with a fantastic view of the Chrysler building and the Met life building , the quality of the room furnishings were to a very high standard , from the sheets to the toiletries !! We asked for the mini bar items to be removed in an e mail before we travelled and this was honoured and for the fridge to be left .When entering the room there was lovely plate of strawberries dipped in chocolates and some milk and white chocolate drops with a message saying Happy birthday ,it was a lovely gesture . The location of the hotel was amazing ,so close to main attractions, Our room was really quiet ,we hardly heard a noise which is great for a city that never sleeps !! All the staff were really nice ,friendly and polite and nothing was too much of an effort for them ,Phillip on reception was a stand out member of staff ,he is a total asset to the Iroquois ,he is very informative and so helpful . We have stayed in 5 and 6* hotels in the Caribbean and Mexico and I can honestly say the Iroquois hotel was equally, if not better customer service than anywhere else we have stayed . When returning to New York we wouldn't even dream of looking elsewhere for accommodation , nothing else would compare .

Spent a milestone birthday at the Iroquois, my favorite New York hotel. Cozy, comfy, superb service. Welcomed warmly. Wine a strawberries in my room...what more can you ask for! I shall return very soon!

Home away from home! Very friendly, helpful staff. Impeccably clean. Very comfortable beds. Great location. I would highly recommend this hotel. This was the second time we stayed here and we are looking forward to our next stay!

The entire staff was so amazing and helpful. I was particularly impressed with Seth, he was always so polite, willing to help and when I was waiting on friends to show up he always made conversation, he really made me feel welcome and remembered my name during my stay. I would definitely recommend the Iroquois Hotel, your staff always went above expectation with greeting me, being polite and willing to help out with suggestions for places to eat and things to do. What an amazing stay I had!

The Iroquois offers excellent service, clean rooms and the best burger I've ever eaten, at prices that are typical of it's location. Best of all, it is located an easy walk to Broadway theaters. There are two possible downsides. The entrance features stairs that can be a challenge to the handicapped and the rooms in the rear have a dismal non-view but the lower prices may compensate. It is my go-to hotel in the City.

Good rooms on the top floors, if a little noisy. Nicely equipped and good friendly, helpful staff. Corresponds with my usual adage, small reception area...nice rooms! Cost is always a challenge in midtown NYC, I was slightly surprised by the cost of the water at USD6.50! Overall a good place...I will be back.

I frequently am in NY for business and the Iroquois is my hotel of choice due to its location, service, cleanliness, friendly/helpful staff. The rooms are quiet, beds very comfortable, and bathrooms spotless. The entire staff is always friendly and willing to help in any way.

Stayed here with friends in April and May. We were so looking forward to our stay at the Iroquois as we had done our homework on the internet as well as visiting the hotel several months before to check it out. An old elegant hotel in the middle of a refurbishment and in a great location. We were greeted by warm and friendly reception staff. Feel compelled to mention the staff in the restaurant bar, the concierge and doormen. They were all exceptionally friendly, efficient and a joy to deal with. With beautiful bathrooms the rooms were well appointed but didn't feel clean enough to walk around without slippers - an acid test of any hotel for us. Had some major issues which the front of house manager eventually sorted out and made a reasonable adjustment to our bill. I do not feel as if it is fair to state what the issues were since some recompense was made. However another big disappointment was a broken promise made by the front of house manager. Several months before we had been promised a continental breakfast for our stay but this offer was withdrawn when we checked in. This was very disappointing and a real let down in terms of trust and respect for the establishment. It also embarrassed us with our friends as we had organised the hotel stay for them too. We were shocked at this approach to customer service by an establishment in the SLH group. So for this very very shoddy approach we would not want to stay there again. Such a shame!!!!

Excellent stay at the Iroquois as usual. This was our third stay at this hotel. Friendly and helpful staff, convenient and comfortable accommodations! Just steps away from theatre and great shopping. We will be back!

Nice quiet street; luxurious bedding; and phenomenal staff. Best trip to NYC in 48 years! We had an executive suite on the 12th floor that was recently remodeled. The art deco style was welcoming and spacious. The bed was better than back home. TVs in both rooms were unusually large for a hotel and all the amenities were of high quality. Can't say enough about the professionalism of the staff. We had eaten our way through NY so we did not have the time to enjoy the dining options at the hotel. Wish we could have stayed longer.

This was my third time at The Iroquois, and I have yet to be disappointed. All amenities are high quality, service is excellent, beds are comfortable, and rooms are dark and quiet for sleeping. I highly recommend this midtown jewel.

We traveled from Alaska and were exhausted, arrived early from the airport. The front desk was wonderful to us and immediately checked us in for some much needed rest. The management sent us wine and chocolate strawberries to celebrate our anniversary which was so unexpected and hugely appreciated. The entire staff was delightful. While we didn't use room service or eat in the restaurant, we did visit both cocktail lounges and had some amazing drinks. We had the best stay ever, thanks Iroquois for everything. Couldn't ask for anything better.

We arrived at the hotel with rain soaked clothes. The hotel concierge, Vanessa, went out of her way to help us find a laundromat. In fact, she actually dried our clothes herself! Such kindness is rare today.We will always remember this sweet lady!

I previously stayed at the Iroquois back in Dec 2011, so I figured enough time has passed for an updated review. Once again I was here while my wife attended a work conference. This time my 18-month old daughter and mother-in-law came along as well. We booked the suite, as we needed the extra space for the 4 of us. The rooms in this hotel are not large, but we knew that going in and space was not a huge issue. As expected the rooms were very classy and clean. The bed was large and comfortable (although my mother in law did not love the pullout couch). Turn down and maid service was always reliable as was the WiFi connection. The staff here are really top notch. There is always a doorman to greet you upon entering the hotel, and the front desk staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. The library room with coffee in the morning and infused fruit water the rest of the day is a great perk. Location is fantastic if you want to be close to the main touristy action of Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue shopping, The Empire State Building, etc. However you are tucked away from the action enough to avoid most of the noise and crowds. Highly recommended Bryant Park is just around the corner and is a great green "oasis" in the busy city. If you are looking for hip & trendy areas like Tribeca, Chelsea, East Village etc, it might not be the location for you though. I would continue to recommend this hotel for a great midtown Manhattan experience.

We just spent eight wonderful days at the Iroquois. This boutique hotel offers luxury, charm and delightful comfort; an oasis within the bustling city of New York. Our room was quiet and very well appointed. The shower over the bath was strong and hot. Great after a days shopping. There is a neat little bar offering cocktails and nibbles and there is also a restaurant where the delightful Thomas will look after your champagne needs! There is also a small library lovely for reading or emailing. The doorman JJ took our hearts. He was so helpful and sincere; a true professional yet warm and approachable. We looked for him each day just to say hello! The hotel is in a fantastic position in the theatre district close to great restaurants and bars and of course shopping! We can highly recommend the diner a few doors up and an Italian bistro a little further along. This establishment hotel is a gem in so many ways. We will definitely be returning.

The Iroquois is the best hotel overall in NYC. It is very immaculate, the food and beverages are fresh, prepared to perfection, the staff is always right there to assist you with whatever you need, they always provide complimentary coffee and tea in the morning and throughout the day they provide a complimentary seasonal beverage in the library. This hotel is very unique in that it is a historical building and it is not a chain like the some of the other ones. Therefore, you get personal attention and your room get immaculately cleaned. Also, every room gets turn down service each night. When we are there we feel like family. The Iroquois is our hotel.

The Iroquois hotel has the best staff of people, knowledgeable helpful and friendly. Always stay at the Iroquois which is within walking distance to all Broadway Theaters, it is safe, clean and a friendly place to stay!

The staff were consistently excellent in service and attitude. Fine hotel with personality and a personal touch. The Lantern is a great bar with top craft servers and a fun vibe. The restaurant was terrific and the restaurant staff were attentive and clearly enjoyed treating the customers.

This is the second time we stayed at the Iroquois and we will be back again! The staff is friendly and you can't beat the location... on a quiet street just blocks from Times Square and Bryant Park. We had booked the executive suite (Black Friday Deal!) which consisted of a large sitting room (pull out couches) and a bedroom WITH closing door. The bathroom had both a shower and separate tub and plenty of bathroom products. It was more than enough space for both my husband and myself-- probably the size of most NYC apartments. We have stayed in the city plenty of times before and you can't beat the space, cleanliness and polite staff. We will be back again and refuse to stay anywhere else when we are in town. This is a good deal! There was also free internet and daily flavored water in the afternoon. In the morning there is complimentary coffee. The adjoining restaurant and bar is nice when you don't want to go far.

Warm, welcoming staff, very comfy beds and good food. It is a lovely little gem in a super location in the City. And it is surprisingly quiet. I stay here frequently and never have a noise issue. A nice, quiet Hotel!
user_name:
F5705OHdonnam
New York City, New York

review_body: Fabulous weekend in New York on our way home to Australia. So welcoming and such a great location, walking distance to so many of the places we wanted to experience. The room was lovely and clean, if a little dark. Bed was super comfortable and the towels and dressing gowns were very soft. Staff where all lovely and helpful, but a big shout out to Bill the concierge, never lost patience with our never ending questions, never having been to New York before. Would recommend to all my friends.

We love the location of the hotel. Near the time square. Near a great gregory ☕ and the red flamr diner.The bed is great and comfy. Only sounds from other rooms disturbed us. The elevator is good.The house cleaning is more than great and the towels are excellent

We stayed five nights in late April and loved our experience at The Iroquois. It is very important to book well in advance to get better pricing. We paid ~$320/night all in, for a deluxe queen room- small but efficient, and comfortable. The location is fantastic on West 44th. Everything is very close so it is easy to walk to all the key attractions within 10 minutes-Central Park, top of the rock, the Empire State building, Broadway shows, shopping on Fifth Avenue, and great restaurants.

I have stayed at the Iroquois at least 4 times but this is my last time. Rooms are small , but this might be OK given prices of real estate in Manhatten. But the hotel needs some serious work. Room was not clean, and not in good state. Elevator service too slow and on top of it 1 elevator of the 2 was constantly out of order. I did not expect view in NYC but a window facing a brick wall is a joke (room 1006). Reception staff are nice.

My mom and I recently had a Mother/daughter to NYC. The Iroquois is in a fabulous location for theater or shopping on 5th or Madison Avenues. The rooms are small but nice. The restaurant - Triomphe - prepared wonderful meals - breakfast and dinner. (The truffle butter served with warm bread is definitely worth the calories!) Unfortunately my mom was a bit under the weather - BUT the staff could not have been kinder in helping AND sending flowers to her room. We look forward to a return visit!

While the rooms are somewhat small but totally adequate, the amenities, the service, the people, the ambience, everyone is friendly and everything is first rate. Very welcoming. A great experience in New York and the location is great for a dinner and theater vacation trip.

Feels a bit like visiting your great aunt's house in New York. But if she were a Manhattan socialite who managed to stay hip and relevant, despite beyond a certain age. It is a bit dusty and old, but also attractive, well-kept, and charming. The bed is amazing. You will not wish to get up and go see sights. The bathroom is very well-appointed, and very elegant. It is a bit small, especially for those who are blessed to be above 6 feet. The room we had had not much of a view, but you are so close to Times Square that you should not begrudge them that. The hotel staff is helpful and pleasant. That should already make them a stand-out in New York City. They were kind enough to lend us umbrellas for a walk during a rainy night when it was pouring. And they kept our luggage for free the next day when we went out exploring, but had already checked out of the hotel. It is a great price and a great location.

The only good thing about this hotel is the bell service and location. The front desk staff is not friendly. I could never get to my room in a timely manor due to blocked stairs and a 5+ minute elevator wait. Takes 30+ minutes to get your car from valet. I was concerned of the fire hazards in the rooms and halls due to the plugs being overloaded slow elevators and blocked stairwells. The staff did not seem be worried when I asked them to move boxes causing concern.

A very nice Hotel with charm and excellent service. If you are seeing a show or want a great central location in NYC this is the place. The real charm is that you are on a quiet almost dignified street. Yet only 2 blocks from the bustle of Times Square.

The Iroquois gets "Very Good" from me only because of its excellent location. Right in the heart of Manhattan, on the street with the smartest private clubs, NY Yacht Club, The Penn, The Harvard Club etc, close to Times Square and Fifth Avenue, it is perfectly placed for sightseeing, shopping and theatres. I was looking forward to my stay as I had previously stayed here 16 years ago (just after 9/11), but sad to say I was rather disappointed as nothing much seems to have changed over the years and the hotel is in need of refurbishment. It retains its elegant charm but is looking and feeling somewhat tired.My Deluxe King room was extremely dark, small and a bit shabby. At $480 a night this was not what I expect, even in New York. I should have spent a bit more and gone to The Peninsula or about half at the excellent Gild Hall downtown. I enjoyed a good dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant Triomphe, but it is a relatively small internal room which feels a little claustrophobic. I was most surprised not to be able to have a Vodka Martini in their famous bar, Lantern's Keep, as they don't stock vodka for some reason. No Martini in New York - very odd I thought, but I was happy to find that I could be served my choice in Triomphe's bar. In mitigation I have to say just how impressed I was by the Head Concierge, Vanessa, who was most helpful with my changing plans before and during my visit and was very charming in person. Credit also to the General Manager for a swift and polite response to my remarks on the post-stay survey.

This hotel, due to its manageable scale, feels more like a luxurious private residence than a hotel. Every single staff member was extremely friendly and helpful and the concierge is very efficient. An EXCELLENT location on top of all other pluses. Hope to be back in NYC and this hotel in the not too distant future.

I would stay here again. The bed and pillows were the most comfortable that I have ever had at a hotel. The room was so quiet that I slept all night without waking even though I was concerned I was only on the 2nd floor. I was afraid of the nighttime noise from sirens, etc., but was so surprised the next morning that I heard nothing and slept so well.

Perfect position, friendly staff, helpful Concierge, clean rooms, good wi-fi connection...what we expected. Appreciate the complimentary newspaper, coffee in the morning. We were given a bottle of wine since it was our honeymoon.....we would comeback!

I love this hotel. It's small & has a European flair. The rooms are charming, tidy, and on the small side but perfectly appointed. There are older rooms and more modern rooms,depending on your taste. I like a room that looks out right on 44th Street. This hotel also has a wonderful restaurant downstairs as well as a popular and lovely bar. The lobby staff are very friendly and helpful, there is complimentary coffee in the morning and flavored water all day long. Room service is very good. The prices are also quite competitive by NY standards. A brand new Whole Foods at Bryant Park, just two blocks away, is so convenient. If you are planning an extended stay, the staff will bring a refrigerator to your room. The turn-down chocolates are splendid! Linens very nice.
user_name:
Holly M
New York City, New York

review_body: Rooms were comfortable but small dark and horrible outlook. No upgrade for me as an SLH member. Breakfast offered free then charged for, charges deducted but took time to sort them out. My colleagues also stayed strong the hotel and they shared the same opinion as myself. Would we return, perhaps not, So looking for a good hotel in NY for three trainers with good budget to spend in the Times Sq locality.

The Iroquois is a great place to stay. It is small, comfortable, quiet, perfectly located for the opera, museums, Broadway, and great range of mid-town restaurants. The staff is highly competent, professional, and cordial. The options for food and drink are high-quality, and shhhh it's not advertised so I probably shouldn't mention it but there's a wee bar/speakeasy/clubby (?) sort of place tucked away off the very tiny lobby that is good fun. I had an issue with a sudden repetitive noise in the heating system in my room late one night that was handled with courtesy and dispatch. I'd stay here anytime.

Overall my family had a great experience, staff were excellent and very friend and helpful. The room was good although perhaps slightly dated. I was very happy with my stay and would stay here again. It is in a great location, close to times square. Eating in this area is expensive, so I would recommend travelling a little further out for food that is value for money.

Located between 5th & 6th, so excellent for shopping & theater. Staff were all very competent and friendly.Very clean rooms, but fairly small - with 2 double beds, there was very little floor space left. Biggest complaint - rooms are very dark. There is one floor lamp and one table lamp between the beds - but both are insufficient. Hotel really needs to install reading lamps over each bed.Accessibility - multiple stairs at front entrance; not sure if ramp is available.

Just returned from a five night stay. In an excellent position to see all the sights but on a street quiet enough to get an excellent nights sleep. Room very comfortable. All staff very helpful (special mention for seth and vanessa). If you want a view of Tmes Square in New York then you will get noise. This hotel may not have great views but makes up for it in so many ways. I would definitely recommend.

The rooms are nice, but the location is what keeps us coming back. It's very near the metro and Times Square. The best part is you don't walk out into Time Square with hoards of people, but a quick few blocks and you are there or in the theatre district.

Here for one night for business, this is a member of the small leading hotels of the world group. Usually that's a good sign but this place was a disappointment. The hotel is small, the staff friendly but the rooms are old, small with not very good bathrooms.I used it as an emergency stay but will be unlikely to stay again.

If you want location, this is a great place to stay. Front desk and lobby staff are absolutely top rate. On the down side, the room we had was small compared to other boutique hotels where I have stayed in this area. It had two double beds and no view to speak of. The downside was housekeeping, which was spotty (second day we were left with fewer towels, no bath mat or washcloths and things had been moved around. Bar service was awful - we had to call the waiter over for everything we needed including ordering drinks, reminding him about a menu item we had ordered, and our check.

The hotel is very nice, as advertised. The staff is very accommodating. But when you choose a place to stay in NYC, and you advertise a top notch bar. It would be nice if it was open during the hours advertised. I chose to stay there based on knowing I was going to be everywhere but the hotel until late. Being closed 45 minutes early on a Saturday night? Hitting the mini bar for a night cap sucked

This being an anniversary,we decided to visit New York, and we choose the hotel Iroquois. On arrival we were greeted by the reception personnel, who I might add were very helpfull and charming.The hotel is near to every thing you may want to visit and is all within walking distance, but if you need help the people in reception go out of their way to assist.The Hotel itself is old but has a modern outlook,all the modern amenities of today The room we had on floor 9 was small ( not claustrophobic as such) and like the bed, comfortable. The room looked onto another building, but as we were out most of the day this was not a problem. The challenge we had was the air conditioning which was some times ok, other times not,(I might add we did not report this as most of the time we were not in the room) the windows did not open so you do not get fresh air,so if you are a person with allergies and you want fresh air then ....... The other down side is you have to go down to the libary if you want morning coffee when you rise in the morn: no facilities in the room, also there is a fridge look alike in your room BEWARE it is not a fridge, if you move any item from this you will be charged.All in all a nice and pleasant hotel ,staff are very helpfull and accommodating. All I can say is "Give the Iroquois a go"

Forget the hotels in Times Square this one out classes them all. Could not have have felt more welcome or comfortable. Amazing staff and quality room made our stay memorable. Being a smaller hotel, you will get service that is unparalleled and a throwback to better times when quality mattered. Located at 44th and 6th it's close to all the "action" of NYC but provides a quiet comfort when you are ready to settle in for the night. Class without being stuffy or snobby. We hope to have return trip and longer stay!

The friendly service we received from every member of the Iroquois staff is among the best we have received at any hotel. They really tried to make you feel at home. The rooms, lobby, and restaurant are also welcoming and comfortable. The location of the Iroquois could not be more convenient. We will plan to stay here on our next trip to New York.

A fantastic mid-town location, decent rates, clean room, friendly and helpful staff. Check often as rates change frequently. Coffee and cider are available during the day in the lobby and newspapers are plentiful as well.
user_name:
Gary B
Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States

review_body: The Iroquois is our favorite we had wonderful stay the reservation staff was more than accommodatingWhen we arrived we were met by another staff of gracious doormen who met us with a smile a young man John took our bags and made us know we had no worries Amanda at the front desk also made us know we had no worries we shared alot of laughs she is the one of the reasons we'll return the entire staff from doormen to front desk room service all the staff is the best we recommend you book your next trip to New York with this wonderful group

All the staff was amazing and they have gone beyond to provide services during our stay with them.Concierge Bill and Vanessa was always available to answer and provide information.On our arrival, my partner had a swollen foot from an accident the night before, Bill had bag of ice organised to be sent to our room.Vanessa not only provided directions but would actually go through the map and write all the details on the map. She made phone calls etc without asking her to do so.The bell boys, John and Seth, always available to go beyond to assist.We had a long flight arriving 6am, check in is in the afternoon however, the front desk made all effort to have the room ready by 11.30 knowing how tired we were.

Location good but the hotel for us didn't live up its luxury rating. The rooms were quite small and badly lit, our first room was very noisy. However, we were upgraded to a room size that we had expected in the first place but the lighting in this room was even worse. Our friends room was also very cramped, badly lit and lacked a fridge even though the room rate was the same.

Really enjoyed our stay here. Great value and what a wonderful team working at the hotel. The room was great for 3 people and was kept spotless every day. So helpful which was really great as it was our first time in NY. Nice and central for sightseeing and great for shopping. Will be back definately
user_name:
Margaret M
Rosyth, Scotland, United Kingdom

review_body: We had a one night stay here while we attended a show. It was cold and rainy and we were dreading the check in process.The minute we pulled up to the curb, the valet attendant was there and our bags were all put into the hotel lobby while we checked in. So seamless. I must add here that we had been in London for a week and our bags were quite cumbersome. Everyone at this hotel greeted us with such hospitality. Everything was seamless. As we were leaving for the play, it was raining and they handed my daughter an umbrella to use. We had raincoats. The location is a perfect as it can be - Times Square is two blocks away as is Bryant Park. But the hotel is so quiet you would never know it. The hotel itself is beautiful. It's not your Holiday Inn or even Marriott. It has such character with its dark wood paneled walls and the quaint library in the lobby. I felt more like I was in England than in NYC. The room itself was a good size by NYC standards. The bed was very comfortable as was the bedding. They have DVD players in the room and you can check out DVD's in the hotel lobby. The room was very clean and, as I said, once you closed the doors, you heard little outside of the room. Very solid hotel.We will definitely stay here next time we are in NYC. I highly recommend it on every level - from comfort to cleanliness to customer service.

This is a great small hotel, with quiet rooms, comfortable beds, and a friendly staff. The rooms are small, but no surprise in Midtown! Location is perfect, A couple blocks from Grand Central Station, and close to Times Square and theaters.

Well what can we say. From our arrival til our departure the staff were there and ready to answer anything that we wanted. There shoe shine service is the best I have ever used in a hotel and it is free. I always ask myself 1 question after departing a hotel, would I stay here again? And the answer is YES in a heartbeat! Thanks for everything and making our stay memorable.

Charming hotel with excellent staff, friendly and helpful. Great location and spotlessly clean. My room was small and inadequate for two ladies. As the hotel was fully booked there was no suitable alternative available.

This is my 2nd visit to NYC with a stay at the Iroquois, and it was fantastic. The staff at this facility are very friendly, always offering to help and expecting nothing but a smile in return. I will always stay at this property when in NYC because it is close to great entertainment, food and fun. Again the staff at this hotel really contribute to a great experience.

We were in a suite for the weekend at The Iroquois. The location is excellent - accessible to all parts of Manhattan. The rooms were charming. The service from the staff was very good. Nothing but good things to say about this hotel.

Beautiful clean room, beautiful safe block, stayed on the 3rd floor, absolutely quiet, no street noise, no noise coming into our room from other rooms, great night's sleep in wonderfully comfy beds. Great diner right on the corner, too many restaurants to name just a short walk away, different prices so you can choose whatever fits your budget. The service was wonderful, very knowledgeable, pleasant people who gave us anything we requested. The room was big in a small hotel, filled with old world charm but modern amenities, all for a great price! Will stay again.
