I have stayed at the Iroquois twice before, this last trip; which I bookended with 2 stays before and after a trip to Paris. Both rooms were clean and well appointed, but the bathrooms are starting to show some age. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are quiet. All of the staff is very friendly and accommodating and (IMO)it is a perfect location to theaters, restaurants, and transportation.

Several couples came from Chicago to enjoy a weekend in New York. We all wanted to stay in the same area. Some stayed across the street and some stayed at the Iroquois. The rooms were small, as expected, but I was not prepared for the dark and depressing feeling in the room. There is a big difference between being true to the historic style of a hotel room and just having old stuff. My major complaint was the lighting inside our room. If there had been better lighting available in the room, it would not have seemed so dark and dirty. The bathroom was small and outdated. No counter top. We were told that they are renovating some rooms. So ask for a new room.. or bring a flashlight to find items in your suitcase! With some updates, I believe the historic and gorgeous building could be grand once again!

The Iroquois New York exceeded my expectations on all levels. I will be back! Great location near Broadway. Very quiet and very comfortable. I am so happy I found this hotel. Fantastic staff in all departments.

I stayed two midweek nights at the Iroquois, very conveniently located just blocks from Bryant Park and my two conference locations. The staff were extremely welcoming, and the place is a charming boutique hotel. The front desk staff had a bowl of clementines at hand--a very thoughtful and energizing gesture. The view from the windows could be better, but then again, who spends time looking out a hotel window when there is so much to do in this city? The room was a bit small compared to what you see in chain hotels, but very comfortable, a restful haven after a busy day. I loved that there was a tub, not just a shower. My one complaint was that the items on the minibar were a bit pricey; fortunately, there are plenty of other snack/drink options right down the block. I don't get to travel much, and this felt like luxurious getaway, some "me" time, even though it was for business.

Very comfortable hotel in midtown. There were so many wonderful members of the Iroquois staff that truly enhanced my vacation. Christoph at the front desk, Vanessa and Bill at the concierge desk, Carlos the doorman, along with their colleagues, made us feel special. And because use this was a very special trip to celebrate my niece's birthday, the extra effort was really important to me. It is very evident that the staff takes pride in doing their job well. The bed and pillows were super comfortable and the hotel restaurant is well worth the splurge! And the walking tour that the hotel provides is extremely well done.

Excellent location. Friendly helpful staff. Very comfortable beds. No bothersome noise. Only downside was the docking station was for old style iPod so bring your chargers and adaptors. Didn't use the restaurant or room service so can't comment on that. Would recommend.

I am in NYC several times a year on business and always stay at this hotel. Staff is friendly and very accommodating. They have also noted my preferences so I get the room I like. It's a well-appointed boutique type hotel.

The service, accommodations, and location were excellent. We highly recommend the Iroquois for business and pleasure. It is near theaters, trains, buses to almost everywhere. The staff were very warm and helpful. Only issue was a noisy toilet and a constantly humming machine of some sort nearby.

I love this small hotel in a great location. The helpful friendly staff made me feel at home. I also like the quiet relaxed atmosphere. An easy walk to all the Broadway theatres. Will definitely return.

We've stayed at the Iroquois 3 other times. The location is perfect for sightseeing/business/dining, which is why we are there. The rooms are a fair size, even for NY hotels and the bathrooms are full size which is also nice for NY. There is no grand lobby, which we like, giving the hotel a boutique feel. There is a 'library' that always has coffee/tea for guests to grab and go. The staff is extremely accommodating. We look forward to staying there again.

The Iroquois works. It's in a perfect Midtown location....minutes from TimeSquare and all the hustle and bustle, yet once you step inside the lobby and especially the rooms, it's a peaceful oasis. The staff is very attentive and the place is impeccably clean.

The Hotel was good people were great -except the Bar - thy were rude and unfriendly- they are not interested in your business if you have more than a few people in your group. The hotel and staff was very good but if you have a group you may want to look elsewhere if you plan on getting a drink before dinner and a show.

My daughter, cousin, and I stayed here for three nights in March. I would highly recommend this charming hotel. The rooms were huge, by New York standards, and service was superb. We were greeted with chocolates every night, and the front desk staff was very helpful in answering our questions. The beds were very comfortable.

We have stayed here several times. You can't beat the location just a block from all the action in Times Square, but very quiet. Rooms are NY small, but very nice. Marble baths, nice bedding and flat screen TVs. Library in lobby really cozy and great to have a nice coffee or tea which is complimentary. Staff is very friendly and really gives you personal attention. Highly recommend.

My wife and I stayed overnight to celebrate a weekend getaway in NYC to see a show and see some of the sights for our anniversary. We took a train in to get an early start and were expecting to drop off our bag and be on our way to check in later. The staff was great and checked us in very early AND had upgraded us! We also had a surprise treat waiting for us. Everyone was so nice and helpful and the room was great and spacious. Not what are used to in NYC. The location was great for walking to Rockefeller, Times Square, dinner and our Broadway show. We both slept like babies when we got back late that evening! *We did drop in on the bar before we called it a night and it was packed, the only knock on it was the drink variety and price range but still a good time. This was our first time staying here and we definitely would again in a heartbeat! -Jason

This Hotel has an Amazing staff, the location is ideal as you are walking distance from 5th avenue, a ton of restaurants. Overall: exceptional location, room accommodations & very affordable rates. We Found the PERFECT place to stay in NYC! Highly recommend

I highly recommend it for location,value and service!The only comment I have is that The Triomphe restaurant breakfast price is ridiculously high!Cafe Boulud is next door and phenomenal!I truly enjoyed the staff and the little morning coffee library with the WSJ and NYT!

We were very happy with our stay. The location can't be beat, we walked everywhere or took the metro from grand Central (just 2 blocks away). Comfortable beds, slept very well. Entire staff was very welcoming and helpful. We recommend the Iroquois and would stay again. Two things to note, there is no coffee maker in room, they do offer complimentary coffee and fruit in the lobby, and avoid ordering top shelf martini at the little bar in front of check in desk (my small-ish drink was $23). Overall, a wonderful stay, we loved it!

The Iroquois is an excellent location. Close to everything in Midtown Manhattan, but also away from the crush on Times Square. A comfortable although small room (hey, it's NYC) and friendly and helpful staff. This was our second stay. We would definitely recommend to others.

Highly recommend the Iroquois! It's a beautiful historic hotel, with a midtown location that makes it convenient to the theatre district. We received great service from a very professional staff, and really enjoyed our stylish room and extremely comfy bed. I would also like to mention their Library just off the lobby--a coffee and tea room with books and newspapers of their guests. Loved our stay!

I liked this hotel because it was small, cozy and comfortable, and centrally located close to Time Square. It also had much better ambiance than chain hotels. My three suggestions for improvement would be:1. Provide complimentary water. If your room rate is US$250 per night, don't charge your guests $9 for a bottle of Fiji water in the room, especially since the hotel is a bit old and the tap water probably not healthy to drink. 2. There is an excellent diner next door with a 4-star TripAdvisor rating. Suggest you price your hotel's breakfast accordingly, or better still include it in your room rate. I had a great breakfast next door at the diner for $10. 3. The shower is a bit of a trickle. Would have been nicer to have been able to shower with a better water flow. Notwithstanding the above, I did like this hotel and do recommend it.

I don't think I will be returning to the Iroquois . . . even thought the location is conveniently located to Broadway and restaurants, the quality of the hotel and value related to price is really, really poor.

Great little hotel, good service, good location for transportation access and shopping. The staff is helpful and courteous. The rooms are not huge but not tiny either. Only addition I would like would be an in-room coffee service.

My family and I stayed for one night and from the moment we walked in the staff was gracious and professional. Once we walked in to our room there was a personal letter welcoming us to the hotel with chocolate as well as coloring books for the kids. That night we left to an event and the front desk asked if we are enjoying are stay and if we needed anything to please let them know. There is nothing I love more then a hotel that genuinely wants to make sure you are having a great stay and The Iroquois Hotel definitely did that. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was because we ordered room service for breakfast and when it finally came the food was cold but it could have just been a busy morning so make sure you get an estimate of time before you decide to order.
user_name:
sylvita8e
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here with my daughters, loved it. All staff were helpful and attentive. Room was comfortable and quiet. Very good location as most main attractions were not too far to walk to. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

We had a wonderful stay at the Iroquois Hotel. The staff is great and wiling to help you in any way. The location could not be better. Two blocks from Broadway. Close but not too close. Would definitely stay there again.

I was only here one night but my room was comfortable enough for a much longer stay. I had a deluxe queen room which was quite nice. The bathroom actually had shelves, towel bars and hooks to make it useful unlike so many minimalist bathrooms you find elsewhere. This is an old fashioned hotel, so I do miss a coffee maker in the room (there is complementary coffee in lobby). But the personal service is great, the bed comfy and the price is excellent for a midtown quality hotel.

Each spring I stay here for an annual business meeting I have at the City Bar Association across the street. The staff is fantastic and welcoming. The room is always spectacularly appointed and immaculately clean.

We had a great weekend at the Iroquois Hotel once again and were helped tremendously by the concierge, Mr. Bill Heinrichs, after we fouled up our show tickets. He made some calls and got us in after we mistakenly bought tickets for the wrong show.
user_name:
bhnf
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed at this hotel in April 2016 and did not hesitate to book the same hotel in March 2017 to bring my husband as a tenth wedding anniversary gift. The concierge was extremely helpful prior to arrival and helped me arrange a surprise cake to be in the room on arrival. Additionally, the concierge kindly surprised me too by providing chocolate dipped strawberries and red wine in our room on arrival. This was a wonderful gesture and was completely unexpected but genuinely appreciated. The room was very nice with an alarm clock that had a USB port and a lightning docking station which enabled charging without the need for a UK to US plug adaptor. There were bath robes in the room and good quality toiletries. We had cocktails in both Triomphe and Lanterns Keep over our stay. The chocolate martini is delicious. The hotel is in an excellent location which puts you in the heart of the city. Overall, a fabulous 2nd stay and if I visit NYC again, this would be my first choice.

Personal, friendly service in a comfortable room at an ideal location. This is our second stay and we would definitely return. The hotel's quality is very much down to the lovely staff and the diligence and personal attention of the manager, Breandan. He is genuinely concerned that all of his guests have a truly great experience, which we did.

There was never a moment when I felt like the staff was not happy to have me there, was not happy to help in any way. They were pleased to be of any service that I required. I felt they were exceptional at every level. I had nothing but an excellent experience there. Moving forward, I will always stay at the Iroquois for any NYC visit I make. I look forward to checking out the special rates and prices that your reception staff told me were available on your website. I understand that weekends are often less expensive and certain months. Thank you for a wonderful stay in your perfectly located hotel!

We went to the city for our anniversary and to see a show (Saw On Your Feet - GO!). We booked the hotel last minute at a great rate for New York. The hotel was in a TERRIFIC location - near Grand Central and Broadway. Easy to get to - we walked everywhere except when we went to Lincoln Center when we took a cab- and we felt very safe walking in the area near the hotel. The room was small but comfortable. Bathroom was updated and bedding was very nice. We were near the two elevators so we had a little hallway noise while folks waited for elevators, but we didn't hear a peep from any rooms around us. Our only challenge was the heat was through a small unit that also provided air conditioning - we didn't figure that out for a while and when we finally turned the unit on, it was really too loud to keep on while trying to sleep. Thankfully the bedding was extremely warm and comfortable but late night trips to the bathroom were definitely chilly! Overall a great place to stay and the convenience couldn't be beat. Lovely offer of morning coffee and tea, and apple cider in the afternoons. I also understand the hotel offers walking tours when the weather is nicer. Desk staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. I would stay here again.

Nice rooms, excellent service, comfortable bed. Nice Street, friendly helpful staff. Really enjoyed the hot apply cider on a cold March day in the library. Will stay again next time I'm in New York City.

I can't say enough good things about this hotel and its staff. Having taken a redeye from Los Angeles, I arrived with no luggage (see my JetBlue review) at 8:30 in the morning. Not only were they able to get me into a lovely room, they even provided me with a compatible phone charger so that I could charge my rapidly dying cell phone. Great location, great service, great ambiance...just GREAT!

The Iroquois is a hidden gem that dates from the golden age of NYC "hotels with personality." The rooms are typically New-York-cozy, but well laid out and comfortable. Amenities are adequate and well-maintained, and the location makes for a short stroll either to the many attractions of Theater District, or further up 5th Avenue to the endless delights of museums such as the Frick and the Met.The Lanterns Keep bar is jammed most evenings with younger and very animated locals, but the Triomphe restaurant offers a smallish bar of its own, which is much better suited most times for a nightcap and some quiet conversation.Don't overlook the Library room, which offers good coffee, newspapers and comfy furniture for a nice start to the day, or as a respite between sorties out into Manhattan's many attractions. Computers are also on-hand, for us dinosaurs who still prefer to check e-mail that way, instead of poking at the tiny screen on a cell-phone all day and night.The staff and front desk were unfailingly pleasant and helpful during our stay, and quickly sorted out a problem we were having with charging our phones.In sum, the Iroquois offers solid value and a great location as a base-camp while taking in the many delights of New York.

The Iroquois is always a delight. Great location, perfect size and wonderful staff. We love coming to NY and staying in a home away from home. The size allows for familiarity and wonderful warm feeling.

This is an awesome historic hotel wonderfully close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Bryant Park. We have probably stayed at a dozen hotels around Times Square and this is by far the most delightful. Our room was spacious and extremely comfortable. The staff are friendly; the hotel is super clean; and the location is unbeatable. We had great wi-fi. This is a wonderful hotel is unbeatable, and we would never hesitate to stay here again.

A fabulous room to retreat to in midst of midtown Manhattan. Total comfort and lots of help with making the most of New York experience. Room Upgraded by the reception staff, concierge and door staff always helpful and friendly. Quality of room finish and amenities were excellent.

Really enjoyed our stay. Very convenient location, 5 minutes walking distance to 5th Avenue & just a few minutes walk from Times Squares. Friendly staff, beds very comfortable. Will definitely return. Would recommend the Red Flame diner a few doors away for a good breakfast.

Staff and hotel are hands down the best in the city. Food was amazing, room and accommodations exceptional. By far the best hotel in NY. It's right in the middle of everything and convenient shops near by!

On a recent trip to New York, I stayed at the Iroquois, a small, independent hotel in midtown. It is a few blocks east of Times Square and the Theater District and a short walk from the shops of Fifth Avenue. Its rooms are comfortable, clean and well-kept. The staff that I encountered while staying there – from housekeeping to bell staff and front desk – were all friendly, efficient and welcoming. The hotel’s location is a short walk to many tourist attractions. However, it is far enough away that it is rather quiet, a welcome break from the noise and bustle of the City.On the whole, I enjoyed my stay at the Iroquois. I certainly will consider it for future visits to New York.

Enjoyable but room was warm. Staff frienfly and helpful. Close to everything and easily within walking distance of times square. It was a pleasurable experience, and good value. Just try to adjust temperature controls in room

I've stayed here a number of times - some of the rooms are very small and my experience has been that none of the rooms have nice views, but I love it. It's small and cozy, and everyone in the hotel is nice - from the front desk and concierge to the housekeeping. It has some "old world charm" feel to it, and they give you free coffee and newspapers in the small library. This time we got there so late that I guess they were out of regular rooms, so we got upgraded to a remarkably large suite: bigger than my 1-bedroom apartment when I lived in NY! The elevators can be a little slow but nothing that ever bothered me. I've never had any trouble with noise from other rooms. It's a great location for proximity to Broadway shows. We like to walk so we even walked to Lincoln Center, which took about 20-25 minutes. It's not fancy (except for my suite!) but it's my go-to place when I'm traveling to NY.

Brilliant location , spotlessly clean hotel, friendly welcoming staff, nothing was too much trouble , quiet room by New York standards, well equipped room with safe and refrigerator, good value and we certainly stay again.

So many good things to say about The Iroquois .. location, cleanliness, quality (friendly and professional) service and 100% comfort. We always look forward to our stay here, as they never miss. The hotel, its staff and amenities offer excellent value. We don't look elsewhere when staying in NY...

We spent our annual long weekend in New York with another stay at the Iroquois. This is a true boutique hotel with superb, helpful staff and delightful rooms. Ours was on the 9th floor this time - and it was simply great. Substantial space; large bathroom with plenty of storage area; comfortable king bed. Although the room faced 44th Street, we experienced virtually no traffic/emergency vehicle noise.We have stayed at the Iroquois about 6 times - and will continue to do so each time we return to New York. It is a great hotel, reasonably priced, outstanding in every way.

Nice boutique hotel two blocked from Times Square. Typical small NYC hotel room. Bathroom was good size. Comfortable beds. I would have preferred more lighting. We called maintenance staff for a window blind issue and the guy was there right away. All the staff were friendly and always asked if we needed anything. Bar didn't open until 7 and was closed on Sunday so we never ate at the restaurant or bar. There's a diner right out the front door. Convenient. Late hours and good breakfast spot. I'd recommend the Iroquois and would stay here again.

Great location and price for a nice room in midtown Manhattan, that's what I call priceless. If you prefer a small hotel over a madhouse lobby this is your place. Stayed for one night over Presidents weekend to see a show and enjoyed every minute of my short stay

My daughter and I travelled to New York last weekend with another mother/daughter pair. The staff at the Iroquois were wonderful! They welcomed us and even entertained our teenage daughters at times! Bill Heinrichs provided great recommendations for places to eat and see while we were there. We will definitely go back and stay at the Iroquois! Alex, Seth, and the rest of the staff-wonderful welcoming committee! By the way, the chocolate covered strawberries are out of this world!

We stayed two nights (Friday and Saturday) in February. Although I knew the hotel from having stayed nearby, I had never stayed there. Chose it on the basis of price and location. The location is terrific--perfectly central for Manhattan. My room was small, but absolutely clean and well appointed. Bed was incredibly comfortable and the room was very quiet. I would definitely prefer a room that was not on the street side of the hotel. Both check in and check out were quick and easy. We did not eat at Triomphe (the restaurant) or visit the bar. The lobby is small and modest. When I called down for ice (no ice machines on the floors), it arrived within a minute or two. I would definitely stay there again.

We have stayed at the Iroquois many times when we spend time in NYC. Easy and comfortable and close to theater. Staff is always efficient and polite. Our room (1009) was blessedly quiet, and the bed was super comfortable.

Check out this location for 5 blocks in any direction on foot you will not be disappointed.You are near Birdland and The Iridium for jazz, and many theatres are within 2 or 3 blocks. Acess to subways and buses in this location will take you anywhere in the 5 boroughs.A great location!

Booked the Iroquois after finding a tremendous price on Black Friday. From the time that we made our reservations until arrival, The Iroquois had been in email contact to ensure that all was ready for our arrival. Helpful maps and information preparing us for our trip. Once we entered the hotel the excellent customer service continued. From check in process to check out all was tremendous!! Room was clean and very comfortable. Plenty of drawer space for clothes. Staff constantly checking to see if there was anything they could do to improve our stay. The Lanterns Keep bar was an amazing little place to relax after a long day of walking the city. Bartenders very social and engaging. Learned a couple of very good tips for making drinks. All in all an A++++ hotel and perfect trip!!

We have stayed here many times through the year. A great hotel for the price. The elegance is a bit worn but you still can't beat it. Comfy beds, nice lobby with hot tea/coffee or cider. Work out room onsite and you are close to EVERYTHING!

Stayed here for 5 nights in a premium king room. Location is perfect -easy access to several subways and walking. Lovely 'old' historic street. Room was very cold and bathroom even more so (not even a heated towel rail). When we asked we were given a small heater which helped. Bed was super comfy and room facilities good. Housekeeping was a bit hit and miss (dirty glases left and not replaced).Coffee and hot cider where a nice touch. Didn't eat in triumph but did have a few cocktails in the lanterns keep, which were fantastic, really original and fab flavours. Offered us gym to change after storing our luggage which was really appreciated. Overall nice hotel with friendly staff, doormen especially great.

The Iroquois is ideally situated in Midtown Manhattan; a stone's throw away from Times Square, the library and Grand Central Terminal. The hotel houses a restaurant offering French cuisine and 'Lantern's Keep' (a cocktail bar).The staff gave me a warm welcome and greatly assisted me in a somewhat rushed departure, they're very accommodating and demonstrated the ability to go the extra mile.

We spent a weekend in NYC and wanted to stay near Times Square. The Iroquois offered a great location. Room was clean, bathroom impeccable with bath robes provided. It was newly renovated. The room itself was small but that's fine as we don't spend a lot of time in there. Good quality television and free wifi with our package. Fruit available at front desk and coffee in the am. We had a small trouble taken care of efficiently and with a smile. Would return.

We stayed here for the location and b/c we got a deal, as Triomphe was having an anniversaryspecial during this time. The room and bath were more than adequate, but nothing special. Theservice was uniformly excellent. from baggage to front desk to concierge. Did not use the restaurantor room service. We like the 44th St. location and would stay here again.

This hotel has it all: location, amenities, friendly service and within walking distance to all major attractions. Our room was incredibly quiet (I was shocked!), and small details like the turn-down service give the feeling of a luxury boutique hotel.

Really loved staying at this midtown gem of a hotel. My girlfriend was celebrating her birthday and we stayed here before catching a Broadway show. This hotel is central to midtown theatres. Short 5 minute ride or walk. The front desk staff was so very sweet and gave us a quiet corner room as well as provide a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries as a birthday welcome for my girl. Really friendly and happy staff! Will definitely return. Thank you Iroquois!

My friend and I have been staying at the Iroquois for years. We always return because it is a well run property, has a great staff and a great location. The hotel is very good about keeping the property up to date and in good condition. The bar and the restaurant are very nice additions--it is convenient to have such nice places in connection with the hotel. Over the years, I have sent people to the Iroquois.

The Iroquois is a beautiful boutique hotel within easy walking distance to Times Square, the Theater District, and Central Park. Our room was beautiful and comfortable. I love the vintage charm of the Iroquois. The staff were friendly and helpful. This is my second stay, and I plan on returning!

We stayed at The Iroquois for 8 nights and had an incredible time. The location in Midtown was very convenient with only a two block walk to Times Square and a five minute walk to all of the theatres. All the staff went above and beyond to make our trip special, particularly Vanessa, JJ and Carlos. We stayed in a room on the seventh floor with two double beds and the room was the perfect size and the beds were extremely comfortable. The turndown service with chocolates were a special touch which was great to return to after a night out. We couldn't fault this hotel and would definitely stay here again if we return to New York.

We stayed 7 nights at this hotel. It's in a great location, walking distance to Times Square, Grand Central, and Subway stations. It's very easy to get anywhere from here.The staff was wonderful. We'd definitely stay here again.

Gosh this review is so long overdue. I stayed at the Iroquois Hotel in June 2016 for 4 nights. I booked it through their own website during a promotional anniversary sale. The hotel is not too far from Grand Central Station where I got a shuttle bus to and from JFK. Check in was quick and easy. I had requested a quite room on a high floor and that is what I got. I thought the room would be smaller than it was but I had plenty of room to walk around & there was sufficient storage. Room was spotlessly clean with turndown service each night with a chocolate left on my pillow. The bed was very comfortable. I could hear very little street noise in the room and therefore slept well each night. The bathroom was a decent size also. Molton Brown toiletries were supplied which I just love anyway. I didn't eat breakfast in the hotel but there was a diner a few doors down from the hotel which was good. Complimentary tea and coffee were served in the hotel lobby every morning. This hotel is in a great location in midtown on W44th St. between 5th Ave & 6th Ave. I was going to see a play in the Belasco Theatre which was a block away also on W44th St. so it was very convenient. Near subway at Grand Central & Times Sq. I love New York. It's a great place to visit. This hotel was great. I was so pleased with my choice to stay there & I would highly recommend.

We're suburban NYers who stayed in the city for the weekend for a birthday celebration. This was our first time at the Iroquois and we were delighted with our choice. It's a gracious boutique hotel with a friendly and responsive staff. Our room's decor was lovely and the hotel breakfast was delicious. Location couldn't be better: the hotel is on a quiet, pleasant street off Fifth Avenue -- it's near several other small hotels and the Harvard Club -- yet minutes from the theatre district, a few blocks from Grand Central, and less than a mile from Penn Station. The "library" -- a book-lined room off the lobby -- offers hot drinks and a comfortable place to read. My one small gripe: There was no coffee maker in the room.

Nice location and relatively quiet considering it is close to major thoroughfares. The hotel is small and the rooms (depending on what you get) can be chopped up a little different. The place as a storied history. The bar is classy and cozy; there are some nice restaurant choices not far away. The street in general has some nice properties. Getting a taxi or UBER is easy. It is a good choice for a business stay in midtown overall. I would return.

Great location, rooms are very clean, good beds, friendly and helpful staff. A little noisy at night hearing some of the mechanicals. If you like it toasty in your room I'm not sure this is for you, I like it in the low to mid 60's at night.

The hotel's location is in midtown - convenient to Broadway shows, Times Square, and Grand Central Station. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and while not large, aren't small either. Would highly recommend .

The Iroquois is a great mid-range hotel in an ideal location in midtown Manhattan. The rooms are small but elegant and comfortable, with updated bathrooms. The library in the study is a cozy spot to drink coffee and read the New York Times.

Just returned from a 3 night wedding anniversary weekend with 3 couples. This hotel was absolutely wonderful if you enjoy historic detail, friendly and caring front desk folk ( Amanda), excellent concierge services (Bill), and a cozy, quiet respite within walking distance of subway and theater district. Everything went so well, from reservations, to extended check out. It was super freezing for this Miami couple and it felt great to enjoy the warm cider in the library. Our room was small, and well equipped with a terrific king bed. So appreciated the kind recognition of our anniversary. This hotel will be our go to NYC one for sure. Only wish we had had the time to go to the highly rated restaurant Triomphe, but we intend to on our next visit.

We stayed here for 5 nights in Oct/Nov 2016.The hotel is in a great location for exploring NY, just of Times Square and central for most attractions. The room was slightly smaller than we expected, but was decorated and maintained to a high standard. The staff were friendly and helpful, we arranged a car service back to JFK for around $80 which wasn't that much higher than the cost of a cab. They also stored our bags on the last day, and offered us the use of the gym to shower and change prior to our flight home. This was a very much appreciated gesture and went a long way to making our journey more comfortable.We did not eat at the hotel, but found a excellent diner at the corner of street which served up great, huge Americana breakfasts. Upon reflection I would happily stay here again, mainly for the quality of service we received, the standard of room and the location.

Location is what this hotel has going for them and the staff is amazing. The rooms need to be updated with hardware and to make it more efficient for business traveler. Room size is good, quiet and you won't be disappointed

About two blocks off of Times Square so it was quite, not too must cat or pedestrian traffic. Rooms are New York sized (small) but clean, up to date and had everything you needed. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Only critique is the room was warm, and temperature not really adjustable.

Thoroughly enjoyed our 8 days at the Iroquois! Great location, close to everything, comfortable rooms, nice bathroom, beautiful old building. The staff were amazing! Very welcoming and helpful. Can't recommend this place highly enough! Special thanks to Amanda Scalzo at Reception for making our stay so special! Also Alex at front desk and Jay-Jay the loveliest doorman I've ever met. Thank you all for such a beautiful stay in NYC

The Iroquise is very nice Hotel. OK Size room for New York and everything is clean and nice. The Hotel has a nice "old spirit" and You meet a lot of happy returning customers.The Staff is really amazingly helpfull and good organized. The Front desk manager Amanda Scalzo is a great help. She is organized, helpfull and do everything she can to help out. I will stay there again.

Great hotel in a great location. Staff are friendly and efficient. Definitely reccomend this hotel for a visit in NYC. Restaurant is good and the location is perfect: close enough to everything without being stuck in the crowds. Loved it.

The Iroquois was at the center of a perfect weekend we had Manhattan, celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary. We splurged on a one bedroom suite, and were rewarded by an especially large living room area, tastefully furnished. The location on 44th Street couldn't have been better -- on Friday night, we had dinner a block away on 44th Street; on Saturday, a block and a half away on 43rd Street; and went to the show "Beautiful" practically around the corner. Best meal of all: Saturday brunch with our children and grandchildren in one of the hotels small private dining room, where the service and the food were both excellent. What particularly distinguished Iroquois from other hotels we've stayed at was the warmth and friendliness of the entire staff, from doorman to concierge to front desk. We can't wait to visit again.

My husband and I were attending Broadwaycon in NYC this past weekend and choose to return to The Iroquois for our fourth stay at this boutique hotel. We liked the hotel, it's location and service. Unfortunately, this time it was NOT a four star experience.This time on arrival, we noted that our room was far too hot. We lowered the thermostat to 60F and opened the bathroom window, then went out to visit NYC. On our return, we noted no change in the temperature and had to call for assistance in order to open the 2nd window in the bedroom. No relief. It remained too hot to sleep well ALL night.FAR more bothersome was the mechanical device that was frequently rattling and banging in the wall directly beside the bed at 20 minute intervals ALL night long! The combination of both these things meant little rest for both of us on our first night in NYC. The next morning, Kelli, Director of Front Office at the hotel, immediately expressed concern when we related our issues and upgraded our room at no charge, arranging for our belongings to be moved while we attended our convention. Our new room was a definite improvement, with two exceptions:1) the bathroom while gorgeous,had no thermostat and with NO windows open was FREEZING 2) there was no hot water on our final morning, which necessitated a change in our plans for our final morning. Eventually, hot water was finally restored. As we checked out, another discussion with Kelli about our latest issues, lead to the cost of one night's stay being deducted from our bill. That was fair and done proactively by Kelli.While we remain disappointed with our experience, we were most appreciative of Kelli's proactive efforts, professional and empathetic attitude and her personal involvement to redress the situation. She also escalated our concerns to the General Manager, who did contact my husband via email twice to apologize. We have been travelling to NYC for almost 30 years, and we have never chosen to stay at ANY hotel four times. We love this section of 44th St. and have stayed in 4 other hotels on 44th. We were excited to be coming back to The Iroquois, but honestly, I'm not sure we will stay there again.

Wonderful stay close to Time Square, quiet location. Red Flame diner next door great for breakfast. Front of house were brilliant and helpful nothing was too much trouble. Would recommend this hotel highly

I found this boutique hotel on TripAdvisor, and tired of large chain hotels in New York, I thought I'd give The Iroquois a try. It was a smart move. I got such a good rate on the room, that I decided to splurge and get my grown sons their own room for a change. That was a smart move because the rooms are a bit small, small but well-appointed. The bathroom is spacious and well-equipped, and the room itself is tastefully decorated with very comfortable beds. Because it was my birthday, a bottle of wine and chocolates were placed there for me. They also put my sons' just across the hall from me without my saying a word. The small bar is wonderful, if a bit pricey-great snacks there as well.The hotel is located near Broadway, so getting to the theaters was super convenient.The only things I have a complaints about are the lights and the outlets for charging phones. In my room, in order to have the bedside table on you have to have the main lights on, so you had to get out of bed to turn off the bedside lamp. I had to charge my phone in the bathroom because there were no convenient outlets in my room. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

This Hotel is quaint. The rooms were small but comfortable. No complaints really. The location is ideal for touring NYC. You can walk everywhere. The hotel is small which i find very nice. Feels more like a home. One note: The Lanterns Keep is very unique. The staff are super nice, and hand craft cocktails. They were a real treat. I would definitely stay here again.

For our 30 year anniversary we went to NYC for Christmas. Our room was very nice with a view of the Chrysler Building. The staff was friendly and helpful. Seth gave excellent restaurant recommendations and Bill found show reservations on short notice.Most of their ideas ended up being highlights of our trip.We stayed 5 nights and had a wonderful experience! I so enjoyed the hot cider when we came in cold every afternoon. When the staff realized it was an anniversary trip, they provided us a special treat.The hotel location was fantastic. Easy walk to Bryant Park, the library, Times Square, the theater district and many restaurants. The room was comfortable with a great bed! Although we were between 2 elevators, I never heard them or other guests. We would definitely stay here again!

Great hotel, great charm, good food, great location. Very service oriented staff. Definitely reccomend this hotel for a visit in NYC. Restaurant is very good and the library has wonderful atmosphere. Loved it.

I've stayed at the Iroquois for several business trips. Always a delightful experience; staff is friendly, rooms are very comfortable and cozy, the boutique hotel style makes for an intimate experience and the location is superb.
user_name:
barbaragY7332HF
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed at the Iroquois Hotel for six nights and couldn't have enjoyed the experience more. We were welcomed back as valued guests. The rooms are lovely, very quiet and very well appointed. It's location on 44th between 5 and 6th is fantastic - so close to the action without the hustle and bustle. The restaurant is amazing as well but it is the service which stands out. All of the staff from the front door to front desk to concierge go out of their way to help and make the experience all that you wish it to be. Bill and Vanessa at the concierge desk are particularly helpful and knowledgeable. We will be back again soon!

This was our second trip to this great hotel! It's close to Grand Central, close to Times Square, the theater district and great restaurants, yet on a quiet street. The staff are so nice and professional. We had a large, beautiful room, newly decorated. The bed was super comfortable too. I highly recommend this hotel!

The location and atmosphere of the hotel were top notch. The rooms are clean, updated, and have everything you need including chocolates on the pillow at night! I would highly recommend this hotel to any type of traveler.

Would happily return to the Iroquois anytime. Friendly staff, quiet and handy midtown location, The room was small, but it is NYC, Only issues were the a/c is turned off in the winter and the room was very warm. I also would have appreciated a bin for recyclables.

We came to NYC for a weekend getaway and once again stayed at the Iroquois Hotel. We found the rooms to be great as always. The rooms are clean and quiet and the staff is very helpful and nice. This is our go to place when we visit New York.

The hotel's location is very convenient to Times Square and Bryant Park The staff was friendly and helpful and provided suggestions on sightseeing. Our room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. Would absolutely stay here again!

Based on the reviews here I expected better. We had an ok stay, but nothing special. Rooms are small and older. I particularly would not recommend a stay here in the winter because the room was cold and the bathroom was freezing. Probably the older style windows are to blame. Management could help a bit by putting in bath mats in the winter. If I return I would prefer some other more modern hotels in the area with similar or lower prices. The location is very good if you want to walk to theaters.

First time staying here ~ we chose it because of the ambience & different than the typical large NYC hotel; If you want to enjoy a quaint, beautifully decorated hotel - stay here! What a pleasant surprise! It was beautiful, clean & from the moment we walked in, we were greeted with friendly hellos; Room was clean, comfortable & had so many amenities that we loved that you do not always get nowadays, i.e., mini bar, split bottles of wine, robes, turn down service; Bathroom is a bit small, but not an issue; Would definitely return as we did not get to check out Lantern's Keep! Great value for the price & location to theatre district; Breakfast was very good also; Look forward to the next stay!

It's one thing to have smart daughters with their smartphones in NYC, but Kia gave us a personal demonstration on how to use our Metro cards--not intuitive!! We were grateful for her assistance and found our way on the bus and subway for the next 2 days.

We spent a night at the Iroquois before the Women's March in January, and could not have been happier. Everyone was so welcoming. The room was small but elegant and very clean and quiet; the downstairs had a lovely "library" and two great bars. We didn't have a chance to try the French restaurant--but it looked lovely. Would stay there agin in a heartbeat.

This is a great New York hotel. The location is perfect for both theater fans and those who want to enjoy the tourist sites. Bryant Park and 5th Avenue are a few steps away. Our room was exactly what we needed: comfortable, clean, and cozy. The staff was terrific and the price was right! We will stay there again.

This was my second stay at The Iroquois, and I'm thrilled to have found my definitive New York City hotel. Rooms are not particularly large, but everything is high quality. Comfort of bed, along with lack of noise and light, makes for a great night's sleep. Service is wonderful, and location is excellent. I highly recommend this charming hotel.

My mother, sister and I travelled to New York for Christmas. I wanted somewhere very central to stay, so that we could easily walk everywhere, but I also wanted somewhere that was affordable and comfortable! I got my wishes with the Iroquois. The service was exceptional, right down to the complimentary umbrellas on rainy days and a DVD loan service. The room we stayed in was very comfortable for all three of us. Yes it was "cosy" but there was a large set of drawers so we could unpack all our clothes and put our suitcases away in a large cupboard, so we weren't falling over our gear either. It was probably a relatively generously sized room for NYC, as I understand almost anywhere you stay is a squeeze. I loved the coffee and hot apple cider that were provided in the library every day - great winter warmers. Also the daily newspaper and chocolates with turndown service were so lovely. We were within easy walking distance of Times Square, Broadway shows, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller and Macy's, and a little further of a walk to Central Park. Thank you Iroquois for helping our stay in New York to be as magically Christmassy as we had hoped for!

We've been staying at the Iroquois for years and love it. It's in a great location, has a wonderful staff, comfortable rooms, reasonable price. It's close to Times Square, Grand Central, shopping, restaurants, etc. Definitely recommend it!

Location couldn't be beat. Near, but not too near, Times Square and theaters. 2 blocks to subway. Excellent directions from JFK by subway. Hotel was entirely satisfactory. Staff were very helpful. Room was clean and bed comfortable. Very quiet.

The location is perfect and the staff at this hotel is the best! We had a great weekend and were very happy with the suggestions from the concierge. The staff went out of their way to assist us...especially Wayne in reservations and Seth the bellman! We were surprised when complimentary strawberries and wine were delivered to our room...much appreciated! I highly recommend this hotel.

Simply and consistently the best. Great location. Street noise can be an issue if room is on 44th. Quality amenities. Excellent and friendly staff. Concierge did a great job. Bell captain was very helpful.

Nice relaxing hotel, middle of many fine restaurants and establishments. Small, very friendly staff and guest. Really enjoyed the restaurants on site. Looking forward to my next trip back, thank you for everything.

Great hotel. Excellent location, 10 mins to Times Square, 10 minutes to grand central station. Went with my daughter had a room with 2 double beds which gave us plenty of room. Lovely fluffy towels, nice touches newspaper and turndown service with chocolates. Loved the chilled water in the library and coffee. Loved New York.

This is boutique hotel certainly worth considering depending upon the room rate you can obtain. Well located between 5th & 6th and minutes from Times Square, Grand Central, Empire State etc. Rooms are compact but dark especially for the rooms that don't overlook the street so if you intend to spend time in the room, ask for a street facing room. Otherwise, staff are friendly and the restaurant is adequate.

This hotel has it all with location, courteous and professional staff, clean and well appointed rooms. When the staff learned it was my granddaughter's birthday a "Happy Birthday" plate was sent to the room filled with sweet goodies! Turn down service at night complete with chocolates.We were able to walk to attractions, restaurants, Broadway, Times Square...great location!!! This is our new "go to" hotel in NYC!!!

My wife and I enjoyed our first stay at The Iroquois. Our room (Premium King) was of decent size, well appointed, and relatively quiet for NYC. The bedding was excellent. The hotel is in an excellent location within a short walk to Times Square, restaurants, and the subway. The staff is very friendly - with a special shout out to Vanessa the concierge. Our breakfast in the hotel restaurant was delicious although expensive and our service came to a standstill while NYC health inspectors were in the kitchen (surprise inspection). Overall, an excellent experience and we will likely stay at The Iroquois again in the future.

Loved this hotel...elegant, central to theater and restaurants and beautifully appointed. Staff was accommodating and very pleasant. We had room 800 right by the elevator and no noise whatsoever. We will definitely return.

I stayed at The Iroqouois for two nights in January while in New York to attend the opera. The hotel is on the fringe of the Times Square area, but just far enough away that you are not right in he middle of the hustle and bustle. Indeed, the area is remarkable quiet given its proximity to Times Square. The hotel is a delight - the room was well-kept, beds were very comfortable, and the service excellent but unobtrusive. Highly recommend The Iroquois if you need to be in mid-town Manhattan yet desire not to be overwhelmed by the usual noise and hubbub of the Times Square area.

Stayed at the Iroquois as my flight out of NYC was cancelled. Great hotel and excellent staff, courteous and professional. The room was spacious and cozy and it relieved the stress faced from my cancelled flight out of NYC. Best location and great service.

My friend has stayed here before and recommend we stay due to size and location. Proved to be very true. Our room small but two beds and yet the bathroom was spacious, clean, and well supplied.Personnel were genuine and most willing to help in all areas. Loved the place, food, and people.Definitely was a good part in me falling in love with NewYork.

I very much enjoyed my stay at the Iroquois New York. Even though it was a short stay it was very memorable. The location was perfect. Close enough to everything, with plenty of great options of places to eat near by. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. Greatly enjoyed the atmosphere as well. Very much looking forward to planning another trip back in the near future and returning back to the Iroquois!

Never a bad stay at the Iroquois I am a Gokd Club member and am treated like royalty. Clean and comfortable rooms and friendly staff at all levels. Breakfast was outstandingTwice a day room cleaning with turndown. Great midtown location

Excellent location. Requested a quiet room, high floor and were given both. Lovely touch of free wine and chocolate strawberries upon arrival for our wedding anniversary. Small, friendly hotel. Will be back!

Average hotel in midtown.While location is good , the rooms are small, breakfast is very basic and most important heating doesn't work in rooms.It's freezing in the rooms.For this price you should be able to find a better deal in midtown.

We enjoyed our staying very much - Front desk and concierge were very friendly, helped and advised ,whenever we asked them . Quitness of the bedroom was excellent. Perfect location of the hotel. Very close to all NYC attractions, subways and trains. Thank you for the very good accomodation and staying in this hotel.

Me & my boyfriend stayed here for a week over the new year and this hotel was the perfect choice. Perfect location with so many sights and shops right on your doorstep. Staff were happy, friendly and did all they can to help. It was the little things like getting up on a morning and being able to go down to the lobby and get tea and coffee, then coming in on an afternoon and getting a hot drink (perfect when its - degrees!). Rooms were lovely we had the most basic room (superior queen) but was pleasantly surprised at the amount of space. We are used to staying in a lot bigger rooms but for the time we spent in it, it was brill. They were also really quiet which was great to get a good nights sleep. 100% would recommend and stay again if we were to return to the big apple!

Stayed at the Iroquois with my wife and daughter over the New Year! What a treat to stay in this bijou elegant hotel which is truely grounded in the history of Manhattan. The hotel is well located within a 5 minute walk of Times Sq, Rockefeller Plaza and excellent restaurants in the heart of midtown

Excellent. Location. And services. Attentive staff and available. Charming library and bar. Easy to get cabs and even a local eatery right next door. The front desk staff could not do enough for us and they had people to flag down cabs. Only blocks from Times Square but on its own quiet street.

Staff was nice and friendly, food and drinks at two different bar/restaurants were excellent. The location kills for theater buffs. DB MODERNE next door- order the scallops! There's a cute side room on main floor with large screen MACs and comp hot chocolate. Complimentary pinot Noir red wine and chocolate in your room. Love this place!
user_name:
D9064XNwilliamt
New York City, New York

review_body: This location has lovely, clean updated rooms, and is quiet, but most of all, I love the staff. The bellhops, front desk, and all service staff go completely out of their way, and make me feel at home even far away from home. I have been returning for years, and will continue to do so. A dreamy spot!

We enjoyed our stay. The location is great, and we were able to walk to most of the sites and restaurants. Valet parking worked well for us. The concigere was extremely helpful with directions and suggesting sites.

Had a great time for the week between Christmas and New Years. Fantastic location close to Bryant Park Winter Village, Rockefeller Plaza, Times Square and 6th Avenue. The staff was amazing. The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet. Elevators run well and the Hot Cider int he library was a big hit..

Everything fine but the hotel should confirm reservations a week prior to arrival. We found the Rooms closets too small and also sometimes the cleaning lady would take all the glasses and didn't replece them ..

Truly exceptional service from staff on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. We felt like honored and appreciated guests the entire visit. From booking the hotel to checking out to picking up our car from the valet, the customer service was second to none. They took care of everything for us. We didn't have to carry luggage or even get our own ice. The bed was comfy. My only gripe was that the bathroom was tiny. GREAT location with good proximity to theaters, but on a quiet stretch of street. Very low noise level in our room. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be treated like royalty!

This boutique hotel has a rich history dating back to 1911 with some of the delightful architectural detail remaining. Centrally located in the theatre district and a short walk to 5th avenue shopping this is an excellent choice for a fun filled weekend in NYC. Coffee and tea is available each morning for guests along with complimentary wifi. Staff was wonderful eager to assist with any questions you may have .
user_name:
Timitraveler
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel was recommended by friends and did not disappoint, the service and facilities were lovely and the staff were very friendly. The central location was excellent for our first visit to New York. The room we had was very quiet and you would not know you were in the central city.

Have stayed at the Iroquois many many times but not recently....not in the past 8 years. It is a welcoming little hotel in an area lined with hotel and restaurant choices. It has an old fashioned feel and the rooms could use an update, but, that said, our small room was very cozy. The shades are excellent, and the room silent. Best feature is the bed - very comfortable. The bathroom small and old fashioned. The cord charging options really need an upgrade. The location is very good...close to many good restaurants; some in other nearby hotels....and close to the theaters and Fifth Avenue. Triomphe restaurant seems to never be full though the food is good with inconsistent service.

Upon checking, we were happily greeted! Checking could not have been smoother!!!! The bellman delivered our bags promptly.The room was very clean~typical size for NYC! Awesome diner a couple of doors down!!!!Hoping to return with my lovely mother for her to experience!!!!Loved our stay~

The hotel is in a quiet area but very close to the subway and major sites. The room is a bit small but the linens are very comfortable and the shower has very good pressure. There is coffee in the lobby every morning and apple cider upon your return in the evening.

My family of three traveled to New York for the Dec. 16 though 19 weekend. The hotel was recommended by a colleague and really, we could not have choosen better! The staff was wonderful and attentive, always one step ahead. The rooms was cozy but very clean and quiet. My only recommendation would be to change the mattresses on the double beds. They were ok, but a little soft with small "body pits" beginning to form the middle. I would highly recommend a stay here.

The Iroquois Hotel is a great place to stay in NYC. It's on a quiet side street. Next door to the Red Flame diner that offers wonderful meals on a budget. The location between 5th and 6th Ave is great. A 10 minute walk to Pen Station, a 15 minute walk to most theaters. The convenience of the location lends itself to walking everywhere!The staff is very friendly and accommodating.The bathrooms are very nice. The bed area is large enough with ample storage.The only downside is the darkness of the rooms and no plugs by the bedside. With the technology we all take with us now that has to be upgraded.I cannot think of a nicer hotel, or better location to stay at.

Best location in Manhattan. Close to most major sights. Many restaurants and cafes in the area. Queit and comfortable bed. Friendly and helpful staff.Big sized room for NYC. Coffee in lobby is a nice touch.

The location of the hotel is great. Not far from the subway, walking distance to the theatre and shops on Fifth Avenue. My room was a Superior Queen. It was smallish but well appointed and kept very clean. Housekeeping was great, the NY Times was delivered to my door each morning and chocolates left on my pillow every night. The concierge (Vanessa) was helpful in making dinner reservations and answering general questions. The morning coffee/tea service in the lobby was nice as was the hot cider in the afternoon. I paid $154.00 per night before taxes which was less expensive than their usual rate and a great value for me.

Hotel situated between 5th and 6th Avenue which is ideal for Times Square and the designer shops. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable although slightly on the small side but all amenities provided. Would not hesitate to recommend.

Smaller hotel with great location close to Times Square, Rockefeller, and 5th Ave shopping. Staff is friendly and responsive. Had a couple service issues, staff worked hard to satisfy. Nice restaurant on property.

Great boutique hotel! We went for a mini moon after getting married on Saturday and the staff made us feel very special. The hotel is in a great location, easy to walk to everything. Down the street from Bryant park and Rockefeller.

The hotel is in a fantastic location, 5th Ave, Times Square, attractions on the doorstep. Really comfy beds & amazingly quiet area for the middle of NYC ! Staff friengly,Would certainly return to this hotel.

Firstly, brilliant location, just a minute from time square and very central. Lovely staff, facilities, and and many restaurants locally. Super busy, as expected, HOWEVER not a good hotel for a family of three. Very small room, bathroom tiny, I.e. If you were told it cost £1,000,000 per square foot , you would understand. Can't really say much else, good for 2 or less people, will not stay again, purely on room size alone, not staff, or cleanliness etc.

Lovely Hotel. Location was excellent. Walking distance to everything. Room was very cozy and comfy. Beautiful Bathroom. I can't want to go back. Staff is very attentive and friendly. Just a wonderful hotel to kick back and relax while enjoying the City.

Amazing stay taking in NY during the holiday season. Great location... walked to theatres and restaurants, Bryant Park and Grand Central terminal, windows on Fifth, yet quiet enough to relax and unwind. Great staff... very experience-based and caring. Absolutely loved Lantern's Keep.

I love Christmastime in NYC and went for a girls' weekend from Dec 9-12. Our meeting point was Penn Station as my friend took the train up from the DC Area and I flew into LaGuardia and took the train into the city. We both had carry-on bags and it was an easy 10 block walk to the hotel. Of course, the only challenge was navigating through the heavy Christmastime crowds but that's to be expected during this time of year. Check-in/Check-out: The staff from the doorman to the front desk were professional, courteous, attentive, and friendly. They greeted us immediately and check-in was fast and efficient. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready yet so the doorman checked our bags and we were able to grab a libation and bite to eat in the hotel's restaurant. As promised, our room was ready after we were done with our meal. Our early checkout was fast and painless. Again, staff was professional, friendly, and peppy, even at 6:00am in the morning! Doorman was there to help us with luggage and a taxi but we ended up walking back to Penn Station, too. Room: We stayed in a room with 2 double beds on the 9th floor. It was cozy and clean with enough space to move around. Beds were firm and comfortable. Bathroom was clean and loved the toiletry selection. The room didn't face the street but you could still hear the outside noise at night. We never heard other guests on our floor. It was nice to get turndown service at night with the chocolates. My only complaint was the lack of an in-room coffeemaker. I'm an early riser and the coffee service in the lobby downstairs didn't start until 7am which was definitely too late for me on Monday morning when I had to be at the train station before 7am to catch the train back to the airport. What I liked best: Location: You can't beat the location. It's half a block away from 5th Ave and a short walk to all the mid-town sites and conveniences: Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, NYC Public Library, Bryant Park, mid-town dept. stores, convenience stores, ATM (corner of 5th), small local eats, subway station, etc. Staff Customer Service: The front staff and doormen were always professional, courteous, friendly, attentive. They always greeted us when we were either leaving or coming back to the hotel. They also have a great knowledge of the area restaurants and bars. On Friday night, the hotel's bar was still busy so the doormen suggested the bar across the street which turned out to be an excellent choice-great vibe and atmosphere and it had a fireplace, too! Perfect to sit by on a cold night. On Sunday night, we had planned to eat at the hotel's restaurant for dinner but it was closed so the front desk staff suggested the restaurant next door which also turned out to be an excellent choice-it wasn't crowded at all and the food and service were excellent. I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in the heart of mid-town Manhattan. You can't go wrong with the Iroquois Hotel. We hope to visit again soon!

My mum and I visited New York just before Christmas and we stayed at this hotel. The hotel was great. It was quite traditional in style and our room was extremely clean, the beds were very comfortable and the room was very quiet (which can be difficult to come across in busy New York). The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the location is perfect for exploring the city as it is located just below Central Park. We had a fantastic stay.

Our stay at the Iroquois, good old hotel with nice amenities, good staff, excellent location, comfortable rooms. Our experience was tainted because of a malfunctioning in room safe. It took 90 minutes to remedy the issue which caused us anxious minutes getting to the airport. The hotel was gracious in getting us a car to the airport and paying for it.

This small hotel is a true gem. We have stayed at this hotel many times and never been disappointed. It is a perfect location in the theater district, a short walk to all theaters and many many restaurants. We highly recommend it.

Great place in a great location. Nice neat rooms, not massive but not small either. We needed to change rooms for some reason and the staff were great about it, even shifted our luggage for us. Always friendly at the front desk and greeted with a smile. Old school set up was pretty cool as well. Small but usable gym for those inclined. Would stay here again.

From the initial call for reservations through check out, excellent customer service. Staff were not only responsive to any requests, but friendly and personable. The great location of the hotel was a bonus.

Iroquois is a quaint location, a bit high priced for mid-week. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Only one smallish window made room dark, but we didn't stay here for the view. Have already recoed for a family member.

Great location on a relatively quiet street in the middle of Mid-Town. Convenient to 5th Ave, Rockefeller Center, many wonderful restaurants. Could walk to Central Park in 15 minutes. Room was very small but well equipped and nicely decorated. Lots of natural light in ours on the 7th floor. Comfy beds. Staff was absolutely amazing. We always made sure we had anything we needed, and were very welcoming. They really make you feel special here during your stay. Will definitely recommend and stay here again.

The Iroquois has been our go to hotel for years in NYC; this trip was excellent, and the hotel contributed to our memorable stay. The service was top notch, and every encounter with staff was helpful and done with courtesy and a smile. The hotel location can't be beat - for our purposes. Will return annually to this superior hotel!

This hotel is in a great location, on a one way street on the quiet side of 44th between 5th and 6th Ave. We walked to everything, Grand Central, MSG, Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park, Macy's. We are great walkers and even walked from Brooklyn over the Brooklyn Bridge and to the hotel, stopping at all the places in between.. Was a full day.

We came in to New York to see the city in all its Christmas splendor, and the Iroquois was the perfect place to begin our visit. It is right in the heart of mid-town, but not too close to TImes Square. They had hot cider in the lobby, excellent cocktails in the lounge, and a staff second to none. The lobby is tiny and simple, but the library is cozy. The rooms are New York small, but well appointed and quite comfortable. I will be back!

Came to New York for my sister in laws surprise 50th! Had a fabulous time in Hotel and in the City. Rooms slightly small at the Iroquois Hotel but staff are fantastic.Hotel was extremely clean and tidy.
user_name:
Sean b
Enfield, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Everything about the hotel was perfect. Fifth or sixth time I've stayed there. Love the location, staff and restaurant. We had a wonderful dinner in the restaurant. The room and amenities were great. Housekeeper was very nice. We were often in the room for turndown and we had some nice conversations.

We frequently visit NYC and might have finally found our go to hotel in midtown. Great little boutique hotel that has a lot of character and the price is reasonable by NYC standards. We got a basic room with queen bed on 5th floor. Negative was that it was right next to elevator and a little warm even though we had heat off. Positive was that the room and bathroom were well furnished and very clean. Staff are excellent and very friendly. Had a drink in hotel bar which was really nice. Didn't try restaurant. We definitely will be back.

We have been staying at The Iroquois Hotel on and off for the past 15 yrs. We were coming back for a special occasion and the first hotel I decided to book was obviously The Iroquois. I contacted the hotel and advised them of the upcoming visit and quite simply, they were AMAZING!!!! The hotel staff did everything they could to make sure that everything was perfect and it certainly was! We checked in and were surprised to find that our room had been upgraded. Upon arrival in our room, we were greeted by a platter of chocolate covered strawberries , a bottle of red wine and a lovely card wishing us the best of celebrations! All in all , I can't say enough about the Iroquois. I have always loved the hotel, location, amenities, proximity to EVERYTHING and just love going back!!! Thanks to Kelli and the entire team for a spectacular effort and for making our celebration perfect!!! We will be back and thanks you very very much for your warmth and kindness! Merry Christmas to you and the entire Iroquois team! See you soon!

Excellent property in the perfect location. Very convenient to all 5th Ave stores, Rockefeller Center, and Theater district. This is a great small hotel with excellent service at all levels. The entire staff was very attentive.

Our first time here. We wanted to be closer to the theater district this visit and decided to try this hotel. Location is perfect! You can walk west to the theaters or east to 5th Avenue to see the holiday decor at stores and Rockefeller Center along this famous Avenue. Out of all the hotels we have stayed at in NYC, this one felt most insulated from the city noise of honking horns and the occasional sirens from fire trucks etc. No noise to wake us up, which is unusual for the west side of town. Staff is lovely, gracious, professional and welcoming. Special thanks to Anna and Amanda for making our visit extra special. They were so nice and helpful when we arrived after Delta rerouted our luggage. They immediately gave us toiletries to get us through the night, complimentary drinks at the bar and delivered chocolate strawberries to our room. Nice touch ladies and greatly appreciated. We booked a deluxe queen room. Roomy for NYC without booking a suite. Mini bar is stocked and reasonably priced. Bed was comfy and the room was very clean. Free wifi too. They offer complimentary walking tours of the city, which I have not seen before. Very cool for tourists who don't know NYC. There is also a great diner a few doors down and a multitude of bars and restaurants nearby. The ambiance is intimate in the lobby and Xmas decor is lovely. Chanukah display is very pretty as both holidays are celebrated this year at the same time. Thank you for a lovely stay here. We are glad to recommend the Iroquois to our friends and family. Happy holidays! ☃️

My fiance and I stayed here for the night when we were going to see Paramour Cirque du Soleil on Black Friday. The front desk woman was very nice and our room was ready. The room was very clean (king bed). The bathroom was pretty small, but nice. I love the Molton Brown products in the bathroom! They are my favorite! The elevators were pretty slow and there were only 2 of them on the floor. The best part is the hotel was 2 blocks from Time Square where the play was. My fiance and I walked straight to the play and it was great when there was a huge crowd trying to leave. It was a nice hotel, but nothing special, great location.

We stayed in a "Deluxe King" room the Iroquois last week for two nights. On average, we stay in the City three to five nights per month for work,and leisure. This trip was booked late the week before and the hotel that where we typically stay was booked solid with several holiday events, so, I chose the Iroquois. We welcome a chance to try a new place, so I tried to select a room with a couple of upgrades vs the lowest level. The deluxe king is advertised as 300-325 square feet, so I was a bit surprised to be given a 15'x12' room on the second floor at the back of the building; must be a "rentable" vs "useable" area calculation there. The room itself was very clean and the bed was quite comfortable and with the exception of the creaking metal door in the service alley one floor below, the room was as quiet as a cave..and the level of outdoor light was similar. The bathroom was also very clean and at around 5x7, your belongings won't get scattered about. The three stars are based upon a room cost that is more typically around $225-250 per night. If $450 were the average, I would lower that rating to two stars. The location is very good and staff at the desk and throughout the facility were always courteous and helpful. So, an extra star for that.
user_name:
GoneOutNow
New York City, New York

review_body: My daughter and I recently visited New York, We booked the Iroquois Hotel on-line and were very pleased when we arrived. We would definitely recommend this Hotel! Excellent location and great accommodations.

Wonderful boutique hotel that we have been coming to for years. It is nice to see the same staff from front desk, doormen to housekeeping. Obviously they treat their employees as well as they do their customers.

The hotel couldn't be more central to Time square and the "Buzz" that New York has to offer.The Staff from the door being opened are welcoming and so very helpful and nothing was to much bother for them.The room was perfect - no view so to speak but hey when you only have to walk down the road to the Square and over a couple of blocks to Rockerfeller why would you be sitting in room? The bed was the comfiest bed ever and if we could have shipped it home it would have been done. There is a mini bar in room (we didn't use but that it because we were only back to wash and sleep). Bathroom had bath and shower which were both good and plenty of shampoo/gel etc if you have forgotten.Superb stay wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

A very nice little hotel. A good location, should you need to be slap bang in the middle of Midtown Manhattan. Pleasant staff. The room was quite small, but that is expected in New York. Beds were comfortable -- high quality Frette bed linen and robes. A negative for some would be that the room had no view, looking directly into a dark back alley. For us, it meant a quiet night's sleep, as all street noise was inaudible. Some of the furniture in the room was starting to look a little tired, but this did not detract from our experience whatsoever. Molten Brown bath products were another nice touch. Even during a very busy period before Thanksgiving, the hotel never seemed crowded or noisy. The hotel organised a well priced airport transfer for us at the end of our stay. Recommended.
user_name:
ludic_bonviveurs
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: This is a good, classic, restored NYC hotel, close to almost everything we need when visiting New York. Cozy but small lobby with good coffee and apple cider available in the library room. The only negative is the small interior bar with no windows and restricted hours, infact unavailable to us during our entire stay, thus forcing us to go to the Algonquin Hotel next door. Extremely comfortable king size bed and otherwise good service made up for the shortcoming.

This was a wonderful small and quaint hotel. Front desk was unbelievable!! The location was incredible! We could actually walk anywhere-- which was a good thing because cabs were very difficult to get at the hotel. If I have any opportunity to visit NY again I would definitely consider staying here again!

If you are looking for a hotel that has charm, history, character and is in a great location with a team that of people who would do almost anything to make your stay as perfect as possible The Iroquois is a great choice.

Location is excellent, you should get rid of the unhealthy carpets in rooms, we had to change room due to extrem noise the first two nights in a neighboring room. Overall impression is good, mostly due to the location.

A very friendly Hotel where nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff from the moment I got out of the Taxi to the end of my 5 day visit. Whatever I asked for I was greeted with a polite positive response and quick service. The entire staff are extremely professional but without being over the top, relaxed and friendly is the order of the day which made my stay all the more relaxed, stress free and enjoyable. Housekeeping was discrete, efficient and friendly, the Doorman always greeted us with a smile leaving and returning and always willing to offer advice be it with the weather, shopping or traffic. I travel around the world and stay in Hotels regularly and to meet one or two exceptional staff in an establishment is not so unusual but not a Hotel where every individual was so helpful and kind. The beds were clean and very very comfortable providing a really good nights sleep. I highly recommend the Hotel for business or for a quiet relaxing break plus its location is unbeatable with Times Square, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller and Radio City all within a 5 minute walk away! A brilliant understated Hotel, the owners and management should be extremely proud of their employees.

This is a fabulous hotel in a great location just off 5th Avenue. Free coffee in the library (just off the lobby) in the mornings and Mulled cider after 11am. All staff first class. Although the location is just off 5th Avenue the rooms are very quiet at night. Highly recommended

A fantastic week in NY - shooping, shows on Broadway, Christmas tree at the Rockefellar Center .Staying in perfect Hotel with exelent staff very nice helpfull - friendly and service minded.We will be back - miss you allready !
