This hotel was recommended by a friend who visits New York often. I loved it. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. The rooms were comfortable, relaxing, and immaculately clean. Our maid came twice daily. The attention to detail on every level was superb. Excellent price for an excellent stay. Great location. Easy access to broadway, Times Square, shopping, and metro/public transportation. I will be back.

We stayed at the Iroquois for 5 days in Nov/Dec and loved every minute. The hotel was welcoming, centrally located to several different subway stops and a short walk to Times Square, theatres and Rockefeller Plaza. There are many different dining options close by. Our room was comfortable, warm and clean. The bathroom was a nice size with a great shower. Staff were helpful and friendly, particularly the doormen. Local knowledge was great and it was lovely to be greeted personally after a long day of tourist stops and walking.

Lovely building with lots of history. I had a tiny room which was vastly overheated and a bed so soft that even a board couldn't provide sufficient support.Staff very helpful and it is very well situated.I spent very little time in the hotel.

Excellent! Location ideal. The rooms are large and comfortable, very clean. The staff is very welcoming, they always had a smile on their face. Front desk and bellman were extremely helpful.The lobby bars are inviting.

Great location whilst being quiet. Rooms could be a bit bigger with better lighting. Overall it was a very good hotel and I would definitely stay again. We were close to Times Square and very close to the theatre's. A very central hotel for access to everything.

Our second stay at The Iroquois affirmed our choice in hotel. Attentive, friendly, welcoming, staff. Comfortably furnished, spacious room and bathroom ( even instant hot water ). Excellent location for access to theatres, Fifth Avenue, restaurants, and other midtown sites. Quiet respite although close to Times Square. Most helpful concierge'. Halls, lobby, public areas maintained in excellent condition. Great lounge and restaurant. The Iroquois is our home away from home when visiting NYC. Highly recommended for those who prefer a smaller, elegant, hotel.

Our room overlooked 44th street and suffered from the noise of horns and sirens from early morning till late. Room itself was clean and well-serviced. Perhaps a little small for the high price tag. Breakfast only available as room service. Excellent concierge service.

After staying in one of the much larger (and slightly manic) hotels during our last visit to New York we decided to go for a smaller boutique hotel this time around. The location is perfect – just two blocks from Times Square and approximately 20 minutes’ walk from Central Park.We booked a superior room with a queen bed. We were given a room on the 12th floor and it was a decent size. Our room was also spotlessly clean with a lovely bathroom with a shower over the bath. We were also pleased to find that the bathtub had a full length shower screen rather than a shower curtain (I personally dislike shower curtains in hotels). A nice little touch was the free newspaper that we found hanging on our doorknob each morning when we got up. There was a large safe inside the closet – plenty big enough to house a laptop if needed. Our only minor gripe was that the closet didn’t have a light which meant that we had to rummage around in our suitcase in the dark. We opted not to eat breakfast in the hotel. There are plenty of restaurant choices for breakfast a few minutes’ walk away. There is a small library just off reception with complementary coffee during the morning and hot cider during the afternoon. There are also two PCs and a printer available for guest use in the library so we were able to print out our boarding passes for our return flight. We found all of the staff to be friendly and accommodating. A special mention must go to one of the doormen (sorry, but we didn’t get his name). After a taxi that we had booked to take us to the airport let us down during an extremely busy Friday evening rush hour, the hotel doorman ran up and down the street flagging yellow cabs until he found one that would take us to the airport. After initially beginning to panic, thanks to this young man, we were finally on our way. The Iroquois Hotel was perfect from start to finish. The next time we come to New York, this is the place we will stay.

This was a lovely hotel with an interesting past. My room was clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable, which is great after a day on your feet. All of the staff were very helpful and full of ideas for things to do and places to eat. The only thing is we thought our room was too warm, even with the heat turned down as low as we could get it.

This was my second time visiting the Iroquois. On both occasions I received excellent service. The staff was both friendly and helpful at all times. Great location, within walking distance to most of the attractions. I definitely recommend this hotel and I will be using it again if I ever return to Manhattan.

Hotel was great, location was very central. All the staff were very helpfulI found lanterns keep (the bar) a bit dingy and also if you wanted anything except a cocktail it proved difficult, the only drink I could have was an orange juice.

We had an outstanding family trip to NYC. The Iroquois Hotel was amazing. We will definitely stay here next time. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and confortable. I suggest a room on a high floor to help with the road noise.

The best "home away from home" in Manhattan! Wonderful accommodations, staff & location. We have been going there for 6 years and love this beautiful, comfortable, and welcoming hotel. It is a pearl in the middle of Manhattan!

A beautiful convenient boutique hotel!Situated two blocks away from Time Square with diners, broad way theatres, shops and bus stops for hop on hop offs.Iroquois has the most amazing concierge who was most warm and friendly.The staff are polite and courteous.

By far our favorite place to stay in the city. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is perfect for theater-goers and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The restaurant and bar are romantic and the food is outstanding. If you like smaller hotels, this is a great choice.

This is the third time we have stayed here. We love it! This is a great location. We walked everywhere we wanted to go--Central Park, Macy's, Times Square, etc. This hotel has a cozy feel about it. We will definitely stay there again.

Husband surprised me with a Thanksgiving getaway and booked us into the Iroquois after reading several positive reviews. We were very happy. The room was quite small, but not unexpected. It was clean, our bed was super comfortable, we had chocolates and fresh linen/towels daily. We arrived to a yummy plate of complimentary chocolate goodies. Staff was very friendly and concierge, Vanessa, was very helpful. There was always hot coffee, cocoa, or spiced cider in the library available. We had a lovely experience!

Such a beautiful boutique hotel that is full of charm and character. The staff are all genuinely friendly and professional and are a great asset to this fantastic hotel especially Alex, Aarion and Liriam. The staff at the front door are all excellent. We would definitely stay again. All your complimentary drinks, chocolates and fresh fruit is very welcomed. Its all the little touches that make a difference to a memorable stay. Being 3 females that wanted to be in a central but quiet and safe location this hotel was perfectly placed. We walked everywhere..from downtown to uptown with great ease. Congratulations Iroquois Hotel..we miss you already!

We stayed for 4 nights over thanks giving staff where all very polite and helpful room was good size and very quiet kept clean and tidy the chocolate for bed time was nice could have done with 3 as it was a family trip but that was a minor issue everything else was really good would defo recommend

From the welcoming front desk to the dining & bar personnel to the accommodations, the Iroquois was an excellent choice for a short trip to New York. The location made it easy to get to other sites in the city and to actually have a quiet night's rest away from the noises of the city.

Surprised because we booked this after reading all the 5 star reviews. I would actually give it 3 1/2 if I could. The room is small, but that is pretty much NYC. Very dark, no light in the closet so it was hard to find things. I really resent the items for purchase taking up space on the night stand and in the refrigerator that is not a refrigerator. The location is great so they get points for that and the staff was pleasant. I'm amused that some reviewers get excited about complimentary coffee. Most hotels actually have it in the room so you don't need to get dressed first. Both mornings when I went down for coffee, they urn was empty and I had to find someone to refill it. Price under $300? Somebody got a better deal than I did. Also someone mentioned a box of chocolates and a bottle of wine. That might have been if you booked a suite, nothing like that for the regular room. Again, okay, but I will check out other places for our next trip.

My wife & I traveled to NYC to celebrate her birthday (I won't say which one). We wanted a nice hotel in midtown that had reasonable rates, access to theaters and was highly recommended. I found the hotel on TripAdvisor and after reviewing the comments of others who had stayed here, booked the hotel for 3 nights. We were not disappointed.From the moment we arrived, it was clear that customer service was a priority for the hotel staff. We were met by Seth in the lobby who took our bags and was extremely helpful throughout our entire stay with dinner suggestions, directions and any questions we had. Our room was very clean when we entered and the housekeeping staff kept it spotless during our stay. The location of the hotel was perfect for what we were looking for; close to theaters and in walking distance to Bryant Park and other sites. Our room did not have a great view, but it was quite and suited our needs very well. Both of us felt that this was an exceptional hotel for the price, location and service we received from the staff. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others and look forward to a return trip to NYC.

Hotel probably deserves a 4 but given all the options in NYC it just doesn't try hard enough. On the positive I give high marks for the non-restaurant staff. Rooms were clean and well appointed. We stayed here 5 years ago and didn't read our last review until we checked in. Same held true...the thermostat was worthless, we burned up. Opened the window and turned the heater off for the duration of the stay. Now the bad...Triomphe must be run by an independent company. 10:45 on a Friday night after a show the wouldn't serve us drinks and dessert because they were closing! It's NYC! There's a bar in the back but we took our business two doors down and had a great time. Liked the staff but will probably expand our search of options next trip.

Having been stranded at the airport we managed to book a last minute room at the Iroquois.The ladies on reception were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a fantastic location, and the food at breakfast was excellent quality. I would recommend this hotel to any one looking for a great hotel in a perfect location.

Excellent boutique hotel in MidtownLocation was perfect for our itinerary Nice in hotel bar and restaurant ... Complimentary coffee each morning is a nice touchRooms were clean and comfy. Only negative was Bathroom was very small ... Highly suggest a suiteEmployees Seth, Amanda and Anna were so friendly, helpful and just amazing people. We felt like returning to "home" each time we made it back to the hotel.We will definitely stay here again when we come back to NYC.

A fantastic stay at this outstanding hotel. The service and attention to detail made my weekend exceptional. I will return. It is my home away from home. I highly recommend the Iroquois for your visit.

The Iroquois have it right! What a great little property in the heart of NYC. The staff were all amazing and the room was just right. The room was a bit noisy at night (large heater or something nearby) but we overlooked that for all of the positive attributes.

We stayed at the Iroquois for two nights in November. The location is excellent if you're looking for access to Times Square, Madison Ave, 5th Ave, etc. The only downside to the location is the potential for bad traffic if you're in a car. The hotel doormen we encountered, Seth and John, were always pleasant and cheerful. The Check-in is attentive and efficient and included a box of chocolates and a bottle of wine. Very nice! The rooms are smallish but typical for Manhattan hotel rooms. The bed is quite comfortable and the room and bathroom were sparkling clean. There is minibar in the room but no refrigerator. The closet has a safe but needs an overhead light. The TV has a DVD player and the Front Desk has a library of DVD's. The complimentary coffee in the Library is delicious.This is a very nice, conveniently located hotel with excellent amenities and a friendly efficient staff. We would definitely return.

Me and my partner stayed here in October (28th - 31st), we didn't think about Halloween when we first booked it, so that's probably why it was so expensive.That said, the hotel was in a great location, around 3 minute walk to Times Square and a 8 minute walk to Empire State Building. The rooms were VERY small and we booked through booking.com which didn't say there was City Tax, this added around $150 - $200 onto the hotel than we thought we had to pay, so just be careful if booking through a different website.Overall, the hotel did what we wanted it to do, would I stay again? Probably not... I'd find a cheaper hotel in a decent area, as you literally only sleep in it.

Found this hotel on trip advisor and picked it based on the price and previous reviews on here and Yelp. Best hotel in New York City for under $300 a night! Location, Location, Location... Service staff was friendly, amenities were nice, rooms are very clean and modern. The only negative I could even think of is that our room was small and the window view looked out into another building wall, no sunlight or daylight, or city view, but I wasn't here to stay in the room and watch New York through the window. My wife and I tend to use our hotel rooms for the basics of rest, sleep and showering. We were here to explore the city, and The Iroquois was a perfect home base for that. This hotel is only a couple minutes walk from Time Square, Bryant Park, Grand Central Station. Would definitely recommend staying here and will consider staying here again on our next visit! Two Thumbs Up!!!!!

Staff where very professional and polite. The rooms would benefit from better lighting. Was in a great location for all of what New York has to offer. Price of the rooms was very good for New York....

This hotel is excellent and the staff are superb. It is small and friendly. Whilst the facilities, like the gym, are small, their are few guests and the hotel feels intimate. It is also very quiet for a NY hotel.

We requested a suite on a high floor and were given this. As we were three, I slept on the sofa bed in the living room. As we all know, sofa beds are not known for being the most comfortable, but this sofa bed had a tempur-pedic mattress and it was a great two night sleep. The staff, especially Christoph, are fantastic and are so helpful and courteous. If there was one negative, is that we were not able to get in to Lantern's Keep. We had tickets to a show, and as we were walking back we were looking forward to a drink. It was SO crowded that no one came to attend to us or advise how long the wait would be, at it was already after 11pm. The couple in front of us had stated they had waited already for 15 minutes. It is a shame as the bar is a hidden gem, it would have topped of our last night. Again, the hotel is very nice, and so peaceful, and a pleasure to stay in. We will be back soon, frequently!

Good size room with everything you need. Maid and turndown service was wonderful. all of the staff were friendly and helpful. Room size is good, location is terrific. easy walk to Times Square and many good restaurants.

This is just a review to note my thanks to the Iroquois management for being very kind. I accidentally booked a non-refundable room at the Iroquois using the Amex travel website. Yes, it was stupid, but I truly didn't realize it. The Amex site wasn't a model of clarity, and unfortunately I didn't discover my mistake until after I had to cancel. In any event, after much wrangling with Amex, I called the Iroquois and unbelievably, they waived the charge, which was over $2,000. I am very grateful to the hotel management for this, and think it reflects well on what the hotel experience must be like for their guests. Thanks, again Iroquois. I will stay there next time I'm in Manhattan.

This was my third stay at this hotel. Elegant old intimate hotel. Close to Rockefeller Center, Bryant Part, Library, and Times Square. Surprisingly quiet street given the location. Rooms tend to be small but efficient. Very comfortable relaxing hotel.

What do you want from hotels. Good sleep, good bathroom, friendly efficient staff, unobtrusive service, excellent location for activities, breakfast lunch and dinner venues nearby, and reasonably close to transport connections.The Iroquois has it all, and tariffs which are not overwhelming.I have visited New York city a number of times, and stayed at a range of Manhattan hotels, but none have felt as friendly or convenient as this one.Would return here in a heartbeat, if i find myself in the city ever again.

Great hotel, great location, nice staff. Breakfast at the restaurant and the service was excellent! A nice atmosphere all around, and very welcoming. Would recommend to family and friends. A lot of good restaurants near by.

Wow. This hotel is just so cool - the always there bellmen got us cabs in the rain and umbrellas for the day. Friendly and efficient staff at reservations and the front desk were able to check us in early and get us adjoining rooms. Housekeeping cleaned when it was convenient for us. Bowls of apples, urns of coffee and apple cider in the library. The best newspapers. And all this at a very reasonable price. What more could four friends meeting in a special city want in a hotel! See you next year Iroquois! You're the best.

great location and friendly staff the rooms were quiet and comfortable There was no refrigerator in the room, but they would bring one up if requested. The proximity to Times Square, Bryant Park and Broadway was a big help. Subway close as well.

Excellent stay at the Iroquois hotelwe were gone go back to this place. Ilts a perfect place form a long week end beacause there is a lot off things to do around the place et restaurants are close.Also the staff are very nice.thank you

The Iroquois Hotel was the perfect perfect place to stay for a family trip to see the Christmas show at Radio City. Wonderful midtown location in a lovely, small, friendly hotel. We have stayed at the Iroquois many times and are always happy to return.
user_name:
Nancy R
Syracuse, New York, Usa

review_body: do the offered complimentary city tours, great ecperience!!we also appreciated the freshness of the products used for freshly prepared breakfast and the very friendly staff at the concierge desk. good location for nightlife

On my Manhattan visits, I usually stay in the West Village (dislike Midtown) at the Marlton (fabulous), then cab-it to Midtown theaters. But all of my all of my activities this trip we're in Midtown. I like historic hotels, and usually stay at the Algonquin. But thought I'd try the Iroquois this time... I've walked past it dozens of times. I was not disappointed, lovely staff, and a comfortable room with all the amenities I required.

The Iroquois is the best hotel of all our stays in New York ! Very good service and location ! We were several times in New York , but this was the best stay. Morning coffee or tea in die lounge, newspaper every day in the room! We will come back again!

Stayed at the Iroquois hotel for the New York Marathon, the hotel is located half way between Times Square & Grand Central station and is an ideal location for exploring mid town, Manhattan, close to the hotel are several bars and a great coffee shop opposite. Hotel facilities are very good, the hotel is traditional with comfortable rooms. The staff are really friendly and always more than happy to help. The concierge was brilliant really helpful with great advice and was very honest. subway stations are within a 10 minute walk, as is the Rockereller centre, Broadway and the central library, 15 minute walk to the empire state building. we stayed for a week and had a wonderful experience. There were loads of special touches like a good luck card for guests running the marathon, along with a goody bag with a bagel, fruit, bottle of water, free New York Times every morning.

I booked 4 nights in a twin room at this hotel in November. Whilst traveling around the USA my daughter needed to attend some meetings which meant that she wouldn't be joining my wife and I in New York. I contacted the hotel to change the room to a king room and they were very accomodating. On arrival the young bellboy was very polite and helpful with our bags. Checkin was good and the room appeared well presented and clean. The beauty of this boutique hotel is its location. Close to everything. I filled out the hotel survey and whilst there were things that the hotel needs to do to improve their rooms the managers response was quick and pointed out that they have taken the negatives onboard and doing something about it. The staff at the hotel also deserve recognition particularly Vanessa at the concierge desk who is an absolute delight and John the young bellboy.

Helpful staff, comfortable rooms, great midtown location near Broadway theaters and Fifth Avenue. Easy walk to MOMA. Love staying here. Triomphe restaurant on premises is excellent and there are many fine dining choices nearby.

Room was not prepared after a 10 hour flight, jetlag, no 3d bed for our son and we asked for a stay of a week for a high located suite.....but reception and doorman were very nice and did their utmost best to make up for that. Excellent beds, nice suite, small bathroom but adequate, excellent staff and congierge. We enjoyed breakfast.

Nice hotel but small room. Lack of hot water was an issue on one occasion. Otherwise very impressed.Location was first rate, convenient for Central park, Times Square and many attractions. On a quiet street.

Nice hotel within walking distance of Times Square and Theatre District.Very quick check in and good room on 1st floor at rear of hotel which kept us away from the traffic noise. Very comfortable bed and large bathroom with walk-in shower.Decent restaurants for breakfast within walking distance.Would definitely consider staying here next time we are in New York.

My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at The Iroquois.The hotel feels comfortable and quaint and the room was very nice. It didn't feel tiny or cramped like many NYC hotels can. The staff were excellent and made this feel like a much more personal experience than a larger chain hotel.The Iroquois' location is really good, being a block from both the Bryant Park Subway and Times Square, it is easy to get almost anywhere in Manhattan quickly.On Sunday we took the free walking tour offered by the hotel and really enjoyed it. Our guide Dan was friendly and although I have been to NY many times I still learned a lot on the tour.Overall great experience and will definitely come back to stay here again.

Just a short walk from the neon madness of times square yet a peaceful retreat for our 5 day break. Rooms are standard new York .... just enough space for two. Bathroom functional with v/good toiletries provided. Bed extra comfy. Lovely friendly helpful staff. Downers for us , no in room tea/coffee provided.....available in reception area !! very loud ac in room and extremely loud external ac units echoing around the interior courtyard. We did not want to stay in a "chain hotel group " so this hotel did meet most of our expectations and therefore would recommend to others with a similar outlook for a change to the usual hotel norm.

Can't fault this accommodation. It is stylish, clean and full of character and the staff are friendly and professional. We are already planning another stay at this hotel. Little extras (for example the hot cider) were a pleasant surprise.

We had a nice stay in The Iroquois. centrally located to many attractions shame about the air conditioning that can not be turned off and constantly buzzed over our heads like a train constantly passed otherwise our stay had been perfect. This applies to us because we are not used to sleeping with aircon.

As good as the marketing material! Clean, well presented rooms. Very comfortable and large beds, Pleasant and helpful front desk and concierge. Ideally ocated near to Times Square. No issues at all. Complimentary hot cider in the library on an evening was a nice touch

I loved the location. The hotel is very central just of the Fifth Avenue. I enjoyed the fact that the hotel is so small and very cosy. It has lovely rooms and friendly staff. Hotel is kept tidy and clean.

This was our first time in New York and we stayed at The Iroquois Hotel for 5 nights.The hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly and nothing seemed to be any trouble for them. We asked for a fridge for our room which was delivered within 5 minutes. We came in one night after an exhausting day of sightseeing and shopping and asked the concierge if it was possible to have a cup of tea instead of the complimentary hot apple juice and again within 5 minutes he brought us 2 cups of tea to take to our room. This hotel is very well situated for all the sights especially Times Square. I would definitely go back to The Iroquois . Many thanks for making our stay so enjoyable

This was a pretty standard hotel in the centre of New York. No view out of the window but at least this kept the noise low. Good location close to Times Square and I presume the prices were high as it was marathon weekend but all in all just a standard central Manhattan room

Excellent accommodations, helpful and friendly staff, superb location. The hotel is in the middle on Manhattan, walking distance to most of the attractions: Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Theatre district, etc.

We arrived two days ago and I was rather unhappy with the room we were given.Unfortunately they were sold out and couldn't change it.The following day Amanda on the front desk found us a beautiful room and made our stay most enjoyable. All the staff here are super friendly and helpful.You mustn't miss the delicious free hot apple juice!

My stay at the Iroquois is always pleasant. The rooms are always comfortable and clean. The details are nice for an older hotel. The gym is out dated but functional. The room service is not ideal but you can walk anywhere from this location. The bar downstairs is quaint.

We booked this hotel as a member of the best small hotels of the world and were lucky enough to be given an upgrade to a suite, what a great start. We stayed in the hotel in February we were here for 3 nights our first stop as part of a road trip around New York State and the Canadian side of Niagara. The suite was spacious and bathroom great and we had a very comfortable bed. We had great time here and we were in walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central Station and tons of other things. In fairness given that we had such great suite we didn't spend much time in it as we were here to explore New York. What a busy but great City.I our opinion this is a great hotel and we would happily stay here again.

the Iroquois is a very nice boutique hotel. it is well located within walking distance to theaters, time square, rockafeller center etc. Boutique, means small. the rooms are small but nicely appointed. you will not be spending much time in your room anyway. Nice little restaurant right there. Many excellent bars and restaurants nearby.

second time in The Iroquois this year and can't complain about anything. it's just an amazing hotel where to stay, comfy rooms, wifi works perfectly, breakfast menu is great, staff is just amazing and friendly (yeah i know - Friendly in NYC)... perfect location. everything about this hotel is just great.

Was at the Iroqouis for a brief 3-day stay in NYC returning from a European trip to see a couple of shows. Stayed on a special deal for cheaper (by NYC standards rooms for a 3 night stay). Rooms were decently sized for NY and the amenities were good. Only bad was that the air system was set for the floor and couldn't be changed by room so got a bit warm when the temp went up in NYC. Ate at the cafe for breakfast. OK. Had a drink in the bar also OK. Concierge was extremely helpful with setting up reservations, cars drivers etc. Would stay here again as the location is really convenient.

Small but neat hotel very near Times Square and all amenities. Free coffee and tea every morning, and Apple cider every evening. We had a standard room but very comfortable. 12th floor, so very quiet. Very comfortable beds,turn down service and chocolates, also Milton brown products
user_name:
susan j
St. Albans, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed here in for a couple of nights, which was our first visit. It's a boutique hotel, so even for Manhattan it's expensive. Like any NYC hotel, the rooms are small, but the furnishings and fittings are very nice, and overall very comfortable. With so much choice nearby we didn't use the bar or restaurant. All the staff were polite & helpful. Overall a great experience.

Super close to Times Square and major shopping and attractions. Very comfy beds. Concierge was very helpful in my planning of festivities. We brought our toddlers and they were accommodating to that as well. I would definitely stay here again!

We felt great hospitality for free coffee and lemonade in the cozy library .Amazing accessibility to anywhere we'd like to visit.Wonderful breakfast provided at the elegant dining room, at the happy hour, congenial atmosphere filled in.

I've lost count of how many times I've called this hotel home when in Manhattan. I keep coming back. It has everything I need and is located nearby to activities I enjoy when playing, and the places I need to be when I am working. It is overall "just right."

Nice location for sightseeing Small and friendly hotelFree wifi There is not a real lobby, just a small sitting area where complimentary coffee/tea is available No breakfast included, you can have it for 20$ pp, but the ambiance in the restaurant area is not greatCocktail lounge at the back , cosy but service rather slowThe rooms are very smallGood sized bed and decent bedding Only one desk/ bed side table and nothing on the other sideNo space to open your suitcase Most rooms have no view, no day light coming through I felt like I was sleeping in a cupboard Bathroom was okCleaning was ok

Have highly appreciated the location. Réception and luggage service is excellent. Rooms are are relatively small and it is difficult to open 2 large suitcases. Confort of room and bed is excellent. Our stay has Ben very pleasant.

Spent a very busy seven days in NYC and the Iroquois was the perfect located home. Great, clean and decent sized room better than ever expected given location in NYC. Wonderful efficient and endearing staff throughout the property for whom nothing was a problem. If you visit the bar and are fortunate enough to be severd by Thomas you are in great hands. A very personable, professional host, what an assets this young man is to the business.

The Iroquois is brilliant. It is centrally located in midtown and is close to the subway, Times Square and other attractions. We found the hotel clean and comfortable. The staff were brilliant. They were relaxed, professional and very helpful. It is clear that they enjoy working at the hotel and helping to ensure their guests are comfortable and get the most out of their time in New York.

The Hotel was just as nice and lovely what I expected. The rooms were excellent, beds comfortable, and the service extremely high. Perfect location. If you like to live Midtown Manhatten the Iroquis is a good choice. The prices of the food in restaurant were however very high.

Outstanding service from the front desk to the location of the hotel.A complete outstanding vacation experience at a great hotel. Within walking distance to Times Square and right in the middle of the theatre district and shopping. Convenient access transportation and subway access as well. A unique and very warm and friendly hotel experience with very friendly staff and great customer service.

This hotel is a lovely boutique hotel with very friendly and personal staff who were always available to help. The rooms are excellent size with modern bathroom facilities. It is conveniently located.

My husband & I stayed for 7 nights celebrating our 25th Wedding anniversary, hotel is a real gem, so close to Times Square without hearing the street noisesRoom was cleaned expertly our entire stay couldn't fault (I'm a Executive Housekeeper)We ate breakfast only once as we wanted to experience the city food sceneThe hotel bar is a nice little spot to relax in after a busy day out sightseeing, Thomas is a fantastic host & represents the establishment very well indeed.Check in was proficient and welcoming, we are just about to check out, very sad to be leaving your city as 7 days wasn't long enough to see everything Concierge & doorman were excellent I haven't opened the entrance door my entire stayThank you Iroquois team for making our stay so memorable June & Harry Bennett Adelaide South Australia

For our first-time visit to NYC, the Iroquois was a terrific home base. It's within walking distance to the theaters, Times Square and Central Park, and the room was clean and quiet. But the quick, friendly service really sets the place apart...the staff were uniformly excellent.

My husband and I celebrated a milestone birthday in New York, and we loved this hotel! It was highly recommended to us by friends, and we found it to be ideal - especially since we love smaller boutique hotels. The room was very comfortable and well-appointed, and the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The concierges made great recommendations that made our trip even more special. The hotel is in a fabulous location - close to theatre and subway. We will definitely choose this hotel when we return to New York City!

The Iroquois is so convenient that you can walk to almost any place in mid Manhattan. On top of that as it is a small hotel with a style, everything works efficiently. Unlike a big hotels, basically there's no waiting time (for reception, concierge service et al) and no need to walk endlessly inside a hotel. The hotel has a small gym but it does not have a swimming pool. But who cares, you did not come to NYC to swim.

We greatly enjoyed our stay at this hotel: the rooms are well-equipped, the beds are comfortable and the location of the hotel in Midtown gives easy access to Bryant Park, Times Square and all subway lines. Yet the rooms are nice and quiet, ensuring a relaxed stay. The hotel services are excellent as well, with the ready supply of tasty apples at the reception and of umbrellas on rainy days as particular highlights.

All we have to say about this place is in the completed review. In a nutshell, stay away! Service was terrible, accommodations were small, smelly and terrible. Right from the start, we had to carry 5 pieces of heavy luggage up the stairs from the street to get to the lobby. No doorman, no bellhop, no valet. Got worse from there!

Very nice hotel, memorable stay, friendly staff, good price for money, excellent location.I thoroughly reccomend this hotel, with all its ambiance, history and the clean renovated rooms.Much better than the big new hotels from the large hotel chains.

Excellent service, excellent food - you must try the Dover Sole!!!! Flaky and flavourful. The selection was varied with a great wine list available.Alberto and the wait staff did a wonderful job taking care of our every need,

The Iroquois has become my go to place to stay in NYC. Yes you can find more affordable solution but if want a great staff with a personal touch the Iroquois is your place. Location is perfect and if you drive in to the city which we do parking that is affordable and safe is nearby.

We travelled to NYC for our 25th anniversary for a week stay. The hotel room is a little compact, but sufficient for our trip. One of the highlights of our trip was the Iroquois staff. They are as much a part of our memory as the attractions we visited. We felt we were treated like royalty. All of the staff went above and beyond to ensure our 25th wedding anniversary was recognized and appreciated.

We spent 7 days there. Interacted mainly with the evening shift with the exception of Vanessa, concierge extriodianere! The entire staff was professional, courteous and willing to accommodate any need. Particular thanks to Amanda, Anna and the young men who all worked diligently to make our stay special. True, the rooms are smaller than expected, however, you pay for fantastic location...short walk to Times Square and all manner of transportation. I highly recommend this small luxury hotel to all.

I planned this birthday trip to New York around 6 months in advance and I was so excited to finally try The Iroquois.... man, was I disappointed. Mind you, I visit the city 4-5 times a year so I have tried MANY hotels and consider myself to be very easy to please. Upon arriving, the staff was very helpful; they opened the doors for us, took our luggage, and were very warm and polite. However, every time we entered the hotel after that, we did not receive the same A+ treatment. I felt as if they treat you amazingly well at the time of check-in but then say "screw it" afterwards.When we entered our "double bed room" we were SHOCKED by how tiny and musty it was. I won't dock points from them because of the size because come on, you're in Midtown... you can't expect a huge room if you're paying around $300 a night (ridiculous, but true). But come on, there was barely any light at all and it was SUPER warm in the room. We adjusted the A/C but it didn't seem to work. We spoke to one of the staff and he adjusted the thermostat in our room (the same thing we did) and he said it would definitely work now- 45 minutes later, still sweating. So, I went downstairs and spoke to someone else. It was then that the lady up front explained to me that the air conditioning is controlled DOWN STAIRS and that the customers cannot adjust their own room temperature- WHAT THE HECK?!! I know people who freeze at 75 degrees and others who like their room at 60 degrees- leave it to the customer to decide if they want to freeze or burn, lol. She said she would adjust it... 1 hour later... still sweating. While we waited for the a/c to kick in, I checked the hotel rates online and noticed that although they were charging me $341 a night, the rate online was $297.. I was LIVID. You're going to overcharge me for a crappy room with no light fixtures, no a/c, and a tiny bathroom? No way. That's when I went downstairs and spoke to the manager and requested that I be charged the FAIR and POSTED daily rate.. I also requested we be moved to a room with a working a/c (they refused to admit that the air conditioner in our room was faulty). After speaking up, our rate was reduced and we were moved to a more modern room which allowed us to control the a/c temperature.I shouldn't have to pull teeth to get BASIC amenities. I think the hotel is gorgeous on the outside but I am very, very, very disappointed with the interior and the amenities. Spend less money on making the lobby look ridiculously high-class, and allot that money to improving the rooms.On a small positive note, the cleaning staff was very sweet, they left chocolates in our room every day, and you really can't beat the location (1-2 blocks from times square). I just couldn't bring myself to stay here again, unfortunately.

We are so glad we booked this hotel, it was ideally situated close by to lots of attractions. We contacted Vanessa the concierge before our trip to request an airport transfer, this was arranged for us and all worked smoothly. When we arrived at the hotel we were quickly and efficiently booked in by Nicole. We found our room to be larger than expected after reading lots of reports of NYC rooms being on the small side. The bed was very comfortable and nice size bathroom with good shower. The turn down service was a nice touch. We can't comment on the bar or restaurant as we didn't use these but we can recommend The Red Flame Diner at the end of the block for breakfast. Sauna was nice. On our final day, when collecting our luggage, we were offered use of the shower room in the gym after a hot day despite having checked out that morning - thank you again Vanessa! We thoroughly enjoyed our 5 night stay and would definitely stay here again if we should be lucky enough to return to NYC and we'll recommend to all our friends. Thank you Iroquois!!

From check-in to check-out, our weekend stay at the hotel was exceptional. After our cruise, we returned for another night's stay, and experienced the same phenomenal service at the Iroquois. We would, without hesitation, book this hotel again when visiting NYC.

I would rate them a five if my room wasn't so small. James Dean stayed just around the corner from our room for 3 years. Concierge, Bill and Vanessa, were extremely helpful to first time NYC visitors.Location was very special, three blocks from Times Square, 4 blocks from Grand Central Station, subway access everywhere, 15 blocks form Central Park and museums, museums, all around. Restaurants galore. We loved all the staff from front desk to bellmen.

We spent a long weekend in New York at this boutique hotel and thought the value we received for the rate was excellent. The location is convenient to subways and the diner just down the street was a nice option for breakfast. We ate one night at the Triomphe and the food and service was very good. The bar has well made drinks and the wine by the glass was a nice quality. The rooms are small, but they are modern with all the amenities. Internet service is good. Our room overlooked the fire escape and was very quiet by New York standards. We would stay there again.

We were very impressed with the size of the room at this hotel. The staff was very helpful with suggestions regarding transportation and amenities. We were with a group of friends and enjoyed excellent service at the bars and restaurant in the Hotel.

Recently had a 3 night stay at The Iroquois. From the Front Desk Staff to Housekeeping, the hotel was perfect in every way. You couldn't ask for a better location. We had a very private room (1208) which was quiet and cozy. The bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable and the turn down service was such a nice touch. Proximity to the subway, the theater district, Fifth Avenue and beyond!! We were there on Columbus Day and after less than a five minute walk from the hotel, we were able to view the parade from a front row vantage point. There were a few minor "glitches" during our stay (a non-working tv remote and a problem with a bathroom door hinge). Both glitches were taken care of quickly and efficiently. I have never stayed at a hotel with a more friendly, courteous, capable staff. Will definitely stay here on my next NYC visit. You should too!!

Spent a weekend recently in New York City and wanted a nice clean place close enough to walk to the MOMA, Grand Central Station, New York Library, Central Park, and great restaurants. From the moment we checked in with Amanda, we felt comfortable. She even gave us extra chocolates! All of the Iroquois Hotel's staff was friendly and helpful. There were lots of special touches such as free coffee off the lobby in the mornings and free hot cider in the afternoons. We would recommend the free walking tour on Sunday mornings. Also be sure to ask for great restaurant suggestions from Bill (the concierge). One downside is a lack of space for visiting (we were traveling with another couple) but the Algonguin Hotel a couple doors down has a great lobby for meeting for an after dinner drink. Rooms only had one chair but small rooms are typical for NYC.

Stayed 3 nights on a business trip recently. The hotel is a charming, older hotel in a terrific location near to everything. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room, about average size for NYC, was clean and quite comfortable. Very little street noise even with a room on the front of the hotel. Bathroom is a little small but very nicely appointed. The only small negative is that some of the room fixtures are dated and a little worn. Overall, a very good hotel for the price.

This was a family trip - me, my husband, and a fifteen year-old - and while the double room was a bit of a squeeze when we were all trying to get ready etc. we spent so little time in the room, it didn't really matter.The room did tend to smell of smoke at times, and the bathroom was a touch dated, but it was clean, and well-maintained. The only issue we had was with the safe, which kept opening at random after having been locked.The hotel bar was lovely, and the staff could not have been more helpful.In terms of location, this is exactly where you want to be - perfectly central, just moments from Bryant Park, Grand Central, etc.Would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Caroline F
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: A slightly fading lady. Shows a little wear but still nice overall. Great location near 5th Ave and Times Sq; easy walking to theater and restaurants. Excellent bartenders in Lantern bar, very creative, great showman. Concierge services, outstanding. Staff very helpful and personable.

Was pleasantly surprised - excellent location. Iroquois staff were excellent and very helpful. Made my stay in New York a pleasure. Will definitely be on my preferred accommodation for when I am in New York next.

We recently stayed at the Iroquois for a four night trip to New York. We were looking for a good central location for exploring the city and seeing a show. The Iroquois fit the bill. The hotel was surprisingly quiet given its central location. Noise was not an issue at all. I had read other reviews that called this hotel a "port in the storm" and I feel that's a very accurate description. After long days of touring, trekking through the streets and hot subway stations, this was a very welcome place to return in the afternoon and unwind before dinner, drinks, shows and nightlife. The beds were very comfortable and we slept exceptionally well.The staff at the Iroquois really set it apart, though. We arrived very early and they were quick to assist with secure storage of our luggage, ready to make suggestions through concierge, and provided a place to freshen up before heading out for the day. They were able to accommodate our check out needs as well, which was greatly appreciated. They were quick to arrange transportation and were super approachable and helpful throughout our stay. We'd probably skip the breakfast package next time, but definitely did appreciate the coffee in the morning.The bar was a comfortable and convenient place for a drink.We had considered some larger hotels in the theatre district, but this was definitely more personal and more our speed. After seeing the Times Square adjacent locations of those other hotels, we feel we made the best choice.

can't afford Four Seasons Hotel this is the next best Hotel , what a great find we will be back. My wife's has a very rare Muscular Dystrophy and is in a scooter . The staff could not do a enough for her and the room was equipped with outlets for her ventilator. Location was awesome never got in a cab.

The location of the hotel is unbeatable, near the meter and the most beautiful areas of Manhattan, people in the front desk extremely friendly, helpful desk and ready to provide any requirements requested.
user_name:
N3744PAfernandod
Ciudad Autonoma De Buenos Aires

review_body: This was our first time to stay at the Iroquois, but it won,t be our last. We had a large (by NYC standards) king room with a big bathroom. The room was quiet and the staff was friendly and attentive. You cannot beat the location, especially if you are going to the theatre.

I really liked staying here. I've been to a lot of NYC hotels. This one is very enjoyable. Great size and location. Rooms are nice appointed. Bedding was great. Bathrooms were definitely tight inside but nicely done.

My wife and I were celebrating our 10 year anniversary and decided to stay at the Iroquois. The people, from the doorman, to check-in, to housekeeping were the nicest people. A big thank you to Seth whom we had bring us ice daily and he also brought extra ice for my leg.We stayed in the suite on the 12th floor and so far this has been the biggest and most comfortable room we have stayed in in NYC. I highly recommend the suite. The location of the hotel is just a block and half from Times Square.Some of the best restaurants are right there on 44th street.I recommend Osteria al Doge on 142 W 44th St.For the price of the room it was well worth it. Try looking up the price of a suite at other hotels.It would have been nice to have a coffeemaker in the room, but there was free copy in the lobby every morning.It also would have been nice to have an ice machine somewhere on the floor, but when we called for ice, it was a minimal wait time. Thank you for a wonderful time and we will be back next year. Promise.

Recently stayed at the Iroquois for the 4th time in 2 years. This is is a review I write with mixed feelings. The hotel was fantastic and has a great location, but by saying that and giving it a great review it will no doubt become more popular! Fantastic location within a few blocks and a short walk from Time Square, Theaters, Bryant Park/Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center--it's centrally located. We love that this feels (and is) like a small hotel with the level of service you would expect from a top notch hotel. Staff are friendly and courteous. Rooms nicely appointed. It's tucked away in a nice quiet and safe location. Love staying here when in NYC and will definitely be back. If you are looking for a quiet, quaint and romantic hotel - than this is a great place to stay. If you are looking for lots of noise, large hotel atmosphere and higher prices- then opt for one of the big chain hotels in Time Square.

First-time stay at the Iroquois on a recent business trip. Very happy with the hotel overall. My room was quiet and very comfortable. The NYC traffic and activity has prevented sound sleep at other larger hotels over the years. This hotel's location provided a quiet stay. Convenient to Madison and 5th Avenues, and Grand Central. Local restaurant options. I thoroughly appreciated the comfortable bed, hot water and steady stream shower as well as the cleanliness and atmosphere overall. I will certainly consider the Iroquois on future trips and recommend it to others.

Lovely hotel perfectly situated in Midtown and only a short stroll from Times Square.Rooms were comfortable and clean with the added bonus of Molton Brown toiletries.Really friendly,helpful staff.Would definitely book this hotel again.

Fantastic midtown location, easy access and wonderfully helpful staff. The rooms are classically styled, comfortable and clean. Nice Molton Brown bathroom products and plenty of towels. A great continental breakfast. Highly recommended.

This hotel is very nice and is located in a good area of midtown just a few minutes walk from Time Square and lots of restaurants. The rooms are small but that is not unusual with older hotels in New York the decor is to a high standard as are the items such as bath robes, toiletries etc. We had an internal room so no view other than brick walls however the bonus was it was very quiet which in New York is a good thing. It has a nice small bar which was great and a small restaurant with an award winning chef although we did not eat there are so many nearby restaurants and cafe to eat in. The only minor problem they have is the TV package they have does not include a programme guide which the maintenance manager/engineer tried to convince me this was normal in the USA which was nonsense. So you will have no way of finding what programmes are on and at what time unless you go out and buy local TV guide.The staff were very good especially Bill the Concierge who was a font of knowledge - all in all very good and I would stay there again.

A wedding brought myself and my family to The Iroquois for a weekend and everything about the hotel was wonderful. I was skeptical about booking a suite for 4 people or getting two rooms, but was very happy I did. It was very spacious and the sofa bed was comfortable. The accommodations allowed us to have our privacy, as well as enjoy each other's company in the living room. We will definitely be returning for next year's family reunion. Thank you!

After 5 stays, I continue to love this hotel. Four of us on a girl's weekend stayed four nights in the double superior rooms and never heard one noise during the day or night--no kids running in the halls, no plumbing sounds from other guests and no voices. The beds are extremely comfortable and the shower pressure divine. They offer a cotton blanket as well as comforter and a memory foam pillow in addition to 3 other fluffy pillows. The linens are soft as well as the towels. The concierge and front desk were always helpful answering our various tourist type questions. The hallways have been smartly upgraded but the carpeting and furniture in the rooms could use a little sprucing up. It's not perfect--definitely needs more lighting, especially over the dresser. The bathroom is very small and no place for toiletries. But for the price, location and comfort, this is an ideal place to stay in this area. Theaters are within easy walking distance from the hotel. Plus the Red Flame diner is steps away for a great, fast breakfast.

this sparkling gem is incredibly well-located and quiet. We walked everywhere, took subways (very nearby) and returned to the tranquil beauty of our room when we were tired from show-going and eating well.We'll definitely be back!

We were amazed how quiet our room was despite being midtown Manhatten. Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful at all times - just wish we could have stayed longer. We checked our luggage in a couple of days prior to arriving as had arranges a visit to Montreal and this was no problem. Great supply of umbrellas for rainy days!

Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Great location. I wouldn't say it's fabulous but for a hotel to use as a base it's fine. Our room had 2 double beds and was ok. Very small & cramp and not exactly cheap but I think you pay for the location! Walkable to Times Square and also 5th avenue for all the shops. Word of warning - don't use the mini bar! 10 dollars for a bottle of water is a joke! Buy from pret up the road as the water from the tap doesn't taste great!

We spent 5 nights at The Iroquois at the end of September.A very comfortable, clean, well looked after hotel with wonderfully friendly, helpful staff, ideally situated and within easy reach of all Manhattan has to offer. A special thanks to Vanessa and Bill on the concierge desk for all their assistance – great job you two lovely people.The hotel does not offer breakfast but tea and coffee are freely available in the morning with cool “posh” iced water on tap in the afternoon. We’d recommend The Red Flame diner a mere 50 yards along on the same street for breakfast.Should we be fortunate enough to return to New York at some point in the future, we would not hesitate to return to The Iroquois.

Incredibly relaxing night and just felt at home. The room was tight but cozy and had everything we needed. The bathroom was super clean, bright, and had bright white towels & robes to use. Conveniently located next to Bryant Park with easy subway access but away from busy streets. We were able to open the windows for some fresh view - sadly no view, but we didn't really care. Overall, incredible experience with very friendly and helpful staff.

Recently I spent 8 nights in this excellent hotel in Midtown Manhattan. The Hotel is in an excellent location for visiting Times Square, Broadway, Central park, Grand Central Station, etc. The hotel is small and the staff are excellent. The concierges were very knowledgeable and always full of recommendations, the receptionists were always happy to answer any queries and to sort any problems (my wife and I had an issue with the toilet not flushing properly and without any prompting we were moved to a superior room for 5 nights of our stay). The Bellhops were very pleasant and made our stay very easy (especial mention to Seth). The cleaning staff were hard-working and pleasant and the turn-down service with the chocolates was a nice touch. Other nice touches were that extra towels were always left in the room and the also bathrobes were provided. The hotel does not serve breakfast (free tea & coffee are provided from 7:00am - 11:00am). To eat in the hotel is expensive but there is a great diner only 5 minutes away and some great delis around the corner should you wish to eat in your room. The hotel also ran walking tours which were had very knowledegable tour guides who showed us parts of NYC we wouldn't have known about

We stayed 3 nights. They have a great dining room-had breakfast and dinner there. Excellent! The rooms were very nice- very very clean. All of the staff were so helpful. Great location- close to Times Square and walkable to the theaters. Also close to subway which we took one day. A quiet bar was a good place to meet friends.

Just a few steps from Times Square, you enter to a luxury perfect boutique hotel. The efficiency yet kind treatment you are going to get in the Hotel are unbelievable. The beds are heavenly comfortable, nice bath amenities of Molton Brown, and if you need anything, just ask. You can't dream about any other better Hotel in the middle of the city. If you are looking for a noisy, crowdy place - this one is definitely not the right one for you. If you are looking for a stylish one with perfect service , hope they are not fully booked for your dates.
user_name:
Michal M
Herzliya, Tel Aviv, Israel

review_body: After flying back from South Africa I arrived in NYC at 7am. I took the subway into the city to get to the Iroquois Hotel. Of course because it was so early my room wasn't ready yet. But the front staff checked me in and put my luggage in storage until my room was ready. I came back to the hotel around 1pm but my room wasn't ready but the front staff checked to see if another room would be available so I could get in and shower before my concert that evening. The room was very comfortable and it felt great to have a nice hot shower after a 15 hour flight and walking around in the heat for 5+ hours. The nice touch is the bowl of peaches at the front desk. After walking around for several hours the peach was a nice touch. The hotel is close to Times Square but my room was very quiet. I would definitely look into staying here again if I'm ever back in NYC.

We stayed here for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. Items we noted were:-1 Friendly & efficient check in ... Important when you've been travelling for 30 hours. Plus the front desk were helpful each time we spoke to them (thanks Nicole & Amanda).2 Good sized rooms - we had 807 a corner room.3 Comfortable beds and pleasant bathrooms.4 Great location ... Close enough to Times Square & Theatre District to be convenient but far enough away to be a very quiet area.Plus a great coffee shop across the road (important to Coffee Lovers like us Australian's, an excellent French/Italian restaurant down the street (Saju Bistro) and a good diner for breakfast (Red Flame).We'd definitely return when staying again in Midtown.Thanks to all the staff for an enjoyable stay.

My 4th visit to this hotel and most definitely not the last. Love the location just two blocks from Times Square in a clean and (relatively) quiet street. Red Flame diner just steps away for a great breakfast. Rooms clean and comfortable and staff friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was great and maintained the room very well during our stay. We requested a quiet room, and were allocated one at the side of the hotel which had windows, but no view. We didn't mind one bit about the lack of view but appreciated being away from the street and slept soundly. We noticed that some areas had been refurbished since our last visit (2010).

I stayed here for two and a half weeks and had a wonderful stay. The hotel has a very warm and private atmosphere.Moreover this gem of a hotel is upgraded with warm and professional personnel. I had to change rooms due to my booking and then had a mishap with my suite. All handled by the hotel personnel with calming attitude . They found a tailor to fix my suite on time for Monday morning during the impossible weekend hours.They literally took my worries away allowing me to go on with my business.Thank you ~~~Amanda~~~ and ~~~Anna~~~ for your wonderful help and taking care of my uncommon requirements quickly and efficiently. My only little annoyance is the two elevators that are definitely not enough for the weekends.I am definitely coming back here again if only for this committed staff.

The Iroquois is a down-at-the-heels dowager that was probably an okay hotel when it was last renovated 20 years or so ago but is in need of radical plastic surgery. The carpets in the rooms are worn and oily with the foot grease of travelers, the rooms are tiny shoeboxes, the air conditioning does not work well and there are no individual thermostats, the room service restaurant is just plain nasty, and I'll never stay there again.

excellent hotel - top notch. great location- a short walk to everything. This is a classic hotel (but remodeled and in perfect shape). Small lobby. The onsite restaurants looked good but we did not eat there. Luxury all the way. The concierge - Bill I think - was extremely helpful (as was a woman whose name i did not get). Beds really comfortable. Can't think of anything bad - spent two nights and didn't want to leave. It is a bit pricey as you would expect but keep an eye on special deals.

A lovely friendly boutique hotel right in the heart of all the attractions NYC has to offer. Other reviewers state that the rooms are small, but my travelling companion and I found them to be perfectly comfortable.

We love the Iroquois. It is very comfortable and clean and the location can't be beat. WE consider it our home in NYC. The size of the hotel make it much more personal. The linens on the beds are wonderful. I always sleep very well there. We have been guests for years.

The hotel is in an excellent location to Times Square and the popular tourist attractions. Everyone was very friendly and made us feel welcome. The room was clean and the hotel itself was very charming with lots of character. The bed was also very comfortable and we would have been happy to have stayed longer than one night. One negative is I attempted to sign up for their loyalty program before arriving but the system was apparently down as I was unable to do so. I explained this to the front desk agent at check in. She handed me a form to fill out which I did and handed it to her at check out and that's the last I have heard about it. no one has made any contact since. I prepaid for my reservation and fortunately checked my credit card when I arrived home because they charged me $295.00 for the night I stayed. I called and this was straightened out but if someone didn't notice they would have been double charged. So check your credit card after your visit. We had breakfast at the Triomphe Restaurant and were very happy with the food and service.

I actually go to New York two or three times a year and this hotel surprised me because I usually don't like to stay near Times Square but needed a central location this time. It was a good location off the main crowd and surprisingly quiet. We had a welcome gift of chocolate covered strawberries which was so very nice and appreciated. I did not take advantage of the restaurants or amenities but it all seemed nice.

I stayed for one night at the Iroquois NY, it was a last minute thing and found a very good deal on line. Service was excellent, rooms are cozy and room service delicious. I was at waking distance from Time Square and did some last minute shopping. I would definitely come back because of the great location.

This was the first night for my wife's birthday weekend. We only stayed 1 night and we were very, very happy with everything at the hotel. All of the staff that we spoke to were very, very nice and professional. The hotel is in a very, very good location. Times Square is 2 blocks, a short walk away from the hotel, less than 10 minutes. There are many restaurants and attractions that are easy to get to from the hotel. The Rooftop Experience at Triomphe for my wife's birthday was a total surprise for her, courtesy of me and the staff keeping it quiet until we arrived at the hotel. The dinner was awesome, the restaurant staff took care of us, and we hope to return to the restaurant when we visit NYC again. A very, very special "Thank You" to Garette Ziem and the entire staff at the Iroquois New York. The hotel room that we stayed was not very big, but for a boutique hotel, it was perfect for us.

Stayed over for a day after a business trip. The hotel came highly recommended on trip advisor. Though there was nothing wrong with it, I couldn't quite figure the reason for such high rating. Anyway, a good decent hotel at a great location. Complimentary water bottles could have been great.

Before our arrival we enlisted the help of the concierge team who arrange our transfers to and from JFK. They were a great help and continued to be of top quality service throughout our stay!Arrival was as expected and all checked in with no problems. Room were huge! We had the Exec Suites. Room - large living room with comfy sofas and large TV, nice big bedroom to spread our stuff out in again, a large TV. The bathroom was probably a compromise for such large living spaces but for us average Brits, we had no problem ;-) My ONLY grip is that I wanted a cup of tea as soon as I wake up and as no facilities in the room I was unable to do this. Guys, a kettle or something in the room wouldn't go a miss. I was tempted in making a point of this and wondering down to the lobby in just my underwear to make myself a good old cuppa..... But then thought better of it. It was irritating having to get dressed and thus my wife had to put up with Mr grumpy pants each morning :-) That said, if the only thing I can moan about was not being able to make a cup of tea in my room then we are still on a winner. Even for Jonny English this isn't a deal breaker!!The room overall was very good although there were a few touch ups that are due.Location - Well, it's ideal!! Only 5 minutes from the frenetic Times Square and between 5th & 6th Ave yet it felt serenely calm around the hotel. Around 10 minutes from grand Central, Rockefeller Centre, Empire State the hotel is a great base for sightseeing.Finally, the Staff generally - They were great.... Friendly, welcoming and very helpful.Would we stay here again, I hear you ask.....? Yeah!

The Iroquois New York is located within walking distance to many things tourists want to see. Although in a relatively quiet location, you could walk to Times Square in 5 minutes or so. The beds are wonderfully comfortable. The turndown service with chocolates is a nice touch. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Room size was sufficient. The bathroom was small but sufficient with good lighting. The shower head is high, which is good for taller people, and the water pressure was great. The bedroom has low lights, but that did not cause a problem. The concierge, Vanessa, was very helpful in directing us to the right subway stations/trains and buses.The only problem experienced was getting ice in our room when requested. I would stay here again if returning to NYC.
user_name:
Donna R T
Darlington, South Carolina

review_body: very good hotel,paid a little more but got a little more back,this is a well placed small luxury hotel in the heart of midtown,a block across from times square and two blocks up from Bryant park/grand central.Free strong coffee in the lobby was very welcome! rooms are a little on the small side but for 3 of us it wasn't a problem,the mini bar was a bit scary as it works on a sensor,if you remove a drink it automatically charges the card you left with front desk,even if you put it back untouched.we stayed for 7 days in September,the hotel was busy but elevators were quick and front desk always had someone to help if needed.The concierge was especially good,helping us with directions and securing us tables at restaraunts when needed.

This is a small hotel located close to Times Square. I stayed for a week, combining business with a weekend sightseeing in NYC. Location ideal for both purposes. Staff in hotel are excellent; very friendly and helpful. Room was a reasonable size with a very comfortable bed. Nice little bathroom with plenty of toiletries. Good to see an iron/ironing board in room - much quicker, easier an cheaper than using a service for this. I didn't eat in the hotel so cannot comment on this. I used the bar which is small and comfortable. Location is on a surprisingly quiet street between Times Square and 5th Avenue; the hotel felt like an oasis away from the noise and tourists! Would definitely return. The downsides? 1: Quite expensive but I would expect this for such a central location. 2. Gym is only 'adequate', and so if you go expecting to be able to use it for thorough workouts you might be disappointed. 3. Rooms could do with better facilities for re-charging phones and laptops - I had to unplug lights to do this.

We spend very little time in our hotel rooms on holiday but for our first visit to New York wanted to stop in what we thought would be a lovely hotel. This is definitley not a hotel we would return to. If boutique equals musty and dirty then this is spot on. We are generally easy going but this hotel is not up to the 4 star standard. Yes location is great and the staff are helpful but the floor we stayed on (11th) smelt musty as soon as we stepped out of the lift. Our original room was small, dusty and we couldn't fit all 3 suitcases in the closet (as it was tiny) but would have done us. Unfortunately on our return from our first nfl game and first night in new york the discovery of a blood trail down the sink made for an uncomfortable sleep when added to the general state of the room...the hotel was fully booked and as it was late (11.30pm) they couldn't move us. They did however send someone up to clean it...albeit asking if we knew how it happened!!! (Not impressed with that!) The hotel did move us to a one bedroom suite but again the cleanliness standard was low. The double sofa bed for our teenager had a stained mattress and was incrddibly dusty when pulled out. The experience from the first room just heightened our look out! The bathroom was larger and had a spa jet...BUT when our daughter used it black bits came out of the jets presume it hadn't been used in a while. All in all thank goodness we are travellers who spend majority of time out of the hotel. We also will make sure we book direct with the hotel as would have moved to another hotel the first night if we had booked direct.

Being first time New Yorkers, we found this hotel to be in a fantastic position. It was within short walking distance to Time Square and many tourist attractions. All other attractions were easily accessible by subway close by. The rooms at this hotel were clean and of a decent size by New York standards and the bed was really comfortable. I would stay here again.

Conveniently located to best theater, shopping, restaurants and transportation, yet an oasis of quiet and calm with excellent service and a high level of comfort. The speakeasy bar is popular and provides excellent mixology, the restaurant has delicious breakfast, lunch and dinner. Feels like a second home to me.

Excellent hotel in a great location. Rooms small, but on par with most of NYC. Very friendly, efficient staff especially Anna, Vanessa and Seth. Only complaint was that room lighting was quite dull. Good value for money.

I decided on this hotel on reviews I had read on trip adviser and it did not disapoint, I arrived on a very early flight from Raliegh into JFK and arrived at the hotel by 10 am.My room was not ready but the hotel stored my luggage and told me they would e-mail me when my room was ready, so I went exploring New York. At midday an e-mail came in saying my room was ready.The rooms are lovely big bed and big bathroom mini bar and safe, my room had no view but that was no problem as I was exploring New York, the staff are great also especially the reception and bar staff brilliant people.On my departure day I aske for late check out as my flight was not until 8pm I was told it was only possible to have the room until midday so I decided to check out, again the hotel stored my luggage and after returning to the hotel through a thunder storm I was offered to use the shower room to freshen up before my flight to Paris.This hotel is great value for money, I had dinner in the hotel that was a bit pricy but I was in New York center and breakfast was also very nice.There is a nice libary with computer and iced water to keep you cool on the hot and humid days.Thanks to all the team great hotel I will return.

Always a pleasure to stay at the Iroquois. Friendly staff, quiet hotel, within walking distance to many different areas of interest; Time Square, NY Library, Bryant Park, Broadway shows, even the Empire State Building is not too far away....

Great Hotel with a great location with a 5 minute walk to Times Square & 5th Avenue -Staff are very helpful & knowledgable with time for everyoneFree coffee in reception in the morning where you can relax before heading off to the office / sight seeing reading the complimentry daily papers or chat with fellow guests from all corners of the world !! - ( London )Highly recommend for tourist or business trips

I've stayed here several times. Each time the desk staff has been welcoming and accommodating. I've always had a double superior. (last room 1101). The bathroom is sparkling clean, new and bright. Nice amenities, magnifying mirror, lots of towels and robes. The room space is compact but well managed with a chair, floor lamp, table lamp and stand, comfortable beds, dresser w/drawers, hairdryer, closet & plenty of mirrors. There is cold fresh flavored water all day long in the lobby. Free coffee is offered in the morning (no pot in room). Besides being clean and cheerful staff (including concierge and bellmen), it is an excellent midtown location. You are very close to Times Sq, GMA, GCT, Bryant Park, NY Library, subways, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Today Show, St Pat's, and so much more. A coffee shop and dinner are a few feet from the door for reasonable drinks and eats. You are also close to every broadway theatre. We were supplied with a refrigerator in our room at no charge. There are 2 elevators (in case one is busy). Didn't realize that until my 4th visit as the 2nd one is not visible from the front desk. Definitely a refreshing oasis in the city to take a break from the all day and night touring at your feet.

I booked this as part of our honeymoon so spent out a lot more than I would usually - I've not been to NYC before so I'm not sure how the hotel compares to others but I thought the room was very small for the price we paid. The hotel is lovely and the staff were all excellent and it's in a great location. If you didn't want to pay for the hotel breakfast there is red flame diner literally about three doors down on the right as you come out of the hotel

Went to the hotel in 2013 and in 2015, at the first time we had an awesome time. The location is PERFECT and the staff were very helpfull for us to get tickets for events, directions and any information. The second time we stayed at a lower level, which was a little louder than the first one. Also, we had a misunderstanding with a pre-paid credit card, they charged us in the first days without notice and we were planning in paying our reservation with cash. Besides that, was a nice stay.

Great hotel close to everything. Really helpful and nice staff. The room was a bit small, but that's no surprise in NY. The price was quite high, but that was expected since Times Square was only a few minutes away.

We always end up at the Iroquois. The rooms are comfy, the breakfast is delicious, the price is fair. We always are welcomed with a smile. We love the proximity to theaters and there is a garage right across the street.

My family and I stayed at The Iroquois New York for 8 nights during our 'destination wedding' trip in New York City from August 28th - September 5th 2016. The wedding party consisted of me, my (now) wife Lindsay, our parents and our 6-month-old son Noah. The Iroquois New York provided the best customer service experience I have ever received at a hotel. The entire team were extremely professional, attentive, knowledgeable and friendly throughout our stay. The hotel is perfectly located. Although The Iroquois is situated right in the heart of Midtown (2 blocks from Times Square), West 44th Street between 5th & 6th Aves is quiet, clean, historical and safe. Important nearby amenities include: the Red Flame Diner a few doors down (highly recommended for breakfast), a Duane Reade convenience store / pharmacy at the end of the block, drop-off laundry across the street and several main subway stations a short walk away. The Iroquois hotel boasts free tea/coffee in the library, excellent free WiFi, a complimentary DVD library (great selection!), a complimentary newspaper delivered to your door each morning (NY Times) and daily free Walking Tours. The adjoining hotel bar is a relaxing place to unwind with daily 'drinks offers', including a good selection of premium bottled beers, wines, spirits and cocktails. Stop by for a chat with bartender Thomas if you get a chance. We all felt that the entire hotel staff went above & beyond to ensure that we had a great stay, a memorable wedding experience and made things very easy for us, especially caring for our 6-month-old baby boy during his first big trip. Even the General Manager Breandan Gallagher made himself known to me and took the time to congratulate me on my wedding day.
