For the attention of the management, the following members of staff should be commended for their professionalism and kindness throughout our stay: Amanda on the Front Desk, Vanessa and Bill on the Concierge Desk, Seth and Lirim the Bell Staff, and Thomas the bartender. I would especially like to highlight the fact that Seth totally enhanced our experience from start to finish. He was the first person to greet us when we arrived and the last person to bid us farewell when we were leaving. We were all blown away by Seth's kindness, knowledge, communication skills and professionalism. He is an asset to The Iroquois New York.

My wife & mother in law just got back from New York & said I must post a review after they spent a weekend at this great hotel in an equally great location.All the staff were most helpful & they'd like to give a mention to Amanda, Anna & Seth who helped so much.The room was lovely & clean & they liked how a little card with the expected temperature for the day was left.They talked it up so much I'm going to have to take her back.Thanks The Iroquois New York

Our last minute reservation for a hotel convenient to Times Square couldn't have turned out better than our stay at the Iroquois Hotel on west 44th Street in NYC. Anna, Amanda and Christoph at the front desk were welcoming and helpful with our upgraded accommodations and providing walking directions to Rockefeller Center. The room was clean and spacious, and the dark wood and leather accents contributed to its charming, cozy feel. The jacuzzi tub in the bathroom was an unexpected bonus. We'll certainly be back to the Iroquois Hotel.

I was welcomed immediately and felt right at home. Everyone there made sure I was comfortable. Room was small, but a good size for Manhattan. Ammenities were amazing! And employees from the front desk to housekeeping were all friendly, courteous, and eager to help. I'll definitely be back!

Excellent location close to but not on top of everything in midtown in a slightly less busy street. I would describe this as a smaller boutique style hotel. You step off the street into calmness. All the staff you meet are charming and helpful and a special word for the concierge and luggage assistance who looked after our luggage after we had checked out and when we returned to change before going to the airport. You could not wish for a more comfortable bed or pillow and the room was a decent size by NYC standards, and quiet (on a higher floor away from the front). Been before and will come again.

In a great location if your looking to check out Broadway or times square. We lucked into a free upgrade and ended up getting the largest hotel room I think I've ever had in Manhattan. Staff was also really friendly and wiling to check our baggage after checking out while we walked around the city.

This was my third stay at this hotel. It was lovely as usual. Friendly and helpful staff, comfy beds, linens, and robes. This time, we stayed in a deluxe king which is a larger room than my previous stays. Hotel location is wonderful. If there's a problem with anything in the room (a lamp didn't work properly so I left a note with the front desk) it is attended to immediately. The hotel staff does everything they can to make the stay as pleasant as possible.

The Iroquois was perfect for our leisure stay while attending the US Open. Would not hesitate to stay here again. To be recommended for anyone visiting Manhattan. Service, staff and rooms were quite excellent.

We stayed at the Iroquois for four nights in September 2016. On arrival we were greeted warmly and on accessing the room found a small box of chocolates and a bottle of wine, plus a card, to celebrate my recent 60th birthday. The room was lovely, very clean and lots of space, with a fully stocked minibar. The bathroom had all amenities, plus Molton Brown toiletries (my favourites!!). We were fortunate enough to be looked after by Seth on the door with our luggage, as well as him sorting out a taxi for us when we (reluctantly) had to leave ! Overall this hotel is perfect ... clean, great location (a quick walk out and you were on 42nd/broadway), fab view (we could see the Chrysler Building from our window), a hotel I would absolutely recommend and would not look anywhere else in the future should I return to NYC (hopefully!!) soon. Perfect!

Very nice hotel, great location near 5th avenue. room was definitely tiny. Strictly meant for sleeping in but that is the only thing one can knock.Very European feel. Wonderful friendly helpful staff.

Where can you find a perfect location, feel at home but so much better.& amenities This is the only 4 star hotel i and much deserved! The staff was extremely helpful and attentive.Hotel is absolutely wonderful. I definitely plan to stay again on my next trip to NYC. The accommodations were lovely, the service was beyond expectation

Excellent experience in wonderful hotel.Staff were exceptionally helpful in providing directions and other information about the city, location perfect for theater going and sight seeing in Manhattan. Property is beautifully maintained. Highly recommended.

The hotel is perfectly positioned in Midtown ideal for exploring a great City. The rooms are clean and what you expect from a NYC hotel. The Concierge and Front Desk are really helpful. We had a great vacation and would have no hesitation in highly recommending this hotel.

Wonderful hotel, perfect location. Our new go to place to stay in NYC. The staff was excellent. WiFi was very good, room was spacious. We had a corner room directly next to the workout room and we were nervous about noise but we never heard a thing.

My last stay at the Iroquois was in May of this year after staying there for many years and since then I have have had the opportunity to try out several other NYC hotels in the same price category (or agreably lower such as The Executive Le Soleil Hotel) and sadly, for me, the Iroquois just no longer compares in relation to terms of affordability, comfort and amenities. With it's centrally controlled air conditioning that is either too cold or not cold enough, its old slow elevators, its mostly cramped and outdated rooms that are noisy on the street side and quiet but dark and dingy at the back of the building, it's complete lack of in-room coffee making facilities or ice availability (you have to order ice from the front desk)...etc.I have to point out that the service cannot be faulted however that should be the norm for a four star hotel. The high bill at the end of the stay does not warrant the experience in relation to the many other hotels in New York that have sprung up or updated themselves in the last several years and that give you far more bang for your buck.

My wife and I spent 5 days at the Iroquois hotel the last week of August 2016. The hotel is located in mid town making it very convenient to Times Square, subways, and the Broadway theaters. The room was quiet and faced in towards the courtyard, the hotel offered free wifi and a well equipped gym. The staff was helpful and professional, we would recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in mid town Manhattan.

The Iroquois is a beautiful hotel, perfectly located for exploring New York. Great restaurants nearby. Theater. The staff is very friendly. We were provided a map and clear directions for using the subway.

The room is just unacceptably small, especially considering the it's a pricy hotel. Could barely touch a thing without generating extra cost. Two stars go to towel and body wash. Nothing close to its luxury hotel title.

This is a good hotel conveniently located near Times Square. The hotel would benefit with some renovation. We were staying in a room with 2 queen beds - we felt there was not enough space for 3 people.

Whether on business or for pleasure (usually three or four times annually), I have been staying at the Iroquois for over eight years.and always look forward to seeing the friendly staff. Just off Fifth Avenue, it is so convenient for shopping, theater and dining. On this most recent stay, my husband and I spent five nights and we both agreed that we would not consider staying anywhere else in Manhattan.

Loved our stay at Iroquois Hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great location. Spotlessly clean and very comfy beds. There are a lot of hotels in NYC to chose from, the Iroquois is a true gem. Looking forward to our next stay.

One of the cheapest hotels located centrally, smack bang in the middle of mid-town Manhattan. The location is absolutely superb as its within a 5 minute walk to both Times Square and Central Park. Great place to base yourself for a short stay.Rooms are quite basic and our shower wasn't working properly which was a pain, but staff were really friendly and gave good recommendations for restaurants and local taxis. Taxi from jfk (yellow cab) is $65 including tolls and tip, so not too bad. Definitely recommend for another short stay.

Pros:- Great location (if you want to stay in Midtown - I would in the end rather have stayed Downtown with more stylish and less posh eating options)- Great friendly and helpful staff (be it the guys opening doors for you, Vanessa the concierge or the maids)- Quite stylish- Details such as free newspapers + morning coffee and afternoon water with fruits (refreshing and the coffee is actually not bad compared to what you get in NY usually)Cons:- Roughly USD 250 price tag for what looks super stylish on photos but in reality is just old.- The room was inadequate to the price (1. extra small bed, 2. no ceiling light at all and it was quite dark with all the small lamps on, 3. no proper power outlets/ wall sockets, just cord on the floor, 4. the air condition is noisy and 5. the windows are old crappy windows with no noise isolation so you hear drivers blowing horns ALL the time).- Sauna - entrance from gym directly (no separate spa area), temperature never got above 70 degree Celsius, making it useless

We stayed at the Iroquois to see the US Open as well as New York for three days over a weekend. The hotel is small and charming and perfect for Broadway seekers and shoppers alike. We were all over the city and we found it perfect. A second walk to 5th avenue, Broadway and delicious little restaurants. We had a king bed small room. The bed was luxurious and perfect after a long day of wondering the streets of NY. Bathroom was clean and mini bar was perfectly stocked.The staff are the gem in this hotel. From the bell man to the front desk staff, everyone wanted to make everything easier for us. Just a lovely place to stay. Great wifi. Bar and restaurant on premises, tiny but mighty. We would stay again.

Great hotel, very comfortable,fabulous staff and amazing location. Beds are very comfortable and the rooms was spotless. Would definitely recommend for a central New York stay. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff.

Believe the hype. Steeped in history, central to all New York's attractions, superb service from all staff who couldn't do enough for you, rooms with incredible attention to detail, pretty much everything as you'd expect from such a revered hotel. Highly recommend.

We really loved our stay at this hotel. We were celebrating our anniversary and we had booked the premium room. The check in was so friendly, and even though we were early the front desk stored our bags and offered for us to shower and freshen up before heading out for the day. Once we checked in properly that evening, we had a lovely welcome note with some wine and chocolates waiting for us, which was a lovely touch. The hotel were so helpful with everything we asked, including rushing a shoe shine for us, collecting laundry and arranging a great car to take us to the airport. The coffee in the morning and the flavoured waters in the day were a great touch. We also really enjoyed having evening drinks in the adjoining Triophe bar where the bar tender who looked after us was fantastic, and also offered us advice on transport and restaurants, I wish I had taken her name as she was a sweetheart!Our room was big especially for New York. We had a desk area, a huge bed, lots of storage space and a lovely big bathroom too.The location was fab, right between 5th and 6th, and around 15 mins walk from Central Park, close to so many great food spots and easy transport all round city.I high recommend staying here if you visit, the hotel feels like a slice of paradise, so cool, calm and collected. A lovely way to chill out after the busy streets of New York.Thank you for making our stay so great!

Overall an excellent hotel, taking into account the location, can't really compare with outside NYC, NYC is something entirely different. Close to Times square, Grand Central so easy to access other areas. Friendly and helpful staff, was a totally enjoyable experience.

This hotel is in the perfect location for a nyc break could not be better placed, rooms are adequate with very comfy beds. Staff are very friendly and helpful, defiantly would return to this hotel. (Couples trip)

On this charming little street, you feel like you live here as you return from any event or day. You quickly become familiar with all the staff and above all, you feel so safe. Daily advice, umbrellas when needed, and fruit at the front desk all make this a special small and family like hotel.

And amazing is an understatement.Really cozy hotel, supercentral position and with an awesome staff.Rooms are very comfy and the beda are something incredible.Perfect option for a couple, the ambiance is really cool and, once more, the position is fantastic...smacked downtown Manhattan

A great experience all around! I shall return!! EVerything was very customer oriented. Desk staff and Bellmen all totally on the job and committed to the guest having a great experience. THe German bellman walked me and my heavy package all the way up to the next block to hail a cab. He also told the bike cabbie to be sure to take good care of my friend and I ! It's always the little kindnesses and heartfelt things that add up to a great experience. Also the flowers in the lobby were extremely beautiful and fragrant. Somthing I enjoyed each day I was there!

Good sized room for NYC. All staff were excellent, room and shower all excellent, free wifi and good speeds, excellent location, very quiet and comfortable beds. TV in room. Elevator and quiet room downstairs with 2 PC's to print off passes ect. Concierge and front desk all really helpful. Location was between 5th and 6th Ave, really easy for Times square and GCC.

Booked last minute for 5 nights. Centrally located for Time's Square, Grand Central, bus and subways, theatre district and many tourist attractions. Hotel was very clean. Complimentary coffee/tea in the mornings followed by iced water infused with mint & fruit throughout the day were a welcome touch. Staff were very pleasant & helpful. Would definitely return/recommend The Iroquois Hotel.

Wonderful, centrally located hotel with beds to-die-for and great personal service by the entire staff. Local restaurants are terrific, including the hotel's restaurant, Triomphe! Would definitely return here.

Room was typical, small but dirty carpet. Location is good for theatre and shopping. Needs updating. We were in the 9th floor and the ventilation fan was above us, woke us when it went off and on. Staff were friendly.

I stayed here while in NY on business. The room was small but comfortable, for me if the bathroom is adequate I'm fine and this was the case here. The staff is great and the restaurant is high quality. I'd stay here again.

Excellent value of money. Good localization and clean. I recommend the hotel - near of main attraction of midtown and a lot of restaurant/cafeteria close. Time Square are two block from the hotel. I will return back!

I booked this hotel last minute after reading terrible reviews of my original hotel I booked so I decided to move to the Iroquois Hotel. I was not disappointed the front desk were very helpful I arrived very early on a connection flight. The hotel stored my luggage checked me in and said they would e-mail me when my room was ready, I spent a nice few hours walking around New York and then the mail arrived. My room was big and clean with lovely big bed and bathroom with everything you need and more. The bar staff are great nice and chatty or not depends on you nice choice of food and beer and wine. They could not do enough to help I love this place and will be back.

Clean, great location, walking distance to Times Square, easy to find, staff seemed preoccupied however, quite helpful when prompted. Refreshments in the am and pm was appreciated. Would stay there again.

Great stay! Lovely staff and special thanks to Amanda and Ana at the front desk. Always very attentive and helpful. Not my first time, and for sure won't be my last. Good location, service and value for money. Recommend it to everyone looking for a friendly hotel. Many thanks for all the staff! Ivo

My husband and I stayed here in April, 2016 for 2 nights, to celebrate his birthday. We last stayed at the Iroquois about 15 years ago. It has aged gracefully and imperceptibly. The location was perfect for our theatre visits. The Red Flame nearly next door was great for a quick breakfast. The room was really beautiful and although the rooms at the Omni Berkshire Place are larger, the smaller room at The Iriquois had everything we needed. The quiet room was beautifully decorated and appointed. The linens were luxurious and the bath products were top notch. We had a perfect stay. Even the terribly slow elevator was easily overlooked! Hotel staff is professional and knowledgeable. We'll soon return.
user_name:
SusanNYC2017
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is small and cozy. very nice room and close to everything, but not in the thick of it. Staff was so nice. Small touches like free coffee and tea in the am and water in the pm. I would definitely stay here again.

The location of the hotel is fabulous, especially for us as theatre-goers. They had wonderful service, were willing to help us in any possible way and the room was quiet and dark - we overslept by accident! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reliable option in the midtown area.

the staff is great and the hotel is good value for money if you can get a room for up to $300 in my opinion.the rooms are OK although not with sufficient light and the bathrooms are a bit small - that is expected when staying in new york though.

We took two of our grand children for their first look at New York. The location of this property is perfect and the entire staff seemed aware and interested in helping. Directions and suggestions were spot on .We highly recommend The Iroquois to travelers looking for great value and customer appreciation.

My husband and I just returned from 9 nights at this delightful hotel which is centrally located in mid-town Manhattan. Great for seeing Broadway shows and accessible to several subway stations within 10 minutes walk.We stayed in a superior queen room which was comfortable. From reading Tripadvisor reviews I was wary of the size but found it to be comfortable for two people for a 9 night stay with plenty of room to unpack. Our two mid-sized suitcases fit in the wardrobe still allowing hanging room. Larger or more luggage may have struggled for space.I was wary of noise in our room as it was beside and opposite the lift wells however we did not notice any lift noise and our 8th floor room was generally quiet except for occasional street noise, which is to be expected in a city of this size, but was quieter than expected.Staff were friendly and efficient. We enjoyed the nightly chocolates.Lanterns Keep bar is well worth a visit.We got a great deal through the Triumph hotel group summer sale.We hope to return to this hotel next time we are in New York.

Front desk ladies were amazing. The hotel overall was very clean and all staff worked together in making guests stay as comfortable as possible. It is clear that the hotel team is on the same page and works together in making guests have a positive experience. Great team!

Having looked at all the numerous chains of hotels we wanted something different.This place is ideally situated for easy site seeing as is in walking distance of a lot of attractions. Hotel rooms very clean, functional and two large double beds which we needed.Bathroom very well furnished. Staff very polite and helpful and a lovely touch of a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates as a birthday gift from them. Concierge was a fountain of knowledge giving us great tips for exploring. This boutique hotel id a great find we would defiantly return

My favorite hotel in the world. Perfect size room, so clean. Everybody treats me like a friend, like a valued guest. Also a great location with all the places I like to go within easy walking or subway.

Very friendly staff and great location to see all the attractions of New York. Only a block and a half from Times Square.Rooms are quite small with limited views but very clean and comfortable. Beds are small too especially if you are sharing it with someone but comfortable enough. No refrigerator in room which was a disappointment as it was very hot when we visited in August.

We had a weekend class in Manhattan and wanted to be close enough - and we were! The Iroquois is a small-feeling, boutique hotel with a very stylish room...comfortable bed and chairs...SUPER bath...and we did not feel in the least as though we were touristas - the staff was professional and kind. The only thing that kept it from being a stellar experience was visiting the bar - it smelled moldy - so, no visit!

This hotel is for business and holiday a very goog hotel!Why?- lovely hotel (inside and outside)- employees very friendly - calm area and quit rooms / air condition- 44. th between 5. and 6. Ave => best starting point!

Very clean and Easy to get to from grand central, easy to get to different restaurants the bar is a little expensive but appropriate for the location I would definitely recommend I plan on going back soon

Great location, outstanding staff, comfortable clean rooms. Did not use the restaurants, but did visit both bars which were excellent. Front bar has a great happy hour which goes until 7 PM, other bars in the area only go until 5 or 6.

I have reviewed the Iroquois before. Great location...excellent service...friendly staff...accommodations just a little dated (I understand a refurbishment is scheduled for this fall). Otherwise, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and family members. We will be back!

We stayed one memorable week in this hotel. The central location is very convenient for exploring different parts of Manhattan. The building is extremely beautiful both outside and inside. The staff vere extremely professional and polite while being very friendly and went out of their way to make our stay as good as possible. Both check in and check out were very efficient, although the could have felt a little warmer. Our suite was spacious, clean and comfortable although it started showing small signs of wear in a couple of places. The bed was especially comfortable and our bathroom was beautiful. Wifi connection was fast. A complimentary breakfast was included, so we did not try the à la carte breakfast, but the complimentary selection was large enough, made with fresh ingredients and of sufficient size. Overall we did thoroughly enjoy our stay and do wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

That's definitely the place I'll chose for my next trip in NYC!! Can't be beaten! The only thing that could be optimized is a touch of renovation and I believe it's in their schedule... Book it, you'll thank me later!

The rooms are clean and Quite nice hotel , have the best services. I loved this hotel - nice good and excellent services The best hotel in New York !I really have grate time there !The location is perfect The hotel has a very good Resterant Computer Room !

Very happy of our stay in this hotel! The location is excellent, near Time Square and 5th Avenue. Our room was clean, bed comfortable. We recommend this hotel, without bemol. Really a good choice! Enjoy!

Great hotel close to Times Square, Broadway, Bryant Park, shopping and Public Transit.Rooms are well appointed and staff was courteous and accommodating. Beds were quite comfortable and room was quiet. Would definitely stay there again!

Excellent staff, excellent accommodations and excellent location. I stay here every year and love it more each time. Everyone on the staff is pleasant, efficient and accommodating. I feel confident that I am recommending to my friends a hotel of such quality. Boutique hotel.

The Iroquois beds and pillows were excellent! I only wish I could have entered my room at or before the published check-in time so I could have actually enjoyed it more. Also, the new lamps on the lower floors looks pretty however they provides insufficient light.

Loved the room, great colors, enough room and bathroom size for two. Check in smooth and the entire hotel staff was great. Had room service, it was quick and great food. Asked to take off the tray and didn´t pass 3 minutes before there was someone knowing at my door, loved it!Carlos at belldesk was amazing!

We chose the hotel for its location, but the overall quality of the experience was fabulous. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. It was remarkable to be just steps away from the noise and bustle of Times Square and yet have the quiet solace of a quality hotel. The staff were friendly and personable; they made us feel truly welcome! The whole staff were wonderful, but I want to especially thank Amanda and Seth for making us feel like family.

we had the king with a/c which was helpful in the heatlocation is minutes to everything you needfront desk and concierge were great, did not see housekeepingthe elevators take a while, and there is no easy staircase, so stay on lower floors if possiblecoffee and tea in morning is nice, also get you paper and shoe shine for free!no ice available on floors -- had to call for it. Minibar is expensive and in the waycramped quarters, but understand it is NYCwindows let light in so be prepared, and the walls are somewhat thin (could hear conversations next door).I would probably stay here again though, enjoyed it.

I am not usually a fan of boutique hotels, but my daughter loves them and based on Trip Advisor reviews we decided to reserve at the Iroquois. I booked the room seven months in advance and was happy to receive an email saying the hotel staff was looking forward to our visit. ( special touch). A few days before our trip I tried to check on the room size, but it was not mentioned anywhere ( booking.com, the hotel website, etc) . When we stepped into the room I found that it was so small I couldn't unpack! The hotel was full, but Kelly was kind enough to offer us a suite at a lower rate than usual.It was then that I started to enjoy my stay. The staff and service are exceptional. The amenities are of high quality. The towels and sheets are Frette. They offer chocolates at turndown.Coffee is available in the lobby in the morning and fruit flavored water is available in the afternoon.The hotel restaurant, The Triomphe, was excellent too. If you ever needed anything, your needs were met immediately. Maybe size does matter, and a smaller hotel has more personalized service!

I stayed 5 nights at this hotel and the overall experience was great. it is perfectly located as you are 5 minutes away from Time Square however you are not that crowded in their Street location. it's just a block away from 5th avenue, two blocks from NY Library, you pretty much have everything, Time square, shopping near by, nice restaurants, a couple of pubs on the same street as the hotel, a diner just 1 minute from the hotel, this is a place where you want to be in you are in new york for any reason. it's a small hotel so you feel very exclusive and somehow secluded. i would definitely come back when i am in NY

Thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. Staff was amazingly helpful and friendly and atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming. Room had everything we needed and was immaculate, but air conditioning was a little a loud. Would definitely return, but would choose a different room.

Everyone who worked there was amazing and very helpful. They recommended some wonderful restaurants! The room was very nice. There is free coffee, water and tea in the library which was nice. The location is amazing! There are many restaurants in walking distance! We did not have to drive to a single restaurant! Times Square is a short walk away!

We were traveling with 5 young adult grandchildren. The atmosphere of the hotel was perfect for our family gathering. It was relaxed and friendly . Everyone was tremendously helpful. We all got a good night's sleep in our quiet and comfortable rooms. I have never had a better experience at a New York hotel.

Great hotel and location was so near to everything that we wanted to see and do hotel staff were first class so helpful .room clean .bill the conceige was great booked a private car to take us to the cruise port .which was so helpful

Just spent 3 days action-packed in NYC. So happy we selected this hotel. It's a bit out of the Times Square frenzy. Staff is professional yet very welcoming and helpful. Our room & bath although small (welcome to NYC) was immaculate. Daily refresh service was great. Lovely boutique hotel experience.
user_name:
Jean T
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Everyone who worked there was exceptional, very helpful . The room was clean and rather big for being in the heart of Broadway area. There is a cute little bar on the main floor, that was a nice place to sit and relax after a long day out enjoying the city. We were impressed!

Small luxury hotel with a calm and relaxing atmosphere. Excellent location close to everything. Free coffee and tea in the library which you can take up to your room, fruit on reception and soft drinks in the afternoon. Excellent staff and a pleasure to return to after a hectic day out in new york.

This little property is in a great location....do be careful which room you get. rooms The blinds are suppose to be blackout because of how they are hung, too short light streams in. We changed room because of this and it was the same in the new room. Seth tried his best to change our room to one of similar quality but it wasn't happening. We walked in on a room which was occupied (big blunder not knowing this before opening the door). The next room had more windows and they overlooked a noisy courtyard with all the compressors for heating & A/C so it was noisy.

It a nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff. It is located on W 44th between 5th and 6th, two blocks away from Times Square (7th street) and Grand Central Terminal (42nd) and has easy access to shops, restaurants and different places around the city. The room is clean and neat. We received a complimentary bottle of wine on arrival. On and off there is fresh fruit offering for hotel guests at the front desk. We will definitely stay at the same hotel for our next visit.

This hotel offers wonderful service in all areas! The staff are both friendly and willing to go to extra lengths to make arrangements which will enhance your visit to city and make your stay effortless.

The location is wonderful. Though small the hotel is big on quality. The room was extraordinarily "crisp". Everything seemed brand new. The bathroom was a sparkle. Though we did not use the dining facilities the menu was impressive.

Efficient staff, clean well appointed rooms in a very desirable location. Typical NYC view out window (building across the street)). South-facing rooms, so a lot o light. Location with abundant restaurant options.

I have been staying at the Iroquois for business for quite some time and thoroughly enjoy it. The staff is delightful and the rooms are lovely. The best part is the incredible comfortable bedding and pillows. Absolutely top notch, at a reasonable price.

If I write a good review everyone will stay here and I will never get a room! :) I enjoy this hotel for all my business travel. It is smaller hotel so there are no lengthy lines to check in, the bell men remember who you are doing your stay. It is in walking distant to Times Square, shopping, Bryant Park.

Ok yes our room was on the small side and bits of it could do with changing but I mentioned this to the staff and was offered an upgrade/room change straight away. It wasn't necessary so we stayed put and enjoyed the room. The service was exceptional. I was fortunate enough to converse with the General Manager Breandan Gallagher who went out of his way to make us happy with all aspects of our stay. The coffee in the morning was a welcome addition as was the afternoon refreshments as it was so hot in NYC. So perfect location with perfect staff delivery great service. Thank you.

Very comfortable room, quiet, excellent location, and the staff - especially the guys who reception us at the entrance (doormen does nor cover it!) are outstanding - helpful and friendly!! Would come back!

Exceptional stay, exceptional location, exceptional staff. Vanessa, the concierge did a great job getting to know us, so she could provide us with the activities we were looking for. She exceeded our expectations.

The Iroquois hotel is an NYC treasure - a gem of a hotel. The rooms are clean and very comfortable, each one is different, the staff is exceptionally courteous and friendly, price is quite affordable. I give it high value for the money and I stay there at least once a year when I'm in the city for business. I highly recommend it.

Good location , average size rooms but clean and in overall ok , friendly staff , we arrived at 3am and the bell boy was very friendly and helpful .The noisy AC old system units in the room need an urgent upgrade .

We spent a few days at Iroquois for the 18y birthday of my girl friend niece,we spent a fantastic journey at the hotel which is excellent and super well located in NYC,thanks to the personnel of the hotel who was extremely nice with us,hope to see you again for my next business trip end August 2016, jfv

This hotel is well positioned has nice clean rooms but no fridge and no tea or coffee making facilities. This is not good enough to wake up in the morning without the ability to make a warm drink. The mini bar was described as being computerised and if you remove one item...even accidentally...you would be charged for it.

Stayed here for a week at the end of of November last year with my husband and brother and sister in law. The rooms were lovely and clean and bigger than we expected for New York and the bed was really comfy. The bathroom was great too, very clean and had complimentary Molton Brown products. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only negative for me was that I couldn't get a cup of tea in my room, but this was easily solved by stopping at a diner just down the road on our way back at night. I would definitely stay here again and have no hesitation in recommending it.

We stayed in the Iroquois as part of a four night break. We had a suite on the top floor (12th) facing West 44th Street, with our children sleeping on a fold out bed in the sitting room.Check in was at 3pm. We turned up at 2.30pm and were told that the room wasn't ready as house-keeping had to check it. However, at 3pm on the dot, we were allowed up to the room, so I'm not sure whether we were just being made to wait until the allotted time.The room, and sitting room, were both of a good size (for NYC) and the bed in the bedroom was large and comfortable. The sofa bed was also a good size. The bathroom was fairly small, with a 60cm x 60cm shower cubicle and separate bath (which was not full size), but was fine. Like the rest of the room, it was clean.There was free wifi in the room.We didn't eat in the hotel's restaurant. For breakfast, we went locally to Pershing Square (just by Grand Central Station) and the Brooklyn Diner (just by Times Square), both of which we would recommend. (There is also a diner on West 44th Street called The Red Flame, which I have eaten at previously and is perfectly fine.) For dinners, we went to the West Village - The Spotted Pig, Spice Market and Cafe Cluny. I would recommend all of them, though be careful not to order too much food at the Spice Market. Also, you cannot book at the Spotted Pig and have to put your name down on their list (in person).While we liked the hotel, if we were to go again, we would probably stay in the West Village, which is a bit quieter and more 'boutique-y'.

A small friendly hotel with a wonderful staff that makes you feel at home from the second you arrive.Attention given to small details.Newspaper, computer and reading room- always with a complimentary drink (coffee, tea or fruited water).Small but useful gym and sauna.Complimentary walking tours of NYC - A GREAT idea. A very attentive GM.I RECOMMEND and will return.

We've stayed there and it was just amazing. The licatuon is super close to the broadway and of course all the stores such as american eagle and so on.The hotel itself is small but it is totaly enough. We've loved it :)

This hotel is among one of the tops in NY. It is centrally located by most everything you would want to do. You will not be disappointed. The staff is great and the accommodations are too! You will not find a beter hotel for the price!

This is a very nicely run boutique hotel which is centrally located. The rooms are comfortable with Molton Brown toiletries. The attached Triomphe restaurant is a nice place to enjoy breakfast or a cocktail before a show. The Lantern's Keep speakeasy is a great place to relax after a show before turning in for the night. Moderately priced for New York.

Just a few blocks from Times Square and all the flash, lies a quaint, quiet and sophisticated parlor-hotel to rest and rejuvenate. Rooms are the usual New York City small, yet a strategic bay window, room mirrors and spacious and well-appointed bathroom give the small room depth. Queen beds are really doubles -- so get prepared or ask are there any king-sized beds in the hotel. My search online yielded none, but call. Calling, also, yields the best rates -- better than any online consolidator. HOW'S THE FOOD?The hotel has a famous bar with resident mixologists serving up specialty cocktails and a place in the history books. The bar is part private club-ish, and part bar for the urban sophisticate. There are no hipsters in sight.Room service is very costly -- even moreso than usual. - Tip 1, order room service breakfast in bed for one and you can most definitely feed two. After two heaping plates with at least six pieces of bacon a piece for my partner and I arrived, I then understood why the attendant asked twice if I meant to order two breakfasts!- Tip 2, there's an American diner about five businesses down boasting its TripAdvisor certificates of excellence where many guests on the block of refined hotels savored the fare and saved their funds for other delights of New York.ATTENDANTSEach person encountered is genuine and hospitable. Expect elevators to be held and greetings for a great day and pleasantries upon return. You will not have to wrangle luggage. Eagle-eyed attendants quickly determine if stowage is needed or a cab -- with luggage taken off your hands for whichever transaction quickly and with ease. Upon reaching your room, expect tips on room devices and inquiries of whether additional assistance is needed in shows, reservations or directions.COZINESSThe hotel has a comfortable library with books, fresh fruit-flavored water, hot water and tea choices, computers and newspapers. This area is easily accessible through French doord right off the reception area and towards the entrance/exit door. The decor includes dark wood floors, large-paneled wood walls, room-sized rugs, lamps and the warmth of a den. The reception area is kept replenished with perfectly ripe and sweet strawberries, good for grabbing on the way in or out. The entryway and library are inviting, spacious as well as cozy. SUMIf you seek a nicer place to relax while in the busy hub that is NYC and near Times Square and Broadway theaters, you have found your quiet NY home without having to go to the Upper East Side. The hotel is best suited for couples, solo travelers and perhaps those with business near the area. Rooms and ambiance seem more suited to the adult traveler moreso than the family fun outing. The Iroquois is the sort of place where once discovered, you are bound to try it again. Happy travels!

quiet boutique hotel, centrally located, great staff. great artisan coffee across the street. close to Times square. Easy access to Metro. Safe, convenient for our needs of theatre and visiting family.

We stayed 3 nights and were very happy with The Iroquois and impressed with the quieter location yet still right in the heart of midtown. The beds were comfortable (although the double bed in the other room seemed a bit shorter than normal - likely due to the size of the room), the room itself was clean and all the staff we encountered were very pleasant and helpful. The drawbacks here are that there are no great views and there are no ice machines so you must always call down for ice to be sent up - and with no mini-fridges it makes it challenging to keep drinks cold in the room.Overall it's a pretty good spot that I would consider again in the future.FYI - there is a parking lot across the street with a decent rate ($45/nt).

The room was excellent, recently refurbished. The staff were fantastic, very polite and helpful. The location is perfect too, with time square and grand central station only a couple of block in either direction.

A little Jewel in the heart of the city that offers value for money.Includes gym, walking tours of the city.Excellent location. Very helpful and friendly staff.Very pleasant rooms and comfortable bed.

My wife surprised me with a night in NYC for my birthday. Very nice hotel near Times Square. Best bed ever. Small room but very comfortable. Lounged in bed until 11:00 AM! Loved it. Will be back. And found a parking place on the street right across the hotel!

I loved staying at the Iroquois Hotel! The location is perfect, with Grand Central Station a couple of blocks away, and Times Square close by, too. The room was small, but very nice. Service was top notch, especially the concierge. The Lantern's Keep is such a cool place to have a drink. There is a coffee shop across the street and a diner close by, too. This will be my hotel of choice when I visit NYC. Great experience!

When it comes to booking a hotel in New York when you're a first time visitor the choice can be endless and what location do you pick?! The reason I picked this hotel was because I'd read the reviews that had mentioned how helpful the staff were, how welcoming there were and how it was a little more intimate than some of the larger hotels. As I was travelling alone with children I felt this would be the ideal hotel and I wasn't wrong!! When we arrived after a long journey, there were no mad queues or bustling to find where you were going, we just went straight in, got a lovely friendly warm reception and Seth took our bags, showed us our room and gave us loads of tips and helpful information without overwhelming us, brilliant! Now don't get me wrong, the room was a little small and there are no tea/coffee facilities in your room but you do have free tea and coffee in the lounge in the morning before you head off out if you wish. However, another fantastic thing about this hotel is the location! Turn right and in less than a 2 minute walk and you're in Times Square and turn left and in a minute you're on 5th Avenue and 5 minutes off the Empire State Building! Top location!!! I wish I'd understood the location before I came to New York because i have to be honest and say that we booked a hotel directly in Times Square for our last night (I hadn't realised how close we were!) and when we got to the other hotel the hustle, bustle, queues and 15 lifts and the impersonal nature of a large hotel made me want to run screaming back to the personal touch of The Iroquois! Plus I could hear every beeping taxi driver and police siren and I can normally sleep through anything! I'd just got used to the quiet of the Iroquois! I can't recommend this hotel enough and if I'm lucky enough to go back to New York I will stay here and only here!!

Great hotel near Bryant Park....friendly staff...great clean rooms with Molton Brown toiletries...turn down service with chocolates and daily newspaper...This is our 3rd trip to New York but the first to this hotel...would definitely recommend this hotel...Within walking distance of most amenities...

I was on room 500. However I can't imagine that makes a difference. What made a difference were the employees. All were charming and efficient. I live in a very rural area so my first visit to the big apple was not without some social apprehension. (I sound like quite the bumpkin). The staff at the Iroquois helped me realize that folks in NYC are as comfortable as anywhere else. Amanda, Bill, thanks for helping to make this trip wonderful.

What a refreshing experience we had staying at this centrally located, clean, and quiet hotel in Manhattan. The exceptional customer service we received from the doormen, the front desk staff, and the concierge was both surprising and very much appreciated. Who said New Yorkers aren't caring folks? Can you imagine staying in a hotel in a city where you are wished a good day when leaving in the morning and welcomed back warmly when returning at the end of the day.

This is a great location close to numerous major sites or within easy access to the subway. Nice hotel .with excellent air conditioning. Well worth taking the free walking tours available each day - great guidesThat said, facilities were average and for the price paid I would have expected at least breakfast which was no included.

Everything was fabulous.great location and amazing and attentive staff.It was my birthday weekend and I received a bottle of wine, chocolates and a birthday card.Our room was upgraded when we checked in which was a pleasant surprise

Stayed there last weekend (7/14-7/18/16). Fantastic location: close to everything in Midtown without the typical noise.Premium queen room was about the size of a usual NYC hotel room, maybe a bit bigger.Hospitality was incredible. Room and lobby were very clean. Staff was very friendly. Upon check-in, my wife and I were given a complementary bottle of wine and chocolates. Received chocolates, newspaper, and weather cards daily. Very impressed with the hospitality.Bed was comfortable, amenities were above average for NYC. Highly recommend staying there for the price.

Everything was great from the time we walked. We were greeted right away and the check in was fast and easy. The entire staff was kind and professional. I recommend the bar as the drinks and atmosphere were great.

Great boutique hotel 1 block from time square, location within walking distance to hot spots, food, super service, clean rooms. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but that's just new York.Would definitely stay again

We looked at several options for a three day stay in the city. After considering many hotels we chose this intimate and comfortable hotel in the Times Square area. The hotel is situated on a quiet section of 44th between 5th and 6th. If you are going to see Beautiful it is a great option. We chose a suite and found it roomy and comfortable. Some street noise on the eighth floor but one does expect it since it is "the city that never sleeps!" The staff is helpful and friendly. Our only complaint is that the shower door would not close. We reported it on the first day of our visit but nothing was done to repair during our three day stay. We were also disappointed that the bar/restaurant was not open on Sunday. We ended up at the neighboring hotel bar, which was very nice. Would consider a future stay!

We stayed at the Iroquois Hotel for 5 nights and we were extremely disappointed with this hotel. You need to know that this hotel is overpriced for the equipment and rooms are very tired. You will find better option for the price. I will not return to this hotel, ever. We stayed in small leading hotels of the world before and we will complaint to them as this hotel should not be listed in their group of hotels, as it is so tired.We paid over $400 a night for a room full of dust, with dirty and stained carpets! The housekeeping is really minimal (we found a piece of pizza on the floor when we checked in!!). Even paying this high price, you are still expected to tip everyone, including the cleaning lady that leaves you an envelope for tipping everyday!! Really annoying...Oh... be careful too: they do not change your bed sheets unless you leave a card on your bed. We only saw the card in a tray near TV the day of our departure... The card should be on the bed or most hotel actually ask you to put the card on the bed if you do NOT want to change your bed sheets. At the Iroquois it is the other way around... See pictures attached...Good point of this hotel (only one):Location - It is located near Times Square and the 5th Avenue.Bad points of this hotel:Old and darkCheck-in counter in the middle of dark corridor (not at all as picture on site)Not corresponding to the picture on the internet site (must be photoshoped)Filthy rooms Tired furniture and bedBed too soft (tired)Awful housekeeping servicesTiny bathroomTiny wardrobeTriomphe restaurant: as the rest of the hotel: old and dark, overpriced. Menu not updated for a number of years I think (serving huge portions of pub food at the price of elevated food).

Always a pleasure. The staff are professional, knowledgeable and very friendly - I always feel that they truly value my custom.Chef never disappoints - the Harlequin Soup is wonderful and the lamb and scallops have made a reappearance on the menu - hooray!!!Worth every penny!!! Pleasure check out this treasure in Manhattan.

Great luxury boutique hotel. Nice location within walking distance to 5th Ave., Times Square and great restaurands. Staff is efficient and friendly. This was my second stay and I will definitely return.
user_name:
barbaragY7332HF
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I really cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The front desk and front door staff greeted me by name as i walked in. My flight was so late.This made me feel welcome and as a female travelling alone it is so much appreciated. Normally, I stay at the larger name brand hotels in time square. Never again. During the recent protest, on 5th, the hotel staff made me feel very safe and secure. the Chef, from Switzerland offered to shoe me his rooftop garden where he grows all his fresh herbs and veggies. Amazing!! As a Canadian, I have become used to coldness when travelling within some parts of the United States. Not Here!! My room was beautiful, great bed and luxurious bedding. The amenities were top class. The price of the hotel per night was affordable . The television worked perfectly with many channels and also a DVD player. Wifi was free as well. Lovely coffee and tea selection was free in the library room in the morning.

It was a pleasant stay there. I would like to visit there for my next business trip in New York. Accessibility and room condition is noteworthy, and their kind service helped me focus in work. Thanks a lot!

Thought I would try this for a change for a business trip as there was very little availability elsewhere. The room was one of the smallest, darkest rooms I have ever stayed in, and I have stayed in plenty of hotels in NYC. I think it was called a superior room. Carpet is very worn, furniture is worn, mattress too old and soft, no control over the room temp. Bathroom is newer. No easy to use electrical outlets- One electrical strip under the desk and modern chargers don't fit. I had to charge devices in the bathroom. Bar was closed both nights I was there. Local restaurants are overpriced and mediocre at best. I suppose some like this midtown location but it's not for me. Too noisy, crowded and dirty.

We booked this hotel for a short weekend trip to NYC and we were pleasantly surprized. Everyone was professional and very welcoming. They really make you feel like you are "part of the team" and that they are genuinely happy to see you. Wonderful concierge and peppy Bellmen. they have a small restaurant downstairs that is supposed to be very good but we decided to eat elsewhere. The location is excellent for getting to almost everything in Midtown. We walked to Times Square / Broadway plays / Rockefeller Center / St. Patrick's Cathedral / The subway to go to Greenwich Village and Wash Square Park, etc. 5th avenue is on one side and 6th ave on the other. Parking directly across the street. And for breakfast, walk 50 yards towards 6th ave and there is an excellent diner called The Red Flame that is great for a quick breakfast or any other meal of the day. We always sat right down and never had to wait for anything. Service was impeccable.

A nice small hotel nearby Timesquare New York, W44Street between 5th en 6th AvenueThe employees are very kind and helpfull. We had a wonderfull time in The Iroquois! This was our first stay in New York.

Amanda at the front desk was fantastic. She went above and beyond to help accommodate myself and my travelling companion with our rooms. It was my daughters 16th birthday celebration trip and she personally delivered a gift to our room. That was very thoughtful. Hotel was in a great location and would highly recommend choosing the Iroquois for your stay in New York City.

We have stayed at the Iroquois Hotel each year for the past 6 years - the hotel is very convenient to mid town sights and as a base for the rest of NYC. The hotel is in a safe area and for those planning their first trip to NYC the Iroquois Hotel is an excellent choice. Hotel staff are very helpful, polite and willing to assist their guests in any way they can. Public transportation is minutes away as are restaurants, theater district and Times Square!This is the place to stay for your memorable trip to NYC!

The absolute best vacation we've ever taken! We loved The Iroquois. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. Say hi to Seth the bell man. He will make your day. The location was perfect for all that we wanted to experience.

Spent the 4th of July weekend in NYC and at The Iroquoos. It's location, which is a couple blocks from Time Square, made it easy to get to my Circle Line boat tour and also provided easy access to the subway so I could easily get the the fireworks on the East River. The Concierge is exceptionally helpful being very friendly and knowledgeable of NYC sites and activities. The Lantern's Keep cocktail bar, located off the hotel lobb, is classy and skilled: one of my favorite cocktail bars! My room was comfortable and incredibly quiet even though it's in midtown between 5th and 6th avenues. Always a great stay at The Iroquois!

We've been in the Iroquois in January. The hotel is very nice and very well situated, the service was excellent, the rooms well furnished and rather small (but we are in New York). We were a little disappointed by the service at the breakfast, the waiter didn't seem really interested by our presence.

At first I was disappointed because the room was small, but I was won over by the amenities: Moulton Brown toiletries, Frette bathrobes, \turndown service, a morning N Y Times in aw bat hanging on the oujtside door handle. They are stuck with the skeleton of their old building, but make every effortr to make up for it. And not to be missed is their terrific restaurant, Triumphf.

As always, we enjoyed your beautiful hotel. The service was wonderful. We will be back soon!The location is so convenient to the things we like to do. The bed is so comfortable. Thanks to Breandan for the wine and chocolates , Really good.

We are a family of three and experienced outstanding service from every member of staff. A first night meal in the restaurant was a very welcome introduction to food in New York - all three dishes were extremely good, supported by knowledgeable, attentive and friendly staff.

Very small, dingy rooms. No bellman or door service. Hotel is small and very old looking. Was not pleasing at all, location is great though in midtown manhattan. Bathroom was very old and bath fixtures were falling apart. AC in room made a weird loud noise that was very annoying at night while we tried to sleep.

Location is fantastic.Old hotel without any work done in many years.Housekeeping did not do the essentials as closing curtains or change towels left in the bath.Shower door leaks and left a ton of water on the floor.Matress needs to be changed...

Had a fabulous time in New York staying here. Staff nice and friendly and always there to help. Room was clean although the only downside was a view of next doors fire escape. On the plus side the room was at the back of the hotel so it was lovely and quiet. Great location just off times square and it was only short walks away from all the midtown attractions. Would definitely stay here again.

Lovely, small hotel, great location. Dining/room service quite expensive.Very,very comfortable beds. Bathroom amenities are good.bathrobes lovely No coffee/tea facilities in the room,Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are not huge, but nicely decorated. Rooms are very clean

Nothing lavish here, but a good hotel room with good desk space, excellent bed, well trained staff. A pleasant surprise just three blocks from Times Square. The restaurant is charming and the room reasonably quiet.

This hotel was clean, cozy, quiet, and had many extras! The staff was amazing and helpful! It was our anniversary and we could not have picked a better place to stay in NY! It is located in the perfect area of Manhattan! We will return when we are in New York!

Our second stay at the Iroquois was as great as the first. We spent three nights in a premium King. The hotel is a perfectly situated oasis between the chaos of Fifth Ave and Times Square. Small, quiet, very warm and friendly staff. We particularly enjoyed the large bright windows in the bedroom AND bathroom. Lovely white marble fixtures, and we love the Molton Brown products. Very comfortable bed and linens. A/C worked fairly well given how hot it was outside. Attentive cleaning staff. We really enjoyed breakfasts in the hotel: reasonably priced, good portions, and choice. Look forward to returning again!

Arrived on a red-eye flight from California and wanted to drop off my luggage and change before I headed up to a graduation in Washington Heights. Although I was several hours too early for my guaranteed check-in time, the front desk staff offered me an opportunity to shower and change in the workout facility on the third floor which is a converted bedroom with a small bathroom off the gym area. It was a bit awkward to bring a small roller suitcase into the bathroom while other guests worked out, but I was so grateful for an option to shower and refresh knowing I would be gone the entire day and likely late into the evening. Additionally, there was coffee and mint-infused water in the lobby that was much appreciated to help adjust from the overnight flight. Arriving back at the hotel around 11 pm, I was pleasantly surprised to have a room on the twelfth floor with windows looking directly at the Chrysler Bldg...a special landmark I never tire of seeing even after years of having an office directly across the street. The bathroom had a full shower over a tub, a large pedestal sink and a sizable window ledge to store make-up/toiletries. This was also a pleasant surprise since I've been in several New York hotels that have much larger lobby and bar space, but the bedrooms and bathrooms are out of scale to the rest of the pubic spaces. This room had a nice-sized closet with door, a desk with great light and view during the day, and comfy bed with really nice linens. The staff were all pleasant without being solicitous. There was a glitch with the guest computer on the day I was leaving, but the front desk staff helped out with computer needs while the server was being fixed. This hotel has a distinct old-world feel, indeed it's a historical building on a centrally located street in Midtown. Because it's 44th street, it's not as busy a thoroughfare as 42nd or virtually any other crosstown street because Grand Central blocks the cross-town traffic, so the street has a quieter vibe. The Iroquois shares the same block at the Algonquin, Royalton and Sofitel hotels, and the Harvard Club of NYC. Two blocks from Bryant Park and NY Public Library and three from Grand Central Station which is a destination in and of itself and certainly the most universal launching point for all subways and trains to upstate NY and beyond. Enjoyable.

I enjoy staying at the Iroquois. It is literally in the centre of town and close to everything. The rooms are comfortable and well maintained. The staff know how to look after people - friendly without being familiar - and go out of their way to make sure that everything is done to assist without running your holiday or business trip for you. On this trip Alex at the front desk and Seth on the door were particularly helpful and cheerful - especially on the check out and getting the cab to JFK. Thank you gentlemen! I look forward to staying at the Iroquois again when next in NYC.

We stayed at the Iroquois for our first visit to New York & we were not disappointed!On arrival we were greeted very warmly by Seth, the doorman. He and the rest of the staff were very attentive and informative of the area, and were always on hand if anything was required. The only slight downside was our room, 201, which was quite dark, even with all the lights on. This was a lovely & recently renovated room to a high standard but could do with better lighting. Overall we would definitely go back to this hotel (tomorrow if we could)!Michelle and Lauren from Stockport

Booked a room here on short notice using Expedia. Got a great price for a pleasant, conveniently located hotel near the theater district. The room was clean, modern, quiet ,and pleasant – although the window looked out onto a wall and HVAC equipment. The bed was very comfortable, and the staff at the front desk very helpful, giving me directions to various destinations.

Location is excellent as it is on 44th street so not directly in times square. The first night we walked down to Johns pizza for amazing new York pizza then over to Bryant park which is really pretty at night. This was a shopping trip and broadway shows so all within walking distance. We did take a taxi down to SoHo for Italian restaurant and rode the subway back with no problem. Highly recommend broadway show Waitress and eating at the Bryant Park Grill.

We booked this hotel for 6 nights for our first visit to NY to celebrate our daughters 21st Birthday. We had been e mailing them with questions, which they had responded to and been very helpful i.e. how to get there from the Airport) They knew it was our daughters birthday and said they would leave a gift in the room. We booked a twin (which had 2 doubles) and a king size room - we were given interconnecting rooms with a lobby door that we could shut so we could leave our internal doors open and use as a suite.On arrival at 3:20pm we were told our rooms were not ready (which was very disappointing after a long flight) so we went out for a walk. The present for our daughter never materialised either(!) so why offer ?!The rooms were large and the beds were so comfortable but the rooms were very dark and very cluttered with items they wanted you to purchase. The bathrooms are compact but showers are great - free toiletries and fluffy towels and dressing gowns were great touches. There is a sign saying to not use the fridge but as were stopping for 6 nights - we moved everything out of the way and put in our own drinks and snacks, returning them on the last day.There is complimentary hot water with coffee and tea bags on the ground floor in the morning. Free newspapers were provided every day and a weather report too. The rooms are turned down each night and small chocolates given - a nice touch when you have been out exploring all day. In fact room service were great.The building is beautiful and the 2 lifts very old but functional. The front desk was always welcoming. The concierge not so - he never introduced himself to us and was usually sat talking to the same lady (with a dog) every time we walked past.On returning to the hotel every afternoon we telephoned down for some hot water and cups (we had to purchase milk and tea bags) and this was duly brought up ....but we got charged for 2 out of the 5 times (disappointing).We didn't use the restaurant and only used the front bar on 1 evening - which was pleasant but had no atmosphere.The location is superb - everything a 10-20 minute walk away or subway stops nearby and taxis stopping outside the hotel. If the ground floor was configured more for guests and not drinkers/diners it would be much better as an open plan layout, with lots of sofas and informal sitting areas. The restaurant was large but we never saw more than 2-4 tables used, the back bar was small, dark and very loud. Saying all of this for location and comfort of the room we would recommend it for families and couples.

out of all of our trips to New York, this was the most memorable one of all, the staff was friendly courteous and greeted us with a smile, we enjoyed the room, the bed was very comfortable and the food was excellent. The Bar was nice, the drinks were great but it was a little crowded, but again, the drinks and the staff was great.We normally stay in one of the big name brand hotels, while in New York, well this will not happen again, "The Iroquois New York" will be our Choice of Hotel from now on, while in New York.Location was fantastic, could not have been better, you can walk everywhere, your right in the Heart.To the staff, a great big thank you, you guys were awesome, your smiles, your helpfulness, stay that way, we will be back

Wonderful location between shopping on Fifth Avenue and Broadway theaters .This hotel is a great find- small rooms but well stocked with frette linens and l'Occitane bath products, lots of lights, wifi and plugs! Friendly staff...

The entire Staff at The Iroquois was extremely welcoming and happy to assist with any need. My stay at The Iroquois was a wonderful experience! The hotel is located in the perfect part of Manhattan. It was a great price and overall value!

Hotels and most businesses these days are expected to not just offer great service, comfy beds, etc. but also allow customers to be responsible during their stay. The Iroquois doesn't offer organic, no recycling?

While I agree with all the positive reviews for the Iroquois, an important item has not been mentioned. I was traveling with a friend who used a walker. To our surprise there were a number of steps one needed to climb to enter the hotel. I was able to carry the walker, and my friend was able to climb the steps. The doorman wasn't always there to help. Our rooms were very small but charming, and appeared recently renovated. Ours did not have a refrigerator, but the hotel did bring one to the room. The hotel has an interesting history. It was at one time an apartment building. The neighboring room to my friend's room had a plaque on the wall which stated that in the 50's it was James Deans home for two years.

Loved how convenient this hotel is to Grand Central, theatre district, and subways. The front desk was always friendly and helpful - loved the fresh strawberries. The library room off the lobby was a relaxing place and we often took advantage of the tea/coffee in the morning and the fresh beverages in the afternoon. Our room was a little tight but bathroom was large. towels and toiletries were great. When we called for items we needed (pillows, etc) they were brought up quickly. Would have preferred not to have the clutter of the assorted beverages/snacks in the room. (maybe they can consider putting them in a basket and asking people at checkin if they'd like one brought up) We will stay here again without question. Had to sign in every day to wifi. Wifi was free when we were there; I hope they are not planning on charging for it in the future. that will be a game breaker for us. Tv had lots of channels. A channel list in the room would have been helpful.

The Iroquois was a very friendly and conveniently located hotel. The staff helpfulness and friendlinesswere outstanding. The amenities available off the lobby are excellent. The rooms are quite for sleepingand the room service is very good. The high quality of the towels in the bathroom plus the amenitiesprovided with bathrobes and products available for use in the updated bathroom were very much enjoyed and appreciated. This is a great place to stay close to the theater district. We will be back again when visiting New York.

The hotel is very good, in a very good location. Only five minutes from Times Square and fifth avenue.The service is great, very welcoming and the staff is very helpful. The rooms are a little bit small but very clean.

This was an excellent choice for a weekend in New York. The hotel is beautiful, clean, friendly and perfectly located. The concierge helped us with show tickets and restaurant reservations. The restaurant in the hotel is also great. I highly recommend The Iriquois.

Checking in for a 7-night stay, we (two couples) were told that our rooms would not be available for the first 2 nights due to "technical difficulties" and they had no other available rooms in the hotel. You can imagine our disappointment. That said, the hotel did everything they reasonably could to make amends. They booked us into their sister hotel, arranging transport of our luggage both there and back. On return to the Iroquois they upgraded us to better rooms at no extra cost and they arranged for each couple to have a refund of one night's accommodation. All in all, they couldn't have done much more, given the initial problem (we never found out what it was).The hotel is a historic hotel on West 44th Street, a few doors along from The Algonquin (of literary fame). It's very handy for all the tourist must-sees - Times Square, Empire State, Rockefeller Centre. We walked to most places including the High-line Path (although I have the blisters to prove it!) Subway travel at $3 a ticket was a bargain, especially from Grand Central Station, again reasonably close to the hotel. We didn't eat at the hotel or use room service, so can't comment o those. The Iroquois is a characterful hotel, with helpful staff and I would love to go back.
user_name:
Posyc59
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: In an area with many hotel choices, this Small Luxury Hotel did not disappoint. We were in a newly renovated room, and it was terrific. Comfortable, And quiet. All the little touches and amenities were very nice and added to our enjoyment. The staff is very friendly and helpful, with Vanessa, the concierge going the extra mile to make the stay special. A wonderful choice in Midtown.

Nice and clean hotel in the middle of ,NY heart. The stuff were very kindly and hospitable. The hotels vicinity to Time Square and the shopping street was perfect. The air conditioners are great but noisy

We visit the city a couple of times a year and wouldn't stay anywhere else. The staff, hotel accommodations, restaurant and location make it a wonderful retreat for a long weekend of Broadway shows, fine dining, shopping & culture.

The Hotel is a primo location and a true 5*.As a born and raised NYC kid we celebrated my Wife B-Day and Fathers Day. They bumped us up after I made an error and we had enough space to have a drink with our kids and friends in the suite King. All Super Good.

The room was adequate but had a bad check in experience with the front desk! Although we were given an "upgrade" to a King room, the stay was spoiled by a bad attitude by the person checking us in. Excellent location!

Our room was very quiet and very comfortable and provided the necessary amenities, including a very nice hair-dryer. It was roomier than several we have stayed in, in the area. We liked the "library" with coffee in the morning. Service was efficient and friendly. The room was spotless and nicely decorated. We were very happy with our stay.

The location is very central to all that NYC has to offer. I stay here every year on business and it doesn't disappoint. The rooms are clean and well appointed. I love the restaurant and bar on the main level. Their craft cocktails are fabulous!
user_name:
Melissa L
San Diego, California, United States

review_body: My husband and I have stayed at many NYC properties over the years, but the Iroquois was by far the best. From arrival to departure all of our expectations were exceeded. The room was spotless, the bed was comfortable and there was barely a peep of noise all night. The staff went out of their way to make you feel as if they valued your business. And the location can not be beat. Overall a perfect stay, we will be back.

Tucked into West 44th Street, the Iroquois provides a convenient base for exploring NY City. Clean and neat rooms (although our "suite" seemed a little small) engaging reception staff, small restaurant and bar on the premises provide everything you need. Within walking distance of theaters and Times Square and Grand Central Station.
user_name:
jrjojo
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This hotel is a true gem, perfectly located on 44th St between 5th and 6th Aves.Everything from the entrance, lobby, library and into the rooms are well presented and the staff are wonderful.Nothing is too much, and they have a wealth of local knowledge to keep any tourist on the move.Central to Times Square, Grand Central Terminal, Empire State building and The Rockefeller Centre, and if you don't mind walking it can lead down to 12th St and The Intrepid Museum and Sightseeing Ferries.If not too keen to walk, the Metro can be accessed from Time Square or Grand Central, then there are the taxis of course.Made my stay in NYC.

This is a great hotel for the price and the location you are only about five minutes from Times Square and within walking distance of Broadway shows everyone at the hotel is very friendly and very helpful

This was our second stay at the Iroquois. This is a boutique hotel, small and elegant, and extremely well located if you intend going to the theatre. This time, we were upgraded to an Executive Room, quite large, with a living room and a nice bath with a window that could be opened. The room had a large king size bed and the location on the sixth floor was quiet. The closet was very small but we managed just the same.The hotel is very close to Times Square. Excellent restaurants nearby (Charlie Parker at the Knick, Café Boulud practically next door). The hotel also has a restaurant that we did not try - we only had breakfast, which is excellent also. There is no lobby to speak of, but there is a small library with printers and coffee. They also have a very popular bar, very busy every day. Housekeeping was also very good and the front desk and concierte always ready with good advice. If you are going to the theatre in New York, there is no better place to stay than the Iroquois. Highly recommended.

With a lobby reminiscent of a private club, and cocktail bar that Zagat's says is one of the best in the city, the Iroquois is a hidden gem. I checked in around 3:00, and I was pleasantly surprised to find people actually reading in the little library off the lobby and drinking the citrus & mint infused ice water that the Iroquois provides for their guests. My room reminded me of a guest room in an old New England house, in the best way possible. The sheets were crisply soft & blindingly white, as were the cushy Frette robes hanging in the bathroom, and the bed was like sleeping in a cloud. The room wasn't large, but the arm chairs were comfortable, and the room felt warm & inviting The bathroom had antique-style brass fixtures that were polished to a shine, a full bathtub & glass-doored shower. The staff was helpful with my few special requests (I only drink coffee w cream - not half & half - so they got some for me from the restaurant next door, and I needed a late check-out), It's a great location as well, being just minutes from Times Square, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, etc...and their complimentary walking tour is a great way to learn more about the theater district.

This elegant jewel of a hotel was delightful . The location couldn't have been better. The hotel was sparkling clean and quiet and the staff all are a credit to the Iroquois . We had a "premium king" room that was very large by NY standards--400 sq ft, so we were not claustrophobic. The hotel provides free coffee or tea in the morning, citrus water in the afternoon and evening, and newspapers in their cozy lounge. There is a great diner, the Red Flame, half a block away, perfect for breakfast and the dbBistro is nearly next door for a lovely lunch or dinner. It was a perfect stay and we will most definitely be back. Couldn't recommend it more highly!

We wanted to stay in mid-town and after reading some very good reviews on Tripadvisor we took the plunge. We were very pleased with the outcome. The staff were very helpful and very professional if lacking in a little sincerity. Nice touches were coffee in the morning as leaving the hotel and drinks on arrival after a hard days walking around the city. If you want luxury in mid-town you won't gar far wrong with the Iroquois.

Very nice, clean and quiet hotel. Very helpful staff as well. Location is perfect. The only but, and it is a big one, is that they provide playgrounds for the kids to sleep instead of really baby cribs. I think the kids deserve a mattress as well. Besides that, if you are not travelling with a baby, this hotel is the right choice.

Beautiful boutique hotel in the theatre district within walking distance to Radio City and Times Square. The non-suite rooms are small but cozy, and the bathrooms are beautiful and well-equipped. We stayed three nights in a queen room, and two nights in a suite. The suite was incredible - a king bed, separate living room with 2 couches, a work desk, TV, and mini bar, and a bathroom with a standing shower AND jacuzzi tub. The staff was incredible - helpful with our luggage, valet services, food recommendations, and any other requests we had. I would definitely stay here again.

If you want a classy hotel, in midtown, The Iroquois Hotel in New York is the perfect place to stay. Efficient service, easy to get to restaurants nearby and theater. We have stayed in the past and this is our 4th stay, and our to to place in NYC. Highly recommend.

I was travelling with my 15 year old daughter and wanted somewhere that was well located and where we would be comfortable. Upon arrival we were greeted at the door and very quickly checked in.
