The room amenities were quickly explained and we were left to settle in. We had a room on the 3rd floor at the back of the hotel so no view but absolutely no road noise. We had not come to look at New York from a bedroom window so this was perfect for us and ensured a sound nights sleep in the very comfortable beds.All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has a library area where tea and coffee can be found in the morning and refreshing iced water in the afternoon. Strawberries were also placed at reception which was a nice touch. The library has two computers with a free printer so checking in and getting boarding passes for our flight home was quick and easy and saved time at the airport. The only niggle we had was that the bedroom itself could have benefited from improved lighting as it was a little dark, although the bathroom lighting was excellent. I also struggled on the first night as I could not get the room cool enough but did get this resolved for subsequent nights.The hotel is ideally located for 5th Avenue, Times Square, Empire State, Rockerfeller, Grand Central and Central Park. We walked to all of these. Subway is close by and the sightseeing buses stop at Times Square; a short walk away. There are plenty of places to eat on the blocks between the hotel and Times Square.All in all I would not hesitate to stay again at The Iroquois as it was part of what made a fantastic first time visit to New York for us.

Wonderful boutique hotel. Well located in the theatre district.Great staff would recommend it to others. We were treated Well by friendly and helpful staff. It was walking distance to Times Square and lots of good restaurants.

A charming boutique hotel in the middle of the midtown madness. We usually stay in Midtown for its theatre, dining and proximity to transportation options. First time we stayed at the Iroquois and we will likely return to it on our next visit.

Stayed two nights at hotel. Staff were very professional and friendly, and appreciated their personable efforts each day. Maid came around for nightly turndown service around 3-4 pm, which I thought was a bit early. Bathroom was very small, toilet block door from swinging fully open.Though beds were comfortable, I apparently was not sleeping alone - had bed bug bites or spyder bites on lower legs that showed up after my departure.Overall, I would not stay again.

The hotel shows its age. But it is made up for in its service. They take great care of their guests and go the extra mile with flexible check in/out times, upgrades and gifts. The rooms are a little worn out but are clean and classic. The location is ideal for Midtown.

We had a great trip the staff where spot on always at every turn with an eagerness to assist and help in any way. My first of many trips to your hotels. This was for my wife's birthday weekend Many thanks. Juan
user_name:
Y4318PPjuanr
New York City, New York

review_body: The Iroquois is in the perfect location for walking to theater and many other NYC attractions. The best part about this hotel is the feeling as you enter the lobby - calm and comfort. It was a perfect place to relax and recharge between city adventures. I have stayed here twice and don't think I will be able to stay anyplace else while visiting NYC. Thank you!

Couldn't ask for a better, more well appointed hotel and room. We will stay in this hotel the next time we visit and hopefully, the same staff will be available to assist as they were amazing. Loved the bar, too.

Service was brilliant throughout our stay and the room (1010) was amazing (view of rock and Chrysler) and very spacious. Would definitely stay again. The location is also great especially for mid town and they also offer free walking tours in numerous neighbourhoods.

This is a beautiful hotel perfectly situated in mid-town. We were able to capitalize on a black Friday sale which enabled us to book a suite for half-price. We were delighted with our hotel stay and plan to return to the Iroquois when next we visit NYC.

From the moment you walk in, you know you will be pampered. A short time later, you will discover how easily you can get around the city from here. The attractive lobby includes a library niche with comfortable seating and a view out the front window. It offers several current newspapers and an interesting and varied, albeit small, selection of books. Ice water with herbs and fruit positioned there makes a traveler feel welcome as do the staff at the reception desk. Elevators are a bit slow, but you will forget that as soon as you see the small (I was traveling alone.) room's tasteful decor, luxurious duvet, and comfortable chair and the bath's robe, plentiful towels, hair dryer, magnifying mirror and unobtrusive scent of the soaps, shampoo, and lotions that clearly say "Relax". There is a well-stocked mini-bar, complete with chocolate, a closet with plenty of hangers, iron and ironing board. There is a large, flat screen cable tv. WiFi is included with the very reasonable price of the room. There are a bar and a gourmet restaurant in the hotel and a wide variety of places to eat and drink in this neighborhood in walking distance to theaters, Grand Central and Penn Stations, a lot of shopping and Central Park,At night, you will find 2 chocolates on your pillow and in the morning there will be a copy of the New York Times on your door knob. Coffee and tea await in the library. There is also a gym.

Just fantastic! This was our first trip to NYC. Centrally located to Times Square, Broadway Theaters, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Square, Central Park, Grand Central Station. Located between the two main subway lines with great access to 9/11 Memorial, Brooklyn, and Canal Street. Intimate lobby with cozy bar and hidden restaurant in the rear. AMAZING Concierge VANESSA is so knowledgeable and can provide you with accurate information on NYC and the surrounding area. Helpful and professional staff with discreet housekeeping service. Comfortable beds and pillows, great amenities. Another fabulous SMALL LUXURY HOTEL hidden in the streets of NYC. Thank you for making our Anniversary SO SPECIAL.

We stayed here for 6 nights with a group of friends. Before arrival we had contacted Vanessa at concierge and she was very helpful in organizing our transfer from the airport. As a member of SLH we were lucky enough to be given a free upgrade, the room was very clean and fairly spacious for a city hotel. We were on the 8th floor at the front and although the traffic noise was noticeable it did not affect our sleep. This hotel is ideally located within 5-10 minutes walk of Times Square, grand central station and the Rockefeller Center. Complimentary tea & coffee were available in the lobby in the morning, as well as other drinks throughout the day. All in all we had a wonderful stay here, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone and would definitely stay again when we come to New York!

We had a very enjoyable stay and would thoroughly recommend staying here. The doormen couldn't do enough. Giving directions or recommendations. The reception staff were most helpful and the location couldn't have been better.
user_name:
Samantha W
King's Lynn, United Kingdom

review_body: Just come back from a 5 night stay in this lovely hotel. It's position is fantastic minutes walk from Times Square, Grand Central Station and 5th Avenue shopping. Lots of restaurants close by and fabulous Gregory's across the road for fresh muffins and lovely coffee. We had a room on the 2nd floor no view but we weren't bothered by the time we got back to the room we just wanted to sleep. And did we sleep! The most comfiest hotel bed I've ever slept in and I'm very fussy. Fluffy towels, robes and Molton Brown toiletries that were refreshed every day. Reception staff were very helpful and on the day of departure could leave our suitcases securely and the offer of a freshen up before leaving for the airport so we could enjoy our last day to the max. I would highly recommend this hotel so central yet very little noise from the city that never sleeps. Will miss you New York and the Iroquois ❤️

What a fabulous find this hotel was. Beautifully clean, lovely atmosphere throughout, GREAT cocktails, comfortable beds, powerful showers, we couldn't have asked for more. Literally a 5 minute walk from Times Square, but far enough away to be reasonably quiet throughout the night.
user_name:
Lisa M
St Cleer, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights just before Christmas 2015! The location of the hotel was excellent! It was just off time square and meant you could easily walk back to the hotel when needed! Staff were all very pleasant and helpful! Room was beautiful, with plenty of space especially on a city and a double bed! Complimentary turn down service each evening with chocolates left, this was a nice touch! Would defo recommend this hotel!

Stayed here for 5 nights with my Mum and loved it. The location is perfect. 5mins from Times Square and by 6th Avenue so you can walk to the Empire State Building, Library, Rockefeller Centre and all the way up to Central Park (I recommend walking, there's some great places to grab food on the way). A couple of doors down is the Red Flame Diner. Brilliant tasty food at a reasonable price, ideal spot for breakfast.The hotel itself is lovely and I cannot fault the staff at all. The doorman always greeted us with a smile and the reception staff and concierge went out of their way whenever we needed help or advice. We had a twin room which had 2 double beds and an en suite bathroom. It was a lot bigger than we were expecting and had a dual sided storage cupboard/wardrobe which was great for stashing our clothes, suitcases and shopping. Beds were incredibly comfortable and black out curtains were very welcome. Room was always completely spotless too, I never found a single speck of dust.The bathroom wasn't huge or super modern but I loved it. There were brass taps and marble-like sink. It was the perfect size and there was always a great supply of fluffy towels and robes. I also didn't notice any issue with the shower pressure which I was expecting.The only downside to our room was the lack of a main overhead light. When we had all the lamps on and it was daylight outside the room was bright enough (lighting in the bathroom was much better) however it did mean the room could be quite dim. As we were only ever there at night and first thing in the morning this didn't bother us but it's something to bare in mind.Lantern's Keep is the cocktail bar in this hotel and it is incredible! Drinks average about $16 each but they're worth it for some prohibition era cocktails. This is not the place to come if you want a cosmopolitan or Long Island iced tea. It is however great if you want to try something new. It's small and intimate with a great atmosphere and very knowledgeable bar staff. We didn't try the restaurant so I can't comment on it other than to say the breakfast smelt amazing.The hotel provide free coffee in the lobby and whilst we were there we also had free spiced apple cider which was lovely. There is a small library area with access to computers and there internet as well as a live flight information screen which allows you to check your flight details and check in without using the regular computers.We asked the hotel to arrange a car to take us to the airport when we were leaving and a huge suburban turned up! We were able to charge this to the room account and it saved dealing with taxis. I would say though we had to be at JFK for 7.30pm and booked the car for 5.30pm (an hour earlier than the hotel suggested) and we got there at 7.45pm due to the traffic. Take this into account when booking but this is otherwise a great service.I would suggest this hotel for anyone who doesn't want to stay in a carbon copy modern chain hotel but still wants to be in the heart of Midtown.

Our 14 day stay in New York in May this year was certainly enhanced by our decision to stay at the Iriquois Hotel. However, we did have an initial issue with our room and politely asked the next morning if anything could be done. The response was somewhat predictable 'we will look into it'. So of we went to catch up on the day's NY sights . When we got back my expectations were not high and expected a response along the lines, 'sorry, there is nothing we can do'. But to our very pleasant surprise they put us in another room and shifted all our belongings while we were out. Full marks to the staff for handling the issue so well. They listened and responded. I have read other comments that the rooms are small. Well, we found our room (deluxe queen) very comfortable and roomy enough to cater for our needs.The location is superb - so central you can walk anywhere. We walked to the MET, MOMA, all the iconic buildings, Central Park and even to the 9/11 memorial.Couple of tips for those who like good restaurants and decent coffee. 44th Street has four superb restaurants the Strip House (pricey but the best steak ever eaten), the Triomphe (part of the Iriquois - has fine dining), Killani provides great greek and mediterranean cuisine, The Modern has great French food. By the way there is also a typical NY diner at the corner if you want some good basic food. Right across the Hotel is Gregory's - they serve great coffee and fresh muffins etc.We will finish off by singling out the staff at reception, concierge, doormen and cleaners - they always acknowledged you and had a smile.Based on our experience, highly recommend the Iriquois.

We had a nice one night stay at the Iroquois. Everyone was extremely nice, helpful and professional. THe one problem was the room would not cool down to below about 76 degrees. It was a hot night in New York! I would recommend it to a friend!

I've stayed in hotels all over NYC and the world. This was without question the smallest hotel room ever. Regardless that I received a "bargain" paying under $250 a night in NYC, I definitely was paying more than $1 a square foot. Service was average. Nothing special.

This is a wonderful boutique hotel, with a perfect mid-town location which is convenient for theaters, upper-east side, etc. The service is IMPECCABLE at all levels, from checking-in, to concierge, to bell boys. Breakfast is also nice. Rooms are not too spacious, but they are cleaned and nicely decorated. Highly recommended!

Staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Rooms are on the small side, but good as a base for touring or broadway entertainment and typical for comparable hotels in the neighborhood. Very functional layout with large desk and convenient closets. Excellent shower.

excellent service and very comfortable rooms. The TV was a bit of a challenge but once it was operating correctly it was fine. Lobby is a bit tight and was not comfortable when crowded. I would suggest a buffet style breakfast as time is a factor and this would speed up the time allotted to enjoy breakfast before a busy day.

Our hotel of choice is always the Iroquois. When you combine location with excellent care and service, this hotel can't be beat. After many visits we remain convinced that the Iroquois is the best value New York has to offer.

This hotel is conveniently located in midtown. Parking is literally right across the street. Rooms are not very large, but very clean and comfortable. We didn't hear any street noise all night. Bed is comfy too and very nice Molton & Brown products in the bathroom. The shower had plenty of pressure and the bath towels are large and high quality. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

Classic hotel in unbeatable location for Times Square and Theatres. Right beside the Algonquin, it has the same classic vibe. Lovely , well appointed rooms, helpful staff, library, NIce old carpets and comfortable furniture in reception, fabulous beds. Nice bar, restaurant a bit stuffy and expensive. Front of house staff outstanding. Great housekeeping, all toiletries replenished daily. A slice of old New York and an unforgettable experience.

We stayed at the Iroquois Hotel for a week with friends and had the most enjoyable stay. Book deluxe rooms instead of superior. There's a great difference between those two categories. Deluxe rooms have more space and light, and also a view. Rooms were clean and comfortable, good mattresses, linens, towels, toiletries etc. New York Times were brought to your room daily as well as chocolates and weather forecast in the evening. Enjoyable. The hotel building itself is quite old, but rooms up to date.Iroquois is one of the best hotels I've ever visited and the best in New York. It is situated in the 44th street between 5th and 6th Avenues and is close to everything. Still quiet, that part of 44th street is not noisy. In the first morning we had breakfast in the hotel restaurant, but it's not that good (price/quality) - there are many cafes nearby that have abbetter quality breakfast with less money.The hotel also has a gym and Finnish sauna - gym was clean and I met there no other visitors. Did you know that James Dean stayed at this hotel 1950-53, they have a James Dean Suite.At the hotel's library you can have coffee and tea in the mornings and fruity water in the afternoons and evenings for free. There are also two computers at your disposal in the library. Also an easy access to free wi-fi at the hotel - worked fast 24/7. The most important value at this hotel is a friendly, helpful and efficient staff. Doormen, concierge and front desk staff - couldn't ask for more friendly attitude. Always at your disposal with a smile asking if we needed any help or assistance with bookings etc. Fantastic persons like Cristoph, Vanessa and Bill. Love them. We really enjoyed our stay.I can highly recommend this hotel and will definitely return...

I have visited NYC a couple of times before staying at the Iroquois. I was going with a friend that hadn't been before and wanted to stay somewhere central. The price was very comparable for Manhattan and the rooms were lovely, small, but that is to be expected. We had issues with feather pillows and they were immediately exchanged. We loved the cucumber water in the lobby each day! The staff was also so welcoming and friendly and helpful!

We love staying at the Iroquois Hotel which is located in a great area. Minutes from Time Square, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, etc. Our family can't wait to return to New York to visit the sights we missed

I've stayed at this hotel twice over the last several years, and I highly recommend it. Although the rooms are small, the hotel is very nice, and the staff couldn't be friendlier. I love the fresh strawberries they set out in the lobby each evening - nice touch. The hotel is close to Times Square yet amazingly quiet. You will not go wrong staying here.

It's a very clean hotel with a wonderful staff. They are all extremely helpful.. I called and mentioned to them that we would be there early and they had our room ready. The room was clean but extremely small. The only complaint I have is that they said the AC was on but we never felt it! The room was an oven... Way to hot!! Otherwise the location and staff made up for that! I would stay there again.

We have just got back from staying here. After being given a free upgrade on arrival to the minute we left, we couldn't fault the hotel, from the service to the rooms it was great. A perfect place to explore the city and recover after a long day. The Iroquois has all the qualities required for a city hotel, being part of SLH you expect a certain level and it doesn't disappoint, when we return to NY this will be the hotel we stay at again.

A luxury 4-star hotel in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, on a great location close to Bryant Park, 5th Avenue, and easy to walk to MoMA, Rockefeller Center - Top of the Rock for a unique view over Manhattan, Jersey, Brooklyn and Queens, and even easy to walk to the Empire State Building. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I had a very comfortable and quiet room, just a few blocks from the overcrowded Times Square.

Booked into this hotel for special trip celebrating my wife's birthday and retirement. I had emailed this information ahead and it was good they recognised this by giving us a bottle of wine and chocolates. Our first room was ok, small by usual standards but we were so tired from our trip from UK that we accepted it. This room 410 was on a high floor (4) as we had requested however the noise at night from the air conditioning or something else was just too much. So we asked to be moved and told the front desk, the man said he would pass this onto the day manager as we were up really early on our first day. We had breakfast at Red Flame came back and saw the day manager and confirmed all of this. We went out and returned about 4:00 pm to check our new room only to be told that all rooms had now been allocated and we would have to remain in 410. After a lot of complaining - no one told us we needed to be back at a certain time to secure a change of room, they eventually and somewhat begrudgingly moved us to a better upgraded room. This was better thank you. The front desk attitude did let this hotel down, fine when you check in but somewhat frosty if there's a problem.As far as sights to see this is a great location, ask the concierge for advice -Alex was great, she even helped out with medical advice. We used Red Flame for breakfast and some evening meals, it's only half a block on the same streets towards 6th Avenue. Do visit the Bar 54 at the Hyatt but for something less pretentious go to the Spyglass bar.Coffee is on tap in the morning in the hotel and there is access to computer for other uses eg printing boarding cards for the next part of our trip.

This is our 6th year of staying at the Iroquois and I can't wait for year 7. We love everything about the Iroquois, the rooms, the restaurant, the bar and most of all the people. Vanessa has been so helpful to us and her suggestions for restaurants and plays have made our NY stay delightful.

Love this hotel. The staff is excellent the rooms are comfy. The restaurant is wonderful. The service goes above and beyond. The location is perfect for restaurants parks and of course Broadway shows. We've stayed here before and we will definitely be staying here again and again

We had a wonderful stay at the Iroquois hotel. The rooms were comfortable, roomy, conveniently located, Quiet, and lovely. The staff was so helpful and friendly. Awesome!!! The concierge staff was great.

Our stay in this hotel was very pleasant. Location is perfect. Easy to walk everywhere. Small, friendly hotel. Shoping and restaurants nearby. We surely will be back next time visiting New York. We can highly recomment the hotel.

This was our first time staying in the city. We usually stayed in NJ and trained in to the city but we will always stay in the city now. This location was perfect to the subway, great restaurants and entertainment. The temperature in our room was warm but I am sure that is because it is an older building. The staff went out of their way to make our stay spectacular.

This hotel was by far the best hotel I've been a guest at in NYC. I was there for three nights with a group of friends. We LOVED this hotel and its staff. The rooms were clean, the service was impeccable and the staff were over the top accommodating and friendly. Hands down, the BEST hotel in NYC. I will not ever stay at a large hotel chain in NYC again. I highly recommend it.

Very pleased with this hotel. Location is a short walk from Times Square...which is perfect since it was quite. Rooms as well as bathrooms were good size, clean and upscale. Good view of the Chrysler building from the window. On site restaurant was also convenient...had breakfast there..a bit pricey but fresh. Service staff from doormen to front desk were top notch and welcoming....felt like I was among family. Highly recommend.

If you are going to NY for the theatre, dining and shopping, The Iroquois is your place to stay. It is a boutique hotel located within walking distance of everything. The staff is courteous and professional.

It was the first hotel of the SLH signature that didn't fill my expectations regarding to quality of the service, cleanliness and commitment of the staff to make our stay comfortable. The heating didn't work, the room smell was humid and they never offered a solution to that point. I won't recommend this hotel as a 4 star hotel deserving the qualification as aSLH, may be years ago things were different...who knows!

I got notification that this hotel cancelled a CONFIRMED 6-night reservation the morning of check-in day, which left me scrambling to find replacement accommodations for a week-long business trip. The reservation clerk I spoke with to inquire about the last-minute cancellation spoke in a monotone, was unapologetic, and nonchalantly blamed a system glitch for the overbooking. And no, she was not interested to see the printout of the itinerary that clearly states the reservation has been confirmed by the hotel and that there is no need to call the hotel to reconfirm.This hotel could not be trusted and will leave you in the cold. Stay away.
user_name:
geoarc99
New York City, New York

review_body: When I made my reservation, I mentioned that I'd be taking a red-eye and would appreciate an early check-in. While the staff couldn't guarantee that, there was an offer of the use of the gym's shower to freshen up. That said a lot to me in advance, and - especially given that they were able to get me the early check-in - this place is an absolute winner from top to bottom.The room, though smallish, was extremely comfortable (though I was surprised by the lack of a hair dryer; not that I needed it ... ) and, most importantly, quiet. Location is superb, not far from anything I needed or wanted to get to, but far enough away to not seem in the middle of hordes of tourists.Everyone I dealt with, from the desk staff to the bellmen to the housekeepers, couldn't have been friendlier or more efficient or just plain nicer.I really, really, really enjoyed my stay.

An English friend and I had a fast trip to New York City to see a couple of plays and museums in May and we chose to stay one evening at The Iroquois Hotel on 44nd St. between 5th and 6th avenue. We had a lovely stay. A very charming small lobby with a small library (infused water, coffee available), very nice people at reception as well. Our room was very comfortable, two beds with extremely comfortable comforters...like sleeping in a cloud! When we returned from our evening play we had lovely special cocktails in the small cocktail lounge. The location is fabulous and also not right in the middle of Times Square so fairly quiet. Basically it was JUST RIGHT! for us and I hope to get to stay there again soon. We didn't eat in the restaurant though it seemed quite nice as well. I prefer a comparatively small hotel to a giant more corporate place. I would certainly recommend a stay there.

We returned to the Iroquois for a two-night stay in mid-May. I liked the hotel as much this time as on our first visit. In contrast with the newer hotels trying so hard to be ultra-hip, I prefer the more traditional feel of the Iroquois. I also like the combination of being in a boutique size hotel amidst the hustle and bustle of Manhattan and enjoying the amenities of a top notch hotel. The guest room was compact - normal for Manhattan -- but sufficient and all the room amenities were top drawer. The fitness center is smallish but adequate for both a full aerobic and weight workout. The hotel is well located midtown. My only negative comment is that there was a noticeable hum from outdoors -- could have been mechanical equipment -- that interfered with the tranquility of the room. The staff was friendly and helpful, even called a week in advance to see if there was anything we needed in anticipation of our arrival. Overall, I would definitely return on a future trip to NYC.

This was a work weekend with my spouse but the staff here is so exquisite that we looked so forward to returning to this little chic boutique hotel as the treat of our day.Amanda, Anna and Vanessa were so warm, responsive and helpful. They literally went out of their way daily to make our little New York stay feel like we had our own pied á terre.

Lovely hotel , great location near time square and Bryant park, stayed as a family had a lovely suite on fourth floor, staff great and very helpful, didn't dine in hotel, but had coffee in the front cocktail bar which was nice,

This is a nice hotel and very well situated. But overall I found the hotel a bit odd but can't really put my finger on why. I was disappointed when I first got there as I had requested a early check in as we had come off a over-night flight but no room was available. Got back to the hotel about 1430 completely shattered and our room still was not ready. The room was very comfortable but the chest of drawers had a mind of there own and the drawers kept coming open. I don't think that we would choose this hotel again.

This hotel is our NY family holiday retreat. Our daughter lives in Brooklyn so we visit NY frequently from Australia (3 - 4 times a year) The Iroquois is just what we need after the 24+ hours flying. The staff always greet us with "welcome back" and the rooms are always ready for us. The front cocktail bar is exceptionally warm and friendly and the food exceptional. Ask for a tour of the rooftop herb garden.. Vanessa and Bill (concierge) are fantastic and can get tickets for anything, even Hamilton.

Initial we were in a room next to the 24hr gym/spa, which was being used very early in the morning and very late at night. Door was banging and you could hear the weights clanging. We asked the front desk what could be done and our room was changed.Great location . The staff were very friendly, informative and willing to help in any way.

My husband and I stayed here for a week and loved the Midtown location. Service at the hotel was excellent and the staff are all friendly and helpful. We made several special requests for housekeeping service at certain times, called for ice daily, and needed to borrow umbrellas and make a car service reservation. All were handled perfectly. Convenient, free internet access from terminals in the library. This is one of the best hotels for service that we've ever found. We would definitely stay here again.

I love the old fashioned charm & comfortable ambiente of the Iroquois. The fantastic locationn & great nearby restaurant scene make up for any other minor discomforts. I would have liked a hand shower in the bath. The windows need fixing and overall this hotel needs renovations. The staff is just wonderful;, attentive, polite & will go the extra mile for guests. This hotel is a home away fr. home.

We found the Iroquois a great place to stay. High service standard, friendly professional staff. Great location to Times Square. Easily accessible and situated in a well lit area. We felt safe walking to and from Times Square and the Broadway shows at night. The Doormen we always polite and professional

Rooms are small, as are the bathrooms. All staff are very friendly, courteous, and helpful with the exception of the Lantern's Keep! They were NOT interested in serving 4 women! My evaluation of "service" would have been "excellent" had it not been for them.

This is the first time that we stayed at this Triumphe Group hotel. We usually stay at another but wanted to try a new area. Recently stayed here to celebrate a birthday and found it to be a good choice. We selected a nearby restaurant for our celebration but found the consigliere very helpful. The staff were very friendly and the hotel is in a good location on a street with many very nice hotels and restaurants. Our room was above the standard however it was not large but very up to date and with usual amenities.We stayed two nights and when we returned found another special they were having and booked again for the Fall.One should try to stop into their special bar/lounge for a nightcap one night and order one of their unique cocktails.!

Always a pleasure to stay at the Iroquois. The hotel staff are all very friendly. Nice atmosphere. Quiet hotel within walking distance to Time Square, Bryant Park, the Public Library....short distance to Central Park.

I've lost track of the number of hotels I've stayed in while traveling to NYC, but the Iroquois is the one hotel I return to whenever possible - the only thing that prevents me from staying here every time is the price as sometimes it's beyond my price point. I love the amenities, the bed is very comfortable and the staff is always pleasant. The location is good for Times Square, Grand Central, the subway, etc. The rooms are a bit small, but not any more so than other hotels in the city. I feel comfortable being here and look forward to my next trip!
user_name:
MCP17
Cortland, New York, United States

review_body: We booked the Iroquois through a 3rd party site (which turned out to be bogus)... BUT Amanda from the front desk was SO amazing and accommodating. She went out of her way to help us out of a really bad situation. We were on the phones for this 3rd party for over 2 hours trying to find a new place to stay (because the Iroquois was unfortunately already fully booked). Amanda helped us talk to the customer service reps to make sure we got compensated and relocated. She was cordial, professional, assertive, and caring. We were stunned when she said she had just started working at the Iroquois because it seemed like she had been there forever. Definitely deserves employee of the month! Next time we are in NYC we will definitely be staying at the Iroquois. 10/10 would recommend!!

Hotel restaurant (Triomphe) was terrific: the service was wonderful, especially considering that I sat for dinner as a single older woman. The food preparation and presentation were wonderful: both dinner and breakfast were perfect.

I asked for a room upgrade and got a suite for a reasonable additional fee. It was nice, well ventilated and relaxing. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The area has lots of restaurants and dining choices, and it's easy to get to the major museums by walking or taxi.
user_name:
paulmA2144QD
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: classy, comfortable, friendly in a fantastic location. will use again when I go to NYC again. only thing was no kettle in the room so had to use room service. I did not want to disturb them during the night though.

Just a short walk to Times Square, shopping and dining. Excellent location, sub ways are close by very walkable.hotel was clean, staff very friendly and helpful. And at the end of our trip we used their driver service to get us to the airport that was very to book and he got us there quicker than taking the sub way.

Nice French hotel Close to time square Easy walk to subway systemThanks for a nice stayPlenty of restaurants and dinners around to choose from. Nice staff at front desk as well.View wasn't nice got a room with a back hotel view with nothing to see

The hotel is certainly in a nice location, and it's mostly an elegant small hotel. But it has its problems. My room was modest, and it would have been small for two people. The bathroom was decent sized, but there really wasn't enough room for my things, and there definitely would not have been room for two people The sink's overflow was clogged, and the water in the shower/bath ran very slow. There wasn't enough light in the room, and there certainly weren't enough plugs. Why the desk lamps didn't provide plugs is beyond me. That would have solved the problem. The desk was small but functional. Wifi was fine, and the A/C was the same. There's no accessible ice machine in the hotel. There was, however, a turn down service, complete with chocolates. And there was a lovely view of a ....fire escape. I didn't expect a view, of course. Also, there are two elevators, not quite together, which made it a bit awkward. Old building so you have to expect some compromises. All in all, the hotel was okay, but it could easily do better.

Staff was polished and helpful and frequently checked in on how everything was going, though the employee who called to check on my room initially was very curt and hung up before I finished replying. Services, amenities, and the look and feel of the spacious room were very nice and mostly fit what I was expecting for an upscale experience. Bed was very comfortable -- fell asleep almost immediately. Desk and power outlet are in a cramped corner position, but nothing huge to complain about.By far the best hotel gym (with sauna as well) that I've ever used. Library had interesting reads on New York and was good to have while greeting friends and waiting for transportation to the airport. All in all, worth a visit.

This classic, well-maintained hotel has a fascinating history and is well-located, near several good restaurants and a diner that's handy for breakfast. The staff - especially the front desk and the concierge - were extremely helpful, recommending places to eat and getting us checked in and out efficiently. The chocolates at turn-down service were a nice touch, as was the free coffee and tea in the library. Our room was comfortable and quiet and I liked that there was an iPod dock, although I would've preferred to have had a coffeemaker rather than the array of mini-bar beverages on top of the fridge. Overall, the location can't be beat, it was a great value, and we look forward to coming back.

This is our go-to hotel for a quick trip to NYC. Staff is polite, efficient and helpful. Rooms are not huge, but well appointed and comfortable. In house restaurant Triomphe serves a great dinner and breakfast. Close walk to theaters and shopping.

My wife and I were fortunate enough to spend 10 nights in this hotel for a combined business and leisure trip. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially concierges Bill and Vanessa. Vanessa took the time to teach us the subway system, and Bill was full of great advice on activities, unique locations to visit, and even coordinated us with his restaurant connections. I know those are normal concierge expectations, but their sincere interest in our first time NYC visit was exceptionally genuine and personal.Prior to the trip, I invested at least 8 hours in reading hotel reviews and researching our options. With “normal” priorities: safety, cleanliness, friendly staff, location, sleeping conditions, price, atmosphere/vibe, (basically in that order), we determined that although most hotels in NYC are expensive (compared to our Midwest U.S. upbringing), it was worth paying a bit more to stay at the Iroquois. We were absolutely correct! We have nothing but good things to say about everything we hoped for and received from the Iroquois. Perhaps it was due to our extended stay, but we even enjoyed our conversations with the bellhops: JJ, Carlos, and Marick. We were fortunate/unfortunate in being snowed out of returning to our home state, and the front desk staff were extremely accommodating in coordinating an additional night for us at the most discounted nightly rate from our prior reservation.The location was convenient for walking to Times Square (2 blocks), a diner and also “Blue Bar” on the block, and the great Brooklyn Diner about 5 blocks away. Easy walking access to subway entrances, reasonable walking to the Empire State building, Bryant Park, and Rockefeller Center, a bit further to Central Park, etc. The attached French restaurant Triomphe and the Lantern’s Keep lounge were nice romantic treats. We felt central to everything that we wanted to do, which included using the subway to travel all around Manhattan (WTC, Intrepid, The Met, Cooper Hewitt museum, Javits Center, “The Friends building”, Chelsea galleries, Madison and 5th Ave shopping, The Roundabout Theater, Grand Central Station, St. John the Divine Cathedral, The View rotating restaurant, The Rum House for live music, etc). Bottom line, we easily walked about 1 mile anywhere around the hotel, and used public transportation to get to all of the tourist and business locations. There were only brief moments walking late at night when we rushed from one area of Times Sq to another, or decided to take a taxi, but overall, we felt very safe in this area.Other reviews say that the rooms were small, but we were actually happy with the size. Perhaps our expectations were low in reading people’s description of other NYC rooms. My only constructive criticism was the need for additional wall outlets or power strips. The front desk said that they would soon be replacing the desk lights with those with outlets.The free morning coffee was some of the best I have had, and if not, there is a coffee shop just across the street. Although there was no real view from the hotel windows, that feature was not a concern or high on our priority list anyway.Safe, Beautiful, Convenient, Friendly, Comfortable bed, Quiet room… We couldn’t have asked for more :) Thank you for making our NYC trip a dream come true!

If you want to be close to Times Square, but away from the traffic, this is a great place to stay. The rooms are small and there are not any views to speak of from the hotel. There was very little street noise. There are several excellent restaurants within walking distance and a little diner down the street towards 6th Avenue that is fine for breakfast or a quick lunch or even dinner. The free coffee and tea and afternoon apple cider is a nice touch. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is somewhat old but fairly well maintained. The room prices are very competitive, particularly given the location. I would stay there again.

Barely showing its age, the Iroquois is a great buy on the most expensive street in Midtown. Convenient to theaters and shopping' and if you have any questions, the staff turn somersaults in assistance

This is a charming hotel with a friendly, courteous staff and a classic aesthetic. The location is perfect, one block east of Times Square on 44th Street, so you are not inundated with waves of tourists as you step out of the lobby and, yet, you are surrounded by great restaurants and you are a short walk from the Theatre District- my wife and I had tickets to 'Eclipsed' on the day of our visit- and the other attractions in midtown. Our room was clean and comfortable with a spacious king size bed; we were actually upgraded to a suite, which was a very pleasant surprise! Complimentary chocolates were delivered to the room and we were treated really well by all of the hotel staff. Drinks and parking was a bit pricey, but not out of line with what one might expect for a Manhattan hotel and the cost of the room (through booking.com) was a bargain. We would definitely stay here again. It was a great experience!

Lovely boutique hotel in a wonderful location. This is our second stay at the Iroquois and we really enjoy the intimate ambiance, well-appointed (on the smaller side) rooms and wonderful staff. You can walk to the theater, bistros, shopping and some top-notch restaurants. A great value for all that it offers.

Three nights stay at The Iroquois on West 44th with wife and 10 y/o son. Quick and friendly check-in by helpful staff made us feel welcome. Our room on 10th floor was modest, clean, and quiet, with two comfy beds. Hotel is on relatively quiet street between Grand Central and Times Square, near Bryant Park. The location is superb -- a short walk to many great restaurants, NY Public Library, Times Square, theaters, 5th Ave shopping, Grand Central Terminal, and subway stations. The lobby library with computer/printer and hotel car service to airport were handy. We plan to stay here again next year.

This is a great, boutique hotel in the perfect location for New York City activities. Grand Central Staion,, Central Park, Broadway theaters, and 5th Avenue shopping are all within a 5 to 10 minute walk. The staff are welcoming and friendly with an intimate lobby for morning coffee and afternoon relaxation. It is a quiet oasis in the midst of the hustle and bustle

Very nice boutique hotel that is on a side quiet street in the heart of Times Square. Still within walking distance of many of NY's finest attractions and theatres. Room, staff, and dining were all great. Definitely would stay here again.

Stayed a Sunday night over to Monday for a short business trip. The Iroquois was perfect in every way. Clean room with modern amenities, super convenient location, a super value and very attentive staff. I had no idea one could get in NYC this level of quality at this location for such an affordable price.

Excellent small mid-town hotel, with very responsive staff. Good location in the theater district. Superb restaurant on site, as well as a nice late-nite pub. Ask for their recommended car service to the airport; Hector was a gem.

The Iroquois is my go-to hotel in New York. Rooms are comfortable and quiet, have wonderful toiletries, and are spotlessly clean. The hotel is convenient to the theater district, shopping, Times Square, and several subway stations. But the best part of the Iroquois is the outstanding staff. They are friendly, gracious and helpful. I look forward to returning.

A very good Hotel. Good service. Fine room and Great bed. Overall good. Easy to get around in NY from the Hotel. We did not eat at the Restaurant . Only breakfast once. Found it a little too expensive.

Close to all Midtown sights & subway lines.Clean, cosy hotel with great amenities, comfortable beds, clean rooms with daily housekeeping. The staff was very friendly and helpful.I will continue to return.

Great location, friendly and helpful staff. Very pleased with the experience and would stay here again. Did not try the dining or bar, so cannot review that. Room was nice based on typical New York room.

Older NY hotel in a great location. Staff is very good. Rooms are small but adequate. Just fine if you don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room. The bathroom could use some more counter space. No room to put your toiletry bag.

Great week in NYC with my daughter. Lots of walking. Lots to see and do. Iroquois right in the heart of it all, but on a nice, quiet (ok it's NYC) street. Close to all Midtown sights & subway lines. Room very quiet and comfortable. V
user_name:
Robyn B
Portland, Oregon, United States

review_body: We loved the location and small size and feel of the Iroquois. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was great. Good proximity to Time Square and theaters but it was far enough away from the chaos. We will definitely be back.

Hotel ideally located, close to theatreland, sights and subway. All staff encountered were very helpful and knowledgable, in advising us how to get the most from our stay. Hotel exceeded expectations felt very personal and homely, would definitely stay here again.

Close to everything! Subway access just 2 blocks away. Walkable distance to time square, central park, theater district, hells kitchen, empire state building, and 5th Avenue shopping. Courtyard view was nothing special but not bad. You could still see some of the surrounding buildings, which was nice, but we didn't spend much time looking out the windows anyway. There was still plenty of light. The blinds can be opened, lifted, or blacked out.We stayed in a premium king room and had plenty of space for two with a larger than expected bathroom. The room was cleaned everyday and smelled great. The bed was so comfy I fell asleep within a few minutes each night. Front desk, door staff, and housekeeping were all very friendly and accomodating. They provided free ny times and chocolate daily. Did not eat at the restaurant but it was always full of people so it was probably good. We did eat at the diner next door and the food was fabulous and not as pricey as some places nearby. There was a Mini bar in the room but we just moved the stuff around and stored leftovers. There is no microwave so we didn't bring back anything that would need to be reheated. If you are looking for a reasonably priced and comfortable hotel within walking distance to a lot of the main attractions, I would recommend this one 100%.

Had a wonderful stay at the Iroquois. The location was perfect. Our room was comfortable and the price was affordable for NYC. The hotel had a European feel that I love. There was coffee in the morning and the staff was very helpful.

I have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the last 12 months and I will continue to return. Clean, cosy hotel with great amenities, comfortable beds, very clean rooms with daily housekeeping. Room service available and prompt, amazingly helpful friendly staff who truly make you feel welcome....especially Liram, one of the doormen and Bill the concierge. Rooms have everything you need and very quiet. The hotel is in a great location, just off 5th avenue but close to Time Square, grand central station, Central Park, Chrysler building, Empire State Building....you get the idea. Going further afield it is so easy to get a cab or the subway. Hotel can also organise a car to the airport....and very nice car too! I felt so important! I did this trip on my own, but felt safe and looked after.

I had a lot of expectations about this hotel as they are part of the Small Luxury Hotels. But It is not near as good as the other SLH properties I have been to.I arrived at the hotel around 2 pm. My room was not ready and I've been told it should be ready by 3 pm. Came back 3:15 and it was not still ready. Had to wait until 3:30 to get into my room. They told me my room had been upgraded, but did not tell me to which type of room and honestly I did not noticed any difference from the one I had booked.The doorman named JJ was not gentle at all. Actually he was very rude and never saw him smiling during my entire stayAs a SLH Loved member, I requested late check out. They only allowed me to stay until 2 pm. Amanda, at front desk, was the only person who at least gave me the option to have a shower at the gym. Good job on that, but all the other could only tell me they were sorry. Okay, I had a late check in but not quite a late check out!I enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfast at Triomphe. Well, on the main menu, the continental breakfast included granola, basket of pastry, coffee and juice. They gave me a separate menu for the complimentary breakfast, which had the options of granola OR basket of pastry, among other options. Absolutely disappointing.

A very special place to stay in NY. A harmonious setting on the second floor in a quaint room flooded with just the right amount of light through the push up windows, so typical of New York apartments that you see in movies. Absolutely dazzled by the immaculate, polished bathroom, with the robes, 1920s (?) styled golden taps - and is it true a gentleman by the name of Mr James Dean used to live here? New York Times delivered to your doorstep each morning. Extra comfy beds, with the most relaxing plump white doonas and pillows!Thank you for such a comforting, first time stay in New York City!Lovely staff - I hope we can return soon.

Our first trip to NYC...Positives: Comfortable, large beds. Clean bathrooms. Quiet (at the expense of light if you choose a room in the courtyard). Room for improvement: the lobby is not really 4-star, not welcoming. The staff was fine, but could have helped me find a more economical car service to get to the airport. Bathrooms need a refresh.This hotel can only be measured against NYC neighbors in terms of price and quality, and I suppose it is better-than-average.Most guests seemed to be tourists from Europe. One of the hotel staff was from Germany.

Comfortable beds and perfect location for our wacation. The Staff was very friendly and helpful.A smal and cosy hotel that we can recomend. The rooms and bathroom were clean and hade good ventilation,

So happy to find this hotel. It's located only a couple of blocks away from beautiful Bryant Park and also Times Square, but on a quieter neighborhood. The closest subway is in Bryant Park, so it was very easy for us to go anywhere from Central Park to Memorial park.Everyone is very nice and helpful. It spooked my husband a little bit one the first day, he was wondering why everyone was genuinely attentive, something that we usually didn't get on other NYC hotels.The hotel offers fresh strawberries on the front desk, complimentary coffee in the morning and hot cider/iced flavored water in the afternoon. There's also complimentary walking tour that leaves from the hotel which is on every Sunday I believe for Bryant Park/Grand Central walk, but if you are interested in different neighbourhood walks, I think you can check out their sister hotels on their website. The walk runs about 1 hour, and it was a lot of fun. I've been to Bryant Park and Grand Central many times, but it was good to see them in different perspectives.The hotel room is average size for NYC, but very clean and the bathroom is beautiful. The bed was fairly comfortable. The view was not good, or should I say no view at all? But all I did is just closed the blinder and problem solved! Especially when the room comes with a complimentary red wine, who cares about the view? :) We spent most of our time outside the hotel anyway. But if you care about a view, maybe just ask for the ones that are facing the 44th st. My fave thing to do in this hotel after a long day is to pop-in into their Finnish sauna within the gym that is open 24-hour. You just need to give the front desk a heads up 15 minutes prior so it will be ready for you. A random fact, James Dean used to live in the building for a couple of years.

We really enjoyed our one night stay this weekend. The bed was super comfortable, great shower too. The staff went above and beyond to make everything perfect. My only complaint, which is not their fault, is that due to the building's age, each floor can either have the heat or a/c on, not both. It was extremely warm in our room, which was fixed by sleeping with the window open, but some might not be comfortable doing that.

Wonderful hotel and centrally located. Very quiet and comfortable beds. Rooms not big but comfortable and clean. Nice gym and surroundings. Would absolutely stay at this hotel again. Lots od restaurants nearby and times square within a few minutes walk.

Nice small hotel near times square (but not too near so avoids the crazies). Good restaurants close (we liked the Greek restaurant almost next door). We had a room facing the street but not too bad noise wise (it is New York). It was a suite which was large and nice with a separate bedroom - worth the upcharge. The elevator is small. The stairwells are funny since you have to get out at each floor to keep descending. We had drinks at the restaurant since the small bar in the back was packed. The restaurant looked good.

This hotel was recommended to us and proved to be a fantastic find. It is located 5 min walk from Times Square the staff were extremely helpful and our room was lovely. We stayed for 3 nights before setting sail on a cruise. On our return we had a whole day in NY and Bill at the hotel kindly arranged for us to leave our luggage whilst we spent the day in the city and they arranged a vehicle to take us to JFK. We will be back thank you!

Location, location, location we were in the heart of the city on our fist trip to New York.We were walking distance to dining, entertainment, public transportation and local attractions we've only seen on TV. The hotel was well kept and extremely clean. The staff bent over backwards to serve our every need. The information they offered about their city was spot on and we were right at home on the Metro with the map provided by the Concierge. They even marked the location of our must see sites on the map and the train to use.The room was not cheap and was a bit small but, not by NYC standards. If I go to NYC again soon I will stay at the Iroquois without a doubt.When it was time for us to leave Carlos swept us out in to the waiting cab (flat rate to JFK, much better than the shuttle) and on our way. We felt very safe in NYC and have nothing but good memories from our recent trip.

As always the welcome remains warm and value for money good. Staff from all departments including the concierge Bill were very helpful. The room and bed were clean and comfortable. Only problem on this occasion was that one of the lifts needs upgrading. Otherwise it's a great place to keep coming back to

We and another couple stayed at the Iroquois for three nights this past weekend, and were very happy with our choice of hotels. We loved the location on a quiet (comparatively!) block between fifth and sixth avenues, with Times Square, shopping, and various restaurants and bars within close proximity. Staff was so friendly and accommodating and the boutique feel of the hotel made it a very comfortable and relaxing place to be. The bar was cozy and served excellent cocktails. Our room was an upgraded room and was fairly large for NY, with a comfy bed and marble bath with lots of shelves and windowsills for all your stuff! We were on the twelfth floor and the room was extremely quiet. Will definitely return on a future visit!

Friendly staff, very accommodating, good location, clean rooms and marble bathroom. Did not eat in the restaurant, or have room service so can't say how they were. The only drawback was only one elevator so sometimes had to wait.

Beautiful, Clean, great stuff, and Nice hotel in the Heart of the NYC : Great location ; close to: Times Square, Shops at 5th Avenue, Central Park, Empire State building, Several Museums, Broadway Shows,
user_name:
renato r
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: Great boutique hotel and alternative to the larger franchises where you are more of a number than a quest. Wonderful location (a short walk to Times Square/Theater District). Very quiet room and spotless bathroom with great amenities. Reasonably priced - warm and friendly staff. Will definitely be back!

Picked this property from TripAdvisor reviews and it didn't disappoint as our base on visiting New York.Had a room on the 11th floor which was perfect - bed was hugely comfortable and nice amenities.Staff were brilliant and very accommodating, especially the Concierge team and in particular Vanessa before our stay and Bill during our stay who made recommendations which were spot on.Location is great for walking and getting the tours etc.As a hotelier, would recommend this to anyone!!

Answers about said it all. Only complaint was the room was cold even when the fixed to the temperature was not that good. Think you have problem with the 11th floor. Should have left the review at the first sentence.

We very much enjoyed our stay at the Iroquis. The location can't be beat and the staff was super friendly and helpful. The room, though small, was good. Everything worked and the room was clean. I would recommend this hotel without reservation.

Friendly people. Great bar. European dining room. Nice linens and old-fashioned, but clean and well lit and very pretty rooms. A wonderful stay on 44th Street. The room was very quiet and pretty. The lobby has just the right amount of bustle with mostly European guests and the bar off the lobby is a classis. 'this place is a gem.

Thank you to Christophe and staff for making our 30th anniversary celebration so very memorable!All of our room requests were accommodated. Room was charming and quiet. Staff exemplary. Lantern bar had a wonderful 'speakeasy' feel. Only regret was we only had time for one night. Would highly recommend this venerable hotel!

The advertisements for this hotel called it a luxury boutique hotel. The accommodations were old, antiquated, and in a state of disrepair. One of two elevators was out of service upon our arrival and still out of service at check out. This created a fire hazard and safety hazard. Our traveling companions were offered a 10% discount on their bill, 2 other couples in our group were only offered a box of chocolates!

To our personal taste this wasn't the best choice for us. The room was small, which is really fine, but being an older building you could really hear between rooms. The decor is older ornate. The bed was quite comfortable. The reception and entry are charming in that older style and we could see the back restaurant looked quite inviting. I couldn't get a sense for house the place left me feeling exactly. Not a place we would go back to. However it was more than acceptable accommodations, location is fantastic.

I really like this location (I've previously stayed at the nearby Sofitel). With the Red Flame Diner a couple doors down, a parking garage right across the street, a pharmacy/convenience store at the end of the block on 5th Ave., and Times Square a short walk, it can't be beat. I find the Iroquois a better overall value vs the Sofitel. The room, Premium King, was clean, comfortable and quiet. It was small, but it was configured in a way that did not seem small. It was well laid out with a good size closet and plenty of drawers for clothing. The bathroom was very well done. Spacious, clean, plenty of room. A couple quirky items of note: Only 1 elevator was working during our stay. It really was only a slight inconvenience during normal peak periods like checkout or dinner time. It was unusually hot during the stay and the A/C seemed to struggle a bit to keep the room cool. The speaker on the TV kept cutting out. The room was cool enough and I was able to "fix" the TV on my own, so no real issues. Overall a great stay. I would recommend the hotel and I will definitely consider coming here again.

Who can resist an iconic NYC hotel in a fabulous location? So we decided to stay at the Iroquois after an evening at the theatre. It felt pretty cozy with a nice vibe when we walked in the door. The staff was super friendly and made us feel welcomed. More good vibes! We had a quiet room with a comfortable queen bed. It was updated and well-maintained. The bathroom was nicely appointed, clean, and stocked with Molton Brown bathroom products. As with most of the older NYC hotels, the room was quite small, but we expected this. We appreciated the free WiFi and turn down service with chocolates. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will visit the Iroquois again, especially in off-season. We stayed in late January and got a great rate. Oh, and I'd like to have a cocktail at the Lantern's Keep next time!

I stayed at the Iroquois Hotel from 16/4-20/4 in a standard room for 3 adults sharing.Although the room was quite small, and probably the absolute smallest size that can accommodate 3 adults, it was a lovely room. The bathroom had Molton Brown products and there was sufficient storage, although we had travelled light. The hotel provides complimentary tea/ coffee downstairs and all the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Surprisingly, there is no ice vending although guests are allowed to use the mini bar as a fridge. There is a nightly 'turn-down' service where you return in the evening to find your duvet turned down and two nice Belgian chocolates on your bed. The concierge service is excellent. They go out of your way to help the hotel guests. I was fortunate to receive a surprise cake delivered to me which one of my party arranged seamlessly with the concierge. The location is perfect, a short walk from Times Square, Empire State, Macy's etc. Central Park us approximately a 10-15 min walk away. There are subway stations within walking distance. Overall I highly recommend the hotel and would be pleased to stay there again.

Our first trip to NYC to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and it was the perfect location. Not a cheap option .....but maybe that's just new york prices. Location is brilliant for times square, Bryant park and much more. Room well equipped and very clean. Staff very attentive, friendly and helpful but in a relaxed way. Didn't eat there but would definitely recommend as a hotel.

Another great experience at the Iroquois Hotel. We took our almost 13 year old granddaughter to the city to see the sights/ Broadway shows, and enjoyed a wonderful few days there. We requested a suite, which was perfect as our granddaughter had her own "room" ; the set-up afforded us all some privacy. The Iroquois is our first choice when it comes to visiting NYC.

We have booked this hotel for a week stay in Midtown. It's not a big chain hotel, but a very nice and quiet hotel. Very friendly staff (international). Every morning the hotel offers tea (hot water and a good choice of quality tea) and coffee complimentary in the library. The rooms are big enough for a couple and luggage, big storage for suitcases. The beds are super duper good, one of the best hotel beds I have had till so far. Bathroom is very nice and looks luxurious, plenty of towels and a nice set of bathrobes. Definitely the hotel I would book for our next trip to NYC

This hotel is in a great location. It's close to the theaters, Times Square, and Bryant Park. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is super clean and nicely decorated. Valet service was helpful (for a fee, but worth the convenience for us). We will return!
user_name:
JFino
Southampton, New York, United States

review_body: Stayed for 7 days over the Easter holidays with my two children had a room with two double beds , room was small but this didn't matter beds were sumptuous and the bathroom was fantastic, spotless marble , great showere and molton brown toiletries. good tv with loads of channels boys caught up with all the sport in the evenings . All staff were friendly and knowledgeable which as great as this was my first trip to New York . Would defiantly recommend infact I've given the details to several friends already . Hope to return again one day

The hotel is excellent if you want to be near Times Square. we didn't have any meals at the hotel but there are many close by. All the staff were helpful and efficient. The room I stay in was on the small side, but as we were out for most of the day, it wasn't an issue. The room was clean and tidy and the only downside was that there was no tea and coffee making facilities in the room.

My wife and I stayed here last week. It's centrally located just a few blocks from Broadway/Time Sq. Our room was reasonably spacious with the most amazingly comfortable bed, easily one of the best I have slept in.The staff were very friendly and their is free tea and coffee available in the lobby.The attached restaurant and bar - Triomphe, was very good and I would highly recommend it.

This was a lovely little hotel located within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park & on the door step of the beautiful Bryant Park. Located on a quiet street just 2 blocks from the hustle & Bustle of Times Square this hotel hides you away from the thick of New York day to day but also gives you access all areas. It is lovely & clean with very friendly staff. They could however do with a bigger bar, very hard to get a table.

I have just come back from a 6 day holiday in New York and the Hotel Iroquois exceeded my expectations. Every member of staff were very helpful and friendly and could not do enough to help us. Free coffee was provided each morning and hot apple tea in the afternoon.The doormen are extra polite and helpful and Bill Heinrich, the concierge was always available to make our restaurant bookings and point us in the right direction.The hotel is ideally situated, only one block from Time Square and within easy walking distance to most of the main attractions.We are planning on visiting New York again before the end of the year and will make the Iroquois our hotel of choice.

Just spent 3 nights at the Iroquois and everything about this boutique hotel exceeded our expectations. Friendly helpful staff, cozy, comfortable, clean and quiet room. Loved the Moulton Brown bath products, good coffee downstairs in the library in the morning, and hot apple cider in the afternoon. Turndown service and chocolates on our pillows every night. The hotel was a quick walk to 5th Avenue shopping, Times Square and Broadway shows. Also a good selection of restaurants nearby. We would definitely stay here again.

It was a daunting task to find a place to stay for our Girl's Trip to New York. But, when I looked at the pictures of The Iroquois, I knew it would be perfect. I was looking for something smaller, unique, and with charm, but still close to Broadway shows. The location is perfect, tucked away on a quiet street away from the craziness from Times Square. It was close to the subway and shopping on 5th Ave.I loved the turn down service and the quaint library where you could get coffee and tea in the morning. The staff was personable and very friendly. Rooms were well appointed and beds were comfortable. Overall, I would highly recommend The Iroquois in NYC!

The amazing Iroquois Hotel in New York contributed so much to a memorable holiday for 8 of us in New York. I was so impressed by all aspects of the hotel. The receptionists were efficient and friendly, the concierge, Vanessa, was very helpful and friendly, the lady who cleaned our room was so meticulous and friendly. You have probably noticed the threads running through this: everyone was efficient, helpful and very friendly! Complimentary tea and coffee drinks were provided each morning, umbrellas were available when it rained, staff opened the main door for us when entering or leaving the hotel, a PC and printer was available for use as was free Wi-fi and staff stood in the middle of the road to draw the attention of taxis when we requested them! Staff went above and beyond the call of duty to make our holiday the best ever. Gestures like the lady cleaning our room leaving chocolates each day just added to the brilliance of our holiday. The Iroquois has a central location in New York, being about 5 minutes walk from Times Square, ideal for exploring the whole of New York. I can't praise the Iroquois enough. Thank you so much and we look forward to staying there again.

Iroquois is a nice hotel where we have had a great pleasure to stay. Don t hésitate to choose this name to spend good time. Close to Time Square and with a nice team. Friends and I was very happy and we hope that we Will be able to come back later
user_name:
Patrick L
Saint Germain Lã¨S Corbeil

review_body: The Iroquois is a lovely hotel near Times Square, but it seems like it is on a far away street. The quiet elegance is charming. The seemingly simple touches, like chocolates on the pillow, the newspaper on the door, and the opening of the doors when one enters and leaves the hotel makes this hotel sophisticated, yet very affordable. The concierge Vanessa was fabulous. There was a small issue with the temperature in the room. It was taken care of promptly. I would DEFINITELY stay here again!

We came for the Tartan Week celebrations. The hotel was within easy walking distance of all our destinations! Staff was professional, attentive and helpful, rooms clean and well appointed! Looking forward to next year!

We have had a great stay in this Hotel. The Services was very friendly and professional. From our room we could see the Chrysler Building. The Hotel is located in Midtown and within very short distance there are a lot of attractions.

100% four star hotel with added benefit of very friendly staff. Had a room with two double beds at back of hotel that was very quiet and in perfect shape. This hotel has a very good vibe and is obviously very well managed.

We loved it. From making our reservations, to checking out, we were met with total professionalism. Kia, front desk services, was perfect. She listened to my requests and then met them and upon arrival to our room, we were met with a lovely bottle of wine and Belgium chocolates with a personal note from Kia. The hotel is a boutique and our room was cozy and perfect. The beds are wonderful and comfortable. Housekeeping did an incredible job as our room was spotless each day. Turn down service is such a nice touch. The bellmen and concierge were kind and sent us to only the best spots in the City. I highly recommend the Iroquois to anyone visiting the city as the location cannot be beat! Thank you for an incredible stay! Sincerely, Katherine Webb

Location coupled with incredible service makes The Iroquois New York a fantastic choice when visiting New York! The service is incredible. The rooms are amazing truly all about old world charm. Additionally this property is close to everything in Manhattan.

Fantastic small hotel near time squareModern and updated! Beautiful interior! Super friendly! Great concierge! Great location in the middle of all the action! Set on the only quiet street in the area! Love this place!

Excellent location and a fantastic vale on 44th Street with great proximity to Theater and 6th Avenue businesses district. Friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff. Well appointed and comfortable rooms with heavenly bed.

Very well located hotel within easy walking distance to Time Square and 5th Avenue. Room was perfect for my wife and I. The bed was so comfortable and the Malton Brown bathroom condiments a nice touch.

The room was clean, spacious with two good beds. The service was excellent and the location was perfect for a couple of tourists doing Manhattan. The rooms were serviced twice a day and a complimentary new york times was delivered at the door each morning. We stayed for 6 nights and will choose this hotel on our next visit.

Booked a stay at the Iroquois to celebrate our honeymoon.Pros - Super location. Friendly staff. Comfy beds.Cons - lack of power sockets in roomOverall a great place to stay to explore NYC. Would recommend

Quiet, elegant old hotel in quiet outskirts of Times Square. Lobby and library are well maintained. Stayed in larger room with king bed. Street view was great. Room was updated and extremely comfortable. No noise from adjacent rooms.

We have stayed at the Iroquois more than twenty times in the past fourteen years and cannot wait to stay again. The staff is exceptional and property perfect. It is close enough to mid-town tourist attractions for ease and convenience but far enough away to be away from the heavy and sometimes overpowering traffic of all kinds.

Highly recommend this hotel; the staff was friendly and met every request promptly. The location is convenient: great subway station close by, walking distance to plays; several good restaurants close by, room was very comfortable and clean. Highly recommend.

The best as always. It's not my first time reviewing this hotel, neither the second. I keep staying at the Iroquois hotel because you can't find a better service in NYC. It feels like home. The bed linens are the best, and before you finish your request, things already done. The rooms are not big, but for this location, one block from Times Square, you couldn't have better than that.
user_name:
Michal M
Herzliya, Tel Aviv, Israel

review_body: Had a fantastic holiday in New York and stayed in this fantastic hotel. for 7 Days March to April.Lovely bath and shower rooms great and comfy. Air conditioned.very helpful lady on the trip desk in the foyer about trips in New York. Every thing was perfect. Nice cocktail bar at the door area to the left. Visit the nearby Red Flame Diner up 44th st, good breakfasts there. Will come back here again to this hotel if visiting New York again in the future.

Two adults and a teenager, this was the second time we have stayed here. Brilliant location next to Bryant Park, clean , tidy and well appointed room. As small as you would expect by NYC standards. Staff were all excellent, Especially Rocky on the front door! When I go back to NYC... I'm staying here!

Location, cleanliness, front desk staff, the guys who helped with our bags- everyone and everything was fantastic.My husband and I were expecting a teeny tiny room as is typical in New York, however, the room size was quite acceptable and the bathroom was very clean with nice, warm colors and attractive tiling. Comfortable bed and bedding. We were very satisfied with our stay.

This hotel was exceptional. Close enough to everything but far enough to not hear all the noise. The room was great. It was small but just right. The bed was a little soft for my liking but still good. The bathroom was superb. Staff at the front desk were courteous and polite during check in and check out. I would definitely stay here again and refer friends and family to stay if they are planning a trip to New York.

This was my first stay at the Iroquois and I will definitely return. The rooms are larger than I expected, the linens impeccable, the quality of the toiletries high, and the courtesy of the staff was delightful. The fitness center is great. The price represents a terrific value. My friend kept remarking at how quiet the room was - no street noise despite a bustling location in mid-town. That must be a testimonial to the original building - beautifully historic but with every modern update inside.

The Iroquois is a beautiful hotel with excellent amenities. The staff is friendly and helpful and the food was delicious! I will definitely stay at the Iroquois on return visits and will recommend it to others!

The hotel rooms, amenities, an the overall service was very good, they exceeded my expectation. Perfect location, it is situated only 3 minutes walk from Time square. Prompt, acknowledged, courteous staff overall. I will highly recommend it to anyone.

Excellent location for our sightseeing trip to New York - Times Square was a five minute walk away. Room was clean and quiet and the hotel staff very helpful. We would return here if we visited again.

We just love this place. First of all, the people are kind and caring. So helpful. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable, the morning coffee is hot and delicious, and the hotel restaurant and bar terrific. But the location, location, location: Times Square, Central Park, New York Public Library, Broadway theaters--all within walking distance. Bottom line: a terrific hotel with a first rate staff. Bravo, Iroquois! Can't wait to come back.
user_name:
Steve W
Berwyn, Illinois, United States

review_body: Our stay at the Irquois was excellent, the location is perfect for all areas of Manhattan as it is so centrally located. We were made to feel very welcome and the staff were friendly and courteous at all times. The room was well appointed and well presented and amazingly quiet despite the location. We would not hesitate in recommending the Irquois and will certainly be staying there next time we visit- this small boutique hotel is a secret that needs to be found.

My wife and myself stayed 2 nights in late March. We were in a 'queen deluxe' room #400 off the elevator. Forget those usual warnings about noise. We didn't hear a peep. Room was small but ample for our needs. Clean and well maintained. The staff at every level were both very friendly and extremely helpful. The Bellman, front desk, maids, and concierge, were all great! We didn't try the restaurant but the Bar was nice with some interesting drinks. This is a very nice hotel with a great location. On an almost historical portion of 44th street, The hotel is an easy walk to Times Square, Theaters, and all of the mid-town exuberance.  We chose to have our car valeted, only slightly more than surrounding garages. But well worth the convenience.
