The Location of the Hotel is excellent. A lot of interesting sights (e.g.Times Square, 5th Avenue) can be reached in short walking distance. We enjoyed our stay very much. The Concierge Team was very nice and helpful.

There were 6 of us staying at the hotel for a week, we all had a great stay. The Iroquois was clean, staff very friendly. The daily extras i.e daily papers delivered and chocolates much appreciated + free coffee in library so much attention to detail .

The service was great. They did everything for us even if it had nothing to do with the hotel. The location is great (only two blocks away from times square) and we will surely come back. We had the Deluxe Room and it was perfect for my mom and me.

Location, location, location. You'll get all three...plus clean and comfortable rooms. Near terrific restaurants (including the hotel's bar and restaurant), as well as Broadway and Times Square. Kind and attentive staff. Get to know them on a first-name basis. They all have the gift of hospitality.

Charming hotel in a great location for our first trip to NYC. My 13 yr old and I found everyone at the hotel helpful and friendly with everything from dinner suggestions, subway route planning and accommodating our early arrival and late check out requests. Proximity to subway stations was very good. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Thanks for a great experience Iroquois!

What a wonderful place to stay. Quiet, clean and lovely accommodations and extremely helpful staff. Couldn't ask for more especially with the reasonable room rates. On our next venture to NYC this will be our hotel for sure.

This was an amazing hotel loved the style and ambience. This was a trip for my son's 21st and they wished him happy birthday on arrival wine chocolates & note in room very special. Definitely recommend and use again.

We enjoyed our stay with The Iroquois Hotel in New York City, very much. Everything in the hotel was clean and well maintained. Service was excellent, from the first contact and reservation to the check out. Excellent value!

Stayed at the Iroquois in late March in celebration of my Mothers 70th birthday. It was both our first time visiting and I wanted a smaller hotel close to Times Square/Theater District. The Iroquois was a perfect hotel for our Mother Daughter vacation. The staff is amazing and room was a good size for us (we shared a king bed). Our room was so nice we actually ended up spending our first morning gossiping in bed, reading the newspaper (provided by the hotel), enjoying breakfast room service. Can't go wrong booking a stay at the Iroquois - I will be visiting this hotel again!

Stayed here over Thanksgiving 2015. Liked this boutique hotel very much. It's in a great location, especially for the Parade. My room was very clean, the bed extremely comfortable, the bathroom big with a great shower. Also good closet space. All staff were courteous and responsive. Nice little room off lobby for computer use. Very comfortable and I highly recommend. Also, nice diner down the street. I had breakfast in the hotel which was delicious, although a little expensive -- but that's New York.

Excellent staff, exzellent location in the heart of Midtown Manhatten, excellent communications to all Manhatten. We felt like guests, not anonymous. In general not a quit place. Heating in the room was difficult. The Bar is wonderful

Stayed here for 7 nights in March. Lovely and friendly staff who are very happy to help. Rooms very clean and not to cramped considering this is New York. Well placed, 2 blocks from Time Square and 3 from Rockerfella. Would happily stay here again.

This hotel is a little gem in the heart of NYC. It is convenient to many attractions, restaurants and public transit. It was very comfortable, clean, quiet and roomy for a big city hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

The Iroquois New York is a great place to stay as it is so close to many of the attractions, but on a quieter street. The hotel is small and friendly with nice clean comfortable rooms and a great staff. Friendliness and good service is there from the minute you arrive. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a quality hotel, but also likes the more intimate feel when staying in the city.

I had asked the hotel for a quiet room. So a room higher up or/and at the back of the hotel. I got to the hotel very late due to my international delays. I had been awake almost 24 hours so it was not until I had unpacked and went to see my Mum in her bedroom that I noticed my room was not on the 3rd floor and very noisy with no wardrobe. I asked to be moved and I was to the 9th floor. A lot quieter and although the room was downgraded to a queen bedroom, the room was bigger and had a wardrobe unlike the King room. My new room was very cold but the porter brought me a plug in fan Heater which helped. My bedroom would take 3-4 hours to warm up, but my mother who was on floor 11 had no issues. Apart from the bedroom issue and the heating issue which I then knew how to get around each day (I would simply turn the heat to full when I went out for the evening so it was warm upon my return) the hotel was enjoyable. The location is superb. The staff are extremely helpful too. It's not a large hotel, but personally I like that. The rooms were tidied each day, but the turn down service is very early so if you are still in your room around 7:30pm getting ready for an evening you will miss this service. This did not bother me, but I wanted to mention it. I would return to this hotel, but book their Queen room as its a bigger room and has a wardrobe and also ask for a higher room or a room at the back and ensure to re ask when you check in as my request was not followed through. Times Square is literally a 5 minute walk, 5th Avenue even less and you are right by the New York Library. Also wait until the hotel had a sale. We booked and then the booked when by chance we saw they had a sale. If you can get your room in the sale you should definitely stay. We will return next year as long as we get the sale price.

Great hotel in mid Manhattan. The hotel was small quiet and with great service. Yet, at the same time we were close to everything and minutes away from the heart of the city. The door men made you feel like you were staying with friends. Across the street is a nice coffee shop ala Starbucks called Gregory or something and next door is a coffee shop/diner ala Seinfeld for quick meals, called the Red Flame, I think. They had terrific cake. I will stay at this hotel again, it was convenient, quiet, clean, perfectly located, safe, just absolutely everything I wanted.

This hotel was perfect for our first visit to NYC. The rooms were great, if a little dark, and the beds were really comfortable. The bathrooms were well stocked with Molton Brown smellies and the shower was amazing. The complimentary coffee in the library was a godsend while waiting for the kids to get up and ready!The hotel is really well placed and yet the rooms were quiet. But the best aspect of the Iroquois is the amazing staff. Everyone was welcoming, friendly and helpful and this made our stay even more perfect. Special mention must go to Bill, the concierge. Nothing was too much trouble and he really is the font of all NY knowledge! He helped us with directions, restaurants and even located and contacted a boutique Soho jeweller that I wished to visit. He had a particular piece of jewellery held over for me and gave me directions and maps to get there. Would highly recommend this hotel and hope to return in future!

The hotel has many good points but i think the two best are the location because is 2 streets away from Times Square and everything is near. The second thing are the beds and pillows. They are very comfortable and really you enjoy sleeping and having a relaxing time in your bedroom. Perfect to rest from a busy day at work.

I was very happy with my stay. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel felt safe ( I was on my own). the staff was always very helpful. The location is great. The hotel had a European flair with I loved.My only complaint - The bar did not serve any type of vodka, only gin based drinks, which I am not fond of , other than that, I had a wonderful experience.

This is an excellent hotel for the price, and the location couldn't be better. The rooms are small, but clean and efficient. Overall service was very good, although the check in experience was disappointing as the room was not ready at check in time. There is a small bar and a restaurant, but they are not open on Sunday or Monday. However, there are several options for food and drink in the same block.

From the moment we arrived this hotel was perfect! We had not been to NYC before and wanted something nice, central and affordable. Our room had two double beds, was really cosy. It looked out on to a fire escape that reminded me of "Friends" tv show. The room was lovely and clean, not overly big but perfect for us. Each night we had a turn down service and a chocolate on our pillow. In the morning the paper was hung on our door. The door men were also so nice and very helpful and chatty which was great as we did ask them for advice on occasion.The hotel is very close to both Times Square and 5th Ave, yet the street is relatively quiet. I would highly recommend this hotel! Clean, safe and very welcoming!

This hotel was clean, efficient and priced well. It was a perfect choice for a Broadway stay in nyc. The staff was very helpful and the proximity to time square and shopping on fifth avenue can't be beat. One shortcoming is that they have central air so you can't regulate your room temperature

This trip was for 18th birthday, everything was perfect, best trip ever!!! We didn't want to leave!!! The staff was fantastic and knowledgeable. Will be staying here again next NYC trip, which I am hoping will be my birthday since we had such a wonderful time.

This is a great hotel in a super location with excellent staff. Our thanks to the concierge Natassa for the welcome gift in our room for our daughter's birthday. We had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend.

This was my first time staying at this hotel. The hotel room was quite comfortable with a large bathroom. Breakfast was included with our room providing great value. There bar provides a great spot for late night drinks. The hotel was very clean and quiet.
user_location: North Kingstown, Rhode Island, United States
user_name:
Deborah H
North Kingstown, Rhode Island, United States

review_body: The staff were friendly and helpful and the room lovely and comfortable. I enjoyed fabulous food and drinks at the Triomphe and with room service. It was the perfect midtown location. I was able to walk to theaters easily and it seemed a short cab ride to everywhere else I wished to go. I definitely would love to return. Lots of interesting restaurants and shops nearby to try on a longer return visit.

Very convenient location in midtown Manhattan. Two blocks from everything. Direct two block walk into Grand Central Station, Half block to 5th &6th Avenues. Location at mid-block is quiet. Library amenity with computer and printer very good.

We had a wonderful time in New York and the position of the Iroquois Hotel was perfect to explore the city. We had a room for three, a bit small but comfortable and quiet, the staff was very supportive.

This was my second time staying at The Iroquois. Great central location, quick walk to Times Square and other sights. Plenty of food choices I the area too! Comfy bed and hot showers are added plus!!!

The hotel was very quiet and clean. The room was basically a bedroom with a bathroom attached altought very clean I had the deluxe queen bed room. Great place to stay. It is located a couple of blocks from Times Square parking is right across the street in the parking garage 45.00 per day.

The staff were all very nice and efficient. The room was small, but it had everything that you would need. The bathroom was very clean. The beds were comfortable. Even housekeeping came in the evening to turn down the beds and leave a couple pieces of candy on our pillows. You just can't beat the location and the overall ambiance. I would definitely stay here again when spending the night in New York.

An amazing hotel, just what we needed for our stay. Rooms are small but perfect for what we needed. Compact and cosy. Very clean, very well provided for. The staff were also brilliant and made us feel very welcome. Thank you for a great holiday!

really lovely hotel great area, staff especially concierge very helpful. Would stay again in a heartbeat. quality of maid service and room cleanliness quite exceptional. Had a great stay in New York !!

i like a lot this hotel! all the staff is very kind, the food at the restaurant is delicious.the only thing that you can improve is more light at the rooms and having more staff that speak spanish en every shift.

The hotel was perfect, we are usually on a slightly tighter budget for NY stays but the extra £20-30 a night on what we usually spend was well worth it at the Iroquois - plus there were lots of little additional perks such as the complimentary walking tours/dvd library/free coffee etc to help! Great location (10 mins walk from Port Authority; 5mins from Times Square), exceptional staff, brilliant wifi and nice bed (and dark/quiet so good sleep) and good shower which is pretty much all we look for. Many thanks for a wonderful stay.

From the warm welcome, through several delightful meals at Triomphe and right through to check out, the experience was terrific.Great staff, excellent food, wonderful amenities, clean rooms - what more can I say? I have made The Iroquois my "home away from home" for the past several years whenever I am in NYC and they never disappoint me. This is truly a rare find these days!!!!

From when we first checked in on March 16th, I knew I made the right choice Picking The Iroquois. Bellman immediately got the luggage out of our two vehicles and the front desk gentleman gave my two granddaughters some welcome gifts. Every person seemed to be swarming around taking care of all of our needs. The hotel is right in the heart of midtown but secluded and quiet at the same time. I really found a gem in this place.

The Iroquois Hotel is a jewel of a hotel. Friendly and helpful staff, lovely rooms, great food, and perfect location to get everywhere. A very comfortable home away from home. Rooms are small but efficiently planned. It's not inexpensive but good value for the money.

Position of the hotel was amazing.Cleaning the room twice a day! Prompt reactions on our demands.Comfortable enviroment and interior.We felt secure,just like at home.Wonderful street.Close to 5th Avenue ant Times Square!and Brynt Park too.

My two teenage daughters and I visited the big apple for a whirlwind 4 days. Perfect location and very helpful, attentive and friendly staff. The room was smallish, but aren't they all in midtown? Would definitely recommend.

Everything about this little hotel was great. My only complaint is that the lighting in the room was very poor. Most hotel rooms suffer from this problem, so I was not too bothered by it. The location is perfect, the price was reasonable, the room was an adequate size for a NYC hotel (enough space for an adult and two teenagers to move around without bumping into each other) and the service was problem-free. I highly recommend this place!

Truly loved our stay at the hotel. Location was perfect, service was wonderful and the hotel had that old world charm that I love! The staff was very professional and friendly. I have already recommended the hotel to my friends and my daughter. i dont think you will be be disappointed with this choice of hotels.

Great location just outside of Times Square and the Theatre District...right between Broadway and Grand Central. Rooms are lovely. Beds comfy. Library acts as a business center so you don't have to pay to use computers for printing. Concierge is extremely helpful.

This is my fifth or sixth trip to the Iroquois and every time is perfect. Every staff member is absolutely polite and helpful. It actually feels like checking into a B&B as opposed to a hotel. The location is perfect for my business meetings but close enough to shopping and the theater district that I can walk wherever I need to go. I do not hesitate to make my reservation at the Iroquois every time I need to spend a night in Manhattan.

So pleased we found this hotel. The price was excellent, and the reservations staff were willing to give me a lower rate that I found online a day before our arrival. Because the hotel is small, there was no wait to check-in or check-out. I've been stuck in long lines before trying to check into other hotels, and it's an awful way to start your vacation. The room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. The location is central to everything. It's a very charming hotel and the staff were charming as well! We enjoyed sitting in the library and reading the newspaper with our coffee. We have found our go-to hotel in NYC!

Great time at the hotel everything was perfect..the hotel had the best customer service very clean rooms the bathroom was very clean a lot to mention..the location was very convenient love the community also was very easy to access public transportation etc

I recently stayed at the Iroquois Hotel in NYC. The hotel is in a great location - easy walk to my business meetings and evening events. Personally, I liked the decor and atmosphere of the lobby and library area. It's not a very large area, but clean and comfortable. The room was very clean and had every amenity I needed. Every evening when I would return, the room was clean and restocked. Of course, the city is noisy, but once in my room, on an upper floor, I could not hear any street noise. The bed was very comfortable.All of the staff were friendly and professional. I was asked several times if I needed assistance or information and if my room was okay. Each of the doormen were pleasant, informative and helpful. I had an excellent stay. Felt secure and again, the location is perfect for business travel or vacationing.

My kids and I stayed At the hotel for 7 days from march 5 to 12. The location gave us the oportunity to walk up and down the complete city without taking transportation. The staff was very friendly and helpfull with us all times and the room confortable. I' will recommend this hotel to my relatives and friends.

Great location Great price We go to New york often and have stayed in a variety of places. We will definitely be back here. The room was quiet and comfortable. Our room service breakfast arrived on time ... Nothing at all to complain about!

We stayed three nights in this hotel and found the service to be very good, the location is excellent for Times Square, Bryant park, Central Park and multiple subways. Very nice bar with selection of good spirits and wines (expensive, even for New York), great cheap eats diner a few doors away (red flame diner) so good when your not in restaurant mood. Room was nice, bit small but nice, the bathroom was massive probably as big as the bed room, good wifi, TV selection, full but expensive mini bar. We had an internal room so no view to speak of, the room air con was not able to be switched off from inside the room and was noisy, the hallway lighting flooded through the bottom of the door and wasn't controllable, had to cover the massive gap at the bottom of the door with a towel....not good, sleep rating is what stops this place from being an excellent hotel and if at the beginning of our three week tour I probably would have complained but just couldn't be bothered, shame as everything else about this place was very good, thank you to the desk/door and concierge staff.

The Iroquois was lovely, staff was friendly and helpful. Room was nicely appointed and very quiet. First trip to NYC with my daughter. Convenient to Times Square and theaters. We loved our stay at this hotel and highly recommend the Iroquois.

I enjoyed my stay and the staff was overwhelming welcoming and accommodating. My room was beautiful and comfortable. The room had fresh chocolate covered strawberries upon check in! What a great treat!The only down side was, it was a very warm day in NYC and the air conditioner did not appear to be working so it made sleeping at night a bit a challenge.

Beautiful old hotel. Fantastic staff -- friendly, as helpful as can be (hat tip to the austrian/german man at the front desk), and really seem to enjoy their work. Beautiful rooms -- ours was definitely on the small side but intelligently designed (desk between two double beds acted as nightstands) and absolutely lovely. Excellent location, obviously: just outside of the hustle/bustle of Times Square, but near enough to walk easily to theater, shows, restaurants and subway. Two small quibbles kept it from being five star. One is that although the library is adorable and the coffee good, I really don't like padding down to the lobby to get my morning coffee. The addition of even a tiny coffee maker in the room would be a big improvement. In addition, we could not get the heat to go down -- I believe it is centrally heated. We ended up having to keep the windows open all day and all night not to be utterly stifling. It worked out, but still... In any case, receiving a Sunday Morning Times on the doorhandle was a fabulous treat, as was receiving 10 bottles of shampoo and conditioner when I asked for 2 extras. The service here really is the bomb. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

We had a lovely well equipped room on the top floor. Molten Brown toiletries added that special touch. Chocolates were left in the room for us everyday and the space was quite good too for NYC. Staff were friendly and approachable. My only gripe was my CC was charged for something from the minibar which we didn't purchase but when i emailed, staff did put the credit back in my account. There is a cheap but nice diner just next door which is handy too.

This was my second stay at this boutique New York Hotel. I love the location which is near but not in Times Square. It is an easy walk to popular attractions and shopping. There is a restaurant in the hotel that serves what looks to be excellent and upscale food but I have never eaten there as I usually opt for breakfast at a much more casual restaurant just a few steps away. The hotel delivers friendly staff, clean rooms, great bedding and cozy bathrobes. The concierge service is absolutely top notch here. My stay was over Valentines Weekend so it was very cold by NY standards. The complimentary and very delicious hot cider that is usually plentiful in the hotel library ran out early each afternoon and I would have liked to see better attention paid to that as it is something my group, and many other guests, looked forward to each day. The Iroquois is definitely on my preferred NYC hotels list.

I am a New York resident and frequent guest in NYC when seeing a play or attending a function. I tried the Iroquois on a hunch based upon good reviews on Trip Advisor and close proximity to Broadway and I consider myself well traveled having been in hotels in just about every major city in the U.S. From the time we pulled up to the hotel, every aspect of the this property exceeded my expectations and I mean every aspect from the outside appearance, uniforms, appearance and demeanor of the bell hops and front desk staff, the warm cider in the lobby library, the sophisticated decor, the proximity to other venues, the intimate restaurant and lobby bar right down to the monogrammed slippers and robes. This will be the only hotel I stay at when bedding down in NYC thanks for fond memories and I will soon be rebooking with my daughters when the weather warms to enjoy Central Park!
user_name:
pete643
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a great little hotel located very close to Time Square, not that you'd know it because it's so quiet. Lovely room (we had a double queen) which had sufficient space to 2 and had good amenities. The bed was so comfortable. Staff were polite and courteous. Would thoroughly recommend it

We stayed for four nights in early March in a two bed room.The hotel was very clean, and very comfortable. The room wasn't large but we had everything we needed, and the shower was great (hot, good pressure.)We appreciated the tea and coffee in the mornings, and the hot apple cider during those last few snow flurries!The location is great- perfect for tourists like ourselves wanting to fit in as much as we could each day.

Friendly staff, comfortable rooms, safe feel, easy to get where with the subway close by, many things within walking distance. Great location to get back to during the day when out exploring. I never needed to use a taxi once.

Would highly recommend! Hotel was very clean, rooms seemed like there were recently updated. The location was awesome. We took the Newark Airport Express bus into the city and the hotel was only 5 minute walk from the Bryant Park drop off. Easy access to all of manhattan

This is our favorite place to stay when we visit NYC. It's well located but quiet, the service is excellent, and the rooms comfortable. It's within walking distance of plays, subway entrances, and other attractions, but away from the throngs of people and noise. Breakfast is good and not overpriced, the bar is great, and the concierge helpful.

Stayed here for 5 nights early March for husband's birthday. Done a lot of research prior to booking and it paid off. A quiet , comfortable , clean hotel with staff who are always available but not intrusive. Was welcomed by name by Vanessa who had made special arrangements and it was a pleasure to meet her. Location wise was minutes from many attractions but far enough away to allow for a quiet sedated hotel. The only negative was the windows although double glazed still allowed the cold and noise in to a degree. Thank you to all who made our trip a carefree memorable visit.

As per title.......Handy for Grand Central, Bryant Park, 5th ave., Time Square. Vibrant, but not too noisy. Plenty of eating options nearby, so good to not be prepaying for breakfast and evening wine receptions.

Excellent customer service. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like family. The staff was attentive, friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean and cozy. I would highly recommend this hotel!

This classic and historic hotel is an oasis in Manhattan. Excellent quality and comfort for the price and convenient to Times Square. The hotel restaurant, Triomphe, is a congenial and quiet island of sanity and luxury. Will stay here again.

Nice hotel, perfect location, midtown. Rooms and bathroom clean. Decoration classic but nice. Ask a room NOT with the courtyard view or in a high floor...to be able to see the sky!Restaurant with too sophisticated food, but a lot of options around. Wifi ok.

My girlfriend and I just stayed here for 4 nights and couldn't recommend it enough. The location is excellent. 2 minutes from Times Sq and 2 minutes from Bryant Park (if you come in from Newark the bus drops at Bryant Park so it's all easy). The staff were extremely helpful. I asked them to book a table for my girlfriends birthday at Robert (also recommended) and they arranged it all and organised a great table with views. Other nice touches were a NY Times every morning and free tea and coffee downstairs as well as a computer and printer to print any tickets off. Thank you!

College educated, worked and lived in NY City 11-years: ---- A hotel for New York experienced visitor; 44th to Grand Central ---- great location --- 5th south to Village restaurants or 6th to museums. Walk to Saks' or Rock Center.

We choose the Iroquois for every trip to New York, because the location, service, a overall care of the staff is simply better than other choices. This time was certainly no exception. The Iroquois is a wonderful hotel.

A very pleasant hotel experience, no complaints at all - elegance, service, comfort, style - valet service was efficient, front desk staff were courteous and cheery, bellhop was friendly, room was comfortable and clean (not huge but nice bathroom, comfy bed, writing desk), amenities were good (tasty tap water, thick bathrobes, chocolates on pillow, window with a view) -- food prices were not cheap, breakfast prices were comparable to dinner prices elsewhere, but good quality, quantity, service. So, old-school Empire elegance, an attractive room rate, comfort, convenience, service, location - two blocks to the theater! Yes, I can recommend this hotel, though more for singles and couples (we didn't see a suite so I can;t compare). High marks all around!
user_name:
Douglas F
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Service is excellent without being overbearing. Lots of small touches enhance the experience. Location is fantastic, we are walkers and could go all four directions from here. Enjoyed the room, bathroom very nice, especially shower. Quiet street, but close to Times Square, nice after a show on a cold Friday night to only have a ten minute walk back. Great diner for breakfast just west of the hotel, same block.

We went to NYC for a few days to celebrate our anniversary. Hotel Iroquois was perfect place to stay in terms of getting around the City. Broadway, Grand Central, NY Library, Rockefeller Ctr are all a quick walk away. It was nice to stay at a small hotel vs a major chain. Staff was awesome, nice little fitness center and rooms were great.

We returned to the Iroquois last week and, as always, had an outstanding 4 night stay. All staff are welcoming, courteous, helpful and thoughtful. Our room was spacious and comfortable. Black out curtains were helpful. Outside sound (This is midtown Manhattan) was inconsequential. Plenty of power sources - a power strip placed out of the way yet conveniently was very useful.We've stayed at the Iroquois many times - it's our New York home away from home. It's the better than perfect midtown boutique hotel.

I'm not one that writes reviews normally but I felt I should make an exception with this hotel. I stayed here in July 2015 and everything about the place was just, comfortable, and by that I mean all aspects of my stay was just so pleasant. One classy hotel, very helpful and friendly staff, great location. Couldn't ask for more really.

Beautiful small hotel (117 room) in a fantastic location for all attractions but as is down 44th street is so much quieter and away from all the hustle and bustle. All the staff from doormen to cleaners reception and concierge were friendly approachable and helpful. Our room was on the 6th floor and had 2 double beds and everything you could possibly need from hairdryer, bathrobe, bathroom toiletries, television etc. No tea and coffee making facilities though there was coffee and tea available in the hotel lobby in the morning and hot apple cider in the afternoon. The hotel is exceptionally clean, well appointed and very welcoming, We were a family of three (16yr old son) and the hotel was everything we could have wished for. we were not bothered by any noise from the streets in our room. There is a coffee shop opposite for a light breakfast snack called Georges or the Red flame diner down on the same side of the hotel which served food of all types all day. All excellent. A special note to Bill one of the concierges who managed to find us and booked a table for us last minute on Valentines day at a lovely Italian. Thanks Bill. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anybody there is nothing to fault.

The Iroquois is an atmospheric place with old-world charm that's just steps away from Times Square and Grand Central Station. My room, though small, was comfortable, quiet and elegantly furnished.The real standouts here are the caring and courteous staff.

The Iroquois is old New York renewed for today. Yes, it is short walk to dinner and theatre but it is also far enough west to feel very private, tucked in among other historic buildings and boutique hotels (the Algonquin, the Royalton). The service on every count is out of this world--offered without the least pretension. I truly felt like a guest hosted by staff who shared a sense of pride in the hotel, Beautiful, understated elegance. Superb bar/restaurant--and the new cocktail salon is very cool.

The Iroquois is awesome! The minute you walk in you feel like a VIP. Vanessa the concierge was extremely helpful and went above and beyond. We will use this hotel every time we return to NY from now on.

We have stayed at the Iroquois numerous times and have always been very pleased both with the service and the comfort of the rooms. One of the surprising things is that the rooms are so quiet yet you are only a block or so from Times Square and Broadway!
Front desk folks were just great - helpful, nice & personable. Location is fabulous - right in midtown.Deluxe room was perfect for 1 person which I was. Slept wonderfully. Very clean, good size bath.

We loved the room -- it was quiet and comfortable. The hotel is in a great location. A little pricey at full rate, but we did get a nice discounted rate so it made the weekend even better. Would recommend it for anyone visiting Midtown for the weekend.

Extremely well located, excellent staff, clean and comfy.Room was a bit small but clean with a good size bathroom.Good towels, bathrobes and complimentary show shine service, well done.In room lighting was poor.

The hotel has amazing staff that helped us all through out our trip and answered any questions we had. Great hotel with great people. We will definitely be staying at this hotel again every time that we come to New York.

We booked a suite special for a two day in New York to see a show and get away. We like the idea of an "Inn". We loved the Iroquois. Our suite was large with two rooms, large extremely comfortable bed, soaking tub and separate shower. The furniture in the living area was a little dated but had character. The doormen, bell hops front desk concierge were all super friendly and laid back but helpful. We liked the location, walked to MOMA, Central Park, Les Mis, museum of natural history. Slept late had delicious breakfast room service. The lounge is small and comfortable, cocktails were a treat. We really recommend the Iroquois.

We stayed for a couple of nights at this hotel. The standard room is small with no coffee or tea making facilities (though there is free tea and coffee in the library downstairs) and a draconian minibar policy. The shower is ver low power but there are nice molten brown toiletries though only one bar of soap. The bed is a normal double and there is a did player in the tv. It is not in a great location quite far from all the bars and restaurants. No complimentary breakfast.

We had read about the nice personal. But they were even more nice. Location on 44th street, near times square and subway are perfect. We didn`t tried the restaurant but it seemed very nice. We`ll be back.

Beautiful hotel, great location, lovely room, modern bathroom in the heart of NYC. You feel like you are enjoying a bit of NYC history staying here. Definitely would stay again especially if I have theater tickets but also would work for many other events as well. Check-in was effortless and we were able to get in our room when we arrived at 12noon.

This place is perfect! Prices are right, rooms are lovely (not huge- so if that's your thing then look elsewhere)- linens are plush, bathroom all marble, very clean, quiet- slept like a baby. Staff- everyone we encountered- was so friendly. Vanessa (concierge) was big help! Location is perfect- central to pretty much everywhere- upper/lower, you're only a subway stop away...we will be back!

I"m still a fan of The Iroquois, but during this visit I felt the property and the staff lacked the warmth and friendliness I'd previously experienced. There's something nice about the familiarity of walking into a hotel where you've stayed before and in this sense I was pleased with the hotel even though there were missteps by the staff along the way. Per my request we had a room on an upper floor facing inward so as to minimize street noise (saying courtyard is a misnomer as there is no courtyard, just other buildings to view as well as fire escapes). The room is small like most NYC hotels but comfortably furnished. The beds and linens were wonderful, as were the plush towels in the bathroom. High quality toiletry items were another nice touch. The room was super clean and our room was promptly cleaned each day. Lighting could be better in the bedroom (bathroom lighting is excellent) and for two people (I traveled with a friend), there isn't much room to unpack and store clothes. The hallways are beautifully furnished and lighted. Coffee is served each morning in the downstairs "library", and warm cider is available in the afternoon, which was very welcome given the cold weather we experienced while there.Taxis are not easy to find there given the number of hotels located close by and the front door staff was not at the top of its game in helping secure them. I noticed several of the doormen preferred to remain inside to escape the cold weather so we were pretty much left on our own to get a cab. I do like the location of this hotel -- 44th street is lovely and enough removed from Times Square as to not feel like you are in the midst of the frenzy. Also, the bar across the street at The Royalton boasts a lovely fireplace area and cozy seating so it was easy to find a good place to go for a drink and conversation since the lobby of The Iroquois is very small.

Gold details, wood and an incredible staff will welcome you to one of the small luxury hotels in a great location, just a block away from Times Square and the nearest subway station. Excellent choice.The bed will never let you go, it's delicious!!

Efficient service was provided with a friendly smile from the doorman to the front desk It's obvious that cleanliness is emphasized at this hotel. The location was perfect in relation to walking distance to points of interest. Parking is available across the street

Very adequate hotel in the heart of theatre land. Close to great restaurants and minutes away from all the top shows. Rooms in the back are very quiet, but tiny. Excellent value for money. Great classy economy hotel.

From the moment we arrived we found all the staff to be courteous and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable, the beds the best we had ever slept in! Cleaned daily, fresh towels and free local newspaper. As there were 3 of us Sharing the room with 2 double beds space for clothes and suitcases was limited.No tea/coffee making facilities so remember the old travel kettle if needing a drink whilst wide awake at 3am!! Very handy and clean deli 5 mins down the road, turning right out of hotel, next door to O'Donoghues pub, on opposite side of road. Open until 11pm with a fantastic choice of hot and cold food. Cheaply priced and a very fast service. Eat in or takeaway. Very close to Times Square and all attractions. Would highly recommend and return if in NY again.

We had a great stay at The Iroquois over the long weekend in February. This hotel is in a fantastic location for anything that you want to do in the city, close to Central Park , Times Square, lots of great little bars for a nightcap. Our hotel room was clean and bright with a nice view of the Chrysler building. The conceirge that worked over the weekend was amazing; he helped us get a couple of dinner reservations and all of the restaurants that he recommended were perfect. We will stay here again!

Perfect location - walking distance from Broadway shows, Times Square. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was warm, clean and comfortable. Great value for money. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

super location best value for the price friendly staff and good restaurant and probably the most comfortable bed .I have stayed at a variety of hotels in this location and The Iroquois has been the gem of them all.

The Iroquois Hotel was a very nice hotel in the heart of the city. Our accommodations were wonderful. The room was clean and comfortable and provided a quiet sleep. The bed and pillows were quite comfortable. Service was prompt and efficient and employees accommodating and pleasant. All in all a nice stay.

We returned to the Iroquois Hotel for our annual theatre and dining weekend. Warmly greeted by the concierge Vanessa who took care of our every need. Over the weekend, concierge Bill gave us plenty of ideas from theatre and restaurants.We enjoyed their luxury suite. You can't beat the convenient central location to Times Square, Grand Central Station and 5th Avenue. Make sure you enjoy drinks in The Lantern at the Iroquois. To die for!

Breakfast was extremely expensive, luckily there were many cafes nearby (Such as the Un Deux Trois, or the Saju bistro or the Red Flame diner), just a few steps away.The bed was extremely small, my husband is only 1.80 and he didn't fit his feet on the bed.The room was extremely noisy, I know you're in the heart of NYC, but perhaps double glasses would have helped. Double glasses would also have helped against the wind which blew through our bathroom window and made it really, really cold. There was no mini fridge in the room, you could ask for ice but it made it less convenient. All electricity sockets were too big for the plugs (original, American plugs!) and we couldn't keep our electronics charging, in fact only the socket in the bathroom was decent, but that meant leaving your phone in the bathroom for a charge and taking turns between our phones, camera, iPad. Location was amazing! Close to many sightseeings such as Times Square and Broadway, 5th and Madison Avenue, the Grand Central and the Public Library. Central Park is 20 minutes away.

The hotel stay during this NYC trip was one of the bright spots. No stress and no complaints. Courteous and professional staff and great location. Room was clean and comfortable with enough ambiance to allow us to relax and enjoy ourselves.

The hotel is at a very busy location but it was quiet and serene once inside the room. The staff is superb and very friendly. Room was very clean and lovely. The staff was very attentive and offered their help on any matters of concern.

The little hotel is the best! Rocky is the best bell captain. The rooms are clean and the location of the hotel is excellent. The staff is helpful on times and assisting in getting reservations at difficult restaurants.

hotel was charming, excellent customer service, staff was helpful and genuine.room was very comfortable just on small size. location was good, Loved thefeel of the hotel, felt European. Really enjoyed my stayQ

My daughter and I drove to NYC for a weekend of theater, shopping and sightseeing. The Iroquois gave us delightful, friendly personalized service in a beautiful old-fashioned hotel with dark wood and marble of fine craftsmanship. It was close to all the theaters on Broadway, and we walked to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and even the Empire State Building from our central hub at the Iroquois.

My wife and I were very satisfied with our recent 2 night stay. The location, ambience and friendliness of the staff were all excellent! A smaller, hidden gem !The rooms and hallways were clean, crisp and well lit. The decor was tastefully elegant, charming and upscale.

Overall... I'd give this hotel a good review, it has some charming and some not so charming qualities about it...just gotta know what you're getting into prior to booking. So here's the not so good qualities :1. The restaurant food was ok. Went there for breakfast ...and ordered a egg white omelette. The waiter kind of looked at me in surprise at that request and although it was cooked without any major issues, it was a bit runny. I had to ask for butter to come with the toast and received an herb infused butter for my toast. What happened to plain butter and jam or fruit spread of some sort? I wound up not eating most of it and just left with enough fuel to get started on my walk about the city.2. The rooms are incredibly small. I knew this prior to coming as I read a lot of the reviews on here, and it was just myself, so no big deal. If I had a traveling companion, then it would have been a less than optimal experience, practically being on top of one another. Again...just myself, so it wasn't a big deal.3. Rooms were stuffy. I had to open the windows for air flow, and the thermostat wasn't really helpful...probably because the hotel was on heat. 4. Bar area was incredibly packed! All the time. So if you're not there when it opens, forget about it. Next doors hotel had an awesome bar that I wound up going to 1 of the nights I stayed. 5. The doorman, except for the young man that was on duty when I first arrived, weren't very hospitable with the opening and closing of the doors and just the occasional greeting. Eh...again, no big deal to me personally, but if these are things one judges and overall experience on, then, well there ya go!Ok...so the positives:1. Front desk staff was very very nice. I checked in later as my flight was delayed and they welcomed with a smile...easy fast and efficient. AWESOME!2. The doorman who was on duty that night helped me with luggage and was very kind and gave me some ideas as to what to do that evening...very friendly and talkative.3. Room was very clean....it actually exceeded the norm on cleanliness for hotel rooms...seriously it was impressed.4. Room was cute and efficient. ..No frills which was ok with me, and it was quiet (4th floor by the elevator too)!5. Love love love the location of this hotel in proximity to whatever you really wanna see. 6. Heating in this hotel is not an issue and I was extremely happy about that after seeing some reviews of that being an issue at other hotels. All in all...this isn't a bad hotel to stay. Just be sure you know what you're looking for and understand what you'll be paying for. If you're traveling solo..I recommend it. It's not a party hotel ( more of an older crowd)...having a queen superior room is fine...it's a place to rest your head and weary feet!

this was an ideal hotel for my first excursion to New York after being widowed. My husband and I traveled frequently, and I wasn't sure what to expect on my own, but the size, location, rooms and especially the service personnel couldn't have been better. I felt very well taken care of and look forward to a return visit.

I waited for a good listing to try the Iroquois because of all the great ratings/reviews. My Aunt was coming in for the holidays and I booked a double room to treat her. Unfortunately both she and I were really disappointed. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, but the room itself was small, stuffy and really in need of updating. It felt stale and dingy and, while we decided to stay in the city an additional night, I booked a different hotel for a better experience. With all the great boutique options in a 7 block radius (see some of my other reviews), I would not choose this hotel again. My high hopes were not met :-(.
user_name:
Gregory M
Tinton Falls, New Jersey

review_body: ...what to say about the rooms...? We were extremely dissapointed with our assigned 'superior queen' room which we found to be small, dark and uncomfortable. However the check-in staff did everything possible to find us a more comfortable room. Earlier, the reservations staff were very helpful in correcting a reservation error, so our experience of the hotel service was excellent.The location on 49 West 44th Street is great: close the Broadway/Times Square for entertainment, 5th Ave for shopping, mid-town for business, and Grand Central or Penn stations for train transport. Rooms were clean and quiet. Bedding was comfortable and we got good sleeps. Good sized bathroom. Comfortable robes and Molton Brown bath products.Free wifi worked well. : )Overall, a good option if you get the right room, with a great location and great service.

We stayed here during the crazy blizzard in January. Most of the staff stayed on property all weekend to make sure the hotel and restaurant were adequately staffed. All the restaurants on the block closed EXCEPT for Triumph at the Iroquois. Neighboring hotel restaurants closed forcing their guest to venture out in the weather. Great small hotel. Off the main drag but close to everything in Midtown but enough good dining within one block Bill the Concierge was diligent in accommodating shows for our snow related extended stay. Highly recommend.

I got this room on a black Friday special, and was worried that the hotel wouldn't live up to the hype. Not to worry. The room was gorgeous. The staff was super nice. The location was convenient. I would definitely stay here again. The only negative was there was no coffee maker in the room. But fortunately, there was an awesome coffee shop in the same block (and a pot in the lobby).

This was a terrific hotel close to Grand Central, in a great area close to great restaurants and things to doVery clean, welcoming staff, comfortable and attractive room. We will definetly return and recommend this hotel to others spending time in NYC

We do a trip to NYC every year to take in the energy of the city. This year our timing was with the Blizzard of 2016. We always stay at the Iroquois and as always they were first class. Everything they did was to make our trip special.

We discovered this gem a while back and have returned 3 or 4 times since. We love the ease of staying here (location, accessibility to things we do there, service, room and sleep quality). It's all good ... always our first choice in NY hotels!

Booked an executive suite. Beautiful room. The room service was served with a lovely smile and we felt very well looked after. Jacuzzi bath was amazing...didn't want to get out of it. Centrally located... 5 mins walk to Rockefeller or Empire State.Highly recommended

We stayed at the Iroquois this past weekend. We arrived there at about 2:40, understanding that check-in was at 3. We had 2 rooms booked. We were able to get in one at 3:20 and the other at 3:40. Not good. Our room was very small. Our friend, who was alone, had a much bigger room. Not sure why they did it this way. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The doorman was so nice and really fun to talk to. Service in the restaurant was incredible slow. Friday night people in rooms next to us kept us up from 2-3 am slamming doors and yelling in the hall. We called down and were told they would take care of it. Not sure they did. We mentioned it to the desk in the morning and they knew nothing about it. The library needs some new furniture. So, all in all, nice place but it needs some updating and they could be more accommodating upon arrival.

very comfortable room. Bed and sheets very nice.great location for my meetings and transportation to and from Newark airport. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Value very good. I would stay here again.

I have stayed at the Iroquois four times now. I am always happy there. The rooms are clean and quiet and the bathroom is heavily stocked with Molton Brown products. Hotel is in a great location for seeing the sights on the Big Apple.

Myself and my wife stayed at the Iroquois Hotel from the 15th - 19th Dec 2015. After looking long and hard at NYC hotels we chose it and weren't disappointed. It's in an excellent location very central to all the sites etc. Yes the rooms are small and would really benefit from an upgrade but that didn't spoil our stay. Small rooms seem the norm in NYC unless you spend a fortune on a room which tbh you don't spend that long in it if you are there to sight see. The staff were very friendly indeed and nothing was too much bother for them. I'd emailed the hotel a few times leading up to our trip and always got a prompt response.We never ate or drank in the hotel so can't comment on that side of things but I'd recommend stay here and would certainly consider staying here again if ever we go back to NYC.

The staff at the Iroquois Hotel are always very friendly and helpful, no matter the circumstances. The hotel is centrally located for the business I do, and is quiet and comfortable....like being at home.

Fantastically located minutes from Times Square this hotel was a joy to stay in. Great staff, great room, a nice gym and a very nice style. Loved the service and treatment, great value for a central hotel in NYC. Highly recommend this for those staying in New York.
Enjoyed stay, Staff friendly. Room clean with good bathroom and toiletries. Negative was small and no view.This is all I had to write but they insisted I type more characters to meet minimum amount..

I have stayed here a couple of times, and enjoy returning. Like almost all boutique hotels, there are niggles - a soft ticking sound from the heating system, and remarkably basic TV in this case - but to counter that, there is the remarkable staff, small hotel feel and very decent restaurant downstairs. Lanterns Keep is a widely well regarded cocktail lounge, too. The room itself is comfortably appointed, bathroom is up to par and a good night sleep should be expected! The are great hotels in the immediate area, but this one stands out for me.

Very gracious spot in midtown near theatres. Staff is wonderful, rooms are small but very comfortable - did not need much space. Everything you need is there. Location is great to walk to plays. There are great restaurants all around, and coffee in the lobby in the morning.

This is two blocks off Time Square which is a great place to go if you're into tourist overload and electronic bill boards (ok, it's kind of fun). But this hotel is wonderfully located for an overall NYC visit, reasonably priced, and quiet (which means a lot in a town with noisy streets. Airport buses are likely to stop in Bryant Park (five minute walk) or Grand Central (ten minute walk?) so you can save on cab fare. The subway is around the corner. But be advised the further you get from Times Square the more likely you are in encountering more interesting dining.

I stayed for four nights for a business conference. Overall, the Iroquois was very close to being great. The room was a fair size for Manhattan, and the amenities were very nice (Frette sheets/towels and Molton Brown soaps). The room was clean, except for a strong cigarette smell on two evenings (that the staff appeared neither surprised nor concerned, despite non-smoking rooms). Better options for pillows and some improved friendliness of the staff would make this a great option that I would be happy to return to. However, there are many other options which makes it's value for its class dependent upon price.

I had walked by the Iroquois for many years and always thought that it looked like one of the most inviting hotels in NYC. My wife and I finally spent two nights there in December and again last week. Absolutely nothing to complain about. The location is perfect whether you are driving or training. The Staff (Seth and other who I regretfully cannot remember but greatly appreciate) were friendly, subtle, but not overbearing ( a hard thing to balance). Prices are very competitive. Rooms are comfy. It is definitely worth strongly considering the Iroquois versus all other 5 star hotels when looking to stay in Manhattan.

Stayed here for 2 nights and was very satisfied with the accommodations, the friendliness of the staff and the location, which is ideal. I arrived and was assigned a room that had not yet been cleaned, but that was remedied immediately. Bar is nice but VERY small and noisy. Small coffee area/business center/library is comfortable. I will stay here again.

Best hotel we've ever stayed at...and I'm comparing it to similar hotels we've stayed at in NYC, Paris and Rome. Fantastic location (quiet off Times Square but within 2 blocks to Broadway shows), but beyond that was the incomparable staff who made us feel welcome, helped us find an authentic soup/sandwich place for lunch and a wonderful Thai restaurant for dinner; amenities such as morning coffee, afternoon apple cider, turn-down service with chocolates and bathrobes delivered upon check-in made the trip complete. A heartfelt THANK YOU! We shall return.

Attentive staff, excellent concierge with a way for impossible tickets. Comfortable, clean rooms, wonderful beds and linens. Quiet, home feel with access to the best culture, shows, shopping and NYC restaurants. A great place to stay; we will return.

We chose the Iroquois for it's Tripadvisor rating, its location and its membership of SLH. Overall we were very pleased with excellent service being the most notable. Downsides were small room (for a suite) limited storage, and even smaller bathroom.

Choosing The Iroquois for our stay near the theater district was an excellent choice for mywife and I. The staff with whom we interacted were all very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and in good shape. I definetely recommend this hotel!
user_name:
Carlos S
San Pedro Sula, Honduras

review_body: I visit New York several times a year, and the Iroquois is my home away from home. The great location and clean, well-appointed rooms have had me return repeatedly, both for business and with my family for vacation. The staff is always friendly and helpful. This gem of a hotel is intimate and calm, not something you find in larger New York hotels.

The Iroquois is in a central location with the majority of attractions within walking distance. Staff very friendly, free refreshments in reception throughout the day. Boutique style hotel with rooms very quiet by New York standards. Will definitely stay again when return to New york.

I stayed at The Iroquois last weekend and was very pleased with the entire experience. I chose the hotel based on its proximity to the Broadway theaters (we had tickets to Hamilton, which was amazing!), but was pleasantly surprised by the accommodations. Christopher at the front desk checked us in, he did a great job of making us feel welcome and highlighted the amenities of the hotel and asking if we required anything further. Vanessa, the concierge, was personable and super helpful. She gave us some bar recommendations and was eager to address any questions I had. The room itself was clean and well-apportioned. It was a bit small, but from staying at other hotels in Manhattan it seemed pretty standard. The bed was very comfortable (esp. the pillows), and it was quiet.The only drawbacks I had was the lifts were pretty slow and the hotel restaurant did not offer any late-night dining options. The hotel bar looked great, but it closed at midnight (we didn't get back from our show until after 11 PM). Lastly, we turned down our thermostat, but it never really cooled down (it was unseasonably warm however). Overall if I have to stay in Manhattan again I won't hesitate to stay at The Iroquois.

Excellent hotel , great location close to everything ! Check in and check out was a breeze with very nice and helpful staff . I couldn't have been more pleased with my 4 day stay ! You will love it here !

The Iroquois was perfect for a quick NYC stay for myself and my husband. Great staff. Wonderful location, close to all, able to walk everywhere and also easy to access all transportation for further jaunts.

The Iroquois is now my go-to hotel in NYC. My premium king room was a good size with plenty of room in the bathroom. The bed was super comfortable, and the room was prepared to my needs (for severe allergies). Staff was courteous and helpful and truly went the extra mile. I walked to and from the theater and all around mid-town. Buses and subway nearby. Lots of excellent restaurant choices, on the block alone. I highly recommend.

Loved staying here. Location perfect for East or West side. Rooms small and simple but quiet and well-appointed. Bed, pillows,and linens five-star. Molton Brown toiletries perfect,too.Loved The Library room, for morning tea or coffee, and afternoon hot cider. Easy touchscreen to print boarding passes. Best part? Service. Warm, caring, professional. If you want boutique-style small hotel, stay here. The restaurant, Triomphe, is excellent, too. Good service, easy to dine solo, very good cuisine.

The location is amazing. The room was spacious and very quiet. Gregory's coffee bar opposite made the hotels lack of breakfast irrelevant. Highly recommend particularly for single woman. It is very safe.

Excellent location off 5th Avenue, hotel suite exceeded our expectations and would definitely return to this hotel. Highly recommend. Go check it out ! Staff really friendly and lovely bar area to chill out after sightseeing each day.

This property provided a very reasonable rate given it's incredibly popular location.The staff was very helpful, particularly the concierge."The Library" was pretty neat - provided 2 computers with Internet access plus coffee and apple cider all day.While NYC rooms are typically small, this was one of the smallest NYC hotel rooms I've been in. However, the rooms, including the bathroom, were nice, so it didn't bother us tremendously.What I liked best about this hotel was how quiet our room was. Of the multiple nights we stayed, there was only one night I woke up briefly because of noise outside. (If you haven't yet been, there is always noise outside in The City That Never Sleeps.) Pretty much all the time, the room shielded the noise incredibly well.

We had a very enjoyable stay at the Iroquois, the staff were very efficient and helpful in arranging things for us. Especially the concierge. The hotel is within a block and half of Times square so very convenient for the shows.

Nice, traditional New York hotel. Very nice staff, clean, quiet, and neat rooms. Great for short stay business trips to NYC. Not much of view from the windows, but the bathrooms are nice and the towels are large and fluffy. Comfortable beds as well.

My Son and I spent the rest of New Years weekend together at the property. We will make it an annual trip forever. The history of the Hotel was intriguing and the staff was fabulous. location was spot on. Rooms were very clean.We wish we had a few more days, there is so much to see.

This hotel has an old fashioned and elegant style to it. A great location and warm welcoming team who quickly use your name and move fast to help. It was a wrench to leave and we will definitely be back when in New York

Last minute booking via a bundling website at incredibly low price. Expected therefore to receive "back of the bus" treatment. Au contraire! From the moment the doorman welcomed me with a flourish I was treated in a completely first class way. The room was exquisite, an elegant updated journey to The Gilded Age. Delightful. Highly recommend this hotel. (Traveling as a single woman, felt very safe.)

This boutique hotel is in a great location with helpful and friendly staff. Anything you need, just ask the front desk or the Concierge. They handle transportation and can help with last minute restaurant details or suggestions. We had two rooms and the staff went out of their way to make sure we were on the same floor and everything was smooth and relaxing.

This was our third stay at the Iroquois in the past two years. It really just feels like home. The staff are incredibly helpful and warm. We like to walk around the city, so the location is very convenient for midtown restaurants/bars/parks yet close enough to the Subway stops to easily travel beyond midtown to venture into other parts of Manhattan. The bed is comfortable, the bathroom is fine and the closet is convenient. This time, we were delighted that an air conditioner unit had been added to the room. It really made our stay much better than before, especially given the unseasonably warm temperatures this December. We had a couple little hiccups but I was extremely impressed with the efficient manner in which employees handled the issues. I am sure other hotels have more modern rooms and amenities, but we just can't imagine staying anywhere else when we travel to New York. The Iroquois just feels like home!

Great for a fun week of exploring and coming back to an amazing room and service. Reliable and grade A customer service. I will be returning and continuing to use this hotel whenever I am in New York again
user_name:
Nick L
Sunnyvale, California, United States

review_body: Great hotel in convenient location, super friendly staff, great room design, comfortable beds, it was a very nice experience. Concierges Bill & Vanessa were so helpful and knowledgeable. Highly recommended hotel.

I stayed in this hotel with my two friends for a week over Thanksgiving and it's definitely been one of the best hotels I've stayed in whilst in the city. I had emailed the hotel before arrival to arrange some packages to be delivered before we arrived and they stored them for me and then brought them up to our room when we asked for them. My absolute favourite memory of this hotel was being brought up to our room, opening the door, and they had the radio playing on a christmas channel. Such a nice moment to walk in to! The room itself is quite small, as per most hotels in New York, so it was a bit of a squeeze for 3 people who like to do a lot of shopping, but we managed just fine! We had two double beds which were super comfortable and I would love to have taken the pillows and duvet home with me. The room was cleaned every day and fresh towels left. There was also turn down service every night were a little card was left on the bed to inform of the weather the next day, and also some chocolates left. There was also a paper left on the back of the door every morning, although we didn't really use this. There was free coffee every morning in the lobby, and then hot apple cider in the evening, which I loved. On Thanksgiving day they had apple cider donuts (which unfortunately we missed out on) and also hot chocolate with marshmallows, as well as the hot apple cider. We literally stepped out the door on Thanksgiving day and the parade was going across the top of the street so we were able to stand there with the rest of the crowd and see the balloons go back. We stood there for an hour and the went back and watched the rest in the hotel room. The location is great. Its about a 10 minute walk at the most to Times Square if you want to go there, and there is a subway stop right around the corner that will get you everywhere else. There is also a Duane Reade at the top of the street which is 24 hour so that you can get anything else that you need. We ordered some food to the hotel one night as well which the hotel were completely fine with. The staff were so lovely and helpful with anything that we needed and there was always someone there no matter what time of the night it was. I'll be back in the states at the same time this year and will definitely be looking to hopefully stay here again!

This hotel is centrally located, always clean and the staff is super nice! We love this hotel and the people and we make this our "go to" place when visiting New York! Close enough to walk to most subway lines makes this place ideal.

Oh how I adore this hotel and the people who work here. I called this trip my sacred & profane pre-Christmas weekend (Messiah & Mormon). For a woman traveling alone, the Iroquois provided a safe, cozy basecamp for lots of happy walking to the following desitinations: Birdland on 44th on Friday night (1940's style supper club with great live jazz, cocktails & a well-lighted slightly-tipsy return on foot at 10:30 PM no hassles); Handel's Messiah at Lincoln Center on Saturday night The Book of Mormon (lmao for 90 min straight) at the Eugene O'Neill Theater on 49th - then treated myself to street vendor falafel near Times Square on the walk back on Sunday night; next day over to Rockefeller Center to see the Christmas tree and Salvation Army dance teams on my way to the Museum of Modern Art (thank God I joined MoMA online before my trip!!!!). Also on this trip: 15 minutes walk to the Hell's Kitchen Flea Market on 39th between 9th & 10th (crazy selection - I bought a slim volume of Ralph Waldo Emerson's essay, "Self Reliance" and a Tibetan devotional hanging). From there to Macy's on 34th/Herald Square. On my way back to The Iroquois stopped by Bryant Park skating rink & holiday festivities and bought the cutest hat at a kiosk. Walked to The Frick Collection at 70th & Central Park (still breathless at the unexpected close encounters with masterpieces and Gilt Age opulence). So happy on this trip I discovered Uncle Paul's Pizza on Madison & 46th - most delicious veggie slice and a great bottle of red to go! (a bottle of wine to go is a big deal for a Southerner). On my last day I walked to Oasis Spa on 1 Park Ave for rejuvenating Swedish massage. HIGHLY RECOMMEND: DIAL 7 car service for to- and from-airport (and cross-town) sedan service. The dispatchers can try your patience but it's worth it - the drivers are sweetly reliable, kind, and wonderfully friendly & professional. The Iroquois Hotel stands at the warm center of another totally enjoyable NYC visit. I sure had myself a time. Next trip: points south (Greenwich & FiDi) ... definitely more MoMA .... another slice from Uncle Paul's ...

Quaint and lovely. Detail oriented. Chocolates on the pillows, the little weather card for the next day on the night stand, a bottle of Pinot and a larger box of chocolates by the television. The towels and sheets were of a very high quality. The room size was good. The hotel staff friendly and helpful. I'd stay here again. Very good value.

The location of the hotel is perfect, but that is not the best part, From the moment my family and I arrived we felt welcomed and important! The staff was so kind and helpful! The room was clean and cozy and the beds were a delight! I highly recommend this hotel to all that come to NYC!

Had a great stay at the Iroquois, room was beautiful and well appointed.We even took advantage of the complimentary walking tour with Streetwise - Dan who was great, really enjoyed this personal attention!Would highly recommend this hotel!

We visited the Iroquois in July and instantly felt welcomed the from moment we walked in. From the doormen to the attendants and desk staff, we really sensed that they were awaiting our arrival and were genuinely excited about it. Our room was clean, comfortable, and relaxing, especially after 20 mile hikes around the city during 100 degree weather. The place is also pretty much in the center of Manhattan, so you really can't go wrong with the location. On the last morning we were there, we decided to dine at the restaurant which adjoins the hotel, "Triomphe." All I can say is that I wish we had eaten there sooner because I would have made it a point to eat there every morning and I'm not even a big proponent of breakfast. Pancakes are pretty generic, but I think these were sent from pancake heaven. They were really that good. I mean, they could win awards. And I'm not even exaggerating. Back to the hotel. At times, it felt like we were some of the only people staying there, which was a plus because you seemed to lose the bustle of the city while there - sort of like a refuge. I say that, too, because, while in our room, we couldn't even tell if there were any others in the surrounding rooms. One warning though, their "black out" shades made us sleep almost too well! I'm continuously planning our next trip to NYC in my head and would be delighted to stay at the Iroquois again. Job well done in all you do and all the best in 2016.

Excellent service, quit rooms, great location close to the theaters, shops and great restaurants, excellent concierge services, all people are friendly and helpful, fast reaction, we will always stay in the Iroquois Hotel when we are in New York

a brilliant hotel, hidden gem, classy, cosy, and absolutely a joy to have stayed in. I would go back again, location, staff, convenience, great staff... all throughout is a great experience. I already recommended the hotel to friends. The room is very pretty and the decor and furniture is absolute class.

We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and the location was perfect, we were able to easily reach the sites we wanted to visit and really felt the energetic "vibe" of NYC. All the staff were warm, kind and assisted us swiftly and efficiently throughout the stay. Our room was beautiful and everything we needed was easily accessible, I have nothing bad to say about this hotel because of the wonderful people and the beauty. Our family most certainly recommend this Hotel based on our memorable experience!!! Epic hotel which we will visit again.

Great location near times square and good friendly service from the staff. Although it was December the room was very warm and there is no indervidual room thermostat for the a/c,so somewhat uncomfortable for sleeping, room's are small but bed is comfy. Noise is a little bit of a problem as you can hear all the adjoining rooms.

A great week in New York City for Christmas. The Iroquois was recommended by friends so I decided to give it a try. Conveniently located, we walked to Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, New York Public Library, Macy's, Empire State Building, and all the shopping we desired. Room service was prompt and the food always good. There are several restaurants nearby if you wish to dine out. Red Flame Diner just a few steps away is great for breakfast and late night casual food. The rooms are big enough and the bed was quite comfortable which offered great sleep quality. Very nice bathrooms with Molton Brown toiletries. The rooms are very nicely maintained. Bill, at the concierge desk, was very helpful with dining reservations. The doorman was always present and courteous, A quaint lobby with hot cider or coffee available most of the day. I look forward to another stay at The Iroquois.

Great location, very nice hotel with super comfortable beds. The free guest computers and coffee and tea in the library were a real bonus. Lovely place. I would not hesitate to recommend. The towels and robes are fantastic.

Great little hotel, clean and well run with friendly staff and close to the theaters. They also have some excellent restaurants right there as well. Easy walk to or from Grand Central and I found the parking garage across the street easy to park at and well lit. The hotel rooms are smaller (as are most NYC Hotel rooms ). I would stay here again.

spent 3 nights the week before thanksgiving with my daughter for some Xmas shopping and sightseeing, location is excellent for all the sights, shopping and broadway shows. Its a small but nice and friendly hotel and gives some respite and a relaxed atmosphere away from the hustle and bustle outside. Staff are great and attentive. Vanessa was our concierge and sourced theatre tickets at 1 days notice with fair booking fees. Would recommend and would come back here should i visit NY again. Im not too fussy with my hotels...location, price, a decent bed and a clean bathroom keep me happy and they satisfied all these requirements....and the wifi is free.

We spent 3 nights here the week before Christmas. We paid around $450 a night. We had a one bedroom suite. My son slept on the fold out couch and usually the couches are very uncomfortable but this had a memory foam mattress on it and was very comfortable. We loved the location on 44th. We were very close to Times Square and Rockefeller center. One of the restaurants we had made reservations at was right down the street. We did not eat at the restaurant or order room service but the menu looked very good. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

I stayed for 4 nights, had a fantastic stay. The location is great being so close to many interesting things. Being a luxury hotel the staff definitely made me feel welcome and important. I will be back.
user_name:
cchan_360949
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I've been coming back for 15 years to the attentive service, friendly ambiance and perfect size of this comfortable boutique lodging in a great location in the center of all things mid-town. They feel me.

We stayed at this hotel 4nights for my partners 40th birthday in december. We absolutely loved it!!! Its a great little hotel and the staff are incredibly welcoming, friendly and helpul, especially the front desk staff and the concierge Bill that goes out of his way to book anything you like on your visit. We stayed in a deluxe room and thought it was a very good size( in new york rooms tend to be small) with lovely molton brown amenities and chocolates on the pillows every night.When we arrived at our room the 1st evening there was a birthday card, some strawberries, chocolates and a bottle of wine there for my partner complimentary to say happy birthday.....so unexpected and a lovely touch!!!The location couldnt be better, 2 blocks away from timesquare, fith avenue, grand central....you can walk everywhere and so many great restaurants nearby.I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody visiting manhattan,you wont regret it.

What a lovely hotel. Yes, it's not flashy and the rooms are small and decor unremarkable but it more than makes up for this with its comfort and location and warm and friendly staff. Although small (and our room was quite dark and might have benefitted from an extra ceiling light) the rooms are very, very comfortable and amazingly quiet. At night, it was hard to believe we were in the heart of midtown Manhattan because (even with the window open) the rooms were so quiet. By day, the location was just unbeatable. The diner just down the street (towards. 6th Ave) was great for breakfast and we also had some lovely food at the Ostieria al Doge, recommended by the front of house staff. I'd definitely stay here again!

The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The room was a good size and the amenities were great. Chocolate in the room and bathrobes were an excellent touch. I would definitely stay at the Iroquois again!

I have been staying at the Iroquois New York Hotel for a few days every month for the past two years. The room, service, food, amenities, anything you need, are excellent. The staff goes out of their way to accommodate my needs, and I think they're stellar! I highly recommend this hotel!

This hotel is older and the elevators are slow BUT the staff are great and the bed/shower are perfect, which are the most important aspect of any stay. Rooms are spacious for NYC, and it's conveniently located.

With all of the hotel choices available in New York City, this small, historic, boutique Iroquois stands out because of its superior customer service. The amazing Vanessa is the Chief Concierge, and she is truly the heart and soul of the hotel. I was in New York for a reunion and birthday celebration with three friends from England. Vanessa helped me plan all of our theatre engagements, tours, and dinner reservations months in advance, and was involved in coordinating every aspect of our 4-day visit so that we could maximize our relatively short time together in the city. Upon arrival at the hotel, Vanessa greeted me with a warm, welcoming embrace as we had become good friends via email over the months. I didn't feel like a traveler, but a true "guest."
