In honor of our birthdays, the hotel had cards and gifts waiting for us in our rooms, and as an added treat, was kind enough to upgrade my room to an executive suite. It was awesome, and we were all so appreciative of the thoughtfulness of the staff. The hotel is conveniently situated near everything we wanted to do and see: Broadway shows, Rockettes!, 5th Avenue shopping, Rockefeller Center, city tours, fabulous restaurants. All of the hotel staff was courteous, helpful, and efficient -- even though it was often very busy in the lobby with check-ins and holiday parties in the restaurants, etc. -- we were always treated like VIPs! In addition to Vanessa, I must also mention the wonderful, Seth -- who was our go-to man for so many things: greeting us in the lobby, getting us in and out of taxis, taking our bags to the rooms, advising us on local news and events. He was a bright spot for us, and we looked forward to seeing him every day. I travel fairly frequently for work and fun, and usually always stay at the big chain hotels where I have memberships and reward programs. I'd originally planned this New York trip at one of the big Marriott hotels, and changed it to the Iroquois at the request of my British friends who'd heard good reviews about it. Who knows -- the Marriott might have been excellent....but I will surely never forget our stay at the Iroquois. It was a beautiful and memorable trip for all of us.

My mom and I stayed 4 days in New York. Apart from the amazing location 250 m from Times Square, the hotel staff went continuously the extra mile to make our stay special. The hotel is a great contrast to the modern parts of New York reflecting the history in a maintained way. We were spoilt with excellent food, room service and the hotel continuously goes the extra mile.
user_name:
Christine P
Greater Johannesburg, South Africa

review_body: The best thing about the Iroquois is it's convenient location to the theater district and mid 5th Ave. the rooms are small (standard for NYC), clean and quiet. The staff is friendly and helpful. Try to get on the upper floors to avoid the traffic noise. The shower could use a boost.

We were so pleased when we arrived at the Iroquois – the location is excellent, the hotel is lovely, the staff very friendly, and the room was spotless. Everyone was very service-oriented and couldn’t do enough for us. I have to call special attention, though, to Vanessa the Concierge. She went total above and beyond her duties when she was able to help us apply and acquire a visa from a nearby consulate for an upcoming international trip. We have asked concierges for help in the past, but have never had such a pleasant experience. In addition to being a wonderful hotel, they are blessed to have incredible staff.

The Iroquois is a fairly old-fashioned New York hotel, and for the price is pretty good. The decor can look a little dated, but the hotel is clean and well appointed. Noise levels can be pretty high from the street, but you don't hear other guests.Downsides: No coffee-making facilities in the room, although there is a communal tea/coffee area downstairs off the lobby (tea isn't great if you're a Brit though, and some days there's no milk, only cream); air con can't be controlled - our room was chilly, but two other members of our party staying on the same floor had the hottest room imaginable. No views.Upsides: Great location, a short walk from Broadway and Bryant Park. Nice little cocktail bar (the Lantern), although you often have to book because it's small and really busy. Comfortable little lounge area downstairs. DVD player in rooms, with a decent selection of discs to borrow. Staff will bring you a mini fridge upon request. Very good complimentary shoe shine service. Free wi fi.Best part of the stay was the staff. Everyone from the maids and bell men to desk staff and concierge was always so friendly and willing to fulfill requests, any time of the day or night. Professional and always smiling!I'd say the hotel itself gets 3 stars, but they get an extra star for the great service.

Asked for a nice view, it was of public flats. Location great, rooms nice, not cleaned daily and one toilet roll offered for 3 nights. Had to ask staff for ice 3 times before it came, 40 mins later. Expensive for the quality.

I grew up near NYC so i had never really had to stay in the city overnight before and definitely never had the treat of staying in a midtown hotel. From when we arrived the front desk staff was very personable and thoughtful. They recognized us throughout the stay and said hello by name which was impressive. The room is small because, hey... you're in midtown manhattan, but elegant throughout every inch of it. It was chilly when we stayed here and the hotel had put out hot apple cider for guests instead of the standard boring and old coffee you get at other hotels. Also had a chance to eat breakfast in the restaurant's hotel which was delicious. The staff was attentive here as well and even though the restaurant was busy and it got a little hectic they were very focused on making sure we were pleased.
user_name:
ctro
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Iroquois is an oasis of calm from the hustle and bustle of busy Newyork City. Only a short walk to Time Square yet very quiet and relaxing. The staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble making our stay even more memorable. A nice touch was complimentary morning coffee and afternoon mulled cider in the lobby.

A true treasure in Midtown! The hotel is a wonderful small, boutique hotel with great ambiance and staff.!The Triomphe restaurant is a joy for foodies - Chef Florian Wehrli is wonderful and his Epicurean menu with wine pairings was fantastic.The Iroquois has been my "home away from home" for the past 17 years when I visit NYC and will continue to be so - it just gets better and better!

I stayed one night at the Iroquois Hotel in midtown Manhattan. The location is great, just a short walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, 5th Avenue shopping & Bryant Park as well as the Empire State Building and the south end of Central Park. The hotel itself is small, a boutique hotel, but doesn't feel it being sandwiched into all the buildings in midtown Manhattan. The room was standard. Clean and updated, but nothing special. It was on the smaller end, but it wasn't our intention to be there long. The bathroom window seemed to let sound in a bit more than the rest of the room, but didn't make a huge difference to us. Free Wifi is nice. Overall, an enjoyable stay at a great location.

I had the the most magical stay at the Iroquois Hotel in NY the WE of Dec 5th. From the moment we stepped into lobby they knew me by name. It was a warm boutique hotel in the heart of NY. The rooms were so clean and beds so comfortable. Alex the manager made the stay so memorable. This is going to be my go to Hotel whenever I come to NY. The tour on Sun morning by Sonya was terrific. My compliments for making us feel so special and welcome..

This is our Hotel of choice when we visit NYC. We love the quaintness of the Iroquois, with a courteous and efficient staff. The amenities are very acceptable for such a smaller, older Hotel. It's in the middle of everything that we want in the Theater District, great restaurants, shopping and proximity to the Theaters. Highly recommend.

Stayed for 5 nights with my (22 year old) son for our visit to New York. I was a bit nervous as had been told rooms were a bit small but perfectly big enough for two good sized beds and space to chill. Bathroom was small but adequate, perfectly clean and the Moulton Brown toiletries a lovely luxury as were the nightly chocolate and turn down service. The location could not have been more perfect and the staff (especially Mallory on reception) fabulously helpful at planning our days! The cocktail bar is well worth a visit and a great environment for a relaxed drink. The only criticism I had was that on our last day we were not leaving until 6pm and when we returned to the hotel about 2 and asked if there was a courtesy room available we were told it would be $150 !! Surely we could have been given a room to freshen up and rest in for a couple of hours? As I said though apart from that an amazing hotel, lovely staff, perfect location and I would highly recommend.

Gold colored fixtures in the bathroom does not make this a luxury hotel. Even for New York the rooms are small. The lobby is small and the elevators should be placed together not separate. There are similarly priced hotels in this block that are a better value.

The Iroquois shows much better on its website. Though the linens and bed were quite nice, the hotel needs a refresher in the lobby and the bathrooms need a makeover to include counters and storage (I hate little glass shelves above the toilet and a pedestal sink). The room is very small, and the one we had was noisy above 44th street, the blinds don't block out all light, and the temperature cannot be controlled from the room, so we were always HOT while sleeping--trying to sleep. At $550/night, we expected more. The bar downstairs in the back was always closed. Just not the experience we were expecting to have.

Accommodation not quite up to scratch and issues with room service. Otherwise pretty good considering its NYC. But considering I was staying in a suite it was not as good as it should have been. But it's still a good hotel.

Hotel is nice but the rooms are tiny...elevators are old and slow.....There is no coffee in the rooms, at 5 am someone started banging on the elevator door trying to fix it right outside the room. Near times square so shopping/dining is good.

The staff was very helpful and accommodating and set the bar high for my nephew's first visit to the Big Apple. It's a high end boutique, luxury hotel that offers many amenities. The hotel is located close to many attractions and within walking distance to Times Square. The food at Triomphe was superb and provided an excellent breakfast experience. It was the perfect vacation!

I cannot say enough about this hotel and everything that came with it. The concierges were phenomenal! Vanessa was a huge help and her recommendations were wonderful. Rocky was one of the first people we met when we arrived and he welcomed us with excitement and a smile! This hotel is in a wonderful location, for our first "girls" trip to NYC we couldn't have chosen a better place to stay! We would definitely stay here again. The staff were so accomodating with everything we asked for such as a box fan, mini fridge, extra wine glasses, and anything else we needed. Yes the closet is small and the shower is a little cramped, but we didn't mind at all! Loved this place so much! We will be returning!!!!

What a great hotel - ideally situated for all the fun and amenities of Midtown Manhattan, very comfortable in all aspects and with excellent levels of service at all times. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which had all the space we could ever need and it was beautifully clean and well serviced at all times. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and if in New York again, would definitely stay here!

We arrived at the Iroquois and were immediately greeted by a friendly bellman, Seth, who lifted our luggage up the front steps and opened the door to the lobby. Kia, checked us in with a smile and an offer of hot cider. Our room was beautifully furnished and quiet. The bedding was clean and soft and the mattress perfect. The dresser had full length drawers for unpacking our suitcases and there was a large closet with a full length mirror.  The bathroom had a pedestal sink with a shelf above to hold toiletries and there was a deep shelf at the window to hold more personal items. Thick towels and a magnifying mirror were another nice touch. The concierge, Vanessa, was a lifesaver! We told her want we wanted see and do, and she got the tickets, made the reservations and gave us a detailed time line and directions. The location is great. We were able to walk to Time Square, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center and to the shops on Park Ave. (And I wore heels!) We didn't navigate the subways, but they were close by. We took a cab to the 911 memorial and then rode the Greyline hop on hop off tour. Our highlights of the trip were the 911 memorial, The Rockette's, Broadway show "Kinky Boots" Wayne Brady is absolutely amazing! Bloomingdales shopping was the perfect place for all our Christmas shopping--I love that store. The cupcakes at Magnolia bakery are pure sugar heaven! We celebrated our 35th wedding anniversary with a dinner at Esca, an Italian seafood restaurant in Midtown (within walking distance of the Iroquois) The Burrata with caviar is delicious. Best lunch was at Ed's Lobster Bar -the lobster roll is outstanding and the atmosphere is sophisticated casual! We can't wait to come back to New York and will return to the Iroquois!

Can't believe that the hotel I had read such glowing reviews about was so bad. Hot rooms, dresser w drawers that wouldn't stay closed. No real lobby to speak of. Uninspiring room decor. At over $650 per night, you can understand how I feel.

The Iroquois is perfectly located in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, one block away from 5th Avenue and a short walk away from Times Square, the Rockefeller Center, the Library and Central Park.The hotel is rather small, cozy and the ambience is quite luxurious. Our room was relatively big for a Manhattan hotel and surprisingly calm taking the central location into consideration.If you are looking for a reasonably prized Boutique Hotel in a perfect location...the Iroquois is just perfect.

The Iroquois (named after the Confederacy of six Native American tribes) is a pleasant hotel with friendly staff, good service and with excellent access to 5th Avenue, Madison Avenue, Theatre land (Times Square) etc. It is also a member of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World (SLH.com). The hotel rooms are not large but they are comfortable. My room was not well cleaned however with layers of dust on the telephone and table lamp. There is a small but charming sitting out library on the ground floor, a cocktail bar and a nice restaurant although with a not particularly exciting décor. The restaurant is labelled by SLH as famous but having sampled dinner and breakfast I would call it good but not outstanding. All in all I would recommend this hotel more for its location than its luxury. At $400/night during weekends rising to $600/night in the week (without room tax) it does not sit among the purse-friendly family hotels and I am not sure it warrants the rate, elevated perhaps by its SLH membership.

We had a wonderful stay once again at the Iroquois Hotel over Thanksgiving. The room was perfect as it always is and the staff was more than helpful on multiple occasions! I currently have multiple outstanding reservations for the coming months!

Iroquois staff was great. Concierge was amazingly helpful. Vanessa was so helpful!! Fabulous location. Would definitely recommend and plan to stay here again when I return. Rooms were nice and hotel has lots of character.

wonderful location and very helpful concierge coffee in the morning and cider in the afternoon were a nice touch  computer check in service was appreciated  I can't seem to submit this survey without writing more words, and this is really all that I have to say at this time. Our second time to stay at this hotel and look forward to returning at another time.

This was our second time staying at the Iroquois and we will be back. Everyone was pleasant and helpful, including to our visitor who was not staying at the Iroquois. I look forward to a return visit.

This hotel is small but comfy and the staff is top notch. The beds were great and so were the pillows, linens and bathrobes. The bathroom was nice but quite small and the shower water pressure seemed to wax and wane depending on what other guests water demands were at the same time. There was an in room safe and a small closet accessible by 2 opposite doors in our room. There is no in room coffee maker but there is coffee and tea in the lobby or library in the morning that is both hot and complimentary. We had a view of a firescape and the building across the street from our room so can't comment on whether there is a view from any other room, but it doesn't matter really unless you are spending a lot of time in your room. Location is midtown on 44th between 5th and 6th avenues so it is convenient to, but not in, Times Square. St. Patrick's Cathedral isn't far away and there are shops, restaurants and theatres within easy walking distance. Good location. Overall a small, nice and convenient little hotel.

We stayed at the Iroquois to be able to watch the Thanksgiving Parade. It was close to the main route and we had an excellent view as the parade went down 6th Avenue. I just love this little hotel in the heart of New York City!

Stayed at The Iroquios for my 50th birthday trip to NYC.It is in an ideal spot to get around midtown and as only 2 blocks from times sq and the subway you can get to all parts of New York in minutes!It is not funky or trendy, equally it's not the Waldoff but it has its own sense of identity and is supported by some of the most helpful staff I have ever meet - nothing was too much trouble even when we came back with a cheesecake and couldn't eat it all, the next thing is I have a fridge sent to my room!We stopped in a suite and it was fab - loads of space and the best bed ever.I would recommend anyone to stop here, it's not the cheapest but far from the most expensive hotel in NY either.

We loved our stay at the Iroquois. The location was so convenient to so many sights. An easy walk to Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue and St. Pat's. It was surprisingly quiet! It was a great respite to walk into a calm, quiet, cozy, serene lobby after the craziness and sensory overload of Times Square. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We truly enjoyed it. A lovely, small boutique hotel. Our room was small, though - so be sure to check what type/size of room you are reserving so you know what to expect.

It's very convenient to mid town for meetings and shopping alike. The rooms at the back are very quiet. It's quite old fashioned but comfortable. Most rooms have centralised temperature control but we were able to have one with independent air con, as even in November we found the room too hot. They have a small gym which is seldom busy and has the right equipment for a workout when travelling. The standard rooms are small but have what needed, including a mini bar and bathtub. There's a restaurant downstairs which serves breakfast a la carte, no buffet, and dinner. Team and coffee are provided in the library until midday, and a hot (apple?) drink during the day. The staff is very courteous, in particular housekeeping is very flexible with servicing the room even after midday.

Excellent location, spotless rooms but on the small size( expected for NY), very comfy beds, very good breakfast, valet parking, walking distance main tourist attractions except financial district/9-11 memorial. Perfect spot to stay for a few days with family

I had 6 nights at the Iroquois hotel while in NYC for work. The location is great. The room was small but had all the necessary amenities (except for a comfy chair to sit in and read). The bed was exceptionally comfortable, lovely toiletries in the bathroom, plenty of towels at all times and while I don't really need to have the bed turned down, I did like the chocolates that came with that service. The staff were pleasant and helpful. I didn't eat in the hotel and I didn't use the other facilities (fitness centre etc) so can't comment on that. The wifi was a bit erratic!

Just home after a fabulous 5 days in NYC.On entering the warm and welcoming lobby, you felt very welcome.Mallory the receptionist was great. Polite, efficient, jovial. She gave us all the information we needed and pointed us in the direction of our room. We had booked their Superior Double which was exactly how it was depicted on their website. 2 double beds, safe, hairdryer, wonderful bathroom with Molton Brown goodies.We had a NY Times left on our door handle each morning and a turndown service with chocolates each evening. The bed, bedding and pillows are of a very high quality, meaning a had a great nights sleep every night.Every member of staff were fabulous but a special mention to Bill (for putting up with my endless requests & questions!!!) He went above and beyond and it was a pleasure to have met him.Complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning and free spiced warm cider in the afternoons. (greatly appreciated in a cold Novembers day)Lantern's Keep, situated at the rear of the hotel is their cocktail bar with very experienced mixologists! Fabulous!!!!We flew into Newark and took the train to Penn Station only 12 blocks away and walked. Great way to get your bearings.Book this hotel now, look no further!

We loved staying at The Iroquois. The staff at check in was excellent. The hot cider served all day was a nice touch. My husband put some brandy in his for our short walk to Times Square:) small rooms as expected but clean and tidy. Walked all over but also near subway station

My husband and I recently spent three nights at the Iroquois Hotel in mid-town New York.We returned to this hotel because we had a good experience last year. The Iroquois is a small-boutique type hotel conveniently located on 44th Street between Times Square and Fifth Avenue shopping. My husband worked for part of the trip in his near-by regional office. We enjoyed being able to walk to great restaurants, to the theater and after dinner entertainment and shopping along Fifth Avenue. The hotel staff was friendly, helpful and respectful of our time and schedule. We loved our nicely appointed traditional and spacious room. At the end of a busy day in Manhattan, the Iroquois was an inviting place to return to for a good nights sleep...a home away from home for three days.

Stayed here for a week while on a business trip. No complaints. Room size was adequate, bed comfortable. Great location in midtown, makes it very convenient to walk to restaurants in the evening. Will definitely return.

The Iroquois is a lovely hotel. Old world charm with modern amenities. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was exceptional with helping my family navigate our first trip to NYC. Seth, the doorman was an awesome source of information and we greatly appreciated his kindness and patience. I would also like to note the great location of the hotel. Very close to to many points of interest.

We absolutely loved this hotel, staff were all really helpful and friendly, rooms were comfortable, well furnished with lovely bathrooms and the internet connection was great.The hotel is ideally placed, right next to Times Sq and the Subway.We'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York!
user_name:
Ellendenise91
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We love the location of the hotel. Comfortable and efficient with touches of elegance. Enjoyed particularly the lobby flowers, the courteous staff, and the morning coffee and evening cider. The room was smallish and fairly ordinary, but bed and linens were very nice. We have stayed here before, and, quite probably, will stay again. Recommend the fine restaurant!

I stayed at this property 4 years ago and loved the location so I returned for another stay...but it really is looking rather rundown and is need of a facelift. I will not stay here again until it has been revitalized which I hope is soon. Considering that my bill was for $348.00 I expected better.

To sum up our 5 day stay.......Friendly efficient staff from front desk to doormen to concierge to housekeeping.....outstanding!!!!! The location of the hotel is amazing and I would have no hesitation in recommending it.

We've stayed at the same hotel about five times and each time the hotel has been clean, quiet and the service, impeccable. The location if fantastic because you're near the middle of the city close to Broadway and any of the major shopping deprtments are all within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

We thoroughly enjoyed ou four-night stay at the Iroquois. The location near Times Square ,the friendly staff and the newly-decorated room made our visit perfect.  We will return to New York City and the Iroquois in the future.

I almost hate to tell people that we love this hotel. It is the best kept secret in NYC. We usually get a suite and really enjoy the homy atmosphere. The location couldn't be better. The rates are very reasonable and service is good.

We stayed here for 3 days while in New York.It is in a very good position for Times Square and all the theatres. There are restaurants all around it so no problem finding somewhere to eat.The rooms were a little on the small side especially when you have two large suitcases.We found the prices in the bar and restaurant a bit high so didn't eat or drink here. They have a small cocktail bar which was popular but again expensive.The staff and the service were excellent as you come to expect in America.

My husband and I just returned from New York and we stayed at the Iroquois for 4 nights. We had a wonderful experience. The staff was very friendly, our rooms were cleaned promptly each morning, and the ambiance overall was amazing. My only complaint is how thin the walls are. I could hear every single word any person said on our floor while they were in the hallway. It woke me up every morning. While I realize that there isn't much the hotel can do about this - it still is a part of the experience. Other than this, I highly recommend this beautiful hotel.

Hotel is centrally located and perfect for visiting NYC. Room are on the small side but quite comfortable. Check-in and check-out extremely convenient. Staff very responsive and professional. Will definitely stay here again!

Had a good experience and location is very convenient. Contrary to other hotels, the Iroquois offers good value for money, quiet rooms and good quality bathrooms - particularly in view of the room charge!

We stayed at the iroquois hotel in october we found the staff helpfull and the hotel in a great location.The rooms were clean and a good size,the concierge helped us with our luggage as the street was closed the day we checked out .The hotel restaurant was a little pricy for us so we found a great little diner the red flame about three doors down.Meals are basic but only $12 to $16 and you will struggle to eat them. .We would stay here again ,the price was good .

Great central position, close to theatres, shops and Time Square (10 minute easy walk) and Bryant Park. Very friendly staff, rooms spotlessly clean. Great cocktail bar too. Will definitely return again.

We were looking for a good four star hotel for our visit to NYC in November 2015. After a lot of looking we settled on the Iroquois. It had good reviews, was in a good location in midtown near to Times Square. First impressions were good, we received a warm welcome and although we couln't check in, as we arrived at 0930 AM, they stored our cases, offered us facilities to freshen up, gave us maps and directions to all local attractions, told us who would be on later when we returned and really looked after us. The receptionist was from London and sorry I can't remember her name but she was great. We returned at about 9PM and again had a good and friendly reception. Our Porter, JJ, was great. He showed us all aspects of the room, how to use the shower, the TV etc. When we booked the hotel, I had indicated that it was our 20th wedding anniversary and they had supplied chocolates, strawberries and wine so that was a really nice touch. The room itself was nice, not overly big but everything you would want. A king sized bed, which was extremely comfortable, we had no problem sleeping. Although fairly close to Times Square, there wasn't any noise. The toiletries in the bathroom were Molton Brown, which my wife informed me were of a very good quality and with nice bathrobes supplied too, she was more than happy.Our two sons had their own room, both had a double bed each.We were in NYC for 4 days, 3 nights and had a very busy schedule so we didn't really make use of the facilities there. The bar was always busy and lively and the dining room looked nice. There are also gym facilities there too. We didn't realize the history behind the hotel before we arrived but found out that James Dean had an apartment at the hotel for 2 years in the 50s.We would definitely recommend the hotel for your visit to NYC. Friendly staff, good service and good location. Nice Irish Bar just down the road called O'Donoghues too.Oh yes just one final thing, thanks to all staff for my daily morning visit to them to enquire about how to get the various attractions we were visiting that day. They gave us the subway details, how to get there, where to change etc. After several visits to NYC I still can't understand how the Subway works, why can't it be as easy as London's?

We stayed over two weekends and were very pleased with the hotel, like all New York hotels theroom was smaller than we would have liked but it was well furnished and big enough to meet our needs. we found the door staff particularly helpfull both with the luggage and valet parking the car. we only had continental breakfast in the hotel, it was excellent and served which is so much nicer than a buffet. We would have no hesitation in recommending The Iroquoise. It is superbly located for all the downtown sites of Manhattan and just around the corner from Bryant Park subway.

The Iroquois is convenient to everything....Broadway shows, Fifth Avenue, great museums, public transportation. It is the perfect anchor spot for everything NY. Though the building and rooms are a bit small, the hotel has done a great job of keeping it all clean and comfortable. The staff felt truly engaged and not corporatized to recite some silly scrip. Check in was a breeze, as was check out.If you want to be in a busy sea of people in some high-rise hotel, this isn't the place for you. If you prefer to feel like you are a guest in a private library, the Iroquois will work for you.

Very nice hotel with quality amenities, staff very accommodating, nicely appointed room, Complimentary breakfast a real plus with fresh squeezed orange juice, perfect location near theatre district , will certainly stay here again.

We loved this hotel for our 1st trip to NY and would definitely stay here again. It was central to everything with less hustle and bustle, there was some noise but it did not disturb our sleep. Beds were comfortable and rooms a decent size, however we thought the closet space could be better designed as it seemed to be a bit of unusable space. Staff were very helpful and we loved the free drinks in the lobby. We asked for a fridge, thinking they would take away the minibar, but they brought us a small fridge for our drinks and snacks. There is a Duane reades around the corner for anything that you need. We could also check in for our flight and print boarding passes for free.

Great location with comfortable room, good amenities and really pleasant staff.Very helpful concierge service and more pleasant than most in the Times Square area at check in and reception. Great stay

I took a NY trip in October 2015 and stayed at the Iroquois.The hotel is very nicely located, the staff have been very attentive and it was also very clean.The downside is that my room was very poorly isolated from outside noise (5th floor) and temperature. Basically it was as if I had no window - I checked multiple time to see if it wasn't open by mistake. It was also pretty cold in the room and the thermostat was not really working - the staff explained that it's not really a thermostat, it's more of a way to specify how much outside air you want to let in. Nothing horrible, I could definitely sleep during the night but reading the rave Trip Advisor reviews had me expecting a lot more.

Wonderful boutique hotel in a great location in the heart of midtown. Welcoming and helpful staff looking to accommodate all requirements. Great cocktail bar. Quiet, large, comfortable rooms. This hotel has it all!

Great location...near Times Square and all the Theaters. Great rooms at very reasonable prices. But the key is the service: The concierge, front desk, bellmen, and other staff clearly take pride in what they do. Oh...and the spiced apple cider available 24/7 is to die for! It is so refreshing to be at a place where people genuinely smile and go out of their way to make sure you have the best NYC experience possible. Clean and generously-sized rooms (for NYC) at discount prices. You can pay double and go to an inferior but big name hotel if you want, but I certainly won't be joining you!

I have stayed numerous times at the Iroquois. The rooms are well appointed, the restaurant is quite good, and the location is great. That said, I have had several challenges with the hotel's reservation/front desk staff and after my most recent experience today, I will not be staying at the hotel again. I called the hotel this morning around 7:30 am to cancel a reservation for tomorrow (11/11) and was told that "we don't open until 9:00 am but let me see if I can find someone to help you." The woman put me on hold, and then the line went dead. I figured I would call back later in the day when I had more time. Around 6:30 pm I called and spoke to a reservation specialist who told me I would have needed to call by 3:00 pm to cancel and that my stay tomorrow would be filled at the full room charge. I mentioned my call to the hotel earlier on the day and was told "No one here would have said that. We are all trained to help guests." When I assured her it had happened she asked who I spoke with since she would need to verify my claim. I reminded her that I spoke with the staff person in the morning for about 30 seconds before I was put on hold and the line went dead and never got a name. The staff person insisted that without being able to verify the conversation there was nothing she could do, since there is no one at the hotel that she knows who would have said something like what I was told. After much back and forth she offered to check with the main office to see who was on duty in the morning but again insisted that no one would have said that they open at 9:00 am and that they could not help me. I finally told her not to bother and that I would not continue to be a guest at the hotel, to which she replied, "ok, is there anything else I can help you with?" Since being indirectly called a liar and receiving such a flippant response, in addition to the misinformation earlier in the day, I will not stay again at the Iroquois again.

Was in NYC for a hospitality convention and lucky for my wife and I, we ended up at the Iroquois. Room was awesome Clean and well set up. The hotel location is A+++.Door men and concierge were very helpful. I have stayed at several Hotels in NYC this 100 room Gem is first on my list. Needed my car they got it immediately. Needed ice for my cooler it was there. Room was cleaned before lunch every day. Door men even held my car so I could park in their spot on Sunday to save me $55.00. Now that's service..

Clean, comfortable & especially quiet hotel, but only couple blocks from time square. Home from home. Been couple of times now & can't wait to get back to NYC again soon. Will be back at the Iroquis again.

Location is excelente, but the service and size of the room are poor. The rate are too expensive for they offer. They are not friendly They need to encrease the maitenance; It is on the limit. The room's amenities are ok.

This is my second time staying at The Iroquois- love, love this hotel!! Great location, great service, extremely knowledgeable staff, great bar - what else can I say??? I can not wait to come back to this wonderful hotel!!!

My husband and I stayed here for six nights in October. We don't have one complaint about this property. As others have stated, the location couldn't be any better. This was our first visit to NYC and I wanted to be within walking distance to everything...we pretty much were. The staff are amazing! Everyone from the desk clerks to the concierge to the bell boys to the bar staff to the housekeeping staff were wonderful. They have a high level of security. We ordered a pizza one night and the front desk called our room to ask if we ordered delivery and then one of the bellmen escorted the delivery guy up to our room and, again, asked if we ordered delivery. I suppose the rooms are not the largest but after visiting Paris anything has to be larger then the room we stayed in there. There is enough room. You won't feel cramped. It is a boutique hotel. The shampoo is the best shampoo I've ever smelt in my life! We were there the week of the Canadian Thanksgiving/American Columbus Day. I wanted to go this time of year to take advantage of the fall foliage. Boy was I disappointed! Not only were all the leaves still green but our first couple of days there it was 23 degrees Celsius! So if you want cooler temps and fall colours you may want to go towards the end of October or early November. We will definitely return to NYC and won't hesitate booking this hotel again. Tip for the ladies: don't worry about being a fashionista. Wear comfy shoes and clothes. I got six blisters our first day wearing a pair of ballet flats. I had to go buy a pair of sneakers and literally wear them out of the store.

We loved this hotel. We were in NY for the marathon to support friends that were running. The hotel was central to everything we needed to do. The staff, especially John and Benjamin at the front desk could not be more helpful. The lobby, halls and room were perfect. Although NY hotels tend to be small, we had more than enough space and the bathroom a good size. I would come back.
user_name:
dcmary2019
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Feels like home when you are away. This midtown boutique upscale hotel gives the best service with spoiling rooms, perfect beds and amenities, and one of the top restaurants of this city. I wouldn't change the hotel for any other !
user_name:
Michal M
Herzliya, Tel Aviv, Israel

review_body: The Iroquois has a very friendly and helpful staff. It is in an excellent location for visits to Broadway Theatres and many other attractions. We have stayed there twice and had a wonderful experience both times.

For us, this is the ultimate 'goldilocks' hotel - it's just the right distance from everything New York City has to offer. A boutique hotel in the true sense of the word, you can feel the history of the building simply from walking up the steps into the reception area, where you'll find a welcoming cup of coffee or iced water.We have stayed here twice over the last two years and we will definitely be back for a third visit. The staff and management team are great and the rooms are of a decent size for a NYC hotel.Highly recommended.

A very lovely hotel in the Time Square midtown area. The all of staff was very helpful , friendly and attentive. John at the front desk went out of his way to accommodate us. From check-in to departure it was an all around great experience. Older charming hotel with very clean, updated rooms with marble bathroom and high end linens. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was very good. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Looking forward to my next trip to NY and stay at The Iroquois!

Excellent from the time we got there till we left! Friendly efficient helpful, wonderful experience. Will definitely recommend Iroquois to anyone. Thanks again to Kia ,JJ, vanessa, Sabrina n all the staff!!

Our stay at the Iroquois started and ended well. On arrival we had a friendly greeting and help with our luggage to our room, then a easy check in which was made all the better when we were offered a free room upgrade to room 903 on the ninth floor. This turned out to be the Presidential Suite with a large bedroom, separate lounge, dinning room and kitchen. The room was clean and well presented with fresh linen and towels as you would expect. The room was cleaned every day with an evening turn down service.The bed was huge and very comfortable. One point we missed was that if we wanted the bed linen changed during our stay we could have used a door sign to inform the staff we need the bed changed. However, our stay was relatively short and this was not an issue. The en suite had a separate bath and shower room with a Jacuzzi bath and gallons of hot water. The only grumble would be that the shower pressure was a bit feeble and not as good as other hotel showers. Hotel staff can make or break a hotel and the staff we encountered were all a credit to the hotel, always friendly and helpful. Vanessa on the Concierge desk helped us with a transport problem and was frequently heard to be arranging theatre tickets and restaurant reservations for other guests. Doorman Seth was a great help with luggage and was a great source of information for places to eat. The location of the hotel was ideal. One block and a short walk to Times Square and well placed to walk to most of the other must see sights of New York. Close enough to Times Square but far enough from the main bustle and noise. There was still some noise intrusion but not enough to disturb our sleep. We did not use the bar or restaurant so we cannot comment on these facilities. I could go on but I think I will conclude with a positive recommendation that visitors to New York would be well advised to consider the Iroquois Hotel as a place to stay. If we return to New York we will book into the Iroquois without any hesitation. We would also he happy to recommend the hotel to family and friends.

A lovely hotel in an excellent location. Staff were extremely helpful and efficient. The rooms were extremely clean and well cared for. The hotel's position between Fifth and Sixth Avenues and right next to Broadway made it an excellent base for tourists.
user_name:
Carrie H
Newton Aycliffe, United Kingdom

review_body: This hotel is centrally located and in a good walking distance from most attractions. The hotel is clean and tidy and rooms are adequate if a little small. They have Molton Brown toiletries which are lovely but on the downside, the rooms are very darkly lit.

Great location. Within walking distance of many attractions. 2 blocks from Times Square. Many restaurants within a block. 1/2 block from 5th. Ave. shoping. Subway and buses close by. Beautiful Botique Hotel.

I would definitely stay at the Iroquois again. It is very clean, and felt like a little piece of calm and quiet in the middle of a busy and hectic area. The bed was extremely comfortable, the amenities luxurious, and the staff courteous and gracious. I stayed 3 nights, and found myself looking forward to the refuge at the end of busy days and evenings.

Special trip for a couple that had met in NYC over 65 years ago and had not been back for many years. The trip was made extra special by the hotel and staff. The hotel was centrally located with a personal touch.

A boutique hotel with a quiet 10th floor room . Personal attention from staff .Easy walking distance to Time Sg , Radio City , and 5th Ave and trains. Liked its location just away from super crowded streets.

Great location and very friendly staff who made our stay so great. We were sad to leave this hotel and New York. PS the cocktails from the cocktail bar are wicked! They are expensive but you only need one.

This is a very nice older hotel in a good location. I would stay again if the money was right but would not go out of my way to be here. Elevator service I'd tedious. The "included breakfast " was very limited. An acceptable stay, but I'll try somewhere else next time.

This was my wife and my 1st trip to New York City and we were a little apprehensive. The staff at the Iroquois made us feel welcome, answered all of our questions and helped us navigate the city. The location was within walking distance of the main Manhattan attractions including Times Square. The rooms were smaller than expected but were nicely appointed and perfectly kept every day. We would highly recommend the Iroquois and plan to stay there again on our next visit to the City.

Well located, boutique-hotel with excellent rooms and friendly service. Worth mentioning that omplimentary continental breakfast was offered to us and it turned to be full of helthy and tasty options. Likely to return when in NYC.

The room was dated dimly lit and the bed creaked with every movement and was lumpy - the room smelled probably due to being right next to the sauna and fitness room - I had asked for a quiet room and was given a busy location. The staff were pleasant and professional and the location was good the lobby and bar were nice but the above comments made my stay one to forget.

My daughter and I flew to New York for a concert at Town Hall. We wanted a hotel close by and the Iroquois Hotel was perfect. The hotel lobby is beautiful. Lots of old charm and to us it felt like it had a more personable atmosphere. The hotel has a nice quite library for reading or taking care of business using their computer and printer. Loved the fruit flavored water and coffee. We booked a Queen room which was sufficient in size. The bed was bigger than we thought it would be. Rooms are updated and extremely clean. I appreciated that this hotel was actually located on a quiet end of the street. An occasional police siren but hey this is New York, we expected to hear this! We thought this was in an excellent location. Close to many sight seeing locations,Times Square, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller, and walking distance to the subway terminals and for all you women who love to bargain shop, it's close to Strawberries. This was our first trip to New York and we didn't want to go home! So much to see and do and we'll definitely stay again at the Iroquois Hotel.

Brilliant location,excellent staff,very clean room!The best choice to stay in NY !Hotel is located in the heart of Manhattan! Walking distance to all attractions.Very helpful staff,great bar,restaurant and little library.

Loved the staff. Had to change rooms because of excessively noisy HVAC but down with gracious regard for our comfort. Rooms comfortable and big enough, especially lots of drawer space making it easy to unpack and settle in. Linens crisp and lovely. Roomy bathroom with good shower. Great towels and robes. Comfy bed. Double-glazed windows helped keep midtown street noise at bay. Great location. Easy walks to theaters, Rock Center, Grand Central, and Central Park. Good nearby restaurants. If you, like us, favor small, intimate and warm hotels, this is the place. Only 12 stories. None of the giant hotel buzziness and rush. We felt well taken care of in a family-like setting. The halls are well designed too and well lighted. The small lounge off the lobby is a very nice touch. We're looking forward to booking here again.

I stayed at the Iroquois for 5 nights while I did a course nearby. It's fair to say the hotel is more 'old world charm' than 'flashy and modern' but I didn't mind that. The location is great, between Times Square and 5th Avenue however I walked from 33rd up to 59th and nothing seemed too far. The staff were polite and courteous, the rooms clean with new manchester. Would I stay here again? Yes.

Booked this hotel a week before our arrival. I liked that it was small, I am not a fan of huge corporate hotels. It was in a great location - close to many restaurants, Times Square and theaters and within easy walking distance of a couple of different subway lines. Room was a good size (Premium King room) with lots of natural light and a nice sized bathroom with a tub/shower combo. Linens were very nice and bed was comfy. The room was very clean and we enjoyed the nightly turn down service and weather card. We utilized room service for breakfast a few mornings (brioche French toast - yum!) and also found the concierge to be very helpful. All employees were super helpful. My only two concerns were the noise - we were on the 9th floor but still heard lots of street noise all night long. But the biggest concern was the room temperature. From what I understand, the hotel either has the air conditioning on or the heat on and you can only adjust the air flow in your room. The day we arrived, the weather was very chilly, but the next 3 days were in the 70's. But I think the heat was on the whole time, it was just too warm, especially at night. Overall we greatly enjoyed our stay and think it was very well priced and in a great location.

Excellent hotel location in upper midtown, close to 5th avenue and time square.Oldish hotel in need for renovation, rooms overpriced for what you get (you're paying for location). Staff very friendly and helpful.

The Iroquois is immaculate. The room is nicely appointed with a very comfortable bed and it's nice and quiet. Housekeeping was very good; they come twice a day. The concierge service was great throughout our stay. Loved the NY Times delivered to our door each morning. Found a reasonable and good eatery "The Red Flame" just a few doors away; did not eat at the Iroquois. Drinks are Very expensive in the hotel bar. Close to Central Station, lots of shopping. Would absolutely stay there again.

I travel a ton for business and usually am relegated to Starwood properties because of my colleagues' choice. Traveled to NYC last week and chose to forgo points and choose location instead. This is PERFECT for Retail/Fashion related business, right near Bryant Park and 7th Avenue. I walked to all of my appointments and up to Saks & the fifth avenue shopping after work :) Super convenient. Charming boutique hotel, smallish in size. The hotel itself is old and there are some noticeable marks of age but it has been beautifully maintained. The wifi was reliable (hey these things are important for business travel!), I was on the 10th floor with an extremely quiet room, they serve coffee in the lobby, the elevators came fast, great water pressure, soft towels & frette bed linens. All around magnificent stay and I will definitely stay again soon!

Room and Bed very comfortable, restaurant fantastic, Staff was great.The concierge was especially helpful with organizing events and transport.Special thanks to the concierge (Vanessa) for assisting us well after we had checked out, by retrieving and shipping an item left behind at the airport. Very Professional and Caring Hotel, Look forward to returning.

We stayed in a suite on the 6th floor. The room had a king size bed in a spacious bedroom, double sofa bed for the kids to share in the sitting room and a shared bathroom for our family. It was at the front of the hotel, pretty spacious, clean and well decorated. Pretty quiet too considering this is NYC. Well located to walk to major attractions in mid town. Great cocktail bar downstairs.

Fabulous theater district location. Charming boutique hotel beautifully maintained. Could walk everywhere. Extremely quiet room. Lush linens and comforters. Bathrooms had tubs. Would definitely stay there again

enjoyed my stay at this hotel. room was NY small but not tiny and bed was comfy. staff were friendly and helpful, very knowledgable concierge. good location convenient to Times Square and subway. I would stay here again

My wife and I visited during the past week and found the hotel and staff to be everything we wanted. Great staff - Special mention to Vanessa (concierge) who ensured that the packages I had delivered ahead of my arrival were received, checked in, stored and available for my collection on my arrival at the hotel. Fabulous services from a very willing, pleasant and professional person !Everything about the hotel was excellent, Room, Beds, bathroom, etc etc . We had a deluxe room on the 12th floor which was spacious.Would highly recommend and would return if and when we are in NYC

I needed a hotel in Midtown for a business trip. I was completely satisfied and very impressed with the quality and comfort offered by the caring staff at the Iroquois Hotel. Breakfast at the hotel's restaurant, (called Triomphe) was an added benefit. It's the best restaurant for breakfast within a mile of the hotel and convenient for guests, since there is a well maintained parking garage with reasonable (for NYC) rates across the street. I will definitely return again in the future.

Nice hotel in Midtown Manhattan. Located close to a variety of attractions such as Times Square, Bryant Park and Grand Central. Shopping at 5th avenue is also not far away from the hotel. Even with the location, the hotel rooms did not feel too noisy (although we did hear sirens several times every day from the hotel rooms). Clean rooms and tidy service. Not a overly big fan of the hotel room interiors though as it felt a bit outdated.

The hotel itself is very well located in Midtown. The check in was swift and efficient. I asked for a high floor away from the front and was accommodated. The room itself was very small. I've come to expect as such from New York hotels but this lacked the minimum of what I consider acceptable. There is no place to put your luggage and when I was on the toilet my knees actually hit the door frame! Also, because it's so small there is no place for a proper mini-bar and it was virtually impossible to utilise the small desk they shoved into the corner.Small touches were nice, like the toiletries. The bed and linens were fine. Free wi-fi. Room service was very good and efficient. But it's hard to enjoy these things when you cannot get the basics right.
user_name:
Michael M
New York City, New York

review_body: I was in NYC for a wedding and booked this hotel based on the location and I have to say I was pleased with everything. Wonderful rooms, clean, and full of modern amenities. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I have to call out John and Jazmin from the front desk who were great whenever I needed something/had questions. I also had a few drinks at the bar and Jessica (I think that was her name) was a great bartender. Delicious cocktails and so friendly. The location was also very convenient. So close to so many things. I will definitely be back.

We stayed for 8 days in the premium suite and it was clean, quiet and comfortable. The dining at the Troimphe restaurant was very pleasant but the main positive was the staff, especially Vanessa who arranged everything for us, especially the free walking tours. We took all 6 with the streetwise group and their knowledge was amazing, especially Patrick. Make sure you sign up for these as the cost cannot be bettered. We would stay again.

We love the room, the bathroom was great, the staff was very helpful. We had dinner in the dining room it was outstanding. The hotel has a great location especially for the theater district. We will visit this hotel in the future as it was a really great spa

I wanted our stay in New York to be really special and the Iroquois made it just that for us. From the friendly greeting doormen to the front desk, everyone was a pleasure to deal with. And then we got to our beautiful room. The decor was amazing and the extremely comfortable bed, big thick fluffy towels, bathrobe down to the little chocolate every night on our pillow made it just so nice. Its location worked so well from catching the bus from the airport, to a short walk to Grand Central Station, Time Square, anywhere really. And it is in a nice part of town and we always felt very safe. A huge thank you to Patrick the night manager for all his help also and we just loved our stay.....thank you so much.

Great location for theatres, times Sq etc. Rooms are a little dark without central lights. Beds are hugely comfortable which is important after days of long walks. Staff are very attentive particular the concierges who gave us great advice.

Good location for Theatre and Times Square.Lovely staff.Rooms small and a little dark....the restaurant is fantastic for dinner.We had the paired tasting menu..probably the most enjoyable meal we've had in a decade.

rooms were very quiet - one elevator made for long wait time - power outlets were not easily located nor reachable - hair dryer was in the dresser draw, not easily located - lighting was not convenient from the bed

Our suite at The Iroquois was quite charming. It was clean and well-prepared. However, the bathroom was smaller than the closet in a child's room! We had a minor plumbing issue which was fixed right away. Our doorman, Seth, was extremely friendly and helpful to us. He recommended we eat at Saju Restaurant which was so excellent we took breakfast and dinner there for the three days we were in town! All in all, a nice little boutique place to stay and probably would stay there again in spite of the size of the bathroom!
user_name:
Jodi K
Rochester, New York, United States

review_body: our room was dark, always. Mostly because the next house is just a few yards away, so daylight did not happen there. Since the light fixtures are to few for these circumstances, packing and unpacking suitcases proved to be a challenge.Otherwise the small room was ok, spare the wall to wall carpeting that had seen better days ages ago.Service was friendly, bathroom ok.Location is great, right in the middle of manhattan.Wireless was very good.

thank you for a wonderful quiet stay in the centre of new York. We felt in the centre of the atmosphere and had a wonderful time . Free guided tour organised at the hotel was also very good. All staff were helpful to make our first new York trip enjoyable. We were able to walk to shows and visited most attractions. did not try the met ran out of time.

You may find hotels with bigger rooms and grander facilities but Iroquois will not leave you wanting because:* comfortable rooms where lets face it you dont spend much time on vacation* close to Times Square in Midtown, so is easy to get to all sights including Theatre District / Broadway* great service from everyone - special mention to Jasmin at reception for answering all our questions and to Bill the Concierge for advice* gym and sauna where you can shower and change before flight

We have spend seven nights in one of their deluxe rooms. Very comfortable beds, nicely appointed rooms. There is some noise from the streets early in the morning (even in the top floor) but it's manageable. The water pressure in the bathroom is not great even after some intervention by the hotel engineer. The Wifi on the tenth floor is not working.

The ambience at the hotel was of old world charm. Car service was arranged through the hotel to and from the airport which made transport a breeze. Our driver recommended the best pizza in town, and he was right. Everyone was friendly and helpful in making our trip wonderful. We did have a cocktail in the lounge which was an experience it itself. The bed was the most comfortable I have stayed in away from home. There's no breakfast, but there is a great diner just a few doors down. The location is wonderful, easy to walk to various sites or get on the subway, or hop on hop off bus. This was a bucket list trip for me, and it surpassed all my expectations.

First time in New York. Hotel perfectly situated for all needs. Staff very helpful, gave details of places to travel including out of the way local inside knowledge. Good diner nearby for a hearty breakfast. Use the sub way not at all scary, clean, direct and cheap
user_name:
sue j
North Shields, United Kingdom

review_body: Other then some confusion on the bill at check out it was as allways a Great place. right near Times square. The rooms are super nice and the beds are very comfortable. The staff is great, resturante and bar are fabulos.

The room was of adequate size and was very comfortable. It was a wonderful location within easy walking distance of Rockefeller Plaza and Times Square. The hotel bar was excellent for an evening cocktail. We would definitely use this hotel again.

This is a beautiful hotel. It has that Bed and Breakfast feel on a luxurious level. The hotel staff was friendly and the housekeeping staff was exceptional. Just a lovely place to spend a few days in New York.

Clean, comfortable, welcoming. Everything was wonderful with the hotel and service. Concierge is especially great. Lanterns Keep (the bar) Is great with fabulous service and cocktails. DONT EAT OR DRINK AT TRIOMPHE. BOTH SERVICE AND FOOD ARE AWFUL.

Excellente location, it took us couple of minutes to be in Times Square! Very close to the Rockefeller Center area. The hotel room is a bit small but had everything we could have needed for our trip. Highly recommended.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night. From the moment we walked into the lobby, we were pleased with our hotel choice. All the staff were very friendly and accommodating. They are very helpful with restaurant recommendations, directions, etc. The location is convenient to restaurants and shopping. Our room was very nice and clean. I would definitely stay here again on a future visit to NYC.

Vanessa (concierge) was best concierge I have ever had at a hotel in NYC !Staff super friendly and very competent Felt like being part of a big house Triomphe restaurant was great Lanterns keep cool little place I will most definetly make this my NYC hotel

Hotel is in great location and quiet. However the air container is turned off at night and I had to call front desk to have someone with a "key" turn it on. Additionally, no one has any authority to help in any way.

The Iroquois has become our "family" hotel and we now recognized upon arrival.The service and position is sensational, easy access to just about everything in NYC. A small and intimate hotel. If you like the big flashy ones this is not for you.

Small hotel in great location! Small rooms- we also had an especially small bed on our last visit- don't stay in room 200!Nice sheets and Moulton Brown bathroom supplies-Iced water and coffee in lobby and good selection of newspapers. We've stayed at the Iroquois off and on for years. There is no royal treatment - that we have ever received- so some years we find other hotels- but it is a good choice for lots of reasons - location location location!

My stay at the Iroquois was absolutely wonderful. I was greeted each morning and night by friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were comfortable, clean, and I thoroughly enjoyed coming back to my hotel every night after a long day at work. I highly recommend the Iroquois and am already planning my next visit to return.

I'm not used to happy & helpful service in New York. I mean there are the exceptions, but holy smokes, the staff at the Iroquois are unreal. I couldn't believe how welcoming the woman was at the front desk. I almost hugged her. And the bell man who took our luggage up to our room was crazy kind as well. And then there was Vanessa at the concierge desk, who went above and beyond recommending restaurants and events my friend and I may want to check out. I really wish I had asked everyone else what their names were, but honestly, I was too stunned. The room was super clean. No real view, a little dark and a little noisy, but it's NY. I've been in darker, noisier rooms. Can't say enough good things about The Iroquois. I almost didn't want to write this review because I'll definitely stay there again and I want a room available next time I'm in town. Pretend you didn't read this review. Go find some other place. ;-)

Our stay at the Iroquois was wonderful. From the moment we arrived the staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, comfortable and most of all quiet. The location can not be beat. We will definitely return will return.

Our 3 day stay at the Iroquois was fantastic. The hotel is is the best location to Times Square, Byrant Park, Grand Central Station and many other NY sites and attractions. Small hotel of a quiet street with luxurious amenities. All staff extremely helpful and always friendly. Excellent complimentary breakfast for booking direct. Would return again and highly recommend.

Fantastic service, very hospitable, very clean!!!! Loved the smaller scale of this hotel and attention to detail.We were 9 women on a cousin's getaway and we had a fantastic time in New York. The Iroquois is in a great location!

The location is extremely convenient to Times Square, 5th Avenue, and Grand Central. My experience this stay was excellent. The doormen and front desk staff were warm and friendly. The room was in perfect order with plush towels and good soap. Most importantly, the food and service at Restaurant Triomphe was superb.

This hotel was a true treasure in the heart of NYC. The location was fabulous and within walking distance of Times Square and many theaters. The staff was very, very friendly. Rooms were comfortable and clean. I will be coming back in the future.

We have stayed quite a few times here. Gap between last stay and this one. We stayed in an executive suite as has a sofa bed. We love this hotel. We drove in and parked right outside whilst we unloaded the luggage. The doormen were very helpful and said for us to take our time. Even settle in our room before moving the car. Not the usual rush to be rid of us as in other places. I had called the concierge a few hours earlier to enquire about parking options. We were given 3 ! I chose self parking and they have a very, very good discount with a garage in the next street ! Needless to say, the concierge was very helpful throughout the stay. Check in is easy. The room was very comfortable. New York hotels tend not to be huge. The room was a good size and comfortable for the 4 of us. Great location and there is a diner at the end of the street, where we had breakfast. The hotel has free coffee in the morning. They had peaches you help yourself to at reception and later in the day, flavoured water. Highly recommended small, boutique hotel with personal service. Free wifi was very good. beds were comfortable, the sofa bed had a memory foam mattress.

A really great traditional hotel with good service. The decor was a bit dated and room service was limited and a bit slow. Would I stay there again - you bet I would! Well worth the money and a very good location.
user_name:
TomW3648
New York City, New York

review_body: Service was excellent, room was very clean. Location was good, close to amenities, like dining out, serious shopping, Least thing was bar area in hotel not big enough to cope with guests, if it got busy.

Eccelent service great location room clean quite bed very conformtable. The restaurant has great food. The hotel is an excellent choice for a New York first experience due to its central position and transportation options.

I enjoyed my stay at the Iroquois New York. The staff were excellent, the restaurant food was very good, especially the breakfast (Brioche French Toast and Egg-white Frittata). The location is perfect for getting around any part of the city; Grand Central Station was practically at the front door. The room was a little snug for 3 people; but I get the space issue in New York City. The only parts of the trip that were not enjoyable were out of the control of the hotel staff: The U.S. Open and rain.

The hotel is near of main interesting points of Manhatan. Good cost/benefit.Quite room. Very polite staff. Room is small but comfortable. Coming back to New York gonna stay in Iroquois hotel again. I recomend!

We enjoyed a stay at the Iroquois in 2009, so we were glad to see that it's still a fairly good value for Manhattan. Our room was small (as we expected) but clean and well-appointed. We were glad we didn't need to use the air-conditioner much, however, because it was rather noisy and smelled musty when running. All of the staff people we encountered were friendly and helpful. The location is great for tourists -- within easy walking distance of theaters, 5th Avenue shopping, Grand Central Station, and more than one subway line. Being in Midtown also means being surrounded by lots of people and traffic, and we could hear some street noise in our room. Overall, though, it was a pleasant stay, and we would stay there again.

We ordered the Executive Suite for a family holiday of 4 adults for eight nights.The hotel's location, its size and the room we received was just perfect!The small size of this luxury hotel is a big advantage because almost every guest is treated individually.The staff was great and all our requests were handled immediately.Location - walking distance from all the main sites in the vicinity of Midtown and public transport stations.The room was a very large suite, luxurious and tastefully furnished including a living room and a bedroom.The level of cleanliness in the room and hotel facilities was excellent.There is a small gym with Finnish sauna.No breakfast at the hotel, but it offers free drinking coffee in the morning and cold drinks in the afternoon in the lobby.There is no doubt that this hotel will be a priority, for us, for our next stay in New York.

with very pleasant staff and a good central midtown location i wish i had better things say. unfortunately this is an older hotel and while renovated and clean, it suffers from the usual older hotel syndrome of indifferent plumbing, an desk not supportive of 2015 (you'll be down on your knees trying to plug in your phone, hitting those same knees because its built for someone 5’1” and your laptop will take up the complete work surface). not a bad hotel, but not a great one. room size varies but mine was good by new york standards.

I have been staying at this hotel for years. This was the 1st time I got a room that I wasn't happy with. The room itself was comfortable, still with the fabulous molton brown bath products. My only downfall this time was that there was the air conditioning vent for the entire floor above my bathroom ceiling. This was a rather loud, annoying hum that continued the entire night. Rather like being near an airport. Anyway, I complained and in true Iroquois hospitable style, they moved me immediately to a luxury king size which made up for the 1st night sleep lost! I will be back, but will make sure I'm not in room 1007!
user_name:
BelindaHaydn
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: After lots of research, I chose the Iroquois for our first trip to NYC. Vanessa, the concierge, was awesome! She even had metro cards for us when we arrived. Central location and wonderful amenities. Very impressed! We loved it and can't wait to go back!

This hotel is in a great location, very clean and with freindly staff.It is so close to many great sites within walking distance, Fifth Ave, Times Sq.,Rockafeller Centre, St Patrick Cathedral even Maceys.I would definately recommend it and hope to go back myself

For our 4 day visit to New York - (my wife's first visit) - the Iroquois Hotel was everything we needed to make our time enjoyable. We were warmly welcomed upon arrival and the check-in was quick and efficient and no surprises when we taken to the room by the front door employee.My wife had some questions and Jessica at the Concierge Desk was extremely helpful with purchasing tickets for a bus tour - reservations for supper and limo service for trip to airport.Kelly & Mallory at the front desk were very helpful with our requests after Concierge Desk was closed. Lirim - front door employee was a delightful young man . . willing to have a chat and share with us some tips on getting around and what to see.The fact that the Hotel is small - you were welcomed and recognised each time you were heading out, or arriving back after a dhow or supper.The location is excellent - 2 blocks to Times Square - theatres - restaurants - Irish Pubs - and only a few steps more to bus stops - shopping - St. Pat's Cathedral - Central Park.Only down side - the Air Conditioning was having a difficult keeping up with the hot humid weather . . . we requested a fan - and that made the room considerably more comfortable.

We visited because it was a special day for us. THe hotel made it an even more special weekend. Room was spacious and staff very friendly and helpful. THe location of the hotel is quite convenient. Near 5th Ave and Times Square and theatres.

Central location for walking to all the Best of what New York has to offer. well as easy access to Subway. Our every need or question was met with very friendly and knowledgable staff. Very comfortable stay and would highly recommend.

We had been to NYC a few months ago and decided we did not like staying in Times Square. While picking a hotel for this stay I saw the Iroquois and was interested until I saw it was in Times Square. We decided to pick another hotel closer to Arthur Ashe stadium since we were coming for the U.S. Open. The second night of our stay a wedding party woke us up at midnight and continued to keep us awake. After repeated calls the hotel staff did nothing even after bringing the front desk clerk up to witness it for himself. We decided that in order to get any sleep that night we would need to find another hotel. That's where the Iroquois came in. The front desk clerk got us a room right away and we checked in around 4 am. He was very compassionate and understanding. We couldn't have asked for better service. The hotel itself is very nice and very quiet. It was like we were the only ones there. We never heard noise from any of the other guests. I wish I had realized when planning this trip that while the Iroquois is in Times Square it is not in the main part so it's a lot less crowded and noisy. It is convenient to the subway as well as restaurants and shops. It was a wonderful stay and we certainly would recommend it to anyone.

In all the dozens of Hotels that I've tried in NYC, midtown locations, this one has been the best in terms of quality/location/price. We stayed as a family of 4 in a 2 dbl queen bedroom and it was prime. Good space for NYC standards and nice WC. If I catch a nice price again, I will come back for sure!

Friendly, welcoming staff. Hotel very clean and 5 minutes walk from Times Square. Chief Concierge Vanessa is very helpful and has lots of knowledge re what to do and where to go to in New York - whatever you are expecting to do.

the hotel is great, the service is fantastic and very helpful. the room was always clean with new towels. they serve complimentary coffee & tea each morning and afternoon they have complimentary water and sometimes even fruits.

During my last visit to New York I stayed one night at the Iroquois and one night at a large chain hotel (hint: it has "Midtown" in the name). The Iroquois experiences was by far superior. The property was clean, the amenities were generous and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The best part is that the room rates were on par with others in the area, so I didn't feel like I was having to dish out more money to get a satisfactory experience.I will be staying at the Iroquois for all my New York trips from now on.

The hotel is small, pleasant, quiet and professionally managed. The location could not be better, close to Times Square and Grand Central. We were in town for the US Open and two blocks away we caught the subway to LI. Same for downtown sight seeing trips. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of our suite. The mixologist at Lantern's Keep is quite talented and the atmosphere is quite relaxing after a long hot day.

We stayed for 5 nights in a king bedroom on the second floor. The hotel is a great location for everywhere in Manhattan. We always prefer a hotel which does not accept huge tour groups. The Iroquois is a posh historic boutique hotel which had all we needed. The room tended to be small and at least ours didn't have nice view. Just faced next building. But we could compromise about that since it was midtown in Manhattan. Their comfy bed and turndown service made for a good night sleep for us. Luckily for us, our room was close to the gym and sauna which we used frequently. Although before using sauna, it's necessary to request it be turned on, the gym was open 24 hours. I was really glad the gym had a bath and shower room, also amenities were Molten Brown which was same as room amenities. All staff were always quick to respond and friendly. One memorable thing was free morning coffee and later on free refreshment ice water which were offered in the lobby. Also they had a cozy nostalgic library room where there were newspapers, internet terminal, and books. Overall, they offered comfortable stay even though they didn't have scenic view.

Great location with nice rooms and friendly staff. It was nice to be able to walk to the Broadway shows but be located just outside of the congestion of Times Square. The staff was very helpful. Overall a pleasant experience and we will return.

I have been staying at the Iroquois for business and personal trips since 1996. I always find the hotel to be warm and inviting from the appointment of the room to the demeanor of the staff. This is one of my favorite places as I travel, and truly a "home away from home". This is my first time back in a year and two bellmen remembered my name...

Hotel is excellent. Perfect location in Midtown within easy walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, the Theatre district and the Empire State Building but far enough away to be a bit quieter. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful with directions when we needed them. Room was a decent size, especially by New York standards, with an amazingly comfortable bed. Our room faced the street but we had no issues with noise at all. Bathroom was immaculate and well stocked with shampoo, conditioner and soap (and one of the best blowdryers I've used in a hotel).We had breakfast in the hotel one morning and the service was fantastic. Had the made to order omelette which comes with 3 items of your choice. I only wanted to use 2 items and they had no problem letting my daughter take my unused third option. I will certainly stay here again and will be recommending this place to any of our friends who are looking at travelling to NYC.

This was a good place to stay and there are many positive things such as friendly and helpful staff, like many other reviewers Vanessa was great with her knowledge and advice about places to visit and where to eat.Whilst our room was very clean and quiet it was very dark, overlooked the fire escape of the adjacent building and was poorly lit. With very little natural light coming into the room there ought to be a decent centre light at least.The mini bar is full of things to purchase but no space to put a small bottle of water of your own water to keep chilled ( we stayed during the heat wave). The mini bar comes with a warning not to remove anything from the sensor pads or you will be billed! There is a chilled water dispenser in the hotel lobby but we found that it was empty on a couple of occasions. For a small luxury hotel which apparently prides itself on it's service and facilities it was a surprise that the adjoining restaurant , the Triomphe, and cocktail bar the Lantern, were closed from Saturday through to Monday.
