We used the neighbouring hotel Algonquin's facilities instead and had we known about the Iroquois's selective opening times it would have been far more convenient to have booked our stay there.Would we stay at the iroquois again? Probably not

Stayed here for 6 days on a trip to New York. The location of the hotel could not be better, 1 min from 5th Avenue and the same to 6th Avenue. A few mins walk to Times Square and many of the other attractions within 10 mins walk. The staff very helpful and efficient at check in. While the room was small (I think even for New York) the beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in around the world. The only negative of the room, was the lack of electrical sockets. But in addition to its location, the concierge - Vanessa - is such a huge asset to this hotel. She provided us with the most amazing recommendations for everything from restaurants, where to see the real New York, Broadway Shows to see and how to get tickets, How to use the Subway etc. etc. She was so friendly, efficient and helpful, always giving such detail advice that it made travelling around New York so easy and enjoyable.

Beautiful hotel close to the theater, great restaurants and shopping. But just enough outside of Time Square area so as not to be too crowded. The staff was very helpful! They called us as soon as our suite was available for early checkin. Overall a great time!

Visited New York to celebrate my husbands birthday. Prior to the visit I contacted the hotel and dealt with Vanessa, the Concierge. Vanessa kindly arranged for a selection of balloons for our room as a surprise for my husband on arrival. Hotel is very well maintained and decor is bright. All of the staff were very polite and incredibly knowledgable. Hotel is situated not too far from Times Square. Certainly worth a visit.

Great location for the theatre district, 5th Ave and other shopping areas, and numerous restaurants. Staff are accommodating and very friendly. Our room had a lousy view of heating/AC units and the lighting could have been better in the bedroom, but it was ok in the bathroom. Room not big but ok for the price in that area of NY.

Great hotel in the perfect location. Two blocks away from Times Square, The Iroquois is in the perfect spot walking distance to all attractions. The staff is very welcoming and friendly, you do really feel comfortable and relaxed after a full day of exploring NYC. The hotel and the rooms are very clean and modern. Our room was comfortable for three people and we were very pleased with our stay. Didn't have the breakfast at the hotel since it is quite expensive, but there are many cafes around the hotel. All in all the hotel was awesome and I would definitely return and recommend this hotel to others.

We were extremely happy with our choice of the Iroquois hotel in downtown Manhattan - in between 5th and 6th ave, the Empire State Building and Rockefeller Center. Our room was stunning, we had a beautiful view overlooking the incredible block - which houses the Harvard Club and the Yacht Club, as well as the New York Bar Association. The service was impeccable, room service for breakfast was delicious and we were made to feel very special. We will definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends, and we will be back.

A wonderful, clean hotel. Guest rooms were a bit small compared to others we've stayed at which were comparably priced, but would recommend the hotel and would stay again. The hotel is in a terrific location and has character.

It was very comfortable, clean and very convenient location. Quiet room, breakfast options nearby. Easy use of computer/printers for travel document printing. Nice, clean and quiet room. We liked it very much

Very nice hotel with friendly staff, clean rooms, excellent position. Enjoyed very much our stay and would return. We appreciated the offer of the use of the gym for a shower after check out as we had a late flight.

Great midtown hotel close to "everything". Staff was extremely service minded and everyone had a smile for you at all times. Our room was small, but clean and cosy and had everything we needed. There's a bar and restaurant "in house" but we only bought wine (to our room) from the bar. The restaurant is cosy and seemed to offer great food from the looks of it. The personnel was better than great there as well.There's a few good diners very close if you'd like to get breakfast to your room.

Found the Iroquois through the Small Luxury Hotel chain which is usually reliable and this was no exception. Had two adjoining rooms which were nicely furnished with excellent beds and bedding, fresh, soft towels and nice amenities in the bathrooms. The suite was very spacious, the queen a bit compact but perfectly adequate.The location is excellent for a city break with many attractions an easy walk away and subways nearby to reach those further afield. Staff are friendly and helpful, always available without being intrusive. Free high speed WiFi worked well, the air conditioning was effective (and very welcome in the heatwave we experienced). Coffee is available in the library in the morning and iced fruited water in the afternoon but it would have been good to have a coffee maker in the room and some complimentary bottled water, although there is a 24hr shop nearby which sells water at a fraction of the minibar price!This hotel and its nearby partners offer complimentary walking tours (from Streetwise New York) - we took two and would highly recommend them if your schedule permits.There are many excellent hotels in new York but based on our experience we would definitely recommend the Iroquois and would be happy to return.

Really nice boutique hotel that is ideally placed to see all of the mid-town attractions. Yet is not actually located on Times Square, so is a bit quieter than the hustle and bustle of TS. The staff could not do enough and the hotel bar is well renowned, which you should try, really good cocktails!

I adore the Iroquois-- the hotel is just the right size, completely comfortable, excellent location, and has a top notch staff. Easy walk home from theater and easy subway access. We had a fabulous stay!

Friendly staff. Nice beds and pillows in room. Excellent shower in bathroom. If there are 3 people staying in one room as we were, its a bit cramped so if 4 people wanted to share, I would suggest having 2 rooms as you would be falling over each other. Excellent location near to Times Square and other attractions and quite quiet for a city hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

I was here last week when my girlfriend and I visited New York for a holiday. The 5 stars for location are accurate, traffic light dependent you're either a 1 or 3 minute walk from times square and about minutes from the Rockafella centre and 5th avenue shops. The staff were polite and the concierges both were very helpful. If you want to be really pedantic you can say the rooms are smallish but if you're on holiday you don't want to spend your time in the room. Though people describing them as "tiny" are going over the top in my opinion. If you're travelling as a couple the hotel as I said is perfect.

The hotel is ideally situated for shopping on 5th Avenue and Times Square, a quiet hotel with very helpful and courteous staff.This was our third visit and we will definitely be returning in the future.

My partner and I stayed here for 7 nights in July. I cannot tell you how wonderful and helpful the staff were. The Concierge service was very good. We had the deluxe King corner room facing the New York Bar. Couldn't hear any road noises and the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was good and the room were spacious. 5 mins from 5th Avenue and Time Square. Definitely going back. Perfect hotel to base yourself to explore New York.

My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Iroquois New York and were pleasantly surprised with our choice of this hotel. Upon our arrival we were greeted by very friendly doormen and receptionist. Our room was on the 10th floor but could be accessed by 2 elevators so we never had much of a wait going either up or down. Our room was well decorated, had a large HDTV, easy to access free internet service, and a large bathroom with a strong shower. In addition, the price was very reasonable compared to many other luxury hotels in Manhattan. Being able to walk to the theatre, dining and shopping is a major plus - if you are very energetic, you can also walk to some excellent museums (25 blocks to the MMA), or take a relatively short taxi ride. We also enjoyed an excellent dinner at the Triomphe Restaurant, the hotel's in-house restaurant.

We spent 5 days at the Iroquois after meeting our son in Connecticut. We were impressed with the hotel and the staff. It proved to be an ideal place from which to explore New York. The hotel is in a quiet location between 5th and 6th Avenues and handy for all the museums, Rockefeller building, Radio City, Times Square as well as the shops on 5th Avenue.

One of the most pleasant hotel stay I've had in ages. Convenient location. Stayed in a very quiet room, which helps if you need a good night sleep. Staff were very friendly, polite and extremely helpful. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend the hotel to friends and family.

My daughter and I have stayed at the Iroquois for 4 days each August for the last 10 years. We love this gem of a hotel! There has never been a year where it hasn't been absolutely perfect. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in NYC. The staff remember us each time and welcome us with warm greetings. It's cozy and not the least bit "touristy" which we love. It's clean, comfortable and luxurious. Thank you Iroquois Hotel!!
user_name:
jacllb04
New York City, New York

review_body: We were looking for clean, safe and close to broadway shows. This hit the mark on all three counts. The location was absolutely convenient to Times Square, Fifth Ave, the subway, Top of the Rock, and Bryant Park. It was also close to Grand Central Terminal which made transportation from the airport easy.

Fairly close to Times Square and reasonably quiet hotel. The staff are courteous and polite and the interior is pleasant. The room we had was the smallest hotel room in history with not much space to move around although the decor is interesting and not unpleasant.

We stayed for three nights and this beautiful small hotel was an oasis amongst the hot bustle of a busy New York weekend. Ideally situated just off Times Square the Iroquois is in an ideal location. Our double queen room was compact but more than adequate for 3 of us. It was at the back of the hotel so no view but so quiet. The staff were helpful and courteous. A well deserved member of small luxury hotels of the world. We loved it.

There is nothing I disliked about this hotel. The location is close to Times Square.....The rooms are lovely, clean....The staff wonderful....Food excellent! Bar fun! We will be back! There are different prices at different times of the year. I must say for late August it was very reasonable.

The hotel is in a convenient location to Broadway Theaters, Time Square and other Mid Town attractions. The room we stayed in was clean, comfortable and a good size - not too big but comfortable for two. And, for New York, it was quiet and relatively inexpensive. I would defionately recommend for a weekend get-away!

Stayed here for 6 nights recently and would highly recommend. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Our room had two double beds so felt a bit small, but it was clean and the beds very comfortable. We didnt try the restaurant as there were so many to choose from nearby. Breakfast was expensive at $20 for continental so we ate at the diner just a few yards down the street, which was better value.The location is excellent. Its only 5 mins walk from Times Sq, 5-10 mins to the Rockefeller Centre and less than 5mins to the nearest subway station at Bryant Park. We also walked to the Empire State and Macys which is appox 20 mins. Would definitely recommend The Iroquois

We stayed 4 nights in this hotel and I can say that it is truly excellent. Upon our arrival the front desk staff was amazing : they were very professional, friendly, and always smiling ! We had a long trip and arrived before check-in time. They told us the room was ready. An early check-in was wonderful as we were exhausted. The room was not very large but it was not a problem. The beds are comfortable and the room is very clean. Belgian chocolate and a weather card are left on the bed everyday which is a nice touch. What is also excellent about the Iroquois is its location: between 5th and 6th avenue and just a short walk from times square.Would highly recommend this hotel !

Small rooms but very comfy beds - staff is very friendly and helpful. The coffee in the lobby wasn't that great - no coffee makers in the rooms. The bar is very small with no domestic beers - Many better choices in the are for drinks!

The staff are amazing, the location of the hotel is great. Free coffee in a morning is a nice touch and the flavoured water was a welcome thing to walk into after a hot day of walking around the city. We asked for a twin double room and got one, it was fairly large for a NY hotel and very very clean. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed here for a few nights in July this years. It's tucked away between 5th and 6th Avenue on 44th Street. The staff are very helpful and we really enjoyed our stay. Parking is pretty much directly opposite the hotel and for a few extra dollars the hotel staff will park your car for you. The bedrooms are on the small side but full of character. This hotel has a great history - apparently James Dean lived here for a couple of year.

My boyfriend and I stayed at The Iroquois Hotel in September 2014 for 4 nights. The room that we were allocated was extremely small and dark with the view from the window being out onto a wall and the other side of the building. I felt extremely claustrophobic and we asked for upgrade. There were no other rooms available on the first night but we were able to pay extra for a suite for the remaining 3 nights of our stay. We stayed in the James Dean Suite and it was fantastic. It was at the front of the building and still it was very quite. It was spacious and had a huge bed, although the bathroom was a bit dated. The suite made our stay in New York unforgettable and totally worth the extra money. The hotel is in a great location just off Times Square and 5th Avenue. The staff were also very helpful.

Home way from home. You get the feeling that you are at home as well as the feeling you get that employes are your family. Alwas nice, always are smiling and always ask if you need something. It is a family.

The hotel is in a beautiful area on 44th. The staff were excellent...really excellent. Mallory, Kia and the most lovely Lisa were spot-on sharp at the front desk. I was impressed by the great bellmen; best bellmen in NYC. Stay was fantastic. Thanks Iroquois, New York.

My niece and I planned a very special trip to NYC to celebrate her high school graduation and her new adventure starting university in the fall. From the moment we checked in – there was no doubt tah we had picked the right place to stay. Great staff, helpful in every way and the doormen are excellent ambassadors for their place of employment! The rooms are larger than expected for NYC, comfy beds and pillows to rest up for more shopping, great bathroom and a serene quiet gem just a short walking distance from the hubbub of Times Square. The location is superb and I will not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to NYC.

The Iroquois is a bit of an oasis on a busy block. The rooms are well appointed and larger than many other comparable NYC hotels. I have stayed here before and although this room was smaller than others it was nonetheless pleasant.

We've stayed at The Iroquois on several occasions and have never been disappointed. Great location, staff and amenities are terrific. Highly recommended! The concierge, Vanessa, is particularly helpful. She knows New York and has great suggestions for restaurants, activities, etc.

Good and friendly personnel, in the first room (905) the Air Conditioning Equipment was too loud (located at the stairs next door), free coffee, fruits and cold water in the Lobby, excellent Location in Mid Town (near Times Square),

This hotel was a perfect choise. Clean, perfect position for visiting NY. A special thanks to Vanessa @ conciergerie. Rooms are perfect for a couple not so big for a family but probably we had big luggages. Cristina

Lovely hotel, well located. We had one of the corner suites with a lounge as well as bedroom - great size, clean well appointed.Staff were very friendly and helpful.Great central location with all the key sites easily accessible. Would stay there again...

The Iroquois is simply a wonderful experience! The location, the staff, and the entire system is exactly what inner city hotels should strive to be. I recommend it to anyone, any time. Every stay seems better than before.

The Iroquois is a lovely hotel in a great location, Vanessa and Seth were incredibly knowledgeable and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were comfortable but the carpets could do with a clean and finer details of cleanliness need to be looked at ie dust, which unfortunately were not cleaned in the 7 nights we stayed. Saying that we had a fantastic time in New York.

My husband and I stayed here while visiting NYC in April for our anniversary and we were not disappointed. This sweet little hotel is right in the heart of it all but its location on a less busy side street meant that we did not have issues with street noise. Our room was comfortable and clean and we were very happy with our overall experience. We would definitely return!

This was our first trip to New York and we are so happy we chose to stay at The Iroquois! The hotel is in a great location (close to everything without being in the middle of Times Square). Our room was a great size and very clean. We stayed on the 4th floor and lucked out with a corner room. The room was so quiet we would have thought we were the only people on this floor and we did not hear ANY street noise! The staff was very friendly and always willing to help with transportation questions or dining suggestions. We will definitely be back to The Iroquois!

The Iroquois is a small, friendly hotel. It's a welcome respite in the center of a busy, noisy city. Service is excellent and the location couldn't be better. We stay at the Iroquois.every time we travel to NYC.
user_name:
Nancy R
Syracuse, New York, Usa

review_body: Spent a week at the Iroquois Hotel with my wife and teenage daughter. It's position is excellent, being minutes away from Time Square, but surprisingly quiet (quieter than I expected anyway) at night for such a central location. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was friendly and went out of their way to assist us. Overall we had a fantastic time and would not hesitate to stay at the same hotel again next time we visit New York. There is a great diner just down the street if you want breakfast outside the hotel and the concierge can provide a good selection of very nice restaurants nearby.

We stayed at the Iroquois in August 2015. The Hotel has excellent facilities, staff and a perfect location. The cocktails are a must whilst staying at the Hotel.The rooms are very clean, with all the usual items including additional items such as an Ironing Board, Iron, hair dryer, TV, DVD. The bathroom is well decorated and includes Molton Brown toiletries. The breakfast was very nice, with traditional American cooked breakfast and continental available. Cocktails and beverages all good, with plenty of choice.The reception staff, Bell Staff and concierge were very friendly. The Hotel is situated literally 5 minutes from Time Square, and Madison Avenue. Overall, this Hotel was excellent value, and we would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at The Iroquois for a New York City weekend adventure. The staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are lovely and comfortable, free WIFI and the location is central to many NYC activities. Short walks to MOMA, Times Square, Bryant Park, Grand Central Station and theaters made our exploring easy. There are also many wonderful restaurants near by, but be sure to visit The Lantern's Keep in the lobby of the hotel. Delicious cocktails. Perfect home base for a fabulous NYC experience.

Had a memorable stay at The Iroquois with my 2 daughters to celebrate my 50th birthday this year. The location was near to all the main attractions - Bryant Park, Central Park, Times Square, Empire State, Rockafella, 5th Avenue, Grand Central. The room was surprisingly quiet at night considering the close proximity of Times Square. Would recommend the 7 day subway tickets, we were able to travel to Bronx Zoo and Coney Island with them. Staff were friendly and thank you to Vanessa the concierge who was very helpful with all our travel queries.Coffee in lobby in morning and iced lemon water dispenser nice touch, especially from the heat of the day. Would definitely stay at The Iroquois if visiting again.

It was excellent as always, the location is outstanding and the service is always exceptional. The concierge was truly helpful, always taking time to giveus ideas and explainingallthe options for a day in New York.

Revisited NYC for our anniversary in May and, after trawling through available, settled on the Iroquois. SO glad we did. My husband contacted them in advance and asked for a room with natural light and informed them of our anniversary. We were given a room that looked across to other hotels and had a view (just) of the Chrysler Building. With two windows, we got light streaming in first thing in the morning which was lovely - previously we've had to stick out heads out and up to see if the sky was blue!It was nearly midnight when we checked in and were greeted with a complimentary plate of chocolate-dipped fruit, chocolates, a bottle of wine and a lovely card wishing us happy anniversary. A welcome touch after our long flight.The room was spacious by Manhattan standards, with a good-sized and well kitted-out bathroom. The bed was so comfortable I didn't want to leave it when it was time to come home. All in all a very pleasing room.The position of the hotel is good - only a couple of blocks from Times Square but it was far enough for peace and quiet. Ideal.We didn't eat at the hotel as it was soo dark in the restaurant. However, it was always busy so presumably the food is good.For breakfast, the Red Flame Diner a few doors down was good food for a good price. Always busy but excellent service so never a long wait.The Iroquois was not the cheapest but we would definitely stay there again.

From checking in to checking out our stay here was faultless. So impressed with all staff members and as first time visitors to New York the helpful advice from everyone was useful, particularly Bill the concierge who helped us enjoy a memorable evening at Wicked on Broadway. Perfect.

Staff was friendly, and quite helpful. Great location in the heart of Midtown. Nice, intimate boutique hotel. Room was clean and the bed was very comfortable! Highly recommend this hotel and will go back.
user_name:
barbaragY7332HF
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Biggest, most comfortable and quietist room we have encountered on Manhattan. We did have a suite but imagine a room only would be the same. Friendly, courteous staff from receptionist to the doorman. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. We will never stay anywhere else.

We went on a whirlwind four day trip to NYC and chose the Iroquois for a combination of location, price, and reviews. We were not disappointed. The staff was great, the hotel was charming, and it was convenient to everything in Manhattan. The only downside was our view of a wall and the fire escape. However, we only wanted a convenient, nice place to sleep that didn't break the bank. A short walk to Grand Central and Times Square, it is perfectly situated. Vanessa the concierge is awesome. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Magical 44th street. What New York is all about. A 2-minute walk to Grand Central Station, to Times Square, to Bryant Park or to 5th Avenue. Smack in the center of the Theater District. The Iroquois is next door to fabulous Boulud's bistro and to the best martini in Manhattan (the Algonquin Lobby -- sorry Iroquois!) And yet, Inside your Iroquois room, you can't even hear the buzz of New York. Very quiet (can't even hear the elevators if your room is right in front of them), clean, cosy rooms, with a staff that makes you feel right at home. Don't forget to chime in on the vibraphone when you check in: it brings good luck.

Rooms are great, location is fantastic, breakfast delicious, bathroom amenities are Brown Molten, staff are amazing, but we got a room on second floor next to an events room - totally not sound proof and late at night with kids screaming was extremely annoying and inconsiderate!!!! Make sure to ask the question.

This hotel is a charming, boutique style hotel with warm, friendly service, small but comfortable rooms and is located within walking distance to Time Square, Broadway, Central Park, and 5th Avenue.We stayed for 4 nights, and really enjoyed ourselves. The service we received right from the start was exceptional, especially Rocky, who went out of his way to make us feel welcome!The bathrooms perhaps could do with a little bit of a makeover, but the beds are comfortable and the rooms have nice lighting and feel very private and secure. We stayed in a room at the rear of the hotel (away from the main road) and it was very quiet.Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel. It is quintessentially New York!

My fiancé and I had stayed at the Iroquois Hotel before in NYC and had a great experience. But this time around, we booked another hotel and we were very disappointed. So we checked out of there and went back to the Iroquois Hotel. Lisa at the front desk was extremely accommodating and friendly. She booked us a room on the spot and even gave us an upgrade as we told our tale of woe about our other hotel experience. The staff is excellent and we cannot say enough good things about this hotel. From now on when we visit NYC, we will not stay anywhere else.

We often choose The Iroquois when staying in New York and have never been disappointed. Recently they have been running some attractive rate promotions and specials. Consider them for your next stay in NYC.

We had an outstanding stay. Thank you and your team for contributing to enhance our stay. The Iroquois is my favorite hotel. it is always a pleasure to stay there. Wish I could visit more often. The library with the computer equipment is very beneficial. I was able to read my work e-mails every day; thereby making my return to work easier.

Great little hotel with friendly staff. Apart from the water pressure being a little low everything was very nice. Great beds! We did not try the breakfast or the restaurant. We loved the free walking tours offered to guests in different parts of New York surrounding the areas where the Triumph hotels are situated.

Everything positive said about this hotel is right. Great staff, very clean, fab location. Rooms are well equipped too. BUT unless you book a suite, the view from your room will be a brick wall because as an older hotel the rooms are built round light wells. This is a bit of a deal breaker for me.I asked Kia at reception if there were alternatives and she was very helpful and showed me what was available but basically the rooms suffered the same problem but were just higher up.Two other things to note This is a hotel about to be doubled in size. And the rooms are changing too..we were lucky enough to be in refurbished rooms which are lovely especially when decorated cream and not grey. But they still can't disguise the fact that you feel as if you are sleeping in a cave.

Right next door in fact.....and not the other Native American named hotel... But the other one on the other side.... And I was unhappy there. I checked out the Iroquois and was pleasantly surprised at the value for money. The food for my room service dinner was excellent- the bed was comfortable- and my check out and ride to the airport (with the immediate help of their concierge) was streamlined and stress free. I'll definitely stay again!

We stayed here on a quick 3 day stay in New York in late may early June. It was my first stay in New York so we decided to stay in Mid town so we had easy access to most of the attractions. With times square and the Rockefeller centre minutes away it was an easy choice. If you are staying for a show Broadway is right around the corner too. The rooms were tidy and a good size for a metropolitan city, and our room had a great view of the Chrysler building. There was free coffee available for takeout every-morning which was really helpful until we got used to the 'over the top' Starbucks ordering system in America. Our concierge was also fantastic. He helped us choose some great places to go and visit in Brooklyn, and also pointed out some great restaurants to eat in. When we returned he showed genuine interest in our choices so he could help to inform other guests was great. Transport was was also really great - To and from JFK was easy with the E line, 5-10 minutes away at 42 Port Authority (Then 50 minutes or so to JFK), and travel around New York was really easy too. For a first stay or a show in New York i wouldn't recommend anywhere else if you could afford it.

We stayed at the Iroquois recently on a long weekend. Great choice! The staff was very accommodating and Mallory at the front desk was a champ and gave us an upgrade when I realized that the queen bed was going to be too small. The bed was very comfy and the hotel quiet, I have never had such a good sleep in a hotel before. The location was perfect you could walk to everything. I regret that we did not get a chance to try the restaurant or lounge. The one issue we had was finding outlets to charge our devices, but it is an older building and sometimes you have to make sacrifices for charm. Would definitely go again.

The staff at the Iroquois were accommodating, responsive and friendly. As my husband and I were celebrating our 10th anniversary during our stay, we were upgraded to a deluxe king room, which we greatly appreciated. We were also treated to wine and chocolates during our stay. It's those little things that can make an experience even more special.The hotel itself is perfectly located - a few minutes' walk to Times Square, Bryant Park and theatres, plenty of landmarks and great restaurants nearby, and close to several subway stations. We found it very easy to get to anywhere from the hotel. The street itself is quite quiet, and we had no noise issues in the room, despite the proximity to busy areas. Our room was just the right size, although anything smaller might be a tight squeeze. This is Midtown Manhattan, however, where rooms tend to be on the smaller size. The room was kept very clean and had all the amenities one could need. Any small requests (ice, extra hangers) were fulfilled quickly and graciously. The air conditioning worked very well - an important plus, as the heat and humidity were high that week - and the bed was extremely comfortable.We didn't have a chance to try Triomphe, but the menu looked great. We did try The Lantern's Keep, where I was slightly disappointed to find they don't stock vodka. At all. Huh. Lovely place, though.I did a lot of research before choosing the Iroquois, and am glad I did. The price was competitive, and it had everything we were looking for in a Manhattan hotel. I would recommend booking on their SLH web site, which definitely offered the best deal when I was searching.Overall, I would highly recommend the Iroquois for those wanting a nice boutique hotel in a central, convenient location, where you will be treated like royalty. A special shout-out to Seth, who made a point of making our stay special.

3 day short break, excellent room, friendly staff, central location, easy walking distance to Times Square and 5th Avenue. Only thing lacking are ice machines but Room Service will bring ice if requested.

I stayed here for a weekend trip to NYC in July and would recommend this to anyone looking for a nice, centrally located hotel in the city. Room size was ample, bed was good, and the guest services were excellent. We spent most of our weekend in the SoHo, Village and Chelsea areas, all of which were a short cab ride or walk from our hotel.

This hotel was clean, comfortable, and very clean. The staff was helpful and very friendly. The price is great for the convenient location. We ordered online so we got the free continental breakfast which was good. At night after the play we had a drink at the hotel bar. The hotel was very quiet and private. We would definitely come here again!

Perfect located, only a few steps to Times Square, Grand Central Station and most of the sightseeing hot spots. Staff is very polite, the room was spacious and quiet. Continental Breakfast was ok. We enjoyed...

My daughter and I spent 4 nights at the Iroquois last week and we had a great time. The hotel is in the perfect location: two blocks from the subway and Bryant Park and just several blocks from Times Square if that insanity is your thing. We had a double room and it was newly remodeled and cute. The bathroom has Molton Brown bath products which are awesome. The linens on the bed are suuuuuper soft. There are strawberries at the desk every day along with coffee and lemon water in the lobby daily. The best part? The service. It's unreal. Everyone is friendly, welcoming, and always looking for opportunities to help you. I'll be back for sure. Iroquois is a slam dunk!!

We stayed in a queen room, which was perfectly fine for my daughter's and my needs. The front desk staff remembered our names! Everyone was very helpful with anything we needed. A bit pricey but not too bad for midtown Manhattan. Would definitely stay there again.

First visit to New York and chose The Iroquois based on reviews! We arrived at 215AM and was greeted by both bellman and reception staff! All staff were very helpful and friendly at all hours!! Room was impeccably clean although small, but I understand that Is a NYC thing! Only thing that was a very small negative- there is very little room in bathroom for make-up & toiletries! Bed was comfy. Air con worked well. 2 elevators got us to our top floor (level12) room. Room was quiet. Fab location - easy walk everywhere & to subways etc. 2 computers + printer in common library. Free coffee in morning in Lobby. All up was a really really great stay - I'd definitely go back!!

Clean, affordable, at a great location in the city, friendly staff, and enjoyable stay. I couldn't ask for a better experience, and I'm glad I made this place my choice. This place comes highly recommended on the websites it's listed.

Stayed at the Iroquois for 5 nights in July and really enjoyed it. Great location Midtown on W44th and 6th. We were very fortunate to be allocated room 1200 on arrival which just happened to have a terrific view of the Chrysler building! The room was lovely, we were very pleased. We had stayed at the Refinery (38th) the week previous and it was good (we gave this a good review too) but the Iroquios was better in our opinion. Great, friendly, helpful staff, including concierge. Wine, strawberries and chocolates in our room on arrival as we had advised upon booking that but was our 1st anniversary trip. Nice touch and much appreciated. Free NY Times on our door every morning, Molton Brown toiletries every day - other touches that separate the Iroquois from others. We loved it and would/will make it our first choice if/when we make it back to Manhattan.

An hotel that despite being located in the epi centre of NY, close to Theatres, Times Square and 5th Avenue offers a peaceful and calm sanctuary. The Iroquois is boutique in every sense of the word. The standard rooms, ( we stayed in 1104 at the front of the property) are compact but not small and contain every amenity of the larger Brand hotels. Quality comes through with things including Frette cotton sheets and bathrobes and a nice selection of toiletries from Molton Brown. However, and as usual, a hotels character and individuality is an outcome of its staff. It's in this area that the Iroquois excels. The doormen, reception staff and room maids were all genuinely interested in providing great service but for us the stand out staff member was the concierge who was quite simply fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble and her knowledge of all things NY was outstanding. Make sure you visit the cocktail bar located on the ground floor. A great atmosphere, great cocktails and for reasons best known to the management the biggest ice cubes one could imagine.Overall the best value for money of any hotel we have stayed in. You may also like to try a restaurant/cafe named Un, Deux Trois just 200 metres from the Iroquois. Great breakfast and prompt service.

The hotel is in the city Center Only metres to Times square.All of the hotels workers are very friendly from the check in to check out They were very helped us. It is a classical hotel old but very good. Protected. Wi fi was free. The Roma'nda batarım wa very Clean .

Awesome hotel!!!!!! The location (near Bryant Park) is central to everything midtown. Very helpful staff & the room was very clean - great amenities. Will definitely re-visit. Thanks for a great stay!!!!!!!!!!
user_name:
mks21
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Hotel was reasonably priced for New York city. It was close to Times Square and we were able to walk to mostly everything or get to a subway stop. Room size was adequate. Service was very good. Added touch of coffee in the lobby in the morning, cold water in the afternoon and strawberries at the front desk was much appreciated. I would definitely go back.

After 8 nights in The Iroquois my familý and I were very happy. Location was excellent, close to everything, but still a quiet street. The room ( James Dean Suite) was very spacious, the masterbed very comfortable, the staff very friendly and extremely helpfull, let me emphasize Seth, and the concierges Bill and Vanessa. The hotel bar: Lanterns Keep was excellent and deserves all the good reviews it has received ("10 sexiest hotelbars", "30 bars you have to visit") Alll in all:: awesome!

My first visit to NYC there's a reason why I chose the Iroquois (after looking it up of course on TripAdvisor).The location just near TimesSquare is fabulous (which has its price but it's worth it)When at first I got a room which was a little small and no view (250 sq ft) I have requested to upgrade to one with a bigger space and got for additional 30$/ night a brand new renovated room with a view to the front (ask for room 204).Furthermore they allow you to shower in the fitness room after checkout for red eyes (like ours).I'll be definitely returning

Hotel is in a great location. Close to Times Square (but not too close where you are always tangled in the crowds), Rockefeller center, 5th Ave shopping and grand central. Room was tiny but adequate..

First time in NY for a week and on my own I wanted a good Hotel ,central location with restaurant and bar ,room service and doorman and safety .this hotel ticked all the boxes ..room was facing the back of hotel and extremely quiet 11th floor (I think ) .2 lifts and hardly ever waited .room service quick and efficient .close to Times Square and theaters ,I walked everywhere from here ,local English pub towards TS was great for a meal and drink (long room ? ) would stay again

Excellent location, friendly and efficient staff, quiet rooms. This hotel is on the small size making service more personal. Nice classic furnishings. Rooms are a good size for New York. Stayed in a suite here once which was huge.

**Given a beautify room upgrade from the 2nd night of stay (stayed 4 nights). **Easy access to shopping area and attractions. Nice hotel and friendly check-in staff. Thanks again for the beautiful room.

We had a wonderful time at your hotel as always. The best service and the room is always nice. On the visit, we lost a cell phone and Vanessa Torruellas chef concierge help us so much in locating it. We left the phone in the yellow cab and Vanessa contact them at once and report the lost with an on-line claim. She also contacted to location visited and notified the lost and found at the World trade center. She was wonderful. Your hotel is lucky to have such a resourceful employee. We also located the phone. Thank you for your outstanding services. Hope to be back soon.Loan and Ted

Excellent location with a clean and quiet room. Easy walking to everything! Front desk staff could have been more welcoming. The cocktails in the Lantern's Keep were amazing! We would stay there again.

Stayed July 4 - July 7 - very convenient to most Manhattan sights. Entire Iroquois team members make one feel welcome and appreciated. Iroquois Hotel just the right size - have stayed here numerous times and look forward to future stays.

We loved this hotel. It was close to Times Square and very close to the train station. It was very quiet at night and we were able to get a good nights sleep. The food in the restaurant was very good and the service was great. We will stay here again for sure.

This hotel has beautiful rooms is very clean and close to all amenities. I would highly recommend it. I will definitely go back!! If you want to got to great restaurants and shop and want valet parking this hotel is for you.

The Iroquois hotel is a little slice of understated calm in the middle of New York. Beautifully located between 5th Ave and Broadway you are ideally placed to explore the delights of New York.Our rooms were of a good size (we had three on three different floors) with a high level of finish made them a good base to work from.The discretion of the housekeeping staff meant that we never saw any of the maids but they did there job well with the rooms being made up properly.I am sure some rooms have a view but none of ours did apart from a wall but hey we were only there to sleep. If I wanted a view of Manhattan I only had to step outside.The lobby guys were really friendly and helpful and a credit to the hotel.We didn't eat in the hotel as it was expensive 20 dollars for breakfast but I'm sure it would be good but with diners all around we choose to eat out.All in all a good hotel that helped to make the holiday memorable

The hotel was well-kept, the room was very clean and nicely appointed, though a bit dark in terms of the lighting. Given it was the July 4th weekend, the restaurant was closed so we could not judge that. We have already booked again since we do find it to be a very excellent hotel overall, especially for a theater visit to NYC.

These rooms are small, but very nice. The staff was wonderful and very helpful! This is also in a great location. Walking distance to Broadway and Time Square...even better, a subway station is a block away that you can use to get all over the place. This is a great hotel and can assure you that we will be staying here every time we visit New York. Highly recommend!!

This hotel has an excellent location. You can go many places walking. But depending on the room you pay is possible you cannot have the possibility of view the street and the only views were a brick wall.On the other side, the shower wasn't work properly and some water went out it to the bathroom. Althought we made an advice to the Front Desk we spent the four night with the same problem.Finally, the air conditioned is fixed, so you cann't turn it off.

I love to stay in the area of the Iroquois Hotel, and was delighted to stay there for the first time. The staff were friendly and helpful and we liked the smaller size of the hotel. For sightseeing and catching a show - you cannot beat the great service and terrific location!

Our first time to NYC, and we had such a great time. Everyone at the Iroquois are so nice and helpful. Vanessa really knows her stuff. She told us exactly how to go and what subway to take. We didn't have to lift a finger with our luggage or getting our car. Best staff ever!

My mom and I stayed for 5 nights at the Iroquois Hotel last week and we couldn't have asked for a better hotel. The service was simply outstanding. From the doorman, housekeeping, concierge, restaurant staff, front desk - all so friendly, welcoming and helpful. They couldn't do enough for us! The rooms are spacious, very clean, modern, beds very comfortable. The hotel is older but very well maintained and kept up to date. The gym was nice, just what you need to get a good work out in. The restaurant was a bit pricy but we loved the food and service so much we dined there 4 mornings. The location was perfect. Close to everything. In the mornings and evenings there's a nice bowel of fresh strawberries at the front desk for guests passing by. In the evenings housekeeping drops off chocolates and the weather for the next day. I really felt like the staff really appreciated our business. We were treated like royalty! We will defiantly be returning to this hotel.

Checking in staff very courteous and helpful.The rooms are nice but small if accommodating more than two people. We had to have a chair removed from the room for our suitcases. The room could also have more lighting.The location is great, close to Times Square and the Theatre district.

This place was great, people who work there are fabulous. Location is perfect, nice block and close to lots of things. Including public transportation -- you can get to anywhere in the city easily. Comfy and private. Plus the NY Times every day!

We stayed at the Iroquois for 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.For first time visitors to New York we were slightly overwhelmed by NY city but the excellent expertise of the concierge was so helpful. He even walked us to a bar instead of giving us complicated directions.We loved our free walking tour provided by the hotel. Definitely worth going on to get some interesting facts about NY that you might not otherwise know. And did I mention it was free?We were within walking distance to times square, 5th avenue and metro station. Perfect location for our first trip to NY.

The room was very comfortable and clean. It was quiet we were on top floor (I had put in a special request from this). Nice Molton Brown toiletries, dressing gowns etc Small room as expected however it had everything we needed. Staff were very friendly. It was my daughters 30th birthday and there was a nice card and plate of strawberries and chocolates in the room as well as some wine.Room was quite dark. However that was the only negative point.

I first want to start off by saying ALL of the staff is WONDERFUL! I cannot speak highly enough of he bellman, Jason or Josh, I believe his name was. Unfortunately, the hotel restaurant is not open on Saturdays. I am a diabetic, and needed something immediately to eat. So, the young man went to the kitchen, and made me an egg salad sandwich. It cost nearly $20. When I told him I really didn't want to pay that much for an egg salad sandwich, he reached into his pocket, and offered me $20 to pay for it. He knew I was diabetic, and didn't want me to have to wait for a delivery to my room. I, of course, declined the offer. But, his kindness filled my heart. Never has something like this ever happened.On the iffy side, the room was quite small. However, I was only in the city for one night; so, I suppose it was not a big deal. I like the fact that there are doorbells for each room, and the there is a do not disturb switch attached to it. When you flip the switch, it mutes the bell, and flashes a neon sign saying do not disturb. Thought that was cool. There was an issue with my first room, but that was resolved in a matter of minutes, and I was given another.Overall, my stay was extremely pleasant, and I would most definitely recommend this hotel.

We had a wonderful visit to NYC and the Iroquois was the perfect hotel for us! Close to all the shows we were going to, shopping, and great places to eat! The staff was very helpful and arranged our airport transportation for us.

Overall stay was good. Very small rooms but I guess it's the average size hotel room in Manhattan. Didn't have room service as it was a bit too pricey. Location is great it's down the block from the 7th Avenue action in Times Square.

Room not huge but very clean and only 5-10 minutes to times square. In close proximity to empire state and top of the rock. Overall I would recommend this hotel. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly.

Really enjoyed our stay at the Iroquois and would not hesitate to stay there again. Initial room issues were resolved quickly having spent the first night on the 4th floor near a noisy lift shaft - we were moved without question to a room in the 12th floor where we were completely satisfied. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean and well maintained. The staff throughout were friendly and attentive. We didn't use the hotel restaurant as there was so much else on the doorstep to explore & enjoy. Recommended to all & I do plan to return to the Iroquois hopefully sooner rather than later! (And Molton Brown toiletries which are always a winner in my book!!)
user_name:
Debw555
Welwyn Garden City, United Kingdom

review_body: I really liked this hotel. The staff were great (especially the doormen who were beyond attentive) and the location was perfect. It was very close to all the theatres yet far enough away from the crowds that you didn't feel like you were mere minutes from Times Square. It's also within walking distance to Central Park, 34th Street and practically anywhere and if you don't like walking, subway stations are nearby. The area felt very safe which is extremely important to me. There are several restaurants close by and an all-night CVS around the corner that also had some groceries which was really convenient. As for the room, it was nicely furnished. It could've been a bit brighter and there could've been more outlets but it was a good size and comfortable. My only complaint was the heating system made an intermittent noise during the night which sometimes was a nuisance, depending on how often it did that and at what time it occurred.....minor complaint though. Overall a great stay and I'd definitely stay there again!

The hotel is beautiful, historic, in a great area and I really had a very, very quiet room. Just don't order the coffee. And know that the top few floors have previously been smoking and if you are sensitive to that, choose lower floor rooms. I LOVE the Lantern's Keep. Very friendly, creative and welcoming.

My husband and I just completed a 3 night stay at the Iroquois, NYC. The service was excellent and pleasant but the room was extremely small. The location, though, was excellent 4 yrs ago on a visit to NYC we stayed at the Jewell hotel close to Rockefeller Center which had a much larger room but the location was not central Unfortunately, with the Iroquois, you sacrifice size for location

Hotel was very nice. Staff are excellent including the concierge. He was able to find me a last minute ticket for An Act of God with Jim Parsons on the same night. Room was average, I had expected more for the price, especially as I had booked a premier room. A bit dark but very comfortable. Bed was excellent. I had a problem on the morning of checkout with the shower, and it seemed the staff were more worried about the room and bathroom rather than my welfare.Dining is superb at Triomphe and at Lantern's Keep. The bar is a hidden gem.

We enjoyed our stay at the Iroquois. The staff was friendly and helpful in every way. The location is also convenient to Times Squares and the theatre district. The only negative feature is that the rooms, both sleeping room and bath, are quite small. I guess that is to be expected in an older hotel, but it was a little difficult for two people to manage. It would be great for one person.

Nice boutique hotel in Theatre District. Standard rooms are small, but clean and efficient. Concierge is most helpful. Coffee provided in the lobby. Staff is friendly and welcoming. A nice place to stay if you are seeing a show.
user_name:
Mary Lou C
Lake Grove, New York

review_body: A lovely hotel in a great location convenient to all the Broadway theaters, Times Square and Rockafeller Center. Hotel is clean and rooms are quiet. Couldn't hear any street noise from our room. Vanessa at the concierge desk is a gem who genuinely cares about her guests enjoying their stay and strives to help any way she can. Would definitely stay here again.

Went to NYC in late May with my mother-in-law and two kids (6 & 8) and had booked two rooms with 2 double beds in each room. My mother-in-law is very particular about places to stay and was very pleased with The Iroquois. The hotel was up to her standards. It is a small, cozy hotel and clean, comfortable and quiet with great beds. They were very accommodating and had us staying on the same floor down the hall from one another. The location is wonderful...walking distance to Bryant Park, Times Square and Rockefeller Center. The morning coffee and afternoon flavored water in the lobby is a nice touch, my kids liked finding out the flavors each afternoon. Also, love that the WI-fi is complimentary. The bellman was very helpful when we were heading back to the airport in finding us a cab in the rain which is very hard to do at times. This was my second time staying at the Iroquois with my kids. It will continue to be my (and now my mother-in-law's) 'go to' when heading up there with them and will definitely recommend to others.

Very friendly, helpful staff who (unlike other places we have stayed) in don't make it obvious they are looking for a tip. Our room was on the tenth floor and very quiet. Good size by NY standards, huge and very comfortable bed. It's not cheap but we appreciated the free and efficient wifi, very well stocked bathroom and nightly turn down with chocs. The air conditioning was very good AND quiet. The Lantern bar makes great cocktails.

hotel stuff are all friendly and happy to help.excellent locationnice and causey room.many attractions close to the hoteluseful concierge that helps you get tickets to whatever show, game, or museum you desire

This is a lovely hotel, centrally located, and in a very good area (very convenient!) It is an older hotel, but is well appointed. The rooms are quiet and the beds are incredibly comfortable. My complaint is w/the level of service, I had made several requests (minor things) prior to arrival, and they were completely ignored. When I again made the request upon checking-in (ask for an electric tea kettle to heat water for tea!), it was again ignored and my request was NEVER met (not good!) I will stay again, but they really need to step up the service!

Lovely little hotel, very central, but not noisy. Nice bedroom, well stocked bathroom. A very pleasant stay in NYC. Would have liked tea & coffee making facilities in the room. It was our wedding anniversary whilst we were there and the hotel kindly put wine and chocolates in the room, which was a nice touch.

Great location, service, beautiful and a solid value! It has become our favorite NYC hotel. Lovely accommodations with attention to every detail. Elegant lounge and restaurant, La Triomphe. Manager even sent us wine and chocolates for our anniversary!

I stayed one night in June 2015 while in NYC on business. Most notably, I enjoyed the location in Midtown on 44th. I also found the property effective at deploying little extras to make guests feel welcomed and comfortable during their stay. Point in case: Upon arriving, there were plates of strawberries and fruit-infused water at the check-in desk. As I was checked in, I was given a welcome letter that detailed the property's amenities. And as I got to my room about 7:00 p.m., turn down service had already occurred, with chocolates left on the pillow and the Bose stereo softly playing. The room itself (605) was small, but it had all the necessities and luxuries you'd expect for the price and location, including a desk area, free wifi, flat-screen television, minibar with beverages and dry goods, safe, iron/ironing board and nice, terry cloth robes for guest use. The bed and linens were comfortable, and the bathroom, while compact, was nicely appointed and fully tiled. (Side note: great shower pressure!)I didn't dine in the hotel or make use of the fitness facility, unfortunately, but I did enjoy the library with complimentary computer access and printers. Tip: Elevator C is larger and faster than Elevator B. :-)
user_name:
Cory C
Nashville, Tennessee, United States

review_body: reasonably priced, but there was musty odor, and you are unable to control the temperature in room individually it's central air throughout. there is not auto, on or off mode avail. Service is excellent and the Lantern's keep bartenders are great

Conveniently located just off Times square, the Iroquois was a very convenient, comfortable, hotel to stay for a visit to the Theater District & the Times Square Area. Rooms were reasonable, and the staff was very friendly, helpful, and professional. The rooms were a bit dated with limited space, particularly in the bath, i.e. One person at a time & that's it, but no smaller than most other down-town NYC hotels. All in all, I'd certainly stay there again while visiting the Times Square area! Kudos to the staff. They were great.

Excellent location of the hotel. Very nice friendly staff. The only downside is that the rooms need to be maintained better. We very much enjoyed staying at the hotel but as mentioned the rooms need to be maintained better and in my view there is a lack of supervision/checking of the room prior to guest checking in.

The Iroquois is a gem and provides a calm oasis within the Theater district and is about four blocks from Times Square, which is just far enough to leave the craziness behind. The restaurant was great for both breakfast and dinner. The wait staff was very helpful and accommodated my spouse's need to eat gluten free, including GF bread and multiple dining options. The Chef proudly took us on a tour of their rooftop organic garden and honey making operation. It was clear he took great pride in his staff and restaurant. This was by far the best place we have stayed in New York! Can't wait to return.

I stayed for two nights and wished it were longer! Everyone I encountered was friendly and helpful. The hotel is quite charming and I loved that it was so intimate. The location is perfect, a quick walk to Times Square and the theatres nearby as well as shopping on 5th Avenue and more! I would absolutely keep this spot in mind when visiting NY in the future. I was in room 200 which was right near the elevator but was still relatively quiet.

A great boutique hotel. Treat yourself to the Premier Rooms they are much bigger and in quieter locations on the inner courtyard. The bar and the restaurant look superb though we did not have time to use them. Also the little library inside the front door with complimentary tea and coffee all day was great. Terrific too is the wifi.Thank you for such a wonderful stay. This was our 6th visit to New York and was the first at the Iroquois. I rather suspect it wont be our last.

Having to stay in a nice friendly hotel in the center of a busy city like NYC really make ones trip very memorable. Our first time in this hotel. We came for a long weekend to see a play, did some tourist "stuff" and of course a bit of shopping too. The hotel is so central that it makes doing all these things possible without having to get a cab. We would like to stay here again next time.

loved the Hotel Iroquois. it was in a great location, walking distance to everywhere in Manhattan and the staff could not do enough for you, everyone we approached was very helpful. Will definitely stay here again

I know it's New York and I didn't expect a lot of space or value but they aren't even trying to please guests. Our room wasn't ready and when we finally came back and checked in I was told the full bed I was looking at in the "superior room" was "definitely a Queen bed". We had a wonderful view of a brick wall, and there was almost no coffee left in the lobby when we arrived. The gym is horribly small and with well placed mirrors they made it seem larger on the website. The staff didn't seem to care I was upset, didn't offer any solutions or chance of upgrade. The location is alright but not great. Overall it's a pretty poor excuse for a boutique hotel, I would never stay here and won't recommend it. The only saving grace are nice bathrooms - but when you expect to rest and relax after sightseeing this isn't the place to do it. I am actually really disappointed and had higher hopes.

We stayed in June for 4 nights at the Iroquois and were so glad we did. Firstly the location, it was ideal for us. Less than a five minute walk to Times Square we were perfectly placed near transport (5-10 minutes from Grand Central Station) and all the major central New York attractions.The cleaning staff did the room twice a day, to a very high standard. The reception staff were always helpful, the bellboy and other staff were always friendly and really went out of their way to make our holiday such a fantastic experience. We didn't experience the restaurant or speakeasy bar but other people who did were very complimentary.It isn't the biggest or most glamorous hotel, the rooms are cosy as opposed to spacious however the quality was very high. The little touches likes the luxurious dressing robes to the 'molton brown' toiletries show attention to detail and quality vs quantity.Would recommend to family and friends alike.

A very good boutique hotel near the theatre district and Time Square. A good place 5 minutes walk away is good for breakfast as restaurant prices are a little high, plus plenty of eating places close by.Have stayed there before and will again if we return to NY.our room faced the street so occasional noise from emergency vehicles at night.the concierge was excellent and very helpful and friendly.

Quiet and well positioned location for great access to various venues in NYC. Fabulous front desk service and concierge very helpful. Rooms very comfortable and great value for price. Nice intimate bar setting .

Recently stayed 4 nights. Outstanding location, convenient but quiet. Very comfortable rooms and attentive service. Smaller hotel, which is a plus. Guests don't get lost in the shuffle. WiFi is included with room, complimentary newspapers and coffee are a welcome touch. Excellent concierge. This is our new, "go-to" hotel in the city. Definitely recommend.
user_name:
TallyTraveler100
North Carolina Mountains, North Carolina

review_body: Proposed to my future wife here. Entire staff was more than willing and helpful to make it a flawless event. Entire building from top to bottom is spotless and this is the only place I will stay from now on. Obviously will always have a place in our hearts. Thank you Iroquois!!!

Fabulous place! Great location, good room and bathroom (fairly small but that's to be expected in New York), plenty of hot water and Molton Brown toiletries, a big bowl of fruit and coffee at reception (great for a quick breakfast) and lovely chocolates in the pillows. The staff are brilliant - absolutely everyone from bellboys, front desk staff to concierge were really friendly, extremely helpful as well as being efficient and professional. We stayed for 5 nights in June and never had to queue at either the front desk or for the concierge and everyone was great at giving us directions for the subway or finding addresses for us. Would definitely stay again. One slight concern might be that although there is air-conditioning, there's no separate temperature control for each room, just an air-flow control. It wasn't particularly hot weather whilst we were there so it was perfect for us, but as we like a cold room it might be more of a problem in a heatwave.

Recently, four of us stayed at this hotel for a weekend. From the moment we entered, the staff was welcoming and attentive. All the rooms are spotless and the beds were most comfortable. The concierge (Bill )gave us excellent recommendations. Complimentary coffee in the lobby was a plus. The location is absolutely fantastic. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you plan on going to the theater. I plan on staying here to my next visit to the city

Fantastic location for Times Square, theater, mid town restaurants, shopping on 5th and Madison Aves, Rockefeller Center, and easy access to subways for city sporting events or just for getting around.A very comfortable and professional hotel with excellent on-site cocktail bar, super staff, cozy rooms, and an outstanding suite. The restaurant looks great too, just haven't had the opportunity to eat there yet since I'm always running about in the cityThis is where I stay in NYC. I'll be back!

Perfect location! Rooms are comfortable and clean. Staff was very friendly and made sure you had everything you needed. Andrea and Josh at Laterns Keep are the best! Looking forward to my next visit!!

Best hotel in the theater district. Close to all Broadway shows and restaurants. The rooms are immaculate and comfortable. The staff is helpful and pleasant. Will definitely stat again our next trip into NYC.

Mine and my husband's first trip to New York, everyone was very friendly from check in to check out. we even had an employee offer to drive us to a rental car place on his day off. Very pleasant and accommadating.

Reviewing a little late for my Feb stay. This was my fourth visit to NYC and my second stay at The Iroquois. Previous trip was with friends this time was with my husband and another couple. I again stayed in a excutive king suite as I was able to secure a fantastic deal for my dates through a cyber monday sale. All the staff at the Iroquois were fantastic but in particular the door men who always have a smile on their face even when outside in the freezing Feb weather assisting us. Due to staying in the suite rooms with lots of space and plenty of amenties I did not have any issues. The hotel does have some age which adds to its character but in some cases, some rooms may need a freshen up when reading other reviews.This hotel is in a great central location, two blocks walk from Times Square (but in quiet location) and midpoint if wanting to travel downtown or uptown walking or on the subway.I have rated this hotel as Excellent again due to central location, great staff, cleanliness, quality of the suite rooms, quality of amenities (Molton Brown products) and I paid a very reasonable rate for my stay through the cyber sale.I will be travelling to NYC again in Jan 16 with my extended family and although I do generally like to experience different hotels and areas I will be sure to check avaialbitly with the Iroquois first.

Hi there - we stayed at the Iroquois this weekend for a couples' getaway. We only had two nights and lots of stuff crammed into the visit. Everything at the hotel from the start was perfect - even though we had one of the smaller, cheaper rooms (as we booked last minute). At no point were we ever meant to feel 'second class' (which can happen when you're in the baby rooms) - far from it....The front desk service was swift and warmly welcoming. We were able to get into our room right away even though we were a few hours early. There was nightly turn down and towel refresh and polite service from housekeeping on the one evening when we were in the room getting ready for the theatre. The hotel provided everything you could think of - coffee in the lobby in the morning, strawberries in the afternoon. Quick suggestions from the concierge and fantastic service from the door man.At night, the best part was the room quiet - you literally blocked out the noise of NY when you closed your door (now - we had an internal facing room - so no view, but dead quiet - that's a trade off I would always choose).There was a personal touch to the visit very quickly (desk staff, doormen and concierge were the same through the weekend) - warm hellos without being in your face. The best part was we were there for the Puerto Rican day parade (staging right on 44th street). We received a letter the night before from the concierge, warning us if we had travel plans and offering to help - the hotel staff was both 'into' the New York moment and yet kept the lobby quiet and clean. It was an added bonus event that we didn't even know was coming.We will totally book again (I am not even mentioning how perfect the location - so close to Times Square and the park and shopping and so much quieter than other mid-town hotels we've stayed at.

Finding a nice hotel in NYC, especially one that is reasonably priced, is never an easy task. This hotel was highly recommended by a mutual friend, and my wife and I just stayed there for three nights. We were very impressed! First, the staff could not have been nicer. From the people at the front desk, to housekeeping, to the Concierge, everyone was excellent and took a genuine interest in answering questions and helping you. Special thanks to Bill (the Concierge) who was more than patient with us, and helped plan our travels in the City. The location is great, the room was very nice, modern, well furnished, and the price was very reasonable for the level of service provided. Overall, a great experience, and we know where to stay the next time we visit the City

Excellent hotel and excellent service with good location and excellent personnel at the service of the guest. This is my first time in this Hotel and my husband and me are very satisfied with the assistant. It's a very clean and neat place to be there.

From the moment you walk into the hotel you feel like you are staying with old friends. Rooms were impeccably clean, we heard no outside noises and had a lovely view of 44th Street. Staff was caring and friendly. We got there early, before noon and they held our luggage and told us to come back in an hour and our room would be ready. When we came back the room was ready as promised. We left again and when we came back in the evening there were amazing chocolates from Le Belge Chocolatier in Napa, CA left on our pillow. A delicious and delightful treat!! Only hotel in the city I will ever stay at. This is my second time at this hotel and it won't be my last!!!

The rooms were small as expected but the location was perfect. Walked to MSG, Theater District, and the Met. The staff were very helpful with restaurant reservations and walking directions. Reasonable price for the location and services.

My family of three adults and an 11 year old stayed one night in rooms 1000 and 1007 at a nightly rate of $211. What a great value! The rooms were clean and beautiful, the location was excellent for the Shubert Theater in Times Square, and the service was very good. The only thing it lacked was a hair dryer, the complimentary lemon water in the lobby (we only saw the coffee), and a view. Relative to Hotel Mela and the Mansfield, the rooms were spacious. We ate breakfast at Triomphe downstairs, which was delicious. It would be great to have a breakfast package. We will stay here again!

Steps away from the Broadway, Times Square, NY library, Radio City, Rockefeller Center, etc. Lovely little boutique hotel. Personalized touches included a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates, with an employee dropping off more delicious chocolates in the evening. Very friendly staff. Room small but adequate for 1 or 2 people - too small for kids! Stayed over on a Sunday night and the price was excellent!

Stayed in New York before at chain hotel and although rooms were slightly bigger I much preferred the experience I had at the Iroquois. We had family holiday for special birthday which I made the concierge aware of in advance and also provided some alternative options. They did not disappoint and exceeded expectations. All staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Rooms were cleaned every day and kept spotless. For me I much preferred this hotel due to the atmosphere created and the staff and would definitely stay again.

Passed this hotel many times. I don't recall it coming up ony corporate travel site befoe but it did this time. I booked it because it was something in the area of 1 Bryant Park and available. So glad it was. Great experience in every way.

Concierge services were excellent. Doormen very friendly. Location fantastic - just outside of the hustle and bustle but close enough for a 5 min walk to Times Square. Room gorgeous and very comfortable

This was our first time to stay at The Iroquois NY and I was impressed by the entire hotel staff, amenities, location, and value. The rooms are quiet and the beds are extremely comfortable. Great stay.

I stayed 13 days in the Iroquois New York . I have enjoyed the excellent service, both at checkin, restaurant, concierge... Professional and friendly staff, always happy to help. The Iroquois is superbly located, close to everything. Rooms are clean, quiet, not really spacious (even for the king size room) , but absolutely perfect for a business traveller. Wifi access was not very good in my room (509), and I was frequently rerouted to the Sofitel network (Sofitel is just next door)
user_name:
Georges L
New York City, New York

review_body: I love the Iroquois. I always try to get the best rate from the Iroquois first before I reluctantly choose another property. The Iroquois is priced appropriately but sometimes I'm on a budget. Patrick Lembo has done a wonderful job assisting me with reservations and anything else I need.

Charming small hotel located close and in walking distance to all the hotspots- theatre, shopping , restaurants, and Times Square! Quiet and safe at night. Suitable for travelling with older relative. Would definitely stay there next time I go!

Had a great stay here. The mid-town location was very convenient, close to plenty of key attractions like 5th Avenue shops and the NY public library. Central Park was not too far a walk either.The common area decor has a comfortable wood-grained, but still well maintained, welcoming feel.Service was excellent and was a great place to return to after a long day of wandering.

I stayed for 3 days at the Iroquois New York and was completely satisfied with my stay there. The location is very central and close to subway, 5th avenue, Times Square etc. The service was excellent and the rooms are clean and cozy. I would totally recommend the Iroquois to my friends and family and I'm sure on my next trip I'm going to stay there again.

We booked this hotel as an Expedia flight & hotel package, purposely choosing somewhere that was not one of the big chain hotels. My partner and I having stayed before in Manhattan, at various locations, found this Midtown hotel to offer the best position for our family's needs. We had a room with two Queen beds, for two adults and a large 12 year old and it was fine. The beds were really comfortable. The room wasn't big, but if you want a large room then you have to pay a lot more (from experience) to get that, especially in New York. If you book a two Queen bed room, that's what you'll get. Also, unless you check into a high rise block hotel, you know you'll have no great view, unless of course you pay for it. This again was not an issue for us. The only real issue I had was the lighting, it was very low.We ate out every day simply because our 12 year old wouldn't have eaten in the main restaurant, but this is easy as there are so many places nearby. A diner is about four shops down from the entrance lobby, just after The Algonquin Hotel. This was a convenient choice on day 1, before you get your bearings.We didn't really use the Concierge much, just to purchase bus tour tickets, but the two staff we saw were really friendly in a genuine way and weren't pushing for business. In fact, the hotel was great in that it was so understated you could come and go and feel like you were in a small apartment building, so unlike one of these 1000 room establishments! Extra highlights are: papers left hanging on your door each morning, umbrellas, a turn down service, flight check in screen in the library, heavy weight bath robes, coffee in the lobby. All in all compared with previous hotel stays in Manhattan this hotel had the most personal service I've noticed, if you so wish to ask for things of course!

This hotel was classy and very convenient located between The Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central Station and the Empire State Building.Close to Shopping, Restaurants, Times Square and Broadway. The room my daughter and I shared had recently been renovated and was lovely.Very quiet with double glazed windows, fast free wifi, beautiful new tiles and carpets.The beds were very comfotable. The water pressure was great.

The Iroquois is a "boutique" hotel; the rooms were nice although small, and probably becoming a bit worn at this point, but we found our room cozy and adequate. Compared to other hotels in this area it was a great value for the money. we would stay here again.

Stayed on the 10th floor in a two bed room as we are a family with 2 adults and toddler. Very comfortable, quiet and clean hotel. Excellent free wifi in the rooms, lovely decor and very comfortable beds and pillows. Quiet with minimal street noise. Great location and excellent super helpful staff - fantastic recommendations for food- very good location a couple of blocks from time square and Bryant park. Fantastic with my daughter and she carried her kids welcome pack around New York - nice touch!

I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel, via an expedia booking. I travelled with another 2 females in my family. Upon arrival at the hotel, my first impression was the reception being small/dark/worn, and I noticed the runner carpet was taped up with duck tape! I was a little more than dissapointed.We were checked in quickly as there was no queue - by a friendly receptionist, and we caught the small lift to our room on the 3rd floor. The hotel is described online as a 'boutique hotel', but in my opinion it is far from this status (it was small yes, in a good location yes, but it was not a high grade hotel).Our room was in the far corner of the hotel, and our view was of the back of other hotel rooms which went up so high we didn't have natural daylight coming in. Considering we paid for 3 adults, I was not particularly amused to see 2 small double beds in the room. I immediately went back to reception about the bed situation, but was told that to upgrade to a bigger room with a kingsize bed and a camp bed, it would be another £400. No thanks!The room itself had 2 beds, a small desk, a small minibar - which didn't get cold, a very grubby brown carpet, a small wardrobe, and a tv. it also had a tiny bathroom, and due to lack of natural light in the room and there only being 3 dimly lit lamps (no ceiling light), we couldn't see very well when we wanted to do hair/make-up.
