The plug sockets were also in a bad position, and i had to crank my neck to get under the desk, onto the floor, to plug in the hairdryer.We didn't let the hotel/room bother us, we had a fantastic time in NY regardless of the small, dark hotel we had booked into because of the great reviews on this site. On the plus side, the hotel is in a perfect location. right on 5th avenue, just a few blocks to the left to rocker feller, and 11 blocks to the right to the left for empire state, 2 blocks straight up to times square, and 7 blocks straight up to the harbour (statue of liberty cruise). The receptionists were all extremely friendly and helpful, the bathroom was stocked with Molton Brown goodies and fluffy robes (but the bath towels were tiny), and the bed was very comfy.We also had umbrellas when it rained, and free coffee in the morning.I would definitely recommend using the hotel airport shuttle for $80 as the car was absolutely luxurious, and the driver was wonderful.I know this review sounds very negative, but I have been to NY before, and always had a much higher standard of accommodation so i did feel let down by this hotel. I would recommend this hotel for small parties/couples only, and for the great location. I would not personally stay here again though as I expect a better standard of hotel accommodation. Finally, if you are going to NY, look into buying city passes (i bought mine on costco for £55 each), as they get you fast entry into top of the rock, empire state, 9/11 memorial museum, statue of liberty cruise, moma, natural history museum. I would also always recommend staying in Midtown to be in walking distance of almost every attraction. And lastly, go to woodbury common outlet centre, via a bus from port authority station for $42, for all your designer shopping needs!

We booked direct through the hotels web site for a Queen bedroom, the first room we were given on the 11th floor had a view of the fire escape stair, not good, a phone call to the front desk and within a few minutes we were upgraded to a King bedroom on the 10th floor, street facing, fantastic service with no fuss. We must say all the staff were absolutely fantastic!!, always a warm welcome when we came back to the hotel. House keeping and turndown staff were exceptional. The room its self was great, good size, lovely comfortable bed. The hotel is in a great location for Times Square, The Port Authority, Empire State Building and for food and shopping. We had an early morning flight and the front desk organised a car for us at 5am at such a reasonable cost. We really enjoyed our stay, and that was really all down to the staff.

We spent an amazing 3 nights at this hotel. Its in such a great central position for everything and the staff are really helpful. We would definitely look at booking here again and recommend this hotel.

the hotel was small but had everything you need it was in a perfect location for all the main sightseeing areas especially broadway shows but it was also very quiet at night a great place to stay, next door is a handy place for breakfast at reasonable prices.

Location is excellent and is matched by superb service in this hidden gem. Rooms are small but very comfortable; beds and linens are all very good quality. The Iroquois provides affordable luxury. Breakfast in the hotel is expensive but there is an excellent traditional diner only minutes away.

This hotel is in a great location for New York for shopping, theater and exploring.The front desk was friendly and efficient. What is great about the hotel is the cleanliness, updated features and brightness throughout the hotel. The hallways are fresh and well lit and the bathrooms fixtures are new. The 2 hotel rooms we were in both had windows in the bathrooms which add some natural light. There was free wifi with the room with coffee available in the lobby in the morning. The rooms are adequate but not gorgeous.The downfall of the hotel was the air-conditioning. We changed rooms because the first one was not cooling. The second room ( different floor) did not cool as well even though the thermostat was set to the lowest point, even suggested by the bellman. If it is hot in New York City, you should be prepared for a room that will probably not be cool at night.
user_name:
stephanie s
Short Hills, New Jersey

review_body: Just returned home from a wonderful 3 night stay here. Everything was spotless and the staff couldn't do enough. Will definitely look at stopping here again. Its such a central hotel and a great base when visiting New York

I really enjoyed my stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and cute. I would definitely recommend this hotel! Had a nice little gym. There are a couple small quaint bars as well that were accomodating.

We were really disappointed with the cleanliness of our room. We have stayed at the Iroquois several times before and were really pleased. However, this stay we were greeted with a greasy handprint on the cloth headboard and carpet that felt sticky to bare feet. We are concerned that this hotel has seen better days and is headed downhill.

We stayed at the Iroquois four nights during middle of May to celebrate my 40th birthday. The hotel could not be in a better location: three blocks from central station, two blocks from most Broadway theater, two blocks from time square. We could get to most boroughs (north, east, west, south) within 15-20 minutes with a combination of subway and walking. We had a king room in the 9th floor overlooking 44th street. It was big enough to support furniture. Bathroom was large and updated. Concierge service was strong and help make hard to find reservations. Overall our experience was a very good one! Price is a big steep but I think the service and location convenience was worth the price.

We experienced the best customer service from every staff member in the entire hotel!Small rooms but that didn't matter as we barely spent time in.I just wish that every GM of every other hotel I've ever stayed at could stay here and experience how above & beyond customer service really should be.Bravo team & hopefully won't be too long until we see you again!

Perfect location...wonderful hotel....this trip 2 missteps on their part.The room A/C was too warm...we were given a fan to help cool the room....we had asked to have the temperature lowered...we still love the hotel.A $35 pot of coffee...was corrected to $17 after I called.

This is our home from home whenever we are in New York and we are never disappointed. Staff are friendly, welcoming and polite, rooms and beds are comfortable and the restaurant is good. The hotel is in a great location for exploring Manhattan and beyond

Loved this hotel and glad we stayed. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location was spot on for the sights and metro. Would definately stay again in the future. Treat yourself and book up.

The hotel and the staff are outstanding--they really go out of their way to ensure you have a great stay. They have great suggestions for restaurants and even coffee. Even when you want to do something unusual they make it happen--we wanted to play bridge and they set up a table for us in the library!

This hotel is close to Times Square, eateries and the subway. I struggled with the air being on at night, but the staff was more than happy to help with this. very friendly and helpful bell staff and front desk attendants. The room was tiny with a wall for a view, but it's New York! Comfortable beds.

Good mid-town location , efficient pleasant professional staff, adequate but not exceptional room, very comfy bed.Did not eat at the Hotel though easy access to a wide range of suitable places to eat drink and relax, similarly didn't use bar or cocktail lounge which was small, crowded and booked for a private function when we tried .
user_name:
mike c
Greater Manchester, United Kingdom

review_body: Well done the Iroquois ! Much of the 'service' in NYC is dreadful, not here. Always done with a smile. Good sized rooms and lovely bathrooms. There is a restaurant attached, but we didn't try it so can't comment on that. Great location and they're happy to give you excellent recommendations on where to go and what to see, where to eat if you haven't pre-booked.

Nice boutique hotel ideally situated on quiet block on 44 th st between grand central to the east and Times Square to the west. Convenient to Broadway theaters and Fifth Ave.shopping. Staff is friendly and helpful.Rooms are on small side but comfortable with remodeled marble bathrooms.Nice bar and upscale restaurant in lobby(Triomphe).The hotel offers a free walking tour of the area including Grand Central Station and Bryant Park which we took advantage of on a Sunday morning and thoroughly enjoyed.Good value for the price especially if staying over Sunday night.

We have stayed at The Iroquois twice, and while our rooms were small and lacked any sort of a view, this Midtown hotel is situated perfectly for exploring New York City. The staff is helpful, the rooms are clean, the restaurant is delightful and we were happy.

My wife and I, and our adult children, recently visited NYC, and we stayed in 3 rooms at the Iroquois. All of us found the location very convenient and central to all of our activities. We also found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We would all recommend the Iroquois.

We would come back , we loved it. It's the best hotel in which we had been in NYC, not only the locación, but the staff,the ammenities,the information they gave us, everything. Close to all main atractions,

Always looking for good boutique hotels when traveling to NYC. This one is tops. Located 2 to 3 blocks from Grand Central Station, it captures you the moment you walk in the front door. Room was small but nicely decorated. Bathroom was updated and clean. Water pressure was great. Staff was exceptional. Hoping to return.

As so many others have stated, the location of this hotel cannot be any better for the myriad of activities that are available in mid-town Manhattan. What separates The Iroquois from many other hotels is its wonderful staff. They are warm and inviting individuals who fully understand the words "customer service" and they do their very best to assure that their guests are well taken care of while at the hotel. I appreciated the fact that the staff were not little cookie cutter robot types just going through the motions of being nice....they were 100% sincerely nice people. That alone will bring me back to the Iroquois on future trips to NYC. We had a beautifully appointed, spacious one bedroom suite on the 7th floor that faced 44th Street. While some street noise was audible, it was not a negative factor at all. I enjoyed being part of the bustling street activity and I only wish we could have stayed longer at The Iroquois. Excellent bath products, fluffy robes, and a shower with no shortage of hot water were also perks we enjoyed during our stay.

The Iroquois is more than just a hotel, it's more like a home! The staff is by far the absolute best, and their restaurant is a 10. It's hard to find hospitality, friendliness and compassion all under one roof in NY, but they rocked ~ 2 thumbs up + high five! Go Iroquois!

We stayed for 5 days in May 2015. I was not as impressed as other guests, although it is a nice hotel. We had a Deluxe King room. The room was of an acceptable size, not tiny but not that big either. There was a desk on one side of the bed, a chair on the other side, and just enough room to walk comfortably around the bed, but barely. The bathroom was very small, with a small bathtub, tight next to the sink, and the sink tight next to the toilet. I carry many bathroom products (perfume, cosmetics, contact lenses and rinser, etc) and I had nowhere to place them. Room decor is very traditional, in very good shape, but somewhat boring.Location is just fantastic, close to so many attractions, and with several subway stations from different lines at walking distance, it is convenient for going everywhere in Manhattan. I found it annoying that they put a sign on the room refrigerator warning that you cannot use it for your own stuff or they will charge you. It is unnecessarily rude, and an unreasonable restriction.Service personnel at the front desk and concierge were polite and professional. The elevators are a bit slow which can be annoying if you are always on a hurry, but not an issue if you are relaxed on vacation time. Our room faced the back of the building, and it was very quiet (as requested) but had limited natural light and ugly view. If you would rather trade a bit of street noise to improve on these, ask for a front room.Good wifi, included in the room price.
user_name:
Maria A A
Buenos Aires, Argentina

review_body: My son and I checked into this hotel on a Friday evening. We had a reservation to stay there until Monday morning. We had selected a premium king room. The room was very nicely decorated the bed was comfortable. Pillows were plentiful. Bathroom was clean and beautiful.

The Iroquois is a gem only a few blocks away from the diamond district, Times Square, Bryant Park, and Rockefeller Center. Most of the rooms are en suite, tastefully and comfortably furnished, with all the current amenities one could wish for. Not only is 44th St. quiet, but the hotel itself is wonderfully calm and serene- from the Triomphe restaurant and bar to the lobby, library, elevators and corridors. You couldn't find a better place from which to explore the city and later completely relax in comfort. The historic Algonquin is almost next door, as are the Red Flame restaurant/diner and Brigandi's coin and sports memorabilia shop which re-creates the palmy days of the Yankees and other fabled teams. Highly re- commended!

This hotel is always really clean, the staff is so nice and always remembers me, and the location is great. You have perfect access to Rockefeller center, 5th ave, Times Square, Bryant park, the subway, Central Park, etc. I stay here for work and it's truly the best work related hotel I ever stay at.

Once again, a delightful stay. We got a suite on the fifth floor overlooking 44th Street. Comfortable room. One small "kerfuffle" with housekeeping, but it was handled by the desk staff. Treat yourself to dinner at "Triomphe" while you're staying here.

We visited New York for the first time from Australia as part of our Silver Wedding Anniversary. The was a great hotel being well located for many amenities. The staff were outstanding, helpful and polite. In particular the Concierge (Bill) was just awesome and worth his weight in gold. When you are a first timer to a major centre like New York you need someone with a good knowledge base to help you navigate your way and he did just that for us. In my opinion a good Concierge can make a holiday a success and is an absolute asset to any Hotel's team. This Hotel is worth a visit.

Third time I've stayed here. My first time (about 10 years ago) was so notably first-rate I made it a point to come back. The second stay was even better. My third stay last month clinched it: The Iroquois is the best hotel in NYC. The best in total comfort, people/service, location, in-room dining/entertaining, atmosphere, cost, and unexpected delights. This hotel delivers old world charm without pretensions, and all modern conveniences with elegant efficiency.The people who work here are wonderfully professional. It's obvious they are carefully trained and well-managed. Individually they demonstrate important qualities that can't be trained, such as genuine kindness, resourcefulness and attentiveness. LISA, ROCKY and CARLOS (front desk) especially so.

This is my third visit to New York and each time I have stayed at the Iroquois. It is a wonderfully small hotel with great staff who are knowledgeable about New York City. The hotel is within walking distance of all Broadway and Off Broadway theater's. It is a very safe place to be and visit. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a quiet, intimate, convenient place to stay in New York Cities theater district.

The hotel was in great shape, and the staff were polite, efficient and helpful. Our room was well appointed, quiet and comfortable. We like being close to Broadway for easy access to the theater. The Iroquois is very close, but its location between 5th and 6th is away from the congestion of Times Square zone.

I stayed here twice now, and both times were terrific. This is a great hotel in a nice, central area, and the rates are pretty good for New York. It's got good character, staff are friendly, and the rooms are very nice and comfortable.

We stayed at The Iroquois for one week i May and we were very satisfied. Big and clean rooms with soft and comfortable beds. The wifi is a bit unstable. The staff were always very friendly and helpful. Will book the same hotel next time we visit New York.

Top notch hotel Amazing stuff and everything !!! They really professionals and make you feel like home ! Bed and pillows very comfy Walking distance to everything ! U can't go wrong with this place!If you looking for class and sophistication here is your hotel !!
user_name:
Olimpiusek1
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were there for the briefest of stays but everything was so nice we wished it was for longer. Perfect location (not too far, not too close). My supervisor and I both stayed in queen rooms and everything was inviting and comfy.

I found a wonderful rate on a room at The Iroquois through a website with a partner property that we have stayed at before. I did not know much about it. Only after we arrived did I find out that it belongs to the Small Luxury Hotels of the World, a set of properties that I often admire but can almost never afford. My husband was attending a conference,and I tagged along for fun. This is a small,elegant hotel in a prime location I midtown (next door to The Algonquin,wish I knew the story there) with impeccable service and lovely rooms. The public areas are less grand thanThe Algonquin, but we don't hang out in hotel lobbies as a rule. We were given a lovely,quiet room on an upper floor in the rear. The staff were very friendly, the service was excellent, and the room was a little on the small side but very elegant,and after all, this is New York.i would stay there again Ina heartbeat if I could get another rate like that.

Overall a fantastic hotel right in the heart of Manhattan. A short walk to Times Square, the Rockerfeller Centre and Empire State and only 5 mins walk from Grand Central station... I couldn't fault it. Beds were really comfy and the staff were always on hand to help and advise... Great for touring the city.

The Iroqious hotel is the best hotel I ever stayed in NYC. Very nice, clean and wonderful rooms. The location close to Time Square but on a calm street was just wonderful. We could sleep very well and then wake up to go out to the noisy NYC. The staff was wonderful and especially Vanessa who is the best I ever met. She is extremely servicesminded and helpful. If you want to experience the best of NYC and enjoy your hotel I would recommend this one to all I know. I will definitely come back.

My stay was short, but really nice. The room was great -- the bathroom was larger relatively speaking, so excellent on that. The staff was all helpful. I had lunch in the restaurant while waiting for my room to be ready, and it was fabulous, with great service and wine.

It's my third stay here and the hotel gives very good value for money. Right in the center yet small and quiet. Staff is very friendly and helpfull. Room was large enough and bathroom very convinient. The restaurant is pricey for breakfast but there are plenty nice places just close by.

Great location to walk from to Time Square, Fifth Ave shopping, etc. Time for new bathrooms, and carpeting. Bed was a little soft.Hallway corridors were bright. Lobby size was human scale and not monstrous as in mega hotels.

excellent hotel in great location and added nicely to our good recent trip to nyc this hotel is next to great restaurants, next to Bryant park, next to great shopping on 5th and Madison avenues, close to pick up shuttle sites to Newark airport at Bryant park

Stayed for 5 nights and couldn't have picked a better base from which to explore the Big Apple. Staff were friendly and helpful and the room was cosy and comfortable. Would certainly recommend and would stay again.

The Iroquois offers a friendly respite in NYC. The staff is accommodating and helpful. Their rooms are small, but nicely appointed. Our only complaint was the lack of control of the room temperature. We should have been able to cool our room to a comfortable level without calling the front desk each time we wanted to lower the temp.

We booked a suite for four of us and this well exceeded our expectations. The bedroom and lounge were spacious, the bed huge and the double sofa bed really comfortable, which is unusual.Sleeping in NYC can often be a problem because of all night traffic, sirens etc. but 44th St. Is a quiet cross st. between 5th and 6th, so we had some of the best nights we have had in the city.The location is perfect....walkable to subways, TImes Sq, Broadway shows, Rockefeller Center etc, and with good restaurants and breakfast places close by. We would definitely stay here again.

On and off for past 4 years, I have stayed at The Iroquois for business travel. This hotel truly became my home away from home and I could not have been more pleased. The rooms are always very clean; they feel like a bedroom and not like a cold hotel room, and the beds super comfortable (not to mention the Molton Brown bath products!). But what sets this hotel apart from the rest is the service provided by dedicated employees. The staff at the front desk (Patrick, Caroline, Lisa), the best bartender (Alex), and the always friendly and helpful guys at the front door (Carlos, Rocky & John) (I know I'm forgetting some names) make this hotel stand apart from the rest. Plus, as a woman travelling alone, I always feel safe and secure on West 44th Street - it's a great mid-town location. Who could ask for anything more?

This is a small, but high quality hotel located between 5th and 6th Avenue close to the theater district. The only "problem" is somewhat small rooms. In room dining for two persons is not an option. The Associated restaurant, the Triomphe, is very good.

This was our first trip to New York and we were only stopping for 4 days before flying off to Florida. We had two rooms for the family.If you are looking for a lovely hotel in a great location, without the corporate bland chain hotel experience, then this is the place for you! The hotel is just lovely, small but very very friendly and the location was exactly what we would have wished for with a short stroll to Times Square but on a quiet side road. We arranged with them before flying to have a car to pick 4 of us up from the airport and all our luggage. The driver arrived and was waiting with a smile as we left the customs hall at the airport so we had door to door service. The cost of the car was simply added to our room account. The rooms were both lovely, different views, but both spotlessly clean and cosy. They made an effort so we were on the same floor but not next door to each other (what we had requested). The beds are very comfortable and everything worked well in the room. Neither room was huge but both perfectly able to accommodate us and all our luggage (and shopping!).We spoke to the concierge on a few occasions and he was so helpful with both suggestions for where to eat/directions/ideas etc. So please do chat to him if you visit as he is a real font of information. The reception area is small but again lovely and the hot complementary drink in the lobby was great both morning and arriving back after a hard days sightseeing.On one evening my husband and I ate in the restaurant and then had drinks in the cocktail bar. This was probably the only negative piece in our stay. Whilst the cocktail bar is dark and intimate and the drinks wonderful, the restaurant is a real let down. My vegetarian meal was virtually uneatable and very expensive! The description didn't match what was served and I had a hard overcooked artichoke. the desert we shared (since I was still hungry) of a baked Alaska was frozen solid in the middle and had already been flambéed once before it was done again at our table so was burnt on the outside. You may think all this was because the place was full, not so, we were the only ones eating!So in summary we'll be going back to stay at the hotel, but we'll be eating out every night.

Our stay was just perfect. The location placed us close to the plays and other attractions we wanted to see. We really enjoyed the quiet atmosphere. The staff made us feel very comfortable and paid a lot of attention to detail.

This is a great hotel just off 5th Avenue. Its literally in the middle of Bloomingdales and Macy's so a great spot if you are heading to NY for shopping!The hotel itself is comfortable with decent marble bathrooms and lovely Molton Brown bathroom products. The rooms are quite spacious, even the standard double.There is free coffee/tea in reception in the mornings and water in the evenings (in winter there is warm cider in the evenings which is to die for!)Haven't eaten in the hotel so cannot comment on any food.I have been here roughly 5 times for business and will be back!Always stay here for business and will be back!
user_name:
BelindaHaydn
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: Iroquois is a good find, especially if you want to see Broadway shows. Free in-room wifi, clean, adequate size room, good shower pressure, as quiet as one can get in his area (unless you are at a taller hotel with much higher floors), 24 hour room service. 2 blocks to subway. Comparable rooms and services would have been $200 more at larger hotels; smaller Iroquois has more character. Pleasant concierge responded quickly with directions and reservations. It is next to the Algonquin and across from the Harvard Club. We appreciated being able walk to theatres/Time Square in less than 10 min, but without the noise and lights of being in the Square. We walked to UN, and 5th Avenue, and to subway which took us all over town. I do not think any windows had much of a view other than of buildings, but that was not important to us. Lively bar at rear of first floor but did not create noise in our room. Small work-out room with 2 treadmills, an exercycle, arc trainer, 2 cybex weight machines, and free weights. Small size lobby, but a cozy reading room alcove with desktop, print newspapers, books, including travel guides. If you are looking for a grand lobby or spectacular views, Iroquois would not be the place, but if you want good services in a small, clean hotel. at a reasonable price (for NYC), you will be more than satisfied with the Iroquois. AAA rates.

There's no marble or chrome, no vast atrium or indoor palm trees - but what the Iroquois does have is charm, style and an intimacy only found in well managed boutique hotels.We stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel perfectly placed for all parts of the City.The staff are absolute stars! Nothing is too much trouble and you are made to feel welcome at all times.My only annoyance was the in-room lighting, which is dreadful! 2 small wattage lamps in a relatively dark room are just not enough.Apart from that small niggle, I can thoroughly recommend The Iroquois for your stay in NY City.For us the other major advantage was that The Harvard New York Club was just a couple of doors away and as we are members of The Royal Automobile Club, we were able to use their amazing facilities as well.We will undoubtably be back to The Iroquois.

The Iroquois provides an exceptional place to stay in midtown close to broadway theatres, but far from the noise and confusion of Times Square. A small older hotel, the Iroquois provides great personal service and boasts a terrific French restaurant that also manages to produce wonderful breakfast choices

We were very happy with out choice of hotel and it fulfilled all our expectations. It was very close to Times square, all Broadway theatres and other sights we visited. Within one minute walking distance we had three breakfast restaurants. The room was also clean and quiet.

The hotel messed up the reservation and then tried to make it my problem. They made the mistake, they needed to fix it, not make excuses. People make mistakes, but take ownership of them, don't make them the problem of the customer.

Booked a suite plus an adjoining room for family for my husband's 60th. The suite was spacious by New York standards and provided ample room for our group to gather for pre dinner drinks. The hotel was built in 1899, is beautifully renovated and decorated to modern standards, and has tons of character. It's located close to everything, the staff is helpful and friendly, and the prices are fair, again by New York standards. I ordered flowers for my husband and they made sure they were in the room when we arrived, along with champagne a friend sent, and wine and chocolates from the hotel. We travel extensively and this was one of the nicest hotel experiences we have ever had. We highly recommend it to anyone looking for a real New York experience.

Wonderful boutique hotel in the perfect location for exploring New York. The staff is terrific, the rooms were nicely appointed with super comfortable beds. If you like small, charming, well appointed hotels at a great price, this hotel hits a home run.

A strategic located hotel, service outstanding, clean facilities, friendly and welcoming people. More chances for breakfast desirable, but in general food is very valuable. Special acknowledgements to Vanessa and Alex from front desk.

Our room looked right out on 44th and yet was totally quiet. Comfy bed and pillows. The heating controls were completely whacky. Do not eat breakfast here though. Expensive and not of good quality. My steel cut oats was horrible...not bad but horrible. The location is great. Easy walking to many theaters, restaurants and even Central Park...

Old school hotel with patina but friendly staff, in the middle of Manhattan. Do not expect a good view but clean and good beds. Recommendation as a starting point for people who just want to use the hotel for sleeping.

I've stayed in NYC hotels for decades, always wanted to try the Iroquois,very glad we finally did. We'll be back. The staff was extra courteous to everyone, including us. The room was perfect. And quiet even in the morning rush hour. And, the 44th street location is perfect.

Upon arrival at the hotel I felt instantly at home. The late dinner at the restaurant with excellent food and kind service convinced me to spend my meals at the hotel instead of testing other places out. I was tired after long travels. Not expecting a restful night in New York I was surprised to wake up after 8 hours of sleep, much needed to start a day of business.

The Iroquois is a lovely little hotel just a few blocks from Times Square in a location that is close enough to the key attractions of the mid-town area without being right on top of them. The front desk staff were always on hand and happy to help, as were the porters. Our room was spacious and had a large comfy bed, and came with a welcome pack as well as nightly turn down service. Complementary coffee in the morning and hot apple cider in the afternoon was always appreciated in the lobby, as was the Lantern’s Keep bar. The only negative comment worth making was the lack of water pressure in the shower, though this is quite common in Manhattan and the bathroom itself was spacious and well stocked with amenities such as towels, robes and shower gel, shampoo etc. The onsite Triomphe restaurant wasn't great (with the exception of the waiters, who were very friendly) and we wouldn't eat there again. Other than that, this hotel was the best we have frequented in New York City, we would be happy to stay there again and have already recommended it to friends and family.

Location, ambience, rooms, staff...all excellent! We were taking my young son to NYC for the first time, and this hotel really helped complete the picture. Doormen, front desk, classic elevators, quaint, and perfect rooms.

My mum and I visited this hotel as part of a second stop in America. We travelled from Washington DC via Amtrak. Although the hotel appears small from the outside, it's actually really quite large. The hotel is warm and inviting, not like some of the ultra modern hotel that are around. I chose this hotel based solely on location and the fantastic reviews. It is rated highly and is certainly worth such a high rating. When I booked it was number 19 out of over 400 hotels in New York!!We were super impressed by every aspect of the hotel. We loved the evening turn down service. It was lovely to come back to the room and have a little chocolate placed on our pillow. Also we loved the facility whereby you could borrow movies. Although we were on a huge sightseeing trip, we aren't drinkers or clubbers (my mum and I) so there wasn't an appeal to be out late in the evenings. Therefore each night we would come back and watch a movie. Really sweet extra!We had breakfast a few times in the hotel restaurant. It was lovely, calm and high quality. I fancied cereal and even though it wasn't on the menu, a fanatic bowl of cornflakes arrived for me! A much needed thing from home.The toiletries in the room were Molton Brown and were constantly being replenished. The rooms were perfect size for us and had all we needed. I only felt I wanted a ceiling light to do my makeup in the mornings, but that's nothing majorly important as I simply did it in the bathroom instead.All the staff were lovely and polite.Two people went the extra mile for us and definitely deserve mentioning!! Bill, the concierge, was fantastic. He helped sort an issue from our previous city and helped booked a visit to the 9/11 memorial, he also gave us advice about where to go and eat etc. i.e the New York pass verses the New York City pass (we chose the prior). But more than the help was his genuine and sincere kindness. I felt that nothing was too much trouble and this means so much generally, let alone in an unfamiliar country/city. The other person was Seth, the hotel porter. He was such a friendly welcoming face at the end and beginning of our days. He remembered who we were and asked about our day etc. Although New York isn't on the holiday agenda for many years now, I highly recommend staying and utilising the skills and expertise of the people who work and live in the city. If we win the lottery, we will certainly be back soon. Thank you to the Iroquois for making this stay memorable for us.

Nice quiet hotel up a side street in a handy location in the theatre district. We stayed in a room with 2 double beds, suitable for 2 family members, or friends sharing a room. Did not try restaurant for breakfast or dinner. Helpful concierge for planning transfers from and back to airport.

Best place to stay if you wish to go to dine, shopping, entertainment in NYC. Everything are in the walking distance. Staffs are kind, rooms are clean and calm, although a bit narrow space.Finally, price is very reasonable.

One block from theatre district. 5th avenue shopping was one block opposite way. Small hotel with comfortable rooms. Very friendly staff. Appreciated being able to print out boarding passes in their lounge area. Coffee available in the morning and hot apple cider in the afternoon.

Stayed here for 4 nights with my friend, her daughter and her friend. We had two rooms ours was on 8th floor and the other was on 9th. On arrival we were welcomed and given all the relevant information regarding the hotel. The bell boy took our cases up to each of the rooms. Ours was 808, which on entering seemed a little dark, with no view but regardless of that it had all the facilities we could wish for, including hair drier, bath robes, toiletries, and plenty lovely soft towels. Bathroom consisted of a shower over the bath so a long soak or a qu9ck shower was possible. There were two double beds in our room also enough hanging space and drawers space. Bed were really comfy and you just sank into the pillows. Just what you need after a long day sightseeing. All the staff without exception were very helpful, and obliging. Nothing was too much trouble. The location was fantastic too. Just few blocks away Grand Central Station,Time square, Maddison Avenue, Broadway and many more attractions. The only time we got a tube while we were there was when we were going to Statue of Liberty and Ground Zero but . was so easy from Grand Central Station. We all agreed it was a wonderful well located hotel, while still being tucked away from all the hustle and bustle. I do not think this could disappoint most people visiting NYC. Had a great time, and came home shattered but happy. Well done Iroquois

Nice small hotel just over 100 rooms on 12 floors. Compact room but very comfy bed, large TV, mini bar (although we didn't use as quite expensive). Staff very friendly. Bar not open Sundays. Loved the location between 5th Avenue shops and Time Square.
user_name:
EnglandHensh
Newton Le Willows, United Kingdom

review_body: An ideal location in the heart of everything. Rooms were on the small side, but adequate. Comfortable beds, clean linen and towels. Great selection of toiletries in the bathroom. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Thanks to the extremely helpful consierge - Bill, always there to find out information on restaurants and best deals for the shows! A HUGE thanks to Thomas in the restaurant who always greeted us with a friendly smile! Breakfast was fantastic and nothing was any trouble. I would very much like his name to be mentioned in the staff meeting and praise given for his outstanding customer services! WELL DONE THOMAS! Downsides - lighting needs to be brighter in rooms. Need tea/coffee making facilities and the bar is SO dark and dismal!! And the barman that served us was the most miserable person we came across in New York!!!!! I would recommend this hotel - fantastic location too.

We have just returned from a 4 night stay at The Iroquois Hotel. The Hotel staff are all very welcoming and very helpful, nothing is too much trouble. This is our 3rd trip to New York and the hotel is my favourite, the rooms are quite small but very nicely finished with a lovely bathroom. The Molten Brown toiletries are a nice touch, I think the only think that is really missing is a kettle to make coffee & tea, though you can get free coffee in reception which is served in a morning. The Hotel is ideally located just off 5th Avenue so you are close to some fantastic restaurants and also the great shops that 5th Avenue have to offer. I would highly recommend this hotel and when we visit New York again we will definitely return. Thank you again for a fantastic stay!!

Excellent location in Midtown, 10 minute max walking distance to Time Square, Broadway, Fifth/Madison Avenue.A small, friendly, boutique hotel in a safe and pleasant street in which you'll find a couple of bars and restaurant.We booked a Deluxe Room with one Queen Bed (equal to a UK Kingsize). The room wasn't enormous but comfortable enough for two people. Quality furnishings, very comfy mattress, good air conditioning. Whilst small, the bathroom was very ornate with Molton Brown toiletries and lots of thick towels which seemed to be changed daily.Room has a 32" flatscreen TV, DVD player (these can be borrowed from the small library in the lobby), safe, mini bar stocked with a good selection of soft and alcoholic drinks plus snacks and chocolate. Ironing board/iron, hairdryer. Complimentary daily newspaper and shoeshine. Turn down service.The hotel has a nice, small bar (Lantern's Keep) serving cocktails and delicious, unusual snacks. There is also a small restaurant (Triomphe) serving breakfast/lunch/evening meals. In the lobby you can access free morning coffee and warm cider in the evening. There is also a fitness centre and sauna.Wi-Fi is free and the library has two computer terminals for customer use.Staff in all areas are very friendly and helpful, and I would definitely book this hotel again.

In the midst of the bustle of Times Square it was nice to find a quiet haven of a hotel. There was a sauna but we didn't have time to sample it, too much else to do in 2 nights! The room had nice touches of dark chocolate and red wine on offer. The water was not complementary however. There was a mini bar and a welcome letter. It wasn't as grandiose as expected but still special. The room was a bit hot but we didn't ask for it to be cooled and it was the hottest day of the year so far! We got a good night sleep in room 600 overlooking a roof terrace. Fairly small but had a nice cosy vibe. Even with roadworks on a Saturday night my partner and I got the best night's sleep in ages. They flagged us down a taxi and the breakfast was good. Expensive restaurant and breakfast but not anymore than the usual New York prices. The cocktail Lantern Bar was again a cosy little snug with great service. We had the tasty Titan IPA but were too jetlagged to finish even half a bottle! I love how in America they make sure your water is always topped up. Overall a good find.

This hotel is absolutely beautiful and right in the heart of all the sights and experiences of NYC. It was our first trip to NYC and we wanted to make the absolute most of it! Given that one visiting spends most of their time walking through the city - it was nice to have a very comfortable bed to sleep and recharge at night. The rooms are not very large, but this wasn't a major concern given we only spent our time sleeping. I was most pleased with its location - right in between time square and grand central station. It was easy for us to see the landmarks of NYC, but still walk to Grand Central and take the subway (also very easy to use). Only about 10 blocks from the Macy's and the same distance (opposing direction) to central park. The doorman at the hotel, JJ, was very friendly! He remembered our names after only one introduction and greeted us with a smile every time we returned to the hotel. The hotel was also very helpful in guiding us with what activities to do, and the best form of transportation to get there. Either way, I think its hard not to have a good time when you're in a city like NYC! I'd definitely recommend this location.

Absolutely beautiful hotel. Pricey but definitely worth it. My boyfriend and met up with six other friends for one of their 35th birthdays. The staff is wonderful and extremely helpful. They were our saving grace in helping us navigate the subway. And it doesn't hurt that the bellmen are VERY handsome! The location is perfect, two blocks from Times Square, cute little coffee shop across the road, and a great spot for brunch about four doors down. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant but it looked gorgeous. We would stay there again in a heartbeat, be it just the two of us or another group of eight. Thank you to the staff for a perfect experience, we'll definitely be back!

second visit to New York, this trip was to celebrate my daughters 18 th birthday. Looked on trip advisor and picked this hotel and I am so glad we did, great rooms, no noise at night which for New York is a miracle!! . Location is brilliant for all the attractions and plenty of assorted places eat. But what makes this hotel stand out from the rest is the staff, special mention for Bill the concierge who was always helpful, Malory on reception who always greeted us warmly and lirin the bell boy always on hand for a coffee.In fact all the staff went above and beyond to make this trip memorable. If we are lucky enough to return to this fabulous city would not stop anywhere else.

We have just returned from 5 days in New York and stayed here. We were warmly welcomed and every single member of staff spoke to us every time we passed - and it always seemed genuine not just 'ticking the box'. The room was very clean - as was the bathroom. In fact, all areas of the hotel were clean and well ordered. It was great that we were able to check for our return flights and print our boarding passes too. We were room only as we like to eat in different places. The coffee station in the lobby was great, too.Well done and thanks to everyone who helped make our stay such a pleasure.

Great Hotel with great room and great service ! I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are big and clean ! The location is also really good if you want to see the main attractions or go out for dinner

Graceful older hotel, perfect location, wonderful staff. I have stayed here four times and each time has been excellent. The staff is pleasant and the location could hardly be better for theater, restaurants and good sleep.

My wife and I stayed 4 nights to celebrate her birthday and our anniversary. We stayed based on a recommendation of a friend and were glad we picked the Iroquois. The rooms were clean and smelled good. The lobby was very inviting and doormen friendly. Vanessa, the Concierge, made our trip and we would go back just for her. She answered all of our questions and upon arrival looked over out list of things to do and helped tweak our itinerary. Another nice thing about the hotel...It rained almost every day and the hotel provided umbrellas.

I was lucky enough to stay in a one bedroom suite on the 9th floor. You dont get much of a view from this hotel but it is a great room and very quite. The bedroom is completely seperate from the living room so you can get your privacy if you have kids in the other room. The hotel itself is very nice if a little cramped but it is great value for the location. Would recommend it

Fantastic hotel, fantastic location, amazing staff, Lisa on reception was lovely and made us feel very special :)Right in the middle of Manhattan but not disturbed by the noise and perfect for all local amenities can not recommend enough.

I very rarely enjoy hotel stays, simply because I don't enjoy leaving the comfort of my own home, but for what it was worth, this place was not bad. I enjoyed the little bar nook that they had, and it was right off of midtown manhattan so the night life wasn't bad at all. The room was quaint and I enjoyed the service. What really got me was this one guy that was working there, after a decent conversation, he recommended that I check out a few places around the town and sure enough they were great places to visit. A tall, Im guessing Indian fella named Sagar, but I think he used another name. But after much talking I got the appropriate name. Good suggestion of what to visit, and enjoy my stay, great detail on the location and good reccomendation on the drink aswell. If he reads this, he should know "not to be a lemon". Im sure he will know what I mean if he remembers my stay. Anyway, overall great location on an inside street. I enjoyed the stay.
user_name:
Prem M
New York City, New York

review_body: I love the peace and quiet of this small hotel in a nice area. Great location for theaters. Nice restaurants in hotel and nearby. The staff could not gave been more helpful. My hope is to return soon.

This is a quaint and charming hotel that is well located in NY. All staff were very professional and nice to deal with. It is a boutique hotel so be prepared for small rooms/bathrooms and a small gym with older equipment. Overall a good experience!

The Iroquois hotel is situated on 44th Street (facing south) between 5th and 6th Avenues. This is important - knowing which way to turn as you step out the front door! It is practically in the centre of the rectangle comprising Manhattan's main attractions (3rd-7th Avenues, 34th-62nd Streets).Avenues run N-S; Streets run E-W. Mind you 3rd Avenue is follwed by Lixington, Park and Madison - then there is 5th Avenue!The Iroquois is a quiet, small to medium sized hotel. Our room was small, clean, tidy, comfortable and all the facilities functioned well. TV - yes, but you will only need channel NY1 with its weather 1's @ 01, 11, 21, etc minutes past the hour!Breakfast was very good quality. We were the only diners on our first morning. Then we got the breakfast bill and realisied why! Never fear, there is an excellent diner out the front door, turn right and walk 60 metres.Staff were excellent as was daily room servicing.At $300 per room per night, the Iroquois is quite expensive, but its location cannot be faulted.

I stay in midtown a few times each year (usually for work, sometimes personal travel), and I will be avoiding the Iroquois on future trips.The location is not bad, but it's much more expensive than some other midtown options that seem much less dated. (For these rates, I'd have expected a bit more of the interior, particularly the rooms, to have been updated.) My big complaint, however, came 4 months after my stay, when a staff member at the hotel contacted me, claiming that I still owed an outstanding balance that they'd never even sought to charge me for when I was there. She blamed it on Expedia (through which I'd made the reservation), claiming that Expedia had originally given them incorrect information-- which, after a long time on the phone with Expedia, I found out to be blatantly untrue (and thus just an attempt to avoid taking responsibility for the hotel's own mistake). When I brought this deception to the attention of the general manager of the Iroquois, I didn't even get an apology (sincere or otherwise). I've paid the amount they claimed I owed, but with so many other hotels in the area, I can't comprehend why I'd ever return to one where the staff has such a cavalier attitude toward the truth. Simply not worth it.

The Room was comfortable. The bathroom was perfect. Everybody were nice. The wardrobe was small. Good and beverages were expensive. The room was silent. I've used your internet point in any time I needed! Beautiful hotel! Thank you!

Flawless visit. Excellent staff. Small room but very nice with crisp fresh bedding. Big screen tv with big channel selection. Very good shower.our room was very quiet at night,no street noise. Great location. Recommended.

We just returned from a 5 day family vacation in New York, with two little ones in tow (ages: 3 and 6), and stayed at The Iroquois. We chose the hotel because it came highly recommended for families, and it did not disappoint. We stayed in a suite which was surprisingly spacious, especially by New York standards. The living room and bedroom were both very big, and we loved that there was both a shower and a soaking tub in the bathroom. I've stayed at larger, chain hotels in the city and The Iroquois had the largest rooms yet. The hotel is extremely clean and well-maintained. I am a clean freak and there was nothing in the room or property overall that I can complain about. The staff is warm, welcoming and helpful. Upon arrival, we received two goody bags for our kids - what a pleasant surprise and a wonderful touch! The hotel also has many, many amenities for those traveling with kids - DVDs, games, and equipment (i.e. stroller), should you need it.If you are coming to New York to see the sights and be a tourist, The Iroquois's location is unbeatable: a 5 minute walk to Grand Central Terminal, 6 blocks to Rockefeller Center, 2 blocks from New York Public Library, and steps away from 5th Avenue shopping, to name a few. We felt so centrally located that it was easy to get anywhere in Manhattan. We loved our stay at The Iroquois and would highly recommend it to anyone!

This is going to hard to write because I can't think of enough superlatives. It starts with the doorman opening the door and whisking our bags inside. The friendly desk staff make you feel like a celebrity they know well. The room is also only perfect.It seems like home but in a place that looks better than yours. The restaurant, bar, library only add to the charm. It is a hotel to come back to anytime you visit NYC.

My family (husband and children aged 17 and 20) stayed here last week. Both rooms were a good size with full bathrooms. We looked out onto other buildings and found our room a bit dark but otherwise very good. Very clean with comfortable beds and pillows. The only improvement they could make would be tea and coffee making facilities in the room but there is coffee in reception in the mornings (although we tended to pop across the road to Gregorys Coffee Shop). Molten Brown products in the bathroom were nice and gratefully received. We also got chocolates on our pillows each night and a free copy of the New York Times every morning. Bill and Vanessa the concierges were extremely helpful and knowledgeable, so don't be afraid to use them. The hotel is located a 5-7 minute walk to Times Square, 5 minutes to Grand Central, 5 minutes the TOTR and 15 minutes up to Central Park. Nearest subway is Bryant Square on 42nd Street. Would recommend the hotel and are likely to return. Free Wifi was nice and of good quality not like some hotel wifis that actually aren't worth having.

Hotel was in great location within walking distance to all attractions that tourists want to visit. Hotel was very clean, room was very comfy and warm and no road noise. Staff very helpful and happy to help with all requests. Would definitely recommend this hotel to family & friends travelling to NYC

Love this place! Very welcoming and efficient staff. Very nicely located in the middle of frequently visited tourist spots. We had lost part of our luggage and staff were quick to call taxi company and had it retrieved intact.

We stayed in a king room and were very pleased. The price on their website was so reasonable that I actually called and made the reservation over the phone because I wanted to make sure the price was correct! The room was a good size (I didn't expect it to be huge, since it's NYC) and the bathroom was very nice. My hair dryer didn't work the first day; I called down to the front desk and a new one was delivered within 10 minutes. We also decided we would like a refrigerator; again, stopped by the front desk on our way out for the day and it was in our room (free of charge) when we returned! The location of this hotel is awesome - close to the Subway, close to any kind of restaurant you can imagine, close to lots of shopping. We had a great time and will definitely return to the Iroquois!

We have just returned from a family trip to New York this Easter - I researched many hotels before booking but in the end decided on the Iroquois, we were not disappointed in the least, what a lovely 'boutique' Hotel - rooms were spotless and of a reasonable size compared to other room reviews. It was a good location with easy access to all area's, and main attractions. Staff were so friendly and helpful, would certainly stay here again.
user_location: East Riding of Yorkshire, United Kingdom
user_name:
Julie C
East Riding of Yorkshire, United Kingdom

review_body: Very good location, with a quiet room and a very comfortable bed. Small room and somewhat overpriced. Overall ok. Photos appear as though hotel is bigger than reality. Good service and attention. I would probably return and would recommend proper timing to get a better price.
user_name:
Jacobo W
San Pedro Garza Garcia, Mexico

review_body: A very historic property in West 44th Street, next to the famous Algonquin Hotel, opposite the New York Bar Association and up the road from the New York Yacht Club and the Harvard Club. The hotel, over 100 years old and owned by the Horn famly for a number of generations, has much history particularly given that James Dean stayed in an 8th floor suite (now named the “James Dean Suite”) for about two years from 1951 to 1953. The warm apple tea and honey offered in the lobby was a veritable lifesaver and very, very welcome. Rooms were very warm and well-kept. The bathrooms were very good and I also loved the Molton Brown amenities which are my favorite toiletries and a rare thing amongst hotels. The hotel also offers walking tours on various days around a number of districts and I took advantage of the midtown walk which included Bryant Park, the New York Public Library and Grand Central Terminal.On the whole, a good property which I would happily return to,

This hotel is ideal for both business and personal travel to NYC. it is ideally located only two blocks from Times Square and three blocks from Rockefeller Center. The Lanterns Keep bar is very unique and a special treat for those staying at the hotel. Great rooms and he beds are like heaven to sleep on!

My son and I got a great deal during Cyber Monday, and was thoroughly happy with the Iroquois. Marble bathroom was gorgeous, and large for NYC hotels. Room was big enough, considering we didn't spend that much time in it during the day. Location of hotel was perfect....dead center of all the great things NY has to offer. Courteous service, nice facilities, plan on coming back for a future stay in winter.

OK, it's not the first time I'm writ about this hotel. This time I've broug friends with me who agreed that the hotel is a great one. The location- midtown west- two minutes from Times Square makes it convenient but not a noisy one. The service is just perfect. A dream bed with perfect cotton bedding, perfect Molton Brown bath amenities, and their Triumph restaurant has an outstanding food.
user_name:
Michal M
Herzliya, Tel Aviv, Israel

review_body: Stayed at your hotel, staff is very friendly and helpful!! Location is perfect, and our overall experience was AWESOME!! Will be back for sure!!! Still can't get over how friendly your staff was, and how they went out of their way to make sure you have everything!!!

I have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the years and I it is still my first choice in New York.I have always been personally greater upon checkin and even if I approach the desk with a simple question.The staff is excellent, and they always make you feel welcome.My only comment is that we had an inside room with a noisy air conditioner

My experience at The Iroquois was excellent in every way. Loved the suite and the jacuzzi tub and Molton Brown bath products. The rooms had blackout shades! The bed had 7 pillows. One of the best nights of sleep I have ever had in NYC!

The location in Midtown combined with an incredibly friendly staff and better than average rooms made this to a memorable stay. As a frequent visitor of New York this is a hotel I would recommend to friends and I might consider to stay here again. Two negatives: we were in room 609 and there was a lot of noise from two vents from a neighboring building and the bathroom was very small, certainly for someone of 6.10 ft.

We have stayed at the Iroquois several times in the past. My mistake this time was asking for a Superior room instead of a Deluxe one. Our room (402) was very cramped. The head of the bed was smack up against the desk next to it. I was afraid I might bang my head into the sharp corner when I was sleeping so I put a pillow between me and it. Other than that, the room was clean, the bathroom nicely lit, and our dinner in Triomphe was excellent. The staff was helpful, polite and friendly.

The whole staff was friendly and couldn't do enough for us. We were meeting a friend at the Coffee House Club for lunch on Friday. Little did we know it was an obscure little club for retired actors. We weren't sure where it was exactly, but the staff did everything they could, without walking us to the address, to get us there. It's on same street as Iroquois, but no one had ever heard of it. It is, however, in an historical bldg. with lots of small clubs.

After a long trip for a short stay, this hotel was a sight for sore eyes. The lobby was gorgeous and the check in process was a breeze. Doorman and front desk staff were super friendly. Location was great for getting anywhere by foot, cab or subway. Library inside the lobby was unique and cozy spot to relax and read.Room was typical NYC small size but welcoming and comfortable, and even had a decent size desk area to spread out and do work on. Minifridge came in handy. Bathroom shower had great water pressure! Again, as in most NYC hotels, no bathroom fan, but I didn't mind. Room and common areas were very clean and elegant.Would definitely return!

We always look forward to staying at the Iriquois. It is an oasis of quiet and comfort in a very busy city. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the hotel itself has an understated elegance that we love.
user_name:
Nancy R
Syracuse, New York, Usa

review_body: I stayed at the Iroquois for 3 nights. My stay was booked last minute (at 2am after landing in NY!) after plans to stay with a friend fell through. Patrick at the front desk was extremely helpful and was ready and waiting for my early morning arrival - he even put wine and chocolates in my room, which was a lovely touch after the stressful evening I had!The hotel itself is fantastically located - close to Times Sq but not right in the heart of it, meaning you can escape the hustle and bustle, and walking distance of plenty of shops. The room was a perfect size for one person. There were always plenty of fresh towels, Molton Brown toiletries replenished daily, chocolates on your pillow at night and very friendly and helpful staff. I would highly recommend staying here for business or pleasure!

Our weekend visit to New York was great, thanks in large part to the staff and location of the Iroquois Hotel. It's central location in Midtown made it perfect to walk wherever we needed to go! The staff was friendly and accommodating, even for special requests. The room was clean and large for New York standards, and the bed was heavenly. I loved coming in from the freezing cold and having hot cider waiting for us in the foyer! Nice touch!

Quiet, clean, friendly accommodations in a very convenient location. Comfortable bed, good pillows, strong hot shower, nice furnishings, friendly staff. Surprisingly quiet for the area. Would definitely return!

This is our second time staying at the Iroquois. Made my reservation via american express. Ist time, 6 months ago.. they were unable to locate our reservation even though i had my confirmation numbers from American express. Evenutally after about 35 minutes, they gave us a room (an upgrade) since this was the only thing left and american express stands by their travel reservations. So decided to make another reservation the same way. Check in is 3, we arrive at 5pm, they once again are not able to locate our reservation, only this time they stated it was because their computers were down. Would we like to have a seat and wait. We stated no, so eventually they found a room for us. The room i had reserved was Superior Queen. I WOULD LOVE TO KNOW WHAT THE STANDARD QUEEN ROOM LOOKED LIKE. Our room was so tiny, that if you went to answer the phone, you woke the other person up, because you could not get by the bed to reach for the phone, if you went to the bathroom, the door opened into the bed, once again waking anyone sleeping at the time. The bed was a DOUBLE, not a queen. When i asked the gentleman at the front the desk on our way out, he insisted that there are different kinds of queen beds. I am 63 years old, and never knew that there were queen size of various measurements. If there are, please show them to me. This was definetly a double size bed, and believe me there is a difference, when you are 6 feet, 2 inches tall. So this will be my last time staying here. For 300.00 i know i can find a more accommodating queen size bed. Also, there are NO OUTLETS except in the bathroom for plugging in phones etc. I am sure there were outlets, because there were lamps, but they were behind the headboard, or behind the cabinets.. so a no go for we lay people.

I come to NY every March for a trade show and this was my second time at the Iroquois. The location is perfect for those who want/need to stay in Midtown. Rooms are clean, but maybe a bit dark. The staff is friendly and helpful.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Iroquois hotel. We were visiting New York to see a play on Broadway. The location was perfect...very close to the theater yet quiet. The staff is incredibly attentive...always available to help. The room though small was charming. No details were missed. I can't think of anything that would have made our stay any more perfect. I look forward to returning again!

Our experiences were as following:Positives:+ prime location: near to Times Square, Central Park and Central Station+ staff: friendly and professional+ superb beds+ free and fast wifi+ free coffee in the morning and free Apple Cider in the afternoon which was a bonus as it was cold!+ our special requests were honoured ++++ free use of computers and printer (we did not use them)+ free use of Dvd's from the library (we did not use them)Negatives:- room could be cleaned better (especially the carpets)- noise from the ventilation systemAll in all, a great hotel and recommendable for sure if you get a good price like we did!

We were warmly welcomed when we arrived and immediately helped with our luggage as we arrived early. While we were at lunch, staff called to let us know that our room was ready. The hotel is in the most convenient location for Broadway shows at W 44th. Very nice room service and lovely toiletries.This was a combined business and pleasure trip. We will be back!

We enjoy staying at the Iroquois. Its close to Broadway and across the street from our regular parking garage. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a nice size for a mid-town hotel. We also enjoy sitting in the Library and relaxing.

excellent location and service. very satisfied with our visit. would stay at The Iroquois again. Street is quiet but has some easy access to dining options for breakfast, lunch and dinner i.e. walking

Our annual trip to NYC was one of the best ever this year because of the staff at the Iroquois. Every request or need was met with a smile and followed through on expeditiously. We traveled by cab frequently and the door people were wonderful at getting the appropriate cab for our travels. Likewise with the maid service. Tremendous. Our room was small and dark and quiet on the second floor. For us this was perfect for resting and sleeping after a long day in the city.The Iroquois was in a perfect location for us as we traveled to upper and lower Manhattan frequently in our stay. We will stay again at the Iroquois when we are in this section of the city.

This hotel should not be in the SLH catalogue. After check in we were simply pointed to the lifts to get to our room, there was no help offered with our luggage. The first evening we went into the bar and the barmaid was too busy complaining to another customer about her lack of a pay rise or bonus "I'm not paid to think"... It took some time to get our overpriced drinks which still had an 18% gratuity added. As "loved " members of the SLH club, we were entitled to a free continental breakfast. We were shown a separate menu to normal customers which was very much reduced, a tea or coffee, a glass of juice and then a basket of bread, a bowl of fruit, Greek yoghurt or porridge. It was a bit dismal. We went to NYC to celebrate a special birthday. We have previously spent time in many SLH hotels throughout Europe and felt confident of the quality we could expect. I am sorry to say we were very disappointed. This hotel is average, not luxury. We are not the type of customer that looks to find to fault in where we stay.

This review is based on a single night's stay, traveling for business. Picked it for the low corporate rate, proximity to the office I was visiting and TripAdvisor reviews. Small room had two double beds (as a practical matter, really only big enough for one person), a rolling office chair in front of the small table between the beds, and one easy chair. The room would be suitable only for two people and one open suitcase at a time. You would have to make an effort to find a place to stash a second suitcase - possibly in the small closet. Bathroom was arguably nicer than the room and there were enough small shelves to hold a shaving kit and toiletries. The hotel makes good use of limited space in the bathroom. I slept well and had no problem with noise, but did hear people from the narrow hallway outside my room.A couple of issues keep me from giving this hotel a higher overall rating. Shortly after I got into the room I heard a noise I couldn't place. I then heard the doorknob turning and before I knew it the housekeeper was in my room with a chocolate and the next day's weather forecast. While I appreciated the offer of the turndown service, the time between ringing the bell on the door (that's the noise I did not recognize) and entering the room was far too short. In addition, the room was stuffy on a 50-degree day (fortunately I was able to crack open the bathroom window to cool things down - windows that open are an advantage of an older hotel), and a number of TV channels would not come in. I had a mixed experience with the WiFi - I was able to connect my tablet but not my work laptop.Shop around and if you can find a good rate, this hotel could be a good value in a prime location in an extremely expensive city.

We stayed at the Iroquois for 6 nights for a honeymoon break to NYC. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and always willing to help you or solves any issues you may have. It is located between 5th and 6th Avenue so is perfectly located as a sightseeing base with the 42nd St Subway stop about 5 mins walk away or alternatively Times Square is about 6-7 mins walk away. There is an interesting cocktail bar located in the hotel which appears to be very popular with local New Yorkers - can't deny the cocktails are good but guess they need to be at those prices There is hot coffee available in the lobby in the mornings and a beautiful hot apple cider in the afternoons. All in all you can't go wrong with the Iroquois....

great location, friendly staff. the rooms are small but clean. the hotel is within walking distance to great restaurants, times square Macy's, empire state building, the village, central park and museums.

I have stayed at this quaint hotel at least once a year for the last five years. Small but adequate rooms are clean and nicely designed. My only complaint is the temperature is never quite right but most hotels struggle with temperature. The staff is by far the best I've encountered in NYC. Always helpful, pleasant, friendly and knowledgeable. Feels like coming to a familiar home. I hate to tell everyone about my secret treasure that is close to everything I need. But it would be a shame not to let the Irowuois get recognized for their attributes.

This is a small gem within the busy city of New York. Staff is always welcoming and friendly. Bar is a pleasure. Room delightful. It is in a great location and the concierge is extremely helpful. My husband and I always look forward to staying here.

With a caveat. We were there in August 2014 when we were visiting law schools with my son and took advantage of the hotel's multi-night discount. Buyer beware. The room they placed us in was hot when we arrived and didn't cool down when we lowered the thermostat. On our way out we asked them to check, but when we got back it was even hotter. Their "fix" was to lower the temp to the lowest setting. The desk clerk actually acknowledged that this was an ongoing issue with this particular room. Guess that's what you get with a discount. The room was 83 degrees and they finally offered to move us to a smaller room, which considering the size of the hot room, they were moving us to a walk in closet. I am giving the experience a 4, only because they eventually (and I mean eventually) moved us to a lovely suite that had AC, but only grudgingly.

Staff was very friendly on check in and throughout stay. Restaurant is excellent. Great wine list and menu. Had hamburger for lunch. Fries are made in duck fat. Chef Florian Wehrli came out and met with diners. Superb experience.

excellent centrally located hotel not far from times square but just far enough away that the noise doesn't interfere with sleepexcellent servicewould certainly recommend to couples and families alike
user_name:
Lynn B
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We were a family of four, husband, wife, and two daughters, the youngest being 17 We were in town to splurge for my husband's birthday with a show and dinner. I had mentioned, when I made the reservation, that we were celebrating his birthday, and there was a fruit and chocolate platter and a split of pinot noir waiting for us in our suite - complimentary! The furnishings were comfortable and generous. Everything was a bit on the dated side, but still very usable, which enhanced the comfortable opulence of the place. There is nothing garish here: you get the same feeling as you do when you slip on your favorite pair of slippers.We were so glad we opted for the suite - which gave the four of us plenty of space. The girls said the pull out couch was comfy - with a memory foam mattress. Our king bed was amazingly comfortable. The place was spotless and well stocked. I do wish they had given us two more water glasses, we had two and then two wine tumblers, which were rather large and hard to handle - and I'm sure we could've called down and had them sent up; but we didn't bother, since we were there such a short time.We returned from the show to freshen up for our dinner downstairs at The Triomphe, to find our beds pleasantly turned down and the room spruced up. The next day, we left our luggage with the bell service and kept the car with the valet while we went to the Guggenheim. We were impressed the doorman remembered us each and every time, and asked after our day, if we were enjoying our stay - just very caring. It was the same with the bell service. And they never hung around for tips. They helped us and then were immediately helping others. We would turn around to tip and they would be gone. It's these little touches that added to our comfort and made us feel so well taken care of.This hotel is small and clearly knows their niche. We thought we got a very good deal directly through their online booking and everything was well coordinated and went smoothly. We will definitely be back!PS - They do provide you with an envelope to tip the maid if you do so desire.

I stayed at the Iroquois for a week between 6 and 13 March, 2015. My room was fairly roomy (considering the pigeon holes I've stayed at in the past in NYC) and well-appointed. The queen bed was comfy. The room came with a decent-sized work table and a chest of drawers to put away clothes. There's also a small closet to hang suits and jackets, which also holds the room safe and a steam iron (VERY handy when you have to run for meetings right after check-in). Can't say much for the view from the room's windows - they looked out into an atrium of some sort between the hotel and the next building. There's a 32-inch LCD TV with a DVD player. Didn't use this much as US tv channels annoy the hell out of me with an overdose of ads. Oh, and there's complimentary high speed wifi that works on at least 2 devices at a time. My only possible gripe about the room was the low levels of lighting. There are no ceiling lights and you need to turn on all the standing lamps (bed-side, on the table) to make the room seem a little lively. The bathroom (sparkling clean) has a tub/shower cubicle combo, Molton Brown bathroom products and lots of towels. Service was quite good. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful, This was evident from the fact that my boss (who was traveling with me) is a tyrant as far as keeping hotel staff on their toes is concerned, and he left feeling very satisfied. Housekeeping checked in twice a day to tidy up the room and to carry out the evening turn down. Food was excellent, although the Iroquois doesn't have a very large in-room dining selection. The in house restaurant, Triomphe, is really excellent though. The best thing about the place, of course, is that it's in the heart of Manhattan (West 44th st.) and a few minutes' walk from Times Square and Central Park. While it's not exactly cheap (my room went for an average of USD 300 a night), it's also not ludicrously expensive like some of the bigger chain hotels in the vicinity. Will recommend this for a stay in NYC, and will certainly stay here again if the opportunity arises.

I had a most comfortable and pleasant stay at the Iroquois. My room was towards the back of the building, very relaxing, peaceful and clean. Service was responsive and kind. My room was small, given it is in NYC I did expect that. There was limited desk space but laptops are for laps, right? I absolutely recommend this hotel.

This was the perfect stay for our two year wedding anniversary. The location was smack dab in the middle of everywhere you wanted to be. We were there during the early month of March and it was cold and snowing. The rooms were so warm and I still think of that big down comforter. The staff were beyond kind and welcoming and late night cocktails at the Lantern's Keep were the best!! I loved this hotel and the only thing bad I can say about it is that I had to leave!!

Opslået Mar 11, 2015We were so pleased with the hotel. The location can not be better , Times Square was only 5 minutes walking away. We could just walk to most of the " must see " places. The rooms are not too specious , but very nicely decorated. We couldn't pack our baggage out from the suitcase , but we managed.The bathroom is beautiful. Chocolate every day and free newspaper , this small things were so nice. Everybody was so kind at the hotel, helped with everything.. We wanted to check in earlier and that was no problem at all. Also ,after checking out we could still come back to the hotel at the late afternoon to freshen up before travelling to the airport.Our luggage could be stored there all day . We will be back again. I will definitely recommended the hotel to others and will be happy to stay here again.

I've stayed at the Iroquois on at least four occasions and after having lived in New York City for 7 years, consider it the best hotel to stay in for the money. The friendly staff, the cleanliness of the rooms, and the location are the reasons why I will only stay in this hotel.

Great hotel! The staff is excellent, we were treated so well! Our room was so nice , well decorated and very clean! This was our second time staying here and when in NYC again, we will chose this hotel again! It is close to everything. We were able to walk to all our destinations. Thank you so much for a wonderful NYC experience!

This was our second time to stay at the Iroquois. We like this hotel a great deal. We chose it because of its location. It's close to the Theater District and an easy walk to two separate subway lines. We chose to return because of the extremely friendly and courteous staff. It's also a relatively good value as Manhattan hotels go. We will definitely stay again.

My wife and I chose the Iroquois for our stay in Manhattan on our trip to celebrate our 30th anniversary. We have stayed at a number of midtown hotels on past trips; the Iroquois is by far the best.Lisa greeted us warmly and checked us into our room. We booked a premium king room.
