She fulfilled our request for a quiet room on an upper floor, and arranged for a treat of wine, chocolate covered strawberries, and chocolates to help us begin our anniversary celebration. Lisa assigned us room 1210 which was on the top floor and located away from elevators and stairs. The room and bathroom were spacious. The room was tastefully and comfortably furnished and well-maintained - no marks on walls; no chipped, peeling, or stained furniture. It appears that the hotel may recently have been updated or renovated. The bed was very comfortable. Even halls were tastefully decorated with sconces, mirrors, paneling and borders; again, not a scratch or mar marked the walls.We enjoyed a special meal at Triomphe, the hotel restaurant. It was excellent, but I save more comments for the restaurant review.We also were very impressed by the attentiveness and helpfulness of the staff. I apologize for not remembering names of the doormen, but someone always was at the door to wish us a great day or to welcome us back after our forays into Manhattan. The concierge was always available if we had questions.The location of the Iroquois was perfect for us. The main reason for selecting this location was proximity to Broadway theatres without staying in the midst of the noise and commotion of Times Square. Bus stops nearby provided convenient access and routes to museums on Fifth Avenue, to restaurants in lower Manhattan, and to shopping. Finding taxis never posed a problem. Also, we walked to St. Patrick's Cathedral, Saks, the New York Library, and other nearby venues.Reservations gave us excellent rates; they honored lower rates even after I booked the room.The Iroquois is an older, elegant, and refined hotel, the kind that we prefer. If you are looking for the bustle of New York and for views of Manhattan, the Iroquios is not for you. Go to the "big boxes" on Times Square.

I've stayed at the Iroquois more than five times for visits to New York. The location is perfect for visiting Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park, but is also located a quiet street. Best hotel in midtown Manhattan.

The Iroquois is a fabulous hotel. The staff is very warm and courteous. The hotel is luxurious as well as gives you a very comfortable, homely feel. Location is perfect, few blocks away from Times Square, right around the corner from Fifth Avenue. Perfect Perfect!!

Just finished a 4 night stay at the Iroquois with my wife. Hard to find any fault in the hotel at all.Firstly the location is excellent for tourists. Its right next to the theaters and Times Square and steps away from 5th avenue. We walked to Central Park (and actually on to the Natural History Museum) the Empire State Building and down to Soho. Its also close to a number of Subway Stations and Grand Central Station is just up the street. Its as central as you can possibly be.The check in was speedy and the staff in the hotel are all incredibly courteous and helpful, especially Bill the concierge. Bill can get you theater tickets, book tours for you - whatever you need. The lobby is small but tasteful. The room itself was a reasonable size for NYC. We had a Queen size bed. Room was tastefully appointed and comfortable. The bathroom was also a decent size and very nicely fitted out. Ftatscreen tv had all the cable channels you would need and there was free wifi for unlimited devices. Didn't use any of the hotel's other facilities although i understand there is a fitness room in the hotel. Also didn't eat in the hotel since its so close to so many great places to eat. We had breakfast every morning in the Red Flame Diner which is steps away from the hotel. We also loved Virgil's BBQ which is straight up the street towards Times Square. Great food and at a reasonable price. All in all I loved the Iroquois and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone and look forward to staying there again on my next visit to NYC.

Very conveniently located for our busy vacation. Indian restaurant on 63, 2 plays, concert carnagie, MMA, MoMA, Blue Note and shopping SOHO. Staff was very helpful. Room was clean and efficient. Bed a little soft and the room too warm.

The hotel is very nice, in a perfect location. It unfortunately share the same problem of many Ny hotels. Noise from the street (and from the air system) that makes difficult to sleep all night long..

My wife and I had an exceptional experience at the Iroquois.It is a snug harbor from which to explore the experiences of NYC. Staff members are friendly and helpful. While on the small side, our room had touches of comfort, including terry cloth robes,a courtesy bar and chocolates each night,plus delivery of the NY Times each morning.It was the dead of winter and we learned to keep the room temp up to a comfortable level. There was a bit of street noise even on the 10th floor,but not bad. We wandered about the theater district,popped back to the hotel for a bit, took the subway to the Village for lunch, and returned to change for dinner. We highly recommend this boutique hotel that is so conveniently located. AND - we arrived at 6:45 AM on a Monday.The overnight desk clerk checked us into a room quite early that day with no extra charge.Thank you!

The rooms were clean and modern. The wi-fi in the room was good. The front desk staff were lovely. There is a pub and bodega across the street. Times square is only 2 blocks away, 3 from radio city music hall.

This is a great little hotel, within easy walking reach of plenty of things in mid-town Manhattan. We were upgraded to a suite, so hard to comment on the size of the room, but it was classic, well-appointed, everything worked, great separate shower and deep bathtub and it was clean. Good reading lights. Great bed with nice Frette sheets. Staff are super-friendly, restaurant La Triomphe, was excellent. This isn't a hip and trendy hotel, but it is comfortable, well-designed and classic. Great value when we stayed.

We had a wonderful 3 day stay at the Iroquois. We were in the city to celebrate a milestone birthday and the staff at the hotel couldn't be more accommodating. We had a lovely upgrade, and gifts awaiting us in the room. It's location is perfect; close enough to the theater district to enjoy its offerings, but far enough away to avoid the noise and congestion. We were also able to travel easily to some of our favorite restaurants on the Eastside. It will be our definitely go-to hotel whenever we travel to Manhattan.

I have stayed here many times. It is a very nice boutique hotel, situated close to the theater district. The staff is very helpful and very responsive to any request. The rooms are quiet, very clean and nicely furnished. The bathrooms are well appointed and they provide more towels than you could possibly use. And Moulton Brown toiletries. The rooms could use better better lighting. Also, the lamps that are there are very difficult to turn on and off if you do not have more strength in your fingers than I do. My room was quite cold when I arrived but when I reported that, they had the building engineer rectify the situation promptly. They have very good specials at times during the off-season. I highly recommend this hotel.
user_name:
nananorth2
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We just returned from 4 fabulous days/nights at the Iroquois. This was our fourth visit. Each of the previous trips were excellent - this topped the others.We had called in advance to ask about wine shops. Imagine our surprise and delight when we were greeted with a bottle of Pinot Noir and chocolate covered strawberries.Every staff member was friendly, courteous, and beyond helpful. We stayed in a superior king: plenty of room; substantial space for clothes (closet and bureau); fine bed; frette linens and robes.Bathroom storage space could be a bit more ample but not a problem. Shower is tall enough for LeBron James - and the mirror did not steam up after a quite warm shower.Location is excellent - halfway between 5th and 6th Avenues near Times Square, theaters, NY Public Library, Rock Center. Multiple subway lines are within a few blocks.We can't recommend the Iroquois highly enough - it's our one and only place to stay for our annual NYC jaunts.

Great hotel with relatively quiet rooms, for NYC. Very comfortable. Great staff. Fantastic location. Book at the right time of year and you'll get a great deal. When NYC is busy it ain't cheap. But it's a great hotel.

My wife and I were coming into the city for a very special occasion and had booked a maximum suite to celebrate (well in advance). On arrival we are informed that there is an HVAC problem in our suite and the other suites are full. They offer to put us into a deluxe room and knock $100 off the price. THATS THE REGULAR PRICE FOR THAT ROOM! Once I discovered that the Algonquin next door had a suite available, and showed the manager that the check in front desk help had done nothing but give us a sub-room for a standard price, you can consider me done with this establishment. Room service is only available on certain days. The staff did come through with a further room rate reduction after I had it out with them, and comp-ed the ***$55*** a day parking fee. The Triomphe restaurant is world class, a tremendous dining experience. Most of the front desk staff was superb and seemed genuinely interested, the other half and management only seemed determined to give out the minimum acceptable...and the price for that is a negative review. While the property is gorgeous, there are NUMEROUS venues in the area, we won't be back. Damn near ruined our anniversary, but WICKED on Broadway was too darned good.

My daughter and I celebrated our February birthdays in true, old world charm. We came to NYC to see a show and The Iroquois is the perfect location. Our theater was one block away. Times Square is down the street but one would never know it. The street is quiet and you can get a restful sleep at night! Upon arrival, we had a bottle of wine and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries in our room with a card wishing us a happy birthday and a lovely stay. The weather was freezing, but sunny. Our hotel offered hot coffee in the morning and hot apple cider in the evening. Delightful! The concierge, Bill, was friendly and so helpful. Vanessa showed us how to get to the subway, what trains to take, and made restaurant recommendations. The rooms are small, it is New York, but perfectly appointed. The bathrooms are totally renovated with modern fixtures and top of the line products. They still offer evening turn down service with chocolates on your pillow! The hotel bar is a lively happening place. Although the lobby is small, it is quite charming and there is a quaint but cozy library where one can enjoy a morning coffee and read the paper. Did I mention the New York Times is delivered daily to your room? I, sadly, leave The Iroquois today. But, as I write this review, using the FREE WIFI, I know I will return here the next time I travel to NYC. Perfect stay!

Myself and two teenage daughters have just returned from a long weekend at the Iroquois Hotel. This is our fifth stay in the hotel over as many years - we've tried others in the City but keep returning to this boutique hotel as we love it so much. Why??1. Location - not even 5 minutes walk to Times Square yet in a quiet street you wouldn't know all the neon and bright lights are just by. It's also the same distance from 5th Avenue and about 8 minutes walk to Grand Central Station.2. Staff are friendly and polite. Very helpful. 3. Hotel itself is lovely - small and boutique, luxurious rooms, chocolates at turn down, towelling robes, molton brown toiletries, lovely beds and bedding. Quiet rooms. The last couple of times we've got a good price for a suite which has a kingsize bed and double sofa bed in the lounge area. 2 TVs, I Pod docking station etc.There is complimentary coffee served in the foyer in the morning and hot apple cider in the afternoon..The only thing that's disappointing is that I they don't provide complimentary bottled water in the rooms. It's available but chargeable along with a well stocked fridge of chargeable items. However on my most recent visit they provided a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates and on the previous visit a complimentary breakfast for us all. I think this was because we've visited so many times - oh yes, this time we were able to check in at 9 am on the day of a arrival and were able to check out 2 pm on the day of departure which was really great. I guess these things depend on the room situation.I would highly recommend - you won't be disappointed. Also visit the Red Flame Diner which is almost next door - great for a traditional American breakfast. The Times Square Deli at the end of the road is good for sandwiches and snacks too..

For the past two years my husband and I have celebrated our dating anniversary at the Iroquois. With the way they’ve treated us both times, we simply could not pick another hotel when visiting New York in the future. But why we would ever want to?! First of all the staff: both the housekeeping and front desk staff members are incredibly professional and most importantly, friendly. They are very helpful and really are a welcome sight after dealing with flights, taxi’s and traffic outside. The hotel itself is small and charming. This year, they treated us to an upgrade, which was very kind of them to do. Our room was larger than the year before when we stayed, with a much bigger bathroom and closet. The location of the Iroquois is perfect. It’s close to Bryant Park, Grand Central Terminal, the theater district and the Subway. It’s the perfect spot to start a walk towards Central Park just to take in the sights and sounds of Manhattan. The cozy bar in the hotel's restaurant is the perfect place for a well-constructed cocktail before heading out to a play or to meet friends elsewhere in the city. Simply put, between the service, location and attention to detail, the Iroquois will always be our home away from home when visiting New York no matter what the occasion is we are celebrating in the future.

We loved New York and the hotel and staff were excellent . It's got style and it's got class which just what you want . With good customer care and positive vibe I would come back again . The hotel location and its cocktail bar make it a place for all the right reasons, just superb.The info given to us was part the reason we had a great trip and recommend this hotel to all my friends . Bill and j jay were really great members off staff and so helpful .

If you are looking for a small, intimate hotel with a very nice staff in a central location then this would be an excellent choice. We have stayed here several times and have had a consistently good experience.

wonderful hotel a bit away from the crowds of times square but close to everything, plays, restaurants etc.very friendly and helpfull staff....................................................................

The staff, services, location and size of this hotel are outstanding. The room essentials - bed, sheets, towels, cleanliness - are also excellent. Room decor is rather basic for a four star but we keep coming back because of everything else.

The Iroquois Hotel is in a perfect location for New York visits. We spent 3 nights there and found access to transportation very convienent. Our room was a premium king, which was a bit larger, and had a good location on the top floor as requested. Excellent amenities. Although technically at the back of the hotel, room 1210, had a open view feeling with 3 windows in the bedroom and you could see out to the street, but it was very quiet. Room was very clean, and had excellent amenities and housekeeping service. We will stay again.

Couldn't have had a better theater weekend in NYC thanks to the staff, accommodations, and great location of the Iroquois. The staff is genuinely concerned about our comfort. Our room was spotless and comfortable. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip.

This hotel always feels like "home" when I'm in New York. We've been staying here since 2001 and rate it highly for location and ambience. It's the perfect choice if you attend nearby Broadway shows or rely on the subway to make your way to all other parts of town as it's a short walk to all subway lines and connections. It's also a perfect choice if you prefer small, boutique hotels instead of large, impersonal chain hotels. I hope this review doesn't make it more difficult to secure a reservation!

A really great hotel, with an awesome location and very nice people. Maybe a bit expensive, but that is to be expected in the center of Manhattan. Nice soft beds, the more luxurious rooms were quite big. All in all a great experience.

Warm, friendly, relaxed but attentive service. Great location. Rooms very good (plus the sauna was a real bonus during the recent weather). intimate bars and restaurant. I'll be back. Highly recommended!

I booked The Iroquois Hotel based on reviews I read on TA. This hotel really is a small luxury hotel situated in a great location. Walking distance to most major tourist attractions. I booked our room during the Black Friday weekend and received a good price for this type of hotel in mid town Manhattan. Our room consisted of two double beds which were very comfortable. The Frette linens were a nice plus. We were on the 8th floor, with views of the hotel next door. Not a big deal as we were only in our room to sleep and didn't spend much time in our room. When I booked my reservation, I mentioned that we were celebrating my daughters Sweet 16 BD and I was told that they would do something nice to recognize her special BD. Unfortunately nothing was done. We found it difficult to access the electrical outlet under the desk and would recommend better location to plug in computer devices.Overall, for the price I paid, I was satisfied with our stay at The Iroquois Hotel. All the staff were very friendly and professional. Vanessa, the Concierge, was excellent and gave us so much information.

I stayed again at the Iroquois during the most recently cold snap. Their attention to detail was amazing; extra blanked, hot cider in the lobby at night. The staff always makes you feel like you are the most special guest they have ever had. You have to stay at this hotel when you are in NYC!

Awesome stay. Might want to consider stopping at Duane Read around the corner for extras.... Light on the necessaries and mini-bar is super expensive.. Service was the best. Great little boutique near Times Square.

Brilliant hotel on 44th Streeet between 5th and 6th Avenue. Perfect location for business at Bank of America Tower and also for the tourist. On this basis, the hotel was perfectly equipped for the businessman and the tourist. My room was on the top floor (12th floor) and had a good view of my favourite building in New York, the Chrysler Building, so I was happy. The bed was very comfortable, the room spotlessly clean and the bathroom a good size. I was delighted with this hotel. I stayed for the second week of February 2015 and at $170 to $220 per night the price was right too. At these prices I would stay again. The staff were friendly and helpful. I liked everything abut this hotel. I will right another review about the bar behind reception, the Lantern's Keep as that deserves an excellent review in its own right.

Everything about this hotel was amazing - the service was outstanding and everyone went above and beyond to make our stay amazing, the rooms, while slightly on the small side, were immaculate and very nice, the hotel gym was top notch, and the location couldn't be beat. My only (very small) complaint is the elevator - there are only 2 and they're both tiny.

I have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions and each time the experience has been absolutely fantastic.The rooms are great, the staff is helpful, polite and courteous and the location is terrific.I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in NYC!

Absolutely agreeing with the bulk of other reviews but bumping the Iroquios Hotel to 5 stars after enjoying a genuine NYC staycation. We actually live in town but wanted to celebrate my fiance's birthday. I let them know in advance and they surprised us with wine and delicious desserts along and really nice note. It's a great property situated right in midtown just a couple blocks from Times Square. It's a great block with lots of historical buildings and restaurants / bars. It's a smaller hotel which gives it a nice personal touch. It's warm and inviting with 2 bar choices that we'll be back to visit regardless. Lastly, the clientele is cool. I literally rode the elevator with an indie rock band who's name i'll keep quiet! There were lots of normal people like me but it felt pretty awesome to talk with some interesting people. Last note... we checked out with no surprises except for a call from housekeeping who told the front desk we left our charger in the room. They literally caught us walking out the door and hand delivered the charger. I was seriously impressed with the entire experience. Hopefully you get the same treatment!

A great location,very nice staff,good restaurant,wonderful towels and sheets! I would highly recommend this hotel.The small size of the hotel makes you feel like a special guest,not one of the masses.

I absolutely loved this hotel! I have ZERO complaints. All of the staff were amazing and accommodating. The room was very clean and comfortable. The turn down service was very welcoming. The hotel was very quiet and peaceful. The location is close to everything! We live in Memphis, TN and will stay here again when we return. EXCELLENT HOTEL!

This hotel met our every expectation and more for our weekend getaway to NYC. Great location, great service and great accommodations. The staff was very helpful and super friendly. We felt like they went above and beyond to make sure that we were having a great time. I highly recommend this hotel.

A great hotel with a fantastic central location that couldn't be beaten. Just a couple of points the lighting in the rooms is extremely poor if you are two females travelling together and one is using the bathroom to get ready and one the bedroom the person in the bedroom will be getting ready virtually in the dark! Also, if you have a room by the lift it is noisy! Other than this everything is great - the beds are really comfy and the staff cannot do enough for you. We will return.

I liked this hotel, it is small and cosy, you quickly get to know most employees, who are very friendly. The room was small, but clean and cosy. Location is perfect, in the middle of everything. I could be back.

Classic elegance in the heart of mid-town Manhattan, with a welcoming and professional staff. Our suite was quiet, comfortable, well-furnished, with superior bath facilities. An easy walk to Broadway theaters, and an outstanding cocktail lounge.

The room we got was clean, bed comfortable and great central location but the head of the bed was right next to the toilet (on the other side of the wall in the bathroom). My recommendation is to go with someone you're really comfortable with cause you're gonna hear everything they do in there. And smell it too. My parents had a different room and didn't have that problem. So hopefully they can fix it soon.

I can really recommend this hotel nice rooms good service by the all of the staff.I only have one thing that i did´t like and was the price on food and quality of it.But overall we were satisfied with our stay.

I really enjoyed our stay at the Iroquois. We got an executive suite and the room was beautiful and very comfortable. We felt very much at home on the property and like that block of 44th street because it is generally very quiet.

We go to the city several times a year to see shows and in the past have stayed at other hotels. In December we ate dinner at Triomphe (the hotel restaurant) and decided to try out the hotel on our next visit. We are SO glad we did. From the moment we walked into the lobby, the friendly staff and atmosphere made us feel welcome. Our suite was beautiful and felt like home. The hotel is close enough to Broadway to be convenient, and far enough away to escape the constant activity. Dinner at Triomphe is something you do not want to miss...top of the line atmosphere, service and food. I have no doubt that we will be returning soon.

We couldn't have been happier with our choice of hotel. I searched online for hours trying to find the perfect place, and this met all our criteria. The location was great, just a couple blocks from Times Square and easy access to subway. The suite was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was also great.

Myself and my girlfriend stayed here for 4 nights, and am I glad I chose The Iroquois!! Brilliant nice and cosy boutique hotel, excellent location. What made our stay so good was the staff who couldn't do enough for you and then there is Bill from concierge what a diamond of a guy, very good at what he does, will definitely use this hotel again!!!

We always enjoy our stay and returned on several occasions. Excellent, attentive, polite staff who are always willing to make your stay more enjoyable. Excellent restaurant, breakfast is delicious and ample, we usually ask for half sizes of their generous portions.

My wife and I came to NY for a show and chose The Iroquois based on reviews and locale. Lovely boutique hotel on 44th and the entire one night stay did not disappoint. Lobby is small and classy, room was a little small but impeccable and quiet. There is a small but cool bar in the rear of the lobby with maybe 6 tables and 4 seat bar. Valet parking available but we chose to park our own car at the Ikon parking garage mentioned on the hotel site and got a $20 discount.A very nice stay and we will return. Almost forgot; free wifi.

There is a reason this boutique hotel does so well here on Trip Advisor. It's quaint, it's clean, it's convenient, it's affordable, it's charming, and it's comfortable.The Iroquois has a simple premise: greet your guests warmly, tend to requests, make the rooms decent, and throw in a little extra: like Frette sheets and towels; Molton Brown products; complimentary Internet; and well-trained staff.I tend to poke around when I stay in Manhattan, trying different hotels. That may stop now that I've stayed at the Iroquois, conveniently located near Bryant Park not far from 42nd and 6th. I suspect I'll return and enjoy another stay.It's a respectable place for a comfortable visit.

Our stay was pleasant and enjoyable. The shower was the best hotel shower I've ever experienced. Water pressure and amount of hot water were outstanding. Water was just a bit softer than most hotels which also makes for a good shower experience. The bed was very comfortable, the room was very clean and the décor was tasteful and well done.
user_name:
Peter P
Colts Neck, New Jersey

review_body: First time I stayed in this hotel, I have to say really impressed and would definitely go back.Fantastic service, great rooms, comfy beds, generally really impressed. There is a great small boutique style restaurant attached, the food was excellent!Generally cant fault and the best hotel I have stayed in within NY.

Enjoyed our stay at the Iroquois. Well appointed, clean, and convenient. Short walk to the theatre and the main attractions but tucked away from too much hustle and bustle. Staff was warm and helpful. This was our second stay and we will definitely consider staying upon our return to New York in the fall.

We had another fabulous stay at this hotel. We come here each year for our anniversary. Great price, beautiful and great location. Times Square 3 blocks from hotel. I was disappointed that the hotel was not full and they didn't upgrade room after I asked. See you next year

We honeymooned and stay at the Iroquois every year for our anniversary. We love the hotel and the location. Doorman services were the only disappointment (it was bitter cold out). We will be back next year.

Perfectly located near subway and bus routes, in heart of theater district and and walking distance to Times Square and 5th avenue shopping. Cabs always available. Room was quiet and bed extremely comfortable. Very nice room. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. Will definitely return.

yes, it's an excellent location, guest rooms are nice and the bed is great. I liked the coffee service in the lobby and the staff was pleasant. There were quite a few issues, though:The bathroom was really cold. There appeared to be no control for that. Reaching a power outlet required athletic prowess. An overflowing toilet was quite a nuisance. According to staff that isn't a rare occurrence. It was resolved professionally, though. Water pressure in the bathroom left a bit to be desired. Two of the more intriguing features of the hotel were unavailable, one - the bar - due to the storm the day before, which in understandable, the second (the Library) due to a private function. Reacting to the email sent out by the hotel asking about my experiences, I described them, checking the box for a reaction by management - which never came, which astounded me at this level. Don't get me wrong, this is still a nice place. Even with the comparatively low rate I got compared to the usual ones they charged, I still didn't feel I got a good value, though, and in fact stayed in two other hotels in NYC where value and, strangely enough, the service was better.

The Iroquois provided a fantastic stay during my first trip to NYC. The concierge service & front desk staff were exceedingly friendly and helpful. From providing a "Subway 101" mini-lesson to holding our luggage after check-out until our evening flight, everyone I encountered at the Iroquois greeted my daughter & I with a smile and eagerness to make our trip an enjoyable one. The continental breakfast (served in the elegant adjoining Triomphe restaurant) was much better (food, service, & setting) than the brunch we had at Sarabeth's. Great location, great people, comfortable, clean!

Excellent service, clean and quiet room, and outstanding location made this trip to NYC with my mother special and memorable. We tried a restaurant recommended to us by the front desk staff and it was wonderful!

The Iroquois hotel provided a beautiful suite overlooking 44th street which was attractive, comfortable and perfectly kept. The bathroom was lovely with choice of bath or separate shower. I was entirely comfortable with the space and was quite surprised at how quiet the room was, considering the busy street. The staff was very polite and very professional. I had breakfast at Triomphe in the morning where I have dined often over the years. The dining room is a lovely space and the food as well as the service is outstanding. I look forward to my next trip.

We enjoyed our stay at the Iroquois. The room and bathroom were spotless, including very nice bathrobes, bed very comfy, desk staff amongst the friendliest I have ever met and we loved the water with citrus slices available in the lobby after the coffee service. There was no tea though! Please add some for non-coffee drinkers for our next visit! The only real negative was the elevator - slow! However, the hotel location made up for that - it was perfectly located near many of the tourist sights we were visiting. We will come back!

Great hotel, nice people, excellent location. The bell men were very helpful, and the all the front office personnel were exceptional. The Red. Flame, next door is a very reasonable restaurant and there is a 24 grocery store around the corner.

I have never written a review on this site, but felt compelled to praise The Iroquois Hotel for making my stay in New York City a fantastic one. We loved the charming decor of our room, the pillows were fluffy, the beds were comfortable and I had a good rest each night. The location is truly great- right next to fifth avenue and a moment from grand central and Times Square, Rockerfeller centre, moma, New York City library and loads of up town shopping options. Also walking distance to numerous subway lines so you really can get anywhere within Manhattan in about 20 minutes, or less, and its convenient on the subway for Brooklyn too. I would highly recommend this small but luxurious hotel to anyone looking for an unforgettable New York City experience.

Stilish hotel, nice (but small) room, elegant bathroom; great location, at three minutes walking distance from Time Square; very nice service; a small defect: the air conditioning starting at night was a bit noisy (but I noticed mainly because of the jet lag that woke me at 3am)

The Iroquois has the charm of the 20th century but mod-cons of the 21st. Excellent location, friendly staff, I will visit again. Loved the coffee in the lobby the concierge was very helpful and the cosy bar. Rooms were warm without being stuffy as can sometimes be the case in NYC in winter.

A wonderful place to stay near the theater district. We stayed for 3 rooms in a double/double which was lovely. Small, yes, but this is NY and how much time do you really spend in your room? No view from our 7th floor room but it was quiet as we were located facing the interior courtyard. Beds and pillows were very comfy. You don't even have to leave 44th street to find fabulous restaurants and bars - Triomphe at the Iroquois, DB Moderne next door, The Blue Bar, The Long Room, The Lambs Club and more! Can't wait to return.

This was my second stay at The Iroquois. The hotel is an old-style upscale type New York hotel, common in this region. It does not have an impressive lobby and its elevators are a somewhat slow, but it is a great hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated, although more to the smaller side. But they are great.The best thing about this hotel is the location. Unbeatable. It is located in midtown, in a very pleasant street, alongside many other upscale hotels, and is a very close walk to Times Square and right next to 5th Avenue. It is also a 3 minute walk from different subway lines. For me, it is simply the best location in New York, especially if this is your first time visiting the city (if you already know the city well, then it may be fun to try out other locations).

If I come to New York again, the Iroquois will definitely be my choice of hotels to stay in.We enjoyed everything about the Iroquois from the service at the lobby to the room.The location is exceptional!

We stayed at the Iroquois for one week earlier this month. Can't wait to return! The rooms are small but appointed very well, and very quiet, and the housekeeping service is excellent. The staff is incredible. The location is perfect for theaters, restaurants, shopping and sightseeing. We took one of their complimentary walking tours and had an amazing time -- learned so much about the area. The afternoon hot cider is a special treat after spending a cold winter day walking around NYC.

We arrived for our annual NYC visit to find that Vanessa,our Concierge,had made perfect arrangements! Terrific suite and the hotel's attention to detail ensured a stress free visit. It is clear why this hotel always ranks top of boutique hotels in NYC.Award winning Concierge Vanessa always makes our visits special.

If you visit NYC for a reason, this Hotel has the location, service and the rooms are beautiful and very clean maintained. Love the shower products they supply, together with nice soft towels. Stay here!

We just stayed at The Iroquois for 4 nights. It was a fantastic hotel. It is small and perfectly located on a quiet street very close to Times Square, Bryant Park, theaters and several subway stations. The staff was top notch, friendly and very helpful. The room and bathroom were small (as we expected), but beautifully appointed. The bed was incredibly comfortable. Although there are not coffee makers in the room, there is coffee available in the lobby -- although it was not good coffee. But Gregory's Coffee is right across the street and is delicious (and their pastries are also delicious). We went there 2 or 3 times each day. Great food at Red Flame Diner (breakfast) and Un, Deux, Trois (crepes) just a couple of doors down. We will definitely stay at The Iriquois again.

Great stay. Super friendly! Great service! Most comfortable bed. Great location close to Times Square but on quiet side street. Gregory's is a great coffee shop across the street. I highly recommend it

A lovely place, friendly staff and a great bar with some great cocktails. On our arrival the air duct in our room was making a racket (thump thump thump at high speed). The front desk tried to resolve the problem without success. The staff moved us to a new room straight away. On our return the next day there was a bottle of wine, some fruit and a letter of apology from the manager - great customer service - with a focus on delighting the customer. Centrally located near all the mid town attractions and a good place to walk to the park and further into Manhattan. Loved the hotel, great rooms (a little small - but hey you don't go to NYC to sit in a room) - I highly recommend. Thanks to Manik for sorting out the rooms on our first night.
user_name:
Steven C
Abbots Langley, null, United Kingdom

review_body: The Iroquois of NY is our favorite place to stay in midtown. The staff are incredibly helpful, we love the small hotel feel with the library off the entrance, and the accommodations. It is an easy connect with Broadway and really the rest of Manhattan.

This is our go-to hotel whenever we go to NY. We like The Iroquois because it is small and centrally located. We also like the fact that there is a very good parking garage directly across from the hotel. We usually get a suite on an upper floor but this time (last weekend 1/24/15) our college age son was not with us so we had a regular room on a lower floor. Our room was right next to the elevator but we never heard a sound. It is true the rooms are small but they are perfectly well appointed. The beds are comfortable, the pillows are soft, the WiFi worked, the staff is always pleasant, the coffee in the lobby is good - it has everything we want in a hotel and if the weather is good we can practically walk everywhere or take a quick cab ride. We got a great online rate because it was January. I will upgrade my review to excellent as soon as they add chargers in all the rooms so I don't have to crawl under the desk and plug my phone into a surge protector or unplug a lamp to recharge my phone. We did have a dreary view of the fire escape but it's the city and closing the blinds took care of that... we will be back.

The suites at the Iroquois have that special charm that allows you to feel as if you're borrowing the pied e terre of some wealthy relative rather than staying in a hotel. Charming, quintessentially New York vibe and a staff that is genuinely warm and welcoming. Vanessa, the concierge, is among the best I've ever encountered. Far from just making a dinner reservation or scoring a theater ticker, Vanessa goes out of her way to make your stay as sleek, convenient and comfortable as possible. Cocktails at Lantern's Keep is a must... a true "gin joint" in the best possible way and meals at Triomphe don't disappoint. All in all, this five star luxury hotel lives up to its promise.

The hotel was very nice, great location and convenience our room was small but fine for two people in a boutique hotel which was the type of experience we preferred. Friendly helpful staff, we would stay there again .Concierge was very helpful too, she explained and arranged our tours.

Stayed for five nights - location and service was fantastic. Beds are very good. Rooms (double double) are quite small but average for NY. We would stay again.If you like really good coffee then go to Gregory's across the road - excellent espresso.

I stayed at the Iriquos hotel last week for 7 nights and I have to admit out of all the hotels I have stayed in New York, this was one of the best. Boutique hotel with a gym and sauna, I never used it but it is there if you need one. Beds were very comfortable, and you have a choice of foam or feather pillows. I usually travel with my pillow but I used their feather pillows and they were great. Rooms are clean, quiet, staff was excellent and two elevators is a perk. We stayed in a room with two double beds and it was quit large for New York standards. The location is 2 blocks from Bryant Park/NY library so you are smack in the middle of many things to see. Theatre district is 3 blocks away, Macy's is a 10 minute walk, Rockerfeller Centre is about 10 minutes the other way. Subway stations close by depending on which direction you are going. Great coffee shop across the street called Gregory's, good breakfast/lunch spot 4 doors down called The Red Flame, and if you want a late night drink (hotel has bars but they close pretty early) there is the Blue Bar a few doors down. You can't beat their location. Free WIFI which is rare in NY. Oh yes, and for the shoppers, 5th Ave and Madison Ave are but a block or two away.

We stayed at the Iroquois before Christmas for a 4 day break. The hotel is perfectly situated a short walk from Time Square and 5th avenue, and only 15 minutes walk from Rockerfella Centre, Central Park, and the taxis are fairly cheap and reliable for other distances around New York. The staff made us feel very welcome and comfortable, and went above and beyond as we were visiting as part of our honeymoon on this trip. The hotel has a charming feel of a classy traditional hotel with a warm feel from the dark wood, and you feel like your at home or staying with friends. Our Room was spacious for the cost (NYC is often expensive for small rooms, not the case here), bed was excellent, rooms well equipped and the Molton Brown toiletries were another luxury touch. The staff could not do more for you as guests and are extremely friendly and smiley. One time we asked for a cab when the road was solid full of traffic, and the doorman went off to 6th avenue, and fetched a cab for us. Concierge also had no problems organising us a towncar transport to Newark at 4am. The ONLY slight thing was that the hot air heating system made a little noise when on, but thats the only down point throughout this hotel!Hotel also provides free coffee in the morning, and free hot apple cider in the afternoon (note that this is American for nice warm apple juice, not the alcoholic version)We will happily make this our hotel when visiting New York again in the future as we had such a lovely stay this time.Just a word of warning for any new visitors to New York, be aware of taxi touts at airports, who come up to you and offer taxis to the centre, these are unlicensed and will charge you a stupid amount on your arrival, make sure you stick to yellow cabs which are available right outside the terminals (yellow cabs are $52 plus tolls and $0.80 surcharge from JFK to Manhattan fixed the touts ask for $150), or official licensed towncars, or hotel arranged shuttles or transport. Just keep you whits about you!

Our family of four stayed in a one bedroom suite over the Thanksgiving holiday. We have family all over Manhattan and The Iroquois's convenient location, just 2 blocks from a central subway station made getting around fast and easy. The suite is clean and well equipped. The sleeper in the living room is due for an update but our teenage was just fine sleeping there. Our king size bed was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was updated, a bit on the small side, but nothing to really complain about. Every night in the lobby the hotel served hot cider. Delicious! Every morning the put out coffee (so my husband tells me.) Of course, times square is just down the street but the crowds and the noise do not filter up to the hotel. We were right off fifth avenue just steps to all the Fifth Avenue shopping. You have to walk up Fifth to get to Tiffanys but Saks is close and so is Joe Fresh and Uniqlo. It's a short walk to Grand Central. There are tons of places nearby to get breakfast. It was a hotel and a real value.

From the minute you arrive you are treated like visiting royalty by a staff that makes you feel like you just got back home! Room was so inviting, spotless and was so comfortable! How many hotels on a rainy day would hand you an umbrella to use for the day !

The Iroquois is a charming and elegant pied-a-terre whose professional staff provide maximum value and dependable customer service. It's wonderful to be treated like a VIP throughout a stressful business week as well as the relaxing weekend that followed.

Booked this hotel with friends for a special birthday. Our room was very small and without certain features you should expect in a 4*. Entrance lobby uninspiring but staff were welcoming and pleasant although one concierge's recommendations (breakfast venue and taxi return to JFK) were poor. The hotel's location was our main reason to stay and in this respect we were more than happy. Two blocks from Times Square and access to all the tourist spots. Used subway almost exclusively for getting around - easy to use just think NS (uptown, downtown), avenues vertical, streets horizontal, Broadway tilted and you just about have it. I will remember the friendy and helpful New Yorkers who, without exception, enhanced our visit, whether they were street cleaners, ticket sellers, police or service staff.

Pros: Good central location. Deluxe King room was clean and well-appointed. Small room as expected, but acceptable. Bigger than some other boutique hotels. Staff was pleasant and helpful.Cons: Moderate "fan" noise, mostly noticeable at night.

I booked this hotel last minute- the website had a "flash sale" so I got a superior queen room for $133. Unheard of in the city! It was located right by Times Square, very convenient to the subway and to the Broadway show I was there to see. The room was a nice size for a city hotel and very clean and comfortable. Front desk was very friendly and helpful. The bar drinks were delicious, but service in there was subpar. The concierge made up for it by sending a complimentary bottle of wine to my room. Valet parking for $55. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel. However, I think the regular priced for my room was $220, so I would have looked for a cheaper place had I not found the deal.

Excellent boutique hotel in excellent location. Very clean and quiet. Staff extremely helpful & the Concierge knows the city well. Would recommend to anyone when staying in Mid-town New York. Made our trip from Australia perfect!!

If you want to be located near to Times Square and within walking distance of theatre shows then this hotel is the place to stay. It also offers a relaxing environment away from the crowds if you wish.The staff were very courteous and concierge Vanessa is the best of any other hotel we have previously stayed in anywhere! The bar located at rear of main foyer is worth visiting for a cocktail treat.Not the cheapest bar in New York but certainly one of the best. Stayed over busy Christmas and New Year period and couldn't have been happier.

The Iroquois is a fantastic hotel. The location is ideal. The rooms are very very nice and completely remodeled. There is no grand lobby which was not problem for us. The restaurant in the hotel was excellent and the bar was hopping. I think anyone would enjoy this hotel.

Room was fine. Staff very friendly. Reasonable rates. Concierge helpful with restaurant suggestions. Great location for the theater, subway access. This was our second visit and I'm sure we will be back. The one negative was that the cocktail lounge seemed a little tired for an after theater glass of wine.

This is my second stay at The Iroquois hotel, and it was just as memorable as the first time I stayed there seven years ago. The location is PERFECT. It is a five minute walk away from Time Square and a short walk away from a number of iconic sites (Grand Central, NY Library, 5th Avenue...) and diners for breakfast. The hotel itself is a small boutique so it's very homely and quaint. Our room was a sufficient size and the grand old fashion decor worked so well, and was lovely to come back to after long days exploring the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel!! The staff were lovely, the hotel was really personal and a world away from a generic chain hotel.

Stayed four nights in suite. Very satisfied with the location and hotel experience. Street noise was noticeable since we were in the front of hotel but that is expected in New York. Hotel staff was very helpful especially the bell men who inquired about our day and what they could do to make it more enjoyable. Will stay again.Will stay again when in Manhatten.

Great stay with three couples celebrating birthdays. Location was outstanding and all staff were anxious to make sure we enjoyed our stay. Room had a nice view and blackout shades to allow for privacy. We will return for sure. Really enjoyed our trip.

We couldn't have been happier with our stay at the Iriquois. The location was perfect for the Broadway show we saw, restaurants and Times Square. The suite we stayed in was absolutely lovely. We are already looking at the calendar to see when we can return!

Great staff and awesome amenities. Vanessa did a great job recommending places to eat and the onboard tour she booked us was great! Jimmy, our guide, was very interactive and knew a lot about New York history. Carlos, went above be beyond to make our stay as pleasant as possible.

Very pleasant hotel, clean and quiet, near to Time Square. Nice room with two comfortable beds, not large room, small wardrobe, bathroom with window. We did not had breakfast.I will probably return there!

The hotel is very well located. Times Square in 5 minutes. Near the subway. The hotel itself is a little old. Our room door handle fell off in the bathroom, so its not repaired. Rooms tiny. The door to the bathroom beat on the table ... but good beds and pillows, clean towels. Newspapers in the morning in the room. Very nice - in the lobby should always hot coffee or punch, fruit platter. There is a business center with computers. The restaurant at the hotel is always full of people, we unfortunately did not have supper. The attentive staff. I liked everything.

Hotel in the middle of everything. Very nice amenities, great restaurant and bar on the premise, good service. Street side is somewhat noisy. Room clean and well appointed but not a lot of room, good for two people not not more.

We have stated this hotel numerous times – and we can't think of a better place that we would stay in the city. The hotels warm and beyond, and excellent service, make us want to go back every year! Even though they had an engineering problem upon check-in and give us a lesser room – manager upgraded us to a sweet and made everything right

Had a nice 3 night stay in the Iroquois during a weekend visit to NYC. The location, as I'm sure you can tell from the many reviews, is superb, only a stones throw from Times Square, 5th Ave, Bryant Park etc.Our room was a Deluxe king on the Fifth floor facing 44th street. Room was a little noisy with some sirens, but it was only a small price to pay for the tremendous location. Room was nicely furnished and was ok size-wise for us as we didn't spend much time at the hotel. There are some signs of wear and tear and it could have done with a little TLC in a number of areas - not quite shabby chic scuffs were dotted throughout the bathroom and bedroom. Refrigerator provided free of charge and was promptly brought to our room when requested, also ice only available on request from the cocktail bar via reception. Sauna & Fitness center were adequate for a small boutique hotel and served their purpose for us. Can't speak for the food at the hotel as we ate out each day/night.Shout mention to Sagar at the front of house who provided a warm welcome to the property, looked after our needs and answered any questions we had - thank you!All in all, would recommend, and would return.

My family and I stayed at the Iroquois through recommendations from colleagues within the hotel community. As a senior operator in a large hotel company, my tastes are discerning and expectations quite high for cleanliness, standards and customer service that's genuine. I couldnt have been more satisfied with the quality of the operation, people and accommodations. The front desk and bell-staff were notably hospitable and went above and beyond on several requests. The concierege is among the best I've worked with and helped us with event tickets and best pizza in Brooklyn recommendations. The guestroom was large for NYC and easily accommodated our family of 4. 2 blocks from Bryant square (the kids ice skate) with all the great shopping and walking distance to Times Square, this is the place to be for the holidays or otherwise. Highly recommend.

This is a quiet relaxing hotel with very friendly staff, minutes away from Times Square.The comfortable rooms are serviced daily and cleanliness of all areas is paramount.Meals are available at the restaurant but if you would like to explore the local area there are plenty of good bars and restaurants to choose from.We enjoyed our visit to O'Donoghues, a local Irish bar serving good food. Give it a try !A 24 hour health club and sauna is available for guests.There is a small library stocked with New York classics to read and free newspapers for guests.There is 24 hour complimentary internet access on the library computer and use of the printer.Coffee is available in the lobby during the morning. This is self service.Staff at the concierge desk will help you with enquiries or bookings re: theatre, dinner, sightseeing and New York City tours etc. The open top bus ride is a good way to see and learn about New York . Staff will also cater for special events. We came back to a surprise birthday cake and a bottle of wine in our room after the concierge heard it was my husband's birthday on Christmas eve. Her kindness was very much appreciated.We enjoyed a very happy Christmas break as a family. The Christmas decorations everywhere around town were spectacular and really worth seeing.We would strongly recommend this hotel. There is a big welcome waiting for all guests.

Its like home it really is , and respect to those that are up at the crack of dawn in freezing tempretures and come to work at the Iroquois just to take care of us, and still they have a sincere smile on there dial when they see you : )) , Thank you guys .. X

No complaints with the hotel. Great location, nice room and friendly service. For the price, I have to admit, I've stayed in nicer places with more amenities. But overall this served the purpose and no complaints.If you want a great lobby, stay next door at the Algonquin. A family member stayed there, the room rate was cheaper and just as nice.

I stood at this hotel during the holiday season for 2 nights (As it was a gift from my parents) and I must say very impressed! This hotel is near the heart of the city but conveniently hidden in a remote location. As soon as I got there I was immediately attended by my bellman, George. Very pleasant and helpful. He was the most resourceful during my stay.As I went to check in the front desk agent Lisa was immediately smiling making my stay more welcoming. She immediately checked me in to a room 1103. This hotel has a very hands on staff! They literally do everything and anything to make you happy. I don't remember me or my husband even pressing the elevator button! Haha! As we went up to my room George recommended nearest bars, restaurants, as well as rooftop lounges near the hotel. There happened to be a place down the street with the best burgers and fries! I was very grateful for this as my husband and I love burgers and fries! As soon as we got into the suite was absolutely beautiful. The decor is warm and cozy. The temperature was set so that you didn't have to feel the NYC cold through the windows. My only concern about that night was that my neighbors were a bit loud but it definitely did not ruin my experience. I would definitely stay here again because of how helpful the staff was! The hotel location, room and staff all an A+ rating!!!

Good location overall not that memorable... The rooms are typically small, shower wasn't great and there are hotels that are better value in NYC free wifi, coffee and hot cider was a nice touch with a fab hotel bar... Can't comment on the food as we ate out...

We (three adults) spent a week in a one-bedroom suite (one on a foldaway double bed in the lounge) here in July after flying through from Australia. Excellent location for tourists – near Grand Central, Times Square and the theatre district and Central Park, to name a few destinations. The rooms were large, very comfortable (luxurious, really) and well-maintained. Staff were very welcoming and helpful throughout our stay. There was a small but well-equipped fitness centre. We had only one meal at the restaurant (Triomphe) but it was outstanding. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and at the price it represented great value.

This little beauty of a hotel right next to crazy fun Times Square is amazingly cozy and boutique yet quiet and very reasonable - how do they do that ???? Two minute walk to Times Square. What a way to see in 2015!The staff were incredible! Friendly and very very savvy! And there were a lot of them too to help us. You had the feeling that you were in a much bigger hotel with fewer guests they were so attentive. Two Concierges, Bill and Vanessa worked so hard to ensure we had a good experience ..... and boy - did we! And they saved us lots of money by searching for good deals. If you are lucky enough to stay here .... you MUST try the restaurant by the hotel .... Triomph! Exceptional French!

If you are looking for a hotel in midtown (which if you are a tourist I would recommend) then this is the hotel for you. My wife and I and our 2 boys (11 & 9) stayed in a 1 bedroom suite for a week at Christmas and we couldn't have been more suitably impressed. The room was above expectations - very well appointed, clean and quiet. Very little traffic noise considering it is Manhattan and our room fronted onto the road. The location was perfect. 2 blocks from the Bryant Park subway station and Winter village and the New York Public Library, 2 blocks from Times Square and Theatre district and just around the corner from 5th Avenue. Easy access to Newark airport - the airport bus stopped on W 42nd just opposite the library. Great little coffee store, Gregory's, across the road and plenty of restaurant options nearby. Hotel staff were very friendly, attentive and efficient. We will definitely stay there again the next time we are in New York.

We spent five days at the Iroquios while in New York for New Year's.I was very pleased with the hotel and their services.The location was convenient and easy to access by both car and subway. There was reasonable-rate parking across the street.The rooms were completely quiet and free of any rumbling or vibrations; the beds were comfortable. The shower water pressure was great (we were on the second floor).The staff was very helpful and had already gone out of the way to help improve our stay by arranging a room with separate beds for my kids before our arrival.Although there are no ice machines available for guests the staff cheerfully and promptly brought us ice whenever we requested it. We were provided a small fridge without charge. The WIFI was free and straightforward.I will look forward to saying at the Iroquois again soon.

The Iroquois is a midtown boutique hotel on 44th street, between 5th and 6th Avenue. It's two blocks away from Times Square, Broadway, Bryant Park and the subway and withing walking distance of everything worth visiting in NYC. The rooms themselves are on the small side (we found out that NYC hotel are like that), but I was really impressed with the small details that made our stay pleasant: bath robes, chocolates on the pillow every night and the New York Times delivered to our door every morning.When you think about Iroquois, think about prime location and excellent price to quality ratio.If there is one thing the Iroquois could improve is the check-in policy. We arrived around noon, but our room wasn't ready yet (indeed, check-in time is 3PM). We dropped our bags, strolled around and had lunch, but at 3PM our room still wasn't ready, we waited until 3:30 when they told us our room wasn't ready, but we could take another one that is, so we went with that (it was at a lower floor, I believe)

This was our second stay at The Iroquois and it did not disappoint. A year ago we stayed in a larger, more quaint room, but this stay was no less special. The location is unbeatable; we walked to restaurants, bars, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station, shopping, etc., and had easy access to the subway to visit the Lower East Side, SOHO and the 9/11 Memorial. The room was beautifully appointed and immaculately clean. Very comfy bed (and turn down service with chocolates). The staff is warm and attentive; special shout out to Sagar at the front door and Bill at the concierge desk. They gave us great suggestions for our "outings" and were so warm and welcoming each time we returned. The hotel is cozy, elegant and gracious, and the price was very reasonable for a midtown location. As in many older hotels, it is not possible to adjust the heat in each guest room. We were a little warm on the 7th floor, but we were able to turn down the airflow, and opened the window at night. It was actually nice to get fresh air, and the street is a quiet one-way street, so no sirens or street noise to disturb us. I highly recommend this lovely little gem!

Giving this hotel 3/5 would have been harsh, but I do feel 4 is pushing it a little. As grand as it looks from the outside, and as polite and courteous as all the staff were (as you'd expect in NYC anyway) I did feel a little let down by the rooms. The 'classic' look isn't really me and as mentioned below the rooms don't really look as they do online. I had a room with no daylight and that overlooked a number of other rooms which was particularly disappointing given the price I paid. The housekeeping left a lot to be desired also as they appeared to do the absolute minimum. Pro's are obviously the location, the staff and the once we eventually got time to do the cocktail bar out the back I can't speak highly enough of the drinks and bartender and would definitely go back there even if I didn't stay at the hotel.

As an introduction to New York, The Iroquois and its staff were a great place to start. The location was perfect, and we both enjoyed the kind of service and feel you get with a boutique hotel. The staff were courteous and helpful, particularly the Concierges. The room was clean and tidy, however the only criticism was that the shower wasn't great as it didn't produce a lot of water.

From the Front Desk welcome that greets you as one of the family to a purely comfortable room, staying at the Iroquois is like home. I always get a good nights sleep and love the close convenience to my office.

Yes it is NY and yes I have stayed at many different hotels here but the Iroquois has to be the smallest. The bathroom is so tiny that you cannot sit in the toilet. There is no space between the toilet and the wall. You have to sit perpendicular. TMI but "I" you can use. I spoke to the staff on the way out and they asked me why I had not complained the night before as they would have tried to put me in a bigger room. I am not sure why I have to ask. Check the included photo if you do not believe me.Location is great and the staff is quite decent. I would not include this in my next NY trip.

Starting off perfectly we were able to get an early check in and begin to roam around the city. The location is very nice. Grand central station and times squares are a stones throw away. The staff was ultra friendly and always willing to help with questions that we had about the city. Even though we were so close to times square it was not nearly as loud at night as you would think. Some police and ambulance sirens was about all we heard over our white noise app on our phone. Small rooms with a pretty good sized bathroom, very clean and the bed was also very comfortable. I couldn't have been happier with the stay and my first trip to New York. Hot apple cider was also perfect in the lobby for the cold!

This property is very well located but very disappointing if you are looking for a true boutique hotel experience. Our stays at Marriott and Hyatt were equally as distinctive. Rooms are not as posh as they appear online and amenities are sparse. It is crowded feeling and bar in rear is very small and overstuffed. It also does not open until 5 pm so forget afternoon cocktails unless you want to sit in the restaurant which has zero ambience. I would not return and we are frequent travelers to NYC.

The Iroquois exceeded expectations from the friendly greeting from Alex at the front desk, to Ezra's warm assistance with luggage, and our concierge, Bill's excellent restaurant recommendations. The room Alex chose for us was superb, newly renovated with a large bathroom, heated floor, and the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in! As others have probably noted, the hotel is close to everything (Grand Central, Time Square, Rockefeller Center, MOMA). We particularly enjoyed walking a couple blocks down to Bryant Park, with it's charming little outdoor shops and ice skating rink, and the NY Public Library.

We have recently returned from a 4 night pre Christmas break in Manhattan and our stay at The Iroquois for this break was excellent. The location of the hotel is great being a short stroll from Times Square, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park and shops on Fifth Avenue. Really in the heart of the buzz of Midtown. The hotel itself is very smart and whilst our room was quite small it as very clean and comfortable. Best of all, despite being so close to the buzz and activity outside in Midtown our room was really quiet - we've stayed in various hotels in Manhattan over a number of years and can truthfully say this is the first time we haven't heard traffic etc. at night from our room.The really best part of this hotel though are the staff. Without exception they were all first class from the door men, reception team, house keepers and concierge team. I would though make one very special mention to Vanessa (concierge) who really went out of her way to look after us both before and during our stay - she is a real asset to The Iroquois team.
user_name:
John M
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Iroquois in mid december and we loved it! The place was very nice and very comfortable. The staff was terrific and very welcoming. The room was small but when you're out and about every day of your trip it doesn't make a difference. We spent our anniversary there and it was easy to make the place romantic. I would recommend this hotel to any and all of my friends and family. I hope you have as good an experience as i did. Only con would be cold bathroom floors but it wasn't nearly bad enough to affect our experience.

Just before Christmas I stayed in The Iroquois with my young son and 20yr old daughter, I couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough. Lovely friendly staff; doormen and receptionists all so lovely, Vanessa the Concierge printed out boarding passes when computer room occupied, nothing too much trouble. Great hotel if you were staying on your own as it feels so safe, the corridors aren't dark but lovely warm brightly lit short corridors to bedrooms, bedrooms were comfortably not too hot. Loved the bathrooms and particularly like the older style bathroom fittings. All in all a lovely experience and would stay there again in a heartbeat. Central to everything and yet very quiet to sleep in at night.

Cannot fault this Hotel . Staff are all helpful , pleasant & go out of there way to help . Location is perfect , minutes from broadway , times square , 5th ave & port authority bus terminal / subway and grand central station . Did not use restaurant / bar facilities but there is no shortage of places to eat at a variety of prices to suit everyone . Concierge was around until 7.30 every evening & great at recommending everything .

The Iroquois Hotel has a warm friendly intimate feeling. We love the rooms; NYC sized yet very nice. The staff are consistently warm and helpful. The location is great between 6th & 5th beside DB Moderne Bistro (a favorite of ours), a great parking lot across the street and even a diner/coffee shop nearby And two blocks to Grand Central Station and 3 blocks to Time Square, most Broadway shows. You can find less expensive options but the Iroquois is worth it AND they have on line rates often less than the .com promoted rates of Travago, Travelocity etc...

I have stayed at The Iroquois several times now and it's always a wonderful experience. I highly recommend it. The location, service, cleanliness and value are all top notch! It's always the first hotel I check when planning a trip to New York.

We recently spent 3 nights at The Iroquois in early December and had an excellent stay.Location - the hotel is very centrally location. 2 minutes walk to Times Sq/Bryant Park, 7 minutes walk to Rockerfeller Centre and 5 minutes walk to Grand Central. We found that we hardly used the Subway at all, enjoying the walk from the hotel straight to the Empire State Building, Flatiron Building and even up to Central Park.Rooms - we were assigned rooms on the 10th floor. Sagar took us up to our rooms, he was fantastic, telling us all about the hotel and room features. The rooms are average sized by NYC standards, with a decent sized bathroom and full side bath. Free WIFI was a decent speed and TV had a good choice of channels. There is a mini bar in the room, but no fridge. If you want a fridge, you can request one.We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely return. The staff throughout the hotel were pleasant and helpful, nothing was too much trouble.

Spent seven days at the Iroquois in early December. Staff were impressive from check-in and throughout the week, offering friendly, helpful and efficient service. Rooms were immaculate and comfortable and complimentary coffee and hot apple cider in the lounge was much appreciated in the cold weather! The central location was superb. We were able to walk to the theatres, restaurants and many of the major sites. Another facility we appreciated was provided in the Library where you could track flight details and use a pc to print of boarding cards etc.My only regret was that we didn't sample the cocktails on offer at the Lantern's Keep- however it's a good reason to return as soon as possible! I can confidently recommend this hotel for family trips or a romantic weekend. If you're looking for a breakfast nearby try out the popular Red Flame diner just down the block.

This hotel is in the best location, just off time square with 5th ave 2 blocks away in the other direction. Walking distance to all major attractions. The hotel is small but more than adequate. Staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are pretty standard but clean. The bathroom has a powerful shower with huge sink, supplied with molton brown toiletries which is excellent. Nice hotel

It is a really nice hotel in a very busy area. It is calm and welcoming , I would highly recommend this hotel if staying in a central location. The staff are a credit to the hotel all of them, it is a very classy hotel. I have stayed in a number of hotels in various cities and I felt this was like home from home. Very clean calm friendly convenient hotel .

My daughter and I just stayed here, and I found this wonderful, small hotel on trip advisor. It's in a perfect location--a quiet street (44th), but close enough to the bright lights and crowds of TImes Square and within walking distance of Madison Square Garden, Bryant Park, and Rockefeller Center. The staff was very friendly, and the hotel had a cozy, home-like atmosphere. Our double queen room was small, but clean and comfortable. The size was not a problem, as we didn't spend a lot of time there. One of the concierges, Vanessa, was very helpful in answering many of my questions before we even arrived. I can't wait to go back!

The Iroquois hotel is a great little hotel in the heart of the midtown theater district. Nearly everything is within walking distance. Two doors away is the famous Algonquin hotel, but their rooms are very small. One minute away is the very convenient eating place The Red Flame -- fastest service you will find anywhere! Service at the Iroquois is friendly and prompt. I have stayed at the Pierre and I have stayed at the Holiday Inn. I will return to the Iroquois!

First class hotel in a perfect location! Wonderful staff, clean and quiet room, comfortable lounging and sleeping and professionally accommodating. Easy walking to great shops and highlights. We will definitely return.

This hotel is located perfectly in mid-Manhattan. It is short walk from everything. Two blocks to Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, and main train station. Just a short walk to Empire State Building and Maddison Square Garden. The rooms are typical for New York (small) but were well done and immaculate. Of course it doesn't matter because it's NYC and you won't be there much anyway. Hotel was helpful with travel around city and accomadates requests very well. Would strongly recommend.

The staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating. Guestroom was cramped and dimly lit. Common areas were also small yet attractive. The hotel is convenient to midtown attractions, accessible yet off on a quiet street.Bottom line is its tight quarters for a family of three considering the nightly rate.

We spent ages deciding on which hotel to stay at whilst in New York. There were about 5 on my final list, all in various areas of the city, but all in this price bracket. We finally decided on The Iroquois because of the location and also the positive reviews it had on Trip Advisor.The location is great. Located down a fairly quiet (for NYC) street, it's only a couple of minutes to the hustle and bustle of Times Square and the theatre district, and the fantastic shops up and down 5th Ave. This suited us perfectly, and we did a lot of walking as a result, and didn't have to worry about cabs or the subway. The room itself was very comfortable but there wasn't much space around the bed (we were expecting it to be small, as most hotel rooms in NYC are said to be). The only lights in the room were 2 bedside lamps, and a standing lamp in the corner. These didn't provide a huge amount of light for the room. There was very little natural light from the window as there was a large building directly outside blocking it, but as we didn't spend a great deal of time in here aside from sleeping, it wasn't a real issue. The bed was very big and extremely comfortable. I slept very well, until being woken in the morning. The bathroom was spacious and comfortable. The service team were very friendly and polite, and were very happy to help with suggestions and recommendations on things to do and the best way to get to places. They were happy to store our luggage for us when we checked out as we had a late flight, and they arranged for a car to collect us from the hotel and take us to the airport for a reasonable rate.There were however a few downsides to our stay, and these were:Whilst we were there, renovation was taking place on part of our floor. This meant that most mornings at 8am, we were woken by workmen starting work. One morning, they were laying a protective sheeting along the floor, which was quite noisy.The hot water in the bathroom sink came out in a dribble which was a nuisance. Also, the plug in the sink didn't actually stay down properly, so it wasn't possibly to fill the sink with water without keeping the tap running. Finally, as mentioned previously, there wasn't a lot of light in the room.Those few things didn't come close to ruining our stay, we had a great time, and will certainly be back.

I'm really rather surprised by the glowing reviews of this hotel. I found it to be perfectly acceptable but not above average. This is an old building, and while they've done the best they can with furnishing the rooms comfortably, rooms are small and dark.Pros:- the continental breakfast provided for Small Luxury Hotel members in the restaurant was good- they've done a nice job on making the hallways as welcoming as possible, with a fun carpet and light paint- convenient Midtown/theater district location- good water pressure in the shower (not a given in NYC hotelsCons:- room was on the small side, and little natural light despite being on the front of the hotel (not uncommon for NYC hotels), - limited number of elevators so you sometimes ride the elevator with cleaning carts and linen tubs- no upgrade for SLH status because no room available at the class one notch above my booking, even though other hotels will upgrade to any available room- newspaper delivered one morning out of three (hardly important, as several papers are available in the lobby, but just kinda strange)Overall a decent option, and I would consider staying there again if the rate was right and my higher ranked choices weren't available or affordable. But wouldn't be my first choice.

excellant hotel, fantastic location right in the heart of the city. Rooms are clean & hotel staff is very accommodating. We've stayed at this hotel 3 times over the past few years and every time it's been wonderful.

My daughter and I celebrated her birthday in New York. From the minute we walked through the doors at the Iroquois, we felt welcomed. My daughter was even given a goodie bag. Her favorite part of the Hotel was the hot cider every afternoon. As a mom on her own, I felt very safe at the hotel. Room service was great and the location could not be beat. We walked to everything. We hope to return next year!

This was our fourth time staying at the Iroquois. Since we stayed for the first time, we have been hooked. The location is fabulous, the restaurant is outstanding, and the service is impeccable. Once again, we really appreciated the service of Bill the concierge - he is so warm and friendly and helps with any request.

Everything I experienced was perfect. I did not use the dining facilities, I wanted to experience dining out in the city. The hotel room was very nice, with a nice clean bathroom, the room was big enough for a four nights stay. The location was perfect, near everything in midtown, time square was a few minutes away. The hotel as a New York charm that really complimented the whole experience. If your looking for an hotel in New York, you won't go wrong here. They made us welcome, they kept our cases until we were ready to fly after checking out. They also booked us a car to the airport for 80 dollars, this in my opinion was worth every penny. The driver arrived in time, took care of the luggage. He was very friendly, polite and very safe, the car was far superior to a New York taxi and by far more comfortable.Honestly I can not recommend the Iroquois enough, it just enhanced what was a great experience of a great city.
