If you stay at the Iroquois especially if it's your first ever visit, like ours was, you will be in very safe hands. They will help with anything. The best hotel I've ever stayed at just perfect.

This hotel deserves its place among the world's smallest luxury hotels. When travelling to New York our party was adamant that they wanted a small hotel not a sky scraper but still wanted it close to all the attractions particularly the theatre district. After much searching we came across this hotel. Location is perfect (close to Times Square, Bryant Park and Rockerfeller centre).The hotel is about a five minute walk to Times Square but has a very peaceful feel to it. There is a also a convenient subway station nearby. From the minute we arrived the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We had suites in the hotel and they were both very spacious. There was a living room with a sofa bed in and a bedroom with a king size bed in. We travel a lot and I can honestly say that the beds, pillows and linens were the comfiest I have experienced. The room was kept very clean and the chocolates on your pillow at turn down are a nice touch. The bathroom was kept very well stocked with gorgeous Molton Brown products and the shower was powerful and there was plenty of hot water. All of the staff were friendly from reception staff to door men to cleaners. A special mention to Bill and Vanessa on the Concierge desk who were very friendly and pleasant and a big help with all our requests. They recommended amazing restaurants, gave us directions and organised a car back to the airport and always had a smile on their face. I can't wait to return to this hotel in the future.
user_name:
Rachel9033
Isle of Man, United Kingdom

review_body: Rooms are the right size; you have a reading chair with ample light; you have a desk with space to work; thou have wi-fi that is fast; you have a staff that is friendly and helpful. You are in a great part of town.

coming here for years now...super friendly personnel, efficient concierge, rooms are well kept and clean, beds are good ...We always take a luxury room more on the inside and we are never disappointed. We also appreciate the nice little touches of coffee in the morning and a warm tisane in the afternoon in the hall.

This hotel is among the world's smallest luxury hotels, and for good reasons. Excellent staff with helpful concierge. Quaint restaurant with bar. Rooms small but extremely clean and comfortable. Location is perfect. Walk to Rockefeller center, Times Square, Bryant park, and subway a couple blocks. Will definitely come back!

A charming hotel in the midst of everything Manhattan. The rooms are small, but clean, comfortable and well appointed. The beds are divine! Service is warm, efficient, professional and friendly. Ideal

This is my second stay at the Iroquois. The first time I stayed was so memorable that I had to bring my husband and friends with me this time.I couldn't wait to have the warm apple cider after coming in from a very cold, wet and rainy day. What a GREAT way to start our adventure.The staff at the Iroquois are fabulous. I have worked in hotels myself and can say without a doubt that these guys go above and beyond. Vanessa the concierge is truly knowledgeable about that great city and sweet and patient. I can't wait to go again.

I am a regular with the Iroqois since more than ten years. Service has gone from quite good to very good. Location is perfect. I will continue my relation with the hotel and will not hesitate to recommend it to others.

Having paid £1,000 per room for a 3 night stay, I was hugely disappointed that only one of the two "accessible" rooms I requested was available. This was made worse by construction work to the hotel.There were no coffee making facilities & refreshment prices in the room were excessive.A very unsatisfactory experience considering the price paid,

This hotel is located in Midtown Manhattan right in the middle of everything! It is also on a quiet street so you get the best of both worlds. Rooms are usual size for New York but are updated and very nice. Concierge was very helpful as was the staff. Would book again for sure!

I travel to New York often and always stay at the Iroquois. It's an amazing midtown property that isn't too big or too small. The rooms are a good size for Manhattan and the bathrooms are very nice. The hot water is always hot and the water pressure of the shower is always intense (which delivers a shower massage in addition to getting clean). The beds are extremely comfortable and always, always impeccably clean (as is the room in general). And best of all, the staff is exemplary! I really love the people who work at the Iroquois. They always have a smile and friendly greeting waiting for guests (without being cloyingly sweet of pretentious). I'd give this hotel 10 stars if I could. Oh, and I forgot to mention that if you're a frequent guest and you sign up for the hotel's gold rewards program you can rapidly accumulate points that will get you free nights or award gifts of your choice. I just bought a new iPhone 6 and iPad Air 2 with reward points form the Iroquois. Not bad, I'd say!

this is a small midtown hotel that is great. The rooms are small, but comfortable. Ours had two doubles for a family of three. It was tight, but livable. Let's face it, in Manhattan if you are spending too much time in your room, you're doing it wrong. The 44th st location is relatively quiet and well located for Times Square, Broadway theaters, and rock center. The hotel also has an attached restaurant and bar. The bar, the lanterns keep, gets great reviews, but is not kid friendly. Children also receive a welcome bag - ask for it if you don't get one. It has a magnet, picture frame, coloring book and stickers. It's a nice little perk. Movies are also available for free at the front desk for the in room DVD player.

The hotel is a wonderful cosy place that for sure lives up to it's reputation. The staff is wonderful and very very attentive, doing their best to make your stay as wonderful as possible. So if you go do not hesitate to ask for help that involves the hotel as well as the city. The concierge is there until late at night, and can really make your trip from ok to great. I am sure that any type of request will not be to tough for these staff. For the ones looking to for big rooms with large windows, this is probably not the place. The bed was very comfortable, but the room itself was quiet small, not really having space to deal with to many bags. Also, for the ones that need rooms with lots of light, as far as our room was concerned, our window faced an interior shaft that did not allow a lot of light to come in, but hey if you are NYC I don't think you will spend a lot of time in the hotel room. Overall, a great experience, for sure if we visit NYC again, this will be the first play we will try to book a room. By the way, location is the best!!!

Went to NYC to party with some friends. Needed a room at the last minute at one of the busiest times of the year. Used Xpedia points for great discount. Checked in at 4 am. Desk guy was great - even offered late check out. Room was adequate but small - but considering the location discount, it worked. It was very clean and chocolate was a nice touch.

We stayed at the Iroquois hotel for my mums birthday, what an AMAZING place! The staff were all so helpful and friendly, and willing to help with anything. The atmosphere is lovely and the hotel itself is very quaint. As we came at the beginning of December they had lovely xmas decorations in the lobby and great atmospheric music playing, which really gave the feel of New york city. They served coffee and hot apple cider in the lobby for no extra cost. They also have a lovely reading room, with access to the daily New york times, the internet and books. Anything you need to know if your new to the city, the staff will make enquires or organise for you. We didnt eat here, but only because we wanted to be out and about! However on the same street you have Gregorys coffee which we would highly recommend, and the red flamed diner if you just wana get out the cold and have a reasonable hot meal. Everything is great here, the rooms were all lovely and clean and include a mini-bar. The hotel itself has a great atmosphere, its calm and relaxing and we didnt find it noisy. The hotels location is fantastic, at the top of the street is 5th ave, grand central station at the top of the next street. Bryant park is a couple of blocks down and you can see the empire state building, also broadway/times square is a block downwards from the hotel. The rockefeller centre and radio city is right and a few blocks down. EVERYONE SHOULD STAY HERE IT HAS EVERYTHING FOR EVERYONE AND YOU CANT BEAT THE LOCATION!!!!!!

Stayed one night. We were in town to see a musical on Broadway. When we arrived, we were able to check in right away. This is a big plus? All the employees were very accommodating and professional. Things to note:They have a switch below your peephole in door. If you do not want to be disturbed by housekeeper asking if you need extra towels, etc, switch this to the right. If you try to ring the bell on the door, it will light up and say "do not disturb". A nice and thoughtful touch. We did ask for a wake up call at 6 PM because we were going to see the show which started at 8 PM. The only thing is that the Front Desk called earlier and asked if everything was to our expectations. This was a nice touch, but, not necessary. There is complimentary hot cider in the lobby in the afternoon and complimentary coffee each morning. Did not go to Lanterns Keep bar but it was crowded. We had the pleasure of having breakfast in Triomphe which is attached to the hotel lobby. It was wonderful. The best scrambled eggs I ever had and fresh squeezed orange juice in a large glass. The cost is high $25 pp, but, it is worth every penny for the ambience and service. I felt like I was back in Paris. I forgot to mention that the hotel has free wi-fi and cd's are complimentary to use in your hotel room. There is so much that this hotel does to make your stay memorable. The only downside is that the rooms are small. Will return.

We stayed at The Iroquois with two other couples for five nights in November. Everything about this hotel is superb, the staff at the front desk were very nice and helpful. We booked direct with the hotel so a light breakfast was included, the breakfast was lovely, a choice of granola, croissant, pastry basket, bagel with cream cheese, tea, coffee and juice. This was more than enough to set you up for the morning, again the staff were efficient and friendly. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable, the bed and bedding were of a high quality. The jewel in the crown is Bill the Concierge, he is so knowledgable and gave us some great advice regarding restaurants, directions, transportation, etc. The doormen are very nice, always a smile on their faces, they helped us load our huge amount of luggage on departure. We will be more than happy to return to this wonderful hotel.

We spent 4 nights in NYC using the hotel as our base. Exceptional service, very friendly and helpful reception staff. Rooms quiet,clean and comfortable with crisp linens and cosy bathrobes. Some other reviews mention small bedrooms: ours was adequate and this is central Manhattan! Two minutes to Times Square and perfectly placed for museums and sights. Warm apple cider in reception a nice homely touch.

Excellent location, superb quality in all parts of the hotel.Nice and polite staff. The beds where comfortable and the room was very quiet.Very good balance between price and quality.A really good choice for your stay in New York.

great hotel ! i love this place. great location ...cant get better! could use some upgrades but still Very Very Clean . highly recommended !! Food for breakfast is Overpriced !! but plenty of good eats on the street.

Stayed 4 nights , what a find this hotel was on our 5th visit to New York . Very clean, large rooms for N/Y, staff polite and treat you like you matter unlike some big chain hotel which we stayed at after leaving the Iroquois. Good location for everything you need metro,Times Square,restaurants ,and a 15 minute walk to Macy's , takes longer to waik back with amount of bags I had to carry. Only hotel we will stay at now when in New York.

Pleased with location but beware of petty extra charges i.e not allowed to put anything in the fridge other than what they provide. Would have like to use room service but charges were excessive. Cleaner provided an envelope every day for a tip but only left one at the end of our stay. Always a bit wary.

I cannot fault this hotel!!! The customer service was amazing from Carlos on the door to Alex at reception, they made it a memorable holiday. The location is fantastic so close to everything. The room was lovely and the beds were so comfortable! We will be back soon and we wont be booking any other hotel. Miss the hotel apple cider since I came home. Thanks to all the staff for making our stay in New York even more enjoyable that thought possible.

A excelent choice to your stay in New York. Excelent rooms, extremely clean hotel. Worth every penny. Good location, at a street with good movement during the night. Near to the Times Square, restaurants and Theaters. I certanly will stay at the Iroquois at the next travel to New York.

Stayed at the Iroquois from 6th - 10th November to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. The room was lovely with an 'view' of the Chrysler building (well we could see the roof above the tops of the other buildings).Awaiting us in our room was a bottle of wine, chocolates and a birthday card. Nice touch. We did not eat in the hotel but the menu in the restaurant looked lovely. Would we use this hotel again or recommended it, DEFINITELY!!!

The Iroquois was in a perfect location for us. A couple of blocks from Times Square and within walking distance of most of the other items on our "to see" list (which was the usual NYC landmarks). The hotel was next to an awesome diner which is where we went for breakfast each morning. We didn't eat in the hotel, not when there was so many other places to choose from. Rooms are small, but adequate. There was just one of us in each of our rooms, so we didn't need any more space. It was quite dark in the room, but that was most probably because there are great tall buildings all around, and just lamps lighting the room. Not a big issue at all, just an observation. Bed was comfortable, pillows good. Situated where it is it wasn't noisy either, just the "normal" amount of city noise and sirens, as one would expect! Small, cosy entry/check in area as suited to a boutique type hotel. I did recommend this to a friend! I couldn't get the free wifi to work. Unsure if that was user error, or not .
user_name:
Amadee S
Chicago, Illinois, United States

review_body: Stayed here last week with my two friends for 5 nights. Location of room is perfect with Times Square and 5th Avenue on your doorstep. The room we had was wquitpe small for 3. It was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was quite big but a little dated. The staff were brilliant. Nothing was too much bother. Bill on the door was great always smiling and joking and pointing us in the right direction. We didn't try the restaurant but it looked very nice. Coffee in the lobby every morning and hot cider in the afternoon. Yum yum. Would definitely stay here again.

I booked this hotel on Expedia for a last minute NY getaway. Location is great for midtown, Times Square, Central Park, Broadway. The hotel is in a historic building and if you prefer a little character to cookie cutter big chain hotels it's wonderful. Check in was fast and friendly and the room was very nice. NY rooms tend to be on the small size for obvious reasons, but the room here did not feel cramped at all. The one complaint of the stay was the bar. We went down for a drink before dinner and even though there was only one person sitting at the (smallish) bar we were stopped at the door and told we needed a reservation to sit at the bar at that time. The person who stopped us and informed us of this was not particularly friendly. Later in the evening (11ish) we tried again for a nightcap and were once again stopped at the door and rudely told they were closed. So we took our business to the beautiful Blue Bar at the Algonquin next door. The Iroquois and the Algonquin are very similar hotels in many ways, but overall I think the Algonquin has the edge, mainly because of the unpleasant bar experience at this hotel. Still a great hotel though and worth a stay though if you don't mind this issue.

We stayed here for just 1 night but were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were fairly big for NYC standards and the location while close to Times Sq was very quiet and low key. You are 2 blocks from all the action,, but can come back to your room and sleep peacefully. The staff was very attentive and helped with a special room request we had with no issues. The room itself was very clean and nice. Bright white starched sheets and towels as well as a (pricey) but nicely stocked mini bar. The bathroom was mostly all marble, and was a little dated. The lobby offered fresh coffee and a very cozy reading room with internet and couches. We did not try the restaurant but it looked very nice. The only complaint would be the room temperature was very hot and even with the heat off it was uncomfortable. We slept on top of the sheets because of this. We would stay here again for sure. Great reasonable parking garage right across the street.. Nice boutique hotel!

Is the only word I can use to describe our hotel stay. There are so many choices of hotel in this are and at this price point. We have stayed at meny "neigbors" of the Iroquois over the last few years and found them to be adequate and average and high priced at best. The Iroquois far surpassed the experience with them. And...for a splendid dining experience, you can't beat Triomphe! All in all an A-1 rating!

The hotel has an excellent location near Times Square and Grand Central St.The rooms are nice - not big, but they have everything you need. The fitness room and sauna are good and well equiped.Not much variety in the breakfast included.

Great location for Midtown convenience but dated hotel with small rooms. Paid for an upgraded room but was still disappointed. Poor lighting in room, and didn't feel as modern/clean as other 3- and 4-star hotels in the neighborhood I've stayed at before. Gym was very dated and small.

Everything about the getaway was delightful and the accommodations were clean and cozy...the staff was extremely cordial and inviting and the hotel is lovely...we would definitely return to this hotel which is close to the MoMA....which was our destination. I would highly recommend the Iroquois Hotel for every reason.

This was our third stay at the Iroquois and each stay gets better. Great friendly service from everyone. The updated rooms are spacious and comfortable. Its location is perfect, very close to the theater district, lots of fine restaurants close by and a fairly quiet street. I can't think of any negatives, it was a wonderful experience, again!

This hotel is located off 5th Avenue in a street with other high standards hotel. This is close to Bryant Park subway and Time Square so very central though this area lacked of character in my mind. Busy with tourists and very corporate.This hotel has a friendly team of staff and ready to helpOur room was superb on the 12th floor at the back therefore fairly quiet but with great views over Chrysler building The bed was very comfortable with frette sheets Bright room with black out blinds and good space to move about for twoCleanliness was irreproachable The bathroom was also of a high standard with good fittings, Molton brown toiletries in ample supplies and heaps of hot water . More Frette towels that I could think about to use in a day !The hotel offers an extra fridge if you want to keep some personal stuff as opposed to clearing the mini bar Proper ironing board and steam iron in room was good Good wifi and safe in room. TV and dvd of good quality The bar was cute and busy

The Iroquois is ideally situated at short walking distances from the theatres, the restaurants and shopping stores for men. Staying there, one can pack a tremendous amount of activities in a weekend. And the hotel is as efficient as its location: two miniutes to check in, two minutes to check out. Not a moment wasted, either, going to sleep at night: the impeccable rooms are completely sound-proof.

This is simply a magnificent hotel which ticks all the boxes of convenience, elegance, cleanliness and style. Incorporate that with great staff and you have a magnificent stay in one of the most exciting cities in the world. We loved our room and the bed was to die for. We had every amenity at our disposal and I can not recommend this hotel highly enough. Put that with the fact it is one block away from Time Square and a few blocks from Grand Central, Empire State Building etc. you have a full package.

I stayed here one night by chance to attend a show on Broadway. I'm so glad I found this place. I was traveling solo and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Service was exceptional. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel bar had delicious bourbon cocktails. I'll be back.

We had an amazing stay at the Iroquois. It is a lovely boutique hotel in a perfect location. The hotel is really close to Times Square but without all the noise and lights that may disturb you. The decor in the lobby is lovely, and the staff were more than helpful. They provide you with computers which are free to use so you can print any maps or directions you need, this was something we found really helpful. They also provide in the lobby fresh coffee in the morning and hot apple cider in the evening, which is such a lovely thing to come back to. Our room was really nice and clean and there were always plenty of towels provided. This was one of the quietest rooms in any hotel we've ever stayed in. We will be staying here again.

I recently visited New York for the first time and stayed in The Iroquois Hotel. It's location is perfect for every amentiy and attraction, close to Times Square, Bryant Park, 5th & 6th Avenue, subway stations. Despite this, the hotel was suprisingly quiet and just what was needed after a long day in the city. The staff were always helpful and even helped to book my helicopter tour. Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were cleaned daily and left in immaculate condition. Our toilet unfortunately became blocked one day but both plumber and cleaner were there to attend within minutes. When we arrived, we were situated on 11th floor but due to my fear of heights (although in nyc!!!) the reception offered us a room on the 4th floor, very accommodating. The rooms don't have any views at all but I wasn't expecting anything else. Food was lovely and the bar was the perfect place for a drink at the end of the day. Would most definitely stay here again if I ever return to New York, mainly for the location, peace and relaxed/welcoming atmosphere.
user_name:
Sophie S
Great Notley, United Kingdom

review_body: I love The Iroquois, plain and simple. I've stayed at this cozy, boutique hotel five times and it's been consistent from staffing friendliness and helpfulness to quality and service of rooms and dining. The hotel is convenient to Grand Central, Times Square, Theatre District, so many great restaurants and a zillion sites, while being tucked away on 44th Street. I love this place and will ALWAYS check for availability when traveling to NYC and be happy to return!

GREAT boutique hotel with quiet rooms despite the bustle of the neighborhood. Very convenient to Times Square, Bryant Park, and the theater district. Excellent service, pretty room, very clean. I only wish the wifi was faster. I will stay here again.

I have just arrived home after a 4 day trip to New York. My husband selected this hotel and I am sooooo glad he did. It is elegant but slightly understated. The beds were really comfortable and the room which was a superior twin was spacious enough for two of us girls and all our paraphernalia! It was also quiet and we felt safe.The location is excellent as it is within walking distance of some of the major attractions ie Rockafella, Times Sq, Maceys, Bryant Pk, Grand Central Station. there are lots of places to eat around the hotel and so you don't need to eat there although we did on the last day. There is a small bar where we had cocktails one night and a library where you can check in for your flight home.The main highlight of this hotel were the staff themselves. They were super helpful and friendly. They were incredibly accommodating and couldn't do enough for us. Everyone from the front desk to the door people were easy to get along with and quick to respond to our questions and requests.The Concierge (Bill) is the best guy for the hotel to have up front because his knowledge of the city is excellent and he will help you with places to eat, and more specific things that will make your experience of the New York more full. For example we had an hour to kill on the last day so he recommended Bryant park for a last minute activity which was perfect for the time we had . He also has a great sense of humour!!! Thanks Bill!! I hope to return next year.

Wonderful historic hotel with fantastic location. Classic old school. Nice rooms but small. Of course in NYC, who hangs around the room? We have stayed here twice and loved it. Wonderful restaurants close by. Easy walk to Times Square. Great cheap breakfast dinner same block

This hotel is absolutely charming. The staff were friendly, welcoming, polite and extremely helpful. We had a deluxe queen room which was a good size for a city hotel. The room and bedding was clean and bathroom was well appointed. Hotel was conveniently central for all the tourist attractions and shopping, being between 5th and 6th Avenue and not noisy at all considering its location. We would have absolutely no hesitation in staying here again or recommending it to others.

The Iroquois is minutes away from Times Square, Broadway shows and Restaurant Row. We had a suite which was very comfortable, well appointed and quiet. We were very happy about everything except the front door staff who were friendly, but inattentive and lazy in general, unless a tip was imminent. Everyone else went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating, especially the AM concierge.

If you want to stay somewhere other than a soulless chain then try hereA piece of nostalgia and how travel should beRooms not bad size for nyc and wonderful bed linensTop marks to the door men - within 24 hours one in particular knew my name and always welcomed me Will def be back in feb

Great hotel, breakfast lovely but expensive. great location, not noisy for where it is located. very friendly staff, more than willing to help in anything you need. Rooms a good size for central location.

Great location in the theatre district. Incredibly friendly and efficient service, particularly the concierge (Bill) He got us into attractions and restaurants we would never have been able to do by ourselves. The rooms are very clean and well appointed. We were in a deluxe queen which spacewise was quite adequate for two people. There is a restaurant (Triomphe) on site that is really pricey but OK, (see my separate review). I believe it is affiliated but not owned by the hotel. There are many other better places nearby. Actually, the restaurant is my reason for not giving an excellent rating. Overall this hotel would be our choice when returning to NYC.

What a wonderful hotel. Rooms are inviting and comfortable beds with great linens!! The staff is what sets this place apart from all the rest. Helpful, smiling, friendly. Bill at their concierge desk is truly one of the best. Restaurant recommendations and pulling favors for a table!! He was spot on with all his help and advice. Made the trip a memorable experience!!

While the room was tiny, it was impeccably clean and the furnishings were new. Can't beat the location in the theater district. Great service/welcome from housekeeping and bell/valet staff. Fun hot cider offering in the lobby in the evening.

The location of the Iroquois Hotel was within walking distance to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. The hotel is quiet and the beds were heavenly. A pleasant surprise was the afternoon apple cider.

This was a wonderful location and a quiet secret tucked into the hub of New York's busy Time Square. A great find and a gem of a hotel in the heart of an amazing city. We stayed on the upper floor and did not hear the noise of the city at all! Staff was friendly and very helpful. We will definitely stay again and recommend to others.

The hotel is situated in a prime location and is central to shops, broadway etc. Rooms are small but very clean. For a central hotel, the room we were in was very quiet. Staff were pleasant and accommodating.

Previous visitors have mentioned the location as a major plus and it is very centrally located to Times Square, a short walk to other major attractions to include the Empire State Building and the subway system that will take you anywhere in the City. I do however believe the strength and attractiveness of the Iroquois is its people: from the General Manager who personally assisted us with our limo ride to the airport, the wonderful concierges (Vanessa and Bill) to its door staff. I am looking forward to my return visit to this wonderful property-----on a dollar per pleasure ratio you cannot beat it!

Stayed here for 6 nights in October with my wife and 9 year old son . We had a room with two double beds , whilst it was pretty small it was clean and as it was rear facing was quiet . We were on the 7th floor . Staff were friendly and the location close to Times square was excellent . Cant comment on the restaurant . Would recommend and would use again ourselves on next visit .

The Iroquois is an excellent hotel with a great location. Walking distance to most anything Midtown Manhattan and a block from Times Square. Yet, it is on a quiet street. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Hotel's location was perfect for walking to many of famous NY sights. We used Uber for ones that were further away. Hotel lobby and rooms aren't fancy or spacious, but were clean and well appointed. Staff members were helpful and friendly.

The Midtown location is great. The Suite was lovely, well appointed and always well cleaned. We felt special in it. Only down side was city noise (sirens) which is hard to avoid. Other amenities were limited. The restaurant wasn't for us (too Emperor's Clothes); we ate out for meals. The Concierge were fantastic and could not have done more. Overall positive and would recommend.

The hotel is located on a good location between Times Square and 5th Avenue. The beds are great and the rooms are very quiet. Services and staff are excellent. Nothing negative to mention and overall very positive.

Average hotel very close to Times Square. Comfortable (small) room, although very noisy, no coffee machine or kettle in room, very good wifi connection. Did not have any food so can't comment on the quality of food.

The Iroquois was a wonderful location and beautiful small hotel. The Concierge Vanessa was extremely helpful - she helped us plan our days and had great suggestions. The location was within walking distance of all of the New York attractions. I would definitely recommend it.

My husband and I stayed at The Iroquois in October 2014, for three nights, to celebrate our honeymoon. On arrival we were upgraded to a front facing, larger room and received a complimentary bottle of red wine which was a nice touch, and very much appreciated. The room was of a good standard, if slightly tired, but very clean. The frequently replenished Molton Brown in the bathroom was also a nice touch, as was the free daily paper every morning. We didn't eat at the hotel, but did manage to squeeze a few cocktails in during our stay at Lantern's Keep (the in-house cocktail bar); the cocktails were fantastic but very expensive. The hotel is in a great location, not far from Times Square (10 minute walk), but don't let that put you off either as the road is quiet compared to others (and what I expected). Along the same road there is a breakfast restaurant called The Red Flame Diner that provides the best American breakfast sandwiches I've ever had, and it's cheap. We also enjoyed an evening at the Taverna restaurant just along the road, a sophisticated location for dinner, and I must say the house red was really good. Above everything though, the single best thing about The Iroquois, in our opinion, was Vanessa. Vanessa is the lady who helps guests' book and arrange everything from cab journeys to theatre and tour tickets. She was an absolute diamond who made our whole trip stress free, not only recommending but also booking our tickets there and then if we requested. I definitely recommend The Iroquois, and would definitely stay there again.

Staff was friendly & helpful. Concierge was very knowledgeable. Very clean hotel. Great location near Times Square, Rockefeller Center, train station, good restaurants, shows, Grand Central Station, etc. If/when I get to NYC again, I would definitely consider staying here again.

The Iroquois is a very nice hotel, well situated very close to Times Square & Broadway, but on the east side of 6th so you are also close to Grand Central and access to east side trains. Two computers in the library are free and coffee is served each morning with cold water all day long. The lobby restaurant & bar is small but nice.

I booked this hotel for my daughter and friend who were visiting NYC from London for the first time. The booking was done directly with the hotel rather than through an agent or 3rd party site.I wanted to make sure everything would be okay as she and her friend are quite young and this was their first time in NYC. Everyone at the hotel who I spoke to was extremely helpful and kind. From making the booking, to advice to arranging transport to and from the airports, you couldn't ask for better, personal service.My daughter gave me the full run down of the hotel & rooms etc, on her return, and couldn't speak highly enough of the hotel and staff during her stay.So a big thank you to everyone at the Iroquois, and when we next go to NYC, we will definitely be staying there!

Great location in midtown, walking to shows, MOMA, great restaurants, subwayNOT noisy, however, as on a side streetSmall room but very comfy bed, very nice updated bathroomExcellent service from concierge and front deskSmall but adequate exercise room.One of the least expensive places in midtown because there is no fancy lobby, but who needs that in NYC anyway? Great bargain for NYC.

Our first trip to NYC, it certainly wion't be our last and we shall definitely be staying at the Iroquois!The staff could not be miore friendly and helpful if they tried. There was a reall effort by everyone to engage in conversation, making everything relaxed and an absolute joy to deal with. The concierge Vanessa, in particular, was amazing in going that extra mile to make sure we booked the best trips and restaurants. Rooms were really confortable, food was excellent and we felt that we had everything we needed for our stay. The location is fantastic too. 44th Street is relatively quiet, but Grand Central Terminal is two blocks away to the East and Times square two blocks to the West. We absolutely loved staying there and will be telling all our friends to go there too.
user_name:
Martin K
Northampton, England, United Kingdom

review_body: No lines to wait in for front desk, easy bag check, no elevator lines, personal service and Great location if staying in mid-town. Stayed in many mid-town hotels this is one of my favorites. updated bathrooms.

I find myself in NYC once or twice a year, and the Iroquois is now by go-to hotel, whether I'm here for the NYC Marathon, or for "fun". I echo what many reviewers have said: great location, welcoming staff, nice relatively spacious rooms, and lovely bedding - but what I'd add to the list of perks is the free wi-fi and my love of the Moulton Brown shampoos etc. And while they're not necessarily geared towards runners, they have been very accommodating with my early morning requests for a smooth marathon morning! The only thing I would change/ improve, is the electric outlet situation. Many are hard to reach and/or are really loose, making it somewhat difficult to charge various electronic devices..... Still, hands down my favorite place to stay,

A good position for access to both Uptown and Downtown is an excellent reason to stay in this small, by New York standards, hotel. Rooms are of a reasonable size; we stayed in a Premier King room that had a very comfortable, large bed. Friendly staff. I imagine in common with most town centre hotels, even though we had a room at the back there was construction, yes CONSTRUCTION, noise and traffic noise all night.

this was my fifth or sixth stay in this hotel , over the past few yearsthe stFF ARE FREINDLY AND HELPFUL, CLEAN ROOMS and very centrally allocated.service and cleanliness have been consistant over the past years

If you like the theater, stay at the Iroquois, walking distance to most theaters and Times Square. We always eat breakfast at the Flame Diner, on the corner and several nice restaurants on 44th. Rooms are very clean, and amenities great. Staff is consistent and greats us every year. They must treat their employees better than most!

This was my first stay in NYC and the Iroquois did not disappoint! Loved the comfy bedding! Tight squeeze to the tub controls was the only tiny complaint. Very friendly staff. Loved the infused water!

Excellent midtown location away from the chaos that is Times Square. If you travel to NY on business as much as I do, you'll appreciate the fact it's a few blocks away from the tourist gridlock but still close enough to walk Hell's Kitchen for dinner. The front desk staff is warm and inviting as well as accommodating. It's a boutique hotel, so as expected, the rooms are on the small side (but then again the majority of NYC hotel rooms are). However, they use the space well and there's plenty of room to work w/ a large closets. The bed was comfy and cozy; the bathroom was spacious; the room was quiet. Overall this is an exquisite hotel suitable for both business and leisure travel. I'll definitely book this hotel again.

Stayed for a quick weekend in the city. Perfect spot, close to the tourist activities, but the street was pretty quiet. Room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and quick to help. We were there Columbus day weekend and the street was closed for the parade preparations as we were leaving - the bellman carried our luggage to 6th so we could catch a taxi. We will stay there again.

This hotel was close to everything. We loved the history and the small size.It truly is the smallest luxury hotel. We loved the marble floor and walls in the bathroom. Room was small however beautifully arranged and was suitable for the two nights we were there before taking a cruise to Bermuda.

We spent a week at the Iroquois Hotel. Very conveniently located within walking distance of all Broadway theaters. Friendly, helpful and engaged staff. Clean, comfortable and well maintained. Good restaurant in house (Triomphe) and many others close by. Would stay again.

We stayed here for 3 nights from Monday 13th October til Thursday 16th October, and we will definitely be returning.We arrived quite early in the morning. Check in isn't normally until 3pm but I had emailed a few weeks earlier to advise of our early arrival and they told me that they would make every effort to sort us an early check in but could not guarantee it, however in the event that the room wasn't ready they would happily store our bags so that we didn't have to wait around. As it happened when we arrived at around 10:30am our room was ready so we were able to check in. One of the Doormen (Carlos I think he was called) brought our bags up for us. The room was lovely. Not the biggest but still plenty of space and very well looked after. There were complimentary bottles of water for us, Ironing board and iron in the wardrobe as well as a large chest of drawers and a writing table. The Bathroom was a decent size and the shower was great. Complimentary WiFi in the hotel, you are given a code in your check in paperwork. There isn't a fridge, there is a minibar however we were advised that this is not to be used as a fridge as moving things in there would trigger sensors which would lead to us being charged, but if we wanted a fridge, they would provide us with one. The room didn't have a view, however this is a 12 storey building in Midtown Manhattan. There are no views in this part of town!The Front desk staff were very helpful, on check in I asked if there was a map of the area he could give me. He obliged and opened it up and marked on there the location of the hotel and then asked if there was anything specific we were hoping to see and marked those on the map for us as well. Just a little extra touch but was greatly appreciated.The next day we were going to the Statue of Liberty. On leaving the hotel we were greeted by Carlos once again who pointed us in the direction of Times Square Subway station and told us that we needed to get on the Red Line. Every time we left or returned to the hotel we were greeted by Carlos or Ezra with a smile, and always asked what we'd been doing and how we were and if there was anywhere we needed directions for. I know it's their job but it really was appreciated.For our departure, the hotel has an airport transfer service which I would highly recommend using. It cost us $105 (roughly £65) to go to Newark airport, which is probably near enough what it would cost you in a Yellow Taxi but a hell of a lot more comfortable (and again with a complimentary bottle of water) This was arranged the previous day with the Concierge desk who are also very helpful. At the front of the hotel there is a small library with a computer and printer which can be used to print off boarding passes (Or in my case tickets to see the Knicks at Madison Square Garden after a last minute decision) There is also in the lobby a machine which in the morning dispenses coffee and in the afternoon and evening Cucumber water (again complimentary)The best feature without a doubt of this hotel is it's location. 44th between 5th and 6th. 10 blocks to the South, you have Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden and Macys. 15 Blocks to the North you have Central Park and Bloomingdales (Rockerfeller Center and St Pats Cathedral will be passed on the way) less than a minute out of the door and you're on 5th Avenue in the heart of the shops. 5 minutes walk to the East and you are in the middle of Times Square. The majority of the major Theatres are all within 10 minutes walk. Subway station is 5 minute walk, Taxis are relatively easy (dependent on time of day) to flag down on either 5th or 6th. The doorman will do his best to flag you one down, but you don't really get many coming down 44th and the ones that do are usually flagged down by doorman at hotels further up the road. The beauty of it though is that whilst you are so close to the heart of everything, you are just far enough away for the noise and madness that is Times Square to not be an issue. On the corner of 44th and 6th there is a Duane Reed convenience store which will have any essential supplies that you may need.There is a restaurant attached to the hotel, however we did not use it so I am unable to comment. There are a large number of restaurants, cafes and sandwich shops all very close by and we ate out throughout or stay. To conclude we thoroughly enjoyed The Iroquois and "WHEN" we go back to New York we will most definitely be staying there. Its not the cheapest place to stay in New York by any stretch but it's well worth it for the location, the friendliness of staff and the fantastic service that is provided here. We look forward to seeing you again soon.Thank you

This hotel was amazing! Definitely will use them again in the future for ALL of my visits! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who values location, customer service and cleanliness. I cannot wait to come back!

Beautiful hotel with excellent service. Great location. The rooms are not large but they are lovely and beautifully appointed. The hotel is quiet, clean and has a feeling of historical grandeur. Hope to be back.

We just checked out of this hotel yesterday. It was our 2nd stay at The Iroquois and hopefully not the last. My best friend and I have decided to try to make this an annual event. The hotel is in a perfect location. Close to the hustle and bustle of Times Square but far enough away to be quiet and peaceful. The room....we had the 2 double beds......is very clean and the beds are ultra comfortable!! The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The only thing I wish they had was a small coffee pot in the room. I need my coffee 1st thing! They do however, have it in the lobby. A small fridge would also be nice for leftovers after dinning out. We had to throw out good food. The hotel is small but charming and intimate. I love staying here! I keep eye on the rates all year until the rooms go on sale and then I reserve ASAP. October is my favorite time of year in NYC and am already looking forward to returning next year!

The Iroquois is a smaller property, but with BIG hospitality, services and staff.We've stayed at other hotels in Manhattan: paid less, and also paid more. This hotel is a bit high-priced, but in actuality the price is fair for the product.

The Iroquois Hotel is a very clean, quiet hotel, just a few blocks from all of the action at Times Square. The staff is absolutely fantastic! They went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed, and always greeted everyone with a smile. Next time I go back to NYC, I will definitely be returning to the Iroquois. Thank you!

The is the best hotel in NYC and we've tried many. It is centrally located, the staff is suburb, the hotel is small and intimate and overall it is worth every penny! We've recommended it to al our friends.

This hotel was absolutely fantastic. This was our third trip to New York from South Africa and should we ever return to the States this will definitely be our hotel of choice. Your staff were wonderful at all times, friendly and courteous and when our shuttle didn't arrive on time to take us to JFK they went out of their way to help us sort things out,even kindly offering to make us a cup of coffee while we waited. The conciege was so apologetic that we had to end our holiday on this note. Thank you so much to everyone for making our stay in the Iroquis hotel so memorable.

Very nice boutique hotel in theatre district. Well appointed and very clean in a convenient location. Restaurant and bar were closed during our stay due to renovations which was disappointing. We were not notified of this fact before hand.

stayed October 17-19 for 20th wedding anniversary trip. Great location. Two blocks from Times Square. Room was very clean and modern. Bed was comfortable. Staff, especially bellman, very helpful. Price was reasonable (New York city standard). Would return again. Used AAA discount.

the room is very satisfying and the bed is really comfortable.the location can't be better if you want to be close to dining and theater options. the staff are very nice and willing to help in any request.the room is a bit noisy from the A\C and the street.

The hotel location and the hotel itself is excellence. Regardless if you are staying on vacation or on business the staff treats you great. The atmosphere is great. I travel around the world for the last 50 years and if I vote for it I will put it in first place.

In a city as big as New York, It's easy to feel intimidated. But the friendly faces, helpful attitudes and professional services at the Iroquois makes you feel at home.The rooms have a definite quality feel to them and a good nights sleep is guaranteed.Easy commute to almost everything imaginable.Just been to ask reception for help with my bank back home. The young lady, Jasmin, was very helpful, polite and played a large part in solving my problem.Great place to kick back and relax without having to drive miles and miles of out the city.

I love the Iroquois!: the on-premises Lanterns Keep cocktail bar, the friendly/helpful staff, the services provided, and its central location. My upgrade related to the Small Luxery Hotels of the World member card (to which the Iroquois belongs) landed me an incredible room upgrade that further added to my outstanding experience. The Iroquois is where I continue to plan to stay when I'm in NYC. Thanks to The Iroquois I had an Outstanding stay in NYC!

Great service! Brilliant restaurant!A quite small and very relaxing hotel to stay in.We reieved great help form Bill at the consierge desk for all kinds of assistance. I strongly recomend this hotell to others.

This is a charming, comfortable, well situated hotel, both for theatre and shopping. We were treated like longtime, important guests, even though it was our first stay. Everyone working in the hotel seems dedicated to ensuring that we have a positive experience. We've tried fancier hotels in NY, but had way more fun here, and slept very well in the excellent bed! Thank you!

The hotel was very small but stylish. It gave me the feeling of being in my own home. Our room was great, especially the king size bed, quite comfortable. The hotel was in walking distance to the theatre district, say around a 20 minuite walk, 5 minutes to Grand Central Terminal and a great diner, The Red Flame, right down the street which we frequented for breakfast. The daily cost for the room is quite expensive, including taxes but I guess being in New York City, you expect these prices. It was worth spending the money!

The hotel is in a great midtown location. The room was larger than expected, well maintained, and quiet (we stayed on the sixth floor). The staff was very helpful, providing us with walking directions and umbrellas (which came in handy). If we ever return to NYC, we would stay at the Iroquois again.

Stayed at the hotel for 22 nights by the time we left myself ,wife and Daughter felt as if we were leaving our home. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Every member of staff, and I mean everyone went above and Beyond. Special mentions for Venessa and Bill the conciege , JJ Ezra, Sagar , Carlos, Rocky on Door reception Patrick Night Manager Florion Exec Chef. Robert Holmes General Manager. Sorry if I have missed anyone. I have stayed in many hotels around the world, I can honestly say that the Iroquois is by far the best one I have ever stayed at. If you are going to NY City then the Iroquois is a Must.Bob and Family UK/Thailand

The hotel property is beautiful and located within 2 blocks of Times Square. Because our party includes an all girls' weekend getaway, the suite available at the Iroquois was the perfect solution for our travel since it included 2 large rooms, one with king bed and the other with queen sleeper sofa. There was enough room for all of the luggage and for all of us to dress and relax comfortably. The room was exceptionally clean, staff was friendly and helpful and we were conveniently located within walking distance to many major attractions and within walking distance to subway. I would definitely stay at the Iroquois again.

Small and remarkably quiet given its Midtown location the Iroquois is a lovely hotel that's perfectly placed for sightseeing in New York, being within walking distance of Times Square, the Rockerfeller Center and the Empire State Building and just a few Subway stops from many other attractions. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel restaurant, Triomphe, is pretty good. Sadly we didn't get the chance to visit the bar with it's cocktail selection - but there's always next time!

We stayed here for our 12th anniversary. Complimentary chocolates/ strawberries and a card awaited us. Everyone was outgoing, friendly and helpful. Great location close to many subway stations. The room was comfortable with windows that opened. Bath amenities were nice. Free WiFi was a plus. We would definitely stay here again.

This was our first visit to New Your city. We were unaware that we were there in September just before world leaders were meeting at the UN with over 100,000 people there for a protest parade causing intense crowds and street closures. The Iroquois provided a sanctuary from the world outside. The room with an elegant feel was comfortable and clean. The concierge informed us of free walking tours provided by the hotel. Since the tour began early in the morning, it was before the crowds began. We had the pleasure of having Andrew as our tour guide and we were lucky to have him to ourselves along with another couple, our friends, who we invited along. Andrew was informative, interesting and very pleasant. Andrew's tour was a highlight to our short stay in New York. If we were there longer we certainly would have taken advantage of additional tours provided. The Iroquois was also welcoming and helpful prior to our arrival by emailing us to confirm our reservation and offer assistance in trip planning which we took advantage of to help with airport transportation, activity planning and restaurant information.

I stayed her one night on business. Close to TIme Square and to 5th Avenue. The staff was friendly; the room was spacious. Very comfortable, clean, and quiet. Great bathroom and shower. Accpetable Fitness Center whcih also includes a sauna and private jacuiizi tub. Free fresh coffee. Nice lobby area, small cozy restaurant, nice bar. Great place for drink and some mingling right across the street too.

It was my first visit in New York and for sure the quality of service and frendship the Iroquois Staff offered contributed to my great satisfaction. Hotel is super strategic in terms of position, not suffering the noisy crowded TimeSquare area. Bedroom was clean and confortable. Great staff from desk to doormen, always available for hints and suggestions. I would definitely recommend this hotel and for sure when I'll go back to NY I'll book here again.

From the greeting at the door to the front desk staff to the bell-staff, this hotel was a treasure. Room was very small, as are most of the rooms in NYC, but very clean and very comfortable, and pleasantly decorated. The linens and towels were very plush. Location was wonderful....close to Times Square, but far enough away to be out of the hustle and bustle...just a couple blocks from the subway. Will definitely stay at this beautiful hotel again!

My husband, daughter and I stayed at The Iroquois during the last week in September. Everything about this hotel was perfect! Extremely clean and welcoming...made coming back to our room at night feel like we were coming home! Everyone from Carlos (the doorman) to Vanessa (the concierge) to Robert (the General Manager) made us feel valued and welcome and made sure our stay not only at the hotel, but in NYC, was enjoyable! The hotel is centrally located so you can walk to all the major attractions and Broadway, but thankfully a few blocks away that it felt like a respite from all the crazy hustle and bustle of Times Square. We stayed in a double/double room and it was larger than I had anticipated (based on other reviews). More importantly it was immaculate! We are anxiously awaiting our next visit to NYC and will definitely stay at the Iroquois again! P.S. Need a recommendation for a Broadway show? Go see Kinky Boots! Broadway at it's finest!

As a mature couple we returned to the hotel for a second time hoping that all would be the same - we were not disappointed in any respect and would return without hesitation - thoroughly recommended in all ways

This hotel is ideally situated in the heart of Midtown. It has an old-style charm with modern amenities. Staff were friendly and helpful. Plenty of cafes nearby so you don't have to rely on the exorbitant room-service that all Midtown hotels have. The bed was amazingly comfortable and the room pleasingly furnished. As with all Midtown hotels, we would recommend earplugs to stave off the noise from the sirens outside, but within the Iroquois Hotel itself the atmosphere was serene and calm. A pleasant stay.

Stayed here a couple of days after New Years last and the hotel was very clean and the staff attentive. The hotel has that old New York feel. Very central location in mid town. Did not have a chance to eat in the hotel. Valet service is a must for mid town and it was nice to leave the car and bags and just get to the room.

Travelled to New York to celebrate my 50th birthday and was not disappointed. Hotel was fantastic all around, easy to get to all the tourist destinations, planning next trip and will be staying at the Iroquois!

Amazingly quiet room in Midtown Manhattan. Perfect location. We walked to Central Park, Times Square, Grand Central, Theatre District, 5th Avenue. Wine and chocolate on arrival for our 30th anniversary was a nice touch!

We stayed at the Iroquois for 3 nights on our honeymoon, the hotel staff were warm, welcoming and very polite. We were given a room on the top floor which had two windows and a view of the Chrysler Building.When we arrived at our room the staff had given us a chocolate and fruit platter, a bottle of wine and a card congratulating us on our marriage- it is something we will keep for years to come to remind us of our honeymoon!The location was excellent - less than 3 minute stroll to Times Square, and to be honest I wouldn't have wanted to be any closer- where we were was quiet and so we slept well!Thank you very much to all of the lovely staff, they really looked after us well!

Friendly and helpful staff. It is surprisingly quiet and restful given its location. Certainly beats staying in Times Square itself as you can actually sleep, yet still are close to everything. My only suggestion would be to park your car yourself. Valet is very expensive and it takes about 1/2 hr to get your car back

This is a small, intimate hotel conveniently located in mid town. It is in desperate need of refurbishing. It is tired and old and shows it age in such things as the air conditioning, the elevators and the size of the bathrooms.

My now husband stayed there on our wedding night. Perfect retreat after a stressful and hectic day. It was heaven :) The room had to be soundproof because we didn't hear any NYC street noises. Felt as if we were in a different city. Wish we stayed there another night. Will be going back on our 1 year anniversary. Thank you!!!!

My husband and I stayed for a total of 3 nights pre and post cruise.The customer service in this establishment is excellent, the staff are polite and very helpful.The position of the hotel is quiet yet central, I would certainly stay here again.

I have been staying at the Iroquois on my trips to NY now for close to 8 years. The quality only improves. The beds are so comfortable with beautiful linen sheets, the rooms all well appointed and spotless. The hotel restaurant Triomph is one if the best kept secrets in New York! The Itoquois is one of the worlds leading small hotels and fulfills the promise time after time. Professional yet personal, excellent quality and an amazing position for everything in NYC. Ask for a room at the back, these are sometimes smaller but very comfortable and very quiet.

I was searching for a hotel for a one night stay with my husband, just prior to his birthday. We were coming to visit friends and family in the city. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted with warmth and friendliness by Alex and Chen . They couldn't have been more gracious to us. Our room was not ready, but upon hearing that my husband's birthday was coming up, they gave us a box of candy and birthday wishes. Just a great way for us to start a 24 hour celebration!We returned at 5:00, needing to be out of the hotel in 15 minutes to get to a party. Our room was ready and we were reassured that our bags would be delivered immediately. Unfortunately, we had to call the front desk 20 minutes later feeling frustrated that the bags had not been delivered. We were told they would arrive momentarily, which they did. The bellman apologized several times and offered to get us a cab. We dressed quickly and dodged out of the hotel.The rooms were spectacularly clean, cozy and with an updated bathroom. We loved it! We slept so well and felt good being there. Aside from the luggage delivery, it was a WOW experience. I didn't expect it to be so.Thank you Iroquois for being so great. We will be back to you soon, we hope.

This is a fine hotel, but 4 stars may be pushing it. My first room had a broken door. Replacement room was fine with 2 beds, but very small. Not much of a lobby. Tight with two older elevators. It is very clean. Very quiet, clean and safe location if you want to be close to Times Square. Stayed during UN Assembly week, so of course the price was too high, but had no choice. Service is fine, but a cold reception and for the most part seemed to be not overly friendly.

I stayed at the Iroquois early this year in May. I booked and prepaid to get a better deal. There was a problem with the credit card being charged twice. The people at the hotel did refund the money, but I wondered if the hotel was going to be up to it's great reviews.We arrived and were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is on a really nice block of the city. It had a prime location to most everything we wanted to see. It was quite close to Times Square, which isn't my favorite, but might be a perk for someone else. The staff was attentive and was very helpful. We especially loved the friendly doormen. They were very helpful and Rocky saved us from a long trek to find a post office! The rooms were small, but that is kind of expected in New York City. We really enjoyed our stay here and I will definitely think about returning.I would recommend book here, just watch if you prepay.

We loved this hotel. The staff were all first class and the concierge, Vanessa better than that!! The hotel is quite small but situated in an excellent location on W44th., close to good shopping, very good restaurants, access to easy transport and the theatre district. Don't expect a large room, but the facilities were all very clean, well maintained and modernised; and wi-fi is free. The restaurant attached was of a very good standard too. Can sincerely recommend to anybody who likes traditional luxury NY style accommodation in this area.

The Iroquois has an enviable Midtown location, within walking distance of Bryan Park and Times Square. The rooms are typically small, with subpar plumbing, but make up for it with high end amenities (Molton Brown toiletries and Frette linens). The service at the front desk, bar, and restaurant are excellent. In particular, the bartenders, food, and cocktails at The Lantern's Keep are top notch and worth the trip alone.

Everything about our 3 night stay was just wonderful. Courteous, helpful staff. Wonderfully appointed rooms. Superb bed and linens. Very attentive and helpful staff - especially Vanessa and Bill at the Concierge desk. Plus our room was ultra-quiet even with the two elevators right next to our 7th floor room. We never heard it one time while in the room. The Iroquois was a perfect Midtown location and a quick walk to Times Square and the Theatre District. We will look forward to our next stay here.

This hotel is well located in mid town NYC. The staff are great and made you fell very welcome. As it is an antique building it is also charming. The bar behind the lobby and the one in the neighborhood "blue bar" are nice.There is a problem of noise. I am not sure if that is the air conditioning of the room or a machine on the top, but it did walk me up at 3 am, and was so intense that took me time to sleep again. I was at room 407 if that helps anyone! So, pay 500 and get a noisy room !!!! Well in New York that is the common place !!!!
user_name:
darwinsail
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: What a wonderful getaway for my husband and I. It was a peaceful solace from our usual blessed yet crazy life with 3 kids. We felt at home and was conveniently located. We'd recommend this hotel to all.

First time at this hotel and I can say the service was great. Everyone friendly and were willing to help with any questions. Sadly you just don't find that at most NYC hotels. Rooms a bit smaller then some other hotel rooms but that is because of the location which I think is one of the best in NYC on 44th street. Room was clean and bathroom re-done. Very nice stay for us.

My wife and I spent our 1st anniversary in NYC and after checking all the websites etc. we decided on the Iroquios. Great Location, Nice quiet rooms, and the staff are amazing. Vanessa at the Concierge desk was helpful before we arrived, and set up a nice surprise for my wife. Rooms were smallish, but it is New York and to be expected. Everything was clean, and seemingly of good quality.The location was perfect for sightseeing, times square, and shopping on 5th avenue. Only a couple of blocks for most theatres. The hotel itself is on a relatively quiet street, and it was always nice returning to the lobby and finding a quiet oasis in NYC.We will be back for sure, and highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel is very well located close to Time Square, Central Park, 5th Ave making it very easy to walk around. Very clean and good services. Friendly and very efficient staff. Highly recommended. The price is reasonable compared with other offers in New York.

The Iroquois is a small well appointed hotel in an excellent location. The reception area can feel a bit crowded when parties are checking in and out. Rooms are clean and comfortable good bar.A bit expensive

My wife and I stayed here for 5 days in September. We arrived at 9pm and check in was a breeze (less than 15 minutes). The doorman (JJ) was very helpful and took care of the bags without even being asked. The room: small small small. This is a boutique hotel so don't expect a large room. The room was very clean, we'll lit, and had adequate amenities. The bed was okay as far as comfort. The bathroom was nice with good hot water and water pressure. Remember, you're in NYC so you won't spend much time in the room anyway, so this room was more than adequate.Staff: the staff here is very very accommodating. They are very courteous, helpful, and always greet you with a smile. We have traveled all over the US and I have to say, this hotel staff has to be one of the best.Location: can't beat this location. It is one block from Times Square, one block from the subway, and in a quiet location. You can walk to anyplace or get to anywhere from this location.In all, we highly recommend this hotel. From top to bottom, this is a great hotel.

Just got home after a 4 night stay at this hotel. The location is perfect, with Times Square just a stones throw away. The staff are really friendly and very helpful. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated, there's free WiFi available, and free coffee in the lobby every morning. I would recommend this hotel to anybody wanting to stay in New York. Also if you're looking for somewhere reasonably priced to eat check out the Heartland Brewery & Chophouse on W 43rd St. I had the best strip steak EVER!

Just got home from staying at the Iroquois for 4 days. This small hotel offered a great mid-town location that provided easy walking access to fine dining, shows, shopping and Times Square. The hotel and staff were both first class. I would return without hesitation.

We were here from September 19- 21. Immediately, the staff was warm and friendly. We were early so decided to grab a bite nearby. We left a contact phone number and they called us promtly ( before the scheduled check in). What a great start. The beds were super comfy and surprisingly the hotel was quiet at night. The day we were supposed to leave, 44th Street was closed off due to the Climate March. Our airport shuttle was supposed to pick us up in front of the hotel. Staff did everything from contacting the shuttle company to contacting me after departure to ensure the shuttle picked us up. A very memorable trip, especially when you receive 5 + star service. Thank you Iroquois staff!

Friendly staff, quiet room, lovely decor and great location! Breakfast at Triomphe was delicious. Looked like they were making preparations to redecorate when we were checking out. We will stay here again.

I am never a fan of NYC hotels but after spending a week here, I am changing my mind. The staff were excellent and aside from one small cleaning issue (maid forgot to empty out my trash one day) the overall stay was great. I will definitely be coming back. Excellent location, good staff and clean up to date rooms.

The hotel is in the best Midtown location; the staff was offered top service with many unbelievable extras that saved time and money to make the trip easy. They went above and beyond what most hotels would do and really made the boutique experience worth it in many practical ways!

Spent the weekend in New York, and part of the weekend's success was this hotel. The room was great, clean with with wonderful linens, a very comfortable bed, and amazingly quiet. Best of all was the staff; each and every one was incredibly helpful, and went out of their was to provide suggestions, directions, store our luggage on our last day, provide a room for changing before we left the city, and just good friendly advice all around. By the end of the weekend I felt like we had made friends with the whole staff. This is what a good hotel experience should be.
user_name:
Carolyn R
Derwood, Maryland, United States

review_body: This has to be the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in! We have had a fantastic 4 days here and don't want to leave! Amazing finish to our honeymoon! Yes the rooms are small, but the personal touches are so appreciated! From the Molten Brown toiletries, the nightly chocolates on the pillow to the beautiful plate of chocolates that were sent to our room along with a card congratulating us on our marriage. We have memories that we will treasure forever and will not hesitate to book this hotel again the next time we come. Thank you to all of the wonderful staff at The Iroquois who have made our stay here so wonderful!Mr and Mrs Woodward

The Iroquois is located perfectly between 5th Ave and Time Square.The location on 44th Street is quieter than the hassle and noise of Broadway.The hotel is small with very friendly, professional staff. Not impersonal like some of the larger hotels.Highly recommended.

Great service from first walking through the door.All the staff were pleasant, helpful and helped in every way they could.All of our family felt that nothing was too much trouble, the staff exceeded expectations and the hotel was great, would recommend this place to anybody wishing for a non stress place to stay in NY with helpful people great menus,close to everything and top accommodation.

Perfect for exploring New York, very nice rooms (although not too big), friendly and supportive staff, a nice bar and just a five minutes walk from Time Square, Rock etc. For sure we'll again choose The Iroquois for our next NY trip!

A great little gem in Midtown. Close to everything, and great rooms as well. The service by the staff was top notch. Everyone was helpful and eager to please. It was like having a little piece of home in midtown Manhattan.

The location is excellent close to subway, shops and Times Square. The room was very quiet and had the most comfortable king bed, with an excellent pillow choice. Even though the room was not large there was ample space to move about plus open 2 large suitcases. The staff could not have been more helpful, the room very clean and well serviced. Restaurant and bar served an excellent selection of food and cocktails. All in all a fantastic stay.

Excellent location which is matched by It's elegance and It's staff. The Iroquois definitely added to our New York experience. The rooms are comfortable yet functional - ideal to recharge and prepare. If we are to return, it will be our first choice of hotel.

Great location, a stones throw from times sq, Bryant park, broadway, the Rockefeller etc. The hotel is very boutique, and it feels like you've stepped into a peaceful underworld away from the mental streets of nyc.All the staff were incredibly helpful and seemed genuinely interested in our day. The only bugbear was the lift - it seemed to take ages! However, it wasn't enough of an issue to affect my overall rating.

The Iroquois is a very pretty luxury boutique hotel in a great location. All the staff members were extremely friendly, competent and helpful. Our very nice Premium King room was in a back corner, so it was relatively quiet for NYC. And I have to say that the bathroom was a favorite of mine--large, lots of good light and plenty of storage shelves. My husband and I definitely recommend The Iroquois.

We loved the location because it was close to Broadway shows, among other many things (Times Square, Rockefellar Center, Grand Central), yet not in the middle of the craziness. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I loved the cold water to drink when returning, and the fresh fruit… nice little gestures. We felt like we hit the jackpot on where we stayed!

Fantastic location, staff polite and service minded, excellent amenities.The hotel has good atmosphere. We appreciated coffee in the morning in the lobby. Concierge team very helpful. We will recommend this hotel.

Got exactly what was advertised. Facilities were great; staff was great. Location is excellent, particularly if you're comfortable getting around by subway. Several good places to eat/drink locally. Will definitely stay here again

Great holiday hotel was lovely with friendly helpful staff. The beds were very comfortable. Room was a bit on small side and lighting was subtle but not bright enough to read etc also would have liked tea/coffee making facilities in room. However coffee is available in reception in the morning. Excellent location and a lovely diner down the street that serves great breakfast. Would go back again.

Nice little hotel in a convient location. There was a diner a block away for breakfast. The subwas was about a block or so away. Very clean with great staff. Room needed more lighting and colder ac for August.

We came to NYC for my birthday and the Iroquois did not disappoint! We were upgraded to a better room upon our arrival and chocolate covered strawberries and treats were available in our room! The hotel is close to everything and very central. We walked EVERYWHERE: 5th avenue, central park, Lincoln Center, downtown, broadway! We also took the subway to shave some time off for some places we had to be at more quickly.The concierge was amazing and booked everything for us that had not already been booked prior to our arrival. I believe her name was Vanessa. There was another concierge but she was the best! We were able to skip huge lines at the 9/11 Museum and the Natural History museum. She was so helpful that we were never lost and always knew where to go.The hotel always had fresh, fruit-infused water available at the end of a long day and bananas in the morning, too. It was great! My one complaint that has been echoed on here before is the climate control in the room. It was really cold! BUT, it did not take away from the wonderful experience we had.

If the bright lights of New York City is your thing then this hotel is in a perfect location for 5th avenue shopping and Times Square etc. best parts of NYC are out down the east and west sides. Hell's Kitchen Chelsea, Greenwich, BrooklynThe subway is dated and needs serious money spending on it, but it is safe quick and efficient. Use the subway, get out and about into the more residential New York for a better experience

Great location for all the action, Time Square, Street food, Brazil Fest. Staff are friendly and helpful. Room was small but clean and we spend little time there, plumbing was a bit loud. Had turndown service and bed was comfy. Nice touch was the favoured water in the lobby, will be stealing that idea for home gatherings

This hotel is superb and I cannot say enough wonderful things about it…although I'm almost afraid to say this as it is the best kept secret in NYC. The service is exceptional and very personal….we still can't figure out how they remembered our taste in wine and ice cream every day. The location is perfect, the Concierge is brilliant and hits the mark every time, even the bell hop ran down the street to get us a cab when none were coming by. We will never stay anywhere else in NYC.

The service was impeccable. The room was clean, quiet and cozy. The amenities were very high end. Location of hotel is perfect for both business and pleasure. As the song goes "a room is just room", it is the people that create the experience. The staff at this hotel are so professional, kind and courteous that you are left in awe. With all the negativity in the world around us, it was wonderful to experience a little slice of heaven at the MIracle on 44th Street.

We stayed 4 nights while visiting NYC for the US Open Tennis Tournament. We found The Iroquois to be a very good hotel for our needs.Location: the location is great. It's a couple of blocks west of Grand Central and a couple blocks east of Times Square. To get to the Open we either boarded the subway at Bryant Park or Grand Central.The hotel is very nice. It's in a historic building and the lobby and public areas reflect a historic atmosphere. The rooms were nice with nice furniture, good flat screen tv's, and comfortable bed.The service in the hotel was very good. The front desk workers, and other staff, were always cheerful and attentive to our needs. Things, like request for ice, were taken care of promptly.We didn't eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on it other than to say the decor looked very nice. A diner is next door that had good breakfast.
user_name:
Stuart D
Mobile, Alabama, United States

review_body: The location of the hotel is perfect, right in the middle of mid-town on 44th Street inbetween 5th & 6th Avenue. It’s extremely convenient if you want to go updown or downtown and drop off your shopping mid-day so you can go shop some more without being weighed down. The hotel is situated in a busy area of Manhattan, even if you are walking back to the hotel late at night (i.e. 12am), there are still people on the streets and lots of cars on 5th Avenue, so you don’t have to be particularly concerned about safety issues. db bistro modern by Daniel Boulud (3* Michelin chef) is just 2 doors down, so if you’re too tired to go out for dinner, you can always try their delicious burger!The Superior room is a bit small, but that was expected from reading all the previous reviews. It was adequate for a single traveler like myself. My room was facing 44th Street, so there was no view, but I wasn’t planning to spend much time in the hotel.
