The hotel is elegantly furnished and the room was clean. Lighting was adequate in the room, which is great as many hotel rooms are too dim. The bathroom was decent sized and you don’t feel too cramped. Molton Brown amenities are provided which is great, so I didn’t have to bring my own shampoo, conditioner, body wash and body lotion. Some hotels don’t provide good amenities hence you have to pack everything in your suitcase. One problem I had with the bathroom was that there was nowhere to put all my toiletries and make-up as they have a pedestal sink, hence there is no counter for you to place your personal items. They do have 2 tiny glass shelves above the toilet, but it’s hardly enough space to put all your stuff properly without having to worry they will drop into the toilet at any moment. Housekeeping provided more than enough towels during my stay and it was probably too much (should be more environmentally friendly) as I had 4 small towels (which I didn’t use) on the shelf above the toilet and I was a single guest in the room. The air conditioning in the room was a bit cold and as the temperature is centrally controlled, there wasn’t much the staff could do about it. But I guess it’s better that the room is slightly too cold rather than being too hot, else you really can’t sleep during the summer months (I visited end of June). There is free wifi throughout the hotel, but I had problems with the signal strength in my room and in the hallways. I was staying on the 4th floor and I couldn’t make calls on Skype as the connection wasn’t very good. I had to go down to the library/computer room at the lobby where I got a better connection and was able to make my calls. I notified the reception of my problem and straight away they tried to call their internet service provider and try to sort out the problem. Although I couldn’t get a better signal in my room at the end, it was great to know that the staff really care about the guest’s needs and provide immediate assistance.There is a platter of fresh strawberries by the reception desk which you could help yourself to. This is a great treat to the guests, every time you pass by the reception you couldn't help taking a couple of strawberries. They also have ice water infused with orange and lemon slices in the lobby during the day, so it’s great to be able to quench your thirst as soon as you walk into the hotel after being outside in the summer heat. The small library/computer room at the lobby is a great place to relax/wait for your friends. They have 2 computers and a printer which you can use, free of charge, which is great for printing out travel itineraries/boarding passes. Other hotels often charge you for printing (even for 1 page), which is very annoying.Before my arrival, I called the hotel asking if they were willing to keep a package for me prior to my arrival and they said it was not a problem. This was extremely helpful for me as I had to send something to repair in the States and they could only send back the item to a US address. Hence I had the item sent to the hotel prior to my arrival. After I had checked-in and arrived in my room, a member of the staff knocked on the door and delivered the package straight away. So if you want to do a bit of online shopping prior to arrival, rest assured it will be safely kept until you check-in. But do call ahead just to let them know so they are expecting your package.All members of the staff are extremely friendly and helpful which is clearly the best asset of this hotel. I’ve travelled worldwide and stayed in many hotels, but I’m truly impressed with the level of service at Iroquois. I did not have a chance to interact with all members of their staff, but one person in particular was extremely helpful – their Concierge, Bill Heinrichs. He’s absolutely the best, even better than other Concierge at 5* properties elsewhere. He’s friendly and can help you with anything. Do remember to look for him during your stay and just let him know what you would like to do/see/eat/drink during your stay and I’m sure he will give you great advice that even the best guidebook won’t mention. Another staff at their Concierge desk, Vanessa was also very friendly and helpful.The hotel is not cheap, but you’re paying for the location, quality and great customer service, which is all worth it. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to New York. If you are like me and trowel though pages and pages of reviews on Tripadvisor before booking any hotel, you will understand why there is consistently such positive reviews for this hotel after you have experienced it yourself. Highly recommend to anyone visiting New York.

This hotel is exceptionally well situated within a few blocks of Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Grand Central Station. Despite its proximity to major tourist areas, it is remarkably quiet. It was an oasis of serenity after navigating through the crowds of New York. It is an elegant, older NYC hotel and the rooms are compact, typical of a mid town hotel. The beds are very comfortable, not too soft or hard and the hotel is VERY quiet. The service in this hotel is also exceptional. Everyone was pleasant, helpful and knowledgeable. Special thanks to Bill, the concierge, who assisted us greatly with his local knowledge. The lobby of the hotel is small but has a lovely sitting area with coffee and fruit infused water for the enjoyment of guests. There is also a computer for guests to use with a printer, at no charge. The Wifi was included and worked well. I have been to New York many times and I would highly recommend this hotel.

No better location. No better service. This not-so-hidden gem has proven me right each time I recommend it to friends and associates. And even it's tiniest faults have a way of making you appreciate their professional staff even more - if that's even possible. Coming back real soon.

Stayed here for 4 nights recently as a family of 3. We were welcomed by a very friendly staff. Check in was fast. The hotel is really quiet - perfect after a long day of sightseeing It is nice to sleep and not be interrupted by street noise. The room was a bit on the small size, but comfortable, It is not a lot of space for a luggage, but in New York you do not spend a lot of time in the room. The location is good for sightseeing (the Times Square is in a walking distance).The staff was very friendly and approachable, what definitely make a difference to other hotels we stayed. We will definitely stay in this hotel next time.

Lovely, midtown boutique hotel, conveniently located near Grand Central Station and Times Square. Great neighborhood with lots of restaurant options. Room was clean, comfortable and modern and staff were friendly and helpful. Only negative is that our deluxe, queen was on the small side and may not be optimal for an extended stay - great though for a weekend in the city! We'd certainly book here again

The Iroquois exceeded our expectations. The location was very convenient to Times' Square. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and comfortable, and the room quiet and cozy. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in New York, and the Iroquois was not small part of that. The concierge staff was most helpful!

Great location just 200m to Times Square (which is awful) and 50 metres to 5th avenue. Quaint retro style hotel with lovely library room for free morning coffee, albeit In a paper cup. Room was good size with lovely en suite, decent towels and toiletries. Room service came twice a day and were discreet as you never saw them on the corridors. Loved the doorbell/do not disturb sign, great idea. Had a great view of the Empire State Building from our room. Despite being on the 9th floor we had a fair amount of street noise, traffic and car horns, and the builders start work early! The only thing missing was tea/coffee facilities in room, which we missed in the morning, cos if you had a lie in the lobby coffee went off mid morning. A minor grumble though
user_name:
Heather G
Whitley Bay, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Perfectly located for our needs as first time visitors to New York, The Iroquois turned out to be an excellent spur of the moment final choice after a long weekend poring over a gazillion booking websites a few months beforehand. After stepping out the front door, within a couple of minutes you can be at Times Square if you turn left, Grand Central Station if you turn right, Rockefeller Center if you go uptown and the Public Library if you head downtown. Yes, Empire State is a few more blocks and a few more minutes further away, but this is Manhattan and everything is ... but nothing's too far away. But I'm not here to sell you on New York. The shuttle bus driver knew exactly where it was, how to get to it through the one-way system and that he'd be able to readily park right outside to drop us off. The reception team welcomed us like it was our hundredth stay, not our first. There was hot cider in the lobby to take the edge off the chill from outdoors. We had an inside room on one of the higher floors away from the lifts and never noticed any noise. Yes, the room was a little more compact than it might have been and we had a panoramic view of absolutely nothing, but it wasn't a concern. No disrespect to the Iroquois, but we weren't there to spend hours admiring their hotel. Gregorys Coffee over the road does an excellent morning cuppa and The Red Flame Diner a few doors down provides the quintessential diner experience day or night.

From arrival to check out this hotel is fabulous all staff were friendly and helpful Bill the concierge booked us a town car to the airport which was good and helped when the zip broke on my case when we coming home and saved me having to buy another case - this was my second time staying and would recommend it to anyone and yes I will be staying there next I go to nyc

We really liked this hotel. Our Premium King room was pretty and comfortable. The bathroom in particular was large for NY standards, although there is no counter for your toiletries, as there is a pedestal sink. The location is terrific; it is walking distance to 5th Ave, MOMA, Times Square and Broadway theaters. They have complimentary wi/fi, turn down service (complete with chocolates), and complimentary DVD rentals. We didn't order room service, as it was too pricey, but there are many restaurants within a few minutes walk. It's a very pretty hotel, and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. I recommend it.

I have stayed in New York numerous times and I will never stay anywhere else. Just wonderful!!!!!! Great location. Walking distance to everything. Staff are so nice and helpful. Rooms are wonderful and turn down service special. Great price. A hidden gem in a busy city!

I have stayed here a few times before, as the location is so perfect and the service is unbelievable good. The last time I tried their restaurant called Triumph. If you like a gourmet food - this one is the right for you. Excellent !
user_name:
Michal M
Herzliya, Tel Aviv, Israel

review_body: The Iroquois was an excellent choice for our stay! All of the staff; from the front door to the front desk made us feel welcome! Room was great; clean, well decorated, and created an intimate ambiance. Conveniently located The Iroquois allowed us to tour all of Manhattan but escape to a quiet retreat when we needed rest. Room was very small for price compared to other areas of the US, but hey, its New York! Will definitely return if we get a chance!

I stayed at The Iroquois August 15 and 16, 2014. The hotel is well located for walking to Times Square, theaters, restaurants, shops etc. We used the subwway to go uptown. The room and the bathroom are normal size for a NYC hotel, more space would have been nice, but we managed fine. The room was clean and it came with robes. I spilled water on my bedding and new bedding was delivered by housekeeping within 15 minutes of my call. We stayed on the top floor in room 1208 and it was quiet. The elevators ran efficiently and the hallway was quiet even though the hotel was fully booked. Hotel staff were helpful and courteous. We did not eat any meals at the restaurant in the hotel. We ate breakfast at The Red Flame diner, coffee house (just a few doors down) and were happy with the service, the food and the price. The first night we saw IF/THEN and loved Idina Menzel in it. The second night we went to the MetLife stadium in N.J. for the Eminem and Rihanna concert. We had considered taking the train but opted for a car service instead and everything went smoothly.I recommend this hotel, but if you are not able to book a room here there are several other hotels very near by.

The Iroquois is one of the few hotels of all price ranges I looked at before my trip that had consistantly positive reviews and after our stay I can see why. First and foremost it is an excellent location if you are looking for something very central and convenient, yet on a slightly more quiet street with less noise. Our room was large for a hotel room in the City - the bathroom was palatial for New York. We did complain that the room was a little too hot, however the front desk adjusted the thermostat immediately to make us more comfortable. The bed was good and they had a selection of a firm and a feather pillow for each person. The closet was fine. The desk in the room was narrow enough I wouldn't have wanted to spend any time working at it. The lobby is nice and they keep coffee out in the mornings and iced water in the afternoon and evening which we always really enjoyed after coming in from walking around. The staff was incredibly professional, friendly, and accommodating. The hotel bar is also pretty cool. The only reason it isn't 5 star is because it's not a "luxury" hotel like some other (much much more expensive hotels) you could find. We like a mixture of luxury and value and in my opinion the Iroquois is a great value. You'll be comfortable during your stay and the staff will make sure that your stay is a pleasant one. I would absolutely stay here again.

Great stay! Concierge Bill very helpful. Only one glitch. Called day prior to arrival to inquire if dining room Could do gluten free. In the end it Worked outWaiter in Triomphe was rude about gluten free but manager was able to accommodate

From check-in to check-out our stay at The Iroquois New York was fantastic. This is beautiful and charming hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and very well appointed. Dinner at Triomphe and drinks at The Lantern's Keep are a must. Can't wait for our next trip!

Will definitely stay at this perfect location when we return to NY. Although small, it was quiet, very clean and absolutely perfect for our needs. Staff were all extremely friendly, courteous and helpful! Had breakfast downstairs in the restaurant - always pleasant. Would definitely recommend!

Good location - quiet street for NY. Easy to get to Times Square/Fifth Avenue/Broadway shows. Price a bit high for room size but it is NY. Front desk and staff were very accommodating and very helpful.

From the time we checked in until we departed we were treated like royalty here. The rooms were small but comparable and extremely nice. Good location in the Times Square area but far enough away from the overwhelming hustle and bustle. Lots of amenities. Extremely clean room with very thorough housekeeping. Exceptionally nice staff that always greeted us with a smile. The concierge and front desk staff were extremely helpful in helping us navigate subways and suggesting local tourist and dining destinations. I wouldn't have dared to touch the mini-bar or room service menu for the prices but that's as expected. They had a nice restaurant and bar on site that wasn't too busy. The rooms were quiet except for the normal sounds of NYC, in the hallway you could hear other patrons but within the rooms it was quiet. The beds were probably some of the most comfortable I have slept in during a hotel stay and had very nice, classy bedding.

excellent location --highly recommend !! staff was sooooo friendly and helpful !! turndown service. coffee and water in lobby available. very quiet rooms good size for NYC--cots available if needed for "extra person" . beds comfy ! def will be back there--just cant say enough expec about helpfulness of staff !!!!!
user_name:
Mary E
Hampton, Virginia, United States

review_body: My family and I stayed at the Iroquois for ten days in August. We had a lovely stay - the staff is courteous and helpful and the hotel is situated just a couple of blocks from Broadway, Times Square and Fifth Ave, so the action is within short walking distance.Rooms were very clean and pretty. Beds comfortable. Our view was disappointing, but we barely spent any leisure time in the hotel, so it was not a major issue. My husband used the gym facilities which he said were fine. Definitely my go-to choice the next time I'm visiting Manhattan.

Great location, great food in the restaurant. I was very happy with the hotel overall. Nice gym and sauna. Very clean and I had a good time. I would recommend it to a friend for sure. I would stay there again.

The hotel's position is great, very near to a number of attractions and to the metro station. Hotel has a limited number of rooms, so it is very quiet and peaceful, thing that we appreciated. But if you are looking to trendy hotels with crowdy places, it will not be your type.Staff was nice and the room was clean. Though comfortable, we find the room very small, probably too much considering the price. Breakfast is available a la carte in the restaurant of the hotel, good though pricey.

My husband and I visit NYC several times a year for a few days. We deviated from our usual hotel to give the Iroquois a try as there was a sale going on. Upside - the location is terrific, staff very welcoming, bed comfortable, room very clean, free wifi. Downside (perhaps for some) - room was a bit small and view of brick building. Neither of those bothered us. As long as we are not traveling with our kids, room size is irrelevant. Ditto for the view. We're just there for a comfortable place to stay. Which leads me to the big sticking point with the hotel. The temperature control is centrally handled so we could not adjust the a/c in our room. Comfort is important to me and the room was just too hot for us at night. We were able to fall asleep because we were tired from being on the go and having had several drinks. However, if not for that, I would have had a hard time sleeping. Hate to say it considering everything else was great, but I would not book with this hotel again because of that. When traveling, I need to be comfortable. My husband woke up super early and left the room just because it was so stuffy and uncomfortable. To be fair, we did say something to the front desk after our first night and were assured that they would try and cool that side of the building a bit more. We didn't really notice much of a change though.

Great location. Amazing service. Small and quaint. Not to be overlooked! We stays here for a long weekend and it was just perfect. The room was small, but that is to be expected in NYC. Great area as you are near the theater district by not in an overly touristy section.

This is a wonderful small hotel in the theatre district with excellent staff who are more like friends than employees. Can't go wrong with this place. No spectacular views but great accommodations. Concierge was one of the best!

Not just a great location, it’s all about the atmosphere and employees. The Iroquois has it ALL – charm, customer service, and all of the above. Charm! I loved EVERYTHING!! (Where should I begin?)! First, I love the fresh peaches waiting for us at the front desk – delicious and HEALTHY!! Second, our hotel room had a DOOR BELL! –OMG! The list goes on, on and on.. our morning paper was delivered in a cute cloth bag.. and the concierge was AWESOME! Thank you Veronica and Ezra! You guys rock…. After Veronica’s shift, she escorted us on the dreadful NYC subway to Harlem (to Sylvia’s Soul Food—yummy)… definitely above and beyond her call of duty. And thank you Ezra!! He was the bomb! Ezra informed us of all the Times Square hot spots, soul food joints, and must sees! And the BEDS and bedding... oh la la Ia! The best sleep EVER! I would definitely recommend and STAY Iroquois again!! This was great getaway..

Pricey for value received. Great for my business convenience at 20 West 44th Street. Views for most rooms limited. Rooms on small size. Lighting darker, with always some burned out bulbs in desk lights.

We stayed at The Iroquois for 1 night after a weeklong cruise. We got to the hotel well before noon and were able to check in early and got an upgraded room too! Our room was across from the elevator but we never heard any noise. The room was a comfortable size, Molton Brown tolietries, Frette bed linens and a lovely marble bathroom. The front desk staff and bellman were pleasant and professional. Cold water and coffee in the lobby as well as no charge computers and printer, with free wi-fi. We don't get to New York often but we would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at The Iroquois for our 45th wedding anniversary. Although we live close to NYC, my husband had never expressed an interest in staying there or doing "touristy" things. Based on advice from a travel expert in the family and the discounted price offered that weekend, we chose The Iroquois. We were not disappointed. From the moment we walked into the hotel, we felt like very special guests or family members. The desk clerk was friendly and efficient. We even managed to find out that she was from a town right next to our own. The deluxe king accommodation was exactly as pictured on the website. It was small, but then most hotel rooms in NYC are. The room was clean and the bathroom was very big. All the amenities are listed on the website. The only thing that was missing was a blow dryer, but since I did not need one, it was no big deal. The air conditioning in our room was not working correctly. The desk clerk called engineering immediately, and, by the time we returned to our room, the unit was functioning well. Bill, the concierge, found out that it was our anniversary and had complimentary wine and chocolates sent up to our room. He also helped us to find the correct subways for some of the tours that we wanted to go on. Finally, Bill and the manager of the hotel's restaurant Triomphe arranged a very special anniversary dinner for us. I will review the restaurant separately.

Vanessa Tourruellas and Bill Heinrichs exceptional concierge service is why we will return to this hotel. We were always greeted walking in and out of the hotel with such a genuine feeling and curiosity about our adventures around the city. We also found all the bellman to be extremely friendly and helpful. I would defiantly request a king bed next time because I'm pretty sure our queen was not your normal queen bed. (a little smaller than we have at home) However it was amazingly comfortable. The only issue we had was follow up with the front desk when we asked for ice and shampoo at separate times neither arrived. Again thanks Vanessa and Bill for making our stay in New York so great.

After visiting family in New Yersey and haring plans to wander around NYC for 2 more days, the Iroquois is a perfect spot! With a traditional interior and well-manered personnel you really feel like royalty. We had the junior suite at the front of the hotel and that was a little noisy but not too much. It's normal with city life... The king size bed was one of the best i've slept in in my whole life! Great experience! Together with watching 'The Wolf of Wall street' it was almost a legendary stay! Thank you Iroquois!!!

Excellent facility, staff and location in mid-town. My favorite of all New York hotels. The Iroquois is not only comfortable in its facilities, but staffed with knowledgeable and engaging Reception team.

I do not think we could put into words how outstanding this hotel and it's staff are! We arrived early and found our rooms ready. We had 2 x 2 double bedded rooms. They had ensured that we were on the same floor. Our rooms were beautifully decorated not huge but really great use of space. Our bathroom was beautiful and the Molten Brown products were fabulous and made the stay even more luxurious.We had a problem with one of the room safes and the manager Robert came and sorted it for us. Honestly the care and attention that is shown at this hotel is second to none, I have never stayed in a hotel with such fabulous customer service. A special mention for Vanessa, the concierge, she was amazing. Before we went I had questions and Vanessa answered them with ease and quickly. We needed to get a wheelchair for my mum, it was there waiting for us when we arrived and the hotel kept it downstairs so it was not in the way in the room. Bill the other concierge was fantastic too making sure my mum was alright and that our fussy daughter had a drink of coke as she didn't like the beautiful flavoured water in reception. The porters were all friendly and enjoyed joking with us 5 mad scottish people, makes a difference when people can laugh with you! the The hotel is not far from any of the major attractions in fact we kept falling upon things and laughed that we had primed ourselves for a long walk.So all in all The Iroquois and staff deserve 10 out of 5! When we return to New York we will be staying here and will not be looking elsewhere. Forgot to mention the chocolates, chocolate strawberries and strawberries that were in both rooms when we arrived as our daughter was celebrating her birthday and each night her 3 cuddly toys were positioned on the turndown of the bed. Personal touches like these make the difference between wonderful and magnificent! Thank you. Please pass on our sincere gratitude to all your wonderful staff.

To say we were pleased with rooms and how we were treated by your staff would be a masterpiece of understatement. This to me, this is an indication that you train and coach your folks well and that you run a tight ship. Congratulations! Your staff are absolutely delightful. I was particularly impressed by the Bill Heinrichs' (concierge) assistance in helping me to navigate my way around and for his suggestions as to music venues. He steered me on to Dizzy's at the Time-Warner building, where I enjoyed a great meal listening to a great group. We had great experiences with everyone including Vanessa, Alex, JJ, Sagar, Carlos, Ezra, the cleaning lady, plus the lovely ladies at the front desk (unfortunately, I can't find where I wrote their names). For someone on vacation, your breakfast prices warranted that we visited the local coffee shop across the street and Cranberries Delli on 45th. As with any mini-bar that I've seen, your prices were out of my "snack bracket" all together. I would prefer not to even have this in my room the next time we visit, and would prefer that you provide a small refrigerator at no charge. I suggest that you have the A/C unit in Room 806 checked out, It's noisy and annoying. My wife will recommend your hotel to our friends and we will return to your hotel for our next visit. My wife says that she read that your hotel was rated as 19th of 400 plus hotels in NYC. No need to convince me, or my wife of this. Please convey our sentiments to your staff.

We travel very frequently but we must say that this is one of the finest hotel we have stayed at. Our luggage didn't arrive and everyone at the hotel helped us with everyone vigilant at all hours of the day! The Concierge Mr. Bill was a very helpful person willing to help with anything and even managing reservations at the last hour. Its Location is perfect located in the centre of the city with everything at walking distance.

This was our second stay at the hotel and are very happy to recommend it.All staff were exceptionally nice and on this visit the front desk staff very kindly arranged for a room upgrade, wine and chocolates for our newly wed son and his wife who joined us at the hotel for the last two days of our stay.

I really enjoyed my staying at this hotel. All the staff has a warm reception and are very helpful. I was at the Marriot Marquis before and I would recommend the Iroquais than the other one. The streets here are more tranquil and you're still close to the Times Square. I would come back again.

We had a great suite with plenty of room for all of us. The hotel is in easy walking distance too many tourist attractions and good restaurants. The concierge was very helpful in recommending and booking dinner. We will definitely be back.

I was excited to visit the hotel considering the great reviews I've read online. Unfortunately, I was disappointed. The front desk ignored me, were down right rude and do not belong working in a hotel.

Stayed in a double room with my husband and teenage daughter last week for four nights. The room was a little on the small side and the room lighting is not the best though it creates a nice atmosphere. Lighting in the bathroom is much better. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms and bedding are kept clean and linen is changed regularly. We did not use the dining facilities, preferring to eat on the run each day. We did visit the bar one evening but were a little disappointed with the aloof atitude of the bar staff so didn't return. The best thing about the hotel (other than the very helpful concierge) is the fantastic location. It is right in the heart of midtown and within easy walking distance of most of the major attractions or very near to subway stations for reaching those further away. All in all a really great hotel to use as a base for exploring this wonderful city. I would recommend it to anyone.

What to say about this hotel.. Great location, impeccable service and small enough to not be crowded 24/7. We stayed here with my younger brother and he loved it as much as we did, staff are consistently polite and will always try to accommodate any requests you have. Location-wise, its near perfect, plenty of restaurants around and not far at all from Times Square, the concierge is also very helpful when you're trying to plan a special night out. Whether it's your first visit to NYC or your tenth, its worth at least one visit.

I booked this because of the reviews on TripAdvisor combined with a great rate I found directly through the hotel's website. First, the positives. The location is fantastic--it's an easy walk to Times Square/theaters, to many restaurants, Rockefeller Center, and several museums. The rooms are immaculate--we booked a Deluxe King--and the staff is very friendly. The woman working at the check-in desk was helpful and when the first room we were given was on the second floor facing a dark wall, she moved us to a higher floor with no problem. Turndown service is also incredibly friendly. Knocking first (some hotels are terrible about this), chocolates for your pillow, and a card noting the next day's weather. Now, the not-so-positives. The room was freezing...the AC was cranked up, but changing the thermostat didn't seem to help. It's also quite dark. Even with all the lamps turned on, it's not too bright in the room. Great if all you need is to sleep, not so great if you need to work. The bathroom, while very clean and boasting luxurious fixtures, is tiny. There isn't a spot to put your toiletries, as the glass shelves are narrow and already contain extra toilet paper and towels. If you have a makeup bag, you'll have to put down the toilet seat and set it there. And a biggie: no plugs in the bathroom. We couldn't believe it and searched high and low, but nothing. If you want to use a heat appliance for your hair, you have to do it in the main room. Overall, I'd give it four out of five stars, because it's clean, safe, and the staff is extremely friendly. Not sure I'd choose it again, though, given the other choices nearby at a similar price point.

Great location to visit NYC as you even do not need to take the metro. Most of interest are close to the hotel and you can use sightseeing guided tours to see more. The architecture of the hotel is very nice. Definitely a great place to stay and experience mid town.

Nice oasis in the hot hectic city. Friendly staff, good service, clean and nice rooms. Stayed in a suite - a little extra in price gives you a lot of extra luxury. I will definitely be back. The hotel is a good choice if you want to stay in that part of town.

Hotel in great location and staff is fabulous. Great hotel experience. Check in easy and accommodating. Size makes it a very friendly atmosphere, but they have everything a large hotel offers. Love the newspapers in the library.

We arrived early at about 10am after a long flight from Hawaii, followed by an unbelievably long airport transfer from JFK that made several stops in rush hour traffic all over Manhattan which left us regretting our decision not to take a cab as we only saved about $10 so we could not have been more tired on arrival. We were so grateful when reception unexpectedly told us we could check in immediately. Very impressed with that and being able to get a few hours sleep before venturing out into Times Square meaning our first day was not a write off.Being on our honeymoon they also brought wine and chocolates to the room which was a lovely touch, although I'd forgotten to put the Do Not Disturb button on and as I staggered out of bed to answer the door still half asleep and dressed only in my underpants the poor hotel staff were probably not as impressed with their view as I was with their kind gesture!The room was very compact but well laid out given the space, the "view" from our window was of an alley outside and the sky was hidden by an enclosed high rise in every direction so you couldn't even tell if it was day or night but it meant the room was very quiet despite being in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. The carpet was a little worn and dated but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom clean. We'd been warned not to expect too much from NYC hotel rooms but considering the reasonable price and the location of the hotel we were satisfied. We were on the 3rd leg of our honeymoon having visited Vegas and Hawaii so the hotel room was always going to be less extravagant but the point of New York isn't staying in your room anyway.We booked a Broadway show through the ever helpful concierge Bill and this hotel is the perfect location for the theatre district. We saw Les Mis and my wife enjoyed it but I must admit although I love live comedy, music and entertainment, musical theatre is never going to be my thing. I tried to look for other husbands who'd been dragged along but they all seemed to love it. I swear the guy sat next to me actually cried and they weren't tears of boredom like mine. Maybe it was the $30 dollars you had to pay for double whiskey and coke! Luckily the concierge Bill had more wine sent up to our room free to help us celebrate! Top man.The hotel is the perfect base to explore Manhattan. We found the subway quite easy to use but to be fair as long as you have a reasonable pair of shoes you could walk around all of NYC and there's so much to see. We spent an entire sunny day in the beautiful (and free) Central Park, went to the top of the Rock for the outstanding views, took in live (and free) musical performances in Greenwich Village, walked the (free again!) High Line, took the (free) Staten Island Ferry to see the Statue of Liberty, visited the humbling 9/11 Memorial and we paid in to the visitor centre which was well worth it and very emotional, and were taken out in New Jersey by friends we'd met in Hawaii for stunning views of the Manhattan cityscape, there's a great bar called Nevada Smith's for the football (soccer!) during the World Cup, just a shame about our England team being a let down as usual, but our favourite night was The Comedy Cellar in Greenwich Village followed by great live music at Cafe Wha. We were so impressed by how much you could do and see that was free like Union Sq or Washington Sq and I will definitely return to NYC.By the 5th day all I would say is I was a bit over Times Sq. As a first timer in NY I'm glad I experienced the beating heart of Manhattan but after a few days battling the crowds, touts and hustlers I was a bit sick of the area. We found Greenwich Village and the Meatpacking District much more to our liking and will probably try and stay there next time.If you do want to stay near Times Square though then the Iroquois is a great base at a very reasonable price with nice little complimentary touches like the best tasting, fresh strawberries on the reception desk every morning and iced water garnished with oranges, lemons or cucumbers which was very welcome after another day pounding the city streets!The lobby area is nice, we didn't go into the bar The Lanterns Keep but it looked a great little hideaway, the rooms are adequate but best of all the staff made our stay great with the early check in, little gifts and helpful advice.We did come back to an unexpected minibar bill on our credit card that we hadn't signed for and certainly hadn't used $102 worth of items. We think we did use some mini bar but it was a lot more modest figure than what we had been charged. Again though credit to Iroquois, one email to the reception and Jazmin wiped the bill to apologise for the confusion and refunded the credit card. This was above and beyond what we expected and again all credit to them. The "can do", helpful attitude of the staff is certainly the highlight of The Iroquois.
user_name:
GeordieDave
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: This is a perfect central location to retreat to after galleries and theatre in Times Square. Super. Particularly fond of quiet bar. Try for corner room next time. Two windows next door that would have made the visit even more satisfactory.

Just spent 3 nights at The Iroquois Hotel and as like my other stays there it was a perfect visit. The staff is always helpful from the first phone call when they accommodated my special requests for rooms to meet my family's needs, to the great service of the concierge with either directions or recommending a great restaurant and being able to make a call and get us the reservation we wanted, to the front desk staff who is always pleasant and makes the guest feel appreciated. The fresh peaches at the front desk were a favorite of my kids. The location is close enough to the many things NYC has to offer, yet in a location where you can escape from the craziness that surrounds some of the larger hotels.

I love the personal attention at this hotel. I love they respect my privacy and treat me like a valued guest. Wonderful experience for the solo-traveler. Everyone from the doorman through front desk and housekeeping seemed genuinely pleasant and courteous.

I enjoyed this hotel very much. The staff were outstanding, especially the concierge. Well done to both of you (sorry forgot names), its the little things that matter. The rooms are small but intimate but most of all it was an oasis from the hustle and bustle of NYC. The hotel is an older style hotel but has been refurbished with good décor. There is a restaurant in the hotel but we didn't dine there, so can't comment. The hotel is located about 1.5 blocks from Times Square and this certainly is a plus, as you are away from the crowds. The hotel is located between 5th & 6th street so there're amenities close by, not to mention shopping on 5th. There is, 'The Red Flame Diner' 3-4 doors down on the right as you exit the hotel. This is good for a cheap breakfast. We mainly ate at Times Deli on 44th but closer to 7th on the left. Good breakfast and a good place to stock up before you hit the subway. Also Bryant Park is close by so if you want to catch an old movie at night, outdoors, its not a bad option. I stayed at other hotels is NYC but this was certainly the pick of the bunch for me. I'd recommend this hotel because of the great service and location.

I recently spent several nights at the Iroquois on 44th Street. I had meetings in the area, have regularly stayed at a good hotel nearby but wanted to find another mid-town hotel for regular business use.The traditionally-styled lobby is small (a good thing) allowing quick entry and exit. Front desk staff were very helpful and attentive without any of the artificial fawning found at a lot of boutique and would-be boutique hotels these days. Check in was quick and easy and the two small elevators are just a step away from the desk.The small "Executive" room was both fine and a disappointment. They got the most important thing very right: the room was very quiet and the bed exceptionally comfortable. The musty smell on entry was not so welcoming.As a very frequent business traveler, details that may seem petty to an occasional traveler count.  - The desk lamp was not plugged in. Not a big deal. Just move the chair aside, get down on the floor at the edge of the desk and plug it in.  - There was no hair-dryer. Having unsucessfully searched, I called the front desk and was politely told it was in the second drawer of the dresser; except it wasn't. Another call to the desk and a dryer was courteously delivered 10 minutes later. Perhaps a prior guest stole the dryer but why isn't the presence of a dryer on the housekeeping checklist when turning a room after a check-out? - there was no luggage rack in the closet, leaving the top of the dresser the only place to place my roller-bag (BTW, thus partially blocked the TV; see below). I could have easily called for one but didn't bother. - TV isn't important to me and I didn't even turn it on so I don't care about this but one so-often wonders whether people designing hotel rooms ever actually stay in mock-ups of the rooms they design. The large-screen TV, mounted on the wall above the dresser and facing the bed, was not visible from where the single easy-chair was placed and the room was too small to move the chair to a place where the TV was comfortably viewable.The property is attractive and well maintained. The room decor is very nice. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. The location is great for mid-town business or access to the theater district. Wi-Fi was stable and fast. The price was reasonable. So the Iroquois has a lot to offer. But to be a top business hotel, a bit more attention to detail is needed.

My daughter and I took a trip to New York City. We were looking for a good hotel that would be centrally located. I did some research, and after reading many reviews I decided this would fit our needs. This is not a good hotel but a great one! The people there are courteous, and extremely helpful. Especially the concierge. They went out of there way for us. Not like other hotels, doing you a favor. The hotel is only two short blocks from time square. If you want a great hotel, that is reasonably priced centrally located I recommend the Iroquois.

This is a boutique style hotel, in the best mid-town position between 5th and 6th avenues. It does not have all the amenities or size of a large international chain, but it is understated and quiet and you look forward to going back to your room after a long day sight seeing. Bed the most comfortable ever. Room on 11th floor absolutely quiet and adequate size by NY standards. Great toiletries supplied and very clean. It all starts with a great front door and front desk team. Triomphe restaurant excellent for a special meal. Highly recommend.

The Iroquois was a quiet retreat in the midst of the theatre district. Staff was friendly and helpful. Beds were comfortable and rooms were clean. Carpeting a bit dingy and view not so good, but loved the quiet.

Have stayed here off and on since 1981. Great little hotel. Reasonably priced. If you're looking for a big room, you're in the wrong place. If you're looking for a conveniently located, clean and friendly hotel 5 min from Times Square, this is it!

I stayed at The Iroquois for one night and was delighted with my experience. I arrived early and expected to wait for check-in but received access to my room immediately. The room was a nice size for an NYC hotel room, very clean, comfortable, and attractive. The bathroom was spotless and beautifully styled. The best part was the sound-proof windows! I slept like a baby all night. Also, the location of this property is one thing that drew me to it when booking my hotel. It is close to the Lincoln Tunnel (easy in and easy out), parking directly across the street, Times Square around the corner, in the Theater District, Bryant Park and the NY Public Library a couple blocks away, Central Park within walking distance and great shopping along 5th Ave. Would highly recommend this property to friends and colleagues visiting the area in the future and will definitely stay here again in the future.

From the moment we pulled up to the door to the time we loaded out, we were treated like Queens. The service at this hotel is first class all the way. Front desk was attentive, friendly and professional. The concierge was superb and extremely helpful, going above and beyond to make our stay - and future trips into the city - delightful. The Triomphe bar (and Carlos, the bartender) offered a delightful respite to the end of a long day in the city. It was well stocked with the usual drinks, and offered a nice specialty menu as well. Our room was impeccably clean, with a well appointed bathroom, including robes and amenities. For NYC, it was very spacious. And really, who doesn't love turn down service with chocolates on the pillow? Free WiFi is such a rare find anymore, and the small 'library' area is a perfect waiting place or quiet reading area. This hotel also boasts a functional fitness area and a dry sauna ! Elevators ran quickly and smoothly, and although we did not go in, the small exclusive cocktail bar "Lanterns Keep" seemed a Romantic's haven. This hotel is close enough to all the hub and bub of Times Square without all the noise and confusion that goes with it. We also did not eat at their restaurant - too many other choices. Maybe next time. This hotel is a beauty, and we can't wait to go back to be pampered again.

Great small hotel with terrific service. We had a special request to have a selection of pies from Little Pie Company sent to a guest's room (we weren't guests at the time). The concierge, Bill, went out of his way to meet our needs, walking over half mile each way to pick up the pies and deliver them to the room. Above and beyond!
Fabulous hotel! So close to everything. Very clean and quiet hotel. The staff is so helpful and provided personalized service. Will definitely stay here again.Will recommend this hotel to everyone!!!

Stayed at the Iroquois for business. Got upgraded to a small room, so I don't know what the lowest grade room was like. Room was alright, but no different in size or amenities than other hotel rooms for a comparable price in mid-town. Front desk staff polite but not very helpful. Couldn't get room service at night, no matter what I did - eventually had to leave hotel to get dinner, instead of staying and working in my room. Not a major problem, but a huge waste of time and really aggravating. Hotel staff didn't seem to care. I won't be going back - not worth the price for what I got. A positive note: very quiet relative to other hotels. Could sleep without being awakened by street noise.

My husband and I enjoyed the stay. Staff was friendly and helpful. Queen room was small but very clean... Perfect for a one night stay. I would definitely return. We arrived on a Sunday and the affiliated restaurant was not opened. It would have been nice to have the option, but the city has so many places to eat that it really didn't matter to us.

Great hotel, excellent location and a staff that is very accommodating. I would stay again when I travel to NYC. The staff was most helpful and understanding. Very close to Times Sq and the theater district.

The welcome we received was refreshing after our long flight. The staff in this hotel are very friendly and helpful without going overboard.Our room was not big but a good size for a couple. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had luxurious furnishings.The location of the hotel is close to all touristy places like Times Square and Empire State Building but hidden enough so it is not too noisy at night.We will highly recommend The Iroquois as the place to stay in NYC.

We stayed at Iroquois during the NY's period in 2012/2013. This place is chic with it's colonial theme. The lobby is setup nicely to welcome you and the service is excellent. Staff were always at hand to answer any questions and point you in the right direction.Iroquois is positioned nicely to the Times Square and is about to a 10 mins walk away. It is also surrounded by many eateries and other attractions. The rooms are well laid out but are small. They do provide all the necessary amenities and a butler is on hand if required.

This was our first visit to NYC. So we depended strongly on Trip Advisor to assist us in choosing a hotel. We stayed at two different boutique hotels - one was the Iroquois. We were not disappointed. Only about a block away from Times Square - but on a quite street. It was a true respite from the city. We reserved a room with two double beds. The room was small, but probably not by City standards. No view. But extremely clean with high end bedding and toiletries. Plenty of hot water in the shower. Cold water and coffee were available in the lobby - nice touch. We chose not to eat breakfast at hotel or have room service. Gregory's Coffee is right across the street where we enjoyed good coffee and wonderful baked goods.While at the Iroquois we were able to walk to and from train station, Central Park, Top of Rock, Hell's Kitchen area, and of course Times Square. Very central location.

This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.Amazing location, both for leisure and business guests. Lovely specious rooms, fantastic friendly home away from home service.Cleanliness is flawless, everything sparkles, really fabulous in every way.Recommended with all my heart.

From the ease of using the valet parking, to the rooms, the staff went out of their way to make sure that our stay was enjoyable.The fresh fruit and flavored water in the lobby was an added bonus. The willingness of the front desk staff and concierge to answer questions on locations and how to get there.

The Iroquois and their staff did everything that they could to help make our trip to N.Y the best it could be. The room was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. I would totally recommend this spot.

My first visit to New York City and I love this hotel. I love it!! Go! You won't be disappointed. It's on an off street away from the famous noisy Broadway. Welcoming and friendly staff. They upgraded us to a king bedroom because our room was not ready. I love the room. Just like the rooms you always see in the movies. The self serve strawberries were a touch of class. Cafe, coffee shop, and bars nearby. Clean and safe to stay. Had a safe for personals and the robes were comfy. If I was were the Jeffersons I'd say this place made me feel like I was movin on up!!! Lol :-)

The Iroquois is a small, intimate hotel with attentive and personal service. Our room, while not large, was elegant and comfortable. The front desk made it easy to check in and check out. All the staff were welcoming and professional. The location couldn't be better.

The Iriquois hotel was very nice place to stay in New York. The rooms were very comfortable the bed fantastic and amenities were very good. Located close to Time Square, it is a very good location. We would recommend this hotel.

We stayed at the Iroquois for 9 nights after it was recommended by a family member and it truly was a home away from home. It's location was ideal, close to the shopping on 5th Ave, Times Square and the theaters.The staff from the doormen to the front desk were fabulous, friendly and always welcoming to us.The concierge staff were very good at their jobs and special mention to Vanessa who treated us more like friends and was able to answer our many questions with a smile.The rooms were great and we looked forwards to returning to the peaceful haven after a busy day out.We have found our new home away from home at the Iroquois and I can honestly say I was very sad to leave.

The Iroquois is within distance from Time square so we can just take a walk and restaurants is everywhere because we love to eat. The room looks so cozy and comfortable. We think we stay at the best hotel in New York.Loan and Ted

The Iroquois is THE place to stay in Manhattan. On 44th Street between 5th and 6th, the hotel is a short walk to theaters, Times Square, restaurants, public transportation, shopping and so much more! Taxis are easily available right outside the door. The front desk, concierge, door, and bell staff were consistently kind and polite, greeting us each time we walked in from the craziness that is NYC, and providing any assistance needed :) No, really...you will not believe how tranquil and welcoming the Iroquois really is until you experience it. Our room was on the 10th floor and very quiet. There are two elevators, so we never waited more than a minute.The rooms was small because this is NYC, where space is a premium, but room layout was maximized by furniture placement, etc. We never felt cramped, and believe me, we did not pack light! Plenty of drawer and closet space to store our "millions of clothes and shoes," and even the proverbial kitchen sink! Comfortable beds! The bathroom was also small but quite sufficient for our needs; great Molton Brown products for use. Housekeeping was awesome, and nightly turndown service, with chocolates on our pillows, made the whole experience even better. There is free in-room wifi for guests, and when it's time to leave, the Library off the lobby has computers with printers for guests to print boarding passes. The hotel has large umbrellas for guest use; perfect for the mid-summer downpour we experienced on the way to the theater one evening. There is also water and fresh fruit in the lobby, for when you come in after a long day in town.We did not go to either the bar or the restaurant on the property, and would highly recommend Cafe Un Deux Troix a block away, for breakfast.Our experience at the Iroquois greatly enhanced our visit to New York City. If it's about the little touches, this is the place to be! I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else! Can;'t wait till our next trip!

On our last stay in NYC we swore we would never stay in midtown again because of the mobs of tourists hanging out in Times Square. Well, we ended up having to stay in midtown again and it was a very different experience thanks to The Iroquois. It is located very close to most attractions, yet just far enough from the Times Square madness that you can avoid the crowds. The last hotel we stayed at we had to fight the crowds every time we wanted to take the subway. The rooms are not big but they are tastefully decorated and have wonderful bedding. I didn't love the pedestal sink because there wasn't a lot of room for all my toiletries. They do have a few glass shelves to place things on so it makes up for it. Nice bathrobes for guests which I would definitely use in cooler weather. Our room was on third floor facing the street and was extremely quiet. We were there over July 4th so that certainly helped with the noise factor. They have coffee available in the lobby in the morning and fresh citrus water during the day that I looked forward to daily. It looked like it had basil leaves in it. The entire staff was friendly and warm. My only critique was our closet was very shallow. It was fine for summer clothing but would have never fit winter clothing in it. If you are going in cooler weather and need to bring boots, coats, etc, just ask for a room with a bigger closet. We would not hesitate to stay here on our next visit to NYC.

The Iroquois is 200 yards from Fifth Avenue and a 7 minute walk from Times Square and Broadway. It's in a quiet street - for NY - and is ideally located for all your NY activities. The staff are most helpful - especially the concierge - and the hotel has a calm efficiency for the busy tourist.Rooms are spacious for NY and food good with a bar to relax in after a busy day.Would certainly go again

We were able to upgrade to a suite for a very reasonable fee. Both the sitting room and the bedroom were spacious (cavernous by New York standards). Street is quiet, but close to everything. The staff was helpful. The day we left there was a parade, with various streets being closed. The bellman simply carried a luggage multiple blocks and hailed us a taxi.
user_name:
MicKades
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: $2600.00 for 6 nites at iroquois === condo in mexico for 10 weeks for same money....!!!!  we came for our son's wedding along with 13 other family menbers..we were not offered a group rate eventhough we booked 7 rooms,, Barb MORRISH inquired about a group discount when booking and was told there were none..

This hotel is all about its character, friendliness and charm, as much as it's excellent location. A wonderful stay in NYC. A lot of the main attractions are only a short stroll away. The various subway stations are really close too.Hopefully one day to be repeated.

Have stayed twice and had great service ; amazing beds ;wonderful breakfast of oatmeal & coffeeGood location & quiet street !Little restaurant down the street good for lunch & snack. Hotel breakfast & dinner great .One of our favourite hotels in NYC. P & J > Canada

Currently staying at the Iroquois with Partner and teenage son, five nights in total. This is my fourth time to New York and I have always stayed in midtown Manhattan. This hotel has been the best, exceeding my expectations. Everything from check in onwards has been excellent. Comfortable, well serviced rooms, friendly helpful staff. No street noise in our room at all (301)!! A special appreciation for the wonderful concierge Vanessa, who has helped us navigate the city and was able to direct me to a good walk in doctor when I fell sick, helping my partner fax my passport details to them when I needed photo ID. Will recommend this hotel to friends.

I stayed here for 2 nights with my teenage daughter. The staff was courteous and friendly, the room was compact but charming, nicely furnished, comfortable and clean, the bathroom was brightly lit and had good water pressure, and the bed was extremely comfortable. My only complaint was an inability to turn the air conditioning any cooler--it was maybe 2 degrees too warm for complete comfort at night. It was in a good location for the theater district. We will stay again!

This hotel is consistently excellent with wonderful service and excellent attention to detail. The rooms are immaculate. I would highly recommended this hotel to friends, family and others. It has made trips to New York a pleasure. My friends from out of country mirrored my comments.

As always, a lovely stay in a super friendly hotel. Service and location was excellent. Concierge excellent, you can't beat the doormen, very professional cleaning staff. A home from home in the centre of Manhattan

Had a great stay at the Iroquois. Great location with easy walking to different locations north and south. Easy access to many Broadway shows. The staff was very helpful with my departure as well, arranging a car for me so I can spend a few more hours in the city instead of dealing with transportation to the airport.

Everyone at this hotel is very friendly and helpful. The rooms as well as all guest areas are impeccable! I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC. Great value for the money and a great location

Perfect location with a wonderful staff. Great in house bar & restaurant. Fantastic food, drinks & service. I never made it to the fitness center but I thought about it once. The local coffee shop is a great place for breakfast. Fantastic steak house down the block. Vanessa, the concierge was so helpful. I can't wait to go back.

The Iroquois Hotel it is a recommendable place for staying in New York City, the situation is perfect close to Times Square and Grand Central Terminal. The room very comfortable and the staff all the time is taking care about you.

I stayed in a few different hotels in NYC during my recent visit. The Iroquois was the most traditional and charming and probably the nicest hotel I have tried in NYC. I got a good rate, on a Sunday night.The Iroguois is located in midtown, one block from Times Square and between 5th and 6th Avenue (Av. of the Americas). So it's well located for shopping and access by bus or subway to most places in Manhattan. When you walk into the lobby it feels like an oasis in midtown. Reception staff are nice and helpful. The very pleasant lobby has free refreshments at various times, fruit or iced lemon water. Off the lobby is a small library, with a couple of desktop computers and printers, so that you can easily print out boarding passes or reservations for your next hotel. There is also free wifi in the lobby and the rooms.My room was very small, with a window looking out to a fairly large light-well. The room was traditionally and pleasantly furnished with a good bed, small desk, good sized bathroom and a separate walk in wardrobe, that had hanging space and the safe.Unfortunately the flat screen tv didn't work on most of the channels in my room.I didn't try breakfast in the hotel, but walked up the street for a minute, past the Algonquin Hotel to a reasonably priced diner/coffee shop for breakfast. There were lots of other cafes in the area.If you want to stay in an elegant, small, traditional style New York hotel and you can find a reasonable rate, the Iroquois would be hard to beat.

We booked a 4 night stay to celebrate my husband's retirement from the Air Force at the Iroquois and had a fantastic experience. We had a room on the 10th floor away from the elevators and we never heard any hallway noise or street traffic. Our room was an upgraded king sized room and yes, as others have noted, it was not large. This is very common for NYC. The bed was comfortable, and the towels were nice too. The concierge services were terrific - both Vanessa and Bill were great to work with! They were extremely helpful and quite knowledgeable of the area. The location of the hotel was perfect. We only took the subway twice our entire visit as most things we wanted to do were within walking distance. The only negative thing was the internet service went down while we were there. It wasn't down long for but neither my Iphone nor our Ipad would connect in the room - it would out in the hallway or in the lobby. Our rate did not include breakfast, yet the Red Flame Diner is right down the street and was ok for a quick bite. So glad we chose to stay at the Iroquois - we will definitely be back!

This is an old but really nice hotel that has been tastefully updated. The location is superb if you are wanting near Time Square and Broadway. The rates are reasonable for NYC. The bed, bedding and pillows were wonderful. The size of the room was large by New York standards. The decor was very pleasing to the eye. The bathroom was marble and well appointed with high quality toiletries. The front dest staff, which seemed quite young, were all professional, warm and welcoming. They went out of their way to get a room ready for us so that we could check in by 1:30pm (normal check-in is 3:00pm) and drop our luggage in order to make a Broadway show that started at 2:00pm. There is a highly rated french restaurant attached to this hotel but we did not get to use it as they are closed on Sundays. Room service to a limited degree is still available on Sundays. The one and only problem we had with this hotel was the street noise. If you have a room over the street expect to hear EVERYTHING all night long. Trash truck emptying dumpsters at 3:00am, sirens, horns, people yelling, entire conversations like the people talking were right next to you. Something about the buildings along this street traps the noise and sends it upwards. We did not get any sleep as the noise levels were constant all through the night. This wasn't just the usual city noise it was LOUD city noise. I would recommend this hotel as it is quite nice if they can give you a room away from the noise.

We enjoyed a 3 day girls weekend at The Iroquois. The proximity to Broadway show and Times Square as well as the metro is superb. Just off the hub, the hotel is very well appointed and the staff are helpful and welcoming. Free wifi added value,too. We will stay here again.

Went to NYC with my youngest son. This hotel is fabulously located. Easy to get to Times Square, Rockefeller center, easy access to the subway, and the Empire State Building. Staff was great. Breakfast included and good, but nothing special.

We spent 5 nights at the Iroquois for Easter. Our luggage was lost at London Heathrow and we arrived at 11pm at the hotel with a warm welcome. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is great. The beds were very comfortable, the room was small but very clean. We'll definitely stay at the iroquois again next time we go to NYC.

When we travel to New York City we always stay at the Iroquois. On our recent trip we realized some previously purchased theatre tickets were not going to be our cup of tea. When Stub Hub could not help us, the very friendly concierge Bill Heinrichs said he would try to find a buyer. He followed through and quickly found the person who wanted our tickets. He would not accept our offer to share half the proceeds.

My wife and I stayed here for two nights in June 2014. The hotel location is excellent for tourists being centrally located within walking distance of Times Square, broadway, and Rockefeller Plaza. Rooms are a little small and you're not going to get a great view rooms are very clean and eloquent. I probably would not stay here again but only because we are growing tired of midtown and the congestion.

This was my 2nd stay at the Iroquois. This is a little oasis in the big city. It is a small hotel and rooms can be tight, but the space is used well and there is plenty of room for the amount of time you are in your room. The entire staff is friendly and efficient. Location could not be better in Midtown. It is an older hotel, but improvements have been made since my first stay...lighting being one of them. We were on the 12th floor so noise was not a problem. If you want a view this is not the hotel for you. If you want an attentive, wonderful staff then it is the place for you.

Whenever I visit New York City, I always book at The Iroquois.I would go no where else!! It is like a second home to me.The location is excellent. The staff is friendly and will go out of their wayto help you.

Very well situated to Time Square, shopping, theater district and trains. The concierge was able to provide wonderful restaurant recommendations. We easily mastered the area. The fitness center was very well done given the size it provided a good amount of equipment and free weights. Beds were comfortable and black out blinds made sleeping in easy.

We stayed one night at the Iroquois when in town to see "Hedwig and the Angry Inch". Wish we'd had more time! The hotel is still one of the few class acts left in the neighborhood and you feel welcome from the minute you pull up to the front door.

The Iroquois is a great boutique hotel. The location is fantastic with easy access to TSQ, Broadway and shopping. Plenty of subway options. Helps to make your stay in NYC feel more comfortable. This is our go to hotel.

We came for just the night to see Hedwig (the theater is only a block away) and it was wonderful. They checked us in, stored our luggage, and called us when our room was ready. The room was very spacious and the bed was super comfortable! They even brought us a mini fridge at no cost. When we came in late from our show, the bartender kept the bar open so we could have one of his signature cocktails before turning in. We were so impressed and pleased. I will definitely be returning to this hotel.

Came in to see a show. Hotel was able to check us in early. Location is just a few blocks from Times Sq., Bryant Park. Great service, clean and nicely appointed rooms. Gym was more than adequate. Nice bar.

Great Hotel, perfect location! The Iroquois Hotel is a perfect hotel for a short trip to NYC. The location in Midtown is perfect, the service is excellent, always willing to of help to the guests and very friendly. The Rooms are very clean, comfortable and quiet. The bathrooms are of good quality. So far the best hotel we have stayed in NYC. Thanks!

Dropped by for cocktails with a native New Yorker. Great setting, small intimate and outstanding service. Close enough to the madness of Times Square to be convenient and far enough away to be sane. Highly recommended and the perfect start to the evening

Well priced boutique hotel. Excellent location. Clean rooms (and public areas). Great attention to detail here that you don't get at the chain hotels. Good restaurant attached to the hotel (Triomphe). Very central for 5th Avenue, Times Square, Theatre District and only a couple of blocks from the subway. Staff are friendly and attentive.

The service provided was impressive and exceeded our expectations. The staff in all areas was attentive, efficient, and focused on ensuring all our needs were met. You'd think we were in small town Iowa. The rooms were very clean, bed extremely comfortable, location excellent as in only a couple blocks to Times Square, subways, etc and noise was never an issue. The rooms are on the small side and prices aren't inexpensive but considering the location its still a great value. Would definitely stay again and recommend to everyone I know.

Our stay at the Iroquois was great. The staff was super friendly and very patient with first time New Yorkers. We would highly recommend this fine hotel for either business or leisure stays. We were in NY to see the sights and this location was great. Can't say enough about the service, especially Ezra, who was there at a moments notice.

Nice hotel, great beds, it's a little dark, but comfortable. Got a room in the back of the hotel so not noisy!,.........................................................................................

Excellent hotel that delivers as promised. Zero complaints. Efficient and helpful staff. The concierge, in particular, was helpful with making arrangements both big and small. Couldn't be happier with the stay. Another excellent SLH member hotel.

been there for a week. excellent locationvery nice room, very cleanfriendly stuffexpensive breakfast. the are many coffee shops around to have nice breakastgreat and very helpfulstuffi am sure ti stay there again on my next visit

I was relocated from the City Club hotel two doors down because of a mechanical issue. The transition was seamless. When I arrived the front desk person already knew my name; that was a nice touch. The staff was friendly and courteous. The room was comparable. I would stay here again

The Iroquois is an excellent hotel in a great location in midtown Manhattan. The staff was extremely courteous and the hotel had everything we needed to make our stay memorable. Although the room was not that large, the bathroom was more than adequate and the bed was extremely comfortable.
J.Dean Suite Perfect for family of four including 2children 11&8. Immaculate,everything works, we slept like logs.Staff Perfect,Competent,Helpful.Vanessa,Concierge,Perfect, helps above and beyond.

The Iroquois was a very nice experience. It has an intimate feel the moment you arrive. The room was small, yet fine for our stay. The beds were amazing!! The location was perfect. We were centrally located to Time Square and the Theater District, 5th Avenue and shopping, Central Park, The Empire State Building, transportation to anywhere, and we felt very safe coming and going.

The hotel location was perfect. Close to Times Square and within walking distance to all the theatres and other tourist attractions. Staff was friendly and helpful and the room was clean. Concierge staff was very helpful and patient answering all of my questions.

Very nice small hotel with a fantastic location if you're heading to the theater. Close enough to walk to all of them (as long as you're not wearing stilettos). Small, elegant rooms with high end fittings. Baths are satisfactory for a day or two (pedestal sinks, no shelf space). Hopefully they will add space when they freshen the baths, which are getting close to needing it. The Red Flame diner is steps away (very reasonable prices, good quality, fast service) as is DB Bistro (unreasonable prices, excellent quality, excellent service). Fifth Avenue shopping is also a short walk.

Thanks to NETRATE CONCEPTS for putting me up at the Iroquois Hotel in NYC...Great location in the heart of Times Square. Was able to enjoy the convenience of walking around the "city" and being able to enjoy the fine dining in the area and walk to the theater all in the general area. I would recommend this hotel and thanks again to NETRATE CONCEPTS for making the suggestion and ALL the arrangements.
user_name:
rick j
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here four nights the end of May and had a great time. Location could not be better if you want to stay in midtown. Room size was adequate with no view---how much time do you spend in the room anyway? We were on the 10th floor which meant no street noise except sirens. If someone was talking in the hall, you could hear everything. Only heard people two maybe three times the entire trip, so it wasn't an issue for us. My friend complained about the lack of light in the room, but the hotel has plans in place to remedy that. The staff was great with one small annoyance for me. I asked the front desk clerk for a recommendation for a great burger even if it was expensive. She replied "five guys" and I apologized and said no thanks. Perfect location for my first trip to NYC.

This was one of our many trips to NYC. I have to say The Iroquois Hotel rates at the top of the hotels we have stayed. Cant beat the location. The hotel is clean, friendly staff, and very comfortable bed and pillows. We will definitely be back!

Vanessa in Concierge will help you with anything, including using the subway.I highly recommend taking the red uptown train to 42nd Street and dining at the Red Rooster.Aladdin is a must see if you don't do anything else.

We really enjoyed our time at the Iroquois. The location was excellent. It was close to everything that we wanted.The service was outstanding. We would stay again. Great time for our anniversary weekend.

Stayed 4 nights in this hotel and will not ever return. This is not a four star hotel, rather an average three star in good location.- If you are one of those who gets problems from aircon, this hotel is not for you. Aircon is central system, so couldnt adjust the temp. Also couldnt switched it off - or once you "switched it off" as the staff member advised, it actually stopped blowing directly on the bed but turned to the side. And the noise doubled. Conclusion: its loud and blowing all the time. The clerk said it will start heating but it wasnt true at all.- Small rooms (had queen), was uncomfortable to fit in. Wardrobe didnt have lights and generally sockets werent easily accessible- Old full carpets- There was a space between door and wall, so light came from corridor at night. Also heard everything from corridor- Cable TV and internet didnt work on the first night so had to go to the next hotel to catch connection- No coffee / tea facilities- Guy who filled minibar was exceptionally rude. No manners at all. When he returned, he just walked in without knocking the door and didnt say a thing, just put the water on the table. + Guys at the front door+ Location+ Ok cleanNormally would give this hotel average rating here, but as the staff managed to spoil our stay by overcharging our friends' credit card which took 3 days to solve. Instead taking responsibility they first denied and said it is some other hotel, then they said its fault of booking.com and at the end they told my friends that it was my fault, resulting to disasterous ending of 3 our weeks holiday. Hotel compensated our friends though after they admitted they made a mistake. When I mentioned my feedback to the staff member called John, he wasnt that interested and later didnt even bother to say goodbye. Although got arrogant apologies from him. Very unpleasant man.Conclusion: very bad taste from this hotel and certain staff members. Our grande finale night in New York and whole holiday was spoiled by accusing me on the credit card mess. That is unacceptable.

I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in May. The whole experience was delightful from the moment we arrived to when we sat in our car to return to the airport.All the staff could not have been more welcoming, helpful and friendly. Our room ( whilst small, which is par for the course in NY) was very comfortable and spotlessly clean, as was the en suite bathroom. Linens, towels and robes are of a very high quality, and super soft.The hotel is in a great location for midtown, Times Sq and theatres.The Red Rooster Diner next door is fabulous.I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat and will be booking for my next trip.Loved it !!

Everything was perfect:Size and quietness of the room (We took an executive suite), staff efficiency, location... for a very reasonable price, considering NYC prices.We didn't try the restaurant, though, so no opinion on it.

Enjoyed our stay at the Iroquois. Small but nice rooms. Very clean. Loved the turn down service and the little chocolates on the pillows. Great location -close to Times Square, Broadway, and 5th Avenue. I would return to the Iroquois.

the hotel itself was what we expected, traditional and had an authentic boutique feel to it. We were very impressed as we walked through the front doors. When we went up to our room we were shocked at how small the size of the rooms were, but we were later informed that this was typical of the majority of hotels in manhattan, especially times square. The mini bar and the hotel's bar were all very expensive so i suggest that you buy food and drink elsewhere, but beds were comfortable and situated in a great location!

I was very impressed by how friendly and helpful each member of the Iroquois staff was during my week-long stay. And, because I was there working on my Ph.D. dissertation, I appreciated the lack of noise.

This was my first visit to the Iroquois Hotel, and I had a wonderful experience. Per other reviews I requested a quiet room on a higher floor before arriving. We were given room 601 which was located right across the hall from the elevators, and had a limited view overlooking the backs of other buildings. We didn't experience any noise from other guests or the elevators, and only heard some street noise in the mornings. This hotel is small, and we only saw two other people on our floor during our week-long stay. It is in a great location, near Times Square/Rockefeller but without all the chaos and swarms of people.
