The staff was friendly and helpful when we needed additional towels or ice (you have to request ice brought to your room, which we did about twice a day). The appeal of this hotel for me was the location and double beds. The room was small, but that is to be expected in NY. The beds were comfortable and the room/bathroom was very clean. Our room was a little dark, as the light coming in the window was blocked by other buildings. I would have been happier if we had an additional floor lamp, but that is about the only thing I can complain about. Overall I was very happy with our visit, I would stay here again and again.

I've stayed here twice, both times for work. Good location in midtown. The first time I had a nice room with a bay window, even though it overlooked an interior courtyard/other buildings. The bed was very comfortable and the Molton Brown toiletries are a nice touch. The second time I stayed the room wasn't as nice and there more windows in the closet/bathroom than in the actual hotel room. It's an older property so I can understand the quirks. The elevators are very small and slow. I found myself hitting both elevator buttons and ruining between them to see which would open first. Once again, this can be chalked up to the fact that it's an older property. Overall, it was a good stay and I would stay there again.

....did go wrong!!! The staff is amazing, but they cannot keep up or make up for the deficiencies in this old time building. Central AC means that you cannot adjust your room temperature!!! It was usually too cold (even though it wasn't very hot for NYC). I got a sore throat from the constant blow of cold air. The TV service is cable that was constantly out! I mean daily!!! It's one thing to say "coffee is downstairs til 10:30", but then they pull the coffee service prior to 10:30!!! An apology letter from management at my door almost every morning. Look, the Westin a couple blocks away has bigger rooms, nicer rooms, more amenities, for less $$$ and NO PROBLEMS!!! I have to finish now so I can go blow my nose and sneeze!

The Iroquois may just be the least expensive luxury hotel in mid-town Manhattan. I have stayed there twice; and enjoyed both stays. The bar (Lantern Keep) and restaurant (Triomphe) are both outstanding.

Had no problem booking this hotel and the staff are all outstanding. The room is a good size while the bathroom was a great size. Bed was comfortable and the best part was the location, close to Times Square (still a quiet hotel), close to 5th Avenue, Broadway, The Rock... and a short walk to the Empire State Building and Central Park. New York City is the friendliest city I've had the pleasure of visiting.

Every year three generations of women travel to NYC to see shows, shop, and sightsee. The Iroquois staff is very accommodating and fills every request we make. The rooms are great for us with both two doubles or a suite having the sleeper sofa for the younger girls. Both breakfast and dinner in Le Triomphe's dining room are real treats. Le Triomphe is a great place to have a topnotch dinner either on the first night in the city or the last. The bar is also very welcoming and quiet. Hotel Iroquois is very well located for both the theatre district and 5th Avenue shopping.

great location for shopping. Plenty of bars/restaurants, range of prices. Near to times square and 5th avenue. Lovely hotel, rooms not massive but really nice. would stay again. New york is so tourist friendly. Recommend brunch on rooftop 230th at 5th.

A wonderful hotel in a great location. Within walking distance to shopping, food and theater district. Very clean rooms with comfortable beds. Bathroom bright with perfect lighting. A pleasurable trip. Will def return. Wish we could have stayed longer . A beautiful property!!

We really enjoyed our stay, the facilities were very good, staff were very pleasant and helpful, the location of the Iroquios is superb very handy for Times Square and 5th Avenue. This was our second visit to the Iroquios and we will hopefully return next year.

This place is great! Location if perfect for Times Square and Broadway, staff was nice, was able to check in early and they even gave my daughter a NYC goody bag upon arrival. It rained the night we were there and they had DVD's available to borrow for free which was perfect. We will return next time we are in NYC!

I used to work in New York but never visited with my wife. We took a few days for me to show her around my old stomping ground. The rooms are crisp and clean. It was very hot while we were there and the A/C worked very well. The price was very good too.The concierge was well informed and always spot on with his recommendations. This hotel is brilliantly positioned and we were able to walk to most of the tourist spots we had chosen.Would definitely go back.

The staff at the Iroquois really do want to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. When we first arrived, we requested a refrigerator and some ice. Both of these things were in our room within 10minutes. This was the case the entire time.. Anything we ever called down for was promptly brought to our room. The room itself is large compared to other NYC hotels. The fitness room is small, but just enough if you are trying to get a quick workout in. The only drawback to this hotel (others may think it is a benefit) was the location. It is right in the middle of tourist city. You are very close to Time Square and Broadway. The streets are always busy and you will not find too many unique/ off the beaten path stores or restaraunts. The rent is too high so you will encounter a lot of chain stores. If you are visiting NYC be sure to check out some of the other neighborhoods like SoHo, Chelsea, and ABC for a different perspective. There are 2 train stations very close to the hotel, so I recommend venturing out a little bit!!

Hotel staff is always very nice and friendly....LOVE the personal service they provide. Much nicer than staying at a large hotel. The hotel is located in the perfect spot for my week...withing walking distance everywhere I went.

We stayed in the Iroquois 6 days; location is ideal for theater lovers. Room (in one of the upper floors) was super quiet. Staff was friendly and efficient. Inccredibly good breakfast! Neighborhood with plenty of shops.

We went for our 18th wedding anniversary. The service is excellent. We stayed in a beautiful suite. The rooms are gorgeous with the most comfortable sheets. My husband loved the complimentary shoe shine. You put shoes outside door and they are ready by morning. Walk across the street to neighboring hotel ..great bar. This hotel has a perfect location, 2 blocks from Times Square. My husband says if you don't stay here you are missing out!

We stayed at the Iroquois New York for three nights in May. I can't say enough about this hotel. The staff were incredible - personable, friendly, and above and beyond helpful. The room was quaint and the beds were comfortable. Location was PERFECT for whatever we wanted to do. I would strongly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a comfortable, convenient, clean, home-away-from-home stay that isn't a cookie-cutter big box hotel. The hotel atmosphere was warm and inviting and if I ever go back to New York, the Iroquois will be on my list of preferred places to stay.

I'm not sure how I've been to New York so many times and hadn't yet discovered this little stretch of 44th street between 5th & 6th with several boutique hotels on it. I stayed at The Iroquois in May 2014 with my mother for a girls' weekend to pack in as many Broadway shows as we could in three days. The hotel is lovely. We had a room with two full size beds. As you'll find in most NYC hotel, the room was small but they truly did make good use of the space and I never felt cramped for space. There were some shelves added in the bathroom and a window ledge that provided enough space to set toiletries & cosmetics. My only complaint is that we had a bit of a hard time getting the dresser drawers to stay closed - it seemed that the dresser was slightly tilted forward so you had to make sure the drawer was stuck in place or else it would just slide back out. I'm sure this was an issue just with the particular room we stayed in. Though there were not coffee makers in the room, the hotel had coffee service in the lobby each morning and a particular national coffee chain has 3 shops within about a 2 block radius. The hotel also offered infused water later in the day which was so nice to have if we were stopping in to change or drop off bags in between sightseeing and shows. All of the agents and other employees we interacted with were professional and courteous. I've been to New York about a dozen times over the last 10 years and this is the first hotel I've stayed in that I would return to without hesitation.

Great location, nice quiet hotel. Food and beverage very expensive. Other than that splendid hotel. If you are looking for central hotel to explore New York this is for you. Our room was a little small although well equipped.

Great location, helpful and friendly staff, clean hotel. We found the premium king room big for New York. Bed linens were very comfortable. We will return and recommend this fabulous hotel to family and friends without hesitation!

We arrived slightly before our room was ready as our flight was early and the taxi was very quick to get in the city. Upon arrival we were greeted in a very helpful and polite manner and were able to leave our bags with the concierge whilst we headed out into the city. When we arrived back to the hotel the concierge helped us up to our room and couldn't be more helpful. The room was beautiful very boutique, bed very comfortable and bathroom incredibly clean and tidy. Every trip through reception was a delight and the attached restaurant and cocktail bar is very much worth a look in if room service is your thing then you will not be disappointed. Every member was a absolute delight but our most outstanding member of staff was Zachery the best member of concierge I've ever had the pleasure of being served by. Thanks again Zac you made our visit
user_name:
Mark G
Dorking, England, United Kingdom

review_body: My two daughters and I have a wonderful holiday visiting New York for the first time in May 2014. The Iroquois was recommended by a friend and I am very grateful to her for it. The Iroquois was exactly the right accommodation for us in every way and when I return to NY one day I will certainly stay there again. We have wonderful memories of this beautiful, centrally located hotel and its warm and friendly staff.

Great location and welcoming hotel for a girlfriends' trip to NYC. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The beds were amazingly comfortable with multiple pillows...and we loved the fluffy robes!!!

Fab boutique hotel. We stay here 2 or 3 times a year. It's location can't be beat as it is in the heart of Midtown. Easy walk to Times Square, Rock Center, MOMA, 5th Avenue and Madison Avenue Shopping.Many good restaurants within walking distance. Always a taxi to take us downtown. Rooms are stylishly decorated, impeccably clean and a little tight but you're not there much anyway. The staff is always so friendly and accommodating. Valet parking or self parking right across the street. On a quiet street to there's not much street noise at night if you happen to be in one of the front rooms. Enjoy a cocktail at the bar after a day of shopping or touring. You will not be disappointed.

This is the first time we stayed in the hotel. We chose this hotel due to location as it was so central. We had arrived early around 2pm and the concierge was very helpful and checked if our room was ready and allowed us to check in in advance instead of us coming back after an hour! It was great as it allowed us to fresh up. The room was a bit of a tight squeeze however it was great value for money for 2 double beds. The room was very clean and the bathroom was nice and bright. However, the lighting in the main bedroom area was really poor. There were not enough power sockets in the room. In general, the staff were helpful and very friendly. There were chocolates left for turndown service. In the morning there was complimentary coffee and bananas. The hotel is within walkable distance to Times Square,Bryant Park, Radio City, 5th Avenue. If you stay here definitely walk to Magnolia Bakery for come cupcakes! Only 5-10 minute walk from hotel. Simply delicious!

On an absolute scale, value vs price paid is kind of low even though, on a relative basis, considering it is in New York, I would say it is good. We have found some dust here and there in the lobby and in the room.

The Iroquois is a great location and a good value for the quality of the property. I stay for business and it's a central location for attending theater and there are several nice restaurants on 44th street.

The Iroquois is just two blocks from Times Square - perfect location to almost everything you may want to see in New York. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful. The concierge goes the extra mile to help with your needs. There is always someone opening the doors for you and welcoming you back. Complimentary bananas in the morning is also a nice touch.

Everything was just perfect. Room clean & quiet. Our travel agent booked a Premium King and we had an end room and loved it. Hotel is located close to everything.....perfect! We will be back to The Iroquois!!

My Daughet and I went to New York for mothers day and stayed at the Iroquois Hotel. It was a great hotel, clean rooms , amazing beds, a little gem in paradise.It was a ten minute walk to Times Square, very central location.The restaurant at the hotel was excellent, definitely a five star.You will not be disapointed if you stay here. We will be back!AMAZING

The room was cold for the first two days. Service managed to get it warm enough after two attempts.The bathroom was cold throughout my stay.Lighting was poor - difficult to read by.High price for inadequate accommodation.

We stayed at the Iroquois May9-12th and loved it! The location was perfect for our stay. The rooms were very comfortable and had great amenities, especially the bathrobes. We would definately stay at the Iroquois again!

The location is wonderful as it is very close to Times Square where all the theaters and shopping area are. The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly. I will definitely recommend this place to anyone traveling to New York.

We first stayed at the Iroquois 10 years ago and keep coming back to this gem. We have tried several hotels in the same area and price range (The refinery - NG, the Sofitel - ordinary, the Palace - larger but sterile). The biggest negative is the small rooms but otherwise, it is really worth the money. The decorations are warm and welcoming, the staff efficient, the bathroom well kept and nicely appointed, the rooms are clean and well lighted. The breakfast is good, and the restaurant is pretty with a nice staff. I just can't find a hotel I like better so we keep coming back.

It's close to both Grand Central and Times Square so subways are very accessible. Bike rental is right down the street. The rooms are larger than many with a very nice bed. The bathroom is fine and there is a closet. Computers and printer in the library for resident use (free). Very good concierge service. They always have coffee in the morning and water out all day. Great places to eat and drink all along the block. And of course it's just a block or two from all the Broadway shows!

great hotel in the centre of NYC very close to Time Squarevery helpful staff, great food for breakfast and the restaurant is excellentrooms are nicely decorated and clean, I will go back to the Iroquois!

A lovely, quiet hotel around the corner from all the excitement. Nice sized rooms for the money, friendly and efficient, could not be more central. Short walk to theaters and Radio City, but away from the noise and crowds.

very good location; very quiet, friendly staff I really enjoyed my stay there; I particularly appreciated the help provided by Vanessa, the concierge, who did a very good job and was very helpful and friendly; thanks a lot to her

Great mid-town location a block from Broadway. Friendly service and clean facilities make this hotel a cozy little home away from home. Easy access for business during the day and theatre in the evening.

we recently stayed in a premium king for 5 nights here. The position is fantastic, Bryant Park subway is very close, and so is pretty much everything else! We chose the room, for the free wi-fi, the size was slightly larger than others and the position was brilliant. Close but not too close to Times Square. We had no problems at all with any noise, our room was spacious (for New York) 2 windows for light, a lovely spacious marble bathroom, great shower, radio with iphone/ipod charger built in. Lovely fittings and immaculate decor and an absolutely fabulous bed, so comfortable. Housekeeping was great, the lantern bar, is very dark and the girl a little sniffy we found, so that was a once only visit! It started well, with our room available as soon as we arrived late morning, after our flight a change of clothes and shower was very welcome and we still had practically a whole day to make the most of, we were hugely impressed by that. The concierge here are absolutely without doubt the best we have had in a long time, both Vanessa and Bill are amazing and were so helpful and accomodating. They saved us so much time and trouble, we put in our requests and by the time we returned all the hard work was done and any tickets were waiting for us or bookings made all done!. They really made our holiday exactly that, stress free no hassle, something we both really appreciated, with someone else making all the arrangements. I would have no hesitation recommending this lovely smaller hotel for a much more personal touch with lovely decor and a great ability to make their guests feel important and special rather than just numbers through the doors like so many other larger hotels do. You will not be disapointed I have stayed in AAA 5 diamond resorts that were not as good an experience as this stay.

Another great trip to New York and Iroquois was outstanding again, my favorite place to stay! The staff are very helpful, friendly and give great advise on sites to visit. Very close to Time Square where all the night time action is and you can safely walk to almost all the theaters!

My boyfriend and I had 5 nights here for my 30th birthday last year and both absolutely loved this hotel. We were upgraded on arrival (birthday treat!) and had a lovely room overlooking the main St. Only did B&B as wanted to eat out each night but breakfast was lovely each morning. Location was brilliant and no distance at all from most major attractions. Didn't use the spa as no time unfortunately but loved every other aspect of the hotel. Would absolutely recommend this hotel and plan to stay here again, someday!

short and sweet!! The hotel is extremely close to time square.. less than a 4 minute walk. Most quiet cleanest street in the area in my opinion. rooms are good, people are friendly and very helpful. I chose not to have housekeeping in my room as I had a lot of personal items, but they would give me complimentary calls to see If I needed anything, which I thought was great. rooms were clean, hotel was clean and the bar was nice. the best time I had was the places that were recommended to me by the doormen. so if you want to know about the nightlife. my opinion would be to ask the doormen they had me go to some great places

Perfect location for first time travellers to the Big Apple: close to Times Square, Fifth Ave, MoMa etc. Nicely appointed rooms with Frette linen and Molton Brown amenities. Our adjoined rooms were in the back, no view whatsoever but very quiet. Very efficient concierge and friendly staff.

Historic Midtown hotel with great charm & an interesting history. Just enjoyed our 4th stay at this gem. Ideal location for theatre goers..perfect distance away from the Time Square madness. We'll be back.

A fantastic experience, service in Manhattan hotels is generally good so to exceed this stand is exceptional and that is what The Iroquois Hotel achieves. Brilliant service from Concierge made it great

the hotel and the staf wos excellent location cant better close to most important site and the service its realey value for the moneythe room nice clean and warmthe staf are really wont to help you for all you need really very good hotel

Can not imagine a better location...rooms not big but have all you need..very clean .very friendly stuff..will go back for sure..close to all the attractions..was in the hotel few times and always enjoyed the stay

We just returned from a Mother/Daughter trip to NYC. The Iroquois was the perfect spot. The hotel itself is lovely - rooms are relatively spacious and very clean and the staff are friendly and accommodating. The location is excellent. We walked everywhere - theaters, restaurants, Time Square, Central Park, Empire State/Macy's, Hell's Kitchen, etc. We must go back to explore further!!!

we were looking for a hotel to accommodate 4 people and found the iroquois to be perfect for us in all ways....ease, location, style, ammenities. the staff were beyond helpful and responded to our every need with immediacy. loved it here!

This is not my first review as I keep coming back. What can I say, the location is perfect, Vanessa the concierge is super efficient and extremely helpful to organize things, staff at the reception desk very knife and helpful and this remains the same for all the personnel. Rooms are tidy, clean and we'll maintained. So I will certainly be back!

My first time to New York and the hotel was lovely - great room and great service! The concierge was very helpful with suggestions for us. The service at the door and desk were excellent and also very helpful.

I'm very glad that I booked the Iroquois for our NY holiday. It made all the difference to have the comfort and friendly cheer of the staff at our disposal. Nothing was too much trouble and the rooms were immaculate and clean. The location to top sights and eateries was perfect and the concierge Bill was instrumental in making our day trips and dining recommendations fabulous.

The Iroquois was central to a wonderful New York experience. The hotel was very clean and comfortable; nothing was too much trouble for the staff; and the location was perfect. Special thanks to the concierge team, Bill and Vanessa, who couldn't do enough to make our stay so thoroughly enjoyable. Future trips to New York will always start with a booking at the Iroquois.

We went on the reviews to pick this classic hotel, and glad we did. The location was the best, not too close to Times Square to be noisy and hectic, but only a few minutes walk away. We were there for 6 nights. The room was small, but had everything you needed and was very clean, we had a view of a wall so didnt open the curtains. That was no problem as we were only in the room to sleep, you want to spend every minute you can out enjoying NY. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Just worth it for the location, you need to be there.

We found the Iroquois to be just what we hoped…classic style; with an understated but very welcoming lobby; rooms tailored, comfortable and clean; and hotel location just right for access to Subway, not to mention a block away from beautiful Bryant Park. The prices are not exorbitant by New York standards. The staff are extremely helpful and understand they are there to help out-of-towners get the most from their visits to the city. There's also an intimate library off the lobby where you can catch your breath or obtain a newspaper. We definitely want to return on our next visit.

I found this place on a walk from Grand Central. I had reservations at another hotel, but was not happy and changed my reservation to The Iroquois. I was very pleased with my overall stay. It was very clean, friendly and exactly what I needed for a long day of business in the city.

Elegantly styled and very comfortable rooms with lots of space to move about; beds very comfortable and nicely turned back - great chocolate treats left on the pillows; friendly reception & assistance

Small, friendly hotel. Near theater district but not in it and quiet inside. Helped us with late checkout which was necessary. This is not a hotel to remember for itself but it is terrific place to stay right in the heart of New York City

The beds were the best. I slept really well. Often they are too hard for me. The position of the hotel was perfect for us. It was close to walk to a lot of places and easy to take the metro. There are several places close to the hotel for breakfast.

It's a charming boutique hotel with many elegant touches, and the Victorian decor was beautifully emphasized, but nicely coupled with up-to-the minute bathroom fixtures, a nice strong shower, and super comfortable bed with top quality bedding. The only drawback to my very short stay at The Iroquois was that the beautiful Victorian bar (where I had planned to meet with friends) was closed on Sunday, and no food was available either. I am not prepared for things to be closed in NYC which I think of as always hopping. Other than that, though, my stay was wonderful. Front desk was very welcoming and even made coffee for me at 4am for a ridiculously early getaway. A very charming hotel with comfort and character and ideally located right down the street from theatre. Service was impeccable. I will definitely return.

We have stayed in this property many times over the years and every time, the hotel is spotless, the staff very friendly and accommodating, and the rooms are quiet and comfortable. Highly recommend the Iroquois!

We stayed three nights and the staff welcomed us with open arms to this lovely boutique hotel. There is always fresh infused water for hydration Coffee in the am in the lobby The staff made sure we had anything we needed for our outingsWe went to two Boadway shows within walking distance and also were able to walk to Central ParkTimes Square is a block and a half away but the rooms though a little small were quite and we rested well on luxury linensDid not eat at the restaurant but had dens at the bar-talented bartender-best brandy Alexander for a nightcap and my husband lived his Manhattan Want to Especially thank the bell boy Zach from San Rafael California his cheerful welcomes always made our comings and goings greatTo the owner manager thank you from the bottom if my small town heart for making my first visit to NYC Amazing awesome fabulous fun!

We stayed during a very cold and snowy week in January 2014. Building is well maintained and the rooms are a reasonable size given the location. The bed is comfortable and it was quiet so we rested well. The best part is arguably the staff, who are passionate about delivering great service. Friendly, concerned and genuine. You'll always be asked if you know directions or if you'd like a recommendation. We really felt at home and would return.

If you need a midtown location near Broadway/theatre district, this is a wonderful little hotel. Double rooms (2 beds) are incredibly small...you practically trip over bed upon opening door...but singles are adequate. Professional, friendly staff. Nice touches like bananas at front desk and refreshing cucumber water in lobby. Quiet hotel, good night's sleep. Carpet could use an overhaul.

I stayed in the hotel with my son 4 days. The service was impeccable. Starting at the reception desk, to the helping desk and the daily maintenance of the rooms. The hotel is very clean, cosy and decorated in classic elegance. Our room was specious, at least in NYC boutique hotels standards and the bathroom was very comfortable.

The staff make this hotel exceptional ... yes the hotel location is fantastic and yes the rooms are very clean and comfortable and yes the product has quality stamped all over it ... however the staff are the stars, they are so HELPFUL and SO FRIENDLY and always go that extra mile to make your stay enjoyable and memorable. Thanks to all the team at the Iroquois, you are all amazing, but special thanks go to Vanessa on Concierge for her spot-on recommendations and helpful and enthusiastic nature ... what a pleasure she was to deal with. When we return to NYC we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else but here, this hotel is a perfect balance of a quality product coupled with respectful and friendly service! Thank you, you made our week in New York so comfortable :)

We stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel is in a fantastic location, about 5 minutes walk from Times Square. Our rooms were quiet and just the perfect place to relax after wandering about all day (beds were very comfy!) Free coffee is served downstairs every morning - and warm apple cider later on. Everyone at the Iroquois was friendly and always available for advice on where to eat, or the best way to get Broadway tickets. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

The Iroquois is a (relatively) small, upscale luxury hotel, so be prepared to pay up. It was first class all the way. The restaurant was excellent. The staff were friendly and attentive. The concierge was most helpful. Top notch (and pricey).

This beautiful hotel, is wonderfully located: Broadway, Times Square, Central Park, the Rockefeller Center, were all in walking distance. Still our rooms were wonderfully quiet and we slept like babies. The staff was very helpful and helped us with reservations in restaurants, directions, etc.. We had a delicious breakfast, chosen from a cosmopolitan menu including fritatas, belgian waffles, etc.. lovely experience! We will definitely come back.

Our first stay will not be our last.Minutes from the theaters....perfect location.Their Triomphe Restaurant...even better than the River café....except for the view of course.The friendliest hotel we have ever stayed at. Perfection.

I've stayed at this hotel but always let the ex do the reviews. I've never had a bad night's sleep in this hotel. Never. The beds are always comfortable, and this stay was no exception. The is always professional, the bar has single malt scotch, its within walking distance to the theaters I want to attend. And as an added bonus with this trip, it was handy to the garment district so I was able to do some shopping and planning as well as relax.If you are a very light sleeper, request a room that does not overlook the street, but the noise is not as loud as visitors would expect. Have breakfast in Triomphe and before dinner cocktails at the bar. Or grab a paper and people-watch in the lobby...its all up to you. The hotel gives you the perfect backdrop for your stay.

An Excellent location just 2 blocks from time square...we stayed in a suite on the 12th floor (top floor) . From the moment you check in you are made to feel so welcome and the staff are very attentive to any requests. The room itself was superb, we had chocolates and wine in our room on arrival which was a nice touch. The bathroom was clean , maybe a little on the small side (as we had 4 adults in the suite) but it did have a bath and a separate shower cubicle with molten brown toiletries provided along with bath robes. No street noise could be heard from the room.A nice touch was the coffee in the lobby in he morning which was then changed to warm cider mid afternoon. There is also a small library for communal use.Please email the hotel with any queries or requests before you travel , the concierge service is excellent.I would definitely recommend this hotel and would return again.

This hotel has the old-NY feel, a location in the midst of just about everything and staff that are consistently friendly, helpful and welcoming. We spent 6 nights there and loved everything except the windows opening only onto a light well which limited natural light to the room. Remarkably quiet room, perhaps because faced on a side light well! Thanks to the great staff for making us feel at home.

A lovely stay in New York. Service was excellent all the time.The room was exactly as we expected. Clean and well located hotel.If we return to New York we will definitely stay here again.We have already recommended this hotel to friends planning a visit to NY.

I recently stayed at the Iroquois in midtown for 4 nights. This was a work-related stay, although I did do some sightseeing. The location couldn't have been better! I took my coffee & bagel to Bryant Park for breakfast and just enjoyed the greenery and the new spring flowers. The staff at the hotel were always helpful; the room itself was clean, if small (but no smaller than most NYC hotel rooms.) The bathroom, however, was plenty big! As was the closet. There was no view, really; just a fire escape and an alley. But that wasn't an issue for me. I had a wonderful experience at Lantern's Keep, the little speakeasy tucked into the back of the lobby. I do recommend reserving a table there, as it's tiny and fills up quickly. The front desk was very helpful about that. I don't think the food at the restaurant is very good, and I wouldn't spend any time or money there, not even for room service. But there were several restaurants and bars nearby, of course - the Algonquin right next door, for example. I'll definitely return to the Iroquois for future stays!

Clean comfortable rooms, for a great price.. Professional service,and then some !!! Accessible to all the hot spots of New York.. There was always someone alert, and willing to assist with all sorts of questions..

I was very pleased with this stay. NYC has many hotels to choose from, but, this is one of the tops! The location is absolutely ideal. There are so many restaurants to chose from near the hotel. Times Square is a short walk as well. The room was nice and tastefully decorated. It also has a large bathroom. Highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed at the Iroquois for three nights and couldn't rate this place highly enough. The staff couldn't be more friendly or helpful, the rooms were typically small (as expected in New York) but very nice and the Molton Brown toiletries were a nice touch. If we wanted to be in the midtown area on our next visit would definitely stay here again, and would be happy to recommend to any friends too.

Great place to stay. Right location to reach all venues for tourists. Quiet, respectable street. Room abit small but worked fine for me. Felt very comfortable, turndown and maid service wonderful, available services exceptional. Classy in all respects. Amenities, food and beverage, staff, concierge services really went the extra mile for us in every way imaginable. Detailed services, very accommodating as needed.

At 2 blocks from times square, a great Services, coffee in the lobby, the rooms are the vest thing that i saw in the hotel, like a movie with the snow ouside and me in the room, warm and safety hahaha, the housekeepers are so comfortable, the rooms has great lighting , good tv, the bathroom is giant and so pretty. I all so i return

What a pleasure, from check-in to check-out the entire staff treated us like royalty. One of the great old New York hotels - completely upgraded, but still with the "grand old hotel" feel. Couldn't ask for a better location - within walking distance to theaters, great restaurants, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc.Will definitely stay at the Iroquois on our next New York trip.

It was my wife's birthday so we decided to go to New York City to celebrate. After lots of Trip Advisor research I chose the Iroquois Hotel for our stay and play hotel. I wanted a junior suite and 2 attached bedrooms (our 45 year old son was joining us) so I needed a room to have cocktails and hang out. The experience of the hotel was perfect. Everyone from the reservation manager, Mercedes Kerr, before we even showed up to Rocky who carried our luggage, the personnel could not be more helpful. We did not want a "cold" big hotel weekend. We wanted a small feeling, warm and accomodating "loving energy" feel for our experience. Everyone we had any contact with was gracious and delightful. We couldn't be happier.

The staff was incredible. Hotel clean and very convenient to TIme Square, Rockefeller Center & a nice walk to Central Park. The bed was so comfortable and the room darkening shades were awesome! Would definitely return when we visit NYC again.

We checked into a Superior Double Room. Certainly not the largest room in the world, but certainly well equipped and adequate. Front desk staff was superb. I loved the complimentary coffee in the lobby. More importantly I loved the location. The hotel was perfectly tucked away from the busy sounds of NYC, yet close enough that you could be in Time's Square within moments. Very pleased and will return!

Wonderful rooms and terrific service. People are incredibly friendly, and willing to do anything to make you comfortable. My hotel of preference in NYC. Great location - close to Times Square, Bryant Park, and great restaurants.

Haven't been to The Iroquois in several years. Love this hotel because of the location, friendliness of staff from the Manager, front desk, housekeeping, and front door staff and for the comforts they provide.It is cozy and elegant at the same time. The hotel bar and Triomphe restaurant have always been exceptional. We always recommend it and will continue to go back.Thank You to everyone at The Iroquois!!

The hotel is well located and easy to find. The front desk staff were always incredibly friendly and helpful. I was impressed with the room, everything was immaculate and well maintained. We did wish the flat screen TVs had HDMI ports so we could have used our Chromecast, but that's a minor complaint. Also, the only window in our room faced a brick wall, but it turned out to create an incredibly dark night that had us sleeping like babies.Being so close to Times Square was wonderfully. We could get around easily to all of our destinations and there were great dining options nearby. The concierge made great recommendations for options during our short stay and we were very satisfied with the experience.My only complaint was regarding the shower - the fixtures were very hard to control making the water temperature difficult to manage. It quickly went from too hot to too cold without a lot of room for minute adjustments. Overall, thought, I'd highly recommend The Iroquois and would stay there again.

This is a great location, close to Times square, Rockefeller center, Broadway shows and subway. Rooms in NY are not big, but the bedding was luxurious, the room and hotel were beautifully styled, and the staff showed a nice combination of classy and casual. They give a break on Sunday rates, which accounted for the good "value".

A wonderful hotel with lots of character and extremely friendly staff! The beds were very comfortable and the room was big and beautiful. The location was perfect! We will definately return! Thank you!

We have stayed at the Iroquois many times and we are always treated to a lovely stay. The rooms are clean, friendly staff and interesting drinks in the bar. The location is good and parking right across the street.

Hotel`s location was great (near etc. Grand Central Terminal and Bryant Park)and staff was very helpfull and friendly. Room was little bit small (three girls and shopping bags in two queen size superior room ;) ) but it was clean.

This was my third visit to NYC and I spent many hours / weekends researching Hotels on Trip Advisor and their websites before deciding on the Iroquois based on previous reviews, amenities offered and their location.Jizelle and Lisa in reservations were extremely helpful and very prompt in replying to my emails when enquiring re availability, room choices and then ultimately making my booking. We were a group of five ladies staying and had booked an executive king suite interconnecting with a deluxe king (making it a 2 bedroom suite). The executive suite had a very roomy king bedroom with a separate lounge room that housed a pullout sofa and this room interconnected with a deluxe king bed room. This hotel is in a great central location, two blocks walk from Times Square and midpoint if wanting to travel downtown or uptown walking or on the subway. I found all the staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful and we used the Concierge services quite a bit during our stay for their knowledge and recommendations.I have rated this hotel as Excellent due to central location, great staff, cleanliness, quality of rooms, plenty of amenities and I paid a very reasonable nightly rate for my stay.I am travelling to NYC in February next year and will choose to stay at the Iroquois again if available.

The location is excellent, a 2 minute walk from 5th Avenue, 5 minute walk from Times Square. There is a diner a few doors down which is great for breakfast.Clean and luxurious rooms, small but no smaller than what I'd expect for NYC. We were offered an upgrade of our room but were more than happy with the room we were allocated at check in. Gym has the basics and we enjoyed use of the sauna.The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, particularly the concierge who are more than happy to recommend some of their favourite places and make reservations, something which is always helpful in such a big city. I will stay here again when I return.

Quiet elegant hotel in an ideal location. Wonderful staff and the rooms are lovely and comfortable. Lots of charm - not a corporate box wonderful staff. Milton brown toiletries. A stay here is luxurious.

Very clean comfortable hotel, rooms are well kept and luxurious, a little dim with only lamps but no problem. Ny times every morning and coffee in the lobby. Located halfway between grand central and times square, walking distance to all the tourist attractions. Travelled with my daughter for her birthday treat and this hotel was one of the few I manhattan that had twin rooms available, actually 2 doubles but perfect for us, Excellent

This was our second stay at The Iroquois and once again the hotel delivered a good experience. Our room was small but comfortable and if you turned your head the right way, you could see the Chrysler Building. The staff are friendly and helpful. The location is good - it's a long but manageable walk to the park and very close to Grand Central Station, Times Square, and not far from shopping. For a cheap but good breakfast, go down the street to The Red Flame, and spare your wallet the pain of the hotel breakfast costs.

We booked this hotel because of its convenient location in an elite block. The friendliness and hospitality of the entire staff is incredible. Robert, the manager, goes to great lengths to see that you are enjoying your stay and that his staff is living up to his expectations for great service. The restaurant is very good, although the menu is limited. We will definitely return.

Do not hesitate in booking this hotel! Not only is the location fabulous (4 mins walk to Times Square and 2 mins walk from 5th ave but on a great side street) but a small oldy worldly hotel where all the staff know yr name n greet you like friends

Small Lux Hotel - 6-7th visit to The Iroquois over the past several years. Nice central location for Theater goers and discounts can be had if interested. There are probably similar hotels if one wants to be uptown or at the South end of the island.The restaurant in the hotel is exceptional.

I've stayed at this hotel so many times that I've lost count. The room is always very clean, comfortable and much luxurious than most other hotels in the city. The value is great! The staff really shines. The food is remarkable (although I wish there were a greater variety of selections). And, most of all, I get reward points for every stay. I've accumulated enough for several free nights! Highly recommended!!

Great location and fantastic staff. We have stayed at the hotel on a number of occasions and are always warmly welcomed on our return. The hotel is very comfortable and the staff are extremely accommodating. This is always our first choice for a place to stay in NYC.

We just returned from staying a week at the Iroquois hotel. What a great experience! The location couldn't be any better; close enough to walk to all the venues but far enough away to be quiet. We even walked to Central Park from the hotel! Had a great night sleep every night since the hotel is very quiet. Staff were friendly and helpful. Everyday they had smiles and had genuine conversations with us. When I reported a noisy heating fan, they fixed it by the time we returned from our day touring the city. They brought the bar fridge to our room with in ten minutes or less. The complimentary cider and coffee in the foyer was a nice touch. We were also able to print our plane boarding passes on their computers/printers. Rooms were very clean. The toiletries smell great and didn't dry your skin. The only downfall, if you want to call it that, was that we didn't have a view from the window. However, we were only there to get some sleep, clean up and relax before heading back out. We would totally stay there again.

We stayed for 4 nights and have found our new favorite NYC HOTEL. Romantic, elegant, friendly and clean. Room was small but very well laid out. We will be staying at the Iriqouis again. Since it is about 2 blocks east of the Times Square craziness, it is quiet and jus two short blocks to Bryant Park.

I stayed 2 nights in this hotel. Location is great and staff is so friendly and helpful ( especially Selim, the receptionist ). The rooms are big enough and very clean. I highly recommend this hotel for the travellers planning to have a couple of nights in New York / Times Square. The only comment could be about the breakfast. They might have more options like cheese, tomato etc. for the visitors coming from meditarrenean countries.

The Iroquois Hotel is a little jewel in the heart of Midtown. The staff is welcoming, courteous. and accommodating. The ambiance is warm and inviting. The location is perfect for easy access to theaters and museums.

Clean, elegant, comfortable. The thick towels, beautiful bathrobes, and a library like comfortable section of the lobby. The location is nothing short of brilliant for a midtown hotel. it is so easy to go anywhwere. The staff is sinmply fantastic

The Hotel has really good service, I think it's the best feature of the hotel. Specially the front desk and bellboys were very helpful. Room was quiet and clean, but tiny. We had a double queen room. The room needs a little update and it was quite dark, but the atmosphere was nice. Location is almost perfect especially if you want to stay in the Times Square are. Iroquois is close to major attractions and restaurants so it's easy to walked everywhere. Overall i'm satisfied with our stay in the hotel.

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel other than the pillows. We do not use down or foam, and had requested no down in our res. However when we got there the only other choice were very old and unusable polyester.

Another great stay at the Iroquois for my daughter and me, for one of our overnights to the city. I always feel like I a coming "home"when I stay at this hotel. From the moment I enter the small, classy lobby, see the complementary coffee, and the quaint library off the lobby, I feel like I am welcomed and comfortable. The room ( superior 2 Queens) was very clean and spacious enough for the two of us. The rooms are not large but fine by NYC standards. The bathroom is beautiful and immaculate, with lovely amenities. The bed was so comfortable, perhaps the best bed I've had at a hotel in recent years. The staff couldn't be more helpful- Roman, Selim and Patrick at the front desk were each so kind and provided attentive service with smiles and eagerness. They each made me feel as if they will remember me at my next visit ( which I have already booked for April) which is one of the criteria I appreciate the most in a hotel stay, and one that can be rare at a hotel in such a busy city. Jessica, who was my server for breakfast at Triomphe (delicious), was lovely and friendly. Rocky and Zac were attentive and helpful with my bags and my car. The Concierge ( Andrew?) was also very kind and helpful recommending nearby places to eat, even insisting on walking outside to show me when to walk around the corner to a particular restaurant. This hotel, with it's great location (quiet street but close to Times Square, Bryant park, Rockafeller center) , kind staff, immaculate classy presentation make this my easy favorite in NYC.

Friendly and helpful staff. Fine, smaller hotel. Perhaps our best hotel experience ever. Great location for Theatre District and 5th Ave strolling. Very comfortable room. Morning coffee in the lobby. Lovely.

Conveniently located to most of the attractions. Beautiful, old-style architecture. Rooms are on the smaller side but perfectly outfitted for travel, especially for business travel for one person. Friendly and helpful staff.

Perfect hotel near Times Square and all the Broadway shows. The hotel is near all the action but on a nice quiet street. Hotel staff and concierge are very helpful! Rooms are small but comfortable. Offer nightly shoe shine service. In the morning they offer hot coffee in the lobby and afternoon evenings there is hot cider. There is a nice library with newspapers, computers and comfy chairs to meet up and plan your day. Tucked away in the back off the lobby is a wonderful hidden treasure "Lantern's Keep" Bar ... Be sure to visit and enjoy one of many handcrafted cocktails! A wonderful small luxury hotel you will not be disappointed!

We are hooked on the Iroquois and stay there every time we come to NYC, about 4 times a year. The appearance, location and the amenities are hard to beat for the price. The lounge off the lobby with the computers and the Sunday Times is an extra bonus.
user_name:
bhnf
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is well placed and the personnel were very pleasant and courteous. My friend really enjoyed her sleep on the bed. I used airline miles to pay for the room. The room had one king sized bed and a good amount of room for the city.

Excellent location and great deal for price. The hotel manager and restaurant manager are on site and deal with any issues promptly and effectively. Rooms are boutique size but comfortable with great beds! Quiet and cozy bars and restaurant.

We very much enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Iroquois. The location is great and the staff is very friendly! If we travel back to New York City, we'll probably stay there again. Thanks so much to everyone at the hotel.

Perfect hotel very near Times Square but far enough from the madness. A large selection of subway stations nearby. Hotel staff very friendly, room although a bit on the small side was perfect. Beds really comfortable. Great diner for breakfast a couple of doors down Red Flame Diner. Will definitely stay again on our next visit.

The staff at the Iroquois was absolutely fantastic. room was great, the location is great for both business and pleasure. the only disappointment is the fitness center, tiny and not enough of the right equipment for a good workout.

Booked this hotel for my stay after reading the really good reviews it had.The reviews are true to the word. This a great hotel with really good service. Just spent four nights at the hotel and found the staff very helpful, with a special mention to the concierge staff, one in particular is Vanessa who is the font of all knowledge and nothing is too much trouble. Hot coffee on tap in the foyer during the day and a hot cider waiting when you walk in during the evening after a cold March shopping and sightseeing day. This is not a large hotel but the room was good and the bed even better. Never once disturbed or heard any street notice. I would definitely come back to this hotel, it is perfectly located and the service was brilliant.

Had a wonderful time staying here this week. The staff could not have done more for us. Everyone was so friendly. The room was pleasant and cosy - and quiet. (We were in 705). The complimentary coffee/hot cider in the foyer was most welcome with subzero temperatures outside, and the doormen were always ready to help us in or out with luggage etc. And we had free WiFi to back up our million photos every evening.We ate in the restaurant once and the food was pricy but fabulous. I mean fabulous.The location cannot be beaten - two blocks from Time Square (in British terms - not very far at all!) and Fifth Avenue is at the end of the street half a block away. Walk down Fifth Avenue one way for Rockefeller, and the other way for Empire State, Macy's and the Chrysler Building. Grand Central is nearby and you can get the big red tour bus (recommended!) from Times Square, a ten minute stroll away. For the keener walker, Central Park is not too far up Fifth Avenue, and for the very keen (us!) you could walk right down to the very tip of Manhattan - but better to get the bus or subway! Restaurants all round, a great traditional diner next door but one (Red Flame Diner) and plenty of places for coffee/dinner. It was all happening right there yet the room and hotel felt like a little luxurious world of tranquility.I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and for the outstanding service you got I think the price was pretty reasonable too.

Great hotel, close to everything we wanted to do. Had a great stay. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Would definitely recommend a stay here. We will be back soon!

The hotel was very convenient. Only several blocks to Times Square. A comfortable walk. Hotel restaurant was pricey and limited. Hotel bar was small. Room was very nice. Had a large stain on the carpet. Bed was comfortable. Room was very warm and thermostat did not work. Complained to staff but it was never corrected during our entire stay.

We were pleased with this hotel. The staff was friendly and the rooms clean. Our room was quite hot and we had to open a window. The food was very expensive and we didn't buy there. Overall, we recommend.

Excellent trip in a wonderful hotel : the quality of the rooms is high and also the great level of serviceThe hotel has an ideal location near every facilities : subway, touristic sights and different accodamations

My wife and I spent four days in the Iroquois earlier this month. While our room was not large, it was kept clean and neat, and its central location allowed us to travel throughout the city. The service was excellent, the concierges were very helpful, and the Lanterns Keep Bar in the hotel was exceptional. We certainly would consider staying there again.

We loved our stay at The Iroquois! We were so close to Times Square and Rockefeller Center but far enough that it's peaceful at the hotel. Quiet and comfort abounds! Clean, friendly, and beautiful! Thank you so much!

I stayed here for a fun weekend with friends. We had two connecting rooms, and a sitting room with a sofa bed. The rooms were very comfortable. The bathrooms were nice, and had great lighting! The staff was excellent, they helped us find amazing places to eat in the city. The doormen were wonderful and welcoming. The location is perfect – you are minutes from times square, a short walk to central park, right by 5th avenue shopping. Its also close to the port authority bus terminal (if you are coming or going via train/bus).

I got to NY early and Alex was happy to check me in so I could get to my meeting. The front staff and concierge went above and beyond to help me. The room was beautiful and the bed was so comfortable I fell right asleep. Great location for work and walking to Times Square.

The hotel and dining experience was very good as captured in the comments. The food was excellent. The rooms are small. The desk is too small to really do business work. There is a need for more up to date connections for cell phones, computers etc. The mattress is too soft for people who require a firm mattress for their back.

The hotel had all the ambiance we were looking for.The location was perfect for going to the theaters, art museums and anywhere else.The restaurant was a pleasant surprise with it's great food and service.

Two lady friends and I had a king suite --- a large bedroom with comfortable king bed, and a sitting room with a sofa bed --- perfect. Vanessa, the concierge, was friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. Alex in the small bar (there are 2 bars) was not only very friendly, but an expert in "mixology". The entire staff from the front desk to the doormen were always helpful and efficient. Location was perfect, especially for Times Square, but also for touring -- metro 2 blocks away. A real find, and a definite choice for future stays

Overall a good experience. Room was on the tenth floor with a glimpse of 44 st. Nice and quiet. Very comfortable bed. Great location and well maintained property. Bar closes a bit early (11p.m.) weeknights.

The best 5 days we have spent in the city in the past 15 years due to the hotel accommodations and staff that was very helpful in all aspects of our trip. from the free newspapers to the free videos and help in getting directions and cabs at hard time was great.

For being so close to Times Square, this hotel was surprisingly quiet! I heard nothing in my room all night. The room was spacious and well appointed. The only complaint I have is that I struggled to find a plug accessible to charge my phone. Other than that, I was very pleased and would highly recommend this hotel. The front desk was very attentive and the check-in process was efficient.
user_name:
Debra B
New York City, New York

review_body: Nicely refurbished, well managed small hotel with an excellent restaurant and location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Much more fun than a large hotel. Rooms nicely decorated.  Will definitely come again.

Great hotel, great service, great location to Time Square, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, Theater District. Rooms clean, new and quite. Great service from bellmen to cleaning personnel. Will be back.

Stayed at the Iroquois while in NYC for business - client chose hotel and could not be more pleased with selection. Excellent location and even more fantastic cocktail bar. Will definitely recommend to colleagues.

My three-night stay at the Iroquois was wonderful! The staff was pleasant, professional and helpful. The room was comfortable and nicely decorated. The food was outstanding! Because of the location of the hotel, we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. The location is perfect for the theater and all the highlights of mid-town Manhattan. The Iroquois will be my first choice on my next trip to New York!

We stayed in a Premium King room and it was a nice size and had a nice layout. The room was very clean which is a priority.The staff was wonderful. Everyone we encountered was very friendly and personable. Since we were going to a 2:00 show, we had arrived early, around noon, and stopped by the hotel to check our luggage. Our room was ready and we were very appreciative that we were able to check in and relax before heading back out to our show. This was our second stay at the Iroquois and would stay there again when we return to NYC. It is in a great location!

Booked for 3 nights before a Bahamas cruise. Enjoyed our stay, the hotel is in a fantastic location and the staff the most helpful I have ever encountered. After the cruise the hotel looked after our bags (for a small charge) rather than spend a whole day waiting at the airport. I would definitely stay here again.

We came to New York for a weekend getaway and really enjoyed our time at the Iroquois! The room was great and the staff was very helpful! Dinner at Triomphe was super (especially when it was 12 degrees outside!) Vanessa and Bill at the concierge desk helped us with several great restaurant recommendations and transportation arrangements to a concert in Newark. Sofien, the bartender at Triomphe, was there before and after the concert with a few snacks and expertly crafted drinks! All of the staff were helpful and considerate.When we return to New York, Iroquois will be our first choice!

The Iroquois is perfectly situated for easy walking to Madison Square Garden, shopping, shows, and superb dining. The hotel is excellent: clean, well appointed, very elegant. The staff was pleasant, accomodating, helpful and professional. You cannot go wrong staying at the Iroquois.

We recently stayed for four nights in an Executive Suite. It was four of us, three adults and one child. The hotel is located just minutes (waking) from Times Square and the theatre district. Check in was effortless and we had prearranged a birthday gift for one of our party to be in the room when we first entered. It was there as promised. The executive suite is a living room with TV and sofa bed which is separated from the king bedroom by a door. King room has its own TV and a comfortable sitting chair. The bathroom is on the small side but has a separate shower and nice jetted tub. The room was extremely clean and very nice. We were on floor 7 and our view was facing the Chrysler building. There are only two elevators in the hotel but never had to wait long. The staff without exception are first class and they really do take pride in the hotel. The bar is nice and intimate. We tried room service twice and were very pleased. The queen sofa bed was used by one in our group and it surpassed many of the sofa beds we have used. Sofa bed has memory foam and not a mattress so it is supporting and comfortable. The king bed is incredibly comfortable.There is a relatively small but well equipped fitness room that serves it's purpose. The concierge was nice and helpful. If you prefer small intimate boutique hotels with superior service with excellent location, then look no further. We had high expectations of this hotel and all were met with most being exceeded. This is a very well managed hotel with staff that actually like to work there.I read in other reviews that the thermostat in each room is controlled by the front desk. This is only partly true in that it appears each room has a locked range of temperatures you can control by the room thermostat. We used this with no problem. If you need a larger range of control you just have to ask the front desk. We will definitely stay here when we go back to NYC.

This was a really good place to stay in midtown. Allowed us walk everywhere, was nice and quiet for sleeping (we were on the back of the hotel away from the street), comfortable bed, nice and clean. The decor is a little tired but that's minor. Staff was friendly without being too in your face which was nice.The Lantern's Keep bar makes good, unusual cocktails - but it's tiny so if you want a seat either go early or make a reservation. Also it only opens at 6 on Saturdays so if you want an afternoon pre-theatre/dinner cocktail you'll have to look elsewhere.

This was my second stay at this beautiful hotel (first stay was about 3 years ago). It is perfectly located in relation to all the Broadway shows/plays and numerous sites of the city. It's just off of Times Square, but far enough out of the way so you're not right in the middle of the chaos! There truly is nothing bad to say about this hotel! Extremely clean rooms, polite and helpful staff and most comfortable beds!!!! It is quite pricey and even though I'm giving it an "Excellent" rating for value, I was lucky enough for this stay to book back in November during their Cyber Monday sale. It's worth the full price, but no one likes to pay full price!

We loved our stay at the Iroquois. Perfect NYC location for Times Square and close to subway for transportation to most other NY activities. Beautiful hotel, quiet, helpful staff and large comfortable rooms for reasonable rates. We would definitely recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

The hotel was by and large fine and got a great rate through Orbitz for under $140 for three days in February... The room wasn't the largest (almost no space besides the bed for working at the desk) but couldn't complain about size for the rate. Everyone at the hotel was friendly as well and kindly gave me a street facing room rather than a wall which is what I'd requested. There was a couple of niggles though, where I believe that a hotel which has the latest automated charging minibar could certain do with tea / coffee making facilities as well. The safe didn't work (although I didn't complain about this as I didn't need it), no slippers and finally not the greatest shower pressure...I do believe that it's these details which could set things apart at a four star establishment like this especially compared to all its neighbours, which I've stayed in as well (Royalton, Sofitel...).But given the rate that I got, no complaints for this time... I would think twice however should it be what it usually is for New York which is double or even triple for a room like this.

We enjoyed our stay from start to finish (alas only one night). Staff was very friendly, helpful and professional. Our room was small but was a good value for such a great hotel. Parking directly across street is affordable by NY standards.

Everything was great about our stay. Great location just minutes from Times Square but away from the hustle and bustle. Everyone was very friendly, I loved the coffee and apple cider in the lobby and the library to relax in. I was worried we'd be woken up all night by the elevator right outside our room but never heard a sound. Great experience, would stay again.

My wife and I had a great albeit short stay here in November 2013. The lobby is really quite neatand well appointed. The neighbourhood is great and the restaurants nearby are excellent. The Red Flame is a great diner and where we went for breakfast. The Kellari had great greck food for a reasonable price and it was just a few doors down the street as well. Our room at te Iroquiss was spacious. They had a small bottle of red wine out to welcome us. The bathroom was sparkling clean and well appointed. I was very impressed by the gym. It was larger than I expected and had up to date equipment. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is convenient to many landmarks (e.g. the NY Public Library) and the subway.

Excellent reasonably priced mid town hotel in the busy 44th St area. Rooms are of a decent size and the amenities are very good. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. We didn't try the cocktail bar, but the free coffee/cider in the lobby is a nice touch too.

Loved our stay at the Iroquois! While everyone was helpful the valet a busy Saturday night went above and beyond to get us a taxi. The larger hotel next door was getting all the taxis so he ran to the cross street to get one for us! Beds were extremely comfortable and the room was quiet even though we were near an elevator! Would stay here again!

Just back from a getaway weekend in New York. My wife and I chose The Iroquois based to a great extent based on Tripadvisor ratings. I prefer to stay at smaller intimate hotels. I almost always find them to have more charm and character. If the price is more or less the same, why not stay somewhere interesting? The Iroquois is all the foregoing. This late 19th century lovely boutique hotel is situated very close to the hubbub and excitement of Times Square (though to tell the truth, I was not aware of this at the time of booking). From the moment we walked in, we experienced just the right amount of guest attention. The staff was gracious and professional, but also very friendly and not stuffy in any way. In a word, we felt genuinely welcome. We booked a deluxe room, which I think means it is a corner room with a slightly bigger floor plan and two windows. Our room was very slightly tight, as you often find in these older buildings. I don't really take that as a negative, just part of the deal. Our room was impeccably clean, with very nice linens, towels, a wonderful king mattress and superb quality feather pillows. The bathroom was generously sized, and completely tiled in marble. The bathroom could use a bit of a freshening up, as it was decorated with gold accents which do not feel terribly contemporary, and these fittings were also showing their age. A small quibble. High points: Really wonderful staff, very comfortable room, lovely charming old historic building. Also you must try The Lantern's Keep, the on-site "speakeasy" bar. Absolutely amazing cocktails.Less high point: I found the street noise a bit annoying. I have stayed in NY on a number of occasions and the big city noise is always present. Having the room on the front of a nearly 120 year old building meant the noise at night was a little more present. This is one of those "it is what it is" things, certainly not a deal-breaker, but if you are sensitive to street noise, perhaps pack some earplugs.

Ideal midtown location and very attentive staff. The fold out sofa bed was comfortable for our 2 kids. The concierge was very helpful for dinner reservations and show tickets. The car service recommended by the hotel was pricey but worth it.

I love this hotel! The location: two blocks from Times Square, the Theater District and footsteps from Fifth Ave and NYC dining; can't be beat. Though a small cozy jewel in the heart of the big apple with excellent service and very comfortable and cozy rooms, Iroquois further excels with a to notch restaurant: Triumph; and the retro small yet superb Lanterns Keep cocktail bar

Great old school NYC Hotel - Always like staying here. Rooms are clean. comfortable and the front desk staff always welcoming and pleasant. If you need to have a meal though, I would suggest taking advantage of the 1,000's of restaurants available in NYC - Service was poor and servers aloof, almost as if I was inconveniencing them as a customer. Overall, this is a wonderful little hotel that brings back the charm of old NYC.

What more could you want from a New York hotel?Right from the outset check in was professional but friendly. We had a couple of very minor issues with our room (phone and WiFi weren't working), both problems were resolved immediately.Location is great (one block from both Fifth Avenue and Times Square).In short couldn't recommend highly enough. Will definitely be out choice when we go back to New York.

We returned to the Iroquois and enjoyed 3 wonderful nights there. Although the rooms were small, they were very quiet . Being a small hotel, we appreciated its warmth and cosy feel. I will be back. It's location makes this the ideal hotel to enjoy NYC.

Location cannot be beat if you are planning on going to several shows. Lovely hotel and lovely staff. Easy access to the subway running on both east and west side of town. Hell's Kitchen is walkable and offers several affordable dining options.

We took advantage of a cyber monday deal so we got the room upgraded and at half price. It was well worth it. It is closer to time square that I would have liked, but it is really removed from the traffic and actually quite a quiet street.But since we were so central, we could walk to museums and our play and take subway conveniently.Hotel was great - I had the premium king - spacious room, comfortable,clean etc. No complaints there - everything you would expect from a luxury hotel - but a bit more personal than the big chain hotel. People were courteous etc.Had we paid regular price, my ratings may have gone down a bit - not because of the hotel itself or anything, just because of the value of the money. But since we got such a good deal, it exceeded our expectations.

My reservation was for two double beds. The room was so small, it did not have a place for my suitcase. The front desk was very nice but I had to upgrade to a kingbed @ $30 more per night.. The increased cost made the hotel not a good value.

Great overnight stay! Wife and I enjoyed a relaxing and comfortable stay at the Iroquois. John at the front desk was a pleasure to deal with, friendly and attentive. Room was clean, location is excellent. Strongly recommend.

Wonderful!!  Great hotel , friendly staff, perfect location and worth every penny! Would totally go back to this hotel again .... I never booked through Travelocity before but would definitely do again. It was quiet, calm, peaceful to come back to after the very busy city of New York! This was a great spot to b because you could walk to so many eat spots without subway or taxi :)

The hotel is a lovely boutique property. The room was small, but it had everything I needed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I had breakfast in the lobby at the Triomphe restaurant, which is lovely and the food was very good. The location of the hotel is great, walking distance to the Times Square but far enough to get away from the noise. Very close to the Brynt park. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

The Iroquois is very comfortable and conveniently located for theatre, Bryant Park, public transport. The double room type we stayed in (for the second time in two years) felt homey and provided a relaxing respite. Room service was a rather bad joke. The neatly framed menu provided on the desk was out of date, which baffled the attendant and us as well. Who knew to look inside the key folio to find a miniature menu? Ordering was a tedious ordeal, with multiple reviews of our selection. After all that, when the food was delivered several items were missing, and one item was burned. It took three other calls and trips by the server to get it right.

The staff were warm & friendly. Rooms were immaculate and comfy! Loved the Milton Brown soaps! Bathroom was especially clean and nice. Great location. 2 blocks from the center of midtown/Times Square. Would highly recommend!
user_name:
Steven613123
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent location and great beds. Friendly and serviceminded staff.I would also recommend the little Bistro on the left hand side of 44th street a block away from the hotel when you walk towards Time Square. Great lamb shank!

The Iroquois is a . The rooms are small. Service is excellent, starting from the room service to the hotel reception and the staff. I was given room 404 which faces 44th street and is was a noisy room. I was then moved to room 209 (rear room) which had a window overlooking a wall but was quite.Sleep quality is very good.the heating system is central and there is no individual control in the room. I was terribly hot. I asked the front desk to reduce the temperature in the room and it worked out very well. There is a small, but well equipped fitness center in the hotel.Overall, the Iroquois is a good hotel and a good value for the price. I would come again!

I don't know what size the room was. All I know is that when I sat on the desk chair in one corner, I was crushed by the bed on one side and the drinks bar on my back. I wanted to sit on my desk chair outside of the corner. I had to lift the heavy chair over the drinks bar or just roll it along the bed mattress.Our view room looked out on all the exhaust pipes coming from nearby buildings. Service is really nice and everybody who worked there was pleasant. My room was clean. But even for New York the size was underwhelming and claustrophobia inducing.

Was in the city for business, this was my first stay and my first impression exceeded my expectations, it is was cute, comfortable and beautiful. Extremely satisfied and highly recommended, I look forward to my next stay.

This hotel is great value for the money with a convenient location and excellent staff who are more than happy to help with city information, restaurant suggestions, travel and accommodation requests.The rooms are clean, extremely comfortable and a pleasure to return to after a day in the city. I would also recommend the hotel restaurant, Triomphe. The food is fantastic and the staff friendly, professional and accommodating.

Rooms are small, but the entire hotel is small and intimate. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, helpful at every turn! On the phone, by email, in person. We were impressed with every person with whom we came in contact.

A classic New York boutique hotel in an outstanding Midtown location. The hotel bar is a great meeting spot, and the rooms are cozy and comfortable, with great linens and toiletries. You can't do much better for a NY trip than the Iroquois!

I REALLY enjoyed a top-notch on all fronts experience at Hotel Iroquois. Both the hotel staff and restaurant staff leave me with great memories of busy Manhattan. Chat a bit with Chef Florian if you get the chance--fascinating guy!!
user_name:
George T
Vancouver, Washington, United States

review_body: My girlfriend and I were in the city for a quick getaway and stayed here at the recommendation of friends. We loved the hotel. It is beautiful inside and the rooms were very comfortable and charming. The staff was some of the friendliest and helpful I have ever encountered when staying in NYC. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean and are well maintained and updated. The hotel was conveniently located just a little more than a block from time square and a short distance to the Rockefeller center, Radio City, Bryant Park and numerous Subway stations. It is located between 6th and 5th avenue so you are right there for 5th avenue shopping. Upon our arrival we were greeted right away and were upgraded to a king size room. Our room was a little chilly one night as we were there during a storm. We mentioned that to the front desk and within minutes they delivered additional blankets for us. We plan to stay here again in the future.

Everything about our stay, which was the 3rd in four years, was outstanding. This is one of the nicest and best run hotels we have stayed in in many years. The staff, the facility and the location near the theater district make this the perfect place to stay in NY.

Recently had a Fri night stay at the Iroquois. As with other hotels, rates are lower on weekends (including Fridays) than during the wk. The minute you walk in, there's a classic air of old NY. Everyone was helpful and efficient from reception, concierge (a big plus for guests), service staff. Didn't eat here but had glorious wine at the bar. excellent selection; excellent service. The Iroquois is in a great location, easy walking distance to Times Square, theaters, Bryant Park, Rock Ctr, 5th Ave shopping and Grand Central, if you don't have much luggage. Wintertime in NYC and walking in and out of ice and snow is not easy, but the sidewalks around the area of the hotel were clear and well maintained. No views from our room; we were on the 4th floor in a quiet location. Room was great, beds super comfortable, bath small but well appointed and stocked with lovely toiletries. If you crave something beyond the commercial and sterile Hilton's or Marriott's of the world, this hotel is a great choice to feel personalized, classy service and style.

Just returned from my weekend in NY at the Iroquois. My husband and I stayed there this past weekend to celebrate my birthday. We had stayed at the Iroquois a few years ago and enjoyed it then, so we returned. We stayed in an executive King suite. It was very roomy by NY standards. The marble bathroom was stunning.
