The room, the bathroom and everything we saw in the hotel was spotless! Very clean! In fact, one morning as we were leaving our room, we encountered an employee with a paint can. He was touching up trim in the hallway. My impression is that they work very hard at keeping up this property - and it shows. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We did not encounter one person that was not wearing a smile and was not completely pleasant. Because it was my birthday, they left a small bottle of wine and box of chocolates in the room and gave me birthday greetings on check in and check out. This was really nice! The location of this hotel is perfect, in my opinion. Walking distance to all the theaters in times square as well as Rockefeller Center and Central Park. The street the hotel is on is out of the fray and pretty quiet which makes for a good night's sleep. I took the advice of fellow Trip Advisor reviewers and tried Gregory's Coffee Shop across the street. Oh my gosh! The coffee is so wonderful! Went there twice in one day! There is also a great diner a couple of doors down called the Red Flame. Very good service and food was great. You can also easily walk to the Magnolia Bakery on 49th and try the famous cupcakes. I can't wait to return to NYC and will definitely stay at the Iroquois again!

I stayed at the Iroquois recently for 3 evenings over a weekend. From entering the Hotel the check in clerk was very helpful, extremely nice and pleasant, I can't recall his name, but think it was Samit? the Hotel is quite small in the Lobby but has a really cool small Bar and Restaurant at the front and another restaurant at the back. I did not eat there but had a few quiet beverages in the evening at the front bar.The room was very small, as often with these older hotels, however very comfortable bed, I slept very well, nice bathroom and nothing too far from the dual elevators.The hotel is located a short block from the ToysRus store at times square, and the Broadway subway station. Also, only a short few blocks stroll the Rockefeller Centre and up to Central park.Many great shows running very close by as well.I would recommend this hotel, and this area as great to stay at, especially if you only have a small amount of time and want to see some shows, eat some good food and do some shopping.

This hotel is on the same block as the famed Algonquin, Harvard Club and Yale Club. The outside is unassuming and the lobby is small, but the staff are very attentive and welcoming. We got a pair of double bed rooms and they were fairly cramped for 4 people - but very little time is usually spent in a room in NYC. The noise on the 8th floor came from the street and nowhere else. Only trouble was that old hotels do not dissipate heat so when it came to lowering the temperature at night for sleep, it wasn't possible. Shower was good and plenty of pressure. Fixtures in the bath were certainly not chintzy. Nice flat screen TV and lots of channels. Beds good and we got decent sleep.As for location, it is 2 blocks from Times Square and near lots of restaurants and things to do.

Very nice hotel. Staff was particularly friendly and helpful.The heat in our room was challenging to regulate -- fortunately, the windows open. Not a big deal but it's tough to give 5 dots.Also, the rooms are on the small side. But it's NY, right?

friendly.... Very small rooms, but after accepting that.. the experience was very favorable. Comfortable and clean beds (which is so important) and very quiet in New York city! Try to upgrade to larger room, as it will make your stay much more enjoyable. Concierge Bill was very helpful...

Great location in Midtown Manhattan. Nice boutique hotel with extra friendly staff. Arrived on red eye flight for Super Bowl and got to hotel around 630AM to drop bags off and low and behold they let us check into our room at that time to get a little rest,awesome! While only a block or so from Times Square the rooms facing 44th st were actually relatively quiet. Would definitely stay here again

Staff is always polite and courteous. I stay here frequently on business. The location of the hotel is convenient and the rooms are very quiet and comfortable. I recommend this hotel to others frequently.

Birthday weekend in NYC. Great location, right off of Times Square, which, being Super Bowl Sunday got a little loud in the evenings. Staff was very attentive, bed very comfy, hot water for showers. We'll be back!

The Iroquis delivered as it promised - quiet boutique hotel charm a stone’s throw from Times Square. I went for 5 nights with my mum to show her the sights and needed somewhere comfy, central and friendly, with an element of the stylish about it. Iroquois was great; staff were welcoming and helpful as we often had bags we needed help carrying, and forthcoming with advice on local restaurants and how best to get where we were going. Our room was super comfy with a spotlessly clean bathroom and insanely luxurious beds; I hadn’t slept so well in ages. It was small, but I wasn’t expecting spacious in New York, and we had enough room, even after our shopping trips. I’d definitely recommend the Iroquis for its comfort, out of the ordinary style, central location and friendly staff.

Beautiful suite for a great price, excellent staff and service. The location was perfect, right in the middle of the theatre district and the business world. Nice quiet street. Would highly recommend.

Pros: Location! Personnel, Value, Bedding, Classic old-style personal attention to one's comfort. Much prefer it to the anonymity of the Hiltons or MariottCons: Eliminate source of banging at night near back rooms.Location: Heart of theater district. Easy walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center attractions and restaurants.The Iroquois is what one expects from a sophisticated hotel in Manhattan: stylish, classic, chic details like the library with free computer access and good natural light to read by. The service is warm without being overly familiar. More Mrs. Hughes than Thomas. The comfy bedding invites snuggling down and lingering past the alarm. Nice to have gratis tangerines instead of the ubiquitous apple at the front desk and the complimentary coffee in the lobby is perfect when one must grab a few quick gulps on the run. Only slight annoyance was some banging around in the back of the building - or was it the floor below? that woke us up a couple of times in the night. A higher floor might eliminate that distraction. (We were on 2). The Iroquois enjoys a fabulous location so near the theaters and restaurants we only had to walk a very few blocks and this was most appreciated in the freezing weather. Hotel personnel are the stars of this place and the custom liqueur Brandy Alexander nightcaps in their Speak-Easy era bar are a guilty pleasure as well. I will return here in future for sure.

great location, great staff and wonderful food The bellman was so kind and helped us with our luggage, our taxi and anything else we needed. The bar was fun and friendly. We had a great time at the theater due to Vanessa the concierge. Thank you all for a fantastic trip

I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. The rooms are spacious and their pillows and beds comfortable. The bathroom was really comfortable and the employees were professional and polite. Really close to 5th Ave and 2 blocks away from Times Square.

Very friendly, helpful, efficient staff. The room was comfortable, perfectly clean, very quiet, and the bed was super comfortable. Great location. Had Sunday breakfast with amazing French toast. Very happy!

Excellent hotel. Friendly staff, wonderful accommodations, great speakeasy bar with original cocktails and the ability to discuss your own concoction with the bar staff. A lovely hideaway in the middle of NYC will definitely return.

Our stay at the Iroquois was part of a memorable weekend in New York City. The bedrooms are small but comfortable and offer reasonable value considering the location. We'd use this hotel again. The dining room is excellent.

We stayed at the Iroquois for the first time for four days in January. We were extremely happy with the hotel, from the folks at the front door, the folks at the front desk through to all the roomkeepers. All were genuinely friendly and professional. The room was an adequate size (probably large for NY standards), and the bed was to die for. Very recommended.

Stayed here in January 2014 with my 2 teen/adult children. We arrived mid-morning, not expecting to be able to check in until the afternoon and were pleasantly surprised to be able to check in right away. I had booked directly with the hotel via e mail and found the booking process to be easy and friendly. Our room was on the top floor, 2 queen beds. It was not large, but larger than I had expected and big enough to accommodate 3 adults and 4 large suitcases. The beds were super comfy, plenty of extra blankets when we requested them, lots of pillows, great Molton Brown toiletries in the bathroom, plenty of fluffy towels.Loved the little touches - chocolates at turndown, weather card, personalised greeting card from the GM, bottle of wine. Good free wifi - unlike other hotels we stayed at, there was no limit to the number of devices per room.Most of the staff were friendly and helpful; we borrowed umbrellas one rainy day. Concierge gave us a great recommendation for a nearby deli (Cranberry Cafe) - would not have discovered it on our own.Location was great - near Times Square but not noisy, close to subway, plenty of food options nearby.There are a lot of hotels on this street, but we loved The Iroquois - it just felt "right."

Another wonderful stay at the Iroquois Hotel. In the heart of Broadway theatre district and restaurant row. This is an intimate boutique hotel that always exceeds our expectations! Concierges Vanessa and Bill go way beyond the line of duty in offering up great tips to make our stay special. We always enjoy the expansive suites when we are in town. Ask for the James Dean suite, where he lived for several years in the 1950s.

Good NY hotel in best location. Staff friendly and helpful. Bathrooms very small. Prices in restaurant same as all other NY hotels - way too expensive. Despite small bathrooms & cost of breakfast in hotel, I'd. book it again.

The Iroquois is a lovely traditional hotel with very well appointed rooms and an accommodating staff. The room was good the bed was great and everything was very clean. Excellent restaurant and amenities.

We had a wonderful trip! We appreciated the warm reception and surprise treats to help celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary.We only had breakfast in the hotel's restaurant. I found the menu very limited and needed some gluten-free options. I was glad you offered soy milk.

A friend and I traveled to NYC Jan17-19, 2014 to see a couple of Broadway plays. Another friend had recommended the Iroquois. The hotel was PERFECT! Great location just a few blocks off of Times Square. We were within walking distance of both venues at which we saw plays. We were also walking distance to Rockefeller Center, the NYC Public Library, Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue shopping, and plenty of restaurants. Besides feeling so "in the middle of things," the hotel was remarkably quiet. We had nothing disturb our sleep.The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Our room was tiny, but quaint and very clean. The beds were not as comfortable as I would expect in a small, boutique hotel such as this but the linens were amazing. The room was stocked with all of the necessary toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, soap, body wash, lotion) as well as ironing board with iron, hair dryer and bath robes. The hotel gets a big KUDOS for having a lighted magnifying mirror!! As anyone who has read my other reviews knows, this is a BIG plus as I feel it is an item all hotels, no matter what star level, should provide as it is a necessary grooming tool.My only complaint, and this one is soooo minor, is the hotel uses those pressure sensitive trays for the room's minibar. The minibar is a nice touch but, given that it was on the dresser where clothes were stored, items can easily be bumped and all of the sudden you have a room charge. In fact, I had a charge for a soda show up on my bill and I believe this is why. There is a sign on the dresser warning you, but that really isn't sufficient. I understand why the pressure sensitive trays are so nice for the hotel, but it seems there should be an easier method. Why can't there be a case or something where you have to use a credit card swipe to open it, or a special code given to you upon check-in? Then there's no mistaking your intentions. Anyway, I digress. I do have to say that the staff took care of the removing the charge from my bill without question.I highly recommend The Iroquois for your NYC stay, especially if you will be hanging around the Times Square area for most of your trip. We did not take the subway at all during our short weekend so I cannot say much about access to subway stations. Taxi cabs were easy to obtain on Sunday morning for our return flight and we were at the airport in about 25 minutes.When I return to NYC I will definitely be staying at The Iroquois again!

Excellent location! Small and quiet. Friendly staff. Walking distance to Times Square, Theater District, Rockefeller Plaza, 5th Ave and Central Park. The suite was perfect for 3 adults and all of our winter attire!

Good location, convenient for museums, theatres and Rockerfeller Centre. Comfortable quiet room at back of hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Try Lantern's Keep, a great little cocktail bar full of atmosphere.

A lovely hotel steps from Times Square, provides an oasis of rest and peaceful quiet. The staff is friendly and helpful and all needs are take care of. The bed is especially comfortable. Our stay was very luxurious.

Stayed here last week. Absolutely would stay again. All staff was very polite and made us feel welcome. Beds were very comfortable. Very quite and relaxing. Perfect location for everything in the city!!! Can't wait to stay again !!! Thank you

We spent 3 nights at the Iroquois and couldn't be more pleased. We arrived during the big snow storm - called to advise of our late arrival. Staff, from that call until departure was terrific.We had a deluxe king room - very spacious by New York standards. Quiet and completely comfortable. The in room safe was a great plus.Location is outstanding for cultural events, theater, great restaurants, major NYC sites.If there's 1 thing I'd recommend, it would be a bit more storage space in the (quite large) bathroom. But the towels and washcloths are so incredibly soft and comfortable; the tub/shower roomy with a nice high shower head - I really can't complain. We visit New York about once a year - and will definitely stay at the Iroquois again.

We go to NYC each year and have stayed at the Iroquois for the past four years. It has a great location, very clean and quiet. Although we don't use all of the amenities of the hotel as we are there to see the city and take in some shows, everything appears very classy. We have always enjoyed our stay there.

We spent six nights here on a recent trip to New York. Location was perfect, very close to Fifth Avenue and Times Square. Staff were friendly and Vanessa on the concierge desk was excellent. Room was comfortable and you had all you needed. Only criticism would be the lack of communal area and bar. We spent a few evenings in the bar at the Sofitel next door. Breakfast was fine but the Triomphe restaurant is totally lacking in atmosphere so we were not tempted to have dinner. We tried to go into the Lanterns Keep one evening but it closed at 11 pm. But as a hotel have no complaints.

An absolute gem. We had a fabulous visit to NY and The Iroquois was a big reason why. Charming, cozy, elegant and quiet. Rooms were comfortable, staff was extremely polite and helpful, especially the concierge.

Stayed in here for my 40th birthday trip with my wife. The first room we were offered was very noisy due to fan noise. Reception were very quick to offer an alternative which was much better. Had a view (just) of the Top of the Chrysler Building. Great location close to Time Square and central to all the sites of NYC. Would definitely recommend it as it was recommended to us.

Excellent boutique hotel in midtown, within walking distance to theaters, subway lines, and a few restaurants. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Recently remodeled. Rooms and bathrooms are small but very well appointed. Complimentary wifi. Minibar. Bathrobes. NYTimes in the morning. Chocolates at night.

Great location, friendly and helpful staff. Nice size room with 2 double beds, so close to Times Square. Great water pressure, with plenty of hot water. My mother, sister, and I "blew a fuse" while attempting to all get ready at the same time. It was fixed with in 3 minutes. Dim lighting would be my only complaint, but overall not an issue.
user_name:
Traci Marlena P
Kenova, West Virginia

review_body: My husband and I just celebrated an anniversary by staying at the Iroquois. We absolutely enjoyed everything about this small-scale boutique hotel. The location cannot be beat. You are close to the subway and you can walk just about anywhere you need to go in midtown. The rooms make the best use of space with very nice bathrooms and closets. The staff members are very friendly and helpful. They even were kind enough to give us an anniversary half-bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries. There is no doubt when we return to New York we will stay here. I highly recommend the Iroquois to everyone.

Great hotel with friendly staff. The room was well-appointed. Washrooms do not have enough shelf space, but that is a manageable situation. Great experience and fantastic location! Comfortable bedding and pillows.

I truly had a perfect hotel experience at The Iroquois, from beginning to end. And I received some unexpectedly stellar customer service, which I'll get to in a minute. But first, a summary of the hotel experience: it is everything you want in a hotel. The entire staff is professional, friendly, and knowledgeable. We chose an upgraded room this time and it included a proper bathtub, which is quite the luxury for a Manhattan hotel room.The bed was super comfy and luxurious; lots of pillows, which I love. The room was quiet and the lighting was subtle. They offer turn down service in the evenings, leaving chocolate and a weather card on your pillow. Such a nice touch. In the mornings the lobby serves good, strong coffee and in the afternoon they switch to hot cider; so nice to come back to after walking through bustling Times Square. Which brings me to location: The Iroquois is very centrally located, just two blocks away from Times Square and steps away from the theatres where we were seeing Broadway shows. Just perfect. And now to that bit about customer service that went above and beyond: we had booked our room during a mega Boxing Week sale, pre-paid and non-refundable terms. When I informed the front desk that we'd unexpectedly be leaving early (due to a health issue, which I didn't tell them), they offered me a refund, which was totally unexpected. I couldn't believe that they did this even though I didn't ask them to. I think that experience really sums up The Iroquois; everything and everyone excels above and beyond expectations.

We stayed at the Iroquois for two nights in October 2013. Nice hotel, to be sure, and almost charming, with a quasi old-school mens club feel in the lobby, which we thought was pretty nice. Upgraded room was a bit cramped, and a previous guest's glasses and other items were still in one of the windows. Bed and noise level were both really good, which certainly is a bonus in New York.

Fantastic hotel. Very clean and comfortable (and believe me I am very fussy with hotel rooms!). Staff were more like friends than employees. The food was excellent. The hotel was also ideally located for seeing the sights, off Fifth Avenue, 2 blocks from Times Square, 4 blocks south of Rockefeller Centre and 10 blocks north of Empire State Building for example. All in easy walking distance. Gregorys Coffee Shop across the road from the hotel was also a must. We had a Superior Queen room and although some might say its small, we found it perfectly adequate for us, our large cases and numerous shopping bags. The bed was very comfortable and the linens nice and relaxing, not crispy starchy (cosy like home). The Concierge, Vanessa, is an absolute gem. Her local knowledge and helpfulness is second to none. Would easily stay at this hotel again and hope to in the near future.

Refined and warm service from A to Z and so near everything. Loved it! Great staff, ready to help with any question. Location is excellent and the area is very safe. Rooms clean, and romantic the warm cider at the door is what can I say unusual and superb when it's cold in NYC.

great. I wrote everything to the Iroquois. love the location, the staff is wonderful, very helpful. the rooms are nice, spacious. I love this hotel. think a little more attention to details in the room could be done, but overall a very special place and I look forward to returning many times !

Great place at NY... It is a small luxary hotel with high quality from the doorman to the housekeeping team, full of great details to the guest... There is a grocery store around the corner open 24 hours

Our stay at the Iroquois could not have been more enjoyable. The attention to every detail is something that we love and this hotel surpassed every expectation. If you are looking for a charming luxurious place to stay in a central Manhattan location, where you will be treated with personal, attentive service - the Iroquois is the hotel for you. We can’t wait to visit again!

a great boutique hotel in the heart of midtown with a great staff. we stay here whenever we visit new york city. they are most accommodating and the location is great if you have theater tickets or travel the whole island. you are in the middle of everything.

This is a new hotel for us. We are both regular visitors to NY and my girlfriend is there twice a month with her job. We could have got an amazing rate at her hotel but we wanted somewhere upscale and The Iroquois delivered. Pre arrival communications with Vanessa at the Concierge desk were encouraging and our car service was waiting at JFK when we arrived. Check in was welcoming, efficient and quick. Our room (1210), was very nice but without a view (if I want a view I will go to the Palace), so it didn't bother us too much!!! Nice room. Great bed. Ample amenities and lovely robes. We didn't eat at the hotel so no comments there. We did aim for the bar on our first night but it was fully reserved. We were a little disappointed with this. My advice is to make a reservation at check in. It is a very small bar. We reserved a table another evening when the bar was quieter. The creativity of the bar tender is to be admired! The only other negative comment is about the bathroom. There is no heating in there so with marble floor and walls it can be a little chilly and also being on the 12th floor the water pressure was a little below par. I don't agree with some other comments here about the lack of hot water. There is a delay whilst hot water arrives, but only about 30 seconds so no a problem really. Overall, a very enjoyable 4 nights. Lasting impression? Staff. Exceptional.

Everyone says that the hotel is in a great location - and it is. It would struggle to be anywhere better.The rooms are very clean with extremely comfortable bedding and a well appointed bathroom. Robes are included.The deluxe room didn't feel small but certainly didn't feel big either. The room we were allocated was on the 4th floor and suffered from noise from an adjacent engineering room. We were moved as soon as this was mentioned to a quieter room on the 11th floor (with a view of the Chrysler Building). You could still hear the New York hum of air rooftop air conditioning units but it was by no means intrusive. There was no noise from other rooms.We were let down by the concierge (or the Lantern's Keep bar - not sure which) when a booking for the Keep wasn't actioned. However, fortunately space became available and we were accommodated. In essence the keep is a room that sells cocktails, not as poetic as the descriptions suggest, but nice enough.Staff were polite and all in all we had a very pleasant stay in a hotel that felt nice. I have no knowledge of other New York hotels yet but I wouldn't shy away from recommending The Iroquois.Could be worth joining Luxury Small Hotels before your visit. It's free and advertises some useful benefits.

Excellent, personable service from Reservations to Front Door, to Front Desk, to Houskeeping, to Room Service, to Concierge - all were above & beyond. Great location for getting around to attractions we wanted.

After eating in their restaurant several times, we decided to stay at the Iroquois New York. A short walk to Times Square and the NYC Theater District. We had a wonderful stay. Everyone was very friendly and most accommodating. Hotel was very comfortable. Room was clean and well equipped. Only a short cab ride from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. All of New York City there to enjoy. Highly recommend the Iroquois. We are planning to stay there on our next trip to NYC.

Excellent small hotel, great location, very friendly, helpful staff. I visit NY frequently (once per month) on business and Iroquois is my first choice. Rooms are small but typical NY. Prices competitive for location.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Iroquois. The room was not at all spacious (Executive) but it was just right for one person. Very comfy bed and pretty big bathroom. The room was cold (this was during the snowstorm in January) but they quickly delivered a space heater. Friendly staff. And the gym was very nice.

The rooms are not large, the views modest at best, and yet this is probably my favorite hotel in NYC. While small, the rooms are supremely comfortable, elegantly appointed, quiet as a library, and host beds that feel like the way you imagined clouds would feel when you were young. The staff is relaxed, attentive, and helpful with just about anything. The neighborhood is perfect and the on-premises cocktail factory and restaurant are amazing, although not inexpensive. The hotel transports you to a more civilized and tasteful era. This is the anti-Trump hotel!

We stayed at The Iroquois Dec 27-Jan 1 and were very pleased. The staff was friendly, efficient, and very accommodating. The location was perfect for us, as Times Square, the Theater District and Rockefeller Center were all short walks away. Central Park and The Met are a long walk or short cab ride away. The rooms are small, but nice, and besides, we were not in New York to camp out in our hotel room. Our bed was comfortable, and we did not have any problems sleeping. Rooms whose window face away from the street are slightly quieter from the traffic noises, but there will always be noise in the city that never sleeps. The heating and air conditioning are controlled floor by floor, as opposed to each room having its own thermostat, so we had to keep our window open in varying amounts to try and get the room cooled off somewhat (we could not get the heat temperature low enough for our tastes without opening the window to let the winter air in). That said, we would absolutely recommend the hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Great accomodation and fantastic location. Staff are very welcoming and efficient and very accomodating when booking tourist attractions. Will definitely return upon our next visit to New York. Can highly recommend this hotel

The Iroquois Hotel is a gem near times square. Would would never know how close you were as both 44th street and the Iroquios Hotel itself are quiet, friendly, and very personalized. The Iroquois Hotel is my favorite hotel in NYC - and I only that at that hotel when I travel to NYC!

We had a two double bed room that was very nice, quiet, and comfy. The beds are extremely comfortable and the noise was not an issue (and we are from NE so we are used to quiet at night). The restaurant was fantastic and that is saying a lot since most hotel restaurants are mediocre. Location for theater district was THE BEST, and very close to subway stations for further destinations. Will definitely return! Please know that I am not saying the room are TOO small (it is NYC) after all :o)

Wonderful location, luxurious bed and linens, comfortable and quiet. Excellent service was provided. Bathroom was quite lovely with a great shower, but it was very small. I loved having a well-lit make-up mirror in the bathroom.

Well, it's a new hotel to us. In the theater district, we usually stay at the Cornell Club, but it was full. With help from TripAdvisor, we decided to try the Iroquois for our wedding anniversary (12/18). The room rate was very good but our experience in the past has not been good when the room rate was surprising low. Not this time. The curbside luggage service was very good, the front desk upgraded our room. The room was small (it is NYC) but very comfortable. We asked for a quiet room and got one! The best was the hotel restaurant -- Triomphe. The food was pretty expensive and worth the price: really delicious. The bread pudding was sinfully tasty. The service was very friendly and attentive. A perfect prelude to the show. All in: a terrific stay.

Perfect small hotel with large hotel amenities, truly home away from home. Staff is extremely friendly and cooperative, concierge willing to go the extra mile to secure the perfect information regarding restaurants and activities, hotel is welcoming and well staffed to meet every need, rooms are quiet and comfortable, had a perfect New York winter weekend experience, thanks to the Iroquois! Looking forward to a Spring visit.

I spent 5 days at this hotel between Xmas and New Year Eve with my two sons. The hotel is perfectly located, next to the 5th avenue and two blocks away from Time Square. The staff is very friendly and professional, the rooms are noiseless (which is a luxury in NY) but a bit small; I booked a superior room for the three of us but it was crowed and the beds were too softy, not providing a good sleep.Otherwise the style is typically New Yorker, beginning of the las century, very charming.

We just weren't blown away by our stay here. It was my third time to New York and I work in a five star hotel, so our expectations could be set a little higher than most. We were stuck on the 2nd floor staring at a brick wall out our window. The heat wasn't working so we had a heater brought to our room. The people working there are very nice, we just personally wouldn't stay here again. It was a place to sleep, it's clean, good location but that's about it. Not leaving with a "what a great hotel" feeling.

Great hotel , great location, rear of hotel has an awful viewWater pressure was poor at sometimes but it wasn't a problem, try to get upper floors and towards the front if possible, the front doormen are the best I have had, very polite and helpful, room was very quiet for sleeping

Great location with warm escape from the crowds. Everything a small luxury hotel should be in a big city like New York. Great restaurant. Private bars. Terrific linens. Excellent concierge. Friendly staff. Very accommodating.

Lovely Boutique hotel in midtown central location. Great base location for all the nearby tourist sites and shops. Rooms are rather small but well equipped and lovely bathroom. Staff were very pleasant and helpful.

My husband and I had a four day weekend at the Iroquois in mid Nov. 2013. We could not get over how attentive and helpful all the employees were, especially Zach and Vanessa. The location was amazing, just around the corner from Time Square but far enough away to miss out on any noise. Vanessa helped us out with TCKTs cheap tickets and made great restaurant and coffee shop recommendations. Zach and the doorman were there everyday when we returned with a friendly smile and interest in how we spent our day. The room was small, it is NYC, but well appointed and the bathroom was lovely. The free movies on CD were a nice touch, as was the warm cider in the lobby. We ducked into the bar one evening and were thoroughly entertained by the bar tender and waiter who were interesting and interested young men. All in all the hotel was terrific but the staff was exceptional -a definite must to add to you NYC trip plans.

The Iroquois is in a great location for Midtown and is therefore well placed to see the sights.Booking for a 7 nt stay, we wanted room to relax and therefore chose a suite for our stay - a good decision. The staff were uber friendly and helpful and concierge was excellent.A comfortable but homely atmosphere was engendered throughout and I would definitely recommend the Iroquois as an excellent choice for midtown NYC.

Stayed here during Christmas. Even though the city was so busy the hotel, was calm and peaceful, quiet and comfortable. This was a family trip. Children enjoyed the room as well. Staff was very polite, and the location was great. Subways were close. Restaurants and Time Square were a two minute walk. Would come back again without hesitation!

This Charming classic & Comfy boutique hotel offers quality accomodation & service from a an ideal location. This was the perfect Stay for a New York Christsmas Vacation. My family and I wanted to be in the heart of the city without being in the chaos. This Hotel fit the bill on all levels. We had personalized & efficient check-in without a wait and into the exact room types anticipated. The classic Christmas decor along with the warm cider in the quite lobby immedialtely put us in the Holiday spirit.The rooms exceeded our expectations; they were warm, welcoming, tastefully decorated and extremely comfortable. The cleaning staff did an oustanding job preparing the rooms and were stealthily efficient during our stay. Never any noise or interuptions.A minor issue with the King room thermostat was promptly repaired and the technician was savy enough to check our adjoining room as well.We wanted to be in the heart of NYC where all the action is, but wanted some peace and quite after a day on the streets of NYC. This was one of the most valuable aspects of our stay. We could step out of the hotel and be immediately into the excitement of midtown,with easy acces to all of the city, but after a full day in Gotham, a warm cup of cider welcomes us back to the quite respite of our hotel. The Hotel Restaurant offered a convenient quality menu and the Bar lounge offer a hip ambience that's simply sophisticated.The size appropriate Gym was perfect for a quick work out to recharge before heading out ot winding down before turning in.The uncontrived warmth and genuine feel to this unique Boutique provided an at home feelling in the heart of midtown. We'll be back soon!

I've been coming to the Iroquois for 13 years, and never been disappointed. The location, amenities, and caring staff always welcome me back. Whether for business or pleasure, I have come to depend on the Iroquois as my home away from home.
user_name:
Lane H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is our third or fourth visit to the Iroquis. We love the location. It is a quiet street but with close proximity to everything.Our room was at the back so it was very quiet, no street noise. We also like the specialty bar, Lantern's Keep for an intimate gathering with friends. The hotel is like a little jewel in the heart of New York.

We loved the Iroquois. It's great location with good NYC price, warm attentive staff. We had a cozy room- not large but not needed. The heat worked great, updated room & bathroom. It will be our first of many visits. (We live 30 miles away but now realize the value of staying overnight in the city)

Returned last night from a fantastic 2 night stay in NYC.For a last minute getaway and first time visit to NYC the Iroquois Hotel was the perfect choice. We read many reviews on various properties and are very happy that we decided to stay at the Iroquois.Each staff member we interacted with at the Iroquois was very professional and very helpful. The property is charming, comfortable, clean and surprisingly quiet. The bed was cozy and we slept very well without disruption from street noise. A welcome haven after a busy day in Manhattan.Vanessa the Head Concierge was extremely helpful. She went so far as to talk us through directions via mobile so we could locate Gideon, our guide for the NYC Gangster Tour. We would have missed the tour had she not called to let Gideon know we were en route and then talked us through the directions. Thank-you Vanessa! ps.The tour was great!The hotel location is convenient, within walking distance to many attractions and Grand Central Station. I will definitely recommend the Iroquois to friends and family as a wonderful place of accommodation in NYC.My only side note is this: We were originally checked into room 506 which was clean and compact. However, it was a little heavy on the perfume and the only view from the window was a brick wall. Fortunately we were able to upgrade to a room on a higher floor and it had a view of the Chrysler Building! Thank you Front desk staff!All in all a memorable stay in NYC at the Iroquois Hotel, we would not hesitate to stay here again.Thank-you!

Very comfortably sized room and bed for NYC, excellent attentive, friendly service- oriented staff- remembers your name, goes out of their way to help with cabs and drivers, charming restaurant with lovely delicious choices for inclusive continental breakfast, great central mid town location in the bustle but on a quiet side street.

Excellent little hotel! Stayed for two nights. Perfect location, staff were very helpful, rooms were nice and delicate, beds were comfy, athmosphere was quiet and relaxing... Will definitely come back.

This hotel was so impressive. Very clean and decorated beautifully! The staff was wonderful and so helpful with suggestions for places to visit in the city. We loved the staff and the entire experience. We will definately be back!!

Location, location, location. Well appointed and very clean rooms, great staff, as quiet as anything in The City can possibly be. I always stay there It was a wonderful time stay perfect service I fill like at home I hope to come again soon

I have stayed many times at Iroquois, love the location the staff efficiency and friendliness, the room decoration....and mainly the calm and quietness: not the least noise when you are lucky to have a room at the back, which is rare in NYC. Suggested improvements: a coffee maker in the room and individual heating/air conditioning system.

One of our favorite NYC hotels-- small, clean, rather Old World in style. Great location for my conference, and for other Midtown jaunts. This has become our go-to place in the City!! Except for outlandish Pre-Christmas pricing-- we have no negatives about this place.

The Iroquois NY Hotel provided a quiet respite in the midst of a chaotic holiday weekend in NYC! The hotel is a classic! A welcome step back into 20th century charm without being stuffy or stogy! Staff was friendly and helpful. Bed was amazingly comfortable and room was nicely appointed especially for a NYC boutique hotel.

The Iroquois Hotel is very well located(next to the Sofitel) - near shopping and T Square and restaurants but is more tranquil and unassuming ( away from the riff-raff ). The staff are extremely attentive professional and friendly and the rooms are adequately sized, quiet and the beds are perfect ! If you drive in there's a lot across the street - Don't forget to validate at the hotel for a discount. This hotel performed its function perfectly..My on;y regret is that with rating like mine that they might raise the price ! "2 thumbs"

Lovely room and ambience, near to my Board of Trustees Meeting, really just across the street. My favorite! The front desk person, Alex, was most accommodating and allowed a room to be available an hour early. I was able to rest, after traveling, before my meeting. Steps away from 5th Avenue and all that mid-town offers. Well appointed and comfortable, in every way.

This delightful, very New York venue on the best block in the city for hotels, gave us friendly service - really! with just enough character that we knew we weren't anywhere but in the Big Apple. Need a cab or town car: here's one! Need a cheerful smile in the morning? You got it. An old NY place, not lavish but clean and comfortable, everything works, especially the good folks there.
user_name:
Margaret S
Glen Ellen, California, United States

review_body: This hotel was great. Right between 5th Ave and the Avenues of Americas how could you go wrong? It is rather small, but the quaintness and the wonderful staff makes up for it. I stayed on the 6th floor and though my view wasn't the greatest, the window completely opens to an old school fire escape. I ended up having drinks at the bar and had a fabulous time singing Christmas carols with the other guests and entertainer for the night. If you want to stay somewhere with a quaint feel, this older hotel just may be the place for you!

Loved staying at the Iroquois! Great small, personable hotel walking distance to so many areas. The staff were friendly, helpful and the hotel was all we thought it would be. The room was nicely furnished and the bath was large and updated. Disappointed we got a room with no view at the price we paid. The bed was very comfortable and the upgraded pillows wonderful! We waited in the bar at the back for 45 minutes for an $18 drink and then had only a few minutes to drink it. Went to Triomphe after theatre and waited an uncomfortable amount of time for the waiter to approach us and to pay the bill and the place was all but empty by then.

We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in NYC. The service was excellent and the location was perfect, right in the heart of all the sites most people like to visit while in NYC. Beautiful hotel !
user_name:
John T
Lincoln Park, Michigan, Usa

review_body: The NY Iroquois is a gem for the all who don't like the to stay in a large impersonal hotel. Rooms are small but filled with amenities. Service is excellent. I stay here for business and would stay here if I was a tourist as well.

While the Hotel is not the cheapest, we are return visitors (over 3 times) and each time the staff greats us very warmly and by name.This is a true boutique hotel with all the perks.The fitness room is small, but sufficient. The street is quite which for New York is a plus.Location is great

The Iroquois is the ideal midtown location, precisely between Fifth Avenue shopping and the Theatre District. One caution: not all rooms have individual temperature controls.Room too hot on a cold night!

Just returned home from a very busy New York in the run up to Christmas.My daughter and I had a lovely stay. Hotel was clean,staff very friendly particularly Vanessa the concierge, who was always extremely helpful. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Location can't get any better - close to everything but still quiet. Room was very small but we didnt spend much time there. Service was excellent. The concierge set us up with maps and made dinner reservations for us. We loved the cider available in the lobby in the afternoon and at night :) Great stay!

This was our first time in NYC! My daughter and I went as her "Sweet 16th" birthday present. This hotel was perfect...it was within walking distance to everything we wanted to see and do. It was great, we would walk in one direction in the morning, come back to the hotel and regroup then go back out and walk in the opposite direction! There were several places to eat within less than 5 minutes away. The Red Flame was a diner style place with a very simple menu and good food! We never ate at the hotel, but it looked nice. The rooms were very, very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable! the room was also VERY quiet, which was nice!!! Staff were extremely friendly and did what ever they could to make your stay enjoyable! Overall, this was a perfect hotel for us!!!

My wife and I came in for a show and a night in the city and could not have been anymore satisfied with our stay. Everything was perfect from the staff to the location to the cleanliness of the rooms. Would come back in a minute

We stayed here for my birthday weekend in December. What a quaint, romantic hotel! Even the hot cider was so yummy in the lobby! Everyone was so friendly and courteous! We left some items in the safe in our room by mistake. The manager called us immediately and arranged to have the items sent back to us via FedEx. Loved this hotel!

Love this hotel. Friendly and courteous staff. Great location. Close to theatres and great shopping. Rooms are well appointed, clean and comfortable. I visit every year with my girlfriend and love fact that hotel has 2 double beds. Not many hotels have. There will be a 5th visit and more!

What a beautiful boutique hotel. The room was beautiful and comfortable. A little small but we had expected that in NYC. They had computers for guest use in their library which was great for printing out boarding passes. 5 minute walk to Times Square. Great central location. The only disappointment was that the restaurant and bar were closed the whole time we were there for a Jewish holiday. We did however, find a little Irish bar across the road that had great wine and food!

The staff and location is fantastic!!! The best customer service we have ever experienced from hotel staff at any hotel we have ever stayed. From housekeeping, front door men, reception, and concierge!! The hotel is very well maintained and very clean. We will be back!!

We stayed here from 23-29 November, hotel was perfect, very clean, comfy beds perfect location. would highly recommend to any one going to New York. Few min walk from time square. Staff were very friendly and happy to help.thank you to every one who made our stay magical x

If you are looking for an intimate,invitingly warm hotel with perfect location(44th st between 5th and 6th ave.) this is the place.We took advantage of the hotel's fall savings discount and we were not dissappointed....we stayed 3 nights for our anniversary and were greeted with anniversary card,bottle of wine and chocolates.Front desk staff were courteous,friendly ,helpful and professional.Beautiful small lobby at this botique hotel with complimentary coffee and hot cider to enjoy in their library/sitting room.Deluxe room size was more than adequate by nyc standards and VERY clean and well appointed with king-size bed......no kidding,bed was the most comfortable we ever slept on.No view,but no big deal as you can walk outside into the city and get all the views you want...right?Bathroom was a bit on the small side but the italian marble from floor to ceiling was spotless.Complimentary turn-down service with fine chocolates was provided by a most delightful woman....we think her name was Madelina.Concierge service was great.Vanessa is a real attribute to this hotel.Even emailing me back with a comprehensive list of restaurant suggestions that I had requested before our arrival.She was glad to assist and very knowledgable.Parking was easy at the garage across the street with a hotel discount to boot($35/night).......Only regret was not having a crafted cocktail at their renouned Lantern's Keep tavern.....next time for sure...Nice job Iroquois Hotel !!......Only suggestion, as contributed by my wife, might be to put a glass door on work-out room entrance to make it a little more visable and safer feeling if utilizing it alone.

We stayed over Thanksgiving & could not have picked a better hotel!Room 808 was cosy, clean & modern. The most comfy bed & pillow, slept so well & with a back facing bedroom there was no traffic noise to keep us awake. Bathroom came with Molten Brown products so don't bother packing shampoo & stuff as it's all there. Every day it was cleaned to perfection & prepped at night with chocolates. As the weather was getting cold there was always hot coffee in the morning & hot cider at night which we took out to keep us warm.The hotel was meters from the thanksgiving parade so we watched it from the corner of the hotel then escaped the rush straight to the hotel. Minutes from Times Sq the location is perfect for midtown.Would 100% stay again!

This was a dream to stay in! The rooms are cozy (which is to be expected in NY) and the Staff are exceptional at what they do! It is Central to just about everything the City has to offer. Make sure you keep an eye out for Vanessa and Zac they are a credit to the Iroquois.
user_name:
Maddie T
New York City, New York

review_body: Loved the rooms, the location, the convenience of being so close to so many great sights, but especially we loved the staff and the concierge. Best ever. They went out of their way to assist us in our sight planning, limo service to our airport, restaurant reviews, and anything else we needed. We would definitely make this our base of operations for our next visit to New York City.

Peaceful old hotel in a fantastic location for all the mid-town attractions, theatres and restaurants and especially lovely at this time of year as it had a very cosy atmosphere.Our room was small and had no aspect other than a wall but even those at the front would have overlooked the narrow street so don't book here if you want a view. However this meant that we were not disturbed by traffic noise or bright lights so slept well.Staff were friendly and helpful and we enjoyed the dinner and breakfast we ate in the restaurant.Tea making facilities in the room would have been nice but I suppose space was at a premium - however $14 for 2 cups of tea from the bar seemed pricey!I would recommend staying here if you want a quaint setting and a more personal experience than you would get in the larger hotels in the area.

We stayed here on our trip to NYC from nov 20-24. We chose it based on its high reviews from trip advisor and it fit our price range. We were not disappointed. This hotel is centrally located in midtown manhattan between 5th and 6th ave on 44th street. It is within walking distance to grand central, the new york library, and times square as well 5th ave and many other places. Also conveniently located 1 block away from from the 42nd street subway. Rooms where beautiful as shown and check was painless as can be, check out was great and even gave us late check out till 2pm since our flight left later.The rooms where very spacious and clean every day, and the staff was very helpful and polite. Our room was in the back, so we didn't really have a view but that was fine with me, with the noise of this city i was glad we where further off the street. There where no ice machines but a call to room service had ice promptly delivered free of charge of course. We had a great experience, and would definitely stay there again. We didnt get a chance to try the restaurant on site as we had reservations every night but look forward to trying it in the future. Thanks for the great services Iroquois!!!

Just completed an all day meeting at this hotel. Last minute business conference. Staff was terrific and very supportive. I highly recommend the Iroquois. We booked this conference at the last minute and the hotel team was quick to react and really made us look good with our client. Door man, waiter, concierge, front desk and sales manager all welcomed us warmly and were very sensitive to our needs.

An excellent hotel, great location and remarkable staff. Elegant, cozy and welcoming. A lovely, quiet hotel to return to after a long business day. Price was reasonable, service crisp, professional and extremely friendly. The bed was awesome. Would recommend to others for both business and personal travel; I'll definitely be back!
user_name:
Mike V
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: It is hard to beat the great central location of this hotel. This is our second stay and we could not be more pleased. The facilities are beautifully modernized but still with the flavor of the hotel's early years. Nice quite dining room and bar. Very comfortable room. We will be back next year for sure and probably bring some friends from California with us.

Gorgeous old, renovated hotel in superb location (walking distance to Rockefeller Center, other great restaurants and bars and other mid-town attractions). An elegant yet cozy oasis and counterbalance to the high energy of this great city. Beautiful, quiet room, comfy bed, lovely bathroom, wonderful Molton Brown bath products. Exceptional service (special thank you to Eric!). Everyone at the hotel was warm, welcoming and very helpful. Immaculately clean. Surprisingly reasonable rates and so much more charm and personality than the high-end chain hotels. The only (slight) disappointment was the gym; perfectly functional, but no "wow factor". No other place I want to stay in NYC.

Just back from a long weekend in NYC celebrating my husband's birthday. I spent weeks narrowing down hotel choices and decided on the Iroquois because we are fans of small hotels, the location was great and, the rooms are not your typical NYC 'postage stamp' size. That said. what a nice suprise to be upgraded and ushered into a lovely suite. From the time we arrived, to our departure, we felt like we were staying with family. The staff is great, - always cheerful and seemed genuinely interested in what we had planned for the weekend. Oh, and the bed! What can I say other than I asked for the brand and model so we can luxuriate at home too. We will definitely be back and would recommend the Iroquois to all our friends. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
user_name:
eshattuck
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The location, staff, rooms (especially the beds) were just perfect. The concierge, doormen, reception and room attendants were so attentive, nothing was too much trouble for them. I would stay there in a heartbeat. Dont waste time looking around for any better, you wont find it.(Bathrooms are small however functional and they did the job)

I have always enjoyed staying at the Iroquois however this stay was not up to snuff. I requested upon check-in a room away from the street as I am a light sleeper and was assured that my room was in the "middle" of the building which happily it was but right next to the elevator on the 9th floor. The room was fine but five minutes after I had unpacked, I heard a loud noisy vibration. I went into the hallway to see where the noise was coming from and traced it to the stairwell beside the elevator. A housekeeping staff member greeted me and agreed with me that the noise was loud and said that it was the air conditioner and that she would mention it to the hotel engineer to have it fixed. As I had an appointment I thought nothing more of it and ran out. When I returned to sleep that evening, to my dismay, the vibration continued on and off throughout the night giving me a fairly sleepless night. I mentioned it to the front desk clerk in the morning and she quickly and graciously offered to change my room which she did, but not before mentioning that had I asked the night before, which luckily I hadn't, she wouldn't have been able to change my room as the hotel was sold out.The inconvenience of having to repack and unpack was worth it to get a good night's sleep, however I couldn't help but feel that my experience has been devalued by this and in the future I might think twice before returning. I just hope that this was a one time occurrence as I have always enjoyed staying at the Iroquois.

A gem of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World in midtown New York, the Iroquois provided excellent service (especially the concierge Vanessa) during my stay with a wonderfully unexpected upgrade to the top floor suite. Ideally situated near Broadway/Times Square and not far from plentiful dining choices along Restaurant Row/Hells Kitchen. Convenient parking option directly opposite hotel (with discount as hotel guest). The hotel staff were a delight and would recommend this hotel, especially for lower weekend rates.

There's just something that I love about this hotel. I can't say if it's the staff, the rooms, the location, or if it's all of them together. I might just be the beds that I get a wonderful sleep in!Easy to find your way around New York from this location, and with plenty of places to eat nearby too. A short walk to Times Square, or even shopping in 5th Avenue.Rooms are beautiful. Hence why I've stayed here more times than any other hotel.

We really enjoyed this small boutique hotel. The staff was very friendly. The mattress and bedding were very comfortable. The bellhops were very attentive to our needs. The bathroom was not large, but we only took a quick shower and were back outside to experience New York City. Turndown service was provided every night with chocolates on the pillow. The paper was in a neat cloth bag every morning hanging from the door. Loved the quiet doorbell that if switched to off, showed Do Not Disturb. If pushed to on, a quiet doorbell would ring if pushed. Hot cider and coffee were provided in the lobby.

My sister and I just spent a four day weekend in NYC for her birthday, my gift to her, so I wanted a nice hotel for her. I took a chance on the Iroquois based on the other reviews and I have to say that I could not have happier in our choice! From the moment we got out of the taxi to the moment we left, it was truly a great experience. Everyone was extremely gracious and pleasant to deal, not something you always find in NY. Our room was not huge but it was plenty of room for the two of us. The beds were heavenly and the bathroom was clean and well stocked with towels, soap, etc. At night the sounds of the city were barely perceptible and never was a factor. We never did try out the restaurant, spa or the exercise facility, but did enjoy the bar. If I have even a hint of a complaint it would be that the bar does not stock vodka or olives which happens to be my usual drink of choice. But I had a nice single malt scotch which I enjoyed immensely. Location was ideal. I could not recommend this hotel more highly. I will be back.
user_name:
Allison B
Chicago, Illinois, United States

review_body: just got back to UK after 4 nights at this hotel. From the moment we arrived, could not fault this hotel. needed twin room - allocated rm 1208 - top floor, quiet, excellent facilities. Two elevators, so never had to wait long. Most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in, my sister said the same. Booked through Trip Advisor, got 20% discount and free continental breakfast - which was really lovely. Hotel staff were so friendly and helpful. Good position for exploring the city. Complimentary hot apple cider on tap in the lobby in the afternoon, just what the doctor ordered after a busy day. Not a cheap hotel, but worth every penny (or cent!). Would definitely recommend a stay in this hotel

Regarding the hotel, the staff, the room size and cleaning i have nothing to say except that everithing was good; the location is just fantastic .The only let 's call, bad comment, is regarding the so called 24 hours room Service , for a city that never sleep is quite unacceptable to offer a chicken or beef sandwich as only late dinner option after midnight.

We visited New York to celebrate our anniversary. Our room was clean and decorated nicely. The service was top notch especially the concierge service. Our only criticism was that the room temperature was too hot and they were unable to adjust it. Also we were on the 9th floor and in the back of the building and the street noise was very loud.

Our room on the high floor is small but has good layout which makes the efficient use of the limited space. The furniture style and the bathroom seem "old world" but all is functional and charming. The two elevators are not connected so you have to choose one or the other or press both buttons. The front desk staff are a bit stiff; no smile; acting like they are doing you a favor. The maid who came to offer a turndown service and the doorman were very nice and friendly, however. Overall, we quite enjoyed the stay. Location close to times square is hard to beat. On the day of checking out, there was a parade on 5th Ave and the hotel's block was used for the parade formation. Needless to say, it was very loud, very crowded and chaotic. Not the hotel's fault but the close proximity to 5th Ave does have the downside.
user_name:
CliveNYC
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: This was my second stay at this hotel. I am now thinking that next time I will stay elsewhere. I wondered if the management was off the entire time we were there. we stayed in a deluxe room this time but it didn't seem any bigger or better than the superior from last time. We had service issues. There is a sign on the mini bar that it is not a refrigerator and you will be charged if you move anything. So you have to call for ice. The first day it took over 45 minutes. The second day we waited an hour and finally we just headed out. The second day we came and went throughout the day. The room was not made up until quite late and by then they just combined the cleaning with the turndown service. The front desk never greeted us, and most of the time they were not helping anyone. The bellboys may as well have not been there. They were busy most of the time standing outside talking to each other to do anything. We did have one yell "hey" from across the lobby when we came in one night. And the next night we watched a couple struggle with their 4 pieces of luggage while the bell boy sat at the concierge desk. Housekeeping did not do a very good job at replenishing. One day we did not have all of towels and I used the kit with cutips in it and all they did was put the empty packet back in the display. I realize this is not the Four Seasons, but for this level of hotel I still expect more service than what one would get at the Holiday Inn.

The Iroquois is my favorite hotel in Manhattan. Even though we live in the NYC area, my husband and I have stayed there several times for a weekend “getaway” on our anniversary. The rooms are not huge, but they are tasteful and very comfortable. The staff is always pleasant, accommodating, and helpful. The TV’s have a DVD player, and the front desk has a DVD library from which you can borrow movies for free, if you feel like relaxing. Whenever we request something – from a glass of milk to help with the thermostat – it arrives quickly and courteously. I look forward to going back again!

In this case, the little package is the boutique hotel - The Iroquois. Steps from the metro, steps from the heart of the theatre district - yet astoundingly quiet, this ultimate comfort yet historic hotel is equipped to care for the most discerning to the most casual of visitors. Not to be missed is the exquisite cocktail and/or dining experience at the Iroquois' Triomphe Restaurant - a feast for the palate and attended to by impeccable and inviting staff. Intent on making sure each guest is cared for, the General Manager of the hotel and restaurant is visible and disarmingly approachable. For an excellent, comfortable and quiet hotel away from the madding crowd yet in the heart of NYC, The Iroquois is our top choice and should be yours as well!

We stayed at the Iroquois for our honeymoon and had a great time. From the moment of arriving the staff couldn't do enough for us. Alex welcomed us warmly on reception and provided us with a great room overlooking the Cryslar Building. Bill the porter was really helpful with his knowledge of the hotel and the surrounding area. He greeted us warmly each time we saw him.Vanessa on the concierge desk was incredibly helpful. She booked us a car back to the airport but also helped us with our sightseeing activities and told us exactly what we needed to do to be able to travel on the subway and even told us the amount we needed to load onto our travelcards to get us to and back from our destination. She even offered to be our personal sat nav and gave us her direct line in case we got lost whilst out and about or she could help us further. Exceptional service.The hotel itself is in a great location that enables you to explore the City perfectly. Times Square is just a couple of blocks away.We've been to NYC 3 or 4 times already so knew where we wanted to be but staying at this boutique hotel added that personal touch we havent had before on previous visits. We will definitely go back

Just got back from another great stay at the Iroquois. We were visiting this time for my son's 13 birthday. I talked to the concierge before our arrival to let them know the occasion. When we arrived everyone seemed to know it was his birthday and there was a box of chocolates and a card waiting for him. Every time we left the doormen would stop us and ask the boys how the trip was going. They made the boys feel special, it was a nice touch! As always, the staff was great, courteous and welcoming. The room was spotless and the beds are ultra comfortable. This is the ONLY place to stay! Centrally located in midtown. Thank you to the staff for making it a special stay for us! Hope to be back soon!

From the moment I called reservations and put in perma-hold - the staff was clueless . I was changed for a no show and asked to stay longer and credit my no show charged toward my extend night. Reservation manager could not figure this out and gave up extra business . Somebody please teach this people customer service and not civil service

Nice boutique hotel in the right location for sightseeing. Great view of the Chrysler Building from our room. Staff were very polite and helpful following an incident at the Airport which mean't our luggage needed to have some Californian Red dry cleaned out of our clothes asap.

The staff puts your stay on the right foot, from check in with Alex or having you bags taken to your room. The rooms are perfect with the most comfortable bed and bedding we have ever slept in. I love having a shower stall instead of stepping into a bathtub. The hotel is in the heart of midtown, close to restaurants, clubs, shopping and the theater. Obviously I can't say enough good things about this hotel but I will finish with these are the reasons we have stayed twice a year for many years. The best in NYC

the hotel is situated quite close to times square, along a row of similar hotels (sofitel, algonquin, etc.) which makes it convenient to both business in midtown as well as theaters and restaurants in the times square area. its also not that far from the higher end stores on fifth avenue as the hotel is about halfway between 5th and 6th avenue on 44th street and so the stores are about 6 to 8 blocks north.it is your typical new york hotel - elegantly done but small and tight. staff are very good and attentive and try their best to make your stay pleasant, they still drop off newspapers at the door, offer a shoeshine service, and have a number of drycleaning and laundry options to meet most needs.a couple of things to note:1) there are only two elevators, but they are not side by side, one is about two doors down from the other, but on the opposite side and its hard to see both. this means that if you are in a hurry you should check the status of the other elevator and call the one that looks the most promising (one push does not engage both elevators - you have to call each one separately).2) the HVAC system is very loud when it is running. (its an old building). this means that you should try to get your room to your desired sleep temperature well before the end of the night, or you will be hearing the system for a few hours - yes, hours). i recommend that you set it prior to going out for the evening.3) early morning room service - you can get coffee at any time, but the pastry orders don't come until after 7 am. so if you are getting up early to do some work, you might want scope out a nearby joint beforehand.4) complex TV controls - I've seen worse, but this should be seen as a big positive. its NYC, so if you don't have to work in the room, you should be out seeing the sights rather than aimlessly channel surfing in the hotel.5) bag storage is prompt and easy - no wait, no lineups.

Hotel has an outstanding location next door to the even better Sofitel (in my opinion the best hotel in NYC). The hotel is welcoming but has a very small lobby for a hotel of this type. My room was clean, slightly small and had a lovely bathroom and bath products - all round very good.

Great location -this hotel is located at right in the center of Midtown. Easy walking distance of times square, grand central, 5th avenue. very clean rooms. Good size. Comfortable beds. The shower is in the bathtub with a big step - not so good for elderly people. Morning coffee available for free in the lobby. Nice staff. Good concierge service. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone
user_name:
Kihwan K
Athens, Georgia, United States

review_body: We stay at The Iroquois multiple times a year. It is centrally located just off 5th Avenue. 2 blocks from Grand Central, Time Square, and Bryant Park train stations. Close to all the theaters and great shopping. The rooms are always spotlessly clean and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are quiet with little to no street noise or noise from other guests. Great hotel!

Great Service, Comfortable rooms and its location is almost perfect to visit NY without car. Sub is close and Central Park and area in walking distance... Highly recommend! Good Wi-Fi service, parking services efficient. Breakfast could be a little more "carefull served" but nothing to make you leave the hotel unsatisfied. Indeed a good choice of Hotel.

The best thing about this hotel was the location. great to all the major places to be/see in NYC.Good access to a variety of places to eat and a Duane Reed convenient store. I was visiting on a warm fall day. rooms were very warm and the air didn't seem to work. I had a hard time opening the window and after calling the front desk they did say they would look into the air temp, but it didn't appear they did. overall, i'd stay here again - friendly staff and very clean and well appointed rooms.

Great hotel, great location. Good size, clean rooms, helpful staff. The concierge was great. And the hotel bar, while a little small, serves really great cocktails (although it closes surprisingly early). Not cheap, but good value compared to other hotels I thought.

Our family of 6 stayed there for 4 nights--two rooms. Location was ideal. Rooms were well-appointed, kept clean, and were quiet. Very reasonably priced (for midtown Manhattan). Outstanding service from the staff. Concierge service was superb, especially important when planning outings for a family new to the city. Would highly recommend to others. I researched and reviewed countless hotels before deciding on the Iroquois and was very pleased with my decision.

We stayed at the Iroquois for our daughter’s 4th birthday recently. The hotel is beautiful, well priced and in a great location close to the theatre district. Parking is across the street. The staff is wonderful. A great experience!

Clean and mostly comfortable room but ventilation problems were not addressed. We stayed for 6 nights and really didn't get relief until day 5 when it rained and the weather changed. I called everyday to request that A/C be turned to a more refreshing setting. Nobody ever followed up with me or addressed my concerns. DIdn't seem like they were trying very hard to make us feel comfortable. Friendly enough staff but any real issues were not addressed in any sort of accountable way. Loved the location. Morning coffee was good. Check in was delayed until after 4pm which was not appreciated by our jet lagged bodies I think the service should have been a little better given the status of "luxury" boutique hotel. Requested a fridge but was discouraged by reception staff. ?? not sure why.

Very nice boutique hotel in a location convenient to all mid-town locations. Staff was very nice and helpful. Room typical size for the price. The bed was very comfortable. Good value for the price. I would definitely stay there again.

If you're going to call yourself a luxury hotel, then you ought to offer more than a tiny, poorly lighted and airless room overlooking an air shaft (that's the good part, because it was quiet). Granted we got a deal through Booking.com because it was a weekend, and we did get chocolates on our pillows—but the maid had pushed the thermostat to 80, the windows didn't open, the shower was little more than a drizzle, and the mattress had two indentations on either side of a hump covered by a single comforter (either use it and boil or toss it off and be chilled), all for a little over $300. We stay in a lot of NYC hotels—definitely would not go back to this one.

My wife and I spent one night at The Iroquois Hotel for her birthday. The reservation process was excellent- they asked for my wife's name- and when we arrived at the hotel the front desk staff wishes her a Happy Birthday and we found a bottle of wine and chocolates in our room. The room was a modest size with a large bathroom. We were on the 12th floor. The street noise was minimal. We had dinner in he Triomphe Restaurant. The service was excellent as was the food.I highly recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Ray C
Miller Place, New York

review_body: The hotel was fine but this review is of the Iroquois restaurant, which we visited almost by accident (not having the energy to go out as we usually did). We're delighted that we stayed in and tried the restaurant. The cooking was excellent, clearly produced by a chef who really understands what he's doing and the service was excellent. We both enjoyed excellently cooked fish in interesting sauces. make a point of eating in when staying at the Iroquois!

I've been to NYC three times over the past 2 years, staying in a different midtown hotel each time. The next time I go I plan to rebook at the Iroquois. Two blocks from Times Square on one side; two blocks from Grand Central Station on the other. Small room (it is NYC), w/o a view -- but I loved the room. It was clean, looked like it had been recently refurbished and was comfortable. The staff members were uniformly polite and while I was with a friend, it was safe enough for a woman to stay alone. I went to a play on 46th St by myself on Saturday night and walked back to the hotel after with no problem. I would have liked easier access to ice (you had to call room service, but they were prompt), but nothing else bothered me at all.

Friendly staff, excellent bellmen. the location is very central for subways, theaters and good restaurants. Room was clean and quiet, little traffic noise, bed was fantastic. No real view except into the NY Bar Assoc library :-)We would definitely return
user_name:
Jill A
West Linn, Oregon, United States

review_body: we found this place on booking.com and read the reviews. great location and staff. the front desk clerk allowed us to check in early which was a great advantage since we were tired from playing tourist all day. the room was large (by NY standards), clean and comfortable. I would stay here again. Actually, the room was positioned that we had an OK view but very quiet and.

It's been awhile since I've been back to the Iroquois as I try to save money every time I go to NYC. I thought that I was going to have trouble getting a room the same day of travel but I was lucky and spoke to Patrick. He was so helpful and recognized my loyalty. He gave me a reasonable rate and a beautiful room. This stay was as good, if not better than my last. The room was clean and beautiful, the staff was great and the service was excellent. I would stay here every time I go to NYC. My favorite hotel by far!!!

The Iroquois is in a great location for shows and shopping. The rooms are nice sized by New York standards, reasonably priced, clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We had a quiet room on an upper floor.

Thanks to all the friendly staff during our 3 day stay in the city. Bill, you are awesome! Comfortable rooms, great location, competitive pricing and friendly. Was here for a special birthday as well as a bit of business. Perfect for both!

Mom and I went for a girls weekend to NYC as we do every year. This year we chose the Iroquois and were not disappointed! The room size was good for NYC. Location was ideal as we were close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and the Theatre District. The concierge who helped us with our dinner recommendations even sent two glasses of prosecco with our dessert - we were very impressed! Would come back to stay here again!

I stayed here with my fiancé. We were impressed by the awesome location, you can walk to Times Square about a block. Very beautiful, nice and clean. The room was super quiet which I was surprised by considering the location at how quiet it was. Our view wasn't good but we weren't expecting a good view, our window faced a brick building. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Two things I do have to say that aren't the best, but wouldn't keep me from booking there again is that there was not inroom coffee and the robes weren't very soft. They are very nice robes, I even bought one, but I think at home I'll use fabric softener.

Loved this hotel. Normally don't take the time to fill out survey's but since I always use trip advisor myself I wanted to make sure I told the world how great this hotel is.Very boutique in size but perfect in location, customer service and decor.

The Iroquois Hotel is centrally located on W 44th St making it very close to both 5th Avenue and Broadway. It is a very well run hotel with spacious, quiet and air conditioned rooms. The staff are very friendly, courteous and helpful, so much so that I sent the manager a letter praising the staff and the hotel in general and a specific staff member who helped me solve a problem in particular. I have stayed in a number of hotels in central New York over the years and I can say without hesitation that the Iroquois is the most memorable and at the top of the “where to stay on my next trip to New York”. I highly recommend the Iroquois if you are looking for a quality hotel that has big hotel amenities with small hotel charm and personalized service.

After having visited several hotels associated with the Small Luxury Hotels of the World brand, I was expecting something a bit more luxurious and well appointed. The Iroquois was a pretty decent, clean hotel. All of their staff was friendly, hotel rooms and bathrooms were clean; however, our "premium" king deluxe was small, very dark and hot. Although there were two windows, there was no view...just emergency stairs and a brick wall. By far it was not the worst hotel experience, but a room with a comfortable temperature would have been very nice. When I called to front desk about the temperature they sent a very nice gentleman to open our room window. Thanks, I guess!! Their gym is also small, with limited workout equipment. At greater than $300 per night, I would expect that I would not have to sleep in a room with an open window to keep cool.
