This was very disappointing, as was the fact that the restaurant and the bar were closed in honor of Yom Kippur. No biggie, but it would have been great to follow our original plans and have a nice dinner in the restaurant that I've heard so many wonderful things about. For travelers that are looking for a decent hotel that is close to Times Square and Broadway shows, the Iroquois may be the ideal location...just do not expect an abundance of space, room controlled temperature, a fantastic view, or luxury!
user_name:
FrequentTraveler1973
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We just returned from a weekend at the Iroquois, our first time there. I go to NYC two or three times a year and like trying different smaller hotels. We had a very nice one bedroom suite on the 6th floor, facing 44th St. I have to agree with other posters that the rooms facing the street are quite noisy at night. My husband never travels without a couple pairs of earplugs and we both needed them. However, that's my only complaint about the hotel. The beds were very comfortable, the linens, towels and toiletries top quality. I appreciate the free wifi, which should be standard in any 3 or 4 star hotel but isn't in NYC. Finally, I think the Iroquois staff is one of the best we've encountered in NYC, uniformly excellent. Aside from the noise issues, which can be remedied with earplugs or an inside room, I highly recommend the Iroquois.

We visited The Iroquois almost 3 years ago for new year.This was our first trip to New York and generally we were not disappointed with The Iroquois.The location of this hotel is fantastic, not far from Broadway etc.The staff were very accomodating and were quick to sort theatre tickets for us.The room we had was very nice and although there was no view etc, it had a feel of a smaller friendly hotel.The only issue that we did have was that when we cisited it was consistantly below zero outside and the warm air heating in our room was inconsistant. It took a couple of prompts to resolve bu they fixed it in the end.

This was our first trip to New York and we found the Iroquois to be in an excellent location as it's right in the heart of Manhattan and therefore convenient for getting to the main tourist sites. The room was fairly small but I believe this is the norm for New York. However it was very clean with comfy beds and a lovely bathroom. The staff were friendly and the concierge was very helpful. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you're looking for reasonably priced accommodation in a great location.

The hotel is a small nicely decorated hotel in a good central location on 44th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues. We had a suite which meant it was very spacious and there was a fridge/minibar. There was no coffee/tea facilities however (not unusual in NYC). There was free wifi which was a bonus. The bathroom was oddly small for a suite. The reception staff were friendly and efficient and the concierge helpful when there (it appeared to be closed quite a lot). The one major gripe however was the noise. Not from other rooms which appear to be well insulated from each other, but from the street. We were on the 11th of 12 floors but still the noise from sirens/horns etc was quite intrusive. Presumably this historic building is not allowed double glazing! For that reason alone it is unlikely we would make a return visit. If you are a heavy sleeper however it would not be an issue.
user_name:
Mark R
Rustington, England, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel is very nicely decorated with good sized rooms & bathrooms, spoilt slightly by the ugly view of the brick wall of another building close by; which made the room very dark. This was not helped by the lighting which is provided only by lamps & one of them wasn't working so you had to go into the bathroom to see properly to apply any make-up.No tea & coffee making facilities in the room; I enquired & was told it was not allowed & that morning coffee was served free in the lobby. Also free internet access which was handy to check the emails whilst drinking my coffee. I didn't eat in the hotel so can't review the food. Nearby are plenty of coffee shops open for breakfast from 6am which was handy as coffee isn't served until 7.30am in the hotel.

We stayed at the Iroquois while attending a wedding in Midtown. It was ideal. Rooms were small - but hey, this is Manhattan - but very comfortable and quiet. Staff were charming and helpful. This is walking distance to Fifth Ave, theaters, Rockefeller Center and two major subway stations -- Bryant Park and Grand Central. The Algonquin is next door (where Martinis are $22) but reasonably priced restaurants abound and there is a good diner for breakfast just a few doors away. Unfortunately, the bar at the hotel was closed for renovations, depriving our group of a convenient gathering spot, but we worked around it. I have stayed at a number of midtown hotels over the years and I'd go back to The Iroquois.

My adult daughter and I have just returned from a four-day, three-night "girls' trip" to NYC. I used to work at the Rolex Tower, one week a month from Toronto and, on business, would stay at the St. Regis. I confess to have been badly spoiled. On personal trips over the last few years, I have travelled without an expense account and stayed at various hotels in Midtown; however, none has been entirely desirable ... until now! I received a notice from Asia Miles that Small Luxury Hotels have joined the awards program. There was an introductory offer that included bonus miles plus a first-time upgrade. Decided to give it a try at The Iroquois.What a terrific find! Located on 44th West, between 5th and 6th, it is within a five-minute walk of Times Square, the Theatre District, The Avenue, and shopping on 5th. Our room on the 9th floor faced to the back of the hotel and was wonderfully quiet. We went out daily, from 8 am to Midnight, so view was not important; not hearing the garbage trucks all night was most appreciated.Lovely Frette Italian linens, Moulton Brown comestibles, deliciously comfortable beds with big puffy duvets and deep pillows, evening turndown service, morning newspaper. Non smoking room was fastidiously clean and odour-free. Complimentary morning coffee in the lobby, to take into the front lounge, and enjoy with the newspaper. Computers available; there is also free wifi throughout the hotel. Lovely front desk, door and concierge staff.We were not able to get a complimentary upgrade for two separate beds (two doubles in a room are the maximum size available); instead, we were gifted with a bottle of wine and a box of truffles.This hotel is in a "vintage" row with most buildings dating back to the late 1800s. There are historic plaques on the building fronts that provide architectural details. Also, the street was home to the literati (playwrights, critics, writers, actors and social gossips) of the 1920's: Hemingway, Faulkner, the Marx Brothers. Fascinating history.New York has become quite an expensive city in the past five years, even more so than London and Paris. The Iroquois is comparable in price to the Hilton Garden Chelsea but oozes charm, class and amenities far beyond.We'll be back at the first possible opportunity! Thank you for a lovely stay!

If you want to be close to Times Square, and want a smaller, even cozy hotel, this is your place. The staff are really wonderful, genuinely friendly and helpful. The concierge is stellar. The rooms are perfectly nice and clean. Loved the comfy bed. Breakfast was not included, which would have been nice. We ended up at the diner down the street which was not so good and an added expense. Overall I highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay here again.

The Iroquois is a hidden gem. We've stayed there on the same weekend in August for the last 9 years. It has become our home away from home. It's not touristy like the big chains, which we love. Wonderful service, particularly from the doorman, Bill. It's wonderfully clean and well appointed. Super comfy beds. The location is ideal, just a short walk from Times Square, but far enough way from the lights and noise. We look forward to our stay each year and are sad when we leave.
user_name:
jacllb04
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here in June while celebrating my 45th birthday and loved it!! The hotel is within walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center,great restaurants and shopping! I love that it was a cool boutique hotel, super clean and good size rooms. We had the James Dean Suite,so we definitely had more room than normal but our friends were in a regular double/double room and it was considerable more spacious than other NYC hotels, The funniest things though were the closets! They were super, SUPER tiny!! We didn't have too much to hang up but the doorway couldn't have been more than 18 inches or so! Another plus.....MOST awesome pillows!! The concierge was so helpful and check in and out was a breeze. They had a refreshing citrus water in the lobby everyday and coffee in the morning.I'd absolutely stay here again on any future trip to New York!

My daughter and I just came back from a fabulous 4 day 3 night stay in New York. Our hotel was fantastic! From the hotel staff, to the room, to the location....was beyond our expectations!! It was a birthday trip for my daughter, and on her actual birthday, while we were out, they left a card and a little gift of chocolate covered stawberries ....she was so surprised..what a nice thing for them to do!!! Go to this hotel, 2 blockes from Times Square and 1 block from 5th Avenue. We loved it, will definately go back...(but I think I left a pair of my shoes there).

Stayed with a friend for 5 nights in late August on the 8th floor in a room with two double beds. No complaints at all. I spent very little time in the room other then to fall into a very comfortable bed with some truly fabulous linens on them. The room was always clean, turn down service, in room safe, lovely shampoos etc. Excellent location for shows and Times Square. The front desk was pleasant and the concierge very helpful. My only very minor quibble is that mini bar took up space on the one dresser which we could have used.

I spent a week at The Iroquois after a week or so at another hotel opposite! Great location, lovely building with very sympathetic décor and furnishings and it has an air of calm about it! Staff were pretty accommodating without falling over themselves to assist which suits me as I know NY well enough. The rooms (2) were identically furnished with good beds, linen and pillows. The air-con is controlled centrally and we all felt the rooms were stuffy and far too warm which clearly affects your sleep quality. Nice fluffy towels and gowns (had to request slippers), Molton Brown toiletries, a 'proper' hairdryer, and very quiet despite being on 44th...however I get irritated beyond belief by hotels that don't supply tea / coffee in the room. Why? You get an iron - give me a kettle! I don't always want to ring for room service just to get a cuppa! We (4 of us) only had one breakfast which was memorable for being totally unmemorable and ridiculously expensive - pop over the road to a similar hotel (read my other review!) or into any local restaurant or coffee shop for a far more enjoyable experience. Iced cucumber water was available in the lobby at all times (vile!) but coffee was only available for a couple of hours in the morning - another gripe. Maybe I'm just a bit long in the tooth! Free Wi-Fi a bonus! Probably wouldn't return, simply because it's not my favourite NY hotel.

This was my first trip to NYC and I struggled to pick a hotel. A lot of them appear to be smaller than pictures and very dated. The Iroquois was lovely and clean. Rooms were small (which was to be expected) though as I was travelling with a friend we were lucky to be able to get 2 double beds which we also found hard to find. Located within walking distance to Times Square its pretty central. Staff were helpful and friendly, I would definitely recommend the hotel.

We stayed here last April,for 7 nights, the hotel is ideally located for Fifth Ave, Times Squares and exploring Manhatten in general. Our room was small but luxurious. The bed was super comfy and the turndown and chocolates were a treat each evening.The bathroom was lovely and the toiletries were lovely and plentiful . The hotel was always spotlessly clean. The staff were always friendly and curteous, Vanessa on the concierge desk was excellent at arranging theatre tickets etc. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning there soon I hope!!

We stayed in Manhattan same time last year so compared this hotel with that visit based on similar cost. The positive reviews are so accurate and deserves current #31 best hotel. Superb location and does make a difference as could walk to many great sights and restaurants. Quality rooms and great service. We loved it and highly recommended.

Really enjoyed our stay. Location and hotel are excellent and we got a great rate. My only complaint is the lighting in the room (why do hotels have such poor lighting) but as soon as I mentioned it to the housekeeping staff they supplied an extra lamp.

Friendly staff. Very helpful. Wonderful room, clean with a view of the Chrysler building. Although next to the lift this never woke us. After a day sightseeing in humid August weather it was lovely to come back to a cool cucumber water in the lobby. Free coffee every morning. They gave us a blanket to go to Central Park to watch a night time showing. Clean room and very comfortable bed. Couldn't be better.

Great location, nice people, good restaurant for breakfast as for diner.The perfect boutique hotel were any European will feel comfortable.The concierge is a reference always helping you to find what you are looking without making money with broker ...

This is a wonderfully located boutique hotel that has everything you need for a great trip to New York City. The bedrooms while small or extremely comfortable and the beds guarantee a great night sleep. Ask for a room facing inwards..you wont have a view but there will also be no noise. Staff very helpful and there is free wifi and free use of computers and printers off the lobby

We chose this hotel on the basis of its position - a quiet street but centrally located. Our room was small - we had expected this - and had no view, just the fire escape - but this was a bonus as it meant it was very quiet, with no street noise at all. Our bed was so comfortable and we slept well every night. Nice toiletries were provided. The hotel was immaculately clean, the staff were friendly and helpful and the chilled water available on arrival back at the hotel after long days sight seeing was always very welcome. We enjoyed being close to Bryant Park - this is the most lovely place to visit any time of day, always vibrant, with music, yoga, film screenings, people working, reading, relaxing - a fantastic area which provided the opportunity to relax and enjoy the sunshine between all the sight seeing and walking. A good place to eat nearby is LT Burger - quieter and with more emphasis on the quality of the food served than some other restaurants nearby. This is a lovely hotel and we will definitely stay here again if we come back to New York.
user_name:
jmh1157
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Stayed here happily for the 2nd time but this time in a suite. It was a major increase in space, approx double the area with a comfortable lounge area and a larger bathroom - tons of room for 3 people. The only negatives were the dim lighting (why don't hotels offer at least one or two brightly lit areas?), the sofa bed mattress which is fine for a night or two but pales in comparison to the amazing beds, the lack of powerpoints, and the very tight width of the shower entrance (although there is also a very accessible bath provided). As in their other rooms the bathroom still lacks shelf space. Also front-facing rooms - I believe all suites do - get some street noise (even in the 11th floor suite). But the central location is head to beat in mid-town.
Great LocationGreat PriceGreat StaffGreat ViewCozy (i.e. small like anything in NYC) but comfortable roomWouldn't change a thing!(This line is filler to meet 200 character review minimum:xxxxxxx)

Service is great, very clean and well located in the best part of midtown: 44th and 6th. Not too far away from Times Square and the theater district, but far enough to avoid the hustle and bustle. The service is impecable and the rooms very clean. I always stay when I am on business, but would come here anytime with my family. And I'm coming back for more.

We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Every member of the staff went above and beyond what was expected to make sure that our stay was memorable. The room was nicely appointed with plenty of towels and the linens/towels were changed on a regular basis. A nice, quiet place to relax after a full day of sightseeing and activities. Conveniently located to all that you need to see in this part of the city. We were in NYC for our Son's wedding and our stay was part of a memorable 4 days.

The Iroquois is situated between 5th and 6th Avenues and two blocks from Grand Central station. The midtown location was fantastic. Close to subway and Times Square. Easy to walk to major shops and sights. This was a fabulous hotel to stay at. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean and quiet, and the beds were very comfortable. I would stay at this hotel in the future. Very impressed!

If you are looking for a quite place in Midtown Manhattan , in the center of everything , this elite hotel, is just the perfect place to stay. Deluxe rooms with Milton Brown amenities , an IPod dock and a walk in closet are in this great hotel.
user_name:
Michal M
Herzliya, Tel Aviv, Israel

review_body: I love the Iroquois. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The entire property is clean and well maintained. When traveling, I always worry about the cleanliness of the rooms and if the beds will be comfortable. There is no reason to worry at the Iroquois! The rooms are clean, the beds are very comfortable, and the rooms are a nice size, even for NYC. The location is fabulous as well. I have stayed at the Iroquois the last 3 times I have visited NYC, and I look forward to staying there again on my next trip.

We read LOTS of reviews before booking The Iroquois for our first trip to New York and were absolutely delighted with our choice. Fantastic location - close to the sights but remarkably cool, quiet and calm. Our room was on the 6th floor at the back of the building and we slept like babies. The rooms are spotless and the beds are so comfortable. Can't praise the staff highly enough - very courteous and helpful with great 'insider' tips for the city, even arranging our getaway to the airport when the streets were closed for a parade. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
user_name:
Alison S
Isle of Man, United Kingdom

review_body: I went to NYC in June with six girlfriends. This was a great place to stay. It has a great location, is intimate and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel for a sightseeing trip to the city.

First time staying at the Iroquois. This is a great location convenient to everything with several quality places to dine on the same block - Blue Bar is a must. Staff was wonderful and worked very hard to make sure our stay was the best it could be. The hotel itself is very nice and updated - only complaint we could've had was the room was very warm despite the thermostat being set to it's lowest setting. I say "could've had" because we were there on 2 of the hottest days this year. I heard other people with similar issues that were not staying at our hotel so seems to be more of a knock on the HVAC systems of these older hotels versus the Iroquois itself. We'll definitely be back.
user_location: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States
user_name:
TomD44
Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States

review_body: I stay at the Iroquois every month on business and have always found it to be a "home away from home". Everything works well at the Iroquois. The HVAC and water systems. The sheets and towels always feel brand new. The hotel is always very clean and the beds are very comfortable. The hotel has an ideal location in the heart of mid-town (equidistant from Times Square and Grand Central Station). Even still, city noises are never heard from the room so I always get great rest. The facility is fantastic but the people are what make the Iroquois exceptional and unique. This summer I took my wife and teen age children to NYC for vacation and we stayed at the Iroquois. We were very pleased with everything. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. It is obvious that they are genuine in their desire to provide you with a great experience. I highly recommend the Iroquois to anyone traveling to NYC.

Great location - quiet despite proximity to Times Square. Staff friendly and the hotel is clean and comfortable. Had a very enjoyable evening drinking cocktails in Lantern's Keep - reservations recommended.We are a couple who travel with an older relative so we enjoyed having a one bedroom suite, which was perfectly comfortable and large enough for the three of us.This was our second visit to New York. We stayed at a large well known hotel the first time - which was a comfortable and enjoyable stay. In contrast we enjoyed the smallness and intimacy of The Iroquois - and we were impressed that James Dean had once lived here.

Took my daughter to see her first Broadway play and we wanted to be within walking distance to Time Square and the theatre district. this hotel was recommended by a friend and it lived up to her recommendation. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable beds, in-room safe, old world charm. The restaurant on premises is small, but the food was magnificent. My daughter had chicken breast on a bed of spinach and she said it was the best she ever had. I had mentioned when making the hotel reservation that the trip was to celebrate my daughter's 16th birthday. When we got to the room there was a card addressed to her welcoming her to the hotel and wishing her a Happy Birthday. They also included a small of chocolate for her. It is pricey, but then it is New York City. Would definitely stay there again on any future visits

I stayed at the Iroquois twice in the summer of 2013. Both stays were excellent and I expect that I will return in the future.Coffee in the lobby every a.m. was great and cucumber water in the p.m.The concierge, Mark, was especially helpful with breakfast recommendations, a dessert tour of Hell's Kitchen, directions to various locations, and subway advice.

Our family (and a friend) stayed at the Iroquois for 10 nights in total. Walking back into the hotel, after busy days of sightseeing and shopping, felt like coming home to some peace and quiet. The hotel is warmly and elegantly styled. Friendly doorman and cucumber water welcomed us after each hot humid day and then coffee was available in the lobby each morning. Library with computers were helpful when planning tours etc. Rooms were a little small but expected in New York and surprisingly quiet for this busy city. Beds were small doubles or queens compared to European and Australian sizes...and could have been more comfortable (a bit saggy).Front office staff though friendly, interpreted requests oddly..not sure if that was our Australian rather than New Yorker accent but we were surprised by their confusion on a couple of occasions.Close to subways, cafes, Irish pubs, mini market, shopping, 5th avenue, beautiful Bryant Park, Times Sq, most of the well known sights/museums and a good walk to Central Park for some exercise and time-out of big city bustle.Overall, we had a great stay in a very central New York hotel and would recommend it to business and holidaymakers alike.

I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone visiting NYC that wanted a hotel that was central to everything and still has a nice luxury feel. The staff was extremely friendly, our room, while small, was nice and we were able to walk everywhere. The hotel is close to subways and Broadway. We got our room for $187 a night, which I would have expected to pay for a crappier hotel. Overall I'm so happy with our stay.

My wife and I stayed at The Iroquois on our honeymoon to New York City in June. The trip was a surprise morning gift to my wife, and the service-minded, kind and very helpful concierge Vanessa helped me to plan the surprise. All pre-arrival requests were executed with perfection, including hand-written card, chilled wine and restaurant bookings. Vanessa helped us a few times during our stay as well, always delivering with a smile.We got a complimentary room upgrade, a small bottle of wine and chocolate in our room due to the fact that we were newly wed. The room was spacious, clean and perfect for us. We could not have asked for anything better. The complimentary New York Times was nice, but we never found the time to read the newspaper. It was after all our honeymoon. The Iroquois really is a small luxury hotel, and in that perspective the value is really good. It was well worth the money in our opinion.Service was - as stated above - truly amazing. The entire staff greeted us with a smile - from the doormen, reception desk, cleaners and concierges. Especially Vanessa deserves praise.I have never been more comfortable recommending a hotel.

Recently my twin sons and I stayed at the Iroquois Hotel in NYC while one of my sons was attending a theater camp in the CIty. The location of this hotel is fabulous - 44th between 5th and 6th and really within walking distance to everything - the theater district, shopping on 5th and I even walked to Union Square on nice day. The rooms are a little bit small and a bit dark BUT they were very clean and the service was excellent. Vanessa, the concierge, was a great help getting us last minute theater tickets and providing us with references for things to do and places to eat for our mixed group of kids and adults. The bell desk was also a big help getting us a great driver ("Big Mo") with a suburban who could take care of our large group at the last minute and who saved us from missing the boat for our NYC harbor sailing trip. I would stay here again without a doubt and highly recommend this hotel!

We stayed for one whole week in this hotel that was picked by my sister who is a frequent traveler to New York. She had arranged everything with the concierge. The service was really well untill the last day. My father (who was just becoming 90) left some luggage in our room on the day of our leave and the hotel insisted on charging us one other night stay! We think that's a real Amsterdam like lousy treat. Furthermore New York was great and this is a good central location for your visit to Manhattan.

Pleasantly surprised as to how quiet this hotel is, right in the midst of all the cool, happenings in NYC. Was there from July 2nd to the 4th. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable There was one glitch where I requested the concierge to plan a helicopter ride for me over the city. My request was never made, so ended up doing a day at MOMA for the new LeCorbussier exhibit. I was taken aback by the $9.00 bottle of water offered in the room - yikes! Also, want to note the palatial bathroom in one of the deluxe rooms. Quite luxurious!

Took my daughter here for her 21st birthday, she'd been talking about a trip to NYC forever! It was fabulous, a real NYC experience and a delightful boutique-style hotel. It's been there a very long time (building since the 1920's I think), and it's a true gem. I spoke to the concierge weeks before our arrival, and she took care of having gourmet cupcakes (from a local bakery, DELISH!), and a bottle of champagne in our room so that when we arrived my daughter walked in and was completely surprised! There was also a lovely box of gourmet chocolates for my daughter from the hotel staff. The room was small, but beautifully appointed. Beds were very comfy, everything was clean (and I'm picky). Toiletries were heavenly. All the staff were pleasant and attentive whenever we had a need or inquiry. We had family from Jersey come into the city to have dinner with us, and the hotel doorman graciously took care of parking my cousin's SUV where it wouldn't be towed! Only a block and a half from Times Square so it's in a perfect location, and just a short walk down from the hotel is the Red Flame Diner where we had delicious breakfasts every single morning we were there! You can't beat the Iroquois NYC for a wonderful stay!

Whilst several friends and colleagues were staying at the Hilton up the road, I chose the Iroquois. Its affordable prices and quiet relaxed atmosphere meant I made the right choice. It is well located to access all the main tourists locations, without the feel of being in the centre of New York. The service of the staff and the quality of the rooms were both outstanding.

We stayed at the Iroquois July 28th to 30th, 2013. We were greeted with friendly staff who were extra helpful and extra accommodating. It was clearly obvious they LIKED people, and their work. The hotel is located in a highly competitive location, but holds a special position by way of their attention to detail and extra friendly accommodating staff. We enjoyed our stay 100%, and had nothing at all to complain about!!! The room was small, but this is the norm in NYC. It is located right in between Times Square and 5th avenue, and many many premium attractions are located just a few minutes walk. We never needed the subway or Taxi form here. It was SUPER!!!

We usually stay right next door at the Algonquin (previously reviewed) but thought we'd try the Iroquois for a change. It was a wonderful experience AND less expensive. The staff from arrival to departure were professional, friendly, helpful and accommodating. The hotel was beautifully kept, updated and very clean. Because our flight was cancelled twice, they offered a fully stocked and clean bathroom for us to shower and change clothes before finally departing. We visit NYC often and Iroquois will be the place we choose to stay.

We stayed at the Iroquois for 5 days at the end of our America trip. The service and staff were fantastic, the room and amenities were first class, and the location was only 2 short blocks from Times Square. The on site restaurant, Triomphe, was first class, with absolutely wonderful food. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

We love this hotel and have stayed in it a few times. Staff are always friendly, the service is great and the rooms are immaculate. The hotel is very central and we just love going to the Red Flame Diner along the road.

During our occasional trips to NYC, we look for reasonable luxury and value--The Iroquois had both. The typically compact NYC hotel room was clean, well maintained, and nicely furnished. The bathroom was modern and well designed. The cleaning staff get high marks and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Great bartender--makes a superb martini and knows how to converse with his customers. No bellhop, however, was available to help with our luggage upon arrival, which was fine because I can manage it and it saved me a tip. Upon leaving, I brought my luggage down myself but would have appreciated some help with the door and loading it into the car--instead, the bellhop just stood and watched, apparently offended my self-service--so they get poor marks. Irrespective of the bellhops, we would still, for the right price, stay again at The Iroquois. CaptainJ
user_name:
James P
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is a nice, clean, classic hotel located in Midtown Manhattan. A beautiful old gem for a decent value.Location:The hotel is quite close to both Penn Station and Grand Central. Just a short walk to Bryant Park, Times Square and Rockefeller Center and just a little longer walk to Museum Row, The Park and Madison Ave. This location is also very close to Broadway. For a typical tourist it's nearly a perfect location. However my personal opinion varies a bit. I've been to Manhattan a lot. Midtown no longer does it for me. In fact my belief is that nothing differs from "real" New York City more than Manhattan. I prefer Brooklyn or one of the villages. This opinion however does not effect my rating.Rating: 4 StarsAppearance/Condition:The building is roughly 113 years old. It's a gem that has been restored beautifully. The street is clean and the condition of the building is very good. The lobby is classic and clean. It reflects the style of the building in its heyday and is in very good condition. The elevators are a bit small, slow and old, but it is not an issue.Rating: 4 StarsService/Check in:Efficient, polite and without issues. A new person was being trained and she did very well. No issues here. They referred to me by name and gave me a welcome packet.Rating: 5 StarsRoom:Small but comfortable. Nicely furnished although a bit dark. The one window in the room opened up to basically a small shaft in the center core of the building. No biggie because when one is in New York one shouldn't be spending time in the hotel room. The only problem I had with the room was the AC was REALLY loud (so were people int he hallway from time to time...don't people know to be quiet?) as was the mini-bar and the fridge we had put into the room. We didn't get any exterior noise however. The room has a mini-bar (don't touch anything or you'll be billed) but they will bring up a fridge upon request.Rating: 4 StarsBed:I rate the bed separately, since a great room can have an awful bed and an awful room can have a great bed. This one had an average bed. I slept well, but didn't want to spend all day in the bed.Rating: 3 StarsOverall Rating:4 Stars

What a perfect little sanctuary this is! Perfect combination of an elegant old world feel with modern comforts and amenities. Great location from which to enjoy so much of what NY has to offer.. As I was traveling on business, appreciated the quiet, well lit room with free wi-fi. Loved the ambiance and service throughout the hotel. Memorable stay!

This hotel us exceptional. Rooms are small but for NYC this is normal. Staff is friendly and courteous. You gave to call for ice but it is delivered promptly. the location is outstanding. Overall, staying here was a good experience. The bed was so comfy! Excellent shower too

First time at this hotel and I'm already planning a return. The location is perfect - close to Times Square and Broadway shows easy walking distance, close to major subway stops, plenty of dining options of all types nearby. I was especially impressed with the friendly and helpful staff and the extremely helpful concierge. The room was small but not tiny - felt open despite the size. Bed VERY comfortable, bathroom well appointed and the shower had plenty of power. Adequate cable stations and DVD with available movies at the desk. Fitness facility small but had cardio machines, some weight machines, and free weights in addition to sauna. Restaurant is excellent if expensive. I chose to enjoy breakfast at diner 1/2 block down the street which was pleasant and more affordable. Overall an excellent place!!

I have stayed at the Iroquois before and really enjoyed it. The location is stellar a short walk to the best dining and plays it really is my favorite location. The rooms are small (NYC) but the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. It is a small boutique hotel so you get a level of service that is higher than what you might find in other hotels. Staff is super friendly too. Turn down service includes a chocolate on the bed! The only uber small issue is that they have the mini bar essentially out in the open and when we were there it took a moment to register that this was not included (last time they gave us a bottle of wine and free sparkling water). So on the counter are mini bottles of vodka, pringles and everything is super pricey. Since it was taking up so much space I asked them to remove it. I would suggest anyone does that as well because it is slightly tacky. Overall I would 100% return to this lovely hotel and recommend it to anyone.

After two pleasant stays, I would still return for a third. The only caveat is that I would specify a quiet room because the room assigned to me for my most recent stay in The Iroquois was subject to random noise and vibration from an external source, like a generator or window-unit air-conditioner being turned on next door.Rooms are reasonably large and comfortably furnished, with good lighting. WiFi is free and works well in-room and in public areas. Staff are always friendly, helpful and considerate. Thoughtfully, in the summer heat, complimentary drinking water flavoured with slices of fruit is available as soon as one walks into the lobby.

I stayed 2 nights. My room was small but i didn't need more space. There is plenty of space to put clothes. The hotel has a lot of charm yet it is not run down. The bathroom was great. Loved it. Staff very young and extremely friendly.

This is a wonderful hotel! I came for a theatre conference and the hotel is perfectlly situated for attendig the theatre; completely within walking distance. Somehow, it manages to be on a quiet street, so there was no Manhatten traffic noise in the room. Everything about the decor was lovely and classy. There was a pricey minibar in the room, but I was instructed very clearly how to NOT accidentally get charged for it. There is no accessible ice machine, but the staff are happy to bring it to you, it just made me feel a little guilty to make someone have to get it for me. The nightly turndown service with little chocolates was a delicious touch. I stayed in a "Superior" room, which has 1 queen sized bed. The room wasn't large, but there was plenty of room for the bed and a desk and dresser for clothing. The bathroom was good sized and complete with robes. I can't wait to go back there again!

We had a lovely stay at The Iroquois in a one-bedroom suite. The furnishings are top-notch, old world elegance and well maintained. The staff were also extremely accommodating with our 15-month old son. I liked the little touches like a newspaper delivered to your door each morning, coffee in the lobby before noon and citrus water in the afternoons.

Excellent little gem close to Times Square, Grand Central Terminal and Bryant Park. The hotel provides all those little things that make a stay comfortable and cozy. Refreshing water cooler in the lobby, complimentary coffee and the NY Times and Wall St Journal in the library and of course wireless internet throughout, To sum it up The Dictator of Wazierstan could not say What you mean $20 a night for the @#$#$%@ internet? The staff are friendly, knowledgeable and made the stay a more rewarding experience than an oversized luxury chain flagship that is more interested in polishing the outside and lobby than to be a hospitality hotel. The hotel is close to the major subway lines. All in all an enjoyable experience.

Found this hotel through booking.com. Very central location a couple of minutes from Times Sq. Small lobby. Polite and efficacious reception staff, doormen, bellboys etc. Requested adjacent rooms - interconnecting and were available. The rooms were well equipped, clean and nicely decorated. Free wifi with good reception. We didn't use the spa, room service, bars. I think this hotel is great for this area, for value of money in NYC. Don't expect to have dinner here.

A very nice mall hotel very near to Times Square .We found al the staff very helpful and friendly .It is practical because it was very central to areas of our interest .We also found the king size bed very comfortable which is quite unusual for us. It has a nice little bar as well.

I am a world traveler and am used to the international concept of luxury for hotels and airlines. Unfortunately, luxury in West and in particular the United States is completely different concept. Especially, New York luxury hotel in Manhattan is often code for a name brand hotel in an excellent location. Service and facilities are often old and rundown. Not only is the Iroquois in an excellent location but the facilities and service is the epitome of luxury - flavored, cold water at the reception, complimentary WIFI, fitness center and sauna access for guests, and rooms are clean and updated.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Iroquois. We received incredible personalized attention. Walking through the madness that was the big name hotel directly on Times Square made me really appreciate the Iroquois. If you want cutting edge, modern design- go down the street. If you want tasteful and comfortable- try the Iroquois. We were offered the chance to upgrade ($30 per night) the second/third night and it was worth it but both rooms were very nice. My best advice- don't go to NYC during a heat wave. Wait until October!

This was our second stay at the Iroquois, this time over 4th of July for 3 nights. You cannot beat the location - less than 2 blocks to Times Square but on a quiet street with great dining options. There is both fine dining and a great little diner within steps of the hotel. There was an issue with the safe not unlocking but an engineer came right away and opened it. The electronics had a problem and the safe had to be replaced, which took some time. We were comped for 2 glasses of wine for the inconvenience, which was a nice touch and seemed fair. The concierge was great and artfully guided us away from trying to watch fireworks with the millions of other people along the river. The other staff - desk staff, bar staff, even housekeeping - were all very friendly and personal. You walk in the door and instantly feel cared for. The room was small, but hey - it's New York. The bed was very comfy, linens were top of the line, and there was very little external noise. One thing - the A/C is centrally controlled and you can adjust the amount of air coming in but not the temperature. We were comfortable but would have preferred to be able to control the temperature to make it a little cooler for sleeping. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but did have drinks. 18% gratuity is automatically added to the bill, which did seem a little presumptuous although the service was excellent.

Always friendly and welcoming, The Iroquois staff makes this member of the Small Leading Hotels group a standout. Its West 44th location, just a few minutes from Grand Central Terminal, situates the guest for easy getting around, shopping and trying interesting eateries. I had an issue with noise keeping me awake. Quickly, the staff relocated me to a upgraded room. They were quite gracious, letting me know that the noise from the pipes was not the norm and that it was being addressed. Some family members use the Iroquois as home base when in NYC. I can see why. When you walk in, they greet you by name, creating a warm yet appropriate atmosphere. The concierge desk is most accommodating with recommendations, reservations and anything you need.

We stayed for a week. The location is great, near buses and subways, half way between upper west side and Greenwich Village and the lower east side, and on the edge of broadway. Staff are wonderful, particularly Vanessa the concierge, for whom nothing was too much trouble. Nice touches: citrus water in the lobby, iron and ironing board in the room. The rooms - ours, anyway - are comfortable, with all the facilities we wanted. It would have been nice to adjust the air conditioning temperature, but overall, a really good place to stay.

The Iroquois is a member of the Small Leading Hotels group and has maintained an excellent standard for the four years that I have been using it. The hotel is situated on West 44th street midway between 5th and 6th avenue perfect for shopping, nightlife and travel with Grand Central a 5 minute walk away. The rooms are beautiful with classic decoration, excellent beds with egyptian cotton sheets, small but adequate bathrooms, good wifi and the bedrooms at the back of the building are exceptionally quiet for New York. Service is second to none, with well trained receptionists doubling up as tour guides. The Hotel restaurant Triomphe serves breakfast delights and is a must for dinner or lunch, it is another New York secret fast becoming reknown for delightful romantic dinners and exquisite meals. The Iroquois is what it says on the label A Small Leading Hotel, and in my opinion one of the best in New York!

We had a great experience with the friendly staff here. The minibar in the room is pricey so stay away. The rooms are tiny for the money, but since it is New York I suppose that's normal. We walked to Times Square, less than 5 minutes. Close to all kinds of restaurants. City bike rentals and subway locations are close by as well. You don't get much of a view but if you're not spending much time in the room, I say it's a pretty good place to stay in the city!

The Iroquois is a boutique hotel that gets it right! While all boutique hotels claim to specialise in personalised service, stylish decor, great dining and a unique atmosphere, the Iroquois is one of the few that actually gets all of these things right. I had been to New York before and as the hotel is right in Midtown I was expecting a tiny room with limited amenities. Boy was I wrong! We were upgraded from our King Premier room to a suite which was double-the-size of an already good-sized room. The suite included a large living room with two couches, TV, bar and desk and a bedroom with King-size bed and bathroom with separate shower and bathtub. The bed was well appointed with large, squashy pillows and pillow-top mattress akin to the ultra-comfy beds one finds at 5-star hotels. Bathroom amenities included Molton Brown accessories and nice quality towels. Beyond the physical size of the room, I was impressed by the quality of the design. This is what a boutique hotel should be. Both the living room and bedroom had giant floor to ceiling windows and warm coloured tones in the furniture, window dressing and bed dressing. The couches, bed, and seats were all very comfortable. It was a wonderful cozy feeling to return to after a day of pounding the pavement sight-seeing in New York and considering the size, it felt incredibly luxurious and indulgent considering we were in the heart of Manhattan. In addition to the room, I was very impressed with the service. One measure I always use for service in a hotel is whether all of the staff great you when passing (including housekeeping and doormen). The Iroquois certainly passed that test. Of course, evening turndown service is provided and doormen were quick to offer umbrellas when it rained. I must single out Vanessa, the concierge as superb and one of the finest and most efficient concierges I've experienced. Her Mexican restaurant recommendation was spot on and she never had to rely on books or maps to help us along the way. She is a true asset to the hotel and compliments its fine style and rooms. One other surprise, was the quality of the dining. I'm not usually one for dining in hotel restaurants, but we looked up reviews of the Iroquois' French restaurant and they were very favourable, so on our first night we decided to give it a try. Again, excellent service and superb food all round. The bar too, has great reviews and was packed each night such that we didn't even try to go down for a night cap. Usually, in these small hotels, the dining and bar is seen as an after thought, but not at the Iroquois!And finally, the location right in Mid-town is ideal for any tourists to the city. Located along a street lined with the private clubs of Ivy League universities, the Iroquois is a short walk from Times Square (and all the key subway lines), Broadway shows, Grand Central Station, Union Square, 5th Avenue Shopping and Central Park.All in all, the Iroquois has to be one of my favorite surprise hotel finds on my travels. Very few properties can tick all the boxes from room, decor, service, dining and location but the Iroquois does it. Further, to find such a hotel where the atmosphere is so warm and service oriented in mid-town was a welcome surprise. I loved my stay here and could not find a single fault. I would not hesitate to return when I am next in New York and recommend it whole-heartedly for anyone looking for some luxury, great service and warm atmosphere in Midtown.

Great location and super helpful staff. Mark, the concierge was extremely helpful with all of our needs. Nice touch to come back from a long walk and have some fresh citrus water in the lobby. Would totally recommend this hotel for convenience, hospitality, and value. No view from room.

We recently stayed at The Iroquois for five nights at the end of June for my 18th Birthday. The hotel was fab. The lobby area was great. It was nice to come in after a long day of walking, grab a glass of citrus water they offered and head up to the room to relax and to get ready to go out to dinner. All the staff were very friendly and welcoming. Nothing was too much trouble for them. We rang down almost every night for a bucket of ice and within minutes, a large bucket was ready for us at out room. The hotel also offers a DVD library service. There are nearly 200 films to choose from. It was great because they are free and handy especially if you like to watch the tv before you go out in the morning or before you go to bed a night. Vanessa (the concierge) was also great. If we told her where we wanted to go that day, she would plan it out, tell us the best way to get there and arrange any tickets needed for the attractions. She also convinced us to get the New York Subway which we thought would be complicated when in fact it was quite straight forward. The room we stayed in was The 'Superior Two Double Beds'. This room was located on the fourth floor and was lovely. Very quiet, however it was a little bit dark because of lack of lighting and the bathroom was a little bit on the small side. However the hotel was really well situated, very close to Times Square and Fifth Avenue. Overall a great hotel, would stay there again especially because of the location and the friendliness of the staff!
user_name:
adamharding95
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Room was okay-nicely appointed-great bed-no view-could not have blinds open as looked directly at room or brick wall,broken bedside lamp. Vanessa the concierge was amazing,extremely helpful,positive,knowledgeable-almost worth the $.Staff was very good,location good,will try a different hotel next time.

The hotel is small and quiet it is close to Times Square and yet now right in the heart of it. I was able to walk to both of the shows that I saw without concern for safety. My room was comfortable and the staff was great. One of the doorman John was extremely kind and helpful. But I have to say that the concierge, Vanessa made my trip successful. She is knowledgable and always there to help.She would print out directions, make reservations for restaurants and excursions for me just go the extra mile to help you to enjoy your visit. She is a true professional. So if you decide to check into the Iroquois make sure that you speak with Vanessa.

First off, the staff here is one of the most friendly and professional staff of any hotel I have stayed at. Bill and Vanessa (concierge) were extremely friendly and helpful. Mark, the other concierge could stand to get some training on how to interact with people from Vanessa but everyone else was phenomenal. The rooms are small but very nice and clean. The location is one of the best in the city. You are literally blocks from many things including Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Broadway Plays, Empire State Bldg, and much more. WiFi, fitness center, etc included in your rate unlike many places that charge extra for the amenities. Would definitely stay here again.

The best thing about this hotel is the location, right in the center of Midtown. The decoration is classic, which also means the rooms may seem a little dated. The shower is in the bathtub with a big step - not so good for elderly people. Morning coffee available for free in the lobby. Nice staff. Good concierge service. Diners nearby. Overall, recommended!

Good points - location, you are only a few walkable blocks from the Empire State Building, Rockerfeller Tower, Times Square and the shopping on 5th Avenue.- concierge advice was helpful.Bad points - breakfast, menu and price? We never did find out. There is a reasonable diner a few doors along if you are on a budget,or like us, know that if the price isn't displayed it is probably expensive! - air conditioning was noisy- complimentary tea / coffee all day would have been a nice touch, instead of a couple of hours in the morning.- cleanliness, the bathroom was fine, in the bedroom however areas under the desk were very dirty, not all of the extension point sockets worked.

I've often passed by The Iroquois hotel each time I visit NYC. I've stayed at the nice hotel beside it several times and often appreciated how The Iroquois would generously share their business center's computer each time the other hotel's system had problems. This time, I decided to try them out and spent 11 days with them last December. It was a wonderful stay, to say the least. The front desk personnel were friendly, warm, and very accommodating, particularly their Filipino night manager. The rooms were comfortably spacious by New York City standards and the refurbished hotel's feel was homey and inviting. When there was a slight problem with the elevator, they looked me up and I received a box of chocolates and personal letter from the Manager granting me a suite upgrade on my next stay (which I plan to use when I return this coming December). This was a hotel who looked after you, and made sure to anticipate your needs. And the midtown location can't be beat, right at the heart of where the action is, yet secure and quite peaceful.

Had stayed here a few years ago and liked it so was pleased to find it was still a top-notch venue. It is very convenient to Times Square, Bryant Park, Grand Central Terminal, Broadway, subway stops and many great restaurants. We had an executive suite and it was large by New York standards. The bed is probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept on. All the staff from the front desk to the doorman were courteous and helpful. We had a little trouble with the cooling of the room the first night but they rectified the problem in short order. They were going to move us to another room if we were not satisfied. The cost was in line with hotels in that area. Being down 44th reduces the noise level considerably. Although you don't get much road noise, you may want to request a room off the road but it's really not an issue as the front rooms seem to be very well sound proofed. Will be back again.

Staying here for 4 nights, close to Times Square but far enough away to be peaceful! Very clean hotel, rooms cleaned immaculately every day. Chilled water and morning coffee an advantage as are the Molton brown toiletries and chocolate each night! Would definitely recommend this hotel to first time visitors to NYC!:)

Have stayed in several mid-town Manhatten hotels....The Iroquois is in the top two (with the Intercontinental.) The Iroquois is closer to Times Square, however. Rooms were the cleanest we've seen, staff was really friendly....new me by name; concierge staff was friendly and helpful. Great coffee shop across the street and Bryant Park and subway are about 3 blocks' walk. REALLY quiet.

The Iroquois is a relaxing and elegant hotel in busy New York. The location is ideal, as there are so many interesting restaurants and sights close by. A short stroll from Broadway, Grand Central Station, Byrant Park and the Public Library. Away from the hustle and bustle. The restaurant and bar were first class. A fabulous pre dinner drink in the elegant bar followed by a great meal. The breakfasts are great, non stop coffee. All the staff were professional, friendly and helpful. We loved the chocolate and weather forecast when the beds were turned down at night. A lovely touch. We can highly recommend this hotel.

This charming boutique hotel is in a great loaction. It's within walking distance of Time Square, Broadway, Rockfeller Center and more. Our room was very clean and all of the hotel staff were very attentive and helpful. The bed was very confortable. The rate for the location was reasonable. I would definetly recommend the hotel and stay here again.

Thanks tripadvisor friends for telling us about The Iroquois Hotel! This was our home for the past 5 days and it was PERFECT for our first trip to New York! 2 blocks from Times Square, 3-5 blocks from both musicals we attended, 3 blocks from Grand Central Station and the shops on 5th Avenue, close to the subway, 5 blocks from the tour we loved (1/2 on bus, 1/2 on boat) called See It All New York from On Board Tours, etc. Loved Hotel Staff Vanessa who helped with directions and advice and Rocky the bellman who was pleasant and helpful. The room was bigger than I expected after reading what others had said. Perfect for a Mother, Daughter and Grandaughter!

Just took my daughter to NY for her high school graduation. This hotel has such a great location. Just a block and half from Phantom and all the hustle and bustle of Time Square.Yet stepping into the hotel at the end of a long day, was like visiting a spa. It was quiet and luxurious. Great turn down service and Vanessa, the concierge, was so helpful with direction and making reservation. I will definitely be back.

It was my wife's 'special' birthday and I decided to take her to New York for a week to celebrate. We had never been to NY before and wanted to see as many of the sights as possible whilst there. The problem was; which hotel and where in NY should we book? So I turned to Trip Advisor for help. Eventually I settled on 'The Iroquois'. The choice proved well founded. The Iroquois is perfectly located; approximately 5 minutes walk from Times Square and 15-20 minutes walk from both Central Park and the Empire State Building. The hotel staff were very welcoming on our late (1am) arrival and when we awoke the next morning we experienced our only, very slight, grumble. Due to the surrounding high rise buildings, there was no natural light in the room and it was necessary to have the lights on all the time. However this is the only very petty grumble and certainly never detracted from the rest of the plusses of the hotel which included: free wifi throughout the hotel, a free daily newspaper delivered to the room, free coffee in the morning and free cold fruit water in the afternoon; available in the lobby. Unfortunately we never slept too well the first 2 nights; this was due (in our opinion) to a far too soft mattress. We therefore asked at reception if it might be possible to change it? The reception staff were most helpful and said they would speak to maintenance to see if anything could be done. That night and the rest of our stay was spent in perfect slumber!! This incident was typical of all of the staff throughout the hotel, who we found to be very friendly and helpful. For first time visitors to New York; 'The Iroquois' is perfectly located. It has great facilities with friendly helpful staff. For returning visitors to New York; you would struggle to find a better value for money hotel and my wife and I would highly recommend it.

This hotel is the utmost in luxury. The room was beautifully decorated, immaculate and quiet. There were plenty of towels, delicious chocolates and a complimentary New York Times. The staff was professional, friendly and helpful. The location is prime- walking distance to everywhere but with private transportation readily available. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a first rate Manhattan hotel.
user_name:
Richie K
Suffern, New York, United States

review_body: Great location. Easy walking distance of times square, grand central, 5th avenue, etc. Very clean rooms. Good size. Comfortable beds. Helpful staff. Plus a few nice touches like free chilled water in the lobby, free coffee in the morning, newspaper delivered to your room. Would highly recommend the hotel and would definitely stay again.

I had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Iroquois during May. The location was perfect - so close to amazintg sights and subway stations. It was also an easy walk to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway and great restaurants. The staff were very helpful and the room was amazingly quiet and comfortable. Thank you!

The hotel was quiet and relaxing. All of the staff were extremely helpful & kind and the concierge had great recommendations for restaurants & shows! We didn't eat at the hotel but heard others compliment the quality. Location of hotel was PERFECT...walking distance to Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Grand Central Station, etc. Beautiful rooms and very comfortable beds! Would stay there again in a heartbeat!!!

As the cab pulled up to the front door we knew we had made the right choice. The doorman greeted us and we were cared for as if we were staying at a 5 star hotel. The ambiance of the small lobby was upscale and pleasantly appointed with a library housing not one but two computers for guest use as well as newspapers and books. They also informed us that they have a DVD library available at no charge. Everyone we encountered throughout our 3 night 4 day stay couldn't have been more pleasant or helpful. The room was comfortable and very clean, the bed comfortable and my husband loved the water pressure in the shower. Perfectly located for our visit, we had theatre tickets both Friday and Saturday nights and even walked to Penn Station for our venture out to Long Island. I will recommend this hotel to everyone.

I took my mother to NYC for the first time as a Mother's Day gift, and our hotel experience at the Iroquois was second to none. The room was lovely, the staff was exceptionally friendly, and the hotel was in an excellent spot near Times Square to go to the theatre, catch the subway, or go out to dinner. I will certainly recommend the Iroquois to others, and I hope to come back sooner rather than later. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

7 girlfriends went to New York and chose this hotel. Perfect decision. From the moment we arrived the staff at the Iroquois could not do enough for us. Tour advice/directions/restaurant reviews, thoroughly knowledgeable!!!! The rooms were lovely and clean, and the beds excellent.We will tell our friends, and we all would stay here again!!!!!

We recently stayed at the Iroquois Hotel in New York for a couple of days. All I can say is: Brilliant! Beautiful hotel, friendly service, great restaurant. The rooms are beautifully presented. We stayed in one of the deluxe rooms. On check in, we were surprised with a fruit platter in our room. Service at this hotel is excellent!

We stayed for two nights at the Iroquois Hotel in Mid-May. We had reserved a king bed room. The hotel is beautiful and well maintained. The lobby is nice and the staff exceptional. From the front desk staff to the housekeeping & maintenance staff, they offer great customer service. The bellman was friendly and gave us a full overview of how everything in the room worked, which was very helpful during our stay. Also, we had a slight problem with the ironing board and they came and replaced it within minutes of our reporting it to the front desk. The room was very well appointed and clean. The bed was firm and very comfortable. The location is perfect for attending the theater and has wonderful restaurants near-by. Overall, this is a great hotel and we would definitely stay here again.

While not inexpensive, this hotel is reasonable by Manhattan standards and frequently has some good deals available. It is small and has a delightful atmosphere. Most rooms are not large but that is generally true in the city. They are very comfortable, well designed, with many appreciated amenities (such as robes) and excellent beds. Service at all levels is very attentive and they also have a delightful little bar off the lobby which is very appealing. The location is about the best in the city for a wide range of activities, especiually the theater.

We stayed for four nights at the Iroquois and thought it was excellent. It was our first time in New York and the location was brilliant - right in the middle of all the main tourist sights, a couple of blocks from Times Square and a few blocks from Central Park and the Empire State Building. But even though it's in the centre of everything, as soon as we stepped into the hotel, it was completely peaceful, far away from the noisy NYC streets. Our room was also remarkably quiet, very clean and very comfortable. The concierge was particularly helpful and very knowledgable. The cocktail bar looked lovely although we didn't use it.

We stayed at the Iroquois for 8 days in Dec 2010/Jan 2011; I admit that was ages ago but I will never forget our experience here. It was fantastic and I tell every Australian going to NYC about this little gem -great hotel, wonderful staff. We stayed 2 extra nights as we got stuck here (thankfully) during the blizzards. It is obvious from recent reviews that the hotel has managed to maintain its great reputation. I'll be back!

Each year when we have a ":Go to NYC" trip we always stay at the Iroquois. The accomodations and hotel personell are wonderful each time, but this year we had some special assistance that we want to recognize. Vanessa Torrellas, Chef Concierge, went way beyond the normal service when she personally walked over to the theater where I had lost my perscription glasses. She found and sent the glasses to me the very same day - now is that something, or what! Thank you Vanessa, I hope that you receive the special recognition that you deserve!
user_location: Southern Pines, North Carolina, NC USA
user_name:
Linda D
Southern Pines, North Carolina, NC USA

review_body: After reading reviews on this site, we booked this hotel for an eight night stay. There were three of us the first two nights and then just two of us the rest of the time. I had made two reservations and we were going to have to switch rooms but Patrick at the front desk arranged it so we could have two room near each other and my husband and I would not have to change rooms when our son left - the best part - no more cost involved!! So happy over this! One of the rooms was not quite ready so we waited in the lobby for about 30 - 45 minutes. When we got to the room, we had a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolate dipped strawberries waiting for us, wow! Talk about service! The hotel is in a perfect location for the subway and MANY attractions. Bill and the other staff at the hotel were very helpful also, such nice people! Our room was very clean and nice. The service was great and although on the 12th floor, we never had any delays or problems getting an elevator. Especially loved the make up mirror in bathroom and the comfy pillows, not hard and puffy. We really enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend this hotel.

Just about to leave New York after a four day trip with a friend and making the most of the computer in the library to write a quick review of the hotel. The biggest plus about this hotel is it's location. it is ideally located for all the main attractions - walking distance to Times Square, Empire State, the designer shops (50th to 59th street - my personal favourite!). Central Park is a bit of a treck but a cab only costs about 6USD. The hotel staff are very friendly and professional and made us feel very welcome. Our room (508) was very clean and quiet and although we didnt use all the facilities - mini bar, TV etc - it was nice to have them. Its hard to find anything negative to say about this hotel - I think they've got the service, decor and comfort spot on! Will be sad to leave New York but when I do come back I'll certainly be staying at the Iroquois.

My mum and I enjoyed a weekend in NYC based at the Iroquois which was surprisingly quiet given that it was just around the corner (and down the street) from Times Square. Location-wise it really is great, with just a short walk to the subway, Times Square and the Public Library. The rooms were certainly on the small size but we did have a window for some natural light. The suitcases had to be stored upright between the beds and the walls and when it came time to pack all the shopping finding flat surfaces was a bit of a challenge. The bathroom in comparison was large and spacious with a fabulous shower and although there was not much bench space around the basin, the window ledge came in very handy. The beds were comfortable and the pillows adequate. Although coffee/tea or hot cider was on offer in the lobby it would have been more convenient to have a kettle in the room - although there wasn't really any spare horizontal surfaces to store it on.

The Iroquois fills the bill if you are looking for a relatively large, beautifully adorned suite in Midtown. It provides excellent value if you stay for three or more days. Staff were very attentive at check-in. We joined the membership club and received a lovely amenity - chocolate dipped strawberries, and a half bottle of wine after check-in. The hotel is in close proximity to Bryant Park as well as the theater district. Highly recommended.

Great 7 night stay in September/October. Staff were fantastic and very willing to help with your requirements. Reception were incredible and knew the city like the back of their hand with quick and accurate directions. Also knew what the best offers to make everything easier. Also gave great recommendations on things I would have never thought to do. Would definitely stay here again

After reading all the reviews, my wife and I stayed here for a weekend in New York and were extremely satisfied. Unlike at other hotels that we have stayed at in New York in the past, the staff was extremely friendly and courteous. Our room (610) was very well appointed, very clean, in great condition and very quiet. Being only minutes away from the Theatre District and Times Square and from many great restaurants as well as having a parking garage across the street ($35 for 24hours) were added bonuses. Their continental breakfast (which was complimentary when booking through their website) was delicious. We will return in the future.

Booked a room at noon through the hotel directly. Asked for adjoining rooms as I had 2 kids and my wife with me. Explained that if the rooms were not adjoining, I didn't want the rooms. "No problem, they are available." Show up at 6PM, "Yeah, they aren't available." I was ready to blow my top. The manager apologized profusely, discounted the 2 rooms by 25%, and offered to find me another place to stay. We stayed and my wife and kids slept in one room and I slept in the other. Totally defeating the point of having 2 rooms. However, everyone makes mistakes. They handled it very well in my opinion. They lose half a star for this minimum.The hotel rooms were average sized for NYC, but there was some grime on the water bottles and hair on the bathroom floor. Not a 5 star experience. They lose another half star for this.All in all, for NYC, if I would've received what I reserved, I would've been very happy.Alex P.

My wife and I stayed here for five nights early April 2012 and loved it. All of the staff made you feel welcome, from the check-in to the exit it was quite an experience.The room, while not overly large (by Australian standards), was large enough for us. The bed was super comfortable, the bathroom was extremely well appointed – although the shower took some guess work the first time – should have listened more closely to the bell boy when he explained the workings of the room to us – but it was 1030pm at the end of a 24 hour trip from Sydney !The best thing about the room was that we hardly heard any street noise. Being a first timer in NYC (and a light sleeper) I expected to be woken every five minutes with traffic noise, which was not the case. I think we were in room 1012.The hotel is within walking distance to Times Square and plenty of other NYC attractions. We hardly caught a taxi, as it is so easy to walk around NYC – even down to the 9/11 memorial site and up to the end of Central Park.There are heaps of restaurants close by, but if you want to go further afield, taxis are everywhere and really cheap – compared to Australia.We will definitely stay at the Iroquois again when next in NYC.

We selected this hotel due to reviews on this site, we were not disappointed. The staff were all friendly and helpful during our stay and went out of their way to see any queries we had were dealt with promptly. We were situated two block from the middle of Times Square and two blocks from Grand Central Station, so getting anywhere was a breeze with subway stations all around. You do walk a lot in New York, so being central was really helpful. However it was far enough off the main thoroughfare to be a nice quiet haven at the end of the day.The decor was tidy, sure if we wanted to be like others and try and find every little small chip on a tile or something we probably could have, but it never felt anything other than well kept. As others have said, rooms in New York are small be we never felt cramped with the three of us all in there at once.There are also Duane Reade stores all over to get snacks, fruit, drinks, medicine etc, which came in handy when needing snack for our lactose intolerant daughter!Thanks for the enjoyable stay!

Friendly, courteous, helpful staff especially Bill very helpful. Luxurious bedding, comfortable and just right, chocolates with bed turn down service at night, plenty of towels and a complimentary dressing gown for use, rooms clean and our two double bed room had enough space for two suitcases, one fitted on the hanging space floor and the other near the chair, not in anyones way. Didn't need to adjust the air conditioner just right all the time. Water was hot and plentiful in shower, bathroom was clean with plenty of towels, had a makeup mirror and a hairdryer. Hotel reception, has hot cider in the cold weather and cold fruit flavoured water in the warmer days. Two Computers and a printer in the Library for use FOC. Hotel provide a service for your luggage after check out if required. Doorman helpful, hotel has a Sauna and also a Bar area. Hotel is in a fantastic location, walking distance to the following - restaurants and pubs in the street (Italian, French, Japanese, Irish, Subway, BBQ, Street vendors, and a Pharmacy which sells everything from a quick meal to alcohol and just about everything else. Times Square (1 block away), Grand Central Terminal (2 blocks), Macy's (a few blocks), Rockerfeller centre (two blocks), Empire State Building (a few blocks), Theatre District - Broadway (1 block) Fifth Avenue (1 block), Central Park 15 mins walking away. Bus stops and pickup location for our get on and get off bus only a few blocks away, also walked to the Wharf to catch our Boat for our New York Pass.

The bathroom was nice and beds were super comfortable. However, the room was very small with little space for our suitcases and the air conditioning was barely functional. I was quite surprised by the lack of a coffee machine in the room, and our do not disturb sign did not work, so needless to say we were disturbed on occasion! Expected more from a 4* hotel and have had more memorable stays elsewhere in the city so I won't be returning. That being said, if you prefer a smaller hotel then this would be a reasonable choice for the right price.

Perfect for walking to all the sights and has a very good selection of restaurants on the same street. The delux rooms are plenty big enough for two, the beds huge and comfy. The was no street noise (floor 9 on the street side) on any of our four nights. The hotel is immaculate, the staff genuinely interested, caring and helpful. And the small touches - chocolates, cookies, hot cider in reception, tomorrow's weather report and a free newspaper make all the difference. Thanks!!!!

I try to escape to this charming little jewel at least once a year. I spent 3, very comfortable nights here this April . Close to Broadway, Subway, walking distance to Rockefeller Square. Chocolates on your pillows for late night sweets craving. Good restaurant Triomphe and DB bistro right next door. Parfait!

The customer service was uniformly excellent - Vanessa the Concierge being especially helpful. Genuinely nothing was too much trouble.The beds were incredibly comfy. The TV had a very good range of HD channels.The location was perfect for shopping on 5th Avenue and for theatre trips around Times Square.The shower was a bit baffling at first (though that is a fault every hotel has) and the free wifi dropped out from overuse (but at least it was free).Would unreservedly recommend the Iroquois.

Just back from a 4 night stay in NYC at this hotel. Booked direct with the hotel (offered the best rate) after lots of research and must say that we were extremely pleased with the choice and the service surpassed our expectations.All the staff are so friendly and welcoming and special mention must go to the lady concierge who was superb, we booked theatre and excursions through her and she was as knowledgable as she was patient :)Room was well equipped and comfortable, we were on the 10th floor. We were very impressed by all the little touches and having free wifi was appreciated too. Beds were very comfortable (we booked a twin), linens were excellent and bathroom had plenty of towels, robes and Molton Brown toiletries.We only had one breakfast in the hotel which was good, after that we used the diner a couple of doors down (also very good)Location wise it was excellent between 5th Avenue and Times Square. Would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone travelling to NYC.

Considering the age of the building, our room was very well maintained and clean. The bed was comfortable and the quality of the linens were very good. I think it's important to remember that the buildings in NYC are old and the rooms are small with thin walls. That being said, I think the folks at the Iroquois have done a fantastic job of making the most with their space. Literally every member of the staff was amazing and helpful, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay!The hotel is situated very close to Times Square, Madison Ave, Broadway theaters, Grand Central Station, dining, and bars, which was really nice. Walking to subways was easy and took only a couple of minutes in either direction, and cabs are abundant.

Just arrived home after a 6 day break in New York staying at The Iroquois! Had a superb stay at the hotel. Arrived a little too early for check in but the reception staff were incredibly helpful. Stored our luggage and promised to contact us should the room be available before check in time. The doormen was incredibly polite and cheery! The bellboy....the one with the flat cap.....was most excellent! Very helpful and was great arranging a transfer back to the airport! Everytime we contacted reception with a request it was auctioned straight away. The room was spacious and very comfy.
