Although we didn't have the best view we didn't mind as we didn't spend a huge amount of time in the room anyway! We had a super king sized bed, plenty of room and a large bathroom which was restocked with toiletries etc on a regular basis! There is a brilliant diner just down the road called The Red Flame Diner.....superb for breakfast! Great hotel. Great staff. Superb holiday!

Stayed at this hotel for 1 night as a treat for my birthday. Couldn't get a better choice. The room is bit on the smaller side, but very chic and comfortable. The bathroom equipped with plenty of fresh towels and wonderful robes ahhh.Very close to Times Square and all it's action.Definitely staying at The Iroquois again.

This is a very good 4 - star hotel in maybe one of the best locations, if you're im NYC for sightseeing. The employees were very friendly and the housekeeping was flawless.I only felt my room and the bathroom were very small. Since I traveled alone, it was fine. But for two persons, this would have been a problem, especially if someone is travelling with heavy luggage. I'd go again, but ask for a bigger room in advance.

I booked this hotel as part of a birthday gift and spent time picking one that had more of a boutique feel to it. The hotel is really central; in-between 5th avenue and time square. You don't hear any of the noise though. Rooms are well presented, have high end finishes, quality towels and toiletries and the beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The housekeeping team do a great job maintaining the standards set. The shower is a bit weak and room lighting a bit too soft but they are really minor points.The thing that set this hotel apart for us was the service; which was outstanding. From before we arrived both Vanessa and Mark; the hotel concierges had answered many questions via email. On arrival our room had a complimentary cheese platter, chocolates and wine as a birthday gift. Also the first restaurant we visited knew it was for a birthday and the whole experience was slick. During our stay every trip, restaurant and activity was organised from start to finish by the concierge team. They really did make sure we got the most out of our trip and experienced the some of the best restaurants in New York. They were both excellent and we were greatly appreciative of their assistance!The whole team at the hotel were professional, reception was a great first impression of the hotel; always friendly and efficient they would make sure they spoke to you whenever you were in their vicinity. John the porter was knowledgeable on our arrival and Bill who we often saw on the door was a really cool character- always chipper and really friendly.Great stay, excellent service, thoroughly recommend this hotel.

After staying in massive hotels, and hotels right in the heart of Times Square, we opted for a quiet, small hotel for this couple weekend. the Iroquois was exactly what we expected and hoped for. I love places with a history, so this was right up my alley.The Iroquois is located just two blocks from Times Square, the NY library and Grand Central Terminal, but it is on a quiet block. The hotel itself is very sedate with only about 8 or 10 rooms to a floor so you don't get foot traffic past your door all night long. Although our room backed up to the elevator shaft, we could not hear the elevator at all.The staff is very gracious and helpful, athough we really didn't avail ourselves of their services too much. From a service standpoint, everything went as it should have.The room itself was very pleasant. Of course, this is New York, so it was not spacious, but we did not expect it to be. It did have ample space, a good closet, desk, king bed, quality flat screen TV and a very spacious marble bathrooom. There were two large windows in the main room, plus two windoews in the bathroom. Considering there was no view to the street, the room was very bright. Except for Sunday, there was an NY Times on our door every morning.There is a small restaurant and separate bar downstairs. We had dessert in the restaurant one night after a show and it was nice. The kitchen does close at 11 and we barely made it. One night we had a drink in the bar, Lantern's Keep. I must say the bartender was very entertaining as the bar specializes on cocktails using fresh juices and homemade syrups. We probably did not need that last drink, but it was fun and we were just staying upstairs.There is a cool little library sitting area off the lobby of the hotel. Overall, I think we have found our quiet place in the city.

Stayed at The Iroquois for the first time last week. I was there on business and the place couldn't have been more convenient. I arrived before a room was ready so I darted off to find lunch...the concierge recommended the Burger Joint which is a hole in the wall dive burger place behind a curtain in the lobby of the Le Parker Meridian hotel. Seriously random and a GREAT suggestion. After lunch, I came back and they had upgraded my room to a king...nice of them. It had zero view but when I am in Manhatten, I spend no time in my room and all my time out in the city in meetings. The bed was great, the room was SILENT (never happens in NYC) and it had the best shower I've experienced in the city. Tons of water and water pressure, very hot water and a drain that actually works well. The towels were huge and super absorbant. The staff was helpful and courteous. The whole stay went without a hitch. Great location, great staff, great amenities, etc. I would give it 5 stars but like all rooms in NYC, it is smallish and expensive. I still found it a very good value.

We had the best time ever staying in this hotel. Friendly staff, willing to go the extra mile for you. Was upgraded to a very special room without asking for it. Lovely coffee on tap in the mornings ready to start your sight seeing day. Would definitely stay there again.
user_name:
Gera M
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: The Iroquois is a small boutique hotel in the midst of the chaotic theatre district. Our room was clean, a good size for NYC, and well appointed. I appreciated the comfy bed, great pillows and good reading lamps. The windows opened up which was terrific because heat and ac are centrally located and our room was too warm for us. Our friends asked to be near us and they got a gratis upgrade to room 1104 which had a great view of 44th street from a floor to ceiling window. I would ask for a room ending in 04 for sure next time. The room was a bit smaller but the window was great. We ate breakfast in Triomphe which was the best breakfast we had on our trip. Delicious late night desserts and good cocktails as well. A definite winner in Manhattan.

Stayed overnight at the Iroquois, service & employees were very customer friendly, could not do enough. Special thanks to Jasmine & Bill, great employees, wonderful customer experience. We will definitely return to this hotel, room was immaculate, bed very comfortable.

Our one night stay here at the Iroquois was great. From walking in and one of the employees taking your baggage. All the employees are so friendly and willing to help you. The rooms were clean. The location of the hotel was wonderful. close enough to the action but far enough away to not hear it when you sleep. when we were leaving the elevators were busy and we didn't wait so we took the stairs, surprisingly the stairway looked just as good as the rest of the hotel. As we hit the bottom of the stairs the bus boy came right over and took our bags from us before we could even step off the stairs. You will not be diasappointed staying here. Parking is conviently located kiddie corner from the motel and were just as nice. $35 for 24 hour parking (with stamp from hotel) not bad in NYC
user_name:
Dave P
Albany, New York, United States

review_body: Our 4 night stay at The Iroquois could not have been better. All the staff were helpful, friendly and welcoming. The room was comfortable and very clean and the hotel location is convenient to theatres, shopping and lots of great restaurants.We will recommend the Iroquois to friends and plan to be back.Thanks for a great visit!

We had 12 ladies in New York City for my bachelorette weekend the first weekend of April. We booked 5 rooms and it couldn't have worked out better. The price was unbeatable, the staff was amazingly friendly, the rooms were great. We also loved the Triomphe Bar, great little place and our bartender was fantastic. I have stayed in many different hotels in New York City but this one is now at the top of my list. The staff made us feel like we were the only ones in the hotel, and their attention to detail was second to none.

We just finished a four night stay here and were pleased with our choice. We had a meeting to attend on 44th Street which prompted the initial selection. Now that we have stayed here, we will be happy to stay here again. We were asked upon check-in whether we wanted a room with a lot of sun, or a 'complimentary upgrade' to a room on a low floor. We took the upgrade. I don't know the other rooms to know how it compared. The room we were assigned was in the back with a view of the light shaft -- in other words: no view. We loved it. Why? It was very quiet, and quiet means good sleeping. No noise from the outside and none either from the inside.As others have said the rooms are not large, but very clean. The staff was attentive. The bellhop helped unload the car and ensured that I parked in a good lot and got the hotel discount. Parking is not cheap in NYC. But the cost was not as bad as expected ($140 for the four days.) The desk worked with us on room preferences as previously described and the maid service was also good.This is not a place to stay for a once in a lifetime 5 star experience. But most of us, most of the time do not need or want to pay for that treatment. What do I mean by 5-star? I use the Milestone Hotel in London as my gauge. But this is good, solid 4-star and just what we needed for our stay. And as the saying goes: location, location, location.

I was nervous as Maid of Honor booking accomodations, transportation, and reservations for a group of 12 women! However, The Iroquois was beyound all of our expectations. From the aromatic hot spiced cider at reception to the top notch bell service and concierge support, we couldn't have been more impressed. Chocolates were delivered to my sister, the bachelorette on arrival without my mentioning it to the staff. The bartender stayed open a wee bit later to accomodate nightcaps when we returned late. Ice was delivered to the room in literally 2 minutes after my call. Professional, courteous, without pretention. Truly not common in today's world! We will all be returning and recommending The Iroquois for out of this world accomodations!

Wonderful place to stay. Just went to NYC for a long weekend. The staff was great, the location was perfect. We were a very short walk to Times Square. The room was very clean and comfortable. Couldn't have asked for anything more.

Spent a wonderful 4 day weekend in NYC at the Iroquois. Our second stay. We love the service, the size, amenities and ambience of the hotel. The location is ideal. We've been coming to Manhattan, frequently for years and this is our favourite hotel. On this trip we were celebrating a milestone anniversary and birthday and the staff worked hard to ensure that all our requests were met. Vanessa, the concierge was outstanding in helping me plan some special surprises for my husband. She even changed her days off so she would be able to meet me and ensure that everything went perfectly. We are committed to come back to NYC and staying at The Iroquois.

Can't say anything different to other reviews, other than to say a massive thank you to the Iroquios for making our trip to New York extra special. We booked a suite to accommodate us and our 18 year old daughter who we surprised with this trip as her 18 th birthday present, and she was welcomed with chocolate dipped strawberries and a hand written note from management. Such a lovely gesture.The suite was perfect and so spacious and luxurious. Location is perfect, and all staff we met were friendly, discreet and efficient.Well done Iroquios, would recommend to all.Many thanks .

We found the Iroquois hotel ideally placed, it was easy to reach everywhere from this central location. A tall terraced building which was tasefully decorated with dark mahogany classic hotel furniture , and really comfy beds. Very clean and had everything you need with loads of towels, molton brown toiletries. There were nice touches, like the linen was changed every day including beds, which wasn't really necessary but nice. , chocolate left on pillow etc. All staff were very helpful and very courteous, the concierge booked us a table at Birdland Jazz club (which is only a 10 minute walk) and we had a table in front of the stage. Breakfast was not provided, although there is a restaurant attached to the hotel which serves breakfast, we just chose to go out for breakfast as there are bakeries and cafes close by. Complimentary coffee is available in the hotel foyer, as there are not tea and coffee facilities in the room.It would have been nice to have a lounge in the hotel...there is just a little library area which has armchairs, but it is only small. Other than this, I can't fault the hotel. its also right next to 5th avenue, so ideal for shopping, ..within walking distance of Rockefeller Center, tiffanys, Saks fifth avenue, etc...Some good restaurants and bars on 44th street itself.The Empire state building, times square, central park, central station, the flatiron building are all within walking distance, and bryant square, just round the corner from the hotel is a lovely area for lunch outside and people watching.I would say not to bother with the skyride if visiting the empire state, as it adds a bit to the cost and is not anything special.the subway is really cheap and easy to use...you can travel anywhere in the city for $2.50. The transfer link airport taxi service takes about 1 hour 30 mins, so allow plenty of time for your return to the airport especially during rush hour as traffic can be really slow.Allow for plenty of spare change for tips as it is expected by doormen, cab drivers, waiters etc (except if there are more than five of you in a group).Staten island ferry is a good way to see the statue of liberty as it goes past her, so good for photos. The ferry is free. Katz's deli is an authentic u.s. deli and a good way to get the real deli experience, (it is where they filmed the famous deli scene from When Harry Met Sally), but it is always very busy, so be prepared for it being a bit chaotic.Madison Square Garden is withing walking distance of the hotel, approx. 25 mins. , and really well organized when seeing a gig there..its massive, but the flow of people in and out to get seated etc, is really quick and efficient.

Just got back from visiting our son in NYC. The Iroquois could not have been more helpful, with suggestions, tickets, directions, plus chocolates and hot apple cider in the evenings. They are all about the customer.

I love this hotel. I was warmly greeted by Patrick at reception and he was helpful and accommodating throughout my stay. I was on third floor in the front, right over the street, but I was not bothered at all by street noise. The room was small but it worked for me. The closet is almost non-existent though, but luckily I didn't have many clothes that needed hanging. The bathrooms are gorgeous, and stocked with plenty of thick bright white towels. Breakfast is a classy affair. Don't expect a generous spread - you order from a menu of modest choices, but the food and service are excellent and it's all I needed. The hotel oozes character while also managing to be comfortable with all the modern touches. I look forward to staying here again soon.

Just back from New York 4th April 2013. Iroquois hotel was great... bathrooms a little small but beautifully finished. Spent my 50th birthday there and reception sent up a bottle of red wine and chocolate covered strawberries, which was a lovely touch. Door staff are excellent - what ever you need - go to them ..... directions , transfer to airport , places to eat , where to get tickets , ANYTHING . Carlos was brilliant and an asset to the Iroquois hotel .... helpful and polite - your the man , Carlos ! Would I stay there again ? Absolutely ! ! ! 4 minute walk to Times Square.

We stayed there in Feb and had a room quite high up. The hotel was clean, and so were the room and bathroom. The Bathroom was very spacious You can walk to pretty much anywhere from here and it has a 24h drug store around the corner if you get hungry or thirsty or just need things! Very nice welcome from the reception staff. Only down side: the concierge... We felt liked he really weighed us down before answering questions.Also the air conditioner in the room was very noisy but at least there was no traffic noise!

I have never written a review on this site, but felt compelled to praise The Iroquois Hotel for making my stay in NYC a fantastic one. I am a frequent traveller and have stopped in many hotels across the world, with this being possibly one of my favourite stays purely for friendliness, cleanliness, location and comfort.On arrival we were greeted with warmth and efficiency. Our hotel room (1005) was extremely quiet where we did not hear the external city noises whilst resting in a clean and comfortable room.The rooms were well equipped with all modern day equipment and added touches such as Molton Brown products and chocolates every night.The bed and it's linen were luxurious, providing us with four night's quality sleep.The door staff were so friendly, only after a few days there, we felt like we were leaving friends behind. Any issues or help needed, they were keen and pleased to help. I could carry on praising this hotel and will not consider stopping anywhere else in New York apart from at The Iroquois.A big thank you and well done to the fantastic team there. I hope to see you again.

I had the luxury of spending a long weekend at The Iroquois, what a remarkable experience! The staff was attentive and the room spectacular. I would highly recommend this small but luxurious hotel to anyone looking for an unforgettable NYC experience. 5 stars.

I've been coming to New York for some 40 years now, staying in some of the more well known hotels throughout the city. The IroquoisHotel is without a doubt one of the best. The service is always " top notch ", the room is impeccable and it's a great location . Dollarfor dollar, you can't find a better venue.

I searched high and low to find a hotel with two queen size beds in manhattan and eventually opted for this mid town option. The location is truly great- right next to fifth avenue and a moment from grand central and Times Square, Rockerfeller centre, moma, New York City library and loads of up town shopping options. Also walking distance to numerous subway lines so you really can get anywhere within Manhattan in about 20 minutes, or less, and its convenient on the subway for Brooklyn too. Although its in a lively part of town, 44th street is actually not too busy and we only had a gentle purr of the inevitable air com to lull us to sleep. No sound from other rooms or the corridor which is great. We did not try the restaurant but it has rave reviews and it did look really cosy and atmospheric, buzzing and full on all our 4 nights. There is a spa and gym as well. The room was fine, very clean, and the beds were fabulously comfy. It was good- just not sure it was worth $250 plus a night. One irritating thing is that there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, although there is free coffee in the lobby all day- a nice touch. And no breakfast included in our deal, not that unusual for NY. There are lots of mid town restaurants and cafes near by. I suppose overall I sort of wished I had booked a cheaper place in a more interesting neighbourhood that was perhaps a bit less central, because i am not sure the location is actually worth paying so much for when manhattan is so easy to get around. Never mind- there's always next time for me. if you want a reliable option in a unbeatably central location this will definitely suit you.

I booked this hotel due to the TripAdvisor reviews and was really hoping for a great stay. However, for the price i paid i have been left with a bitter taste in my mouth. When I booked the room i informed them that i had just returned from fighting in Afghanistan and was wondering if i could have a room with a street view to surprise my fiancee... Instead i got a room with the WORST view i have ever had (SEE PICTURE ATTACHED-1). I needed to charge my phone in the docking station which failed to charge, upon investigation the wire was damaged and i had to spend 5 minutes fixing this problem in order to charge my phone having pulled out furniture. Once this had been resolved i turned on the TV to view Hotel information... However, i was faced with a "Loading" page for 3 minutes before i turned it off. So far i was very unimpressed with the first 10 minutes of being in this hotel. My Fiancee then wanted a drink of cold water from the tap but we discovered that your choice of water is either hot or warm, even after leaving the cold tap running for a while. It's a small thing that is a pain when drinking or brushing teeth. Later that night i noticed that our "Turn Down" hadn't been done. This was advertised on the brochure. I then called the front desk and specifically requested a turn down while i was out for the night.... THIS NEVER HAPPENED.When returning for the night i entered the shower to find black mold all around the edge of the bath it was disgusting! (SEE PICTURE-2).Once i had got clean as best as i could i went to bed to find that the headboard was 2 feet above the bed so your head rests on a lump of wood (SEE PICTURE-3). Upon trying to turn on the bedside lamp... nothing happened. It was plugged in and had two bulbs but I couldn't be bothered to fix another faulty item in this hotel. Throughout the night we were boiling hot. We had the window open but the noise of the city was too loud and upon trying to adjust the thermostat.... it did nothing and it clearly for show!! (SEE PICTURE-4).The noise of the heating system is very loud and kept us awake. However, if you do manage to get some sleep you will be woken early as when other people use the taps within the hotel; it makes a very loud whistling sound. And i mean loud enough to wake you up.The hotel offered free internet if you are able to stay connected long enough as you will find it constantly drops out and you continually have to enter a code to get back in. If you do get in it moves at the same speed a dial-up (SLOW).I would normally give this hotel a 3 star but as i was expecting more I'm afraid it needs to be a two star. For those who have given this hotel a high rating... You clearly haven't traveled as much as I have. I have visited New York City many many times and change hotel each time and I'm afraid to say.... This has to be the worst. Good Luck.

Am glad I booked this hotel after reading Tripadvisor reviews! Stayed 4 nights at the hotel in a room on the 10th floor and had a great time. Service was great, the porters were friendly and helpful from the moment we entered the hotel and our stay got off to a great start! The hotel was very accommodating with changes to our reservation, with storing lots of bulky luggage and purchases before check-in time and with helping us mail off a parcel. We were both very impressed by the hospitality shown by the staff!We loved the charming decor of our room, with lovely little touches such as the chocolate on our beds, Frette bathrobes and Molten Brown toiletries. The pillows were fluffy, the beds were comfortable and I had a good rest each night. The location, as many reviews pointed out, is fantastic-- it is easy to get anywhere-- Times Square and 5th Avenue shopping is just round the corner, there are plenty of cabs around and its a quick walk to Grand Central Station (5 minutes stroll). The complimentary hot cider in the lobby was a lovely and thoughtful touch-- just perfect for the weather! The only downer was that my friend found the complimentary wifi access to be a little on the slow side and inconsistent. Still, we would confidently recommend this place to our friends and hope to be back someday!

I had a recent stay at this charming botique hotel. The location, on 44th Street between Fifth and Sixth Avenues, is without equal; close enough to the theater district sans the noise and crowds. My room was without heat and adequate electric plugs. Within minutes of my complaint, the front desk quickly moved me to a suite. It was far more space than I needed, but what an elegant response, and I was able to sleep. Patrick should be commended for his assistance. I am more than pleased. The concierge was very helpful for a last minute pre-theater dinner reservation. Of all hotels I have stayed in New York, this has been the most accommodating.

Only one endorsement, the position is quite good in the heart of Manhattan.The room was very dark and old, but the most complaint was for the noise of the air conditioning system. Not only noise, but even vibrations.320 USD per night and no chance to change room (they said all rooms were sold out). A 4 star hotel should offer a better service, trying to find a way to fix the issue. Even if they should suggest another hotel. No refund, that's very unprofessional.They made my night waste.

I've stayed in many midtown hotels, and the Iroquois is among the best. Perfectly located close Grand Central, and Broadway, this hotel is quaint and clean and lush with a superb staff, all of whom were very friendly and very helpful. The room was great. And as mentioned in other reviews, the turn-down with chocolates on the pillows was a really nice touch! The bottom line: if you're looking for an affordable, not-too-large, perfectly located, classy, clean, and easy to navigate hotel with a superb staff, this is your place. Will return!

The Iroquois is perfectly situated. Walking distance to Broadway and great NYC restaurants. Otherwise, the door man haled us a cab for everything else. Our stay was WONDERFUL! The staff was very attentive and pleasant, concierge took care of our dinner reservations and even recommended two places that were awesome. Our room was beautiful and clean. The Hotel is tastefully decorated. I loved it. It was nice to be in the middle of it all then have a clean, comfy hotel to go back to and relax. One of the best places I have stayed in the city.

The Hotel Staff are great, The rooms are a nice size and Comfy. The Bathrooms are great too very clean and nicely decorated. The turn down service and chocolates on our pillows was a very nice touch! The only negative was that on our last day the corridor of the floor we were on was being wallpapered very early and we were woken before nine by the noise of it, that was quite annoying as we had a flight that evening and wanted to get a good sleep, we were not warned or made aware by the hotel that this work would be happening which we did not appreciate especially at the price you pay for it.overall though it was a nice hotel with good staff but was just let down by the lack of communication about the work that was being done and also being woken up by the workmen!

Lovely midtown property. Friendly, knowledgeable staff from front desk, to doormen, concierge, etc. They all understand customer service. Loved my deluxe king with Ferette bedding and upscale amenities. Room was spotless. Really appreciated the daily NY Times delivery. Room service breakfast arrived promptly and was delicious. Over the years, business travel resulted in stays at large convention hotels in NYC. Now, I prefer smaller properties. I will definitely return to The Iroquois. The outstanding accommodations and service are incomparable.

We just spent four nights at the Iroquois and were very impressed both by the hotel and its position. The hotel is quite small and has a friendly feel to it and all the staff we came in contact with were very welcoming and helpful. Our room was a King with one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept on, and the bathroom was also very good. The concierge Mark gave us lots of good recommendations for places to eat, all of which were excellent. By booking through SLH we got a really good room rate and an upgrade. Overall I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Manhattan and we will definitely be staying again.

Just returned from a five night stay at the Iroquois. We had an executive suite for our family of four. The hotel was very accomodating with a last minute change in our plans due to weather-related flight cancelations. Everyone was very friendly and went out of their way to help with whatever we needed. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the bathroom had a separate shower from the tub which we very much prefer. The bed was very comfortable for us and the sofa bed in the living room accomodated our children well. The room was very clean and all of the furnishings were in good shape. Concierge was very helpful arranging a few special things in advance and helping with recommendations during our stay. Bellman was also very friendly and helpful. I evaluated many properties before settling on the Iroquois and felt it was the best combination of quality, value and location for us. Best things for us: great location in NYC, plenty of room in the suite, cleanliness, comfortable bed, upscale feel. On the downside: no coffee maker in room (not a big deal for us, but might be for some -- free coffee/cider in the lobby daily), must order ice from room service, limited shelf/counter space in bathroom, quite a bit of street noise (we were on 4th floor; our sound machine helped to block some of the noise, but not all).

We just returned from our second stay at the wonderful Iroquois. All the positive reviews before mine are 100% accurate. The location can't be beat, the beds are to die for and the staff is most welcoming, friendly and helpful. We will never stay anywhere else in NYC again! Thanks Iroquois!

The positives: Clean, comfortable, very good value, uniformly friendly and informed staff, location, free: internet, ny times, wsj, and usa today.The not positives: The gym (though free). The gym is too small, too warm, and has very limited devices and free weights (none over 25lbs). Both days I was there the TVs wouldn't turn on (multiple guests tried) and one of two treadmills wouldn't work.Tea and coffee in lobby would be nice.Recommend reserving their largest room or suite. Rooms are not large.We didnt use restaurants, but many very good places are very close, as are many coffee places. Top shopping, theater, music all within walking distance.

Just stayed at The Iroquois for the 2nd time. Great: Central location in Midtown. Lots of restaurants etc near by. Walking distance from Times Square without being directly in the thick of it. Cute library, bar and lounge in first floor of hotel. Bed was very comfortable.Good: Rooms are nice but small which is not atypical of NYC so don't expect to spread out. Carpets looked clean but worn giving the room a bit of an antiquated feel. But that could be just part of the decor. (The rest of the room was very classically decorated) Rates are reasonable for midtown. Bathroom was again small but nice. Good shower temperature and pressure. Very clean and did not feel old.Overall a good experience. I would stay there again.

just came back from new york 2 weeks ago after spending 5 days at the Iroquois hotel.last year spend there 7 days, the hotel has the best location for : buisness, couples or any other purpose.the rooms are comfortable, free wifi tv mini bar etc...the linen very high quality and all the rest of the amenities.i would deffently recomend the hotel.the best part except all is the locatin, close to everything.

I spend just two nights at the Iroquois while I was waiting for my apartment to be cleaned up. It was really a overall good experience. From the moment you step inside you feel the classic New York atmosphere get under your skin. They have a small "library-computer" room next to the lobby. Really comfy couches and pretty paintings. The price is reasonable, considering where the hotel is located. Close to Times Square, almost every hotel has an averge nightly rate of $150-$300. I think I paid around $160 for the double bed single room which is not to bad considering what you get. There's a very nice restaurant right next to the hotel, where you can also get drinks in the evening. Extra: Try the continental breakfast from roomservice and feel like a king or a queen.
user_name:
YannikBoserup
New York City, New York

review_body: We were looking for a decent but not too expensive hotel room for three adults. Most of the other options we found were in more out of the way locations but the Iroquois was great. We stayed in a suit which had a bedroom with a very large double bed and a similar size sitting room with two couches one of which made up into a double bed. There was a large bathroom with separate bath and shower. Both main rooms had two windows (each) overlooking the street below (rather than the four feet space between your window and the brick wall of the building next door, which so often the case in New York. The rooms had plenty of room to walk around and draws and surfaces to put your stiff! The Wardrobe was a little on the small side but the staff were happy to bring extra hangers and we got everything in.Staff were attentive and helpful. We did not eat in the hotel but the restaurant always looked full and had a lively atmosphere at the weekends. There is a coffee shop just across the road which serves delicious coffee and muffins Our 5 day stay (Thursday to Tuesday) cost $1300

The location of this hotel is great! Your less than 5 minutes from Times Square and 5th Avenue is only around the corner! The staff were very helpful, our porter John helped us with our bags and gave us a full tour of our room showing us all the little extras that you might not notice straight away! He also very helpfully showed us how to use the shower which had controls I had never seen in Europe before but are very common in the states!Room was clean, and the area was relatively quiet considering it was in the middle of Manhattan! Room has TV with about 50 odd channels and you can order movies on their interactive system! There is a restaurant and bar downstairs which always seemed to be busy but the prices seemed a bit steep so we steered clear of them but they did seem good based on their menus! Overall very enjoyable stay! :)

We spent two nights at the Iroquois in late February 2013 and found the hotel to be generally excellent. We stayed in a deluxe room, which was a reasonable size for NYC and had a very nice bathroom with tub. We prepaid and got a great rate. The bed was very comfortable and all the amenities were first rate. The room faced an interior courtyard, so while there was no view, it was very quiet. My son stayed in a standard room, which was a little smaller, but still adequate for a two-day stay. The fitness center was adequate for a good workout -- not fully equipped like a fitness club -- but the five cardio machines, free weights, a couple of strength machines and yoga mats were more than sufficient. There is also a dry sauna. The bar, which has a great menu of mixed drinks, was very fun and the restaurant Triomphe was excellent for dinner. The midtown location is close to Times Square, 5th Avenue shops, MOMA and other attractions. The only mild negative is that you cannot turn the room ventilation on or off, meaning that it is blowing air all the time; if you are noise sensitive, it can be annoying. However, the room temperature was basically fine. The concierge was very helpful and the staff was friendly. Overall, this is an excellent boutique hotel, perfect for people who want to stay away from the mega-hotels but still want the amenities and comfort of a five-star hotel at a reasonable price. I would definitely return.

I stayed in a standard double room. The room was so small, there was not enough room for my luggage and closet space was woefully inadequate. In fact the closet was strangely about 12" wide and 6' deep. Perhaps if there were less furniture in the room it would be better. No need for a floor refrigerator, desk, floor lamp, upholstered chair in a room that size. The bathroom didn't have a shelf large enough for a standard Dopp kit. The hotel has a fine location and the staff was friendly.

4 of us stayed at Iroquois for NYE 2012 for 4 nights. We wanted to be as close to TS for NYE but as we were looking in November, most places were in the thousands! So we were lucky that Iroquois, which was only 1 block away from TS, was available for a relatively reasonable rate over NYE (~NZD500 per night). The room was small but we didn't expect anything bigger for a boutique hotel in TS. It was very nicely decorated (boutique style) and had everything we needed. Th bathroom was very clean and tidy and although small, it was styled beautifully.Unfortunately we did not have views from our rooms other than onto the neighbouring buildings so the room was quite dark, but that is the norm in NYC.The best thing about this place was the service, it was definitely 5 star. In particular we would like to thank Vanessa Torruellas the Chef Concierge - she made our trip very easy!! Every time we left the hotel we would ask her for directions and she would get us there the best way possible. She even went out of her way to find us a coat bag to take onto the plane. Your service was fantastic so thank you very much!The complimentary cider/coffee in the lobby was also a nice touch as we ventured out into freezing NYC!!! Great location, great service, beautifully set up boutique hotel. Made our NYE stay very pleasurable.Cheers!

Just returned from a wonderful five day stay in NYC at the Iroquois Hotel. This was my first visit to the hotel and I selected it based on the location and the many positive reviews on trip advisor. My daughter and I found everyone at the hotel to be extremely pleasant and helpful. The location could not have been better with everything that we needed, shopping, dining, theatres etc. within very easy walking distance. Our room was very comfortable ( although a bit on the small size but I guess that is par for the course in NYC) and well appointed. Enjoyed the Molten Brown Bath amenities - We were fortunate to have booked the WInter Getawaypackage which included continental breakfast daily. The breakfast was delicious and a perfect way to start the day. Having a nice glass of apple cider on returning from a long day of shopping and seeing the sights was a great touch! Would definitely recommend the Iroquois and would certainly consider staying again on our next NYC visit.

The hotel is wonderfully located between Times Square and Grand Central. Room was small but quiet even though it was right next to the elevator. A nice touch - red wine and chocolate were in my room upon arrival (for gold guest member) Most of the staffs were friendly and helpful, especially Mylene and John were amazing. Every night they gave us recommendations for dinner and shows were spot on. Morning coffee and afternoon cider offered a nice break after a busy day and before dinner. The Triumph experience was special indeed - service was pleasant and food was fantastic. The only downside was the room way too hot but the front desk girl told us we should just open the window. We understand the heating/ac is centralized, it isn’t her fault but at least sending somebody to check if it’s working properly. We may return back next month and hope we will see improvement.

I recently visited New York city, and had the pleasure of staying at the Iroquois hotel. The location was perfect as it is located close to MOMA, Times Square, and the theatre district. In addition, I found I could walk from the hotel to Greenwich Village in about 30 to 40 minutes. The staff at the hotel was exceedingly friendly and helpful. My hotel room was spotless and very comfortable. Some additional touches that made the hotel excellent included a delicious restaurant (Triomphe), complimentary hot drinks in the lobby, and a reading room next to the concierge's desk. I certainly plan on staying at the Iroquois upon my next trip to New York city.

Stayed this week at the Iroquois and what a wonderful experience. I was traveling with a group and our plans kept changing due to rescheduled meetings and changing travel requirements. Their reservation specialist was incredibly helpful and easy to work with around changing reservations to meet everyone's schedule. The hotel is lovely and quiet, the entire staff is extremely professional and welcoming. Upon arrival I found I had been upgraded to a suite with a welcome snack waiting. The room was wonderful, the bed comefortable and room service exactly on time in the morning. I plan on always staying here when in NYC going forward, which can be weekly. Thank you Iroquois!

I stayed at the Iroquois and I loved it. The location is amazing - within two minutes of Times Square yet quiet. The staff were lovely and helpful: they even told us to call them for help if we got lost or we needed more ideas for things to do during the day (first time this happens to me, and I really appreciated it). The rooms are breathtaking. There are huge windows to the city but no noise comes from the outside, something important, taking into account that NYC is a noisy city. They are also really clean, comfortable and have a beautiful decoration. The best thing is the bed: huge and comfortable with awesome pillows. I'm from Europe (Spain) and I can honestly say this hotel exceeds expectations.

I have just returned from NYC where my Mam and I stayed at The Iroquois. We had such a lovely stay thanks to the friendly and helpful staff including John/JJ and Bill on the door and the incredibly helpful and efficient Vanessa on the concierge desk. The location was perfect - within walking distance to all the major attractions. Lots of nice restaurants and cafes all around. The beds were comfortable and big, the rooms were warm and the complimentary hot drinks were sooo very delightful after a day outside in the cold!! We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to NYC. I miss it already and only got back yesterday !! :)

I recently stayed at this hotel. It was fantastic. The location is perfect as it is next to Times square, which is NY s heart. The people of the hotel (staff) were wonderful, helpful and very kind. Anything you needed, they will help you. And not to forget to say, the hotel was very clean.I felt very comfortable.In addition, there was delicious cider brewing in the lobby, next to the hotels library, which was a special little touch. I will definitely stay at The Iroquois again the next time i visit NYC!Totally recommended!

We were staying at this hotel within one night in June during our first visit of New York. The hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Broadway, Fifth Ave,we walked to the central park even. Bed is very convenient, one of the best on which we slept.The staff was welcoming and helpful.The complimentary coffee in the lobby. But the room a little close, subsequently more spacious rooms on Manhattan. The transfer at the airport also was delightful, but is a little bit expensive.The only reason I don't stay here more is that it is a bit pricey

We recently stayed at The Iroquois on 44th Street in mid-town Manhattan. This hotel is conveniently located to Times Square and the theater district of New York. Not only was the staff warm and friendly but the hotel room was immaculately clean. The bed was very comfortable with high quality linens. As close as this room was to all the action of Manhattan, the hotel was absolutely quiet and peaceful at night. I would not hesitate to stay here again on another future visit.

We have stayed at the Iroquois New York on many occasions and over the years strayed away because of the cost. This February, we found the cost to be extremely reasonable and stayed over President's weekend while we saw two shows. The Iroquois is not a pretentious hotel, is very comfortable, hospitable and a perfect location for the theatre, shopping and fine restaurants.I highly recommend this as a fine choice of stay while in New York City.
user_name:
VGehrt
Kennett Square, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: Perfect location for sightseeing. 2 blocks from Time Square but quiet enough to offer a respite from the noise and bustle of the city . Room was spot less . Beds were v comfortable and a welcome resting place after a day pounding the streets of New York. Staff friendly and helpful. No kettle in the room but in the lobby they offer free coffee in the mornings and hot apple tea in the afternoon. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant or bar as the city was just outside the door.All NYC hotels are on the dear side but felt this was an excellent choice. Would highly recommend this and would stay there again.

I was in New York on business (which I frequently am) and decided to stay at The Iroquois and enjoy the theater one night. Staff could not have been better and friendly. Location was perfect. Comfy bed and robe. Will be back soon.

Me and my Fiancée came to New York for the first time for Valentines 2013.I chose The Iroquois based on what other travellers had said about it's cleanliness and friendly service (based on a bad hotel experience at Tenerife last year) and the reviews we read we read weren't wrong!Location:This was one of the most important aspects of the hotel for us as we knew how big New York was so we needed it to be in an ideal location. When booking, it stated the hotel was very close to Times Square which we'd been told would be a perfect spot. The hotel was in the middle of Broadway (which would have been noisy) but was in the best place we could have asked - it was two blocks (a ten minute walk) from Broadway which was great as it meant we weren't too close to noise, butt was not too far away, all you could ask for was within walking distance.Staff:All the staff at the hotel were absolutely brilliant, really friendly and very helpful.Every morning we went to Vanessa at the concierge desk who gave us maps, directions, and recommendations for places to go such as restaurants and attractions, and always explained the easiest and cheapest way to get to these.The reception staff were also very helpful, and the doorman helped us with our bags, and flagged us taxis when we needed them.Room:The room was perfect for us, although there was a mix up where we ended up with two double beds (not that this was a problem). It was always very clean each day with fresh bed sheets and towels. The cleaner always left a cute little bag with the NY Times newspaper on the door handle each day, chocolates on our pillow, and a card with the following days weather forecast. The beds were really comfy and we had a great nights sleep. It offered a 32 inch TV, a Blu Ray player (American region DVDs only), a bath with shower function, and a long built in wardrobe.We didn't try the restaurant due to the prices being a bit high, and the mini bar was very pricey ($4 for a small diet coke) which were the only downfalls but didn't spoil anything.Overall, we were both both very satisfied with the hotel, and we would definitely come back and stay here again.

My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Iroquois. The room was clean and not tired at all. We were on the 12th floor overlooking 44th street and never heard street noise. The staff was very friendly. My only slight complaint was the service...I had to call downstairs for ice twice on two different occasions. They must have been busy but it was frustrating. Also, the front desk seemed to be understaffed on a few occasions and confused by a mistake (theirs not mine) on my reservation, etc. These problems were minor, but they kept me from giving the hotel 5 stars. If I was given the same deal on the price, I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

My boyfriend and I came to NYC for our very first visit to the city and was extremely happy with The Iroquois. Everyone from Patrick from the Front Desk who went above and beyond to ensure an early check in even though they were sold out that day, JJ the Bellman who assisted us nightly with taxi service and ice service, Veronica (I believe that was her name) at the Concierge Desk who assisted us in guiding us through the city, Ling and the others in Housekeeping who made our room lovely on a daily and nightly basis, with fresh linens/robes, and chocolates. The room was very quaint, but was all we needed as a couple. Great location in the city, close to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefellar Center; etc. When we return to NYC for future visits, we plan on staying with The Iroquois! Thank you for your outstanding services.

This hotel is maimum 3 stars at most (thanks to comfortable bed). Staff were unhelpful and rude - too busy chatting to each other. This is a very old hotel, with ancient lifts, old carpets and absolute no attention to detail.We have stayed in Small Luxury Hotel group hotels in europe in the past, so when we saw this hotel, we expected the same level of service, surroundings and attention to detail. How wrong we were. We will not be using SLH brand as a stamp of luxury or quality from now on!Please review your bills carefully on departure, as they are ready to charge you for anything and everything... e.g. water which is meant to be complimentary is $9.50...even the random collection of molton brown soap, shower gel, body lotion (all different scents) is an example of carelessness.

You are welcomed from the minute you step in by the friendly doormen..(Rocky has a big smile!) Patrick at the front desk was lovely, made us feel right at home... Rooms are small but very well maintained. The linens are great quality and the beds were super comfortable. Our room was in the back so there was no street noise. Wifi is free. Concierge..Vanessa and Mark both went out of their way to help us get home.We were there for the blizzard (Feb 2013) and they spent over an hour calling the airline for us on 2 different days to get us re booked...it was a lifesaver..coffee or hot cider in the lobby..all day. Free DVDs at the front desk are available to watch in your room..nice little touches all over. Bottom line, this is a beautiful boutique hotel with service that makes you feel you are definitely more than just a number.

We stayed here during a business/personal trip. Its was a very cozy and friendly hotel. The staff was fabulous and very helpful - from the concierge to the front desk to the doormen/staff. The room was clean and comfortable. I will stay there on my next trip to NYC for sure!
user_name:
Lorie J
Hernando, Mississippi, United States

review_body: The Iroquis is a very nice hotel but the rooms are very small and they really need updating. They had to bring the ice to your room and no soda machines-the soda was in the room and extremely high priced for the size soda they had. They didn't have coffee machines in the room and I never seen coffee in the lobby. Am not sure it was offered. (must admit I never asked) They did have hot apple cider in th lobby each evening and it was a nice alternative during the winter months. Our room overlooked other rooms and you could see people in the other rooms. It is very close to Times Square and a great location to do your site seeing from. It is just a little over a block from Times Square and very close to many of the broadway shows. Vanessa, the conceirge was excellant and could help w/ all of your plans.We did find a real nice diner just a couple of doors from the hotel for breakfast the was very reasonable and very good food. Al.so a 24 hour convient store right around the corner.

We have just returned from a great stay at The Iroquois. This midtown hotel has a lot of things in its favour; helpful, friendly staff, well-appointed rooms, amazingly comfortable beds, and a first class cocktail bar; The Lantern’s Keep, on the ground floor. We upgraded to a corner king room which was definitely spacious by NYC standards – it was also at the back of the building so no view but no street noise either which was a bonus. Our heating failed on the penultimate day which wasn’t ideal. However, things like that can go wrong in any hotel – the real test is how staff respond. And in this case, they swiftly moved us to a suite; very comfortable if a little more susceptible to the near constant honking horns of the cabs outside. Personally speaking, The Iroquois is probably too close to Times Square for our tastes – we prefer to be within staggering distance of a bar that appeals to locals as well as tourists – but for other people, this may well be a major selling point. It was certainly convenient for Broadway, Rockerfeller Centre and most other ‘must see’ nyc spots.There’s a decent diner practically next door which was great for breakfast and a coffee shop opposite. Hell’s Kitchen was a 10 minute walk away and good for casual dinner options – (we enjoyed Southern Hospitality & 5 Napkin Burger) and for a rough and ready bar with a great jukebox Rudy’s is definitely worth a visit. Overall, for us The Iroquois delivered; it’s a classy joint with attentive staff and we’d definitely consider going back.

This is a great little boutique-style hotel with a personable staff and a fabulous location. On a frigid Friday afternoon in January, we were thankfully upgraded to a 9th floor presidential suite. The spacious suite included a nicely furnished living area, bedroom with king-sized bed, dining area, and kitchenette. Everything was neat, tidy, and clean. The bed, however, was not particularly comfortable and the HVAC kept the bedroom area unacceptably warm though both thermostats were turned down. While the bath included a separate spa tub and small tile shower, there is no counter space whatsoever. We did enjoy the third floor gym and sauna as well as the convenience of the library computer with printer in the lobby. In my opinion, the saving grace of this hotel is the personal service and the great midtown location. It is otherwise unexceptional.

I felt the swank as soon as I walked in the door. Dark, high-end, intimate lobby with attentive, polite staff. The elevator was slow as snails and the room was on the small side, but everything else about the experience was top notch! I would stay here again and recommend to friends.

I arrived after midnight on a chilly winter Friday evening. The entry is bright and clearly marked but the outer doors looked like one has a damaged hinge, making the entrance look a little less appealing. I hauled my bags up the entrance stairs and through the outer entry doors. Once I passed through the outer door and began to open the inner door, the doorman reached over and opened the door. Given the hour and that the doorman was right there as I opened the lobby door, it begs the conclusion that the doorman was standing there the whole time and decided not to leave the warm lobby to come outside and help me drag my bags up the stairs. To make matters worse, there was a double layer of mats right inside the door and I nearly fell as I tripped over the top mat and lost my grip on the bags. Now, I was disgusted by the questionable doorman service and wondering if my laptop was busted. Fortunately, the person at reception was pleasant and quickly checked me in. The ride up the elevator was a little unsettling; it's one of those old, springy-feeling elevators. My room has been the best part of my experience- it is clean, has decent fixtures, nice toiletries and linens. I would recommend this hotel because it's a clean hotel in a good location at a good price but if you don't want to deal with stairs at the entry (I did not ask how they accomodate folks who cannot walk stairs) and if you like to have your arrival experience just so, you might consider looking elsewhere for accomodations.

We are back in NYC staying ath the Iroquois Hotel just off Broadway. For the 2nd year in a row, we have been given the James Dean Suite. James Dean lived in this suite from 1950 - 1953. We have called it home since we first stayed here in 2010. All in the heart of Broadway theatre district. An intimate, friendly and inviting boutique hotel. Patrick at the front desk is very helpful. Vanessa greeted us by name on arrival, even though she hasn't seen us for 12 months. We know we are in good hands with our entertainment and dining needs. If you haven't been here, we highly recommend it!

The weekend of January 11-13th we hosted our out of town guests for our son's wedding at The Iroquois. The staff was lovely and took wonderful care of our guests. The location could not have been better, since the reception was being hosted at the Penn Club right across the street. And although the rooms were small (it is NYC, after all), they were clean and well appointed. And at least two people could move around at the same time without bumping into one another. The hotel is warm and quaint, yet has all the ammenities you need. I can not say enough about the incredible staff. From handing out our welcome bags to giving advice on how to tie a tuxedo bow tie. All of our guests commented on what a wonderful "home away from home" experience it was. Thanks to everyone at The Iroquois for caring!

Just returned from a weekend in Manhattan, the hotel was prefect. The room was beautiful and spotless.. We were thrilled with our experience at the Iroguois. It was centrally located and we walked everywhere.. Times Square, Rock Center, Madison Ave.... People were very friendly and could not have been nicer at the front desk. We had a couple special requests and they were handled with no problem... HIghly recommend this place
user_name:
Jim C
Norwell, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: Belated review- My friend and I shared a room with two double beds. The loved the location of this hotel- it's perfect! Everything is very close. Staff was always extremely helpful and friendly. I liked them very much. Our room and bathroom was a little on the small side, but it was very clean and comfortable. I wished the bathroom had more room for toiletries (for two women, that is). The room was a little dark, which made it hard for two women to put on makeup in the morning. It's a smaller hotel than I imagined, but I liked it. The vintage bar (with vintage type drinks) was super cool. This is a very nice hotel.

We had a wonderful experience at The Iroquois Hotel! The staff were extremely pleasant, professional and helpful. The entire hotel was very clean and comfortable. Our room was the perfect temperature upon arrival and the bed was a fantastic place to put your feet up after walking around New York City. The location was very convenient and the parking garage directly across the street was a plus. There was delicious cider brewing in the lobby which was a special little touch. We will definitely stay at The Iroquois again the next time we visit NYC!

Excellent location for almost everything we did while in NYC. Staff was courteous and helpful. Our daughter and son-in-law's room was cold our first night there, and maintenance couldn't get the heat up, so they moved our kids to another room which was bigger and nicer as well as warmer the next day. The concierge got us the tickets we wanted for the Top of the Rock which was very helpful. Had breakfast our last morning at the Triomphe in the hotel because our daughter wanted eggs benedict. The restaurant was cold, service was indifferent, and the food was mediocre. Wouldn't eat there again.

We were really pleased with our choice of this Hotel,from a look at various on the internet. The staff (Patrick & Irem) were very friendly(we were grateful for the upgrade) & helpful in lots of ways & Concierge Vanessa was excellent so that we could find our way around N.Y. We did a lot of walking so it was a good starting point for lots of visits.We enjoyed a delicious breakfast in their restaurant(& saw a well known film star!).There are lots of shops within yards of its front doors for eating & shopping.Very happy to recommend it & hope to return again one day.

The Iroquois was our 3rd hotel stay as part of our 17 days holidays in Manhattan. We stayed for four nights there and that was not enough to enjoy the hotel. We are grateful for granting our preferences as most hotels don't do, really big thank you. Concierge Vanessa was most helpful in finding the pet store where I could purchase my dog his specialty breakfast which he ran out of the following day after check in. This hotel definitely deserves higher rating on Trip Adviser compare to some for front hotels I stayed in. The receptionists were all very pleasant. Beautiful Frette towels were very pleasant and our Queen size bad was so comfortable to sleep and sit on. Plenty of towels more than we needed and we never had to ask for extra. We were on the top floor and water pressure was excellent. The hotel has sauna and jacuzzi bath tub in the gym, but I was so ex hosted from walking and took a bath using the energizing body wash provided and it was so comfortable to sit in for a regular bath tub, and there was plenty of hot water to take shower afterwords. The hotel features fairly priced snack bar drinks, has beautiful bar and lounge bar. There is complementary coffee in the lobby in the morning and cyder all day long. All three of us loved the library room: small, but so cozy and inviting. There are 2 computers with keyboards and mouse there, was refluxing to use over lap tap. We had continental breakfast included and loved the choices offered on the menu. After returning back home we went shopping and purchased the foods that we ate for breakfast to continue our indulgence of eating healthy breakfast. We loved our experience in The Iroquois with no spot light on stuff who are there for you when you need them and the location is the best that it can be right next to Sofitel were we stayed years ago, having to have the same great view for much less. We are especially grateful to the doorman and the manager who assisted us to load our 3 weeks worth of luggage on to Access A Ride which could not lower the lift to load our luggage for us. This was the only hotel I booked without reading a single review as I was pressed on time and I am glad I did. We really felt reluxed after all the activities we've done spending holidays in the city.

Came here for New Year's Eve. Very easy walk to Times Square, Empire State Building, subway, Theatre District. Small hotel but very nice rooms. The glass and marble bathroom was spotless, crisp and comfortable white sheets. Nice bathrobes, nightly chocolates on the pillows, and all the amenities one would expect from a 4 star hotel. There was no complimentary breakfast though. It is as nice as Westin imho. Friendly staff and good customer service. Didn't have any problems with bed bug bites like I've had when I stayed at cheaper hotels. Expensive but when compared to others it was worth it. If you're gonna spend that much money for New Year's eve this hotel is worth it. I definitely would stay here again if I ever need to visit Manhattan.

Look no further than the Iroquois. Subway just around the corner, Broadway, Grand Central, Bryant Park and the Rockefeller Centre. Our room was spacious (even when filled with our shopping and suitcases), bathroom huge and included a bath, bed luxurious with gorgeous sheets and coffee in lobby was a great start to the day. The staff were always helpful and friendly. I will stay here again if I am lucky enough to visit NYC again.

I stayed here with my daughter while visiting New York. We had twin room with two double beds. The room was very small, dark and cluttered. Every available surface was covered in hotel booklets and minibar items. The sill in front of the small window that let in very little light was the only clear space in the room. The hotel seems to have taken the need to economise to the extremes. There were no light fittings on the walls or ceiling of the room, no fridge, no coffee maker, teabags or kettle. One can only begin to guess how much they are saving on the power bill! The room was lit with 1 small table lamp and 1 lamp on a stand. It was next to impossible to see into the wardrobe to find things in your suitcase and no room to store the case any where but in the robe.If you want coffee you need go down to the foyer and help yourself from a small silver urn. Coffee is only available for a limited time in the morning. The foyer is also very dimly lit.The bathroom was small and narrow (about 115cm wide) and icy cold.On the positive side, the staff were polite and helpful and the hotel is centrally located within easy walking distance of Broadway, Times Square, the Empire State Building, the Rockefeller Centre, and several subway stations that make it easy to get to Central Park, Ground Zero, the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and numerous shops and museums.

What a fantastic hotel. It is a perfect base for a weekend in NYC. My wife and myself stayed in a top floor suite in Feb 2012 and found the location to be ideal. Having stayed in other NYC hotels, I would strongly recommend The Iroquois. Looking to re-book for Feb 2013.

Enjoyed a one night stay in this hotel for Xmas shopping. Room was fine and though I always miss not having coffee making facilities in the room, one could head to the lobby and get a free cup! Staff helpful; stored our luggage while we went shopping after check out. Elevators small and slow and the free continental breakfast was boring but thats looking for flaws in an otherwise nice hotel. As they say its location,location, location.......

Stayed at this hotel for four nights in December 2012. It is perfectly located two blocks from Times Square and one block from Fifth Avenue. We found it a perfect base to explore all Manhattan has to offer. Walking to Central Park took approximately 20 minutes, Times Square was less than 5 minutes away and with close Subway stations access to all of Manhattan is a piece of cake.With regard the hotel itself, we were very happy with out choice. Location aside, the hotel was very clean and well appointed. We had a room on the 11th floor, and after sending the hotel an email prior to our arrival they provided a room with a view of the Chrysler Building, as requested.The room itself was a decent size, tidy bathroom with powerful shower and Molton Brown products. The hotel has two lifts servicing all floor, and we never had to wait for a lift. Both the concierge and the front desk staff were very helpful and courteous, as were the bell boys. A wonderful little touch was the urn in the reception area. In the morning it was full of coffee, with cups available for you to take out with you. And from the afternoon onwards, hot cider was available. Very happy with our choice and won't hesitate to return the next time we visit New York.

Stayed at this hotel while in NYC. Hotel is clean, cosy and welcoming with a classic decor, staff are also welcoming and friendly. The location is also hard to beat being close to broadway, the subway and reasonably close to Central Park. Price seemed reasonable for the location but the room was a bit smaller than what we would have liked (couple + 6 yr old) and with three suitcases we had to place one on the floor near the door since there was no where else to put it. Prices for food and services seemed a little steep (not sure how they compare with other hotels in the city) but we found a diner only a few doors down which had good food at good prices. Hotel would suit a couple who only intend to use it as a base and don't intend spending much time there but being in NYC that's not hard to do. A positive experience overall.

Perfect loacation for Theater, Times Square and Radio Music Hall. The place was very clean and the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Only complaint, the resturant is over-priced! We paid over $60 for 2 bowls of oatmeal, 2 orders of toast, 1 yougart, coffee and tea. With 20% tip, our breakfast was $78.01. Better choice, The Red Flame on the same block.

I arrived around 8:30 p.m., calling ahead to tell the hotel when to expect me and found no doorman and no help with luggage to unload or go up the steps with my bags. A stranger did it for me! Once checked in, an employee decided to show me to the room with me trailing along with my luggage and holding the door to the elevator for him. I finally told him to take the luggage. Once in the room I was told that I was not allowed to adjust the temperature of the room on the thermostat. When I asked about the window heating/AC unit, he proceeded to fiddle with it. I told him to be sure that it was off. He lied and said it was off. It was not off. I later had to get the engineer to turn it completely off as the prior employee had activated a timer that was cycling it on and off. There is no lighting in the closet or for that whole end of the room where I was attempting to unpack. I took the minimum out of my bag for fear of losing the other things in the dark. All wall plugs are completely filled with the hotel's stuff. I had to get down on my hands and knees to find a strip plug underneath the desk for my IPad to charge. Then I found an outlet on the side of the desk for my IPhone to charge. However, to my dismay the next morning I found that when I turned off the desk light, the desk plug also went dead and my phone did NOT charge overnight. The mattress was good and that is why this hotel received three stars instead of two. Now, the shower: I scalded my right arm turning off the shower because there are absolutely NO markings on the shower as where hot, cold or off is. I recommend that you step outside the tub/shower before turning it off and be sure not to have any part of you under the water when turning it off. There is no ventilation in the bathroom. Therefore, not only was the bathroom completely steamed, which ruined my hair, but also the bedroom windows. As to the so-called BAY window in my room: The top half of the windows is completely blacked out by the hotel eliminating half the light coming in the windows. And this room really needs more light. In addition, there are dark brown wooden shutters that cannot be lifted, only tilted that further curtail light entering this room. What a dismal swamp it is. Breakfast: there was an argument about whether or not I was allowed to order the continental breakfast, being first told no and later told yes. And then there was the issue with the eggs. Even when I told them how many minutes to boil the eggs, the cook could not do the eggs even half way cooked to wear I asked. Not a good situation, in my opinion. Sleeping: Although the mattress was comfortable, I had to wear earplugs and play a sound soother to sleep well. When the neighboring room turned on its shower, the water sound screamed and bubbled right at the headboard to my bed. I checked out in the AM for a conference, stored my luggage at the hotel and was allowed to use the gym in the late PM to change my shoes for my trip home in the early evening. I am attempting to be fair and point out the good, too. And finally, when I noted some of the deficiencies to the person who originally escorted me to my room his answer was: "It is What it is." Now that I am safely at home, I can laugh at this most ridiculous interpretation of customer service I have ever heard.

Our annual trip to NYC this year I selected the Iroquois - look no further - its so perfect. The friendliest staff ever. Nice size room - very clean - every night a member of staff brings you chocolates and a weather forecast for the next day. Allan the concierge is wonderful - very knowledgeable and gives his honest opinion - everwhere he suggested was great. The location is perfect and doors away is the cutest little diner that serves a great brealfast. Can't wait to go again next year. You can walk to all the great shops on Fifth - and Macy's is also not too far away.

I loved my stay at The Iroquois. It was convenient to lots of spots in New York City and the hotel staff was extremely nice and helpful. The elevator in the hotel is a little slow but we stayed on the 3rd floor and took the stairs. They had the best complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning and the best hot apple cider in the evening. We hung out in the lobby and the library sipping our apple cider in the evening. It was nice to sit and talk to other people staying at the hotel. The hotel had a very home like feel and I would definitely stay there again. New York City is an amazing place. I really wish I lived there.

The Iroquois is a beautiful hotel. I chose it because of it's location to Times Square & 5th Avenue and because it also got good reviews here. The staff were very professional and always had a smile. The room was clean and cozy. Our suite, #1000, had the most amazing view of Rockefeller Centre. Also, the windows open nice and wide, which was good because the hotel has that stuffy old hotel air, which gives it its charm but also makes it hard to sleep at night. Of course opening the window makes it louder than normal; I brought earplugs. If you are a light sleeper, BRING earplugs to New York! My husband thought the room was a little small but I thought it was just right. When your on a quick 4 day'er, you don't spend any time in it anyway. It had a TV, dresser draws, a little fridge, a good sized bathtub shower and a desk with chair. Pretty standard. Unfortunately, we did not eat in the hotel restaurant but a lady in the elevator told me that it was great. Within a 5 block radius there are plenty of restaurants and Irish Pubs (which happen to be my favourite!), so the hotel ammendities were not that important to me on this trip. There is a good, reasonably priced, family style restaurant at the end of the block called "the red flame". Great breakfast diner restaurant for it's price. As I mentioned, the hotel is close to everything. Don't kid yourself though, if you are in New York to see the sights, you will be walking alot. Bring good shoes. The hotel conceirge was fabulous when it came to giving us directions, especially subway lines, so don't worry about having to navigate it all by yourself. Thumbs up Iroquois... we will be back.

My husband and I stayed for the long weekend after Thanksgiving. This was our first stay at the Iroquois Hotel. We loved it! The staff was friendly and the room was as described. It was one of the cleanest rooms we have ever stayed at. The bathroom was updated and wonderful. We received a free breakfast with our reservation. It was GREAT! The orange juice was fresh squeezed and delicious. The basket of pastries were fresh and the fruit was freshly cut. Our waiter was very nice and made sure we had everything we needed. We would surely stay here again.

After being in many hotels around the world, there is no other place like the Iroquois! The staff, cleanliness and comfort gets better with every stay. We will definitely choose and recommend others to choose the Iroquois as their Midtown Manhattan hotel! We look forward to staying there again!

Lovely hotel in a great location. The rooms are well appointed and definitely "cozy" - small but that's fairly typical for the age and location. The hotel is right in the heart of the theatre district, restaurants and shopping, minutes from Times Square and an easy walk to Central Park. The staff is very welcoming and concierge Vanessa is knowledgeable and helpful.

I recently stayed at this hotel with a friend of mine for four nights when we visited NYC. We weren't sure what to expect as we went off of reviews from here and viewed picturs uploaded by others on this website. When we arrived the staff was very welcoming and took our bags up to our room. The room and bathroom was very small; however, this was to be expected for NYC. The location was amazing - it was a 4 min walk to Times Square. The staff was very friendly and answered any questions we had including the fastest way to get to a particular place. They also provided us extra pillows and towels when we requested them and band-aids for my friend who got blisters from walking all day. The check-in and check-out was a very smooth process and did not take long at all ! When we return to NYC, we will be staying here again!!

Despite the rather nondescript frontage, the Iroquois is one of the best hotels we have stayed at in N.Y..Our room was excellent, (although the bathrooms are a little on the small side), the staff are wonderfully friendly and helpful k but the best thing is the location- a few minutes walk from Times Square.Overall, a great experience and will definitely stay there again. High praise to all of the wonderful staff who made us feel so very welcome!

This is an excellent small hotel (by New York standards) in a quiet location of Midtown within a few minutes walk of Times Square, the Theatre District, Bryant Park and Grand Central. The room we stayed in was quiet and comfortable and the staff were friendly and efficient. There was always free coffee available in the lobby and the library had internet access and real time flight info. I can't comment on the restaurant as we didn't eat in. I would however recommend the Red Flame diner just along the street, where you can eat breakfast with real New Yorkers at a reasonable cost. There's also Gregory's coffee bar opposite the diner which serves an awesome carrot and raisin pound cake.This was our first visit to New York and we'll definitely be back for more.

I recently stayed in this hotel for three nights during a visit to NY. What a gem of a place. From the perfect location, only minutes from Time Square, St Patrick's Cathedral, 5th Ave, Central Park etc etc. Near subway stations so the entire island is within easy reach. The staff were welcoming and accommodating. My luggage did not arrive for 2 days so they did everything possible to help me out and contact the airlines on a regular basis. The lobby is welcoming with coffee/spiced cidar to enjoy. The room was quiet and perfect. Comfy bog bed with chocolates nightly and Molton Brown bits in the bathroom. (very useful when you had zero luggage!). Lods of moveis to watch on your DVD player and a free newspaper every morning. Fantastic. I could not say enough good about this place. Will definitely be returning. :)

This unpretentious but comfortable, good quality hotel is brilliantly located for manhattan visits. The beds are comfortable & the rooms clean and bigger than some in NYC! The staff are friendly and helpful, especially the door staff. We didn't eat there- but the bars look great. V busy.

I try to stay at the Iroquois when I am in NY for business. The staff is attentive and pleasant. They always remember that I need a feather-free room. Amenities are nice and changed seasonally. Rooms are small but comfortable and impeccably maintained. The noise level is low for being in midtown.

We stayed here for one week after Hurricane Sandy, and although we are New Yorkers, this was a lovely "Hurricane Vacation". While our room was small, it was well appointed, comfortable and quiet.
